column79: VERBATIM_EN

Our gate was changed but we were not notified. We were sitting at B5 with many other passengers and realized it was boarding time and no one was at the gate.  Then the screen no longer showed our flight info.  No announcements were made and we figured our the gate was moved to B18 and we had to run to the gate.

A flight attendant must have overslept for an early morning flight. This left our entire group of customers waiting to board the flight. By the time she arrived, we were delayed over an hour for our flight, purely due to this one flight attendant. Fortunately, our next flight to New York was held back to accommodate the passengers, which unfortunately for other passengers already boarded, left them behind. I know several other passengers on the flight to Chicago were left missing their connections. While I know accidents happen, at the end of the day, United is responsible for its employees and this one employee led to a very disruptive flight.

I was scheduled to leave Sunday December 31st, but mechanical problems delayed us resulting in missing my connection in Chicago to San Diego which was the last flight available that day. when I went back to the service desk/check in to rebook I was waiting to get my bag back and an afro-american female united agent was assisting another gentleman re-book when she announced our delay was a mechanical problem with the plane. I did get re-booked on a 5:40 am flight the next morning by an agent on the phone but the gentleman next to me was having problems as he had the united basic economy ticket and she was not being very accommodating. at that point I stated I didn't feel that was right since it was united's "fault" for the delay and since he had the basic economy ticket couldn't do much. at that point she turned to me, and obviously not liking my comment stated she was not helping me and it was not my problem. and when the gentleman stated so it's your fault the plane isn't here she replied, no it's not my fault. she was obviously NOT dealing well with confrontation and did not give a good reflection on how the situation should have been handled. the other gentleman was very upset as he purchased his ticket not on united's website and said there was nothing really stating of the restrictions/limitations with purchasing the basic economy ticket. he finally did have to talk with a manager then to find any resolve. I experienced the same exact situation in november 2017 on the same flight from San Diego to Madison where the flight back (Madison to Chicago) had problems so people needed to be re-booked. I never found out the reasons why that time but in any situation like this one, if it would be united's "fault" for the delay-you know what you do what you can to accommodate a passenger. so whether they have whatever ticket with united, you should do whatever it takes to get that passenger to their final destination. I know the gentleman was very upset and said he would never fly united again. personally I will also look at other airlines when I have to fly back to Madison again in 5 months. I do not like how united has created this "cheaper" ticket "level" which limits the passenger a lot including not being able to choose a seat, not being able to bring a carry on, limited options on rebooking to name a few. and it's not cheaper-you just created another level to charge the customer more. this year with everything added together my round trip ticket to Madison WI from San Diego was basically $600! I had been pricing tickets probably 4-5 months prior waiting for prices to come down and they never did-so I am not sure why I kept hearing ticket prices were down this year-time you add on all the extra fees you have to pay now...I have never had to pay so much for a ticket before. (I'm digressing however). and personally I did pay extra for my ticket only later to find out 1.) the flight from Madison to Chicago somehow got to Madison and took off and completed the trip in half the scheduled time so if I would have actually taken that flight chances are I probably would have made my connection (why and how I even got rebooked then is confusing to me). instead I now got re-booked on a 5:40 am flight which means having to get up at 3 am (as well as my 80 year old parents) to get to the airport on time to check luggage etc. so my day I am supposed to

Space between seats are of concern especially for persons who are tall and more importantly for people with circulation problems or history of blood clots. Very limited space for movement. For those with the later I would not recommend they fly on flights longer than 1 (one) hour due to possible health risks.
My checked in bag was torn when I received it in Newark.  There was no United person present near the belt, I waited for 25 mins to file a complain but had to leave since there was no 1 available

Early morning departure from Charlotte was difficult because TSA has only one open a 4:00am with a huge queue. Was redirected to another one further away and missed the scheduled flight. Gate agent rebooked us on the next day, so what was a disaster was turned around.

The check in process was very unsatisfactory. There was a long line to drop off luggage and checkin even if we got there early at 415am. There were not enough agents at the gate. The ones who were there were very rude to the passengers. One of them was a woman shouting at the passengers to move the line away from security control. But there were no ropes to keep the line in order so there was chaos. We had TSA Pre-check so we got to our gate with jist enough time. But the plane took off late because of the delay during check-in. Then the people on the plane were concerned because Of their tight connections at Newark. It was really a mess.

The crew in the airport was fighting about choices the head guy Andrew was making. They had no idea about our luggage or the chicago airport. There was only one de icing truck for the whole airport on a very busy day.  Several United people just unprofessional.
The flight was delayed so badly I was waiting for three hours and was a horrible experience

Do to incompetent staffing, I was missing luggage from my first half of the round trip which flagged us in the system causing us a 26 hour delay when trying to complete our second half of the round trip.

During the 5+ hour delay, there was no communication about what was going on. Our flight tracker said the flight was in a different city, even though we hadn't departed. There was no assigned gate or screen with information about our flight. It was very confusing and no one knew what was going on. The airport was also FREEZING and at one point I could see my breath. It was not a fun experience and we should be compensated for our time.

Jet bridge in Newark was frozen and wouldn’t move. Should have been checked before plane arrived. We then were towed to another gate which resulted in my wife and I missing our flight to Hawaii where we were 1st class. Also the scheduled layover was ridiculous. We landed after my connecting flight started boarding.

The carry-on bag policy is ridiculous. I crammed everything into a small napsack instead of a small roller bag due to online warnings I would have to check it. When I got on the plane, many people had roller bags. Very frustrating.

Not having the crew on time was bad. Having another crew late and mistaken for our even later crew was bad. Being an hour late because of crew lateness and endless waiting for deicing and other flubs made my brother in law mis his connection. That’s inexcusable.
I was moved from my chosen seat to the very back row and the seat didn't recline at all and I could smell the restroom. Very uncomfortable after having lower back surgery a couple of years ago.

During the winter months there is no reason why it takes more than 30 minutes to deice the aircraft. This causes a huge burden when your connecting flights are close together and have missed a flight because of this.

All your employees did a good job I had no problem with them. Your new baggage policies are hot garbage though. I will actively avoiding flying with you in the future because of your restrictive policies. Charging for in flight services such as TV will also make me avoid you in the future. I also intend on telling as many people as possible about how awful your new restrictions are.
This was the worst expierence of my life.

Dallas TSA required us to check a bag the Newark TSA did not. We had toy knee hockey sticks that were mad out of plastic and about the size of a ruler. We had no trouble bringing it on the flight at Newark but Dallas would not let us bring it on the flight and so we were charged a $25 bag check in fee. My kids would have been upset if we threw away their Christmas presents. Just wish TSA was more consistent

I’m still missing my bag! I waited almost 2 hours. No one could give me an answer. How can my bag get off the plane and no one locate it! WTF! I’m seriously considering never flying with you guys again. The lack of professionalism was mind boggling.
Hard to check in terminal 1, leave from term.2..long walk!  Also gate changed from E12, to E4, to E8!  Very frustrating, and more long walks.!

Communication to the consumer at the gate was quite poor.  It was difficult to know if we were at the correct gate for boarding w/all the changes and the sign said the outbound flight was going to Akron, OH.    Better communication might have helped lessen confusions and time consuming questions.
Very disappointed that We had to pay additional fee for seats together.  also for bags when others check them at the gate and don't pay a fee.
The seats are terribly uncomfortable

The attendant checking baggage was incredibly rude, not helpful and just generally unpleasant. I was traveling alone with an infant and had a car seat base to check, rather than politely informing what to do or simply helping me do it as the attendant did from LAX to ORD, she rudely ignored me when I tried handing the item to her. Then when I mentioned I needed to check the item, she snotily replied You need to check it at the kiosk. I said I tried but it wasn’t clear how to do it. Again, with an attitude she told me to go to the kiosk and ask the man that was standing there. It’s frustrating and makes a person anxious enough traveling alone with a 4month old but to be tested so rudely right at the beginning of a trip makes it that much harder and stressful. I’d also like to mention that because I purchased, and have in the past, a seat for my infant I knew their car seat needed to be placed in a seat by the window. However, other passengers do not realize this all the time. If I’m purchasing a ticket for an infant their seat when checking in should automatically be selected as a window seat rather than whatever two seats the computer may select because this creates unnecessary friction when I, as a passenger, have to inform another passenger that I have taken their seat because this is where the car seat is required to go. It would help if an attendant were there to inform passengers or if they were informed when purchasing a window seat this situation is possible to occur.

My first name is two sepate words Mary Lou. Your system will not recognize anything but Marylou. Consequently my pre tsa will not work. So I have to use the regular tsa line. Waste of my money. Moreover your gate agent attempted to recheck me in several times which resulted in my getting pulled out st the gate while many others boarded ahead of me. I was told I had tried to check in too many times. I actually did nothing. I will avoid United at all costs

Yes, I would expect a refund on my seat upgrade for myself and my husband and my $25 to check my bag. Due to the 2 hr delay, we did find out that United didn’t think that the plane was going to be used for 3 days so it was not stocked...this was extremely irritating to hear after we were told that the water lines were frozen and that meant the flight attendants were unable to make coffee. It was one of my worst travel experiences!! If we were waiting for two hours I think that United could have done a lot more!!! Very poor customer service!!

Reimburse me for my flight. It is garbage that United has the audacity to treat its passengers this way and all we get is a "sorry." The 2 1/2 hours of delays could have easily been prevented. I will never fly united nor recommend united to anyone again until my account is credited for this delay nightmare. To clarify, I've been on united flights with longer delays and one time even cancelled which I have no issue with because it was due to "technical" problems. When my flight is delayed due to lack of professionalism, laziness, careless mistakes, I get ticked. Clean up your act.

As a frequent business/first class flier, I was shocked to be in a middle seat in business class. It was extremely uncomfortable. There is no place to stow your bag, there is just a little place for a drink shared with your neighbor on one side, and no separation between you and your other neighbor . Hard to climb over your passenger mates if they have the flatbed out. The TVs are not angled so you are staring at tour passenger mates TVs the entire flight. This was the worst business flight I have ever taken. I will not fly this configuration again.
The one negative for me, I'm 5' 11" , is that my legs did not fit when the seat was reclined. Had the seat bent at the knees when reclining, like older versions, I would have.

Aircraft interior starting to get dated.  Food service was disappointing in that for both services (breakfast and pre-lunch snack), supplies of one of the options were exhausted before reaching the back half of economy passengers.
Oversize baggage claim area was a mess and communication was lacking amidst a long delay to retrieve luggage

Yes, Upon a mechanical delay, I fell asleep in my (non economy plus) seat while on the tarmac.  We always book EP seats due to my height. But this flight my family was split up and I was not going to allow my children to sit alone in the back.  I was awoken by a smash to my knee of the beverage cart.  Without an apology I was scolded by the flight attendant that I should have kept my knees and arms from the aisle.  As this was a new years day early morning flight, I was sleeping since we were unexpectedly delayed.  Rather than apologize for not seeing my knee. She told me it was my fault and continued on down the aisle.  Not very professional to say the least.

The flight was delayed 3+ hours and although I have Club access, the delay time is not clear and it updated every 30 minutes so me and my son rushed out to the gate and then found the boarding time changed to 30 min later (9:30am), so we wait at the gate. AT 9:20am, it updated boarding time pushed to 10am so we decided to wait then it pushed to 10:30am... then 11am, and then 11:30am finally we on boarded at 11:45am.  We could have waited in the club after all.  This is a big disappointment.

I asked a gate attendant about the status of the delay.  She started looking into it, then a minute later abruptly left saying it was time for her break.  It is very unprofessional to leave a customer while helping them.

Delayed over an hour because plane was not ready 1st flight of day.  Many passengers missed connections because of this.  Then mechanical issues broken seat.  Kept being told it would only be a few minutes when it was clearly going to be more than that.  As a result my bag did not make connection and had to run from one end of ohare to the other barely making connection.  Not sure why this flight departure was. Not anticipated by bringing plane out— was not even on the way from hangar at the time we were supposed to depart.  It was very cold but all the same many other flights leaving on time

Extremely unfriendly and unhelpful staff at check in and gate in a stressful New year's day travel. Horrible check in and security logistics which made the check in a nightmare. Arrived two hours early and only made it because tsa let us go in pre check line

Women's public restroom near to gate at Newark Airportwas disgusting ... many unflushed toilets etc....granted it was early on New Year's Day but still they were terrible and given there was no real United Club nearby it was a most unsettling way to start the New Year.  Also the food on board which should have been lunch was a most disappointing "Breakfast"  followed by a very minimal dry Turkey sandwich with no mayonnaise or mustard..... The lack of a United Club providing their standard very good re flight food was missed and the 20% discount at the nearby restaurants in no way compensated for the extra money required to get some decent food before boarding the aircraft!
The flight attendants were extremely rude.

My bags were put on the next flight but we weren't told and spent an hour looking for them at baggage claim. we were then given incorrect information on the baggage delivery at least four times. each customer service rep was more clueless than the next. the whole process was infuriating.

I had requested Asian Vegetarian meal and the meal was incomplete I asked the Flight attendant to do something about it as there was nothing else I could eat. there was no response and the caramel cookie is completely inedible. would not actively fly united.

The seats are small and narrow and crowded. One cannot help but it have constant physical contact with people sitting next to you. My back, buttocks and knees hurt. Flying with you now has the feeling of being in a sardine can

The flight was great but we still haven't received our luggage it's been 48 hrs dmdvive called numerous times and they keep telling me it's coming soon it's very disappointing and frustrating I can understand a piece not getting in the plane although we checked in early and our luggage was tagged priority and it wasn't heavy or big boy to be still waiting today in Wednesday when we arrived Monday is crazy we need our luggage and it's been very annoying to call and they keep telling us soon!!

My Priority Bag did not make it on to the flight and allegedly arrived in LA within an hour of our arrival.  We were told that the bags would be delivered by end of day.  They were not and we kept checking the next day (no updates available on the FindMyBag site). By 10 pm we had given up and went to bed.  At 2:30 am Wednesday my doorbell rung with the missing bag.  Completely unacceptable!
Delayed for no reason (only about 10 minutes) with no reason or explanation.  Also had an hour delay from ORD to DTW on Dec 28th without any follow up from United.
Our stroller was severely damaged. It looks like someone either threw it or dragged it. There are several holes and snaps missing.
check in  and bag-drop in EWR was bedlam, staff were rude, and lost a bag, that held up a tense trip with two young children
Too bad
It is a 5hr flight and no food nor entertainment was included in the ticket, a ticket cost that is even more expensive than flying to Europe.
There's no leg room.  It's awful.  Charge more and give us leg room.
The flight attendants were not very friendly.  They were understaffed, but they made no effort to be cordial.
The aircraft was freezing and extremely uncomfortable the whole ride.
You broke my stroller and the staff at united was disgusting

The problem with this flight was that an airport agent would not let me and my family on the security line claiming that 2 of my bags were to big to take as a carry on despite flying with these bags for last 5 years including my flight to Newark.  No time to argue at that point so had to go back to counter to check 2 more bags
Delay because of the bathroom problem should have been handled better.  Over 100 minutes late. And the aircraft -- my seat was not clean
Flight attendant was extremely rude. I had to ask FOUR times for headphones. Never said please or thank you once. Never smiled at any of the passengers

When we entered the TSA security line at Ohare, suddenly TSA shut down the entire area for about 15 minutes.  During that time nobody came over to the line to explain why the area shut down. When the area reopened, the TSA agents tried to herd the passengers through the security area like cows to clear the long line which had backed up.  They did not provide any explanation for the rush but they put us through expedited screening with no shoe and laptop removal.  People were confused and asked questions but the TSA agents were angry and demeaning in their responses

I paid 500 per person (three people) and used 60,000 air miles to upgrade my family to business. The aircraft was short staffed and the service was terrible and the attendant was rushed and rude. I  should have stayed in coach.I want my 60,000 air miles and 500 per person upgrade charge back!!!!!!!!.
It is a 5hr flight and no food nor entertainment was included in the ticket, a ticket cost that is even more expensive than flying to Europe.
Worst attention i ever experienced at an Airport

For a 9.05 departure I did not expect to be served breakfast. I expected something more lunch-like.   The breakfast options - conjealed egg or berry bread pudding were awful and did nothing to satisfy through the next 6 hours of the flight - and I am a 140lb person!  I have never been so disappointed in an international flight food offering.

Cabin was a mess.  Bathrooms ran out of toilet.  When asked to replenish toilet paper, flight attendant handed me a roll from a bag and said, here you go.  I was not pleased that I had to go in and change the toilet paper.  Why was I asked to do this??
It was one of the worst travel experience I have ever had.  Besides all the difficulties, I felt I was being lied to or deceived about the availabilty of a pilot multiple times.

I was unsuccessful trying to determine why TSA precheck did not print on the boarding pass.  I tried for an hour and a half on the phone with the Mileage Plus customer service team who transferred me to domestic reservations who then transferred me back to Mileage Plus who then transferred me to international reservations who then transferred me to technical support.  I never was able to get an answer to a few basic questions.  It is odd, because TSA pre-check prints out on my boarding passes for American and Delta, but not for United.  I have reached out to TSA pre-check, but who (i) were very helpful and knowledgeable and (ii) despite not being able to get basic information from United (see the hour and a half experience above), are investigating to determine what the problem could have been.  The flight itself was fine but the TSA lines at Newark were long and it took ~45 minutes (not United's responsibility).  I am very frustrated with the inability to have basic questions answered by the United team - i.e. no one seemed to have access to determine now my full name was input into the system (tied to my mileage plus number) and what, if any, passport number was tied to my account. I am waiting to see what TSA comes back with to determine what the problem could be.  If TSA can't determine why TSA pre-check didn't print on the boarding pass, I don't know what else to do.  So I am at a loss.
For a short person, the first class seats aren't very comfortable. Otherwise, the fight and crew were quite fine.

Seats are too narrow!!!!!!  The only reason I didn't rate this flight lower is there was an empty seat next to me!  I put the arm up and took over 1/2 that seat.  I'm 5'11" and 178 lbs.  It's not like I'm big.  The seats are too small!!!!!
The food quality was not great.  The second "snack" meal (chicken) was barely edible (rubbery, dry, no taste)
Checkin luggage was horrible. Terrible system to check luggage
My original return flight was scheduled for Sunday, but due to delayed flights, I missed my connection in Chicago and had to reschedule for Monday ... so I was delayed a day.

I had very bad experience with customer service people in sfo where I went to them to tak about 3 hours delay of flight .the lady was so rude I felt like shouldn't visit united ever again .this is my second worst experience with united .same thing happened when I took flight on 21st December 2017 Indianapolis to SFO.I missed my connecting flight in Chicago due to delay In flight from Indianapolis to Chicago.I had to stay all night in Chicago.overall travel experience with united is very very very bad. I'm not going to visit united ever after this.I am also sharing my bad experience with family and friends so that they also avoid traveling in united.

What appeared to be the station manager or customer service manager who was dispatched to the gate to explain the delay was abysmal. He was rude and, frankly, more annoying than informative or helpful. The information from my iPhone app was substantially more accurate than anything he had to say in his patronizing announcements.

The mad house with constantly shutting down kiosks to get bagage ticketed took much longer & was way more stressful than any other airline that I have traveled with, that had People checking the luggage in. Not a fan of this do it yourself, IF you can find a working machine, as a first step on my trip. If you are going to let me print out my boarding pass, check in for my flight, then figure out some way I can PRINT my luggage TAGS at home! This was really annoying & extremely unregulated.
Kimberly, the Gate Agent was rude and aggressive for absolutely no reason. Her behavior was rude and inconsiderate.

The front attendant who checked all of us in was horrendous. She slowed down the process, which delayed us by 30+ minutes. and she made multiple people who carried on in first class check their bags. These bags had been used time and time again on United flights (used the exact bag on 40 flights in 2017), and she was the only one who made me check it. It was rude and she was doing it with malice.

Gate attendants were rude and disrepectful.   I had a few questions at the gate and they rudely disregarded me and did not care I was a global services member.   customer service was as bad as I have seen in years.   Other airlines will appreciate my business.

Check in at Zurich inconsistent with check in at Newark to Zurich.  Check in personnel allowed all bags to be checked to Zurich but o the return only allowed 6.  Also the baggage claim process on Newark for international flights to domestic transfers is completely ridiculous.  Waited for almost 2 hours to claim bags, then have to drag them to another check in?  Why can bags be completely checked through, this policy absolutely makes no sense to me,
1st class "snack" was terrible.  Identified as chicken salad with kale and tomato, it had no tomato, no dressing and was frozen when served.

Our gate was changed without any warning, and it was two terminals away. We rushed to the gate to find out the flight was delayed due to "weather". The plane wasn't warmed up. It is Chicago. In January. No excuse for not warming up the equipment in advance. And all of the reasons given along the way were vague and not very convincing.

When I went to check a bag in Rochester, I got in the Premier Access line. When I approached the next available agent, she told me I was cutting a large line full of waiting people. I told her I had Premier Access and that's why I was in the shorter line, but she said since they were so busy, they were not using the Premier Access or Polaris lines. Taking away the signs would have helped to know that I needed to wait in the full line with all the other fliers. Or, why is it up to the agent whether or not to help me first when I have the upgraded status? And in Chicago, the gate I landed at was in a different terminal from where my checked bag was available for me to pick up, so I had to exit the airport terminal I was in, walk outside in the sub-zero temperatures for a short distance, and enter a separate terminal. Just an inconvenience.

I believe that the seats in the back of the plane should be discounted due to the very loud noise, being unable to recline back and the constant use of the restrooms. I do not want to sit back there again!!!  Very uncomfortable and noisy flight.

The biggest problem was connecting flight to Montrose. 6 hour delay, no crew, standing in freezing hallway for 30 minutes to board, then additional 45 minute delay waiting for infant life vests. Cabin was filthy.
Dayton was understaffed. I was very disappointed on the weight time for both gate check and check bags, especially with someone waiting.
Terrible service from baggage. Waited 2 hours for bags. Still no response from customer service
Waited over 2 hours to receive our baggage in Charleston. Baggage lady was rude and no help. Paid $50 for extremely poor service

After having the flight delayed more than an hour from Chicago. Once arriving to Charleston my entire flights luggage were lost and we waited more than an hour and a half before they were found with no explanation or apology from a very condescending and rude United Airlines baggage claim employee.
I was very unhappy about being bumped from First to economy, because of "overselling" of the flight

Delayed over 2 hours. Minimal to no updates. It was United’s fault. I attempted to get earlier flight to MKE as my connection in Chicago had two hour waits. Told my ticket would not allow it. It seems an airline rule that stopped me doing this was ridiculous after you consider you then delayed me

I have already written to the Customer Care team in regards to my dissatisfaction with how United handled communication around my flight. To summarize, over the course of the 4 hour delay, we were given infrequent and incorrect information. The gate agents would promise to provide quick updates and then go for over an hour without giving us any information (this happened multiple times). We were mislead regarding the cause of our delay. The extremely poor communication by gate agents was unacceptable. Had anyone given us a clear idea of when and where our flight would depart, I would have rearranged my travel plans completely. This was a very unfortunate way to start the new year.

The aircraft had issues that made our flight delayed for 2 hours making us rush  to catch our connecting flight which was also delayed. In short, our trip was exponentially prolonged due to both flight delays. UA should upgrade their aircrafts to make it reliable. It made a bad end to our vacation and a bad start to our new year.
Some of the flight attendants seemed tired and impatient.
The safety announcement was horrendous, too loud and very annoying content overall, but explain the safety, no one wants crappy over hyped audio playing.
In flight service was not the best
Back row seats are terrible and a punishment to whom ever sits there.
Why send us blue cards when there is no club at RSW and was refused in concourse c in Chicago?

arriving in Newark is always depressing. It is good that Newark is very close to where we live, but the time it generally takes for bags to come out is longer than in other airports, and the skis always take 30 minutes longer. This time it took 2 hours (!) for the bags to appear, and the skis an additional (!) 20 minutes) - this is unacceptable in comparison to all other airports i have experienced.
Baggage deliver was unacceptable. One hour and 45 min is not up to standards. Nearly caused missed connection, caused baggage delay of one day

The seat was unbelievably dirty (Business class polaris, 3L).  There were crumbs on my seat and tray.  My hand accidentally hit the open spot by the seat and found the mother lode of dirt.  It was absolutely disgusting.

The flight itself was OK, but I had an incredibly frustrating time collecting my baggage when I landed in Newark. I waited more than two hours for my bags to arrive - and this was after the carousel it was supposed to be displayed on was changed three times. At no point were there any announcements made regarding my baggage and my flights baggage, nor were there any united representatives around to talk to. Many around me missed their connecting flights due to the unacceptably long wait, and I missed my ride because I was stuck in the airport.
I booked tickets for my fiance and myself. I was not allowed to  check us in together online, which caused frustration and confusion with seat selection.

Duluth is very a problematic airport for on time departures.  It's often weather, but there have been a lot of delays due to equipment.  These are older Canadair planes CRJ200 vintage.  For problem airports consider newer aircraft less prone to maintenance issues.

Gate agent was not very professional.  The 6am Newark flight had issues and we were in the gate area for the 11am Chicago.  The agent makes an announcement saying let's go no flight stated and the Chicago flight was the one posted on the board.  She meant the Newark flight. A bit of chaos in the boarding lines.

Although I signed up for alerts, I didn’t get them immediately. Once I did, they were extremely delayed and I only got one. I had to keep going back to the website, which was very inconvenient when traveling to check the status of my flight.

I have never had a good experience with the UA staff at Newark Airport.  I aggregate ~300,000 miles each year through American Airlines.  Every once in a while I have to endure UA.  It is always a nightmare.  Rude, cold and unsympathetic is how I will describe your ground staff (check in) and gate employees.
At baggage drop off - rep very rude and not helpful at all.  My tote was not secured, therefore, items have been lost.

It is horrible that people are packed in like sardines for a 4-5 hour flight. I am a thin person and I could barely move. If something dropped under my seat I couldn’t move to pick it up.  The state of airlines reduction of leg room makes for a horrible travel experience no matter how nice the flight attendants are. Also, my son and I purchased the Classic snack.  The quality of this snack box has gone way downhill from what in our prior experience had been served in the classic.  Just terrible quality for $10!  United has gone way down hill.  I’m hoping the international flights still maintain leg room.  It is just crazy that this economy seating arrangement has become acceptable.  Just horrible!!!
Lack of food on the plane was a problem. There was no hot food left, neither were there even cheese plates left. This was disappointing.
The food was so bad we could not eat it. The temp in the cabin was way to cold.

For long haul flights you guys are way behind the others like American.  The seat back screens looked cutting edge for 1998. No power? Not even us to charge a phone on a 9 hour flight?  Your in seat entertainment is bad... So people want to use their phones to watch something but risk not having  battery for calls, Uber, mobile passport etc.  Makes no sense.

Luggage broke. We also filed a complaint but were told to leave the broken luggage at the airport. We were walking around the airport with all of our belongings on a bag. Such disrespectful.... Like if we were homeless.

The digital screen at the gate said the flight was going to Chicago, not to Newark.  Although we were at the gate 1 hour before the flight, we nearly missed the flight because we thought people were boarding a different flight, not our flight to Newark.  I think this is an egregious mistake.  Had we not heard our names paged, we would have missed the flight.

I hate the under seat room on the aisle! I could not even store my back pack under the seat in front of me. It was a small one! The plug in device needs to be somewhere else. I did not have room for a small purse and my feet after storing the backpack overhead.

When we boarded the plane it was extremely cold and uncomfortable. I had to leave my coat on until half way into the flight. So there wasn't much room to move around and get comfortable. I understand that we are having a very cold winter in the US. but the plane shouldn't be cold and uncomfortable when the passengers board. Part of our delay was waiting for the aircraft's computer system to warm up. This was not an enjoyable flight!! John Squicciarino
the seats were horribly uncomfortable

My bag was delayed. I was not informed of this and so I just waited at the claim a long time, until  I realized the next flight's bags were arriving. I waited in a long line to ask about its whereabouts, and while the customer service rep wasn't exactly rude, she offered no apology, no explanation, or reason for its delay. I had to ask if there was any sort of compensation or voucher they could offer for my trouble, and she said she could give me a $10 meal voucher but I would have to come back in 20 minutes after the line was down. Seeing as my bag was supposed to be arriving in 20 minutes and I was hungry, I asked if I could get it now, and she acted like it was a major inconvenience to take the additional minute to print out for me. When I finally did get a text about my bag delay, I was already home with the delayed luggage.

The limited number of movies to select from was very disappointing.  It was an 8 hour flight and there were only 4 movies to choose from......  On my flight to London, on the same type of Unite plane, there were many more options available.
Very bad communication of chane of Gate from C7 to E7 at last moment of check in time,which made us almost giving up flight and upset.

The gate agents were extremely unhelpful with the delay and were generally unable to provide any useful updates or information which is very frustrating when traveling with small children. While the check-in agent was eventually able to fix the problem with coordination from central operations, it remains unclear why our check-in experience was significantly delayed by being unable to print my infant's boarding pass.

The flight was delayed three hours because the heat was broken on the plane and after they couldn't get it fixed we had to wait for another plane. They waited to give us any information until we were lined up ready to board.  Switched gates to a new plane and all the screens still had the wrong information. Once boarded new plane we had to wait even longer to get catering on for first class and for bags to be changed to new plane. Lots of delays for reasons that seemed unnecessary if communication would have happened.

Our flight was delayed by almost 3 hours.  I'm currently disabled due to recent surgery and yet I was one of the last to board the aircraft.   The updates at the gate and on the United app regarding the delay were inadequate and changed frequently.  All I wanted to do was go home and this was an unpleasant experience.
flight attendents were snappy and not pleasant at all...did not make me feel welcomed on the plane or that i could ask them to help...just poor customer experience.
No wifi, no cable tv. It's 2018, upgrade your planes.

During our time at Ohare airport, we had to change gates 5 separate times. We even had to change terminals and go from the farthest end of one terminal all the way to the farthest end of another during one of the gate changes. Our journey started at gate B17, moved to e5, e12, f7, then c6. We we had to changer terminals twice. And that is completely ridiculous. Even the pilots that were at the gate seemed confused. At one of the earlier gates, I heard a pilot say “I don’t know how to fly this plane. But I’m sure I can figure it out.” We didn’t end up flying in that aircraft, but even if we had, that’s not something a customer should here from the person who holds all of our lives in their hands. I’m throughoughly disappointed.

I would just like to state that my impression of the traveling public is ever diminishing.  People are rude and show very little respect for the flight attendants or other travelers.  I was in boarding group 1 with a paid first class ticket.  There are only 20 first class seats on this particular aircraft but almost 30 people boarded before me and after the uniformed military and global service customers.  When I got on, there was a young woman firmly implanted in my seat 2A.  When I questioned her, she simply stated that her mother was in the adjacent seat and she was going to sit there.  I could have her seat in 4A.  The plane was totally full and I had no intention of holding up the boarding process, so I conformed to her wishes.  Also, have we now taken away the nuts from the lunch service?  It was bad enough to lose the cookies!

The flight didn’t take off for 45 Min. It was delayed and the pilot reassured us that we would be fine as all flights arriving at newark are delayed. Once we landed at EWR, we ran as fastest as we could to c108 to board UA 179. It was gone. The delay was Horrible and there is no special arrangement for us. No one was at the gate to let us know what to do.  The pilot has no credibility in what he said either!    I finally found the way to Assistance. At the EWR UA assistance, we got assigned to UA 179 the next day. My parents speak only Cantonese and the assistant James Germany told us we could sit together and just the system didn’t allow him to choose the seats properly. He told us with confidence that we could be sitting together.     We are assigned flights 24 hours after but we are only given USD 10 per person. Who could survive on usd 10 for a day???? This is ridiculous.   The next day when we arrived at EWR counter I asked to sit together because my parents need special assistance.  The ground staff told me she could not do anything. What service is this? It has been a mess, unorganised and rude.

I will be calling to speak with someone about my family's experience. I was traveling with my husband 2.5 year old son, and infant. We purchased three seats. From the moment we arrived in Newark to check in for our flight to Boston, we had a bad experience. A very busy day (new years day) at the airport and there was only one representative to assist with kiosk check in. We had an infant and a car seat to check, which automatically requires assistance from a United Airlines representative. We waited a very long time. As my husband was working on getting tickets and the car seat tag from the kiosk, I waited in the baggage line.  The representative behind the counter immediately accused us of cutting the line. She did not say hello - just yelled at us. It was very poor customer service, accusatory, and wrong.  She was relentless and didn't believe that I had waited in line.   We arrived on the plane and discovered that someone had vomited in our seats prior to our arrival. This must have happened on the previous flight. The smell was sickening and there was throw up everywhere - pieces on the seat belt, front of the seats, top of the seat. I flagged down a flight attendant who barely acknowledged me and finally came over after about 10 minutes. Yes, it was busy, but this was a bit of an urgent situation and I was being extremely patient and polite. When she approached us, she immediately was accusatory. She did  not say hello or what can I help with, she immediately said - you are not supposed to be sitting here. We were shocked and confused as those were our seats. She was extremely rude. She did not have her information correct and acknowledged that after about a minute, but what a horrible way to start a conversation especially considering the disgusting situation we were dealing with in the seats. The flight attendant arranged for the cleaning crew to come on board as we stood for 20 minutes in the aisle with our two young kids waiting. The cleaning crew replaced the seat cover, seat belt and wiped down the area. Great. But, we discovered this wasn't sufficient as all of our bags that were on the floor smelled terribly of vomit.  We arrived home and threw away our bags and clothing since it had been soaking up someone else's vile.   I still remain shocked by the two accusatory situations we were in -  for absolutely no reason. A very calm and polite family with well behaved children who was doing everything correctly. I am upset that there was no apology for the seat situation and that this was not recognized prior to us boarding. This is a health issue and I am concerned that my family has now contracted norovirus.   I look forward to speaking with someone about this matter.  Kind regards, Allison Allison.azar@gmail.com 508.479.1423

Chicago to Tokyo not terrible, but Tokyo to Chicago on 23rd miserable.  I would not go so far as to say they were rude, (and I do not expect "cheerfulness,") but they were, save one gentleman, brusque.
No one offered compensation for EQUIPMENT FAILURE DELAY.  NO FOOD, NO ACCOMDATIONS  NOTHING.  GET YOUR PLANES TO WORK RIGHT!!!!
The length of delay and lack of communication about it was really bad
This delay was after a 2-1/2 hr delay on my outbound flight to ABQ.

The aircraft we were on was OLD.  For an international flight above 7 hours the in flight entertainment was poor and was the very old system from years ago.  The screen was extremely small.  It did not give you option to select movies.  It was a bad experience fly for over 7 hours expecting some better infliight systems.  This plane was very old and tired and should be retired from flying.  We pay alot to fly with you at least give us a plane from this decade!!!  Embarrassing for an international flight United.
We were 2.5 hours delayed (and were also delayed on the flight TO Dallas FROM Chicago). Consistently ridiculous

I have flown United/continental for over 20 years.  In the last 5 years I have not been able to get a trip that did not include a long delay.  I am tired of being rerouted and wasting my time in an airport while you try to figure out what is going on. These are not weather delays which I understand but is never the less something.  I am cutting up my chase cc and will be using other airlines from now on.  Your attention to customer service and keeping your customers abreast of what is going on is embarrassing.  My reward trip home was a disaster and I don’t like using rewards only to be delayed and shoved in a middle seat like a piece of inventory rather than being treated like a loyal customer.

If there is a known delay like this one, a text message or email could be sent, so that we can arrive to airport later, instead of having to wait at airport, and that too without any compensation for no fault on our side.

When it was finally determined which gate my daughter was departing from, the plane was delayed even FURTHER (after 3 gate changes and already being delayed FOUR hours), because the crew was trying to sort out a Visa issue for a Crew Member at the gate. This should not have been dealt with on the passenger's watch. They should have told him he couldn't fly on that flight, allowed the flight to depart, and sort out his issue after. Instead, they held hundreds of people on a parked plane for an extra hour. Also, while waiting at the gate for the plane to depart, I witnessed numerous groups of people with MAJOR confusion, due to the ridiculous amount of gate changes, and NOT A SINGLE UNITED REP present to answer their questions. People were going from one gate, to another, being sent away and sent back - being told that there were TWO planes scheduled to leave at the same time, at the same gate. It was utter chaos. The screens would update and information would change, but nobody would make an announcement. It was the hardest thing to watch, as people paced back and forth through the airport, without a clue where to go. Thankfully, I was not flying, and I was just there to drop off my unaccompanied minor, but to see the lack of direction from United was extremely upsetting. I am losing faith in this company and I will definitely be looking into other airlines to avoid United, if and when I can.

The flight was 45 minutes late and much of that seems to have been avoidable.  There was a medical emergency shortly after take off but that seemed to throw the two FAs into a tail spin for the rest of the flight. They came around with one drink service - no offer of even water subesquently.  We rang the call button and no response.
Terribly uncomfortable seats packed in like sardines. Filthy plane and charging for basic TV. Tiniest bag of pretzels literally tossed at you. Pretty terrible. Very disappointing experience.

The women at the gate were very rude.  You'd ask them a question and their answer would be we don't know our supervisor hasn't told us yet.  We followed the app on our iPhone to learn about the gate change and the flight status as to when then plane was going to arrive in Nashville.  More professionalism needs to be taught to the gate people.
Terrible delay
problem with TSA, body search was invasive. flight was delayed  due to mechanical  issues of the plane leaving Nwk to our flight to Jacksonville. App said on time!! was delayed take off 4 hours.

In baggage claim, bags were delayed over 45 minutes before coming out - with NO explanation. This is infuriating and unacceptable.  I always try to avoid checking luggage when possible. The local personnel should at least give explanations when such  delays occur.

We were delayed 4 hours.  There is a limited selection of food in the United Club so had to go outside to find lunch for my kids after paying $180 to get in.  The delay put the flight in the dinner hour and there were no hamburger or pizza meals left when we asked for them on board.

My checked baggage was not placed on my flight but rather placed on a different flight that ended up having a delayed departure. This meant that once I arrived in Chicago, I had to wait an additional hour and a half at O'Hare for my baggage to arrive. The baggage attendant in Chicago was very nice, but it was still a very frustrating and inconvenient situation.

SNA is a convenient airport but the auto check in system isn’t great. I’m sure you’re saving money by having fewer check in personnel but as gold premier I’d appreciate some service. I don’t like feeling “herded” by people who ate there to help...but not.
There was no personnel at the curb side check in. Taking our luggage inside the door caused me to be ticketed. There was no help and my wife could not pull the luggage (broken elbow).

It took an hour and 20 minutes from the time we landed until the skis came out.  Then when the skis came out the priority skis were not given any preference.  The first batch came out and majority were non priority and then finally ours came out in the second batch.  In the meantime a passenger not happy about the wait started yelling curse words (F word) and knocking things over which was less than ideal for my two young children.

Upon arriving in Chicago my baggage was not delivered to the baggage claim with the other passengers items which delayed me over an hour. The representative who assisted me was amazing but the delay was otherwise not appreciated.

The flight attendant was shockingly rude.  Yelled at me on the way off the plane.  Literally.  I would think, that given the bad publicity for your airline recently, you would train people to be a little more polite!

We should have been told at the outset that there was to be a delay and a different plane/gate to be used.  I dislike the way United just keeps delaying without a good reason or keeping passengers posted on what is going on.  Even the ladies at the desk had no idea what was going on at the outset and had no true time frame.

The seat space on your planes is getting to the ridiculous.  I am a small/medium build female.  I have no idea how an average man is supposed to sit in those seats.  The seat backs are so close together that I feel claustrophobic.
Check in was horrible
Seats are really uncomfortable- armrests have TV controls that everyone sitting next to you touch and change you channel- totally annoying

I am disappointed in my flight from Chicago to Boston. After being delayed leaving Chicago, we made up some time in the air and were not severely delayed in our landing time. Despite this, I still missed my bus connection out of Boston due to the amount of time it took to handle baggage. I did not get my bag until a full hour after our flight had landed, and as I sat with other passengers waiting for baggage to come out, I heard many people echoing similar complaints -- we were together at the baggage carousel for awhile, as it took 45 minutes for the first bag to come out!
The snacks in First Class were terrible. Insulting.

Because of the hour plus wait for bags in Newark, and the distance/security between the gates I was not able to board in Group 1.  The gate agent said that the flight was full, so I'd have to check my carry on bag.  I told her that it was full of fragile items and I didn't want to check it.  She said that I'd have to check it because it wouldn't fit on the plane. I removed the most fragile item (Leica Camera and lenses), but removing all fragile items would have left the bag totally empty but the all the items would then be loose and more likely to be broken.  When I arrived in San Francisco I opened this bag in the baggage area to put the camera back and found that the other items in my bag were smashed.  I took the bag to the United desk in the baggage area to make a claim for compensation for my destroyed items and was told that United doesn't offer compensation for items destroyed by them.    This was quite unbelievable.    I didn't want to check the bag because it contained fragile items, but United forced me to because it "wouldn't fit".  (Although I know if I'd been able to board with group 1 there would have been plenty of space). Then they refuse to take responsibility for their own actions in destroying my things.  As a 1K member I should not be treated like this.   At the moment I am planning to just drain my miles and switch to another carrier for my future air travel.   I guess that United would prefer to lose tens of thousands of dollars of my future business over a ±$200 damages claim.

You need to understand that our flight out to Chicago was delayed by almost 5 hours due to airport mismanagement and questionable choices by the flight crew.  So to sit in awful terminal F at O'Hare on the way back for an extra 3 hours while United tried to find a crew to fly the plane from Milwaukee was unacceptable.  To make it worse, when we got to Harrisburg, the jetway couldn't reach the plane and then got stuck.  So they had to restart the plane, back out, and head to another gate.  It added almost another 45 minutes to the already late flight.  It was horrible, the single worst United travel experience I have ever had.

Your airline stinks.  Incredibly confusing check-in arrangements. Step one step two ridiculous. Over half the people had trouble at the kidoks.  The girl handling the baggage and asked if there was anything fragile inside and then proceeded to heave our suitcases onto the carousel. Very unprofessional. The flight was didn’t delayed for 2 to 3 hours for no apparent reason. Prompter said aircraft not available. Don’t understand? Upon arrival and Scranton we had to wait one hour and 15 minutes to pick up our luggage. Agent said there were only two people working the whole airline and they had to taxi on another plane fromEWR  before they could bring our bags to the carousel. That’s ridiculous. Everyone was extremely upset. Why only two people working. Doesn’t make sense. It would’ve been faster if I walked home from Chicago.
flight attendants rude, had no blankets on board. no on board entertainment have to have you on personal ipad which many people do not.
The baggage handling and baggage customer service at Chicago O’Harr is the worst in the world. VERY SLOW AND UNPROFESSIONAL!!!
Took over two days for me to be reunited with my bag. Difficult communicating with Bag Recovery system. Very disappointed by experience as a whole.

Flight was delayed by over one hour however we were notified via email long before we made our way to the airport.  Boarding at the gate in pVR is a mess but that’s for all airlines and not just United.  In light of the long delay, they comp’s the direct tv which I thought was appropriate.  Luggage took a VERY long time to get to the carousel but I understand multiple flights landed at the same time and I don’t believe there was anything that could have been done about that.

Absolutely no updates regarding the changed flight time, the reason for delay, nothing.  I had to ask twice if the flight was still going from F1 as the flight was not posted at the gate.  No information shared until we were told to go to F21 to board.  That was 5 hours after the flight was supposed to board.  Then the idiots on the ground crew failed to make an adjustment so the pilot would have the ability to steer the plane.  Another hour wasted waiting for a maintenance person to correct the issue.   United was a real disappointment this time.
Rude tsa workers, long delays because of short staff, never notified flyers about delay until last minute. Should always have a backup fly crew!

flight got delayed by around 2 hours and 30 minutes and we were lied to about the reason why... a little after it was time to start boarding we were told that the flight had been delayed because the crew wasn't present and that the crew wasn't present because they were still in Denver due to their flight being delayed there... however it takes 2 hours and 40minutes to get to Los Angeles from Denver... so either we are being lied to... since they only told us that less than an hour before our flight was supposed to leave... or they already knew that information but didn't want to tell us earlier... both seem bad to me.

I fly only United, and would generally recommend United, but this flight was an uncomfortable experience.  I was seated between a couple in the first row of economy in front of the jump seats, they asked if I'd switch and sit in the isle.  I almost always sit by the window, but agreed so I wasn't between this couple in the middle seat.  However, I really regretted this decision.  People, including the flight attendants, kept bumping into me.  At one point, one of the flight attendants stood on my foot that was straight down against the seat, despite there being five feet in front of me.  There was a baby crying in the row behind me, and the woman in my row kept throwing a fit about it (I just kept my headphones turned up, so the crying didn't bother me, but I felt really bad for that family). I suppose that my experience on the flight was partially my fault when I agreed to switch to an isle seat, but I don't understand how people can bump into someone sitting there and not even apologize - especially the flight attendants. If the seating chart showed the bathroom on the other side of the jump seats, I'd have never upgraded to a seat in that row.

The Palm Springs to LAX leg of was directed to a cab ride from PSP to LAX.  horrible experience.  small cab, no air conditioning. At PSP leg, one of my bags was lost (redirected to Houston) and finally made it to Chicago.  Surprising i'm asked for feedback only on the LAX to ORD leg.  The PSP to LAX was disastrous.  My family and I spent 16 hours at airports trying to get back home due to the PSP leg being delayed for hours
I didn't like being on an old plane that had no current features like electric outlets, etc.
No complaints
Our flight was delayed by 3 hrs due to late carrier arrival but the representative said the destination airport was shut down, which turned out to not be true.

gate hold trying to pull into newark was excessive.   and baggage (as always) a nightmare in Newark.   understand it's cold and operations is slowed down a bit but two hours from touchdown to actually leaving the airport (with a 3 year old) at the end of a long day is frustrating.
No communication about delays at the gate. Terrible
2 hour delay and no gate available upon arrival.  Unacceptable.
we arrived in Newark about an hour early and there was no gate so had to sit on the plane (runway) until our original time - very disappointing

The gate representative in Columbus was very rude and unprofessional.  Boarding was completely unorganized and chaotic - an off duty crew member had to step in and help.  As a result, our flight left 20 minutes late.  When we landed, the flight attendant did not mention that we would be taking a shuttle to the gate.  We were traveling with an infant and had no idea that we would be stepping outside in 15 degree weather.  The attendant should have made an announcement.

Yes. I was not satisfied with the boarding/security process, because as we were trying to board the plane a man and his family refused to sit in their assigned seats. Not only were they causing a delay, but they were also causing uneasiness among the passengers due to the disturbance that ensued. The flight attendants were struggling to get them to cooperate. Then, the family also refused to sit down because they wanted a special seat for their baby, which the flight attendant told them was unavailable. The Passengers all started getting worried about this man and his family, and for 20 minutes we listened to the arguments. I do not know why airport security was not brought on to this flight. At this day in age if it is taking 20 minutes to get a passenger to sit in his assigned seat and cooperate it should be seen as a safety risk. I should have reported the threat, I don't know why the attendants didn't.

The boarding process at SJU was a complete disaster. No organization whatsoever with everyone basically trying to get on board. This was topped off with the fact that a single mother of four children asked to board before other passengers but after they had told people traveling with children to enter. The agents not only refused, and refused again after several passengers told them to let her go through, but were also rude to her without she deserving said treatment. T

Walking is difficult for me and was carrying two heavy items and had to walk the entire length of the concourse.  I saw 4 people movers all parked  with no one near them.  On New Years Day, this was ridiculous.  I asked an employee and was told you have to flag them down.  There has to be someone in or near them to do that.  I NEVER was to go through that again.

A whole lot.  1) There was nothing indicating that there were several airports out of which we could fly home.  Our cab driver took us to Terminal 3, and we had to pay an extra cab fare, $10, to get to Terminal 2, which was also a short trip from the first world to the third world.  United needs to do whatever it can to move to Terminal 3.  We should have had Terminal 2 listed on the ticket or sent to us in an e-mail.  The check-in screwed up, and they had to recheck our tickets manually after we had boarded the aircraft and were seated.  Seating people from both ends of the plane was not a time saver, as folks from the back end had to go forward against traffic to find places for their carry-ons, which led to a logjam and a lot of frustration.  They didn't load the food properly for the flight, and water wasn't handed out until about 90 minutes after we boarded the plane and sat in heat for about 45 minutes of that time during the baggage and ticket screw-up.  However, we did arrive on time after all of that, and the crew did what they could to help out.

column26: CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: Probably the smallest seat I have ever flown in. I am by no means a large person and the seats were incredibly cramped and uncomfortable.
The baggage check in Newark was an absolute mess. The food choices in the terminal were not good, and the gate agent was very late due to a late flight.
I paid for a first class seat upgrade.  I was very disappointed that I was offered the left over meal when complimentary upgrades/nonrev were given a choice of meals. The meal was very poor and cold.
The meal on the return trip was horrible. Scratch it from the menu. Most of the meals in UA business/first are decent, but that chicken was disgusting. (And I wasn't the only one w/ that opinion).

The lines at Newark was very long...also going up and down escalator with bags to get from premier check in to economy was horrible. Should have signage to say lower level is economy checking. The set up was chaotic the worse I have seen.
I'd prefer more movies and TV that are serious, geared to adults.  Most of the selections are not that great.

Yes, my luggage was never put on our flight, so we filled out papers and the person told us their was three more flight out that day from EWR to PBI. We explained we had a funeral the next day. We received emails the next morning that the luggage was found and would arrive at our hotel by 11:30 AM. It did, but we had a sleepless and very tense night.

Very unhappy with the flight attendants.  Our daughter has a severe nut allergy.  We were told it was "against the law" to make an announcement.  I then proceeded to tell the rows in front of me and behind me about the allergy.  The attendants walked by me and gave me a look of disdain.  We are talking about a childs life!!  I have been a loyal united/continental customer my whole life.

Customer service call pre flight (homeward leg) was terrible. Very poor quality and my wife was insulted by the supervisor she spoke to. He also advised that phone calls are not recorded which seems crazy from a QC perspective.

Flight attendants were very rushed and disinterested, especially the two male attendants in economy. Couldn't be bothered. Also, NO HOT FOOD to eat!!!! Really? Make a minimal effort. Terrible. Shame on United.
One wheel on our checked bag was completely destroyed in transit

The check in at Newark airport was horrible. We are 1K members and the bag check staff were not United employees so they did not know the United bag policy for 1K members. We were told to open our bags and move weight from one bag to another when that was not necessary. I had to go find a United employee after 20 minutes of frustration in order to help solve the problem. The United employee was talking on her cell phone, not work related and gave me an attitude when I asked her to help. We also had the wrong gate printed on our boarding pass so we had to run from the wrong gate to the correct one to make our flight. Just a very bad customer service experience!

The Captain gets a giant dud! He never apologized for the 1 hour and 20 minute fiasco because United was unable to work logistics on the bags. Nor did he keep us up to date on what was going on. 2 messages in 1 hour and twenty minutes is shameful and to not even over apologize was incredible. The poor Flight attendant had to apologize when we landed. It was rather embarrassing and not the way to start 2018 on day 1. Why does it take near 20 - 30 minutes to get bags at the Indianapolis airport. United seems to be the slowest at getting bags to baggage claims and its been that way for years.
Bad Airplanes

The flight was delayed due to a late arriving aircraft but there was no timely notification of this delay and no updates announced or communications pushed out about the delay. This is continually a problem for United and prevents customers from having timely information in order to make adjustments to their day. Can you please just tell us what’s going on as it happens? If you know the aircraft needed for a flight is still parked in another city, why not send out an early notification and allow people to stay at home rather than waiting for hours and hours at the airport?

I was very disappointed with the lack of communication regarding flight delays, gate changes, etc. At no point in time did I receive an email, text, automated call. At one point the screen showed that our plane had already closed boarding and caused panic among many of the passengers. There should have been an announcement made regarding the status of the flight. Overall I was very disappointed and do not anticipate traveling with United in the future.

Wasn’t happy with being switched from gate to gate and I at first was on the later flight but I switched to the earlier one to get home earlier but they kept delaying that flight and the later flight left before the earlier one. They were rude when I asked about switching back and anytime anyone asked a question they were rude. I’m not sure I would ride United again or not. I’m sure glad I didn’t spend money to fly, I used miles sorry I used them also. So not to happy about this trip.
United club at Orlando is the worst club I have visited. Too crowded, rude staff and minimal food. Very unhappy with the experience

My flight was delayed leaving and coming back.  I schedule my trips, and typically spend extra money or miles, to accommodate my infant son's schedule.  When you are constantly delayed several hours, that screws everything up.  Also, you broke my son's stroller, and when I tried to go to the services desk at Newark no one was there.  The seat is cracked totally in half, so it will not be able to be repaired.  You must replace it.  Please let me know how to coordinate this.

The gate attendants at Cancun airport were so dis-organized and difficult to understand.  They did not explain we were required to take a bus to our aircraft and allowed everyone to crowd the gate.  The boarding groups were not utilized at all-it was just chaos.

You broke my son’s stroller and ripped my bag. When we went to submit a claim, there was nobody at the guest services desk. This is after the flight was delayed 3 hours. We also gate checked the stroller and couldn’t pick it up until we passed all the way through customs.

Our flight was 2 hours delayed, we sat on the tarmac on arrival for one hour and the baggage took almost an hour to arrive.  Miserable travel experience.  We arrived at the Cancun airport at 2pm for our flight and were not through the airport until 1130pm

the delay was, i suppose, no fault of UA. however arriving at Newark with a two hour delay and needing to stay in plane additional half an hour because the gate was taken an no other gate was reserved is definitely UA fault and lack of caring. I was traveling with my mother in law 88 years old and the wheel chair , which had been reserved, was not there, we needed to wait additional  20 minutes for the wheelchair. I think US personal treats passengers and luggage with the same arrogance, except they do not give instruction to the luggage. The staff has to understand that they work to service the passengers and not the other way around. UA has become non caring, arrogant and self serving.

The flight was delayed over four hours. When we were Finally going to board the airplane out of the Cancun airport, there was absolutely no organization every single person that was going to fly on a flight ran to the front the people that were trying to check us in was extremely rude. Then once we finally got into new work there was no open gates for us so we had to sit on the airplane for an additional 45 minutes. Not a good way to come home from a fabulous vacation

1) No bag available for car seat, 2) no premier luggage claim tags, 3) Gate attendant at MNB did not know whether meal on plane, 4) gate agent at EWR mistakenly told bag crew to take stroller to carousel instead of gate check area (had to hold 12 month old for 1.5 hours through customs)

The flight attendants were HORRIBLE and unattentive and unable to perform their duties.  before we took off the Captain/pilot made an announcement that we as passengers should be nice to the flight attendants and not too demanding because they are working on New Years Day and have already traveled to Montego Bay.  REALLY?  so they already worked 4 hours?  and this is at 3:30 PM?   baggage mess up for everyone and change took a long time - then had to wait longer for golf clubs.

There were a few big problems that should be mentioned: Firstly, the seating was extremely cramped, more so than recent flights we have taken on Alaska Air. My tall husband was SO uncomfortable! Also, it doesn't seem right that there were only 2 bathrooms available for all the economy section passengers!!!

The flight attendant got very belligerent insisting I stow my small carry-on under my seat instead of in the overhead compartment.  I explained that I am 6'3", and your reduced seat pitch is very uncomfortable for me without having extra stuff at my feet.  I also explained my concern over DVT.  She didn't care, and hovered over me for most of the boarding to make sure I didn't sneak the small carryon up into the bin.    Get bigger planes, and fix your luggage policies to prevent these problems.

Communication is key! Let the passengers know what is going on. It should not be up to us to figure out if there is an issue, we should be informed by the staff as to delays or other problems. No one on the ground crew made any announcements until almost an hour after the scheduled departure time. And if you sign me up for text alerts, why not use them either? Overall, not an impressive operation.

We continuously have delays into Fort Myers!  Why should we have to be inconvenienced because the aircraft is delayed elsewhere with so many aircrafts that United owns?  Why not bring in another aircraft rather than have us delayed?  It utterly ridiculous!  Since the merge from with Continental the service has not been the same!  Very disappointed when traveling with United!!

The gate at Newark is terrible. The tables and tablet computer have encouraged people to sit and camp and play with the pcs leaving nowhere for families to sit and wait. ALSO as a wheelchair passenger you should know that not even ONE of the places for using the tablets has a removable chair to allow wheelchairs to use them. I didnt care for myself as I have my own notebook computer but if I did not I would have been very angry especially as I was a FIRST CLASS passenger.  I was not pleased to find that during the ridicuously long wait there was no Presidents Lounge facility for me to use ) SO TELL ME AGAIN WHY AM I PAYING ALL THAT MONEY FOR FIRST CLASS ??? By the way my plane from Manchester UK the day before was also pretty bad. I was seated in row ONE but the tv control first wouldnt cvome out of the stowage bay and then when the cabin manager got it out the cable as not connected to it at all so for 7.5 hours I had no entertainment system.  Oh and the Plane UA 80 was parked on the runway NOT at a Jetway. I had to ride on a dirty diesel lift up van thing with a very unfriendly driver who clearly though I was a major inconvenience. I asked her to switch off the diesel engine because I have COPD and I needed my in haler. She threatened to tell the captain that I was an aggressive customer and then he wouldn't let me and my wife fly !!! TELL ME WHY I AM PAYING ALL THAT MONEY FOR A FIRST CLASS SEAT ? For your information I am a CEO of an Aerospace Engineering Company that does development work on ROLLS ROYCE jet engines. www.pdsengineering.co.uk and also a Past President of the Lancashire (State) Chamber of Commerce in the UK.

We we delayed and gate was changed.   We did not hear boarding announcements because there weren’t enough seats in new gate area.  Not happy with Newark airport installing tables with iPads.  They take up more room than regular sests
Poor judgement to give our plane away and delay us. You ruined the fun of the trip.

Baggage claim was a nightmare. It took over an hour to get my luggage. The baggage handlers kept messing up and getting all the bags stuck so they would have to turn it off. Then someone would come and THROW the bags out of the way. It was such a big show of incompetence that one of the people waiting for their luggage started to take charge a helped people get their luggage and kept the belt moving. Everyone clapped for him no one clapped for your employees.
Food was really bad.

You ruined the fun of our trip by stressing us out. We had a two and a half hour layover, and we barely missed our flight because someone gave our plane away. We walked off one plane and were the last onto the next. Thank goodness LAX had the common sense to hold the plane for the 7 of us that almost missed the flight to SIN. It was unbelievably frustrating to experience so much incompetence with operations, maintenance, and push back.

Golf bag delivery was extremely delayed.   We waited over 40 minutes for the bags to arrive and actually asked to have them shipped home given the delay.  As we were walking out the bags arrived but did not come down the shoot to the carriage so we had to climb up to retrieve the bag ourselves.
Every time I fly to Newark there are always delays to getting me home. I don’t know why but it is annoying.
Your display only said "operational difficulties" and delay times were not accurate.

The Flights Attendants onboard were very unfriendly especially the FA working in the  front of the  plane. She never greeted passengers or said Happy New Year or acknowledged passengers as they left. Obviously, she did  not like working on New Year's Day and it  showed. Very unfriendly crew!!

We waited over an hour to board the plane due to "flight operations".  We had at most two announcements from the gate and neither were very detailed.  This is not a new phenomenon.  Indeed some of the folks around us were wondering whether this was a prelude to a cancellation, something we all had experienced.  But then no one told us anything one way or the other so we were left to guess.  The frustrating thing is that someone at United must have known.  I could speculate that UA changed to a larger plane and thus needed an additional flight attendant and had to reschedule personnel but whatever happened at check in we were on time, then 25 minutes late while standing in line, then one hour late to take off.  Standing on concrete for 90 minutes is painful.

The only reason my flight was comfortable was because I paid to upgrade my seat.  My flight on 12/22/17 from Newark to Houston was terrible -- overhead baggage area over my seat was full & gate person argued that my carry on bag was to big & had to be checked, leg room in seat was nonexistent & extremely uncomfortable.

The experience at COS could not be better; however, after landing EARLY at O'Hare we then waited on the TARMAC for nearly an HOUR before finally finding a gate for us to get off the plane, we then waited in the beyond freezing jet-bridge for all of the gate checked luggage in sub zero temps. The baggage for this flight was a NIGHTMARE, it was posted to go the wrong carousel and never came. Finally after another hour, they told us it was at carousel 2 instead of 11, and we FINALLY LEFT THE AIRPORT TWO HOURS AFTER LANDING. I was traveling with two small children and did not get home until after 11 PM when we landed at ORD at 7:45! This ruined an entire day, very poorly done United!

Problem getting an available gate in Chicago.  Sat on plane one hour before being allowed to de-plane.  Then no staff to transport luggage from plane, with additional wait of 1 1/2 hours.  Very poor experience.

The check in person at the gate (Laura) was extremely rude and unprofessional. She treated our family with complete inconsideration and disrespect. Laura provided unacceptable service and I was very surprised. I fly with UNITED for business regularly and I have never had a poor experience- I am very disappointed.
You changed my seat that I paid (extra leg room) for from the aisle to a middle and window seat without notification. I am slightly claustrophobic so this change caused me distress !!!
