customs was a real mess, worst experience in my 25 years of flying international flights

I paid $4,000 for a first class business class seat and was bumped to a later flight then they ran out of food for my dinner. I cannot eat seafood. That was the only meal offered. I was forced to eat crackers for my dinner. Was disappointed that for such an expensive seat no other food was offered.

Seats were supposed to be the new Polaris but weren’t. This is misleading. Flight attendants were not nice. Seat next to me was broken and would not recline. Plane looked beaten up including bathrooms. Breakfast cereal was stale. Had to wait an hour for a gate at Newark. Had to wait a long time for someone to open the door. Almost had a disaster as the door to the airport was locked but people kept coming up in the elevator and there was no room. People were screaming and panicking. Our priority bags came off very late in luggage process. Priority was not honored. We had checked in 2 hours before the flight. Immigration was not working. It told us 2 hours from landing to get in a car to leave airport. Very bad all around experience.  Only two meals served in first class on a 14 hour flight.
I was awaken two times for no reason by the flight attendants which was really upsetting since it was so hard to fall asleep on those horrible and uncomfortable seats to begin

There was no communication prior to boarding the plane about why the plane was almost 2 hours delayed getting in from Houston (and therefore our flight). People working the desk also didn't see very...capable. I had BE and had a seat assignment - they didn't read my name out over the microphone when handing out seat assignments and when I went up she seemed confused that I was even needing a ticket at first.

I travel frequently for work and don't know that I've ever experienced flight attendants as unprofessional as ours. They were curt as soon as we arrived on the plane. After handing out beverages, they stood at the back of the plane talking and laughing extremely loudly. At one point, they were showing each other video's on their cell phones, playing the audio without headphones. All the while, they directly blocked the aisle way to the bathroom, making it uncomfortable to come through and have to say "excuse me" to squeeze by them. As if that wasn't bad enough, they never came through to collect trash...on a nearly 3 hour flight. Tray tables and seatbacks were all full for the length of the flight, making for an uncomfortable experience. It wasn't until we were (20) minutes out from landing that they finally came through with one bag, instructing people to "push it down" when it got full. Overall, the uncleanliness of the plane and the disrespectfulness of the flight attendants making for a very negative experience.
The African American Agent at the ccounter prior boarding wasn't pleasant at all, distasteful attitude and unprofessional, not good customer service skills.

YEs. One passenger carried a small dog on board that continually  disrupted the flight by barking/yapping randomly during both flights. THis was very annoying to myself and was noted by other passengers. There was a Service dog on board which made NO noise. This other person's small dog was extremely annoying. The lap dog was not a service dog, no visible identification and the conduct of the dog was not in compliance with licensed servie dogs. Small pets should not be allowed on board with passengers unless required as a service dog. Some travellers are allergic to pet dander and this could have caused severe health concerns for any passenger so afflicted. I would like to see all Airlines ecome stricter regarding this issue.

At gate C130, it was extremely difficult to hear the gate announcements.  The seats are located in the middle of the walking area, but the gate speakers were only next to the desk.  Any "terminal announcement" drowned out the gate announcements.  It is very easy to miss an announcement or even the call to board.
The attitude of the women at baggage check in and later in security was APPALLING. They were miserable, unhelpful, disinterested....... a VERY POOR reflection on United as an airline

We landed on time but had to taxi for 40 minutes before arriving at our gate. Once de-planed, we had to wait in the jet bridge for our gate-checked bags in single digit temperatures with negative windchills.
We had to wait for 40 minutes after we landed to get to a gate. NOT HAPPY with that after a 13 hour flight.

I was traveling with my 2 children, one with a fractured foot and the other with a heart condition.  Our seats were in row 7, upon boarding I asked the 2 RUDE flight attendants in the front of the plane to please help me place my 2 carry on bags in the overhead cabin since there was limited space.  They instructed me to find my own place which ended up near row 20 and 25! A few minutes later one of the RUDE attendants comes to the overhead above me and removes a bag and places another passengers bag in the space.  I ask her why she couldn't do the same for me? She shrugs and walks away! During the flight when a different attendant comes to collect garbage, she wouldn't take the small bag of garbage I had!? Towards the end of the flight, I notice one of the two RUDE attendants removed her own bag from an overhead near me!  These flight attendants could have helped me and seemingly went out of their way not to.  At the end of the flight, I had to retrieve my bags in the back of the plane while everyone was trying to get off adding stress I didn't need.  When finally leaving the plane the RUDE attendants just smirked at me and said have a nice night! I really cannot believe I was treated this way! I doubt that anything would be done about the treatment I received and will no longer travel with United again.

Seats hurt my back and bottom, the delays were a huge bummer, and the gate was freezing cold. I wish I had known about the delay via a text or email as soon as it was delayed, instead of waiting until I got to the airport.

The flight attendants in ciach class were rude and dismissive. Kept wairing for them to collect trash and then they were seemingly upset when i walked back to throw away. First time ive seen them hang garbage bags from bathroom door. When i asked for water, she pointed to some on a tray in the back and when i took a glass she flung the curtain right behind me. He, was so rude when teying to ourchase food. He handed three pretzel bags on the aisle seat table and jept walking never asked the middle or window seat if we want d anything. Ignored us when we kept saying... excuse me, sir.... when the orher oassengers got his attention, he was abruot and angry and said.. something rude and hasty. Not professional at all. They disappeared after forst service. Never offered the can to premier 1 k or a option to ourchase
The handling of boarding, carry-on, and forcing people at the gate to check bags was a waste of time, and completely unfair and incompetent.

Our flight was delayed at the gate for more than 45 minutes due to a lack of one copy (of two) of a mandatory flight attendant manual.  The staff tried unsuccessfully to download e-copy but ended up needing to print a 700+ page document before the flight could depart.  This delay resulted in only a 15 minute connection for us in Chicago, which we just made by sprinting from one concourse to the next.  There should be more designed redundancy with these required manuals.  A flight should not be delayed by nearly an hour because of mandatory manuals or paperwork that attendants or the plane should maintain.

For Christmas my 10 year old son asked for a suitcase.  He received that suitcase and was excited to use it on this trip to Chicago.  When we got back to DC and received the bags he noticed that his brand new suitcase had been damaged in numerous places.  These were not mere scratches or smudges, but damage to the seams that exposed the wire underneath in three different places and damage to one of the zippers that will result in it needing to be replaced. We immediately took the bag to the United desk to file a claim.  We were informed that because the damage did not prevent the bag from holding luggage, United would do nothing to repair the bag.  My son is very disappointed.  And as a senior leader at a multi-billion company, I'm embarrassed that any company (let alone one of the largest airlines in the world) would risk losing a customer over a torn $100 bag.     I should note that I am a fairly regular United flier, but my experience the with United in 2017 has been miserable.  This trip was no different.  Prior to leaving for Chicago, I discovered that United had bumped all five members of my party and we had no seats, despite having made reservations months in advance.  I called and luckily we were able to secure our original seats on the flight out.  For the return flight (this flight) we were not able to do that and we forced to selected seats near the rear of the plane.  When we boarded the plane, I noticed that our original seats were listed on the display in blue, meaning that they were empty.  Running an airline is a logistical nightmare.  I get there will be bumps.  But my past year with United has been miserable.  This flight was the icing on a really bad year.  I hope it will get better.

Someone vomited in the plane right before we boarded. The flight attendant said the cleaning crew cleaned up but the smell was so bad for 7.5 hours. The flight attendant tried to mask the smell with spray which made it worse. This is completely unacceptable to have passengers endure the fowl smell of vomit at all, let alone for 7.5 hours. Absolutely disgusting. We paid way too much money for these tickets round trip to Maui to have to be subjected to these conditions. A clean and clean smelling environment should be at the basics to say the very least. I really feel we should be compensated for this and NOT the usual $100 credit/person in the party. We paid $9817.69 for four tickets!!! Please advise.

At first, the departure time of the flight was 511 pm. Then it said it was delayed to 640 pm. I verified the new time at the gate and left to get some food(around 420 pm). While I just ordered the food I switched on my phone which had my google flights page already on, and I saw the time had moved back to 511. And this was at 5 pm. I had to run all the way to the gate and make the flight leaving the food I had already ordered. There needs to be a notification message or email sent to the patrons regarding such last minute changes. I would have easily missed my flight and also lost money on the food I ordered. This is a really bad flying experience which I have never faced before.

There was very little communication to customers when the flight kept being delayed. We were sitting there with no notification as to why we weren’t boarding. We ended up taking off 3hours late. The employee at the gate was very rude when I was inquiring about what was going on. I had a connection that I was concerned about making and I didn’t get strong reassurance.
Leg room at economy. Disaster

When I arrived at LAX Monday evening 1/1/18 I waited for almost 2 hours for my checked bag to arrive. The first woman I spoke with at the customer care desk told me my bag was scanned at LAX and would be appearing on the belt in about 10 minutes. I waited 30 and nothing came out. I then went to the 2nd woman at customer care and after many questions was finally told my luggage was sent on the wrong flight (#275). Since that flight did not have a gate to pull up to, I was advised to arrange for my bag to be sent to me free of charge. I was given a file # and 800 # and was told I would receive a call later that evening once my bag had arrived. I never received a call, but did get an email from WheresMyLuggage.com.   It is now 3 days later and I have yet to receive my baggage, details of its whereabouts, or an explanation of what happened. Each time I call the baggage call center, the representatives either tell me my bag will arrive "within 2 hours", or that the 3rd party delivery company "is not answering their phone".  The supervisors in this department are always busy. The last two representatives I spoke with became very rude when I insisted on speaking with a supervisor... the last gentleman outright refused to pass my call along, saying the supervisor would just give me the same answer.   I have now missed 3 days of work waiting for my baggage to be delivered and am told I will not be compensated for my time or the lost bag until I receive the bag. I have always been a loyal United traveler and my family and I have always chosen United over other airlines, but I am utterly disgusted with the way United is handling this situation. As retail director of a luxury fashion house, I understand things happen out of our control. But United's handling of this situation turned an unfortunate incident into a customer service nightmare. Why was I not notified when I arrived at LAX that my bag had been put on the wrong flight? Why have I not received a straight answer from anyone regarding the location of my bag? And finally, if this 3rd party delivery company is so unreliable and so unprofessional as to not answer their phones, why does United continue to contract with them?  Susan Keng, passenger on flight UA 1258 susankeng@gmail.com 201-787-6095
We were delayed for more than an hour AFTER landing... Pilot made no attempt to find another gate for the aircraft...  A plane full of furious passengers... Another blunder by GoJet

Somehow my family's reservation (4 people) was split into four different reservations. I suspect this was done by a gate agent in Chicago during an earlier leg of the flight. This caused a number of problems: 1. An equipment change resulted in the four of us sitting in four different places - despite an existing seat assignment. I have two small children so this caused a number of issues. We ended up sitting in two sets of two. Not convenient.  2. My kids became unaccompanied minors in the United system which caused a number of issues, including an extended check-in process that could not be done on-line 3. The rest of my family lost their group 1 status - not a big issue, just annoying 4. Part of my family lost their pre-check status  I specifically declined the upgrade option to avoid this. We were upgraded in Chicago because space was needed in economy. Still, even with an upgrade, the above should not happen.   Also, luggage in Boston took 40 minutes from when we arrived at the gate until the first bag came out - on the wrong belt, by the way.

7+ hour delay...  United people behind counter were NOT helpful. The first delay of 7:17 pm stay on screen until well after 7:17 even though they said it would later than 10pm. One person said updates came from Chicago while a different person said he just updated it. There was an initial update that claimed the plane coming from Chicago wasn't even in Chicago yet, but flight tracker showed it was in fact in Chicago. Lies aren't necessary. I don't think there was another group update until after 11 pm. Many other updates were given, but only when people asked about them. I bet he gave well over 100 updates (one at a time) throughout the night. I was told by two people that my luggage could be carried on flight, but they said "No" at the gate. Although disappointing at the time, it was actually nice to know where my luggage was throughout the night. The flight attendant was reported to be sick, but it seems they they could have contacted united group earlier than when the plane landed to find an alternate quicker. After midnight we started boarding the plane only to find out they had been fueling a different plane. The pilot apologized for this disappointed delay after a very long night.
The bathrooms on that flight were filthy.  Other than that, no complaints!

The handle on my suitcase was broken when I arrived in Chicago. I have a roller bag with a retractable handle and it was jammed in and impossible to pull out. Very disappointed because this is the largest case of a 3 case set and it is esentially unusable now because the handle does not pull out. There's a smaller bag that attaches to the handle and that smaller bad will now have to be carried. Very unhappy that this matched set is all but useless.

A two hour delay for traffic is a little ridiculous. The delay was longer than the flight! No one sounded even remotely apologetic. I understand stuff happens but I encountered absurd delays in both directions for fixable reasons.

Could not hear directions given by flight attendants. Too quiet and muffled. We had been on a United airplane from 8:45 a.m. in Hawaii until 11:05 p.m. with no time between flights. NO FOOD was available when we left our hotel for the airport or when we arrived in Chicago at 11:05 p.m. Food choices on the plane were lousy and terribly overpriced. Will not fly United until this changes.

I rated the flight low for cleanliness as when I got to my seat there were crushed pretzels on the floor-not acceptable.  Additionally our flight was due to take off at 5:35pm and it did not take off until after 6:30pm so nearly an hour’s delay.

Having upgraded to business class, I was VERY disappointed in the menu selection.  A cheeseburger or cold salad with a cold chicken breast are not what I have come to expect when traveling business class.   I hope to see better options in the future.  Your chicken or salmon dishes are always good.  I know you need variety, but the options seen on this latest flight were dismal.

One last thing is we were not happy with our flight from Jacksonville to Chicago because it left late and the gate was not available so we were on the runway for 30 mins. But as I said, it all worked out because this Chicago-SFO plane was delayed so they got us on it!
Departure time was not clearly announced & then we had no idea about delay cause.
IDIOTIC TO REQUIRE BAGS TO BE "GATE CHECKED" THEN REQUIRE PASSENGERS TO GO TO BAGGAGE CLAIM AND WAIT OVER 40 MINUTES FOR BAGGAGE.  WILL NOT BE CHOOSING UNITED FOR FUTURE SHORT FLIGHTS.

The terminal was cold while we waited inside for the new flight - people had on jackets and gloves.  There was a long wait while the "carry on" luggage from the previous flight was taken off and therefore the door to the terminal was open.   Our flight was 4 hours late and therefore when I landed - around midnight - so my ride was not able to pick me up.  I had to have a cab take me home and that required additional time as it was around midnight.  Overall, one of the worst experiences I have had flying in a very long time.

We were very disappointed that our flight was delayed 2 hours going home.  This was compounded by the fact are flight TO Tampa was delayed 3 hours.  Not exactly a great experience this time around.  The only reason I am not going to go crazy is that we arrived both times safely.  As a mom of 3 children that is most important.  However, this was an expensive ticket.  So to be delayed a total of 5 hours on this trip was tough to handle at fiest

Boarding was prompt, but we sat on the plane for over an hour as first there was a fueling issue and then a reset to the computer. While these were perhaps unavoidable, more consistent communication/updates and explanation from the crew would have alleviated the frustrations passengers felt. Especially sitting on the tarmac for close to 45 minutes.

There was an assault on the flight , the captain spoke to the main person  who started the fight and allowed him back on the plane . Which I thought was the wrong decision. I did not feel safe with this aggressive person sitting behind me.
Terrible service. Staff at check in and on board were not interested in helping and were borderline offensive
The only negative was the baggage claim experience in Houston.  Over one hour to get bag
Bad experience.
Very poor experience.

As a result of experience at ORD connection, 1 of my 3 bags did not make it to LGA. Not sure why when all 3 were rechecked together. I never got a status update on the bag by United for almost 24 hrs. When I called them to get info, I was misled with info & the bag was finally delivered 40 hours later to NJ!! When I was not home b/c I had to fly out again & no one else was home this week. The bag deliver service left my bag at the front door in what is now extremely bad weather. I have specific directions to leave on porch on side of house which is covered. Just an absolutely disgraceful & disappointing conduct of affairs by all involved.

The step 1, step 2 check in process is complicated by a sea of people and not being able to figure out which lines of people were for what. We ended up getting on a step 1 line a second time after completing step 1 because we thought it was a step 2 line which it ended up not being. Then the agents at step 2 were completely idle behind a completely roped off area. We couldn't figure out how to even get to a step 2 agent without removing the ropes let alone find where the line was. That explains why they were looking bored, but not where the sea of people finishing step 1 were going. Overall, lines need to be marked so people know where to go. It was total chaos because nobody knew what the lines were for or where to go for the line you need.
Racist and rude flight attendance.
Food was horrible. Seats were extremely small and uncomfortable
My baggage did not arrive.  In fact, it never left Ohare airport.  I am now stuck in Amsterdam without my personal items.  Unreal.  Overall, horrible travel experience to start 2018.

The check in system in Newark was awful. The system gave us random seats and I had no choice to changed them. The only option was to pay 189 dollars each. The assistance in check in said I should try on the gate. I tried and a very unpleasant attendent said there was nothing we could do. I saw him giving boarding passes to other passengers. I was at the aiport 3h30 before the flight, I cannot accept that those, my random seats, were the last 2 seats available in the economic cabin and everybody else was already checked in!
The slimline seats are terrible, uncomfortable. They have caused me repeated hip pain/bursitis. I escalated to your CEO.
As stated before, I was very disturbed to find a sharp piece of ceramic in the mixed nuts. It was in my mouth and I barely avoided a cut or broken tooth.

The gate agents announced boarding Group 1 before global services - they then realized their error when I asked if they were going to board Global Services and the guy then announced,  Global Services and Group 1 but it was a bit chaotic at the gate entrance to the jetway and global services customers (I think it was me and one other) were confused on when we could board without cutting off the Group 1 passengers, for which there were MANY.  This is really one of the few real perks of being a Global Services member, and not being able to board first is disappointing so the gate agents should be trained to ensure they ONLY announce global services to board BEFORE Group 1 as so many passengers are now Group 1.
flight attendants were RUDE and NASTY

Everything was smooth and on time.  No problems or delays.  Boarding was sequential with plenty of time for passengers to maneuver through the crowd and into the line as sometimes it gets rushed.  But that wasn't the case.  We left the gate a little late.  But, we arrived on time.  So, there weren't any issues.

When flying from SAL to EWR my sit, that was NOT in the exit section, did not recline. I talked to the flight attended and she said “let me see if I can assign you another sit” but she never came back, I had to called her again just to hear “sorry, there are no more sits available “ so my entire flight was very uncomfortable.

Unless you really want to hear my opinion dont ask. You model your survey to suit your needs. Your aircrafts are relly bad and very very uncomfortable. You make the whole experience of flying so uncomfortable.

I had a miserable experience at Newark Airport. First of all, the checkin was absolutely miserable. Lines were unorganized and, because I had checked in online, I was given incorrect information. I didn't realize that I had to get the baggage tags from the kiosks before dropping them off. When I did, the girl gave me an extremely unacceptable ghetto attitude. She was correct, but she needed to lose that attitude as it is extremely unprofessional and puts people on the defensive. Then it took a while to figure out which kiosk lines were moving, as these lines were incredibly unorganized. When I finally found one that was organized & staff members were willing to help, it was a dream. But it wasn't enough to erase the negative experiences at the beginning. Security was fine. But when I got to the gate, boarding was horrendous. Staff members remained at the counter and no one was there to monitor the lines. I didn't appreciate men cutting in front of me, esp as a woman who is only 5'3". Had staff members been more attentive, I doubt something like this would have happened.

I have already filed a complaint, but will briefly reiterate here: baggage claim in Newark was a nightmare, employees were not doing their job and became incredibly rude when asked what was going on. I was told to check my bag at the gate, even though I was in boarding group 2 and had a bag that is guaranteed to fit in overhead compartments. That bag was severely damaged in transit and is no longer useable. I was told that I would need to return to the airport within 24 hours if I wanted to report a damage claim, which I was not willing to do after spending an additional hour on the tarmac after a 5 hour flight with a 2 hour baggage/security check-in experience. I am a explorer card holder and a frequent United flyer, and I am unfathomably pissed off by this experience and the lack of regard for my time and my belongings.
The food was disappointing. Poor choice for main and not very much.

The airport security line was ridiculously long. The crowd control was poor wen organising passengers into lines.  We were told we didn’t have allocated seats and to ‘see agent’ but none of the staff were helpful. They were dismissive and rude of my partner when he asked if we could have seats together. In the end we had seats apart which was quite disappointing and unexpected.  On board the staff were rushed in giving food out and didn’t seem like they really cared. They came across as rude shouting ‘elbows in or they might get hit’ when pushing trolled up ad down the aisles.    On our way out to newark the food was terrible - the vegetarian pasta was dry and burnt on top with a measly layer of sauce sat at the bottom.   Unfortunately I won’t be flying with United again. Overall a stressful and disappointing experience.

We plane checked our bags but when we landed in Richmond we were told that we would have to go to baggage claim to retrieve them. Our bags were regulation size for carry ons, yet we weren't allowed to bring them on the plan and had the added inconvenience of being forced to go through baggage claim even though we never checked bags
no room in the seats, so uncomfortable, everyone was complaining about the discomfort.
The were NO vegetarian food options.  HOW INSENSITIVE!
The seat was very uncomfortable, could not find a good position to sit.
two days now one checked bag still missing. last known location is check in at newark and no one can tell us where it is

The meal choices for a dinner flight on a 6 hour transcon are pathetic. The quality and quantity has gone down hill to a point where it is not worth paying for first class. It was only a year ago that there were 3 meal choices (now 2) which included options like salmon or short rib. My last flights (in paid first) on the EWR-SEA route have been vegan chili or Mac n cheese and chicken or mushroom pasta. Mac n cheese... really? Not only that, it has gone from a multi-course meal (i.e. salad first, then entree, then dessert) to a single pre-plated tray - feels like I'm back at the high school cafeteria.   The point is that when I'm paying 3x or more for a first class ticket I expect to get something for that money. UA has failed to meet those expectations on my last flights.
Staff was awfully rude.

We were late leaving Cedar Rapids, but it was implied that we would be able to maky up time/arrive with enough time to not miss connections.  However, we sat on the runway for >35 minutes before a gate was available.  My issue is not with the aircraft/pilot/crew for the flight but UNITED's LACK OF COORDINATION OF GATES AND GROUND CREW.  I had to RUN to get my flight that I oringinally had a 90 minute layover for.

I’m so disappointed because I’m an explorer card member and was treated like I didn’t matter at all. Your airline just cares about making money and you don’t care about people who don’t spend millions for you. Talk about completely terrible customer service for everyone that isn’t “first class.” I’m cancelling my card and never flying you again. Southwest just won my business because you lost it.

Our baggage was lost. It contained a firearm and we’re very displeased as our flight to/from Chicago have been nightmares. Our flight out was supposed to arrive at Ohare at 10pm. We didn’t arrive until 3am the following day due to mechanical issues.
There were no gates open when arriving in Chicago so I almost missed my connecting flight. Then since that was late my bags did not make it to my final destination.

The baggage charge on our flight was ridiculous - especially as we had upgraded to economy/comfort/plus.  The delay in baggage collection was outrageous and inexcusable.  United continues to be the most disappointing of all major US carriers.  As a frequent business traveler with Diamond status on Delta and Exec Platinum on American, I would have expected more from United to earn my business.
Terrible flight, we were delayed by more than 3 hours. The ground staff also had no clue how long it would take to fix the mechanical issue
Extremely long delay due to united’s broken plane (not any weather issues, etc)
Bad, bad, bad airline in every sense
The flight was delayed.That was the main disappointment
There is no way baggage should be on the wrong plane on a direct flight.  That is unacceptable.  I should not be charged a $25 fee for checking a bag if my bag never gets on the plane.
No.  Main problems lie in Bangor to Newark.

The delay leaving Newark was frustrating.  We arrived at the gate 10 mins before boarding time, and the plane hadn't been moved to our gate yet (even though the app showed it landed many hours earlier).  Then we had to stand around waiting while the crew readied the plane and the catering was done.  It just seemed unnecessary when the plane had been around for quite a while.  On the plus side, the gate staff was communicative, more so than I've experienced from United in quite some time.  The lounge situation in Newark is currently terrible.  The Pop-up lounge is pretty bad, and I suspect the other one was overcrowded.   The lack of speed getting the Polaris lounge done is frustrating, and I suspect even when its open, if I'm not in Polaris, I'll find the remaining lounges crowded or sub-par as they currently are.  This is your hub ... it really needs to be better, and it needs to be better quickly.  $500+ dollars per year for lounge access is starting to feel like a terrible value.
your airline is garbage. kill self
The amount of legroom in coach now is pathetic.

What is the policy on animals on a flight? There was a small dog that yelped and barked for the entire boarding process and well into the first leg of the flight. It also yelped a few times throughout the flight. Just seems ridiculous how many dogs are now seen on flights...especially when they aren't quiet. A previous flight in Nov was equally as frustrating as the passenger next to me had a dog at his feet and had to spread his legs around the carrier into my space. With such limited space its just really frustrating.
I was traveling w two teenagers and none of us had any source of entertainment until about halfway through.  But our devices were dead by then and no power sources!
Flight delay... no appology....no real explanation for delay. Delay was long. Travelors, like myself, were given no satisfaction.

We arrived on time but had to sit for over a half hour to wait for a gate. This has happened to me a few times now. So frustrating - we were exhausted and almost home and not able to get off the plane.
It was delayed, and then delayed, and then delayed some more.
Horrible experience. Will be writing to customer service in detAil
What is United’s policy regarding small children ( baby) that is sick?
Late flight attendants make flight delayed 1 hour. Which is very unpleasant.

I am always cold on planes and never warm.  This flight was so hot that I was actually sweating.  It was ridiculously uncomfortable to be seated on this plane for the entire flight.  Not sure if there was an issue with the temperature controls but it was stifling.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: Not just the flight to Manchester but the outbound flight to Newark was also terrible, the staff was the rudest out of any airline I have been on, the airport in Newark was a disaster with none of the self service baggage machines working so cues for over 2 hours just to check bags. The food was absolutely terrible and despite asking several times I was unable to get a drink on the plane for over 3 hours. So had to resort to drinking from the tap in the toilet as I was very dehydrated. Also the seat entertainment did not work at all and I have never been on a long haul flight on such a tiny plane. The worst part is I paid £2000 pounds for these two flights, i will never book with you again and will advise other people also not too, I have had many flight experiences and this was by far the worse.

There was no reason that I know of to have my bag come to FLL on a flight ahead of me and then have it inaccessible to pickup upon my arrival. I still don't have my bag and to say I'm pissed off would be a significant understatement.
Dissatisfied due to the cancellation on the original flight from BWI to LAX. I feel like the cancellation by the United Air cause this disappointing experience. This was my worst experience ever!

We were three hours delayed. The gate changed at the last minute. The plane was not clean when we boarded. We sat at the gate for 20 minutes after the doors closed to push back. Nothing complimentary--like DirecTv was offered. Altogether, a bad flight.

gate agent mentioned that if we didn't board the flight in a timely manner, that the flight would eventually be cancelled.  this is after its been delayed for over 2.5 hours.  after announcing that at the gate, there was no sense of urgency to board the passengers.  so what was the point in saying that?
Flight attendants seemed tired and flustered so it must have been a long day for them; gate attendant were rude to an elderly lady trying to board and it seemed to upset her deeply

They never told us the flight was delayed, this was very frustrating as I had a connection to catch. If I had known the flight was delayed I could have looked for alternate routes to get home. We overheard the worker at the gate say delayed and had to get up and ask if the plane was delayed and she said yes, even though all the reader boards said it was on time.
The delay seemed unreasonable for the problem

First, we had a mechanical so the flight was delayed.  Plane is fixed after an hour then no flight attendant. Second, we couldn't get a flight attendant.  Gate agent tells us they are walking over from Terminal 2.   It does NOT take two hours to walk over.    After a four hour delay we take off. We land and there is no ground crew to greet us so another 20 minute delay. January 1. Great way to kick off the New Year American (sarcasm).   Horrible experience for all passengers guys.   Not a good way to start the new year.   Big fail by United.
When I went to check into the Saginaw airport, there were no ticketing agents there. I waited 20 minutes to be helped, and when they eventually did come to the counter, they were rude.
I got NO notifications of flight delay even though I signed up for them. Numerous people around me on plane complained of exact same thing

I wouldn't recommend United not because of this trip but because i had other BAD experiences this past year.  In February I had filed a complaint about two days of delays and lies for a flight to Brazil.  My husband got a partial refund for the flight.  My daughter got a credit.  I was the one that called and filed the complaints, and I got nothing.  I only take United if there are no other choices.  Sorry to be rude, but it's a fact.

When I booked my flight this flight was scheduled to depart at 7:45pm with dinner service for first class. Prior to the day of my flight the time of departure was changed to 8:06pm. Not only was dinner no longer being served the 'snack' was pitiful for first class. Bags of chips! That's ridiculous.  Considering we are told to now be at the airport 2 hours prior to flight, I was hungry and expecting more than 'chips' for the snack which replaced the dinner which had been scheduled when I purchased my ticket. I read United cut back on first class food service in September 2017. Big mistake.

The delays were insane....other flights on other airlines, that were scheduled to leave after us, got lesser delays and both left and arrived before we did....some left and landed at their destinations, before we even left. There was no rhyme or reason to the delays...terrible communications. Overall miserable experience
2nd time this month that 1st/business class had no meal and no noteworthy snacks
Tsa was a disaster one person for pre check on New Year's Day!
very bad in flight experience in terms of not enough food choice, cleanliness , in flight snacks,
The purser in first class was one of the nastiest flight attendants I've ever had.

It was comical expecting some food/snacks in first class to be given a bag of pretzels only slightly larger than the one you get in coach.  Don't sell "First Class" tickets, just sell them as "bigger seat", there was nothing first class about the experience.  There was no TV in the aircraft, even the budget guys have this, really just a not up to standard, left me with a very bad taste in my mouth for the airline.
Plane was on deck for over 2 hours prior to our flight time and we were still 90 minutes delayed bease of catering.  Unacceptable

Air conditioning on plane was too cold and as a result I became sick ..i asked to buy a blanket as I was shaking and the flight attendant couldn't help me ..i know first class are offered blankets and they could have sold me one but he refused

While the delay was most likely out of the airline's control, I was disappointed that the in-flight entertainment was not complimentary despite the flight being international.  I flew to my destination on a competitor and their in-flight entertainment was complimentary.

although I had to book this flight rather late and understood I would be sitting toward the rear of the plane, I was unhappy about being in the last row.  That being said, I can accept that because of my late reservation but I am 6 ' 3" and was incredibly uncomfortable in your seats.  No legroom and just miserable for the entire trip.

When I landed in ORD in order to catch my flight to PHL, I had very little time between the flight boarding time. The gates where very far apart (F Terminal to C Terminal) and I had to run in order to catch my flight. I was severely out of breath from running, also the altitude difference from Aspen to Chicago, and the fact that it was January 1st and I was up all night, made me really really out of breath. When I finally got to my seat, I ask the flight attendant nicely for a cup of water. She told me no water, only until we were in the air, and that the water was all in the front. I was completely exhausted, coughing, and sweating. I waited patiently, then when we were in air, the beverage cart came from the back (with water on it!). I again asked the other flight attendant politely if I could have water since I just ran and was sick. This attendant then proceeded to tell me that they have to start at the front and if I want some water I must think I'm really special. I told her I was sick and that I needed just a cup of water. She then told the entire section that I must be the most special person there and gave me a cup. I'm not one to complain, but I really just needed a cup of water...I didn't want to be denied something so simple and then be put on display just because I was asking for something simple.

I originally was supposed to leave Portland Oregon at 11:30 pm on Dec. 31st.  I decided to extend my trip a little bit longer and instead departed Portland on Jan 1st at 2:05 pm. The fee for this was originally  $84.39. I check my bank account a couple of days later to discover that I've unfairly been charged $200. I had not received any explanation or any sort of heads up for these charges. Because of this I disputed the transaction with my bank. I had no issue with the flight being delayed, I understand things happen that are out of our control sometimes. I am just grateful that we were able to arrive at our destination safely. What I don't appreciate is being overcharged or mistakingly charged. Here is the confirmation # I had: M8S2CN and here is the  eticket # 0167072246154.

I was seated in the back row of the air craft seated directly behind a family with a screaming child. I felt the flight attendants did not go out of their way to make the flight more comfortable given the unfortunate circumstances. I am very displeased.

The flight was scheduled to depart 9.10pm. At 8.45pm we were told that the crew was finishing inspection of aircraft and boarding will start soon. At 9.10pm we say on the screen that the flight was delayed to 9.25pm (no announcement). After waiting for 30 more minutes, we were told that the flight moved to another gate due to change in planes. We boarded at 10.45pm and landed in DC around 1.50am. At that time the DC airport was empty and very few cabs were available.  I am very dissatisfied with the whole process.
Food ok but not great.
Two of our luggage did not make the flight even though we were delayed an hour. They had trouble locating and it took over 1/2 to determine that they were in fact still in Chicago.

3 hour layover and no food offered in business class.  Due to “food cart” being loaded on the aircraft no one in first could board aircraft till last and therefore waited another 30 additional minutes.  Those of us with children in first desperately needed to settle our kids since the flight was so delayed and had to then wait additional time in the terminal and not our seats to get our children settled.

Luggage was open and had been placed in a large plastic bag. Everything seemed to be there. We repacked it and zipped everything up and luggage container worked properly. No note of explanation as to why luggage was opened, not closed, and then placed in a large plastic bag where something could have fallen out. Somewhat disturbing experience.
Very disappointed with the long delay at Newark. I do understand weather but that was excessive and the airport amenities are not great

We landed at 11:33pm, slightly delayed due to maintence issues in EWR. However, the problem was with baggage delivery in ORF. It took over 1 hr for bags to begin showing on the belt. There was no announcement, no apology for the delay, no explanations whatsoever. This was highly disappointing.
Poor experience. Not happy at all.

I was dissatisfied with the fact that we had no wi-fi so I couldn't use my laptop. I also paid extra for the economy plus but felt there was no difference that the economy.  I was also dissatisfied with the fact that on my return flight reservation I had selected seats in row 15 and then on the the day we left for Houston it was changed to row 26.  I feel that if this is being done I should be notified. I do like traveling with United but it is these little things that do bother.

the connection with Aerolineas Argentina was a disaster, they sent me from Terminal A to C then back to A, refuse to give me transfer from EZE to AEP for the connection to Rosario, due to the luggage strike and delay, I had to pay US$55 for the taxis ride of 25 miles to catch the connection.

The food options were really bad. You can choose between pasta and chicken, but "chicken" was really some seed (chia I think) with four small pieces of chicken. The dessert was a mango ice cream. You options should be something common that everyone can eat. I couldnt eat , neither my mother . When we ask if there was something else, the attendants said with bad form "no". Also when we asked for a pair of headphones they dind´t want to give us! after 4 times asking for them, they finally appeared (again with bad mood).
The food was very poor .

The security at lax was unprofessional and horrible, they had all the containers flipping over after being scanned and electronics and expensive watches fell out, this was due to a backup as they were stopping every person to have all their electronics checked. This would be fine if they had someone organizes the boxes so they did not get jammed and flip over. they also had nobody to check the people who they were holding up so there were 5 of us just sitting there for 5 minutes waiting for someone to become available.   The economy plus seats i paid for were horrible , they were crammed and had nowhere to put our phones to watch entertainment,

They had the lights on for this late evening flight for far too long. It was almost the whole trip. Very unnecessary. Also, we sat on the plane for a while before takeoff with no announcement regarding the delay

The check-in experience was very inefficient and poorly labeled. This is partially due to the pre-clearance being closed at YVR, however, there was no staff other than the direct check-in staff helping.  At ORD, the baggage delivery was delayed by an hour for the entire flight. There was no staff helping with any inquiries and we were not informed of the status of the baggage at any point. The baggage service and the lack of communication were very disappointing.
The breakfast service prior to landing was very poor.  The food served was not good, fruit was dried out.
the slimmer seats are just not comfortable, and personal space is becoming more and more limited as more seats get crammed into planes. (I'm looking at you, 777's)
First Class seats that don't fully recline in the 4th row are a WASTE of money. Very unsatisfactory when traveling on a red-eye.

Airport experience at Lima airport was below standards.  The flight was delayed by 2hrs, no announcement from gate staff updating about the status was only made after customers started to complain.   This was after 1hr of waiting in line.   Gate attendant told us the flight was not going to take off and we asked them to accommodate us on another flight which was connecting via Houston arriving into Newark later in the PM.   When we arrived at the other with our new boarding passes, we found out that our original flight was already boarding and we had to ask to gate attendant to reissue our boarding passes which he did.   Would like to understand why is the gate attendant is allowed to make a decision on a flight being able to take off.   As you can imagine this was a very stressful experience.  In addition, Lima boarding airport procedures are very outdated and time-consuming for a traveler who has been waiting for 2hrs in line.   Very disappointing experience.

Our major problem was at the Lima Gate.  The flight was two hours late due to mechanical problems.  This by itself is not a problem, but there was NO COMMUNICATION from the staff at the gate about what was going on.  Flyers lined up in their respective "Group 1", Group 2", etc. lines and we stood there for ONE HOUR before finally a very unhappy flyer went up to the staff and requested that they PLEASE just make an announcement on why we were not boarding.  They then made an announcement--in Spanish only (even though almost all the flyers were American).  They said it would be 15 minutes and they would have more information.  An hour later, we still had not had another announcement on what was going on. Very poor communication on the part of the gate staff.  As a flyer, I would have liked to have know 1) why aren't we boarding, 2) what are you doing about it, and 3) what are my options, and 4) how will I be made right since I'm having to sit here for two hours until 2 a.m. without any info from United.  Very frustrating, hot, tiring.  Also, on the flight we had very little service.  At one point I went to the back of the plane to request a bottle of water.  I was told very CURTLY and RUDELY that I could not have a bottle of water, only a small cup.  And this is on an 8 hour flight. Very disappointed with service on this flight.
The male flight attendant was not the nicest guy!!! The seats were dirty, the blankets were not in plastic bags and they were dirty.

The customer service check in and gate were remarkably rude. A group of United employees was having a very loud argument, complaining about customers and United in front of the gate for an hour. Basic economy is an appalling concept. How many basic amenities can you remove? I was very disappointed with my experience and will be less likely to fly United in the future.

Cabin Crew was extremely rude and ignorant. When asked what was in the vegetarian meal, they didn't even know the contents.  Families with babies had been separated. Other families had been separated too.
The attendants were very rude. And service very poor.

Everything was good but the check-in was the only problem the 2 lady's that work there (11 pm) kinda discrimination for my side (I am obese) and doesn't mean to try to charge me a 2nd ticket because of it (they didn't but there were trying too) that would be the only thing I would have to say that was negative. Overall it was ok flight
No room leg. Overcrowded. Bad experience.

Rude check in staff, told me if I wanted to take stuff on board I should have come to gate earlier. I was there 35 minutes prior to departure and I had to rush to a meeting in new York. That's why I NEVER check bags due to the delay

The gate agent was rude and could not be bothered with my request. The flight attendants were rumpled and and their grooming was sub standard. Once they finished serving drinks that sat in the galley and talked loudly as to disturb at least 4 rows up.
I ordered a kosher meal. I was informed that it didn't arrive prior to take off. I was very disappointed. I had a 6am flight and had to wake up at 3am. That was a very long time to go without food.
I was very disappointed I was not upgraded using my Premier Platinum Regional Upgrade certificate, one of the few perks of Platinum status

When we arrived in Newark, the handicap assistant did not come to pick up my father in law at the door of the plane.  He had to walk all the way up to the pre boarding gate huffing and puffing and the wheelchair assistance personnel was there talking away on her phone.  We had to ask the United Airline desk and follow up the wheelchair for my father in law.     The wheelchair assistance personnel was on a handsfree phone and was on her phone non stop the entire time she was pushing my father in law and was not paying attention to what was happening around her that she got angry at one point when we reached the baggage area and she did not find anyone following her from our party.  There was six of us in the party including a 3 yr old and a 1 yr old.  My husband had to take the escalator because we all cant fit in the elevator.  So when we got to the baggage area and my son took off after a flying pigeon , my 80 yr old mother in law slowly ran after him to get him back.  I was holding my one year old plus some baggage and could not take off after them.  I had to explain to her what happened and she understood.  She dropped us off at an area where my father in law can sit and left then came back looking for a bag that was supposed to be on the wheelchair and left leaving the wheelchair behind saying she's in trouble.  That was our only negative experience during the trip , other than that, it went fairly well.

The man at the gate embarrassed and harrassed me for having my tickets on my cellphone. He was yelling at me in front of all the other passengers. I have aniety issues and I was so upset that my flight was awful. He made me feel like I was an idiot and inconvenience. The other passengers were staring at me and that made me even more nervous. I fumbled my phone and he told me that he “could have gotten 10 passengers with printed tickets in the time it took me to board you!” and he said “next time you better have a printed tickets!” I couldnt get away from him fast enough. I tried to run down th gangway which is difficult for me with an injured knee. I am disabled and off work because of this injury and he made me feel like I was holding up the rest of the passengers.  My knee swelled and hurt the whole trip.  I was upset and my husband was angry over the treatment we received. It will be difficult for me to recommend your airline to others after that experience. I don't know if I can fly with an airline that allows that kind of behavior at their gates.

Security took 1.5 hours. My seat was 12F and should have been Economy Plus with extra legroom. I am 6.4 and with two oversized passengers next to me, the space was extremely crammed and uncomfortable. No food, only snacks on plane; After the extremely long security processing tie, there was no time for a meal before boarding. All in all not a good experience this time.
Wasn’t even supposed to be on this flight. I should’ve been to my destination by the time this flight took off. Four flights in a row now you have failed me

Yes 1) The attendant at the baggage check-in was unhelpful and rude.  I had my boarding pass but because I had an in-cabin pet, was unable to check my bag outside and had to check the bag inside instead where there were long lines and no help.   Directions were not clear as to what needed to be done and the gentleman I asked for help was rude and argumentative.   2) I next encountered a snippy gate attendant who, rather than help to solve the "problem" of "three carry-ons" : my purse, my carry-on bag and the dog/carrier. Seeing this,  she ordered me to gate check one of the items. I asked why - when I paid $125 to carry on the small dog - was I not allowed a third carry on item?!  The answer I received made no sense - and still doesn't -  Why was I paying an additional  $125 if it did not allow me to have an additional carry-on?  That's my gripe with the airline. My gripe with her was her attitude.  I solved the "problem" by jamming my purse into my carry on bag.

The food in BC needs to be brought into the new millenium.  You do not accept pre-orders ov vegetarian meals.  And stop giving away the 2 vegetarian meals to meat eaters.  They don't want the other dishes because they're horrible.  Then none of us get to eat!

Gentlemen that checked my ticket getting on the plane at the gate was very rude   Stopped me and questioned the dog in which I was caring which I had paid for and accused me of not paying for it even though I had the receipt and proof that I had.  Then he told me I would have to buy my dog another ticket on the way home from Key West even though I had already purchased it   I don’t understand what he was trying to prove plus holding the line up for 2 to 3 minutes    Was very rude
The flight attendants except for one could have been more professional - referred to an older woman as “the old lady in row 10”, did not seem pleasant and on occasion appeared irritated.

The seats on this flight were absolutely horrible they were not comfy at all. There was multiple screaming children and a barking dog on the flight so it was not restful in any way. The flight attendants did not did not say anything. I asked for help purchasing the Wi-Fi the stewards were extremely rude no one asked if I would like any water juice ect I'm extremely shocked by the service I received
The whole thing just went smoothly, like it should. No line at TSA. No gate change. No flight delays. No having to gate check my bag. And I even had two seats to myself.

I had to miss a client meeting and I could not provide timely communication to them because there was very limited communication to us on the delay.  there wasn't enough communication to determine i should attempt to get on a different flight. by the time it was communicated it was too late to reschedule a flight anyway.
For whatever reason, the cabin temperature was set way too high. It was the hottest airplane I have ever flown on. Quite miserable, actually. If I had to guess, it was at least 80 F.

This complaint has nothing to do with my flight, it has to do with customer service from your accessibilities department. After being told that my service dog card would not be sufficient, I spent 5 hours getting a letter from my doctor, after I had specifically asked the person at the accessibilities department to dictate exactly what was needed.   Every other airline allows my service dog to fly with my service dog card. Yours does not. After calling my doctor and asking for a letter, having him call me back for details and interupting his busy day, he types up a letter on his lunch hour and e-mails it to me. I send it to accessibilities, but it's declined. I am very frustrated and upset with this department and pay the $125 for my dog to travel. I ask the department to send me exactly what I needed in the letter so that my dog can fly back with me in a couple of weeks. The woman says she will, but the e-mail never comes. I call back again today, the day after flying, and complain and insist on the letter be sent today. The woman says that she will send it, SHE NEVER DOES!!!  THIS IS TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!! I AM SO UPSET WITH YOUR COMPANY!!!  Please respond to this complaint with an explanation. My e-mail address is Buzzboy236@aol.com. I expect a prompt response.

I was disappointed in the fact that economy plus was very sparsely populated and i was not allowed to move one row forward to an empty row. I purchased basic economy, but you had empty seats in economy plus. To then prevent persons from moving to economy plus because they didn’t pay upgrade when they are empty anyway is poor customer service.
I'm not recommending United because of the really cramped seating space on this flight's aircraft. VERY uncomfortable!!!

Meant to leave very dissatisfied on baggage. I had to pay to check my bag and it did not make it to Savannah until 10pm. Will be following up to request a refund. As well for the money spent on replacement. Also very dissatisfied that you require travelers to pay for television. I can understand wi-fi or food as most airlines do, but to make people pay to watch is absurd

I was in the front of Group 3 and check in crew announced we all had to check our bags. I understand that and am not upset with the idea of having to check my carry on, but when I got to my seat, I saw that the overhead space was completely empty.  I believe there was miscommunication or just not caring.  If I was Group 5, I understand... 99% I'm going to have to check my bag, but a benefit of being early in Group 3 should be that I don't have to check my bag.  Frustrated with the error and the delay in getting home.

What is a quick simple flight was a disaster. The plane was delayed 2 hours and I received the email notificstion 43 minutes AFTER the scheduled departure, and the customer service representative at the United desk was a snit and talked down to me like I had no idea what I was doing. She told me I needed “App 101” then when I returned to show her the email notification of the delay arrived 43 minutes later she had nothing to say. #unitedsucks

Disappointed in how you can loose a bag on a direct flight when we were at airport an hour and a half before the flight departed.  Very disappointing.  I was also told by 3 different associates that every effort would be taken using parner airlines to return my bag to me.  It has been 24 hours and still no bag.

I did not like that I could not carry on my duffel bag to the flight. I had an overnight flight. My luggage consisted of a duffle bag and a purse.  I was forced to check the duffel bag - it was a waste of time and felt like all United was doing was trying to capture more $25 checked bag fees.  It will prevent me from flying United for business travel again.
No milk coffee or tea. Served cereal with no milk available.

I was originally booked on a DSM to IAH 6:15am flight that had some maintenance issues and the delay was going to make me miss my IAH to DFW flight, so the DSM gate agent rebooked me via ORD to DFW.  Those rebooked flights were fine...I just missed a 1/2 day of meetings.

My gate checked stroller was not brought back up to the plane. I waited 35 mins for it on the plane jetbridge and then was told to go check in the baggage claim area. I had a crying over tired infant that I then had to carry thru the terminal to baggage claim.

We are missing a luggage, and were told at the baggage claim that it was not scanned and still stuck at the origin airport EWR. We waited for 20 hours and the status of the luggage is still “searching”. We are still very anxiously waiting, without knowing what else we could do

canceled my flight due to weather and can not rebook on your web sight without being charged  again. Called First reservation person 1/8/17 could barely speak english and had to ask to repeat information over and over. Booking me through Chicagp, Denver day from 1/8/17 to days in future none on nonstop that I paid for. Have difficulty walking and needed nonstop flight.Finally recalled and received a person who could communicate and rebook a non stop flight two days.  later. Flight 4022 was sent to four different gates, one plane with mechanical difficulty. Hour later on another  so old it should not be flying. The noise was terrible the bathroom door would not open  from outside and inside and no light inside until third try. This happens in summer and winter when I fly United to Omaha. Canceled flight have the worst service ever, I always am canceled summer or winter with the worst service and trying to rebook. Seat belt very old and too small. So hard to get in and out of a seat.AS who care about canceled flights you give costumers a very hard time rebooking and  what ever you plane can dig up and tough luck booking or service or a decent plane. Pay too much to get so little. Flying it the most miserable form of transportation in the US.

To start out the bathrooms in the first plane we were assigned did not work and maitenance was unable to fix them. So we had to change gates and another plane had to be assigned. Then once on the new plane there was a screaming child that would not sit still in it’s seat or stop screaming.  We also had a significant delay on the runway in a plane which was much smaller in terms of leg room than the plane we should have had. I have flown on a large number of flights in recent years and this was the worst flight I have been on. I typically don’t fly United and I am now reminded why.
Needless to say I was very disappointed with the flight

Yes, there was no vegan food as I requested. I understand I was rebooked onto a different flight, but you should take notice. Instead I was starving for 7 hours (got some fruits but that's not enough).

No additional comments about this flight; however, the flight from Chicago to San Francisco (for which you have NOT sent me a survey), the flight attendants were not friendly, not speaking proper english (saying 'do ya wanna drink' act.) and overall rather unpleasant. The overhead lights for our seats did not work, so we were given other seats, with less legroom (bulkhead originally moved to another Economy plus seat with less leg room), which would not have been too bad except then they gave my original window seat with more legroom to someone else!! If I had known i had the option to keep my seat I certainly would have and I am rather annoyed at being deceived to give up my original seat with more room and a window because of a malfunctioning overhead light.  You should (must) actually tell customers their options so that they do not feel cheated!!
Horrible. Never flying United again. First and last time.

I have experienced this problem before & I appreciate that it’s a real problem for the airlines in general, There was an extremely overweight woman on this flight making demands for seating preference.  I have personally experienced this before and if they are going to be taking up more space than the average seat they should have to buy 2 seats. It’s NOT alright for them to put the armrest up so that they spill over to the other seat making the other passenger uncomfortable. Maybe there could be a larger seat in the back of the plane to accommodate them
Lounge renovation is a joke. Hard to find and no "real" food. 9:15 Thursday and still ok a suitcase missing with "much needed" things. A silver  premium customer very unhappy.
Gate checked baggage had to be picked up at carousel - very bad!
Very disappointed with cleanliness and staff service and attention to detail.
My whole experience was spoiled yet again by having no access to screen - no films, no games, no flight progress, no tv.  As last time they tried unsuccessfully to reset it and failed
The problem was baggage delay that ultimately cost me $125 in lost pre-purchased lift tickets.
Left late and cabin was dirty- floor, seats and tray were dirty.  Flight came in late and cleaning crew had no time to clean before we started boarding.
It was late by almost two hours.  The plane itself is very uncomfortable.  Seats are far too small.  Cabin has zero amenities.  It was not pleasant.

I arrived at MSP early. Was unable to get on an earlier flight and requested standby for the next flight. I was told by the gate agent I was on the waiting list. When I arrived at the gate for the next flight, I was not on the list and missed the opportunity to get home early. Not the end of the world, but disappointing that the agent neglected to follow through.
Flight attendant was extremely rude
No problems...

Doesn't work very well boarding  from front to back. I am United cardholder and I am supposed to board with group 2 but boarding pass had me in group 4. Wasn't very happy about this since it was a full flight

the flight from west palm to Newark was o.k.--it was the way down from Newark that was horrible-first when I booked it I never heard of a sub-economy class where you don't get a carry-on---do they think you are going to florida with just your wallet?-so I had to call and pay $100 extra which made it no longer a good deal---then we got separate seats because we did that--then the plane sat on the runway for an HOUR because of some baggage issue--I am not a small guy--6'  215 lbs--could you possibly make the seat any SMALLER!!!--I wouldn't fly united again if it was free--with all these problems you start to question the safety of your planes--your airline SUCKS!!!

Newark baggage claim is and has always (for the last 5 years anyhow) been terribly slow. I fly with a checked guitar, and the Oversize baggage handlers always seem uninformed, lazy, and uncommunicative about delivery times, which were 35 minutes on this last flight.
Stop spamming my email box when i've never flown you before!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I used miles and cash to upgrade to first class but probably had no shot. Disappointing
Delay seemed avoidable and was unacceptable
The entertainment system was horrible.  SO OLD. Horrible movies. Very disappointed.  Have not had a system like this on a flight in over 20 years
Just seemed rather stupid to have people jammed in seats and others only had 1 in the whole row.

A man that was headed to Cincinnati ended up on our flight.  He was seated In 9A, right behind me.  How he mistakenly got on our flight is an outrage and it was horrible for him because he ended up in Key a West rather than Cincinnati where he was meeting friends.  How could this happen!?  Security on United is apparently very lacking.  What if he was a terrorist?

It is just really hard to compliment UA on a flight that was delayed twice for mechanical problems.  I had just been moved to this flight by AA who cancelled my flight that day.  I was not a good mood to learn that between AA and UA, I could not conduct any business in Michigan that day.  I had spent it all in transit.
Very disappointed with how long the paperwork took and me missing the majority of my meeting.
The seat was VERY uncomfortable!

The flight was delayed for 45 minutes.  According to the pilot this was because the plane was too heavy and we had to offload some cargo/fuel.  I realize weather happens and mechanical equipment requires maintenance but I find it incredibly difficult to believe that your airline is incapable of correctly determining what the maximum weight of a plane can be.  You have flown to and from Orange County with these planes countless times.  Furthermore, according to united.com the flight was delayed due to "severe weather conditions in your network".  So either your pilot lied to us OR you have a very dubious definition of weather causing a delay.  Both are completely unacceptable.
There has been a obvious cutback in the quality of food and refreshments. Such as the cold plate lunch instead of hot plate lunch and no hot nuts.

As a person that is not experienced in traveling a lot, I did not know that gates can be changed last second—I knew in case something happened, that I should check my email. Alas, I did NOT receive any email about gates changing from B5 to B4, which of course, lead me to miss my flight. Another horrible experience I had is that I had my expensive IPad Pro dropped through security check after I put it out in the bin, but someone had the audacity to take it out and it fell on the floor. Horrible, horrible service!
only negative.  my suitcase must have sat outside exposed in Chicago in rainy weather because it is so stained and looks terrible.  Was  not like that when i boarded in boston.
The space in economy is too tight.  It is appropriate for 12 year olds.   I will not fly United again unless I have no other choice.
My main complaint is no wheelchair waiting to transport me after landing. This alsohappened on another flight a few weeks ago in Ft. Laud when I missed my flight due to this.
I had a hard time traveling with my prescribed pet, at the check in. The attendant wasn’t happy to have me and my dog

The purser on this flight was extremely arrogant and rude. While boarding he wouldn’t greet (his colleagues did perfectly) and also while entering. During the flight he had a very arrogant attitude and never smiled at all.
Leg room not adequate. Also person in front pushed seat back making situation worse.

I left 2 candles in the seat pocket at 1A. Your lost item tracking web site is not my favorite. I wish I could get in touch with the gate agents that worked the inbound flight. Somebody certainly took them off the plane.  You have a passenger manifest. It should not be a big deal to match those items with me, call me and let me know how I can get them back.

The food is terrible like always.  For the main meal, the cold noodle salad is terrible, no way to eat.  The mid night snack, the cold sandwich was so hard and unchewable that most people just threw them away.  For breakfast even I was so hungry I could not eat.  My daughter preferred to be starving rather than eating any of those.  My second daughter brought a cup noodles to eat.  If you guys cannot have enough budget to provide decent food, maybe then just reduce the fares and request the passengers to carry their own food.  Don't create more garbage for the world

The problem is, the aircraft was retrofitted for additional seating, and its far too tight for passengers.  the isle was no narrow, when using the bathrooms it was chaotic, people were forced to climb over one another.  I constantly get hit on the arm or shoulder from passing patrons.  The seat itself is cramped, and the middle person flows onto the left and right passenger.  When you are sitting for 4 hours, that becomes torture.  Also, airline execs today squeeze profits from us passengers.  This flight did not provide the streaming of movies for our smartphones because their were monitor where we would have to yet again pay.  Its more than upsetting, it really angers me to think that with all the additional baggage charges, the ever increasing fares, the sardine can accommodations, meals at our expense, the airline executives continue to squeeze us.  WE are not happy ( except the stockholders ) someday an alternative will arise, and we will vote with our feet and wallets.  Profits are great, but there needs to be fairness, and we are not happy.

This aircraft was the filthiest airplane I have been on in the US.  The floor at my seat was full of road salt.  Granted the winter weather has been tough but this aircraft was extremely filthy.  There was debris on the floor throughout the cabin.  The lavatory was disgusting.  There were no paper towels in the lavatory (flight was only approximately 40% full so not likely that the demand was too high).  Apparently someone had complained because the FA had a ground crew come on with a vacuum to clean up either row 21 or 22 but the rest of the cabin was left as is.  Totally unacceptable conditions.
Bathroom was so dirty
The year is 2018. How do still not have wifi on all of your flights? 3 1/2 hour flight on a small crappy plane with no wifi.

We checked 3 bags and only 2 of them made it.  not sure why they could not deliver the third on time inspite of having hour and thirty minute before boarding.  We had to manage our schedule the next day having to wait for our bags. no one said sorry or called to say anything for having missed the bag.

My bags went on earlier flight to SFO finally found it against a wall, then got notification a day later that the bag came earlier and I was to go to where it was being held.  Same thing happened on Newark arrival.  Very concerned  when bag did not appear on carousel,  finally went to Baggage Service and was directed to another place where my bag was kept.  I assume this happened because I checked in so early but the inconvenience was disturbing and not what I had expected from this airline.  Perhaps when I checked in they could have alerted me to this possibility as it was very disconcerting to both myself and the person picking me up.   Thank you, Susan Travers

First of all, they checked a carry on back at the gate, when there was plenty of room on the plane to store it. Worst part, it took FOREVER to get the bags back at the gate. PLUS, I also had a checked bag, which took an additional 15 minutes to retrieve. Very unaccessble at an airport that is not that busy.  Service was NOT acceptable.
Seat was uncomfortable, surprised as food and drink rations. Know it is a short flight but tiny pretzels and tap water were awful plus $75 fee to change to one flight earlier ridiculous

1) Flew basic .. had to check bags, no carry on = $50.  Booked thru 3rd party not knowing .. but found same fare rates 1 week before actual flight - and could have had carry on = $0. 2) Seats -- horrible unless you weigh less than 120 lbs.  Spouse and I are NOT heavy... but we got seats assigned - not together -- middle seats and were BOTH stuck between very, very large people ... any idea how great it is to spend 3+ hours with body odor and coughing!!! 3)  AA seat and knee room is MUCH better.  On our 2 UA flights ... I couldn't even cross my legs.  Very disappointing!!  And I am an ex-Booz, Allen, Hamilton employee who's team did a FULL study with UA when they were in financial trouble and were told about the 'LACK OF COMFORT" for passengers because of seats squissed together Too tightly!!!

You try to CRAM so many seats in the plane and I'm only 5'3" tall and I couldn't bend down to retrieve something that had dropped on the floor for there wasn't room to move at all!  And talk about crossing one's legs?  What a joke.  I heard others complaining about the cramped space too.  One my flight TO Newark on Jan 4, my seat wouldn't recline either.  It was a VERY uncomfortable experience both ways and even though I have a frequent flier number with  United, I think I'll try to avoid flying this airline if I can.

We will be filing a formal complaint via your website. The mistreatment and lack of customer service which was extended to us cannot be fully explained within this survey. We are disgruntled and feel unappreciated as customers and frequent users of both your domestic and international services.  Jennifer D Sweeney
Economy Plus, very disappointing

I finished my business a day early and tried to revise the return flight from Wednesday to Tuesday. The total cost would have been over $500 and there were seats available. No excuse for excessive charges. Needless to say, I did not change the schedule. Very poor customer service!

I am not sure where I write this but I was so angry about my arrival in Newark. The plane was delayed so I knew you guys were putting me up in a hotel. When I got off the plane there was no one to speak with about where to pick up the voucher. I approached about 5 United employees at an info center in my arrival wing and they were rude and just said they were closed. I had to walk all the way across the airport to find someone. I asked for a ride on one of the carts but batteries were low and they had to park it. No offer to find someone.  Got to the far info center, got my voucher, person was nice. The hotel staff was so rude, from the shuttle driver to the manager who checked me in! Ramada Newark Airport are really not nice welcoming people. This is the second hotel stay on my trip that stank. This was my return trip and I was hoping I could leave feedback about my going trip!!!
YOU MUST STOP SEATS FROM RECLINING. ITS SO SO UNCOMFORTABLE FOR SOMEONE LIKE ME W LONG LEGS. INFACT MISERABLE!!! Too little leg room.

For some reason, the drink service missed a delivery or two.  I ended up extremely thirsty.   It seemed like there were more trips to pick up trash than to serve water or other beverages.   Also, I suspect the captain forgot to turn off the Fasten Seatbelt sign for long periods of time.  This encourages passengers to ignore this warning when the urge to visit the lavatory becomes urgent.  Not good for safety.     Also, safety is my number one concern, and we flew smoothly except for some temporary turbulence and landed smoothly.   Thank you to the people who made that possible.

The flight was 30 mins., late in departing and we had a connecting flight with very little time to spare. My husband recently had a knee replacement and has difficulty walking so I asked the flight attendant if a wheelchair could be arranged, she checked and said it would be available at the gate when we arrive. However when we got to the gate no one was willing to help quickly. We did make our flight with two mins to spare but it was a stressful walk to reach Terminal A.
