It is not pleasant when ones's expectations are not met due to airline issues.  We were moved from row 8 in economy plus to the back of coach for weight distribution.  This is not a good thing.

Flight #4689 to Des Moines was delayed several times. Was scheduled to depart Chicago 12:35 pm, actually departed 6:30 pm. When I tried to return to Chicago, the following day, the system would not let me check in on line. I called the 1-800 number and they said the system kicked me out for some reason and I was no longer booked on the flight. They got me re-booked but I lost my original preferred  seat and was assigned the last seat in the back of the plane. Very disappointing.

Flights of this length should have power outlets near the seats. Also, the touch screen controls on the seat back entertainment systems are very difficult to use. Touch sensitivity and pointer accuracy are very poor.

Your website states that complimentary snacks and non-alcoholic beverages are provided on flights between the U.S. and Central America, but that did not happen on this flight. No snacks were provided at all, and I received half an airline-size cup of soda. On a 5+ hour flight. Very disappointing service
The check in in fll was terrible. Being a gold star alliance member and I was treated the worst ever any airline has

When we checked our bags at Fort Lauderdale both our suitcases showed as overweight, even though they were 2 to 3 pounds under on the trip down and we did not add anything to them for the trip back. My case was 2 lbs. over and my wife's was 5 lbs. over! The person that assisted us with the kiosk check-in suggested that we remove items from the suitcases to place in the carry-ons. There was very little we could remove due to carry-on restrictions so just removed 1 or 2 items of clothing each. We then tried to check-in at the same kiosk and scale and had the same problem of still over, so we got back out of line, rummaged thru our suitcases again and removed another lightweight item or two from each case. We then went to a different kiosk and scale for the third time and found out we were both significantly under on weight. It would have to be impossible for what we removed to make  that big a difference in the poundage. It was very frustrating and disappointing that the delays took so much time we had to rush to the gate and have no opportunity to grab a bite before boarding for our departure. I wonder how many other passengers might have been affected by an inaccurate scale.

Even though this flight operated normally, I cannot recommend United Express flights because they are so often very late or cancelled (my return flight was cancelled, as it was on my previous trip on that route).  Whenever I fly United Express, especially to/from BWI, the flights are so unreliable that I always study alternatives before heading to the airport.

TSA experience in Newark Terminal A to get to our A-24 gate was AWFUL.  There was one screening point and a long line down a narrow passageway and it took FOREVER.  Totally unacceptable.  If this were to continue on our trips from GSP-EWR, we would seek another airline and endure the longer taxi/Uber trip to/from LGA or JFK rather than suffer through the TSA experience like we did on January 10.
I did not like the fact our seats were changed prior to our flight. We were moved next to the toilets which I did not care for.
The toilet seat in the forward economy plus section was old,decrepit and peeling  UGH! More attention to detail needed
The person at the gate who welcomed us was VERY rude. The flight attendents did not smile and seemed all tired/pissed off of their day.

I didn’t appreciate the fact that we held up the flight for legitimate reasons due to immigrations forms that were lost in between bag check and getting to our gate! Mexico was TERRIBLE! They were rude and for whatever reason they felt necessary, they gave up seats I purchased and separated me and my 2 year old son on end isle seats, as the two other people who were given our seats, sat next to me, where my wife and my 2 year old were suppose to sit. My wife was thrown into first class along with my mother and they were separated as well. When the flight when up in the air, my wife asked to switch seats with two other members on the flight that sat next to our 2 year old, and of course they were happy to oblige, so that we could all sit together for the flight. I was super angry and treated with annoyance because I didn’t want to be accommodated by first class for the airport giving up our seats and separating my family, as well as my son being separated from me. This was really unprofessional and uncalled for. I was NOT Happy!!!!
The A terminal at Newark airport is awful. Poor restaurants, small cramped conditions
I found it outrageous that they gave you one single cup for a drink. Not the entire can. No other airline pours a single cup.

The flight was delay, then there was a mechanical which took the plane out of service,  three hours later we have a new plane and load us up and dont show us checked in.  the next day my reservations were cancelled, because you said I missed the opening filght.  What a painful disaster.
Unhappy with food choices, wish there were more options to buy. Very unhappy because no individual screens on seat backs.

I hate 7373s, seats are terrible and the spaces under the seat in front for small carryons are not equally distributed between the 3 passengers  compared to A320s where there is almost equal space distribution

I paid for premium economy but I was given seats in the last row of the plane by the bathroom. When I told the flight attendant and showed her my receipt she called the gate agent and would give me no further help. Following that, Edna came to tell me that she had no record of my paid for upgrade and she said the flight was full and offered no remedy at all. Edna was rude and unhelpful and I believe my wife and i are serving of a refund.

My girlfriend and I are frequent travelers to Costa Rica.  On this occasion we were unpleasantly surprised at the hostile treatment of your checkin personel at Liberia.  Our flight rfer nice number was LENFPD.  On arrival the checkin attendant seemed quite surly and unfriendly.  My girlfriend has an Italian passport and even though she was standing beside me and has perfect English, the attendant insisted only on asking me for information and referring to my girlfriend friend as her even though we were standing side by side which we found odd and a little rude.  Then when it came to our check in bags, the exact same one as we travelled with, she insisted one bag, which I have been traveling with as my personel bag and which contained just a laptop and a pair of shoes, was too big as a personal item.  When I informed her that bag for within the guidelines of a personal item, and even when I fit it completely inside the measuring device beside where we were standing, she still insisted it was too big!  Beyond that, we had two small plastic bags with an apple and small water each which we intended to consume before going through security, she insisted that they also were checkon items.  I asked to see her supervisor and she pretty much dismissed us immediately and vaguely threatened us that she would see us at the boarding desk.  She ended up not being there but this whole experience was rather and unpleasant and hostile ending experience for no reason to out two week vacation in Costa Rica.  The attendant seemed quite flustered and angry during this experience which we tried to dismiss as some stress from her work experience but it was not easy to move past such treatment.  I fly a lot in my personal life around the world and I have never experienced this type of unprovoked unkindness which is why I felt compelled to let you know about my experience flying with UA.  Warmest regards,  Kevin O’Hanlon

yes! the security guard was very unprofessional and started touching me without my consent, nor did she explain why she needed to pat me down and instead made an unprofessional comment about my bra. Totally Unprofessional
The flight attendant was very short and rude to passengers even with a lot of crew members on board' very unprofessional
Bad experience with delay

One tweak to the food process.  I was, frankly, starving, and craving the warm almonds.  However, I was in the back row of business.  The flight attendants were going front to back, doing tablecloths, then nuts and drinks, then salads...then they move to the next row.  Maybe next time they could do tableclothes for every row, then nuts and drinks for every row, then salads?  That way we back-row folks aren't waiting around for that first "course"! :)

the menu has changed since last year. However, there are now NO vegetarian options for meals. The Unos pizza now has pepperoni. All the vegetarian options all have hummus (they are essentially the same just more accesories) and one cheese and cracker selection. Not good, United.

I paid to check my bag. This is a very small aircraft. You accepted 17 bags at the gate and then when we got to Chicago you gave priority to unloading those bags onto the aircraft gang way. This meant that I waited over 45 minutes to get my bag at the carousel. I think that is just outrageous. All other airlines I travel take all bags to the luggage carousel. Some are beginning to charge for gate check. Anyone who is in boarding group 4 on a plane this small should not be allowed to bring a big carry-on to the gate and expect free services. Frankly given that you know how small the plane is and you penalize those of us who paid for luggage handling sits poorly with me. I am going to be checking out alternative carriers as a result. And, may I say the Kansas City airport is extremely old and they cannot even process a TSA Pre Check. I have to travel to KC on business but it is not a great customer experience given the airport and then the problems I have with your baggage policies. I don't like that part at all. I am paying for a service and I am being put second to people who are gaming the system.  I am not the only person down in baggage claim who voiced this problem.

This was my return flight to EWR, a different aircraft. All I have to say is that the seats are ridiculously small/narrow for the AVERAGE individual, AND, leg room space totally inadequate! Perhaps for a person who is maximum 5'4..beyond that..IMPOSSIBLE.
Snacks were stale pretzels.  Horrible.  JetBlue beats the pants off of you guys every time with their snacks.

You have to give more room between the seats.  It is so claustrophobic. I am only 5’4” and can barely fit my knees in. I feel like chickens crammed in a cage before slaughter.  Everything is getting smaller and smaller and tighter and tighter.  No elbow room. No leg room. The flight was so uncomfortable.  I don’t care about much else.  But I want to at least be comfy when I am sitting for 4 hours.

The aircraft should have a small sound proof cabin or extra charges for families with small crying children. The trip was so unbearable due to the children wailing for 3 hours, I wanted to hide in the bath room. Also work on back support, we pay enough to have shit seating for 3 hrs.
Retire the aircraft Be less stingy Awful flight. Ruins your reputation and encourages me to fly with other airlines
Horrible service

I was located in a middle seat next to an extremely heavy-set man who took up almost 1 1/2 seats.  I could barely move and had to lean forward close to the seat in front just to have enough space. By the end of the flight my lower back was in terrible pain.
A baby was screaming the entire flight and no flight attendant tried to work with mother and quiet the child.  Worst flight ever

One disappointment was the selection of snacks in first class. This is an area that has gone down hill since my last flight. No peanuts, chips. Just cheese and fruit with one small package of crackers.  When you pay first class prices you are entitled to better amenities. I was extremely disappointed with that aspect
I was very uncomfortable as someone with a child had a car seat behind my seat and although I had no space it was still no comfort
Not having seat choices for basic economy was a nightmare.  I'm 6'4" and almost always select an aisle seat to alleviate leg and knee pain from interference with the seat ahead of me.

Just want to reiterate - Even though I had the very last row seat usually it reclines a little bit and the seat in front of me isn’t so close. It seems that row had at least 1” less room than other rows.   Not to mention the fact that we were delayed and had to sit for an extra 1.5hrs on the plane. Terrible experience all around this time. And the bathrooms were filthy and the flight attendant (a male) had an attitude problem with everybody.
THE SEATS COULD BE A LITTLE FURTHER APART, NO ROOM.  EVEN THOUGH I PAID MY TICKET I SHOULD BE ABLE TO PICK MY SEAT, VERY UNFAIR.
No, but please start the Newark to Bermuda flights again. We miss them and hate flying out of Kennedy to get to Bermuda. Need flights again this September, see what you can do for us?

The touch screen requires a very hard touch, making the screen hard to operate. It is a most often problem in United flights. The one time I didn't have that problem was on my recent flight from SFO to ERW
I would seriously look at a new airline partner for your connection flights.  EXPRESSJET AIRLINES is TERRIBLE!

We were forced to gate check a bag. When the bag was returned in Chicago, a brand new, $30 water bottle was no longer in the bag. I reported the item as lost and the resolution process has been unsatisfactory as well.

The Miami airport has problems. TSA pre only works half, the food offering in the G concourse is not very attractive, combing boarding groups 1&2 makes it messy, at least there are power outlets, a few - otherwise MIA concourse G is bad
The food from Denver is always bad...

To start off, my flight to PBI was delayed over two hours. I wasn’t able to check in because I purchased basic economy (which I will NEVER do again) so I had to purchase a bag to have checked so that I could and wouldn’t lose my spot. I then got to the gate and didn’t realize (since every other airline gives two bags free) that I had to actually check the bag so I got charged another $25. I would be happy paying more money for economy if you just did away with basic economy like every other airline I fly. On the way back I was again forced to check my bag and all of my clothes were ruined because someone’s perfume broke and leaked all out into my bag. My bag now smells horrible and is sticky along with a couple of my favorite shirts and white pants no longer able to be worn. I fly once a week for work and unfortunately with all other options out there I will not be flying United any longer.

Yes.  No fault of you airline , but there was an extremely obese man suiting next to me.  I was in the aisle seat, 32 c I believe, and he was in the center seat. Once in theIr I did mention to the attendants and they noted that had I said something before takeoff maybe they could have changed his seat.  I think he was seated shortly before takeoff but if I ‘t think I would have said anything  in any case. It would have been too embarrassing for him.  So the ride was very uncomfortable snc required me to get out of my seat frequently given the awkward seating arrangement I had.   THIE WAS ON THE FT LAUDRDSLE LEG OF THE TRIP NOT CHICSGO TO LA.
The food was horrible.

We lost one of our bags and it was delivered the next day.  Even with almost 2 hours of connection time, not sure why this happened.  We had to manage our schedule the next day to wait to receive bags.  not a nice thing when the trip was for a specific purpose.

on boarding was ridiculous.  flight was delayed out of gate and we missed out slot and had to sit in penalty box for an hour. if i wanted to get into phx at 8pm i would have booked a flight to do so. sitting on the runway with other flights taking off is an insult to your passengers and crew.
Cabin of plane was hotter than hell for whole trip.  Very uncomfortable.
Delay due to inbound plane was ok but waiting another 30 minutes for flight attendant that was supposedly at another gate ridiculous

I am not sure why this flight has so many issues, but the CWA->ORD flight and the ORD-> CWA flight has had numerous delays.  Our flight out was delayed over two hours due to mechanical which caused us to miss our connecting flight.  The same route had a mechanical issue in October that caused me to miss my connecting flight.  It seems like an ongoing problem that needs to be worked out.
Extra preboarding security at gate was ridiculous, unorganized and completely worthless.
Flight attendants were rude and not very helpful. Usually during a long flight, flight attendants come thru with water. This did not occur during the flight.

I’m so mad about this trip. I checked in a bag in Newark and asked the agent if I can board with my laptop + purse. She said that yeah that’s fine. I got through security and then as I’m boarding the agent said you can’t board with your laptop bag. You have to check it in. I said but the agent at the desk said I’ll be fine even though I have a no carry on ticket. Both together would account as a personal item. She refused and she made me check it in for $60! I was very disappointed. I filled a petition form for refund on the united website and waiting to hear back. If I don’t get a refund, I’m going to cancel my mileage and stop flying united. Truly disappointing!

Most uncomfortable aircraft ever. It was a 6 hour flight and they barely served water once. I paid $100 for premium economy and it was NOT worth it AT ALL. the seat was so tiny and uncomfortable. It was extremely disappointing.

I had a head phone on and the flight attendance wanted to call my attention. She hit be 3 times on my shoulder and it hurt like i received 3 punches on my shoulder.  I'm a muscular male and for me to feel that much pain from the hit/punch tells how much power/force she used. The worse part of when i turned around to look at her she acted like she was dealing with a teenager with no courtesy or professionalism.
This flight was especially uncomfortable because a rude 6’8” man sat behind me and would not allow me to recline my seat. So I had to fly the 5 hours in the upright position.

Very dissatisfied with the checkin procedure. When we got to the United checkin counter there was NOT ONE UNITED personnel there—no one to answer any questions!! We waited for 30 plus minutes; others in line much longer than us. It was noontime!!  Other airlines were accommodating their customers. UNITED no where to be found. Frustrating and tiresome!!

Just disappointed with the limited choice of movies and then the limited time you could select tv programs. I would have enjoyed more movie choices or longer time to watch tv programming. A lot of $ for not a lot. Otherwise, a good experience.
After the overhead bins filled on the plane one particular male gate attendant became rude and aggressive to numerous customers who were required to check their carry-on bags.

We were traveling with a 2 year old and I was disappointed not to find changing tables in the majority of the bathrooms. In fact, I had to circle the entire aircraft before I could find a bathroom that had one. There was only one in the whole aircraft and waiting for that one bathroom while holding a baby with messy diaper was disappointing. There should be more than one on the airplane. In fact, on our first flight we never could find the changing table and had to change the baby standing up. The flight attendant on the second flight informed me that the different airplanes have them in different locations so there is no easy way to know where they are at.

People should not be allowed to carry on more bags than the rule says. There was no room for me to store my bag. The seats were extremely uncomfortable and very little leg room. My ticket was almost $900. This should include a meal, a movie and some comfort. It did not. United was a company I always flee with by choice and now I only fly when I have to.  Very dissatisfied.
There was no dinner served in my part of the cabin and considering the time of the flight, it is totally bizarre and inappropriate
This flight did not offer entertainment on either the seat screens or personal devices, as other airlines do. This is particularly problematic when paying extra for an upgrade.
This is not the first time that’s something does not work on the seats. Poor showing, the $50 is a ooor compensation for a problem that keeps reoccurring.
The air port in Mexico was horrible and the treatment for on older person was very nasty

The lady where we had to drop the baggage was utterly rude, never experienced such a rudeness in all my life. They also did a security check in my luggage which is fine and this has happened before and don't have a problem with it at all. What does bother me is that they made such a mess. They opened a new solid facial powder pot still in it purchased box, unopened,. They probably thought it was drugs and checked it all fine as well but there is no reason to break the content totally that it is not usable any more, then don't close the lid properly put is back in the box but we do not close the box as this would be to much effort and the whole sherade "leaks" true the inside of the suitcase. I was not amused by it at all. TSA left a note that they have been true the suitcase but can't feel any respect for them the way they handled this suitcase. Putting a complaint in by them is not an option as they will probably only say we are sorry and that is end of case.

I purchased a coach plus seat, and it is just terrible how little leg room you provide. I much prefer Jet Blue for this reason. Also, the terminal in NYC is just terrible. There are no restaurants or bars, and just one measly kiosk. It was like a bus terminal. I expect more.

Whining puppy behind me . Very uncomfortable. Need to restrict pets on board to deaf and blind only. This fake comfort companions are BS. I have allergies and pets don't belong on planes. There is no peanuts there should not be any pets.

The flight was delayed by nearly 2 hours and the delay was known by UAL for 4 or more hours before the flight due to delays in prior flight segments of such plane, and yet no notifications were provided to me and at least one other passenger that I poke to on this delayed flight.  I could have attended a productive meeting at work before leaving early if I had been notified.  This is NOT the poor service I expect from UAL.

The flight attendants were fine.  It’s the planes on these smaller routes that need upgrading and the lounge situation at Newark is disappointing as they renovate for Polaris.  So it was overcrowded in the one other lounge and the food is mediocre. Etc.  Time for some new planes and they always always have way too few vegetarian options on the plane.  The few on board are quickly taken by the Global service level passengers.  Just ridiculous given the cost of these flights.

Flight was delayed in boarding, no reason given and then we missed slot for take off and had delay of 1 hour on tarmac. After landing, people on plane had connections and cleaning crew boarded plan before passengers got off, blocking aisles and preventing passengers from leaving the plane.
The lack of communication was frustrating and I had to make alternative arrangements for when I landed in Jacksonville due to the extended delay. We arrived well after midnight the following day.
gate agent was not receiving accurate info from operations this was second time in two days (ord-columbus,ohio on Tues) where operations either had no plane or no crew or both....enough
I had a total of 3 drinks from boarding to in flight and I asked for 1 more and she said she was out of Buffalo Trace. Did not offer another option and just ignored me. Very rude.

I also did not like that I had to pay to check my bag and that snacks were not provided. I get that this is the type of ticket I purchased, but it's not a good deal. How expensive can snacks really be???

i’m suppose to have one checkin and went thru checkin, i not told that my 1 checkin will not fit the cabin and was charge with a hefty 60 dollars. i could have checkin the back in switch it with my other checkin so i would not have to pay the 60 dollars. incompetent checkin handlers

The commuter plane you use (Embraer) is uncomfortable.  Other airlines use larger planes for the short hauls that have a seat configuration of 2 and 2.  When I have an option, I never fly United because the plane is so uncomfortable.

My apologies, I thought the survey was going to let me provide feedback on several aspects of the experience. To be clear, my dissatisfaction was driven by: 1. Despite requesting a gate check tag in advance of boarding, I was denied and we were all slowed down by having them handed to us as we scanned our boarding passes. This caused unnecessary logjams on the jetway down to the plane;  2. The air vents on the aircraft (not just my seat) were not blowing any air, causing the flight to be quite stuffy. Given that time we sat at the gate and on the tarmac, I was far less comfortable than I would have expected;  3. While we did receive beverage service, I was disappointed to get only about 3 oz. of water. Perhaps one could be provided with a second pass-by to get something to drink on a 2-hour flight?

Flight was late leaving Lexington, for an undisclosed reason. After landing in Chicago, sat on the tarmac for 30 minutes waiting for a gate. Many people missed connecting flights as a result; I barely made mine, but was the last one on the plane and had to run from one terminal to another. This was a very unpleasant experience.
The seats in business were uncomfortable no foot rest and didn't recline at all. Food was mediocre for business class. Really?

As mentioned: Unfortunately, my one piece of checked luggage was crushed on top AND bottom. I don't know how BOTH ends of a piece of luggage could BOTH be damaged. It's like a car accident with a car in the middle. I have a claim ticket and would like to send you photos. No company can continue to operate with performance like this.
The arrival at Newark and to de-plane on stairs to a bus to the terminal was a first for the flight from Savannah which we take regularly, needless to say a bad experience on a very cold night.

Gate area was in a corner and not able to line up by groups made it confusing. Then very rude gate agent telling people to move when they are in the correct location. Left a bad tone throughout the whole experience.
Very bad experience with gate workers

Poor entertainment options: could not start entertainment at my convenience & movies had already started, limited selection of entertainment, app not supported in Android, not all movies listed in magazine were available onboard. Flight attendants were not very friendly, always seemed that you were disturbing them.

I had to change my flight from 1/11 to 1/10 due to blizzard-like conditions that were expected to hit Omaha on the 11th. I had given up my seat from my previous flight of EWR-OMA due to weather and did not want to get stuck in Omaha. I called to change my flight and since there were no travel advisories issued by United the representative told me I had to pay the $200. However, upon getting to the gate and talking with other passengers who also were supposed to fly on 1/11 and changed to 1/10 they were not charged a change fee. Their representative waived the fee due to seeing the expected weather. This left a bad taste in my mouth that some fliers were forced to pay the fee and others were not.

The emails updates on flight that I received from United were ridicules.  Consider:  at 3:55pm notified flight delayed from scheduled 6:15pm  to 6:42.  At 4:47pm notified delayed til 7:00.  At 5:08 notified delayed til 7:22.  I was waiting comfortably in lounge, then at 5:18pm notified delayed only back to 6:20.  Rushed to gate only to get notified at 5:53pm that delay was back to 7:15.  Actual flight departed gate at 7:45pm.  Why the crazy and confusing text notifications?

My original schedule was GRR to ORD, ORD to YUL, but the ORD/YUL flight was cancelled (no reason given). I was moved to fly via DC, but that plane was delayed for a mechanical fault, and so I would have missed the connection. In the end my only way home was to fly to ORD and spend the night. Very unsatisfactory.
The only reason I was dissatisfied is that the plane was delayed twice due to a late inbound. For such a short flight I would recommend taking the train instead as the delays were painful!

The boarding area in Atlanta T15-T17 ia absolutely unacceptable.  You cannot mix groups into one lane. It will never work and clog up the entire boarding area and making people upset. The area is too cramped for 3 boarding gates.  IF that won't change then you have make separate boarding lanes for all groups and not mix group 1 & 2.
Had a 2 hour layover at EWR but bags did not get on the flight to Los Angeles.  Arrived at 9:30 pm without luggage and had to wait for over two hours until the next flight landed.  Very poor.
Really disappointed with the service on this flight not really happy with United airlines I’m start to looking another options.
fix the issues - its been years of bad connectivity

The customer service is consistent during my airport experience- check-in to club lounge- every time I fly. Also included is the reservation and mileage plus call center. I have expectations as a customer and these experiences meet if not exceed my expectations.  However, the customer service experience on my flights is inconsistent, especially this one in particular. I obeserved the multiple customers ask what was in the meal, and one of the flight attendants said “I don’t know, I just read what it is. They don’t inform what’s in it.” She proceeded to open the meal there and said what was in it.  I’m glad people asked ahead of me, since I have multiple food allergies. (Soft suggestion, ANA offers a 27-allergy free meal, if this possible for United to offer? I certainly do not want to use my epi-pen on flight and rushed to the emergency room upon landing.) Another observation, is they came through the aisle with the drink cart. Afterwards, a customer asked for a ginger-ale and the flight attendant responded frustrated, “We just came through with drinks but I’ll bring it.” Lastly, when I went to the back with my water bottle, I asked if it could be filled. The flight attendant would only fill it half way. This gave me the perception that water supply is limited on the flight. Overall, the perception I had of this flight was that asking for any assistance or anything that was outside of what the flight attendants offered at the time was an inconvenience and impeded  on their time.
TSA Security at EWR is the worst I have experienced anywhere. 45 minutes?!?!?  Ridiculous.

Somehow my luggage was taken off the  carousel and placed behind a line of luggage.Consequently I never found it until the carousel was empty. The width of the seats and a mount of legroom is very uncomfortable. That being said, the flight was uneventful and on time.
The tray table were not clean. I upgrade to first class. I would have expected the tray to be clean. I used my hot towel to clean it. disappointed for sure
The delay due to the attendant no show was not communicated
yes   paid alot of money in first class - no tv for 5.5 hours wifi terrible -  no hot towels -  baggage not of first priority very disappointing
Asked to move out of my purchased seat.  Delayed on landing due to no gate availability which added to ATC delay. Not a good experience.

the flight attendant was pretty weak...I was in the bulkhead and he told me I could be killed if I put my foot on the partition....when I explained i was a Global services for years, have flown on thousands of flights and never heard that, but would like to learn more he became belligerent, said he won't "defend his position, just that I would be killed if my feet were up"  odd guy

Flight attendant acted as though she hated being there and just barely speaking loud enough on the PA to understand.  Looked like athletic tape holding seat handle together.  Talk about "ghetto".  I normally fly Southwest and I think I'll stick to that next time.

Was rudely kicked out of the first class area by attendant. When I explained I was unable to get back to my seat because food cart was blocking, was told to go back and wait and that it was not their problem. I had a two year old on me and I cannot easily walk around people in an aisle. Staff is unnecessarily rude.

The entire pre flight process was very bad. All contact with UA or TSA people was terrible. Everyone was rude to our entire group of 6 travelers. Not a great start to a very long time coming vacation.
delayed bag is unacceptable -it happened to at least 12 passengers

The seats are the most uncomfortable I've ever flown in and the distance between seats is ridiculous.  Its less than a foot and when the person in front of me leans back its almost 6 inches away from my face.  Not a way to spend a 4 hour flight and I will NEVER fly United again.

The on board personal were rude and for the least, non sympathic. Our seats have been forgotten several times for drinks and food. I have asked the stewart to give me some water in my personal glass, and he discarded me in a rude and unexplicable way. And I apparently had the bad idea to ask for water a second time (after having been forgot...), and it really looks like I was disturbing the personal. They just gave me a bottle of water without a word.
Very poor service from the flight attendants.
I more than likely will NOT fly United again once I complete my return flight.  Very disappointed in the flight all around.  Will NOT recommend United to others.
It wa delayed more than once, which was inconvenient.

The flight attendant was abrasive and rude. She truly made me feel uncomfortable every single time she came around. Asked one flight attendant for sugar for my coffee and this flight attendant in particular threw the sugar at me. She served me coffee and didn’t even offer me milk or sugar. She was a blonde middle aged woman and she seems miserable. Maybe she should get a different job.

They kept changing the gate. The one/two seat one class RJ's are miserable, old planes that need retired ASAP.  This one felt as though it had no shock absorbers or struts. The impacts where hash and shook the plane hard as we taxied and took off. Plane was either too hot or too cold as well. Not to mention it was very dirty

There was NO service in first class -- the staff said it was because it had been "a few bumps" during take off. I think it was because the flight attendants didn't feel like serving us. Even when there has been no service on other carriers to coach class, there has ALWAYS been something offered by your competitors to first class cabin which I was in.
Newark security line was a disaster as usual. Pre-Check was 20 minutes. Apparently there was a regular line down the hall the was nearly empty, but no one told us until we'd waited 15 minutes.
Another typical flight from Chicago to Hancock ... an hour delay waiting for an inbound flight.  This is the worst place I've ever been for ontime flights!
The only negative feedback I had was at the check bags area. The two attendants there were discussing personal business and were not helpful or appear to be interested in doing their jobs.
Poor communication at the gate. Did not post the flight information until immediately before boarding on the screen leaving the crowd questioning if we were at the right gate

Two United flight attendants were traveling as passengers to Baltimore on this flight. They were loud and never stopped talking the entire trip, they turned down Aruba even though it was 91/2 hours..., they had never been on a plane this big....They talked and distracted the entire trip to the two flight attendants who were working the flight. VERY unprofessional and unpleasant for the passengers.

The plane utilize for this flight was the worst configuration of a plane I have been on.  Extremely cramped and overall just uncomfortable.  The actual flight was smooth with no issues, same with the service.

Prior to takin of there was a seriously ill passenger near my area He became violently  Ill and vomited several times. This was extremely uncomfortable to experience that it was and passenger was removed I was looking forward to a pleasant flight but this Delayed the flight  and  May me unsettled .

The flight was on time, even a little early, this was great. However, the cabin was extremely uncomfortable, no place for my computer under the seat, the seats are too close. We were not offered any water after the initial refreshments and it was a long flight. However, all this, while unpleasant, does not make the flight too bad as it was on time, being on time is the most important thing, the rest is just for the surveys...

The sitting arrangement of 3 4 3 is ridiculously crowded. The aisle is so narrow that even for a medium size person is too narrow  to pass. I can't imagine that in an emergency situation it's is safe to have it that narrow. Furthermore the sit itself in an 11 hour flight is also so narrow and not comfortable at all. Expecting people to sleep in such conditions is mission impossible. Personally I will never take this flight again with such sitting arrangement it's

Yes. I arrived at 9 p.m. the gate for a red eye flight scheduled for 11 p.m. I was seated a few feet away from the gate check in desk. I was assigned group 3. They started boarding group 1 and 2 and said that group three should stay seated. As I was extremely tired, I apparently was overcome by sleep and woke up after the boarding was completed. I rushed to the desk, and the agents yelled at me because it was 11 minutes before the flight. They said they paged me overhead, which I of course did not hear. Instead of coming to wake me up, or expressing any sympathy with how tired I was, they rebuked me, and said they had to check in my carry-on, which was an extremely small piece that usually fits under the seat in front of me. My seat was 8 F, but for some reason, they had changed it to 19 F. Every time I said something about the seat or the carry-on, they would say, then do not get on this flight and we will put you on the next flight. I did get on the flight but the 19 F seat is so squashed that it was even difficult to get to it. When I asked the flight attendant to give me my original seat, she called the agent. Another very rude agent came and kept saying you either sit here or we deplane you and put you on the next flight. Finally, I asked her to ask the person in seat 8 F how he or she got the seat. She would not do that, but a hostess did, and that person gave me my original seat back. The agent kept telling me to complain on line. I told her what good will it do me to complain after I suffer for 4 hours. She just kept saying I will put you on the next plane. I had been at a conference in Ventura county and had another conference in Chicago at 7 a.m. therefore there was no way for me to miss this flight and be placed on another flight, plus there was no reason for them to keep threatening me with this since I had an expensive ticket and had done nothing that necessitated such disrespectful and threatening treatment. I always fly Delta and try to avoid flying United or American because of such treatment that these airlines have become known for. Despite the national disgrace that United had with similar previous events of removing customers from planes, your customer service staff are quick to pull this threat on the helpless travelers.  What a disgrace!!

When a flier is scared to fly, that flier should be prepared for a long haul and get xanax or some other form of medication to calm her nerves.  Instead my flight attendant allowed her to drink her nervous away; a drunk woman, scared of flying on a red eye is not a fun experience, especially when she jumped at every plane movement, and needed to go to the bathroom to relive herself of the alcohol she consumed on the flight.  A flight attendant should encourage you to drink your fear away

I think the Flight Attendants should be aware in advance of the passengers who are eligible to take alcoholic beverages instead of asking them their age on the spot publicly and other related questions in case of doubt. It wasn't very comfortable for me to justify myself for asking for an alcoholic beverage by needing to clarify my age and not even being asked my ID instead.
The new thin-back seats and seat pitch, even in Econ Plus are horrible. They are now so bad that my neck hurts for hours after I get off almost any length flight. They make me not want to fly at all.
The seats are ridiculously uncomfortable .... come on it's just pathetic
DISAPPOINTING THAT YOU ALWAYS OVERBOOK THE FLIGHT AND WE HAVE TO WAIT TO BOARD UNTIL PEOPLE VOLUNTEER TO TAKE A VOUCHER ...FRUSTRATING
Some of the laziest service I have ever experienced in first class.
The most cramped seating I have ever felt on a plane, even more so than low-budget airlines. There was no information about where we were, bags were not checked for size. It was all very chaotic.
The flight attendant was grouchy and rude.
Gate agents were severely under staffed when trying to rebook everyone's connecting flights. I waited in line for 1 1/2 hours. Again, NOT HAPPY
Flight delayed 2 hours, late to make connecting flight. No explanation no communication, just bullshit from United. A piss poor company

Yes.  I have been trying to get my frequent flyer miles onto this flight for over a week.  Twice I have called to put the number on, and twice they told me it worked.  But when I got to the airport, it was not on the reservation.  The woman at bag drop off was downright snotty about trying to fix it for me, telling me that I could check online.  But why would I check on line when a SECOND agent at Mileage Plus told me it was fine?  Am I just supposed to never believe an agent on the phone when they tell me they have accomplished what I called about?  At the gate, the agent was much nicer, and she tried to put the number on for me, and apparently another agent tried to help her over the phone.  But I still need to call, now a THIRD time, not including the help I tried to get at the airport for the problem.  Another issue is that this was a basic economy ticket, which is a terrible idea and you should discontinue it.  My employer only allows the "basic" ticket, so if I fly for work and want to fly United, I will have to do this kind of ticket.  But it's ridiculous to not get a carry on (which might or might not be waived if you have a Mileage Plus credit card, but it isn't clear which ones are "qualifying," and I couldn't get the Mileage number onto the card, as detailed above, so I didn't know whether that would be waived or not).  In addition, having no seat makes you feel as if you are flying standby, which is not viable when traveling for business.  It certainly can NOT save United time or money to have to have the agent find you a seat at the gate - that is completely counter to the automation you have turned to to save money.    Anyway, the flight was okay, even though I had a middle seat.  But the service in terms of the Mileage Plus number, including the agent at check in has been appalling -- I'm told one thing, but it's just not true.  And again, the Basic Economy is terrible, and if you leave this as an option, I will have no option but to stop flying United for business -- and I probably fly at least once a month for work.

EWR-ORD went okay.  The seating on the trip back was pure hell.  I am only 5'-10" and my knees were against the seat in front of me.  I don't know how taller people would make it.  Last row / window seat.  Horrible experience.

The aircraft was extremely old. First class service was terrible - took forever to get beverages, food was inedible, seats were old and ratted. No personal device capabilities and no movies to watch. Spending thousands of dollars for what amounted to a slightly larger seat than economy is ridiculous. Shameful

640 am flight says it is on time until after 640 when the plane was not even at the gate.   the plane arrived the night prior before 9 pm.  So we were delayed about 1 hour.  Then when we were getting fuel the fuel truck ran out of fuel so a second fuel truck had to hook up.  At the end of the day we were only 35 minutes late landing at ohare because of the 45 minutes of built in time into your schedule.   Just very disappointing, and I didnt even have a connection.
You lost our luggage and we had no clothes from 11am untill almost 11pm

The flight attendants were fine. However, I had my bag tagged for gate check and your baggage handler was apparently feeling lazy because he basically refused to take my bag telling me there was going to be room in the main cabin.  He was wrong, all the overhead space was full before all were seated on the flight, so I took my bag out and back to the front to have it gate checked as I had intended.  I also saw other passengers with gate check tags who had to end up taking theirs back as well.  The guy working the gate check door needs to do his freaking job. We gate check because we travel frequently and know the overhead space will fill up most likely, especially if the flight is full.  He should have just taken all the bags when he was supposed to and the boarding process would have gone much more smoothly.
VERY uncomfortable.
I want a fucking refund for this horrible travel experience

It was a 7 AM flight with no coffee.   Actually there was no water.   Wipes for the lavatory.   It wasn't United's fault, but it's hard to understand why there's no back up if water wasn't delivered as planned.

I was very disappointed in the breakfast service.  My husband and I were in row of 4 in first class.  We were told we could get a omelet or cereal for breakfast.  We both chose the omelet.  We were told it may not be available.  That we may have to settle for cereal.  Both my husband and I cannot tolerate lactose.  So cereal would not work for either of us.  There was only one omelet which was given to my husband.  I had fruit.  I asked for a least some crackers and was told I would have to purchase them.  Really in first class I have to settle for a bowl of fruit and purchase crackers.

Your options on this survey don't cover my issue. I chose this flight to Chicago because it left early in the morning (the plane arrived the night before). I had a meeting to get to and felt confident that I would be able to get to my meeting on time. If there was a delay with the incoming flight or the plane itself, you had ALL night long to fix it. I don't understand a delay of an hour and a half for a plane that arrived the night before. Once we got to the gate, there was another delay because the crew was late. The gate worker did not do a good job of keeping everyone informed. The pilots actually made up some time in the air, but when we got to Ohare we had to sit and wait for a gate. I guess it was a surprise that we were arriving late???? Why hadn't that already been addressed? The delayed flight made for a very stressful day.
Cabin was very very dirty. Smelled awful and looked even worse.

Airport experience in terminal A is not great. Easy to go through security without realizing it’s the wrong gate. Then you get through, realize and have to sprint out and back through security at a different gate.
I know it is difficult to predict a toddler's behavior, but this child made the flight very unpleasant

The flight attendant at the gate was extremely rude. I have severe flight anxiety and she wouldn't let me sit with my brother or even move my seat at all while there were over 15 open seats on the aircraft. I also offered to pay a fee and she was very rude about it and said no and wouldn't let me move seats when again, there were over 15 open seats.

Yes, I was targeted at security and forced to undergo not one but two pat downs after my valid and legal ID, issued recently, was rejected without cause... As an assault survivor the not one but two genital pat downs we're upsetting an traumatic.

I left my tennis racquets in the overhead bin and was not allowed to return on the plane to get it. The gate agent was rude, unprofessional and not helpful. I've never experienced such treatment. Now my $600 worth tennis equipment is missing. I am beyond upset and devastated.

Sons bike was damaged either first or second flight . Bike is for competition he is attending. Had to spend $100.00 for repairs. Obviously baggage handlers have no consideration for customers property.
I want to reimbursed for the terribleness of my trip and the impact that the lost baggage had on my trip. What a waste.

Flight attendants doesn’t know the food ingredients they’re serving. What if I’m allergic to it? No onboard amenity pack (toothbrush/toothpaste, earplugs, etc! This is over 11 hour flight! We can’t use the United Club because we’re flying Domestic!!! Why! We paid Business Fare!!!
I couldn't work on this flight.  I also couldn't watch a movie.  It was terrible for 4.5 hours.  I'm very disappointed in the entertainment system in general.
Flight attendants were very rude to customers. clearly were not happy and had no patience for customers. Flight attendants on my return flight were happy and exceptional; what a contrast.

The attendant was very unfriendly and she had carried 5 bags on that took up the top 2 bins above the first 3 sets of seats on both sides. She was unwilling to move hers back or into the empty first class cabin and my one bag had to be located at row 20. Attendants should be allowed the same baggage as passengers. She also accessed all of her baggage during the short flight for reading material and cosmetics. She was an angry passenger more than a flight attendant. She made all of the people around us uncomfortable with her attitude and fussing with her bags.

the flight to Greenville was uneventful and not without merit. It was nothing special at all. The disappointment was the cancellation of our return flight with very little notice and little recourse or assistance from UA. We took our business to American and got home the same day.
very disappointed that there was a 4 1/2 delay due to the aircraft
The delay was very uncomfortable and made me lose a whole day of activity, and it took me many hours to recover from exhaustion. I am a senior citizen !
The flight attendant was not helpful, and nasty about it as well. Horrible, horrible!
I find it unacceptable that you do not offer a free meal on a four hour flight

I had to check my carryon at the gate and then when I landed was told that the carryon’s would be at the luggage carousel. I had to wait almost 45 min to get my suitcase which defeats the purpose of checking my baggage. Had to deal with unfriendly and unsympathetic customer service. Won’t be using United again.
Male flight attendant was very rude

A staff possibly called Pam at the check in area, checking ESTA was very rude and aggressive. I complained to the staff there. Her name tag was not visible. She did not introduce herself, did not greet or explain the purpose of her questions. She simply jumped on me and started asking how i got to the airport, etc. When i asked her why she was asking all those questions she said - "if you have to go to america, you'll have to answer my questions". She was very rude. When i stated i wanted to compain, she refused to give her names. The staff there would not give any written information about how to complain either. Unfortunately, the first time i took United years ago, it was a negative experience. This would be the 2nd and the last time.
Flight left late from Edinburgh; baggage delivery at Newark was so slow that I then almost missed my connection to Atlanta. Whole experience was incredibly stressful.
Seats were uncomfortable. Delayed arrival.
All overhead storage was full and the flight attendants seemed annoyed at times. I can’t imagine doing their job but they weren’t overly friendly which was unfortunate.

actually the issue was from STL to ORD but you didn't send me a survey for this. the two people that worked the gate for flight 4726 at 11:10 were extremely rude. I was able to catch an earlier flight so I went to the gate and asked the lady if I could get on, she, with a smile, but still rudely said she wasn't even signed in and couldn't help me, ask my name but didn't write down, I gave to her and said I would be right in the area. After the flight was checked in and they started calling stand by's, when they were done I went up and asked again if I could get on. The man now helping rudely said it was late they were closed and I should have asked earlier. I preceded to say I was here earlier. He then asked if I have status, I said yes Silver then he said it would be a $75 fee would I be willing to pay, I said yes, "its your call" to let me on, he got very rude as he said it was not "their Fault" I corrected him and said that is not what I said can I get on I will pay? he then said no that it was to late, she sheepishly spoke up and said we could probably get me on, he just firmly said no it was to late that I should have done this when I checked in. #1 couldn't do when I checked in, my schedule only opened after I was in the terminal #2 the plane left 5 Minutes early according to your site. #3 you lost out on revenue #4 I was treated extremely rudely #5 I want to know how they will be dealt with????? YOU send out these surveys, I am filling it out assuming you care and will do something , prove me right .
The lavatory was in bad shape. Smelled awful (at the beginning of the flight), like it hadn't been cleaned/sanitized for a long time. The lavatory floor was completely wet.
No coffee on a morning flight.  #fail
Was notified that my upgrade went through with a seat selection then received an email saying I was now on standby.  Very frustrating that it's so difficult to use upgrades/miles.

My first class flight attendant treated me like a second class citizen. He basically ignored me most of the trip. He refilled my water once and never came back to me after that. He came off as very unfriendly and told me I didn’t have the priority level with United the other first class passengers had and that was policy on how passengers are handled. Worst flight I have taken in the past several months. I switched exclusively to your airline with my husband and we also opened a credit card and to have such an unsatisfactory experience has left a bad taste in my mouth. I was definitely singled out on how I was treated compared to other passengers and I was hurt and turned off as I have never been treated so poorly by one of your attendants until now.
Tucson wheel chair assistance is badly missed handled repeatly. Coming and going.

We had 2 adults and 5 children traveling under age 9. Getting to Chicago we had no seat assignment. Waiting for an hour before the attendant assigned seats. And after checking in at the gate everything was out of the system. Had to wait all over again to have the seats assigned. Very frustrating when you have small children.
The last 3 times we've flown United we've been disappointed.  The basics that make air travel tolerable are now considered extra, or premium (ie. food.)  Other airlines do not have this problem.

Mechanical issues in chicago were not communicated and passengers stood in line over an hour and half. No charging stations at gate and not enough seats for area. Passengers were not communicated with by ground crew and the App was terrible. I new showed on the upgrade list. My husband and I were required to separate our reservations in order to show up on upgrade list. Unsatisfactory and obnoxious. He's Global services and I am Platinum. Baggage slow in HNL.

9.5hr flight and I was offered two small glasses of water; traveling with my mom who ended up getting sick, I asked a flight attendant for a glass of water and she was rude and never ended up getting us one. Asked other times for more drink or a refill given the amount of ice in the cup I barely had enough To quench my thirst and were unable to get any more. Yes I brought my own drink too but with a 9.5 hr flight and being pregnant my one drink was not enough and thought that I would have been able to get more, but apparently that is not true on united flights
I'm not sure when it happened but when I picked up my bag a wheel had been broken off.

I was forced to have my carryon checked. Not to the jetway but to baggae clain which took 30 mins and made me late to my meeting. They said there was no room but ppl after me came with carryon and found room.
Difficult getting 2 seats together for my wife and I. Would have had no problem if I had been willing to upgrade at unreasonable extra cost.
Ewe to DC flight was delayed without notice. Feels like your customer service has gone down year over year. No attention to frequent flyers

The flight attendant was rude and impersonal. She was just odd and couldn’t have seen less interested in attending to any passenger on board.  Additionally, there was a panel near my feet (window) that was completely off and so there was a hole in the floor.

The cabin space and seats were waaay too narrow!  People were brushing my shoulder on their way buy.  The drink cart was stopped next to me for about 15 minutes and I was literally cramped in my tiny space.  This was the first time I’ve ever felt crsmped in an aisle seat.  Ridiculous, I am an average size female!
YOU GUYS ARE TERRIBLE 3 HOURS DELAY FOR MECHANICAL LEFT ME STRANDED LAST NIGHT WITH NO UPDATE HAD TO DRIVE GOT HOME AT ^ IN THE MORNING I HAVE NO IDEA WHY I FLY YOUR TERRIBLE AIRLINE
The plane that we were on was extremely dirty. There was stuff spilled all over my seat and tray and all over the floor in the isle. It was very disappointing

The flight attendants did not bring me my coat, which they checked, prior to landing.  Upon deplaning, I asked for my coat and the attendants could not find it.  They finally handed me a coat, which turned out to be a United Pilot's, by mistake which I did not notice until I was in the jetway.  I went back on the plane, fighting the flow of deplaning people, and they were finally able to locate my coat.  This was not the best performance.  I did not get any type of apology.

I’m a Milion Mile flyer so I have some history with united.  Also the flight attendants on this flight seemed annoyed when I asked for the slightest thing, such as taking my empty water cup.  Also, this flight used very cheap plastic cups for the liquids. Not very pleasant experience
One of our bags was left at Milan Malpensa airport.  It was returned to us 3 days later, broken, opened up (our lock was cut), items missing and had an empty red bag in it that wasn't ours.
Seat confort was poor, exacerbated by overweight travelers who take up far more ofmtheir seats.

Problem with people boarding in Zones 4 and 5 who didn't have any room for their carryons and then created a log jam which delayed leaving a bit and also chaos once in Chicago due to people trying to deplane to catch their next connection while people upfront were trying to go to back of plane at same time to get their luggage.  Person scanning tickets should be able to count luggage going on and at some point have the rest checked so as to avoid these problems.  Also, a minor issue but pretzel snack was stale.
One of the flight attendants was a bit rude. I was made to check my bag yet there was room in the overhead compartment right by my seat. On my flight to Vegas the Wifi was horrendous.
Arrived early!  Easy flight, but unfortunately the lack of internet tainted the entire experience.

There was a flight attendant who decided they were going to get in an argument with a passages right after they said passengers could move their seats. The passenger was willing to pay the difference, and even pulled out his credit card to pay the difference, and the flight attendant started flipping out and telling him not to curse at her. The passenger did no such thing and even tried to move back to his original seat. She took his card and then had TSA come into the plane to escort him off the plane. I found this rather unprofessional and disturbing that the customer was trying harder then the attendant to fix the situation. Then right before pulling away from the gate, right after they escorted the man off the plane, she moved another women and a few other people from the back of the plane to the same spot that man was trying to sit.
Seats are very tight...ongoing problem to get adequate seats very frustrating. Made reservations 4 months before.
The flight was on time with no problems or issues.

The plane was not clean. There was not trash lying Around but the control panel above was caked with dirt including the air vents. It looked as though the plane had never been wiped down. myself nor the person I had traveled with wanted to touch anything. It was Disgusting. I took a picture.
you food gave my daughter food poisoning

Delays are understandable in Winter, but not being able to start the plane's engines because of a broken APU is an embarrassment. The frozen tow bar could is understandable given the weather conditions and more forgivable.

When I signed up for economy, I assumed that meant that like Delta, another fulls service airline, it didn't mean I was flying on Frontier or Spirit.  I felt sub human and also was incensed when I was forced to pay for my very small carry on.  Your policy is stupid for a perceived full service airline.  Who doesn't take bag with them?

AS is the case in many of these smaller planes, it was in bad shape. the cabin was dirty, rubber seals were dangling loose, the "united grey" paint was flaking off the interior of the cabin, the seats were old and uncomfortable.  and most disturbing of all:  when we were about to depart, the wheeled staircase was rolled away when the cabin door was still gaping open.  apparently some kind of problem with the hatch.  the poor flight attendant, also dismayed at this, yelled angrily down to the ground crew who prematurely rolled away the stairs:  safety first!   indeed. not my best flight experience.

I know you all don't care and won't do anything about it but my luggage was looked through, now I don't mind checking my luggage but I had an entire makeup bag that's missing from my luggage and all my sentive clothing and shoes thrown around everywhere.

Plane was filthy.  Seat pocket full of crumbs and dirty napkins, etc.  Bathrooms were atrocious.  No tissues and no soap.  Kosher food ordered and hot meat meal was delivered with accompanying cold dairy tray which is forbidden for those observing kosher dietary laws.

One of the flight attendants was very rude during beverage service. She didn’t hear me ask for a couple of water and started to walk away; when I politely repeated my request, she scolded me for “slowing things down.” Then United lost our bag from Chicago to Memphis. This marks the third United flight in a row in which the carrier has misplaced either my bag or my husband’s. Competence at check-in and missing baggage center in Memphis seems to be incompetent at best and hostile at worst.
The in-seat power was problematic.  You had to hold the plug in for it to stay. Very annoying.  Row 10
both in SFO could not gate the jetty to the aircraft left waiting in the jetty 30 mins  Waiting for a gate and luggage at EWR from touch down to leaving the airport 1.5 hours horrible
We waited on the tarmac for over 20 minutes to get to a gate after landing. This is totally unacceptable

We had gate issues on both ends that could and should have been avoided.  On boarding, we were delayed 20-30 minutes as the gantry was not set-up to allow for the boarding of a wheel chair customer.  On arrival in Newark, we waited 15-20 minutes for a gate to open up to de-plane.

Gate agents very unprofessional. Would not pass on information for delayed/cancelled flight. Needed to ask for updates. Had to spend 10 hours at the airport just for the flight to be canceled. Gate attendants OPENLY MOCKED passengers! The problem leaving was not caused by weather but by being ill prepared.
The space between the seats is too small. My window neighbour was a large person who could not help but use the entire armrest as was the person in the aisle. I was cramped and uncomfortable.
The inflight WiFi was broken and catering was limited

I really think you need to figure out the way in which people store luggage overhead. The back rows fill up the front on their way back- it’s so wrong and then when u try and get off you need to try and go backwards to go forward.

IAH gate logistics:  Boarding groups 3,4,5 instructed by signage to get in-line before boarding.  Boarding group announcements/attendant refused to board groups 3,4,5 out of order, forcing shoulder-to-shoulder passengers (about 60% of the flight) to shuffle amongst each other to board in sequence.  ORD clearly segregates group lines.  No issue.  IAH did not, and caused passenger jostling chaos.  I stood first in-line for 45 minutes in group 3,4,5 designation, only to be refused boarding as group 3 passengers jostled amongst groups 4 and 5 passengers to board.  Either designate boarding lines or do away with group boarding.  Agent forced me to check my carry-on.  about 20% of overhead bin space was still available upon boarding aircraft.  Give SWs boarding model a try.  It works.

While the flight attendants were great, i just don’t understand the policy of pouring a glass of soda instead of giving the whole can. It took the attendants over an hour to get to row 35 and it’s because they had to pour from the can each time. Absolutely ridiculous! Give passengers the WHOLE CAN! Very irritating as the beverage service is excruciatingly slow!

The bathrooms at Port Authority / Newark are always disgusting and too small.  While you've clearly invested millions upgrading the terminal, why let the bathrooms be undersized, smelly and always dirty.  I hate it when I need to use them.
Hate this new ticket (basic economy) where we can’t sit together. My husband and I were 20 rows apart. It’s not as if the airline industry isn’t making enough money.
Flight attendants so ovcuppied with infant that they neglected everyone else . I sat with a winter coat on my lap
The food was very bad for first class. United said they would upgrade it. This is far worse than it use to be.

Very disappointed on the service and the disorganization that you guys have is unbearable had to sit and wait longer because of you guys misplacing my luggage so on top of me feeling ill and in pain I had to deal with the up and down of trying to find my luggage
Smooth with no problems, and arrived early!!
The seats were unfortunately so uncomfortable.

Considering that our flight was not only delayed by 3+ hours ON the tarmac, but we had been lied to by the staff.  They had told us it was a maintenance issue and once we did land in Newark and had to be re-routed since I had missed my connecting flight, they told me it was an air traffic control issue.  My bag was also then lost for 2 days, although there was sufficient time from when we landed in Newark until I had to board heading to London.  Every time I have flown United it's been chaos and I am extremely unlikely to fly United again.
The overall state of the cabin was very messy. Food all over my seat, soiled spells on the carpet below my seat and the bathrooms were a disaster.

The stewardess was extremely rude. When a passenger questioned why his electronic device needed to be unplugged at that precise moment, she replied because I said so. The seats are extremely cramped and  a minuscule bag of pretzels for a 5 1/2 hour flight is unacceptable

Because I couldn’t sit up straight or extend my legs I spent the entire flight in an uncomfortable position. The flight attendant woke me up to offer me pretzels. I would have much preferred to have continued undisturbed? At least that way I wouldn’t have had to consciously experience the discomfort the lack of space your seat caused me.
Please carefully review the  flight attendant complement section concerning the problem I experienced, I did not want to give United a bad rating based on one unprofessional flight attendant.

Arm rest and tray table in business class were disgustingly dirty    I wiped with the refreshing WHITE towel handed out after take off and it was dark brown from dirt on the arm rests and then I pulled out some individual hand wipe sanitizing towellets to rewipe the arm rests and tray table second wipe still dirty so needed a third wipe    This is unacceptable

I have been a dedicated United (Continental) for 15+ years, even paying more than competitors at times because the service and aircraft quality.  My college and I were shocked at the lack of general respect and professionalism shown by a few of your airline attendants.  The most offensive was the woman managing the first class cabin seat-to-seat requests.  The problem:  there was a light strip missing over the seat controls, so maintenance was called on board several times to see about replacing... told all involved it was not an issue for me, as they continued to look into it.  The maintenance team came in and turned off the power, following a 10-15 delay with me standing in the aisle.  The first class attended said absolutely NOTHING... no simple / general / blanket apology for any inconvenience while this was happening.  When I asked the first class attendant about the seat situation, she bluntly said after the fact " the seat has no power, will not have power, and as you can see there are no other seats available in first class... I have 7c available if you want it... what do you want to do?'  ... all while the entire aircraft cabin is looking at me as cause for the delay.    I told her 3X that I'm fine, but a general acknowledgment of the problem from her side would speak volumes... she just stood over me saying " are you sure?  are you sure? are you sure?  ... I also asked another attendant to grab something from my jacket they stored, and the attended came to me and said " what do you want?" in a VERY rude tone and demeanor, so much that my colleague made a comment.    I have NEVER written a negative comment about this company until now.  The team on this aircraft needs a serious refresher in general edict.  It left a very bad taste in my mouth for the company.
costumer no-service very rude in Orlando. checking area under staffed

I was frustrated because I got settled into our seats with my 1 and 4 year old, we had been sitting for several minutes and they were happy and then we were asked to move.  Said we will have find someone to switch seats with you because there aren's enough oxygen masks at this seat (the seat my kids and I were assigned).  Why were we assigned these seats and why didn't anyone notice until we were all settled.  My daughter who is 1 and was exhausted screamed and disrupted the entire plane during the move, and no one offered me a hand to help, just stood and watched me struggle.  It was extremely frustrating.

Please stop using the CRJ regional jet and return to the ERJ for flights between ABE and ORD. The CRJ is the most uncomfortable plane in service, and should only be used for flights less than an hour. Numerous passengers were complaining about how cramped and uncomfortable that plane is.  I will do everything I can to not travel on this plane, including considering alternate carriers, which is saying something coming from a Million Miler customer.  Thank you,  Chris Mihalik

Boarding area at Mexico City Airport was chaotic, overcrowded and a very unpleasant experience for most people.  As I have Global Services status, I did not have an issue as the agents took care of me.  However, if I was a normal passenger, I would have been annoyed and angry!
Flight was delayed so I missed my meeting, the communication from the staff was limited even when prompted

The flight was ok but the experience that I had with my luggage was very disappointing. My luggage did not make it to detroit and I looked for my luggage for about 20 mins.. I finally went to baggage claim and told them my situation. They looked up my information and proceeded to tell me that my luggage missed the flight in Dallas and that it would be on the next flight, I didn't have any of my personal needs, clothing, shoe,  I came to Michigan for an event and had to purchase the things that I already had,and didn't really have the extra money to spend because they told me that my luggage will be delivered later that night which it was delivered about 2am in the morning. I need to know what can you do for my inconvenience that I went through.

Boarding process was a bit chaotic with too many with no space for luggage getting in and then having to get out etc, caused a lot of clogged boarding and was not fun sitting in aisle seat (with bags banging my head) through this process

Horrible boarding experience. 2/3rd of the flight was in zone 2, so despite me being in the first 10rows in economy plus, I was required to check in my carry on item. Not a pleasant experience and will not fly United again

I paid extra for additional legroom. Unfortunately, my seat neighbor had a large service dog that took up the majority of that space. I understand and appreciate the need for accommodations, but felt that i should be refunded the extra cost as I could not enjoy the benefit of the additional leg room that I paid for.
This crew was rude. They were not nice to anyone they interacted with. While waiting in the baggage claim area. Several of the passengers were discussing it .

I am very appalled by the flight attendants behavior. One in particular, I did not catch her name as no one has name badges or they didn't announce their names as some airlines do, but I do remember she was Asian. The disrespectful behavior was not towards me but towards a lady that was seated in my row. As this customer was walking to her seat the flight attendant told her there was no more room for her carry on bag. This customer did not understand her so she looked at her puzzled and kept trying to find her seat. The flight attendant continued to raise her voice at the customer sternly saying mam there's no more room for your bag you have to check in. The flight attendant kept insisting with a loud tone you need to move too the back and even started gesturing with her hands to go to the back and was cutting off the customer as she was trying to tell her she doesn't speak English. Another customer in my row and myself were truly frightened and disappointed with this flight attendants behavior cuz my previous united flight had excellent flight attendant service. This is absolutely unacceptable behavior!

The cabin temperature was miserable.  I am not sure who has authority to set the temp in the cabin, however, the cabin temp should be consistent on every flight.  3 hours of sweating in a full cabin is miserable

The person announcing the flight time was entirely wrong and presumably was thinking of some other flight -- he was off by more than an hour. also, the lack of non-wifi entertainment was a very serious minus.
My only complaint is my seat was changed from what I reserved online, and no reason given.  I had picked an aisle seat and was moved to a middle seat.
The delays and chaos at MCI were ridiculous. The wait for my luggage at ORD was longer than expected.
Snack selection is weak and makes me miss Delta.
On check point Landry called me and my wife  Criminals people
I hate it that I am always forced to check my carry-on bag

Extremely cramped. Bathroom was pathetically cramped. Too many pets: I am allergic to pets and get asthma when around them. I have rights also and it’s not fair that I should be subjected to the pets. Most of the pets owners on flights do not need to rely on their dogs for security. On a flight last week, a man in front of me was telling others that all he had to do was go online and pay a small fee to get a dr’s note to take his dog. After the flight, he and his dog were walking up a crowded bustling concourse when the dog stopped and defecated in middle of the rushing crowd.  It’s disgusting that your airline encourages people to being pets.

the seats on the plane were very uncomfortable.  Hard and cramped.  No leg room i economy.  Too shallow a tray table.  Felt like I would bump my head every time I moved.  Could not reach my bag under the seat.
Extra change for full-size carry-on luggage shouldn't be allowed. It caused a lot of trouble, especially I wasn't told clearly when booking.

There was an elderly disabled gentleman who could not walk or stand unassisted (not sure if he also suffered from dementia).  Even though the flight attendants did everything possible to assist him in getting to the bathroom and make him comfortable it was more that they could handle.  The gentleman just could not stand up on his own. He screamed most of the flight complaining that he had to go to the bathroom.  Someone in his condition should have never been allowed to fly by himself.   The passengers had to endure his cries for help for most of the flight.  It broke your heart.  What is the policy for disabled passengers travelling on their own when they cannot take care of themselves?

When I asked for the “Executive Option” of meal service at a later time, flight attendant was visibly annoyed and warned me that it would be difficult to serve me. I said that I was in no hurry and she all but rolled her eyes!  Two points - 1-why is it necessary to serve dinner at 4:00 pm when there is ample time on a 14+ hour flight for both a more timely meal and sleep, and 2-why offer the Executive Option if the FA’s are unwilling to serve it?  It appears that they just want to get the service out of the way and retire to the galley which is what happened.

The coach seating room is ridiculous....UA is squeezing its passengers into tighter and tighter spaces.  I am not a large person...5'10" tall and 158lbs, and this seat row 14 was so close to the seat in front of me, I could barely move my legs.  It was VERY uncomfortable!

I get to the airport at 9:30am to check in for my flight but I missed the cut-off time to check in so she had to put me on another flight. I understood but I was also traveling with my pet. I asked the lady at the check-in desk if my pet would still fit on the new flight/plane. She said yes without really looking or checking. I pay $125 for the in-cabin pet. The standby flight arrived at 11:00, I board as the flight attendant tells me my pets carrier isn't going to fit and to get of the plane so they can figure out what to do.  I told her that the lady at the check-in desk said his carrier could fit under the seat and I already paid my $125. She tells me I can't fly with him and I can't Board the 11:00am flight. The manager (who was very professional) comes and ask who told me my pets carrier could fit? I told him it was the lady at check-in. They informed me she was supposed to measure the carrier to be sure it would fit on the new flight but she didn't which is how I got into this inconvenience. He and his employees try to find me a soft-sided carrier but they didn't have any.
