The gate attendant tells me that she can put me on the next flight out to Buffalo but it doesn't leave Atlanta until close to 4pm and there's a 4 hour layover in Newark, NJ and I wouldn't get to Buffalo until after 11pm, I had no other option but to take that flight and then had to leave the airport, pay for parking, find the nearest Petsmart and buy a soft sided carrier, come back to the airport go through security again. Needless to say I was very disappointed and frustrated with the entire situation which happened because someone didn't do their job right. She didn't even check the paperwork that my pet had the rabies shots and health certificate to fly which I paid $99 for. I feel like a lot of time and money was wasted had she done her job correctly all of this could have been avoided. She inconvenienced me, United Airlines, and her fellow co-workers. Probabaly the worst flying experience I've had. Basically spent my entire day in airports and airplanes with my pet. Very uncomfortable. However, I do appreciate how serious everyone took the incident. I was refunded my $125 and United did give me a $250 gift certificate for the inconvenience. Just unfortunate how easily this all could have been avoided.
Ran out of hot food by the middle of the economy section. I get running out of an option, but ALL hot food was gone with 12 rows of economy to go. Disappointing.

I cannot believe how rude the flight attendant was on this flight.  I was scheduled and paid for seat 1B and when I entered the aircraft gentlemen was sitting in my assigned seat.  When I questioned him, he told me to see the flight attendant.  When I advised her that my seat was taken her response was “So”.  My response was “What does “So mean?”   She got a little nasty and stated “I had one problem passenger, I don’t need another.   The ending of this story is too long.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: Disappointed with reservations team after several calls to get a seat assignment in premium seat area - I was told on several occasions that was my problem and I was the one that needed to call back to update my seat assignment because it was out of there hands and nothing could be done unless I followed up daily to see if the seat schematic had been updated to the correct one for the 757-300 planes. Original seat assignment was aisle in premium, then moved to a middle seat with no notification 1 week before flight, fortunately I checked flight and seat assignment.

First flight I was on had a gate change from terminal A to terminal C.  I was 90 minutes early for flight as original gate had no reader board message on gate change nor did I get a text message on my phone.  When I finally realized flight was moved to another gate, it took me almost 25 minutes to get to other terminal and I missed the flight so missed important meetings and it made a terrible impact on my day.
Planes over heard was very small and low. Cabin was not clean. I could not pre print my boarding pass because i didn’t check a bag in. I didn’t have a bag to check in

Being downgraded to last to board because I am not the primary cardholder is disappointing and unfair treatment.  My one day pass at United club is worthless at Newark. Overall my formerly favorite airline had slipped a LONG way!

Yes, unfortunately, I was seated next to a very fat person. I am not holding this against him but it was an uncomfortable experience for the duration of my flight. This person should have maybe purchased  2 seats due to his size as the seats on this particular are narrow. Unfortunately, I did not enjoy this flight due to the discomfort.

I had asked for some water in my water bottle. The flight attendant refused to pour water directly into the bottle (around 600 mL) . Instead he gave me water in 2 cups. This was the first time i faced such a situation. In all my previous flights i never had this problem.
felt like i was on a charter flight. horribly uncomfortable
The flight was over sold, and CRAMMED full, I know you are running a business but it is torture to sit for 5 hours in a fully loaded plane, in economy.

I paid a lot of money for an upgraded exit row seat. I had extra legroom but the seats were very narrow and the armrests couldn’t be lifted. Also it’s sad that you have to pay extra for entertainment on a long flight. You are behind most other airlines with no having this perk

way too cramped -- I was sitting in aisle seat and every time a fight attendant or passenger came by I got my shoulders knocked into or my legs knocked into -- so uncomfortable! flight attendants didn't apologize for knocking into me. I am a small person, 120 lbs -- If this happens to me I can't imagine what happens to bigger people. What can u do to make this right?
Just suggest pulling that aircraft out of service for some TLC as soon as possible. I usually fly American (Platinum pro) or Southwest ( a list preferred) for work and have never seen a plane so bad

I did not intent to go to Chicago. Was never never notified of original flight delay. Ending up costing me over $200 in extra expenses since I missed connecting flights and we missed a scheduled appointment with our broker. Had to also pay extra for changes in car rental.
We had assigned seats together. With no notice we were moved to different seating, not together. Gate agent was not helpful, rude, and obnoxious. Outrageous.
End it was very condescending and rude. When I asked her if she could throw something away for me she told me to just put it on the floor.

Tri g not to sound like a terrible person and not against a wonderful religion, my seat was directly in front of where the Jewish would gather for prayers.  On several occasions, my hair would be grabbed when they would hold the back of my seat.  The constant up and down the  aisle was also disrupting.  Again, I don't mean to be against the religion, just the experience.

United are crooks.  To change to a basic economy ticket and keep your standard prices.  Then fight with people because the bag is the right size but because its a roller bag it cant come on the plane.  Shame on you for pulling this crap.  I will never fly united again

luggage did not arrive on our plane.  I believe the fault was with the check in at EWR.  I was told to place my golf clubs on a cart at the end of the check in station.  there was no one there and the baggage check in person seemed not to be paying any attention and that is why I beleive my clubs never made it on our plane.  I have nothing but complimentary things to say about Ellen, your rep at San Diego who handled the problem for us.  She couldn't have been more attentive and was as accomodating as she could have been.

I noticed you all didn’t send a surgery for my flight to SANTA ANA because it was the worse ever! My flight from Santa Ana was fine. However, going there was such a bad experience that I hope to never use your airline again. The gate changed and was not able to find it. I was in First class but had to put my carry on way in the back. The flight didn’t land inn Santa Ana! It landed at LAX and your staff had NO information and they werent even kind or apologetic. They had us wait then said we can take a later flight or a bus. Our luggage took forever to come then the bus wasn’t showing up. I had a meeting to get to so I had to take a Uber for $87 from LAX to Laguna. I’m so disturbed by my experience. I heard staff say the plane had too much luggage and too many people and of some people left or took a bus the. The rest could go Santa Ana because the flight would be lighter. How horrible to do that to people. My job paid over $1000 for that flight. I will never fly United again if I can help it.
economy seat was unacceptably uncomfortable especially with person in front of me reclined.  Also seats have no padding so have to use blanket as cushion.

Flight attendants were very impatient. The flight was delayed and departed an hour later. With the flight being 3h01m we were not asked to purchase food until the last hour of the flight. One of the gentleman working the flight was very kind, however, the rest of the crew seemed irritated.  The passenger next to me kept stealing mini bottles of alcohol off the cart.  The entire flight was just uncomfortable.
Flight attendants were particularly rude (significantly more than usual)
The male flight attendant was very rude and condescending to me as a had a hard time putting my carry on in the overhead. There is not call for being rude.

Every united flight I take is delayed, This flight from Flint to Chicago was delayed by 1 hours which cased me to miss my connecting flight in Chicago.  As a result I was stuck in the airport for over 6 hours in Chicago then my home flight was canceled.  I had to go to a hotel at midnight.  to be back at the airport at 6 AM, waited over 20 minutes at the Louisville airport for my luggage.  Just a bad experience all around.

The gentleman steward/flight attendant was very rude. Took about 20 minutes or more to assist why questions/concerns after pressing the assistance bell, and assisted with an attitude and no customer service at all.

There was a passenger two rows back coughing ang hacking all during the flight.  Would it be possible to provide a mask for either the sick passsengers or others if they refuse to wear it?  I’m surprised she was able to all off the plane as sick as she was.

Please get back to using real planes on this route. The little planes are very uncomfortable and rollerboards cant fit in the overhead bins.... adds another 15 minutes waiting for bags after landing.... no first class ... not a good experience
My biggest problem was the poor and/or awkward treatment of people getting them to the airplane.  A jetway to a platform to a bus waiting area, full bus, bus to stairs….

Flying the CRJ regional aircrafts is not a great experience.  The seats are tight but the worst thing is that you must wait an average of 15 minutes on the tarmac for your tagged suitcase.  This is not a very efficient process.  The customer experience is not very good.  You need to have the adequate set-up that allows for a quick in and out.

I am very dissatisfied with the way the aircrew treated me. Even more than this. I’m upset and hurt by their behavior.  I was flying together with my wife - sitting aisle and middle on the 11th row. I was offered an upgrade to business - and hesitated as it was only for one but ended up sending my wife to business. No one told me that someone will come sit in her space (there were empty seats on the plane) and When someone came I was surprised but even more surprised to see that he got the aisle seat and I will have to sit in the middle between strangers (hasn’t happened to me for probably over 10 years).  I asked the crew to sit him in a different seat so I can sit in the aisle.  I was shocked when they came back after a few minutes with their answer. “The captain says that either you sit in the middle or you go off the plane now!!!” I was never treated this way before in my life. Not as a regular traveler, definitely not as a prestige loyalty member of he airline. I was politely asking for something and got a very humiliating response. So many ways for them to solve this differently - moving the other client to another seat, offering me another seat (there was a window seat available) maybe even just apologizing and explaining the situation.  But no. You have decided to act this way.  No apologies. No respect. Not for my business. Not for me.  Shame.

It was the first airline that I have had an absolutely terrible first class experience. The hostess was rude, there was no difference in the snacks/beverages provided to coach and first class, the seat was uncomfortable, the flight was just terrible.

My experience during the check-in process before my departure from Beijing (at Beijing Airport) was really unpleasant. The staff who handled my and my companion's check-in was very rude and unprofessional - which, in my opinion, does not at all live up to a United Airline staff's standard.  Here is what happened:  As a silver member who fly with UA since 2009, my understanding about the check-in policy is that both me and my companion can have the "priority" tags on our check-in luggages, even though my companion is just a frequent flyer.  In fact, for all the trips we travelled together using UA services (in 2016 & 2017), this has always been the case, whereby both of us have the "priority" tag for our check-in luggages.   However, while we were checking in at Beijing Airport on 1/11 (aisle D at D05 desk), the guy who handled our check-in refused to put the "priority" tag on my companion's luggage, even though I explained the UA policy to him when my companion found that he didn't apply the "priority" tag on the luggage (I booked the airline tickets for both of us and we are under the same confirmation number).  Instead of handling this issue in a professional and polite way, the staff refuses to acknowledge his mistake until I talked with his supervisor and showed both of them my confirmation number.  Even then, he wouldn't apologize for his mistake and still insisted that he was right.  The way how he handled the situation was unaccepted and doesn't live up to the standard as a UA staff.  This is the first time I encountered a UA staff who was really rude and unprofessional.  I am just hoping that, the company should strengthen the training to all staff (particularly staff outside of US) so that they are all familiar with the policy and minimize the number of mistakes they might make in this regard.  Thank you.
The cabin smelled of body odor, the cabin was dirty my seat was not clean and trash on the floor

The woman flight attend was very rude consistently. She was rude when she asked me to put my bag under the seat. It was already under the seat but my jacket was on top. When she realized she let out a short grunt of dissatisfaction and kept walking. She was rude during drive service and was rude to another person who had gotten up then the seatbelt light came on. She didn't have to be rude when telling her to go back to her seat. Before landed she did the same thing with the jacket bag issue.

Stop canceling flights and it is always full including the morning flight which was cancel which shows you need to be using a bigger Plane. The staff at the airport have been saying this but no one will listen. Why is That?
Very disappointing execution

Unfortunately there was a family with small children in the row behind me and the parents offered no restraint during the unruliness of their children.  One of the children cried pretty much the entire flight and the one directly behind me was kicking the back of my seat.  Nothing much that the flight attendants could do about it - I believe that it is a "cultural" problem.

The gentleman flight attendant removed my carry-on from the overhead bin and asked who it belonged to so a large roll-aboard coul take it's place.  My legs cramp developed cramps after about an hour of flight. My carry-on is simply a computer case that doesn't fit well below the seat. So I have to twist my feet around to make room for my computer bag. That is why I only have one carry-on.    The result is a painful flight.

Worst flight of my life! The weather was not ideal for flying and turbulence was horrible, I don’t know if the pilot was new or some kind of unexperienced but the plane was moving like crazy during take off,  landing, and during most part of the flight. If the weather is terrible, why not delay o cancel the flight? I would prefer much better to not fly this way. Very scary!
I"m not sure I've ever seen less room between seats.  It was really bad

when I checked in I asked the staff member if I had to check my luggage, he told me no, entered his password and printed my ticket. When we were boarding the lady at the gate saw me in line 5 with a carry on suit case and very rudely stated that I can not bring a bag. I explained to her that another person told me I could, she said well he shouldn't have and I'm supposed to charge you double for bringing it back here. She charged me the $25, and took my bag.

I did not appreciate the departure delay of over an hour.  I even more was upset that we sat on the runway for ~45min waiting for a gate when we finally did arrive.  Fortunately I did not have a connecting flight.

The flight attendants are borderline surly and not helpful I’m a global services and asked for something to eat sitting back in row 22 Answer : we don’t have everything left Me: ok, what do you have left? Answer: look in your magazine  Me: wouldn’t it be easier to tell me what is left? Answer : just look in the magazine Then they walked away and never came back I had to ask three times   The service culture at United is broken Flight attendants are not interested in delighting customers - they are more interested in doing their job DESPITE customers It’s seems like I am just witnessing employees in the back office of some Home Depot vs dealing with client service  This is not the case with delta and international airlines; American is slightly worse

I gate checked my bag due to the over head bin size which is normal on the Regional CRJ. When we landed in st Louis we had to wait for our bags in the jet bridge, which is normal. Here is the problem, it took 30 minutes in temperature of 15° waiting for my bag. It was absolutely ridiculous leaving us in the cold waiting for our bags for 30-plus minutes. There were at least 20 of us waiting for bags freezing because coats gloves head where we're in our bags. With all the problems of air travel this is one that is easily avoidable.
I started watching the second Kingsman movie on my flight from MSP to ORD, so I was disappointed that I wasn't able to finish it on my flight home from ORD to MSP.

When we arrived in STL it took more than 30 minutes to get the gate checked bags.  The gate attendant had to call several people to complain before they sent someone to get our bags off the plane.  Unacceptable

On both flights, I was forced to check my personal luggage because there was no space in the airplane. On both flights, even though I had economy plus I was allowed in on group 4 entering too late when there is no space for luggage anymore.

We were traveling with a lap infant and we specifically booked seats in the bassinet row. When we checked in on line all was good. But we get to the plane and discovered that we were split up due to a change of aircraft. This is shocking as we had an infant. But even more shocking was that we received no notification that this happened. You have my email and should have given us warning before we got on the plane!!

Your staff were very rude I thought  I know it was a massive aircraft but they were very unfriendly and they seemed irritated There was a man orchestrating the boarding ge was very loud and rude quite obnoxious

we ended up with a mechanical delay so it turned out my run was not necessary but the mechanical delay did not happen until everyone was on board....maybe they should have figured out that we were having an issue a little sooner

I was on my way to Melbourne, Australia. My first flight was from Newark to LAX. Check in at Newark was very upsetting. My suitcase was 4 pounds overweight. I asked a leader (Tyrone C - Cooly? I can’t remember his last name) from United if he could waive the fee. He was very unfriendly with his response - no. I explained my mum had just died and this trip was costing me money that I did not have. I have flown to Australia 3 times in the last 6 months because my mum has been very sick with cancer. The cost of this totals over $3500 has been a financial stress. I am not a rich person. I had to use my credit cards to pay for them. Yes credit cards - plural. Now my mum is dead. I just wanted to have a little compassion and not have to spend more money than I already had. I understand that your policy is to charge overweight baggage. However, in any situation I believe there can be a degree of flexibility with policy. I know had the option to remove some items and put them in my carry-on. My reluctance to this was because I already had a heavy carry-on backpack, already stuffed full with personal items. Adding another 4 pounds to it is exhausting on my back and my body. Aside from the cost I just wanted to be able to get to Australia as refreshed as possible. Don you know how long it takes to get to Melbourne from New York? It is 90 minutes from my home to Newark airport. It is then 2 hours waiting at the airport to board the plane and take off. It is the 5.5 hours to LA. Then 90 minutes waiting for my next flight to Melbourne. This flight is 15 hours to Melbourne. Once landed it takes about an hour to get through customs and baggage claim. Finally it takes 1 hour to get to my parents house from Melbourne airport. From door to door it took me 26.5 hours to get home. By the time I got there I felt as dead as my mother was.  It was only 4 pounds - not very much in my opinion. When I explained all of this to Tyrone he was very unfriendly. He stated very firmly that it was not possible. When i explained further he began to get agitated with me and very rude and dismissive. I was so shocked at his behavior that I began to get upset. At this point I was more upset about the way he was treating me with such a lack of kindness, concern, and compassion. No one should treat anybody this way. Tyrone needs to be educated in how to interact with people who are experiencing very distressing situations. Compassion should be his first reaction. Not annyoance and anger. I felt so disrespected. I have been a mileageplus member for a few years now. Last year I reached silver status premier access. I feel given that I am a loyal customer I should have a more pleasant experience with your airline. This experience has made me feel that I am not a valued customer. I live in Brooklyn, NY. Newark is very far away to travel to, but I choose United as I wanted to be a loyal customer who can experience the benefits of my patronage and all the money that I pay you. I have had minor unpleasant experiences with United before such as a broken entertainment unit. I was compensated $100 for this experience. Similarly I was compensated $100 when a different flight was compensated. If you offer me $100 compensation for this experience I will be very, very offended. I’m not asking for anything, but if you think $100 would make this extremely shitty experience (while I am already

There was never information given about delays and if there was it was LONG after the Fact. I had to call Customer service to try and find out if there was a delay because no one  showed up at the gate. The next morning our Flight was supposed to be the first one out to Newark.  Actually 2 other flight left and then they delayed us another 2 hours. Total 15 1/2 hour delay overnight.  Horrible customer service!! I travel for work on your airline a quite a bit during the month.
Seats are uncomfortable. I was supposed to be next my son and wasn’t. They made us check a bag when two other passengers has same exact bag in the overhead.  Argued with us.
1. The seats are too small and uncomfortable 2. The washroom in Newark airport terminal building was dirty, piss everywhere

This flight was great. On time no delays. My flight end Sept return beginning October was terrible....3 hours delay. I have 2 different seats assigned....the print boarding pass was different from my phone app boarding ticket. Flights were delayed both ends.

I was extremely dissatisfied with the professionalism of the baggage workers. I first was asked to put a green ticket on my bag and leave it to be taken underneath upon boarding the plane since there was apparently no space for it. Come to find out there was plenty of overhead space. The flight was not full. I carried on for a reason. After we landed I waited to get my bag back and the baggage crew was first being delayed with bringing out the bags because apparently the bag belt was broken and they were waiting for another one. Than I am the last person standing there still waiting for my bag and they shut the door right in front of me. I wait a minute thinking maybe the are going to bring up another bag and nothing. I finally exit to go inside the gate and was informed that maybe the rain in Detroit took the ticket off my bag and that I should go see if my bag made it to the carousel. The woman at the gate should the baggage workers were not looking for it. So myself and my coworker whom is patiently waiting and thinking he was going to be on his way home in our car service by now go to the carousel and my bag is sitting there with the green tag clearly visible and intact. This was simple negligence on the part of the baggage crew.
The first attempt to land was unsuccessful.  The pilots blamed the guidance system at SBN, but I am doubtful.  I did not feel safe.
Lost my ski boot bags I needed for the next day. Very disappointed

The seat space in economy is excruciatingly painful. I am of average height and weight.  I believe it is a safety hazard to pack passengers in like that.  I am trying to cut down on my business travel due to the overall discomfort of flying. I believe there are both safety and health consequences to doing this to one’s body.

Use boarding lanes by group number - these had been removed and it was chaos.  Group one (including me) struggled to get near the gate because all the higher number groups were closest to the boarding door.

I do not recall being so hot in the flight.  The plane was parked quite awhile before any air was turned on in the cabin.  When the air was on, it barely circulated through the vents by me.   As a result, I found myself sweating profusely, and had a very uncomfortable flying experience.  The crew in the back of the plane acknowledged that it was hot and requested that the air get turned on. However, nearly any air made its way to the back.  It was close to single digits in CLE, where I departed.  The guy in the row upfront and next to me stripped down to a T-shirt and shorts to compensate. I was not as fortunate, with my winter attire, heading to ORD.

The food was terrible! The chicken/rice was burned and stocked to the bottom. At the breakfast we were served a cold almost frozen croissant, which normally on other United flights gets heated. I asked the flight attendant if it could be warmed, but that wasn't possible.  Also I am very disappointed in the cabin comfort, this 767-300 has an interior of 20 years old. The seat on back entertainment is almost black and white, the seats cushion are horrible and the luggage bins don't even fit a regular piece of carry-on. These planes are a real disgrace to the United Airlines product, especially the economy section. The business class has been refitted only 7-8 years ago. Economy is a big disappointment! I know they are scheduled for re-fitting, but I still think that it is 5 years too late! I try to avoid flights of United on the 767-300, but unfortunately there is no there option to fly to Amsterdam. 3 flights (Chicago, Newark and Washington DC) all fly with this old crappy plane! Only option to fly a different plane is Houston on the 777-200, but the flight time adds at least 4-5 hours extra, due to crappy connection with seattlte flight inbound.
The check in was chaos

The flight was delayed due to weather. After 2 gate changes and On 3 separate occasions we were asked to line up to board, only to be told one story after another about why the plan could not board.  "No Crew to fly the plane". The plane we were supposed to board was now heading to LAS, waiting on a new crew.  Finally, on the 4th try and 7 hours later, we boarded the plane.  The point is the information and communications were all bad. We were informed in the United Club our plane was boarding and when we left, we would not be able to get back in.  The plane did not board for another 4 hours. Terrible coordination and information.
Flight was delayed.. what 6 hours?  Weather was root cause but the lack of pilots later became the issue.

our flight was delayed  6 hours and the gate was changed twice. the content of the communication was not good. more the one time we were told that our flight was ready, to be delayed instead by another hour or two. I understand the weather conditions but 6 hours delay is excessive compared to the events. Flight 1762 ETA was 8:57 PM, it landed at 3:00 am! It is obvious the UA is running its business at the lowest cost possible (thin crews & equipment) to the cost of the passenger's experience. Also, my outbound flight from Chicago to Houston on Tuesday (UA 1113) was delayed by one hour due to mechanical issues with the aircraft. For one reason or another UA is never on time and I will start considering avoiding UA if I can. I am not happy with UA at all!

The flight was overbooked and I had to gate check my bag.  Why did the plane not have enough overhead space for bags?  It was a newer plane.  Also, the size of the seats is not big enough.  I was seated next to a large gentleman who encroached on my personal space and made it uncomfortable for me to sit in my seat.  This would not have been as much of a problem if the seat size had been slightly larger.
It took very long to board the aircraft.  Also, I checked in almost 24 hours in advance and still was in group 4.  Very disappointing.

Flight delay was not well communicated at the gate or via the United app.  Also flight attendants did not pro-actively identify bags which would not fit in overhead compartments, which were smaller on this aircraft, causing additional time for many customers to get their bags back off the plane to be gate checked after failing to fit the bag above the compartment.

Security is rude and agents at gate refused my carry on which is the same carry on I brought up there. Needs consistency. Also, the TSA precheck line was longer than the regular line. Newark is a disaster
It was very difficult to link my children and wife to my reservation. Furthermore, it was not possible to do online check-in. This was disappointing.

Cabin storage bins are inadequate and too small.  While my carry on suitcase is within the published guidelines, I always need to check in the suitcase due to the bins being too small.  This is frustrating.

When we arrived at the indicated baggage carousel for our flight, at Newark, we waiting a very long time.  Finally, someone, not sure who, told us there was a change and we had to go all the way down to one of the first carousels to claim our luggage.  Very poor information/communication.

I was willing to pay for an upgraded seat but was unable to do so on the initial booking or the subsequent check-ins. So I was stuck in an extremely uncomfortable window seat. To make the matters worse. the window seat didn't align with the windows as well. So stuck in a bad seat and couldn't look out the window either
The seats are VERY uncomfortable on this aircraft.
there is only a very real problem with the lack of space when seated and I am only 1.50cm tall

Terrible experience. United provides no information, continues to delay the flight. Lost the ability to take an earlier flight to the NYC area airports due to awful communication and updating passengers with information. Terrible way to treat any passenger. Especially business travelers.

the management of the delays at the Houston airport was disastrous. gates changing, announcement not reliable. what is the point to announce delays so frequently when there was no chance to expect planes to arrive on time?
App problems during check in.  Frustrating.  Business partner also had problems.  Timed out without checking in.
You really need to work on your communications. And a process for the pilot to negotiate him coming back every 20 minutes and saying there’s no update he has no idea what’s going on is unsatisfactory

Delayed due to de-icing. You only had ONE truck available. But you had 4 or more departing flights at same time. Inadequate resources and it was known at least a day before that ice storm was coming!! Saw the same problem coming into St Louis. You had too many planes for the gates. My colleagie sat on tarmac for half hour waiting for gate to open. You need to have much more resources on ground for your schedules into St Louis
Refused entry to lounge as a gold member with a one day pass Only middle seat available at checkin Late departure with no explanations
Worked out well. Flight was on time. The seats are just so tight. I know I can pay to upgrade, but it just seems wrong that you would expect people of average height to sit in such a tight space.

The pop up club by 124 was weak.  If you're going to have it, at least have catering from the other clubs.  I get you can't do a full catering but cheese sticks and other pre-packaged snacks was weak.  You could do sandwiches or other cold options if you don't have capacity for hot items.  That was poor.

Very disappointing that for the price of a first class seat you do not get lounge access!   Wanted to have the total first class experience, so reluctantly was willing to pay for day pass ... lounge full!  Very disappointing

This the second flight with this departure time. Last time I had to change gates two times and flight was delayed more than an hour. This time one gate change and again more  than an hour wait. I am currently waiting for my flight from Huntsville to O'hare and this flight was delayed two and one half hours. United has disappointed me for the,last time. You have lost my business.
The seats are extremely uncomfortable and the quality of cleanliness in your planes are continuously degrading.

my experience was horrible because i had a seat next to someone who smelled horribly, talked loudly on his cell phone until we literally took off, kept his light on the entire evening flight, leaned over me to see out of the window and started his cell phone conversations again before the wheels hit the ground in landing. i felt sick to my stomach the entire flight and was very close to vomiting because of his horrific body odor!

It was late boarding and then, after we boarded we had to wait one-half hour on the tarmac thus making the flight very late.  This put me and others in a very difficult position.  Additionally, when we landed, another plane was in our terminal making us wait even longer.  It seems that this is an operational issue.  Lastly, I had to check my bag at the runway.  It took at least 20 minutes to get my bag again compounding the lateness for my connecting flight which I very nearly missed.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: Flight attendant did not care at all. We were delayed because the flight computer wasn’t working. We landed and the gate wasn’t ready. Pretty annoying all around.
flight was delayed due to broken parts

I had the worst pre-boarding experience of any airline to date.  I was so embarrassed, I already submitted feedback on your website prior to boarding the actual flight.  In short, the gate attendant was rude and verbally embarrassed me in front of other customers.  I was using this trip as an interview on what airlines to join their clubs and credit cards.  I have a new client in Chi and was going to use United to get there.  After this experience, I've booked multiple trips to ORD that will take twice as long to get there and cost 50% more, but I will not have to use United.  Shame on her!

Yes, your new seat size/spacing is so horrible, I will never fly your airline again unless I have to or can afford extra legroom.  I am 6' tall and my knees were jammed in the back of the seat in front of me.  I have never been this uncomfortable on a flight before in my life.
on boarding process was a mess and delayed the flight. had to de-plane passengers to check bags. should have paused the boarding process instead of cramming everyone in the gateway.
Flight was delayed but no notice posted. Incoming flight had not even arrived at our on boarding time, yet the board was not changed.
The seats are very uncomfortable for that length of flight. And to only get a small bag of pretzels and one beverage for a 4+ hour flight is ridiculous.

I was put in the back row and awakened not once or twice but almost a dozen times with a crew members crotch in my face, their clothes draping over my seat repeatedly. More than once they dropped items ONTO MY HEAD during the flight. I was already dissatisfied with the non-reclining seat, lack of power outlets, entertainment and wifi, but that took the cake. I'll have a hard time flying United again.

Mix up at baggage claim. Digital notice flight 3724 baggage at baggage claim 2. 30 minute wait no baggage , no notice of change in claim station. Baggage ultimately found at baggage claim 5 by hunt and search. 50 minute delay.

The gate staff was extremely rude not just to me but the entire gate area was even speaking about the rude/arrogant staff that was at the gate.   I know the they have no control over the 4.5 hour delay but when any question were brought their was one particular staff memeber working that was the tidiest person I have ever met.   Disappointed United

When I checked in, the 1K agents suggested stand-by and pretty much guaranteed I would be put on the earlier flight, since my original flight was delayed.  They also told me my checked bag would be put on the earliest flight.  Neither of these things were true. At the gate, as it became apparent my original flight was going to be significantly late, the only consideration offered was unhealthy chips and water.   Fruit, vegetables and healthy sandwiches would be more appropriate. The worst was when the gate agent announced that even if the flight got to LGA, the crew would most likely "be illegal" and there was a good possibility the flight would be cancelled.  That caused a rush to the customer service desk to rebook.  He was not prepared to handle my request for rebooking and a hotel, and left me standing alone at the podium, with no information or explanation as he walked away.  In the midst of it all, a supervisor, or someone with real information came to the area and made an announcement that the flight would not be cancelled.  Quite a bit of upsetness and anxiety caused by someone who didn't know what he was doing.  All in all, the worst experience I have had traveling in a long time.

United left my daughters golf clubs in Newark even though we checked 2 hours before the flight on time.  Oddly, my one bag with clothes that I checked made it, but my clubs got left behind.  My daughter had a golf tournament and we missed our practice round because the clubs did not arrive until the next afternoon!!!  First time United has failed to deliver my golf clubs so I give you a pass, but worst time to fail to do it as it was for a regional golf tournament.
premium economy seats are terrible.  impossible to relax.entertainment system made my head on tray even worse. I will fly Iberia next time

Planes are so uncomfortable and claustrophobic. No tv. No room.  Bathrooms smelled. I got a bag of pretzels that had about 5 mini pretzels to eat. Are you serious?  Pilot talked too much. The trip to FT Myers was a nightmare & you lost my luggage for 5 days.
Flight crew was rude and provided limited very poor service
Attendants were rude and cold towards Old Indian passengers because they were not used to Air travel and looked lost. I will stop using UA for India travel

Yes, the reason I flew United this year is because my experience last year was decent/good. This year I found staff unresponsive to minor request for water ( over an hour for drink of water) impatient and rude in response to walking in aisle. The food was unhealthy and sickening. No fruit or veggies...

The plane itself and your staff were great. However, as a passenger, your seating is really not good. I was a middle seat, row 29. the gentleman in the aisle seat, while not a "large" man was spilled into my seat and I spent the three hours angled in the other direction. Not enough room to cross my legs or even bend down to retrieve my computer under the seat in front of me. Made for a very miserable journey. There were not seats available to even upgrade my seat, but even if there were, the problem exists for others.

Miserable experience. Gate agents miserable. And I paid for upgraded seats on both flights and standard seats on SW are 100% with only 15.00 early bird. I’ll go out of my way to not fly United moving forward.

Service people at the gate were clueless on boarding and line management. The gal at the gate told me I had to check my bag because the plane had no more overhead storage, when I got in the plane, there were EMPTY overhead bins. We waited 10 minutes in line on the gantry to enter the plane, it was so ludicrous that the baggage loaders in the gangway were laughing at us all standing in line. Dismal performance by all United employees.

I am annoyed that I tried to use moles to upgrade to business and you put me on a waiting lot and then I never got it.  Other airlines I use miles and get the upgrade immediately and get tickeded immediately. You Nickel and dime for every penny that I can only use miles for an upgrade provided no one else with cash comes first.   That’s cheap.  I will no longer look to accumulate miles with you guys since new money comes before miles that I got from spending money in the past....  terrible way to do business.

After picking up my suitcase from the baggage claim in LaGaurdia, I noticed the front of my brand new suitcase was now covered in a black dirt due to  mishandling in the airport. It was now 12:30AM, and after a long day of traveling this is not something i wanted to deal with at that time. I went to the United Baggage Claim desk to ask about this and the woman gave a snarky response saying "I shouldn't buy light colored bags and this is to be expected because where they put the bags isn't clean and mine isn't the only suitcase going in the plane." My bag is a grey color and its not that light colored. This woman was unsympathetic and unwilling to help my concern in any way. She immediately dismissed me with an attitude. I did not appreciate her attitude and know this is not the standard of an employee United wants working for them. I'm not expecting anything out of this but it was very upsetting to me to be treated that way when I was already feeling discouraged about my bag. Perhaps this employee needs additional training in customer service. Thank you.
The plane landing was extremely rough and scary!!!
You lost my bag on a direct flight. I had to go to work meetings two days without my clean clothes. I never got an apology. I will never fly United again.
Really disappointed. Didn't feel valued as a business class customer. Everything felt rushed, don't care attitude.

all was great...that was within your control.  Crying babies are sometimes an issue and can really disrupt sleep required to ensure a clear head and energy required for business trips.   Not sure how you would handle this, but very annoying when crying baby is nearby.

Seats are still too small, even in economy plus.  Guy next to me was stealing the arm rest the whole time and poking me.  He got tired of me pushing back when he tried to push me away where he accused me of going over, in which I had to show him my using my other hand that it was in fact him who was being excessively greedy in regards to the space.  Really, we should both have been given all of the space we needed, but the space contention makes every flight with you very uncomfortable.  It's doubly so when you leave customers literally rubbing against each other, which causes social conflict among the passengers.

I travel at least 4 times a year to Delhi and more than 10 domestic flights in US. It was my first experience with United and a very bad one. I used to fly Emirates, Etihad and Delta previously and wanted to try United, but it has left me with a very bad experience. All the other flights provide food thrice on 11 he journey, you provided twice in 15hr journey. It's a shame that some of passengers felt that they should have got food for flight from their home.

my bag was lost, and what upset me nmore than losing the bag was the follow up from the airline. the bag landed in vegas at 10;45 pm, they told me it was going to be delivered to my hotel room by 1anm, so i stayed up for it, then they told me it wont be there till the morning.

The quality and comfort of seat is horrible. My back hurts every single time I take the flight.  Also, the quality and quantity of vegetarian food is worse than anything I have ever tasted anywhere including 'cheap fast food'

five out of our last five flights from MLI to ORD have been delayed or cancelled due to crew, equipment, or some other excuse. This flight was 2 1/2 hours late due to no crew. This was a 5:15 am flight. Missed our connection to Miami and ended up going to Huston first. VERY long day.

The customer service at Check-In was horrific!!!!  There were two ladies working the kiosk area and both were mean and harsh with customers.  This is exactly why I avoid flying United when possible.  I stopped one of them (Wish I had remembered to get her name.) and asked her if I could check in there at terminal C even though my flight was departing from terminal E.  As I was asking her the question I was showing her my gate # on my mobile boarding pass.  I swear before God that her response to my question was and I quote “You are not authorized a carry on on your flight!”  Her response stunned me for three reasons.  First of all I didn’t ask her anything about my baggage.  Second she didn’t answer my question and third she had attitude as if I had pissed her off.  My response to her was, that’s not what I asked you about.  I then had to repeat the question because she was not listening with the intent to actually hear.  After I finished printing my luggage tag and while waiting to drop my bags off, I witnessed the other agent working that area being rude and nasty to a couple also checking.  They were several stations down from my location but I could clearly hear the agent in a nasty voice and tone tell them that they have too many bags, they couldn’t carry them on the plane.  The agent was counting and identifying each bag and what it was.  She was speaking so loudly to them that everyone in the area could hear them.  I couldn’t clearly understand or hear what the couple was saying but I could tell they were speaking with a heavy accent.  The United agent should have been speaking in a softer and calmer manner.  No one else should have heard what she was saying especially not others at the other end of the area.  These incidents happened between 3:30 am and 3:45 am in the 12th of January.  There was a long line of people waiting for the security gate to open at 4 am.  Again, horrific customer service.

Our flight was delayed by 2.5 hours due to what was said to me mechanical issues. Further instructions encouraged us to be through TSA and at the gate at the regularly  scheduled time in case that delay was shortened. Well, we learned that the crew had to have a 10 hour down time before they could board the plane. Obviously with this rule there is no way we could have boarded early. It was a waste of 2.5 hours and I feel it should have been conveyed up front that the departure was in fact leaving 2.5 hours late and that there was no way of leaving before that.

This check-in experience at the airport was probably the worst I've ever encountered!  They were very busy but as a premier member I still waited over 15 min while the agents were helping non premier.  When I finally got to a kiosk I then waited another 5 min for a very rude worker to take my bags.  I get busy and early but this was a little ridiculous!  Didn't feel special being a frequent United passenger at all!

Baggage space is a constant issue.  I pack a travel size bag and by the time I board there is NO room.  I have to gate check every time.  This flight there was not even enough space for my knapsack because I had my preferred aisle seat and the seat in front of me has some design contraption which blocks the under seat area.  So frustrating!

My flight was supposed to be from Houston to Pittsburgh direct on Thursday, January 11 at 7:40pm.  That flight got delayed over 5 times with times and changes gates 3 or 4 times.  The delay got pushed back until 11:40pm which is what was put on the screen.  Not one flight attendant or pilot arrived until midnight and when they arrived they had said they already flew 8 hours and did not have any hours remaining to fly so the flight was cancelled.   That was terrible and left everyone confused and panicked.  They then sent everyone to the customer service counter, not to mention which is far away from that gate all at one time.  The line was tremendously long and everyone was trying to get out of Houston on the next available flight, whether it was a connecting flight or not to Pittsburgh.  I was at the customer service desk for roughly 1.5 -2 hours going back and forth with the lady at the desk to get me out of Houston and on a flight to or around the Pittsburgh area.  I finally got a connecting flight which took me to Newark at 6am and later to Pittsburgh.  I had to sleep in the airport on the floor And was told they would not do anything for me since the cancellation was weather related.  Keep in mind no pilots showed up until midnight and they had no hours to fly!   I did not end up getting home until Friday night and United Airlines is not an airline I am going to recommend to other people.  Terrible experience overall.  Thank you for your time and consideration.  Have a great day.   Regards,  Evan Seiavitch

The flight attendants who were working the back of the aircraft were rude and unprofessional. Particularly one named Lauren. I was sitting at the back of the plane in an aisle seat. The overhead bin space was very limited back there, but I got some space above my seat kna bin that had a metal shelf blocking part of the space. I was able to fit my luggage and my small backpack and overcoat in the bin, as the aisle doesn't have room under the seat due to the electrical wiring. Around when boarding group 4 came on, a group of men complained that there was no space for their luggage (almost all of the bins were obviously full at this point). And they pointed to my stuff and made crass remarks. Without bothering to ask whose things they were, Lauren explained "well obviously that has to be changed", climbed up on the seat arm rests (didn't say excuse me and she was wearing a skirt) and actually grabbed my stuff and threw it to the the side in the bin. Never mind my bag had my corporate laptop and sensitive things that could have been damaged by the metal shelf. I said to her "ma'am, excuse me but their bags won't fit. There's a metal shelf there blocking most of tbe bin which is why I put my stuff there". She turns around, sneers at me and says "yah. I fly this plane a lot more than you do" and continues to shove my personal effects. Only to turn around , look at their luggage, and realize IT DOeSNT fit". So she walks on the arm rests to the next row of bins and starts shoving other people's stuff. Only to find that their bags aren't going to fit there either. So she ended up having to hate check and wasted a lot of time. Not only that but she left my stuff strewn in the bin and didn't even have the grace to put it back.  To make it worse, any time I tried to ask for something she treated me with extreme attitude. Until she came to make me pay for my cheese box and saw my Global Services card. Then her attitude changed somewhat. But honestly she shouldn't be treating anyone that way, let alone a global services member who flies enough to know how many bags fit In the bins....  she spent more time standing in tbe back talking about what clubs she was going to when she got home.   She was probably one of the worst people wearing a United uniform I've had the misfortune of encountering and I sincerely hope I never have to fly with her again.
Communication at the gate was very poor. I was not pleased about yet another United delay, and even less so when information was not imparted timely.
Poor information and notification regarding delays.  Could not open the door at jetway causing me to miss my train and subsequent appointments

The flight was delayed for two hours so I missed my connection. Then when we finally boarded the plane we were delayed again as employees were fighting with each other. The flight attendant and gate worker started fighting and yelling “Don’t fucking touch me!” “I will fucking knock you out!” on the plane and everyone could hear them yelling. I’ve honestly never seen employees behave like that. Then when we finally landed,the terminal door did not work and we were stuck waiting for them to fix it.   Very poor form, especially by the employees.
Bad news was snow flurries at ORD having flew from Hawaii😬

The direct tv ideas is awful. It’s rwally frustrating that even when I pay for a regular economy fare (not basic economy) I still had to have my bag checked to my final destination because I don’t want to pay chase $95 per year to have the united credit card that I don’t need. There was no other way I would have been able to bring my bag on board.

My plane sat on the runway for 30 minutes, and I nearly missed my connection because of it. THEN, the baggage handlers couldn't be bothered to get my bag to the connection, so I had to go without my luggage for the first day, and since I had to get the shitty ticket, I didn't have any carry on luggage to pull from to supplement it. Also, why do airlines in general never lose luggage on the return trip, it's always going in that you lose it. What the hell!?

I was very dissatisfied with the baggage experience. As  I was about to board it was announced that there was no more  carry on allowed & I needed to check my carry on bag at the gate. When I got on the plane there was plenty of overhead storage available however.  My bag was checked in new, clean condition & came out in Newark very scuffed and dirty. Also, the plane seats are not comfortable. The headrest pushes my head forward giving me a head and neck ache.
50 seat regional jets are getting old and tired, seats are uncomfortable and cramped

I did not have TSA approval on my boarding pass and I have TSA clearence so I had to be redirected at security. Not sure why this happened. My assisstant did the booking so it might have been error on her part. Regardless, it was a disappointment.

Our flight attendant was rather bossy and not very friendly to anyone. She told my husband he couldn’t sit in his seat and made him sit in the back of the plane. We were traveling with our 4 children and it would have been beneficial to have remained seated together in our assigned seats. She also walked by and slammed down the window shades at my seat and another one of my children’s seats. No explanation, no warning, just reached across us and slammed it down.
On time and no problems

My flight from Las Vegas to Denver was delayed. As a result, I’d be missing my flight from Denver to Chicago. I was booked on the next morning’s flight from Las Vegas to Chicago. However, I was told that there would be no hotel or transportation vouchers. I was on my own at the Las Vegas airport trying to figure out where to stay during CES.

The flight was delayed in SAT. There was a delay on the runway. The disembarking was delayed by a loss of power in the jetway. In EWR, the escalators were not working.  In addition, I was charged for two snack packs which I neither ordered, nor received. Not my beat trip!!!

You guys really need to enforce the carry on rules and size specifics. It is ridiculous that folks bring on 2 oversized bags as carryons and also a purse or briefcase and take all the overhead space for others and nobody says anything. The folks sitting in the toilet section are already inconvenienced enough, but then you add insult to injury with this nonsense. Also, you should board the plane from the back like some other airlines do. It just makes some much more sense and is more timely. Those in the front seats need to get over their own pretentiousness for common sense.
It took me 2 days , 1500 lost in hotels and transportation . Cut vacation short .
the flight was delayed about an hour then when we got to the gate the thing was broke because of a fire so we where all standing waiting for the gate to open for about 20 min before they got it fixed
Confused about message received about flight delays.  Person I spoke with also confused.  Message caused crowding on flight
No food or snacks were available...quite surprising and disappointing.
TSA in MSP SUCKED.  eliminate overhead storage and load the plane from back to front.
No club in Terminal C sucks.  It is a long haul from B to c29

My wide and I (also Global Services) were traveling together on paid tickets .When I checked us in apparently we were put on separate itineraries for upgrade purposes. I did not realize this until I was upgraded and she was not. In fact, I was not even aware I was upgraded until the passenger that received my seat (7B) came to me and said I was in his seat. I checked with a flight attendant to see what had occurred and she ultimately check her mobile device and found me seated in 1F instead of 7B. I reluctantly moved rather than cause any delay. I wanted to sit with my wife but was unable to. I never did receive a new boarding pass showing the new seat - which I found odd.

The only issue I had was when the gate changed and there was no notification. No announcement the app didn’t notify me and there was no message at the old gate either. I had to run all the way to another terminal and gate within 10 tens. And O’Hare is not that small.
Not recommended UNITED

Can't United provide a nice sandwich for a red eye from Phoenix? The basket was file w/very salty snacks and bananas. Even if you had those waffle cone snack which you provide on your morning flights would be a nice treat on the red eye. Just too much salty snacks !!!
Terrible flight attendant service in first class. I basically had to hang my own jacket and the lead attendant was extremely rude.

The United associate in Newark at the bag check counter was condescending when I stepped up to the counter. I paid to check my luggage and printed the receipt and tag that goes on the luggage. When I went to the counter, she did not even greet me but immediately asked me to affix the tag to me he luggage. Very unprofessional

There was clearly an equipment change, which was part of the original delay, but it added insult to injury that the new plane was subsequently delayed leaving Grand Rapids, then the gate area was too crowded and ex termly difficult to move through

My flight on Thursday the 11th was delayed and that is certainly no ones fault as the weather was causing some issues.  However, the 8:55 flight was basically cancelled though we were just told it was delayed until 10:00 until the next morning.  To me their was no reason given.    However, the real story was their was no crew to fly.  I don't believe that is a true statement.  I was talking to the crew for the Louisville flight while standing in line as we all were waiting for the plane to come in from St. Louis.  When the flight arrived the crew got in to go to Louisville.  However, then things changed.  Someone made the decision to move that crew to the Montreal flight that was also delayed because the original crew ran out of hours.    I am sure that is a financial business decision (and I understand business decisions), however nothing was said except our flight was now delayed to the next morning.  The crew was switched.  Again, I understand but to receive no compensation for a plane/crew change while everyone was in line is not good customer service.  As a Platinum member I find that inexcusable, that at midnite I had to travel to a hotel.  It was perceived (though probably true) that the Montreal passengers were a more lucrative route.  The next morning I got on the 7:45 flight instead of waiting for my "delayed" 10:00 am flight.

This was the worst flight I have ever been on in my entire life.  We missed the runway.  The two he captain was basically silent after that.  It was very very scary.  During times like that you want your captain to be talking to you, not go silent and let you expect the worst.
Not at this point I’m still very mad
3 or 4 passengers were upgraded to first class, but they didn’t offer the large man in the middle seat next to me to move into a more spacious seat, making it uncomfortable for me.

The gate area seemed extremely confusing. With such a large plane (777) the gate area seemed set up for a much smaller plane. The numbered lines were too small and made for lots of confusion for everyone at the gate.

I thought it was RIDICULOUS that the gate people were MAKING someone switch their flight plans because THEY had overbooked the flight. Obviously the passengers had chosen that time for a reason and should not have to adjust their plans for United's problem. They WOULD NOT start the boarding process until someone gave up their seat. I just shook my head in disgust. I will not be traveling with United again. I make my travel plans with the intent of getting to my destination with the shortest amount of time for a reasonable price. Both notions were not supported with my choice to fly with United.

The gate experience was the worst. As our flight was originally delayed the gate attendant came over the loud speaker initially and let us know the plane wouldn't start and since the plane wouldn't start we wouldn't be able to leave until the engines were running. We received 0 (ZERO) additional updates, even as the flight continued to be delayed. The attendant made the comment several times that we knew more than her because the pilots would come inside and fill some passengers in but wouldn't talk to her (according to her). The flight next to ours was delayed for the same reason BUT their attendant was constantly updating the passengers on the status. I understand that there wasn't much the attendant could do about the plane, but communication is a choice...and United did a terrible job of keeping it's passengers updated.
for an 11-hour flight, the food in F was downright parsimonious. I got off the plane STARVING.

I understand there were weather-related delays but it is extremely frustrating to board a plane only to be told that you’ll be waiting inside the plane for another hour.  Just let people wait in the waiting area near the gate.

The airline does not have an order to decide when to leave luggage, there where a mecial tool in my bag, the only one register and you decide to send my bag next day. And there was not communication with the client for aggreement at the moment of checking. You does not have control about the amount of luggage you already accept and the space available. That was a very bad experience. And worst the service in the airport receiving the complaint. I spent one hour there to document a complaint. My first experience with luggage delay.
Your flight attendants are rude and seem disinterested in passengers. None of them smile.
Flight was MISERABLY HOT. Every single person around us was complaining how hot it was. Shirt was soaked in sweat...
Delayed baggage experience was horrible.
Food offering was very poor. Kale omelette is not a good offering and the fruit was not ripe and hard.

The Flight attendents, in first class, disappeared for the entire flight.  Everytime I wanted a beverage (coffee or Coke), I had to call for the attendant.  They NEVER came to our seats and asked if we wanted anything more, except for clearing the dishes at the end of a meal.  Lazy.
Flight attendants were noisy talking in the back. A bit not friendly.

Stop swapping planes at last minute when you have limited resources (GoJet) for backup. I understand the need for a swap, but that appears to a common occurrence. This swap was intended to only be a 1 hour delay which actually led to a 3 hour delay (even thought it says we left the gate at about 2 hour delay). We still stayed at the gate for a good 50 minutes waiting for a maintenance log book that took 45-50 mins for them to drive over from the maintenance area. While it didn't personally affect me other than being late, lots of passengers were complaining that they couldn't ski for their half day they paid for now as we were getting in to late. If you're going to swap make sure it works, but flying to a ski destination should at least consider folks who only vacation every now and then that paid a lot for their flight and just lost out on a 1/2 day skiing. I wasn't going to ski that day so really just the situation bothered me, but felt bad for others.

Seating area was dirty.  Chocolate all over the window shade and on the wall, seat belt and seating area.  Had to clean everything with Clorox wipes after getting settled in.  Seats are terribly uncomfortable.  I complain about this all the time but I know things will never change.  I am really angry at for former CEO for making all the space changes.
Air traffic control delay Dca. But time to leave delayed 41/2 hrs and sat on plane for another hour
Bad food choices and I was a full paying customer of F
I was sad that it kept getting delayed

More than an hour and 1/2 delay and I believe the pilot gave us two updates on status..........I suggested the flight attendant go to the cockpit and ask the pilot to provide an additional update at the 90 minute mark...........after making the request the pilot gave a third update.  While waiting this entire time the temperature inside the fuselage was in the 80's if not higher, despite the outside temperature being in the 50's. No explanation other than "it will be cooler soon".......never happened.
Stop flying fucking 40 year old jets and maybe you won't have maintenance delays that cause missed connections. Fuck you.
never fly through Newark, avoid it if you can. The disaster airport
Movie selection was poor. This is the third flight in a row with poor movie selection.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Smooth ride, no complaints.

It was delayed. Due to incoming aircraft but the captain did a good job of catching us up. It is now a really small aircraft - little in the way of luggage space. No lounge at Albany. This is really now one of my least favorite flights - very bad value for money

I thought it was stupid to announce people have connecting flights and to let them pass first. They should announce the rows and let them get out before the stupid self centered slow pokes get in the way. Help those that are going to be extra stressed out.  Travel has become so awful and there is no pleasure in it.  The Newark airport has the worst most unfriendly people.  The ONLY friendly man was the guy who helped with my luggage.  The TSA, the food service people were all a bunch of miserable job hating people.

We were denied a boarding pass because your agent incorrectly told us we had the incorrect visa information. We lost a day of our vacation and were able to fly out the next day. Totally incompetent!!!
you can't possibly fit any more seats into an aircraft. No wonder there is so many new insidences of unruly passengers.
The staff at the podium was very confusing with numerous episodes of misinformation
Very much delayed and no information about delay crew wasn’t very nice and my seat was not reclining

Change flight cost $800!  But then booked flight hours late. Empty seats with plenty of room not available while crammed in little seats with no recline function. Very uncomfortable flight to Chicago.

The flight attendant was very nice to me but I noticed she was very rude and rolling her eyes at another passenger a mother with two children. I'm not sure why but you could tell she was agitated! It showed in he facial expressions
The aircraft seating is very uncomfortable.  Personal TV system is old and difficult to use.
The delay on the runway in Toronto was annoyingly long and felt like there really was not any good reason for the delay.
I'll never fly your airline again guess when my aunt said she stopped in 2005 i should of listen to her
No food choice in first. No movie. Pam gave us a voucher.
I wasn't upgraded to first class going, which was very disappointing.

One tech problem.  The seats are very close, and the seat backs have a screen putting out drivel; this screen is activated by touch.  As I dozed, my head would plop onto the screen I had turned off and this would turn the screen on with all kinds of lights from the screen disturbing my sleep.  Overall, not a big deal.  Nobody expects to fly too comfortably these days.
The Airbus plane is noisy and one side of the plane had no power nor entertainment. Time to use more Boeing aircraft.

Everything at EWR is awful, especially for incoming international people doing a transfer.   Bags took 30 min to appear on the belt - then a long drag to the re-checkin area, with snarky staff.   After that - TRY to find the queue for TSA.   It was unmarked randomness, a holding queue downstairs with no signage.   Or worse, random incorrect signs.    Finally get through TSA (that went smoothly) and into C-terminal, C for Calcutta.     Too crowded to move,  about 85º,  and endless golf carts screaming at you.    And no United Lounge anywhere near my gate.   Total horror experience, especially after a long jetlagged flight.    Don't just blame this on the Port Authority - this is on you.    I will be avoiding EWR, which for me means taking Delta or Lufthansa to Europe from Seattle.
Too many carry-on on board within the US is a nagging problem, as there is a cost to check-in.
Getting wet suitcase 45 minutes following arrival at gate is unacceptable! My sweaters that I needed to wear that night was very damp! Awful!
The cabin itself was outraged and needs renovation. No outlets and dated seats and screens.
Time at both gates was horrible.  Baggage claim was terrible.

You have made the seats way too small, in every dimension, and the restrooms are so small that they are almost unusable. I have noticed that hardly anyone gets up to use the restroom anymore, probably because they can't fit in the restroom. Your urge to squeeze in as many seats as possible has made flying extremely unpleasant.

Your air travel experience gets worse every year. The charge for on carry on baggage is bogus. I didn't get a seat at check in and almost didn't get on the flight. The food service is ridiculous. The smallest possible snack is given.

No explanation was given for the flight delay.  No staff was at the gate as the revised departure time approached, and the sign at the gate did not display any info.  The latest departure time (per the United app) came and went without any update to the departure time, either in the app or at the gate.  Again, no announcements at the gate.   Delays happen, but the lack of accurate/timely communications is a terrible way to treat customers (including this one, who has been loyal/has 1 million mileage plus miles).

One of the flight attendants was very unfriendly, rude, and high strung. I left my seat in the second to last row of the plane to go to the bathroom behind me while we were taxiing after landing. The seatbelt light was still on, but I was having an emergency and could not wait any longer to get to a bathroom. While I was in there, the male flight attendant knocked, at first intermittently, and then persistently, and went as far as shaking the bathroom door until it came unlocked. When I came out, he shouted at me that I shouldn't be in there and commanded me to get back in and close the door and sit down on the toilet. When he told me I could come out (again, shouting at me) I came out, and while I was standing just one row in front of him he began to shout about me to the other flight attendant in the back of the plane, saying, "What the hell his problem? How could he not know you're not supposed to get up?!" I turned around and told him that I obviously knew I'm not supposed to get up and I wouldn't have done so if it wasn't an emergency. The other passengers around me seemed put off by his behavior and words, and a couple of them expressed their sympathy and disbelief to me. I understand his confusion and frustration that I was out of my seat while the fasten seatbelt light was on, but it was an emergency. I also understand that he may have been concerned for my safety, but it really didn't sound like it judging by the rude, hostile way he spoke to me - not to ask if everything was okay, but to chastise me like a child and shout at me to get back in the bathroom and sit down on the toilet -- and then talking about me behind my back while I was within earshot! I've never had a more negative, unpleasant experience with any flight attendant on any airline.
No..it was just a waste of money even if it was only $79...customers were ignorant
Technology fail with automated boarding gates required gate agents to manually pass passengers (as we used to do it).  Get etch right or don't use it.

Very confused about the check in portion. Went on three different lines couldn’t find any help in kiosk area   Also purchased ticket through Expedia. Not aware of restrictions. Should not be selling the flight as inexpensive as it’s claimed but then when you have no bagged up check in you are still being charged $25 each way for a small carryone.
Warn passengers that the overhead bins are small before they get to the plane so that they know a standard size carry-on luggage will not fit easily.

Keep customer as priority if customer are waiting for repair plane so should the crew instead they disappear and second crew shows up 6 hours later after plane repaired. Is this what you call customer first service. To piss you off gave us $35 even restaurants better atleast when you dont like food they comp you full payment. Just ridiculous on floor staff poor people has no training on such situation. You cancel 2 flights and one delay in single day if I was in charge I would have send a big plane and pick up all three flight plane in one shot but I guess your stubborn process are ridiculous and staff calls the police on customer that is just topped it by threatening not to yell or say anything about 9 hours delay flights.

It is beyond comprehension how you lost our seat reservation when you changed equipment (seat designations were still there on the new plane).  I had to call into the hotline in order to get someone to address this.  My travel agent was stonewalled.  You did put us into Economy Plus without an upcharge, which was a start.  But this shouldn't have happened.  There is also no excuse for the shitty dining experience that is available throughout the EWR Terminal C.  Too expensive and nothing that families or kids want to eat.  Where is my United Club???  I have a membership, but the main branch by my gate was closed for Polaris renovations.  Give me a break.  What is the use of having this membership?  It is also quite pathetic that you still charge for luggage regardless of whether or not the flight was booked using their United Chase card is used or not.  I have the Presidential Plus card.  Neither me nor my secondary card user should EVER have to pay the first 2 checked bags.
Never HAPPY WHEN A FLIGHT IS DELAYED.  THIS ONE WAS LATE 60+ MINUTES.

I purchased my tickets three months ago not realizing what basic economy was. Flew with my wife and my child but could not sit together which is ridiculous considering I bought the tickets so long ago you can’t tell me that there wasn’t three seats next to each other. Try changing my seats but the counter agent was nasty in Fort Lauderdale and called me a liar when I told her that I called do united line and they told me they could change my seat . Then at the gate I asked if I could move my seat and the gate personnel told me that there were no available seats on the plane which was a lie because when I got on the plane that was three seats in row 36 available along with seven all the empty seats on the plane so that’s the second time I was lied to by your company. I would rather fly Spirit no-frills that fly United again

It was a very disappointing flight for my husband and I because it was our anniversary and we weren’t seated together!!!!! While making the reservation I specifically asked if we would be seated together. I used miles and it was NOT a super saver and in my opinion cost a lot of miles and then I had to sit alone. Meal was also very disappointing.

The food at the United club was minimal and really really really (did I say that enough) disappointing.  What happened? only yogurt ad fruit.  No pastries, cereal, veggies, nuts, grains, bagels, nothing BUT yogurt and fruit.  Again, what happened?  Everyoe who waled in and has been to the United club (at EWR) before said something.  There were a few hard boiled eggs and they were gone by 10am.  Someone asked if there were more eggs and was told no.  I use thw oounge a lot and boy was I surprised and disappointed.  Again, WHAT HAPPENED?????

the flight was significantly delayed and little information was provided about the delay.  Once we were finally on the plane the pilot told us our original plane was on time but it was taken for another flight and we were left stuck. Not sure how United decides which flight are more important. But weather at my final destination was a concern which is why I booked a morning flight
Air traffic control screwed us. No excuse for a 3 hr delayed flight to sit on tarmac for 1+ hrs after landing.

2hr delay prior to leaving. Was not notified until I arrived at the airport. Then sat on the plane for almost another 2hrs waiting for a gate to park. Things have gone bad to worse on United. It maybe time to switch carriers.
Food amount and quality of food HK to EWR was very bad.
It was comfortable in Economy Plus, but lack of WiFi service was disappointing.

Plane are old, dirty and not on par with other airlines. Food in business was horrible and the snack selection was some chocolate and only sour cream and onion chips.  It took over an hour to get bags at ewr.

I've just come to expect that the seats and amenities will be below expectations due to all of the cost cutting and seat size reductions over the years.  Business travel is just not that much fun anymore.  Too many people, stressed out people, small, uncomfortable seats, not enough leg/arm room, etc.

Flight attendants were disinterested. C grade service. At immigration they were rude and angry with immigration staff. Very unprofessional.  Food was atrocious / everything tasted like over cooked peppers because it was full of over cooked peppers.

My dissatisfaction stems from the wait on the runway at O'hare. Our aircraft was delayed in Minneapolis. I can live with that, unexpected things happen. What I cannot accept is the wait on the runway when we landed at O'hare. I don't understand how an aircraft can land and there is no plan for a gate. The gate situation needs to be taken care of before we land. I cannot believe the airline industry as a whole cannot solve this issue. There is no reason to sit on a runway when we were already delayed, because you don't have an available gate or a contingency plan in place to get us off the plane.....great work!!
