Bathrooms were filthy 1 and a half hours into the trip. No paper towels, and bin with dirty towels overflowed.  No hot food available by the time they reached row 28. Made us check luggage, but lots of space available when we got to our seat (poor counting) Box lunch,needed a scissor to open the cheese

Not enough seats at gate area.  Kiosk check in area is a chaotic mess.  Airplane had a piece missing under wing.  We told the flight attendant who told the captain.  The captain said he was aware of it and it was not a problem, but not a good thing to see before taking off.

One of the baggage takers at Check-in was extremely rude. I don’t normally check a bag but had accidentally purchased a basic economy package. I didn’t realize you had to check in at the kiosk, then go give my bag at another area and the guy yelled at me saying I wasn’t following the rules. I always seem to have a negative experience at the Newark airport.   The seats themselves were fine and decently comfortable but I had no room to bend down to get my purse (leg room).

Randomly selected to check bag at gate while larger bags allowed on after we were on board.  Late to meeting due to being forced to check bag by rude gate agent.   Suitcase retrieved at claim and contents wet

Poor communication regarding a two hour delay which was announced 5 min before boarding. Excuse was air traffic control at EWR which I don’t believe, flew in and out of EWR so many times and never had any flight delayed that long because of traffic - weather wasn’t the issue at both airports.

To add insult in that flight was 2 hours late and boarding was a nightmare the gate at Newark was broken and passengers had to wait another 20 minutes and the JUMP to the passage way" You should refund $$$ if anyone reads this.

Didn't appreciate the extensive delay on the ground for 2 hours and then sitting in the plan for additional 2 hours before taking off. If we were going to be delayed should've just kept us at the airport not a small aircraft. Flight attendant was very attentive while on boarding passing out water and snacks and handled the delay very well.

I requested accommodations when I booked the flight. The gate officer asked and understood my accommodation request yet did not honor them. I halve an issue with my right shoulder and left knee. I needed assistance lifting my bag into the storage area on the plane. The gate attendant made me pay to check my bag at the gate then required me to carry it to the end of the ramp and leave it there upon boarding. When I arrived at Chicago there was an attendant with a golf cart. He left me and another gentleman who also had difficulty walking at an entrance near baggage claim. I had to walk to carousel 12 to get my. Ag, take an elevator down to the shuttle bus area and walk far, too far, to get to the shuttle I needed. I am very very disappointed and as a person with handicapping conditions this treatment is very close to discrimination. Very dissatisfied and disheartened that United did not honor the accommodations.  I would like a refund for the checked bag. That was disgraceful.
Lose the gogo internet.  $40 for a 5 hour flight is ridiculous.  Plus no option to use miles.
STOP DELAYING FLIGHTS. LGA HAS ONE OF THE WORST RATES OF FLIGHTS LEAVING ON TIME.

In addition to the cramped seat that could not be adjusted more than a few inches, the video screen, about 14 inches in front of my face, spewed garbage continually AND COULD NOT BE TURNED OF!  THIS ALONE IS ENOUGH TO RUIN THE FLIGHT!! PLEASE STOP IT!!! Sincerely, Conrad L. Osborne
Gate was in turmoil due to conflicting information regarding departure delays.
It is inexcusable that on a 12 pm flight in first class there was no meal. If you need to get to airport early you have no time to est
I had to wait nearly an hour to leave the aircraft because there was no power. This delayed my travel plans. Very unprofessional!

The gate area is too small; the terminal is crowded. There is no precheck at the G gates.  A service animal soiled the first class cabin and we had to board last.  Upon arrival in Newark, the terminal had no power at our gate (C133) and we sat there for 45 minutes before we moved to another gate to deplane.
Newark delayed our departure, bad weather

Lunch options to purchase were scarce....we were in the 3rd row of economy plus & they were out of options & said that the ground crew did not restock them adequately. For a 3 1/2 hr flight & a lot of passengers left to serve it is very poor planning and management on United’s part

Delayed bag delivery at Newark again. My bad had a premium tag, but was one of the last bags to be delivered, and took 40 mins to arrive form the time flight got to to the gate. You really need to fix bad delivery delays at Newark, as this is happening every time now.
Over booked flight and people were getting on plane at 12:30, take off time and had 2 people on that didn't have seats, then mechanical problem causing 30 min delay.

When we arrived an hour early to the flight, we were told that our luggage had to be checked in 45 minutes prior to boarding.  That would mean we would have to get to the airport an extra 15 minutes prior.  As a result, we missed could not go on our flight and had to be delayed at the airport until the next flight.  There was no advance notice that the luggage had to be loaded that early or we would have allowed more than an hour advance.  Very frustrating experience outbound as well with very few staff at the airport and extensive delays as a result.
Not only was my seat (34A) extremely cramped, but the seat cushions were sagging and very uncomfortable.

Required to gate check my appropriately sized luggage for no real reason except possibly bad communication among staff. So much space on board. Eventually later boarding passengers able to bring their bags on. Delayed me at destination.

While we understood that there was a fire at the terminal and gates had to be readjusted, the utter incompetence and disinterest of the staff we had contact with was mind blowing. We were shuffled back and forth on the bus in terminal C , despite repeatedly asking if we needed to take the bus in the 1st place. The staff yes’d us to death rather than take the time to find out the accurate information . The general communication was atrocious. We wasted 45 minutes being shuffled around on those buses, half the staff were speaking Spanish in front of us (some cursing) with no regard as to whether or not we understood them. I understood them, and did enjoy being spoken about in another language. We kept asking to speak to whoever was in charge so we could get accurate information, and no one took responsibility. When we finally found someone in charge, he mildly threatened that the terminal could have been shut down and we should just be happy we were able to fly out. It is clear your staff at the terminal is neither prepared or interested in being prepared for any type of emergency. Considering EWR is a major hub, and considering all the NYC area has been through, one would think that your company would have a handle on disaster preparedness, and something like a transformer fire would amount to another day at work. The whole experience just decreases any confidence in your airline, and as a result, encourages me to spend my travel dollars elswhere in the future.
Seats, painfully, too narrow. It took six hours to recover.

The room in the aisle was nonexistent.  People useimg the bathroom lined up and two could not pass each other and had to stand where my feet were in front of my seat.  My head got bumped hair pulled as people grabbed my seat to let others pass.  Ridiculous. Nobody’s should get hurt on a flight.  Start considering the aisle space as important to those who sit on it
It sucked that the flight was to late and till the end it wasn’t clear that the flight is coming or not
Earful ground staff with not motivation to help facilitating the requirements for delayed passengers. Not giving correct information for the process and options for lodging.

The female flight attendant in first close (there was only one) aside from not offering anyone drinks once onboard, not taking jackets and having a rude attitude, later verbally assaulted me! I will preface this by saying I had crutches and knee brace. I informed an Asian woman from coach came to first class for bathroom and as she seemed unable to open the door she started trying to open the pilot cabin. The flight attendant later came right in my face and said “did you get up and stop her!” And if not why? Yelling how I was responsible for everyone on board. She was completely out of line. She was insulting and embarrassing and I am considering my Legal options. She should not have left her post so long and allowed people from coach to use the first class cabin which she did the entire flight not just during cart service. She was rude and aggressive from the moment we got on flight. I want to file a formal complaint against her.
The flight turbulent was very bad throughout the trip
The Newark airport had a fire and the airport was complete chaos. .....

Your gate agents failed to monitor the number of carry one causing me to have to stand in aisle without instructions on what to do with my suitcase which had no overhead space. This failure delayed our flight and was stressful. Further I witnessed the gate agents blaming he flight attendants and acting clueless about the number of bags. I addition I was concerned about my bad being mistagged because I did not witness the tagging to confirm it was my bag.
Fire in the airport and flight delayed

Actually, I hAve a comment about my flight from ABE to ORD on 1.4. The plane was old. The seat pockets were detached from the seats themselves, the cover on the handle of the exit row on front of me was torn from the wall and couldn't be placed back over the cover. Some of the lighting didn't work. It was kind of embarrassing. That plane needs to be retired.
Flight attendants were kind of rude.  I didn't see them smile once.

I understand (but was not happy as I missed visitation on a friends funeral) that the near 8 hour delay was an act of God (weather) but it was frustrating none the less.  I do want to comment that I think that the gate personnel in Chicago did an excellent job in handling the frustrations of the long delayed passengers.

We wasted days due to your failure to deliver our bags in 4 days.  I spent hours on the phone each day tracking down our luggage. Shopping for clothes.  Wehn the bags arrived on 1-08, one bag was broken, all the clothes were wet and all the items frozen and ruined.  I did not take my heart medicine and other treatments for four days, these items when in the checked luggage..  We spent multiple hours each day shopping for cloths which only met a minimum level of fit.     I expect each of our passengers to receive a $1000 voucher for the ruined vacation.   I can be reached at ccortese@hotmail.com or 203-554-3665.   I have a three page write up of this disaster please don't let me share this with the online world.

We were late !! Food was unacceptable  for a 1st class paying customer. Flight attendant service was non existent !! Hard to get a glass of water. Did not give us immigration papers on the flight telling us we didn't need them?? Really??

Flight was delayed awaiting inbound crew.  It is frustrating that the plane is at the gate but the flight crew is not available. United should keep flight crews and aircraft together...the likelihood of a plane or crew not arriving for any given flight is multiplied 2x.
Economy seats are toddler-sized torture racks.
A long delay caused us to wait almost 2 hours inside the aircraft. Cabin got uncomfortably warm, passengers complained.
Very disappointed with my flight wireless/entertainment experience on this flight...
my seat assignment was messed up and then 2 of the flight attendants were extremely rude abt upgrading me to economy plus.  they made me move twice
One hour flight delay and no sign of recognition that this is not acceptable.

Yes, upon landing approx. 10 mins. early, we did not arrive to our gate for nearly an hour after landing.  Pilot stated the plane in our gate was being de-iced hence the delay.  He then stated they were trying to move to a different gate and no luck.  Because of the delayed gate arrival I made the mistake of placing my Ipad in the storage under the armrest and inadvertently left it on board.  I was in seat 3B and reported to your online "lost and found" early Saturday morning.  I have not been contacted that it has been found but there should be no reason why it should not be found by a member of UA and returned to me.  I will be highly disappointed if not found and returned!
The staff onboard did not seem to enjoy their jobs whatsoever. While returning home from a long and demanding work trip, this flight was not a pleasant environment to be a part of.
I hated that we had to wait on the tarmac for our spot at the gate because de-icing is now being done at the gate and not away from the gate.  I barely made it on to my connecting flight.
The seats had the shortest leg room i’ve Ever sat in.  I’m 6’3” and couldn’t fit without completely going on my neighbor’s space.  It was really uncomfortable in 2 ways.
Chaos
One flight attendant in particular was very rude.
4 hours late, no notification that my flight was late until I arrived at check-in counter, little updates at gate area.  Altogether an awful travel experience.

I was extremely disappointed to arrive to Chicago 8 hours later than planned due to my morning flight being cancelled due to air traffic control and the only other option being offered being late in the afternoon. I was late to an event as a result of this delay and was unable to complete my work for the day as a result of being stranded in Eau Claire, WI.

It took one and a half hours in Newark to get through security....fire. That was understandable. When we finally got to our gate. The gate attendant told me the door was closing in two minutes. I had to call my wife and her and my son had to literally run to the gate. We did not have a chance to get water or anything else. We had seats in the rear of the cabin and did not get even a glass of water for over an hour. In the meantime the plane was still boarding for another twenty minutes. The gate attendant was sarcastic and rude. We all had been on line for well over an hour and that just wasn’t the time for her to be so rude.

The flight attendant serving food and snacks was extremely rude and I have never been treated in such a manor by a flight attendant. I was upset because the plane was not properly stocked with lunch items and the selection was very minimal. The attendant did not care and said just pick something. Super upset about how I was treated. I have food allergies so it was not easy and I felt rushed to make a choice or I was not getting anything to eat at all.
The lack of IFE and new thin-back seats are really terrible. Even in Econ Plus. The seat pitch is so bad on the new cabins that it makes me want to fly less.

We had boarded the flight before being informed of a ground stop. I would have preferred to have known about this prior to boarding to see if any additional options were available for travel to the final destination instead of the risk to missing the connection.
Air train in Newark airport not working correctly and causing serious confusion and delay for  travellers.
The EWR attendants were mean and nasty! They purposely threw my bag upside down because my asked if i put the the label on correctly!

delayed because of oxygen tank refill at first ? why coudln't this be evaluated before on plane? then when on plane no free drink --- i paid 100 to get economy plus and there is huge chunk of plastic (covering something) I can't even get my laptop back in next to it.....  Had to ask people with 2 bags in overhead to remove one for my bag....again i am tall, and its horrible to fly for seat comfort even when paying upgrade....my premier status was removed even thought it said 4 of 4 completed....and finally the person in front of me had there seat back (economy plus go further back(dumb idea!)) all during takeoff until landing....flying is always and awful experience for anyone over 6ft 3in tall and HATE when they take carry on luggage without orgainzing or looking for space ......
No fault of United Airlines, but the plane left 2 hours late. Sitting in the seats with little leg room for an extra two hours was extremely uncomfortable.

We were lied to about the cause of the 2-hour delay. When we arrived in EWR we were informed that there had been a partial evacuation of Terminal C. Therefore we could not have been on time.  The given excuse was that your ground crew had not done their jobs, and a tank needed filling.  Are your crews that bad? It was implausible.

Newark needs LOTS of improvement. I was in line for security for over an hour and a half. The line wrapped around from one end to the other. Not only that, not only that but security personnel is very rude. There are a few who are pleasant, but the majority are just rude and unpleasant making the experience that much worse.
I had to wait 2 more hours wasting my time and missing my meeting in DC. But you didnot give any conpensation.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: It sucks that one company has a monopoly of all the food in Terminal C at Newark. It also sucks that there was a fire and the line was massive for security. There was no announcement made, no updates given, nothing.
Airport delay was horrible. Almost missed my flight. Just made it in time. Stressful as I had my two cats already onboard not knowing if I could join them or not. Otherwise excellent flight.

Fire and power outage at Newark caused mayhem and delays in the preboarding and checking in process.  This may not have been United fault, but the situation caused over an hour delay and lines the entire terminal long and squads of police had to be called to control the situation.  There was no communication from anyone.  We were treated like cattle.
What a caos at airpot and very little information. All united people were stressed and I think not knowing what to do. Bad management of a crisis
Specific to Hartsfield, the gate area and terminal were boiling hot and the gate was ill designed for capacity flights. We were literally packed next to one another. It was misery.

The fact that we had to de-board after getting on the plane and pushing away seemed ridiculous. We were told that our plane's air conditioner pack was needed for another, longer flight. Why hadn't United planned for this in the first place and selected a more suitable plane instead of making us change planes so late in the game?

Gate changed 30 min before boarding from B21 to E10 and gate agent did not announce change. Raced across entire O’Hare.  Was told earlier I could not catch earlier flight because my bag was checked for later flight.  Wasted 2 extra hours in airport. Arrived in GRR to not have my bag on carousel. Went to ticket counter to file a missing bag report. My bag was placed on the exact same earlier flight.  WTH?!? So much for me having to stay with my bag. LIARS! Then, to add insult to injury, 3 hours AFTER a arrived home I received a text alerting me to my bag being placed on an earlier flight.  Incompetent.  Untrustworthy. Rude.  I absolutely despise United and YOU have given me excellent reasons to feel this way.

It was delayed as a result of  a morning issue of a mechanical problem with an aircraft.  A substitute aircraft was brought in from Iowa.  Thus, the airline expected delays  throughput the day but neglected to inform us passengers.  That is irresponsible and unprofessional.  Please send me a travel credit for both my son and I.
The delay was only made bad because of a lack of seating and ability to charge devices ... why doesn’t united have those charging stations at FLL?

There were several issues. First, a very large man was sitting in 7E, I was in 7D. The man could not completely sit in the seat as he actually sat partially atop the arm rests and his bottom never was able to touch the seat. Prior to departure I offered to take the next flight and was told to sit down (rudely) and this was the last flight to Chicago for which we were delayed (like I didn’t know). Please note I was myself I need of wheel chair assistance that I declined upon arrival as I needed to slowly walk due to cramping from the trip. I however was told that there were several open seats in the back of the plane if I wanted to switch after take off. I said thank you. Later in the flight I quietly (away) from my seat inquired about procedures in this situation asking why they didn’t offer him the open seat (with a second open seat next to the one they offered and a retractable armrest) near the back of the plane, I was told it is against the law. By the way partially through flight I decided to move but other passengers had switched seats and that seat was no longer available. Not a comfortable flight. The second issue was that I left my vest in the overhead bin. I noticed that I forgot it after I walked through security. I immediately went to the office near baggage claim, they called the gate, the gate confirmed the had it. I was given a gate pass to go back. The security line was close to 35 minutes long (TSA precheck does not apply for gate passes) I decided to go to UA Pemier checkin. A supervisor called on her radio trying to get a gate attendant, after 20 min of no response she told me to wait where we were and she went to the gate. When she returned no vedt was found and the plane had departed to Mexico. Long story short. Bad day for me. My United mileage plus number is. UBF 66016

Seats are very cramped. You cannot enjoy the purchased snack (tapas box) without feeling as though I was "elbowing" my fellow passengers. Also, luckily, my carry-on with fragile items made it on board. On a previous flight, I had to hurry to check my carry-on and the screen of my laptop was broken as a result. : ( I was told by a fellow passenger that the shortage of space is due to some passengers putting the personal item that should go beneath the seat in the overhead compartment instead. Is there a way to keep people from putting two things in the overhead?
Every must have the same complaints.  After arrived at newark after 2 hours delay, we were stuck in the airplane for 40 min due to malfunction of gate bridge.
Flight attendants halted beverage service due to turbulence despite encountering very little on our flight. The organization at the gate was very poor as there was no separation between groups

our flight from Chicago to Newark was continuously delayed so that we missed our connection to Delhi by 5 minutes. We were told that they notified the gate to hold the flight for us and others on the flight but when we arrived the doors were shut. The rebooking was for 24 hours later so we missed an entire day of 6 vacation days. The person at the customer service desk was very surly and the rebooking process very confusing with some agents telling us there were no more seats on that flight when the system had. Already rebooked us. it was unacceptable to be told we could make the connection and then have the departure doors close a few minutes before we arrived at the gate. I am very unhappy with United as I planned this vacation 6 months ago. I know that weather delays are beyond control but to close the doors when we are racing toward the gate is outrageous. can 2 minutes make a difference on A 14 hour flight? I will hesitate to fly United in future even though I have taken numerous overseas flights.

The only thing I was disappointed with was the luggage valet. When they brought up my bag to the breezway it was soaking wet with some sticky, almost oily substance. The handle was slimy and gross and the entire from of my bag was soaked and bled through to my jacket inside the bag. I have taken pictures if you would like me to send them to you. None of the other bags looked that bad. It wasn't raining or snowing so I can't imagine what it could have been.

My primary dissatisfaction was lack of candor when our original equipment was understood to be completely unavailable. We were strung along with delay after delay when I suspect someone knew but did not inform us. The gate agent probably did not know either. Ignorance did not help us tolerate the delay.

Flight attendant did not recognize me as a Preimeir 1K.  I was not offered a free drink or snack box, which I was hungry for due to my late arrival at the airport and lack of time to eat prior.   Also the flight attendant blew her nose and didn’t wash her hands. Unacceptable, especially during flu season.

I was very surprised there was a miscalculation in the amount of fuel we took on board. We had taken on too much and so we had to burn it off, which is bad for United's profitability on the flight, but also bad for the environment. Did the ground crew simply add too much fuel? Or was there a miscalculation in the math? I realize weather was a factor, but the weather did not change unpredictably and so the fuel calculation should have taken that into consideration.

It was total chaos trying to board our flight they were boarding three planes at once. They did not have our correct gate posted throughout the airport and so we didn’t know for sure which gate to even go out of.

After pushback, but prior to departure, plane sat at O'hare with engines revving for at least 15 minutes in an attempt to burn off fuel.  I assume someone mistakenly added too much fuel.  Such a waste of resources and time.

The flight left 45 minutes late which was due to a delayed inbound aircraft.  I understand that happening.  However, no "push notifications" of this delay occurred resulting in much wasted time at the airport.   The baggage claim on the Chicago arrival, however, was the biggest issue.  It took over 30 minutes to get bags.  I have had faster service from full 777 flights whereas this plane had around 20 passengers.

We would be satisfied with a voucher for our experience- we paid for headphones in the airport anticipating we would need them for the plane and worry we wasted our money on an expectation that wasn’t met.
Unacceptable delay!

The seats were old and very uncomfortable. There was little cushioning, no lower back support, and the headrest was designed for a much shorter person (I’m 6’3”) and could not get above my shoulders. My bag was also placed on the wrong flight. Overall a very disappointing travel experience that makes me less likely to fly with United.

The Flight to Newark was OK, it was the flight from Newark on the 8th of January that was very disappointing.  Considering the fact that it was not until we were 30 minuets out from landing at Santa Ana that we were told we were now being diverted to LAX. When we landed we were told that we had to wait on the aircraft because United had no idea how they were going to get 300 passengers from LAX to Santa Ana.  When they finally allowed us to depart we were informed at the gate that there would be buses to take us to Santa Ana with no indication as to were in the arrival area the buses were going to be and not indication as to where our luggage would be at the baggage claim.  Also once the luggage was delivered there was no United Airline Customer Service Representative at the baggage claim to direct us to the are were the busses would arrive. Nor did we even know the bus company that would be transporting us to Santa Ana.  All in all is was a bad experience with by the way cost me $300.00+ dollars to rent a car from the Hertz Rental Car at LAX that was then dropped off at Santa Ana.  An extra fee tacked on to my rental because it was begin dropped off at another airport.  Really, very bad customer service for a airline that touts themselves as Customer service airlines.  I am a frequent flyer member from the Continental Airline days and truthfully your takeover of Continental does not speak compliments as to your Frequent Flyer Program.  Continental had a more customer centric program.  YOU DO NOT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I could have taken an earlier flight that your check in person did't bother to tell me about after I asked.  Newark baggage is the lamest of any airport  Fire then all.
It's extremely disappointed to know that part of your business is subsidized with my taxes and yet is terrible.

The staff at the gate were not engaged with your customers. We were an inconvenience to them. The weather had delays which could not be helped but the attitude of your team was they would rather be somewhere else. The updates were not frequent, the screen with our flight went from Cleveland to Montreal. But the gate was still for Cleveland. Everyone was confused. The staff was annoyed by questions about the gate. On a night with many delays the last thing the staff needs are surly staff.
United's inability to handle the power outage at Newark made the experience more miserable than it already was.

The delay should have been alerted to passengers before they arrived at airport ! Weather in ny was simply rainy. Baggage claim after a 4 hour delay , took another hour because belt continued to stop and no one from United was attending in baggage claim so passengers had to go find united employees representatives to deal with situation. Very frustrating when you arrive 4 hours late !

If you don’t provide a place to charge a phone or tablet on your planes, you should let your customers know ahead of time. Then, they could bring an additional battery pack to make up for it. Are you embarrassed being so cheap that you won’t even tell your premier members about your lack of service??
Lots of confusion after checking in bags. Large crowds and staff members unsure how to handle confusion. Couldn't tell us where lines began or ended

Newark Liberty International Airport is by far the worst not only in the United States, but possibly the world.  There were power outages, fire alarms and thousands of passengers left to their own to figure out what was occurring.  There is an apparent lack of preparation for these occurrences by United at this location (EWR).  Your companies performance and communications with passengers at EWR on 1/12/2018 bordered on criminal negligence and should be investigated by the FAA.

The gate area was tight and congested. Needed more outlets I am an excepting of all but the attendant flamboyance made me uncomfortable  The awkwardness of the de icing workers put me on edge the rest of the flight-the turbulence didn’t help. We dropped altitude like a dissent to land which made me wonder if we were landing in another city. Unusual flight!!

The gate agent in Chicago was horrible. His name is Carlisle. He was rude to the flight attendant and the passengers. He told the flight attendant he did not care about the “specials” on the plane and that customers may miss their connections. He asked the customers why they were running up the jetway. It was quite clear they may miss their connection because we landed at 6:18 pmand did not deplane until 7:15pm
there was a delay for no reason.
weather delay -- obviously no one's fault

I specifically asked the United counter staff (step 2 baggage drop off) if I should leave my luggage open and they said "I don't have time for that, leave it as is" and my lock was cut off ! This could have been avoided by a simple "yes unlock it". Very disappointing.

Dirty plane with crumbs and debris in my seat as I entered. Very poor on-time performance creating stress about connections. Basically predatory pricing with no flexibility for a refund until it’s too late and the flight is delayed several hours. By then I cannot make alternative arrangements. Hostile treatment of paying customers as far as I’m concerned. Always demanding more money for every little thing and then no consequences for the airline when flights are delayed/cancelled. All passengers get are excuses why the delays and cancellations are not United’s fault. If I’m late due to a traffic accident blocking the highway, I’m never allowed to use that excuse. United just says “too bad” and pay us more money. Very one-sided treatment of customers.
Severe delays, poor communication to passengers.

Being told that the flight is delayed because you did not have a flight crew is unacceptable. And then landing in Chicago and not having a gate for almost two hours, which made me miss my connecting flight is ridiculous.

Our flight was delayed 3 hours due to maintenance on the aircraft (as we were told). I understand things like this happen, but the way in which United handled the situation was entirely unprofessional.  Boarding began on time at around 4:30pm. Groups 1 and 2 boarded. Then we stopped for about 45 minutes with no clear reason why. Then, everyone who had boarded was made to get off the plane. Finally, we received an update that the flight was delayed and we'd resume boarding in 3 hours, at about 8:00pm.   At around 6:45pm, I receive an update that the flight will actually begin boarding at 7pm now. I rush back to the gate, I thought this is great we aren't that delayed now. However, when we arrived at the gate again we had to wait in line for 1 hour and we did not start boarding until 8:15pm!! The update was a lie.   On top of all these delays and constant miscommunication of when our flight was actually boarding, they made the entire plane check their carry on bags. Given that our flight was already delayed by 3 hours, I was more than angry to have to wait an additional 30 minutes in Houston at 11:30pm at night to pick up my bag. I planned ahead with a smaller luggage so that I could avoid this. I did everything on my part to make sure I complied with the rules (liquid sizes, luggage size, etc.) only for United to disregard the planning that this took because of mistakes you made.  My experience with United on Friday evening was completely unprofessional and my opinion of the airline has greatly decreased. I think it is only fair to be awarded compensation or miles for the pain that we were put through. I can't believe that you can treat people this way with no repercussions while charging such a premium for tickets.

The flight was delayed 3 hours due today aircraft maintenance. I decided to go to the United Club to pass the time and onetime passes were not accepted. Thankfully one of the passengers on my flight took me in as a guest after seeing me completely frustrated.

Due to mechanical issues our flight was delayed so we missed our connecting flight to Denver.  We had an important family event that we missed.  We only had a short weekend away due to work schedules so it took a huge chunk of our family time.  It was the first time in one year that Randy Prince has seen his son.  I felt badly that his time was cut short.

The male flight attend was unprofessional. He was rude when making announcements. For example, instead of asking people to stay in their seats he said, you will remain in your seat. He poured water in my lap instead of a cup and did not apologize. He walked in to people when walking down the aisle without apology. The general feeling on the flight was all of the flight attendants seemed angry.
The wifi did not work on my phone and they wouldn’t give me a refund. The flight attendant was downright rude and obnoxious. I fly frequently and this was the worst united experience I’ve had.
Was delayed because aircraft was not ready, clean and gathered

I missed my connection in Newark to fort Lauderdale flight 711 by 10 min.  U gave away my first class flights then had the audacity to charge me an additional $1200 for coach flight next day to West Palm. Fucking criminal.  You lost a frequent flyer.  Me and my family will no longer for United
There was a three hour delay, that is why we were dissatisfied. Our landing in bad weather was exceptional, our pilot did a terrific job.
The delay in Newark was more than two hours. Terrible for a short distance flight
While the seats were brand new looking, they were very hard and uncomfortable. Also, I'm not appreciative of having to spend an extra $40 just to bring a carry on.

It took over 45 minutes to have the baggage carasel to start.  I am a gold member and premier bags did not come out first.  I had to wait another 10 minutes for my bags.  Very disappointed in how long this took.  The flight was late and my daughter didn’t get to bed until after 11:30pm.

I'm not even sure where to begin. Originally the flight was supposed to take off at 5:30pm. By the time I got to the gate, it had already been delayed to 6:30pm. While sitting at the gate, I heard the pilot say to the gate agent that our wheels up time wasn't going to be until 10:30pm, but that they were going to push the time back every 45 minutes on the board. This meant everyone had to stay in the gate area to wait and see if anything changed. By about 10:30pm they finally got on and offered everyone $10 vouchers for our delay, but by that time everything was closed and the voucher expired within 2 days. Once we finally got on the plane, it was well after 11pm and I don't think we ended up taking off until after 12am. All in all I would say it was probably part of my top 3 worst flying experiences. I get that weather delays are out of your control, but a more transparent approach would have allowed people time to go and eat, explore the airport or make changes to their reservations.

When checking a bag in the premier access area position 1 it has been a consistent problem of getting the bag tags...happen to me last two times at airport. Have to get this fixed. It leads to a bad start to a trip..

My bag did not make it to Knoxville and my flight was delayed an hour. I don’t understand how it didn’t make it and I had to change my plans on Saturday due to the bag delay. It was very inconvenient and I want 25,000 miles for the inconvenience.

After hours of delay due to weather (which I completely understand) we finally were on a plane and made it to Syracuse. Baggage took a very long time to start coming out and when it finally did, about 25 of us were left without our bags. Our plane sat for 4 hours and somehow bags were never loaded. I called United and filed a claim and told I would be updated on the status and delivery on my bag. I did not receive a single update from United. The only way I found out my bag made it to Syracuse was when I received communication from the delivery company. Upon receipt of my bag I discovered multiple broken items. The manner in which they were broken indicated they were broken at some point when the bag was opened. Very dissapointing.
The over two hour delay due to macitence issues was very frustrating after flying from NRT to Chicago. Baggage claim in St. Louis always takes over 20 min after you arrive at baggage claim.

EWR-LAX passenger on 37A was rude and obnoxious took bags out of cabin and threw them at another passenger. flight attendant did nothing about it she look more like if was her fist day on the job. We were  very nervous and very uncomfortable.
It was unclear why we were waiting on the tarmac so long for the plane to be de-iced. There was no explanation offered for the delay, and other planes were taking off at the time.
Nashville needs to move into the 21st century with de-icing. The red headed stewardesses was the rudest I’ve seen in 50 years of flying. Having a bad day I guess
Nope love United!

I was angered by the inability to check-in in advance for basic economy prior to arrival at the airport.  I think you should find a better way to verify the lack of checked bags.  This alone set my attitude for the flight.  Other than that everything went fine.
Plane was parked at gate and no one could move it.  Caused over 2 hour delay since our incoming plane had to stay on tarmak for an hour.

Passenger announcements need A LOT of improvement! Both English and Japanese PA were horrible on the flight. They were not ready to handle PA. Lack of confidence, very long pauses between sentences- extremely annoying when we all have to wait for the long pause to interrupt the entertainment system. When translating the announcement from the flight deck, Japanese crew couldn’t even translate smoothly. They really need to practice MORE otherwise let other crew handle the announcement. Really unprofessional and annoying.

Fight delays were not explained. Aircraft changes and late flight crews were very frustrating. Having the pilot on the ground for nearly an hour but not showing up to the aircraft was not good customer service, especially with an already delayed flight
Awful seat comfort in first class.  Cabin was dirty.  Bathroom is from the 1970s.  Upgrade the equipment.
I had a damaged bag and delay was awful on board service non existent
Disappointed that flight scheduled to leave an hour later actually left an hour before ours
We were told during boarding that may no longer be room in overhead storage which was unacceptable for me as I had a laptop I did not wish to check to prevent damage.

I realize food isn't always the 'best' on airlines, but the dinner on my flight was just awful. You should consider offering something ala carte - just yogurt or a salad instead of that nasty Tofo curry option.

The flight was delayed and got all notifications and then it was on time and then they change gates at opposite sides of the airport. I arrived and my seat (business class paid) was given to someone else. It was just a terrible experience!

They changed the departure time and then the gate, multiple times before take off. It left us in a complete panic running literally over 2 miles through the airport. At first the flight was delayed, then delayed again so we grabbed a bite. Suddenly I looked at the United App I downloaded and it said the flight was departing in 10 minutes! It did not mention a gate change or alert us AT ALL of these changes. I’ve never run so fast in my life. The thought of my 3 year old crying because mommy was not home for another night was sickening. Why did they not alert us? Why did they change the gates and then multiple gate personnel said the wrong other gates? Why was this one of the worst experiences I’ve ever had at an airport? Overly frustrating, exsausting and frankly sad to think of what a poorly run situation.  The poor people that missed the flight I can’t even imagine what they went through. I was the last one on the flight and was clearly in distress yet the flight attendant couldn’t even bother to offer assistance. He had a terrible attitude the entire time and was overly rude and condescending to other passengers. I’ll avoid United at all costs because of this experience.
The gate personnel was a low light of the experience and did not support the positive advice and assistance I received from the service desk.

The plane was there nearly on time. We had to wait for the pilot to fly in from Cleveland. Not only was he delayed, but I saw him come to the gate after stopping to buy a cup of coffee. Bad optics! Considering the plane was there, and the delay was related to staffing, compensation would make me feel better about the experience. It is hard to understand why we had to wait for one person to fly from another city and be delayed for nearly four hours! Was there not a better solution?
Newark AIrport was a very bad experience, the train connection was delayed and then the airtrain didn't work, almost missed the flight!

The flight our captain was supposed to be on was delayed at 2 in the afternoon. It was clear long before the flight that it was going to be delayed. Why not just notify passengers before they're sitting in a miserable terminal?

No human being over 5 feet tall or weighing more than 100 lbs should be required to sit in the last row of this plane (row 39).  The seats are not big enough for an average size human and don't recline.  Lucky it was only a 2 hour flight.
Aweful old plane. Tiny screen. No power outlet. With so much competition on the London route difficult to justify booking on this flight again particularly when paying an exhortatan change fare
flight attendants were not very responsive to a complaint about the meal, brushed me off when one of the items of my meal was not sealed properly. did not get a meal because of this.
bad bad bad

Communication on the 30 minute delay waiting for our gate was poor. In addition once at our gate it took the gate agent over 5 minutes to realize the plan was there and the jet bridge needed to be moved so we could deplane
Delayed, no beverage service, but both reasonably explained by weather, and actual delay <1/2 hour greater than forecast.  Boarding in BOS SLIGHTLY less chaotic than usual.

The security checkpoint experience was awful. I was kicked and hit by another passenger in line, and the TSA agent did nothing but watch. Finally the agent removed the two passengers out of the line after I was kicked and hit twice, and while moving these two another passenger in line was hit. It was the worst experience.
I got stuck in Chicago - with no voucher. The flight was delayed for mechanical reasons.

Besides being late no ground crew to bring in  the a.c. to the gate it took 35 minuets for them to get there, then no jet bridge driver that took another 35 minutes  before I heard the warning alarm for a moving jet bridge. So we sat there in a stinky plane listening to a flight attendant go on and on about there date life while not once did they walk  through to see if every one is ok or needed assistance the elderly woman next to me needed water to take her medications, the call light didn't work luckily I had and extra bottle of water. things like this should not happen and a flight that should have went smoothly ended up being horrible first impressions last forever and that elderly woman next to me said she would never fly UA again
It was delayed and no one to connect plane to gate when we arrived, 20 mins delay then another 20 mins to find someone to open plane door . No cordination what so ever!!!

When we landed an hour late we needed to wait because theere was no available ground crew to guide us into the gate...  then there was no jetway operator delaying us again....  For real????    Why no offer for additional points due to YOUR staff and equipment problems

I have been a Continental/United FF for decades.  IN the last 1.5 to 2 years I have seen a steady decline in service from United.  This flight was one of the worst I have ever experienced.  I also forgot to mention above that the food was absolutely disgusting.  I actually chose to throw it all in the garbage.  In all honesty you could NOT tell that the chicken was chicken.  Also, the vegetables were so overcooked that they would fall apart when you tried to spear them with your fork...they were cooked to death and absolutely no flavor.  I have been so consistently disappointed with United over the past1.5 years, that I am now actively looking for alternative carriers.   I cant even begin to describe how disappointed I am.  I never thought I would actually consider going to Philly airport and flying American.

The in-flight service was confused and lengthy. Took 90 minutes to get a cup of water. Delayed on the tarmac for over 30 minutes upon landing. The a/c was off - dreadful. No gateway operator led to a dreadful experience.

The experience was appalling. I’m not an obese person, but I cannot believe how cramped I was in my economy seat. It’s shameful what you think can pass as “comfort.” My feet and legs were killing me during the flight. I was exhausted after a long day and a 2 1/2 hour delay, which was never sufficiently explained. Your version of “efficiency” is going to steer passengers away. Perhaps you need to adjust your business model so can find the balance between providing customer comfort and making a profit.

The crew was late getting into ohare which made them late getting to our flight. They walked into our area of the terminal on their phones and walking at a pace that did not match the urgency of this flight. Weather was quickly worrsening in State College and everyone knew it. That bad weather resulted in a very rough fault (clearly no ones fault) and right at the end of the flight my husband starting feeling sick. He asked the flight attendant for help and for some ice and he was quickly dismissed because she said she had already thrown everything out. She had no extra cans of sprite or coke or some cold water or anything? Hard to believe. He ended up throwing up which was the icing on the cake of this awful flight experience.

(1) No room to sit @ gate. Spent the extra time sitting on the floor. (2) Seatbelt sign turned off for only a few minutes at one point during flight. Unable to use the bathroom from gate to gate. (3) Seat 7C had NO cushion. It felt like sitting on a piece of plywood. (4) After spending all the time waiting for flight, then sitting in uncomfortable seat on plane, not able to go to the bathroom, we ended up spending almost an hour on the ground waiting for a gate.

I paid to be upgraded to first class I was in seat 5A right next to the bathroom. From the minute I got on the plane it had a nasty smell. The bathroom was not serviced from the previous flight. It was a purred smell. I almost threw up as the smell was that bad.  I had to experience the smell the entire flight and was very upsetting to me. I feel the cost of the upgrade should be refunded to me. Also the flight attendant did not ask me what I wanted for a preflight drink before take off. Also they offered me a choose of chicken Ceasar salad or Salmon. I chose the salmon and was given a Indian flavored chicken dish which was not part of the offering. And they did not tell me when they served it to me as it was very spicy and I can’t eat spicy food.  This was not professional at all. What if it had peanuts and I was allergic? They need to know what they are serving to the guest before they serve it for safety reasons as well as common courtesy. This flight was not enjoyable at all.

Was not informed of a delay until I got to the gate and was sitting for at least an hour. The prompters and signs on all airport screens and at gate listed the flight as being ON TIME and no text was received on my phone to tell me about the delay before I got to the airport. I continuously  checked this through the day prior to getting to the airport because I received an email the day before warning of a possible delay.  But the United site consistently posted ON SCHEDULE!   The baggage carousel became jammed during luggage retrieval and it took a half hour to fix it.  No personnel were on site at the baggage claim to inform or assist in this matter. Overall the flight was delayed two hours with very little explanation or offer of making anything right for a group of for the most part patient passengers.  An offer of a complimentary alcoholic beverage would have been a small token of apology well deserved.  The flight crew and attendants were polite and attentive under the circumstances however. In fairness to the staff at the gate none of them were rude or unpleasant. They kept their composure quite well in dealing with an extremely rude and obnoxious traveler who seemed to think HIS situation was more dire than the rest of us.
Food service sucks, cleaniness poor
The air condition didn’t work for first 15 minutes and heat wanted to kill us
The seats on the plane were incredibly close together...and I am a small woman. Newark airport was a disaster with long tsa pre-check lines, dirty bathrooms and hardly any room in the gate area.

Four flights in a row (that I know of) we're significantly delayed. One flight was delayed because the pilot was still in Cleveland. This doesn't make sense as a pilot and flight staff member were the last 2 people to boarded the prior flight. Why didn't you have that pilot fly the plane to Cleveland and get back in schedule?  Also you would have known hours in advance of the coming conflict. Why wasn't this addressed in advance?
Someone must have spilled beer all over my seat from a previous flight because it smelled so bad
I was very dissatisfied with my flight being delayed 3 + hours without clear communication as to why.
The flight was delayed , but no food etc. was provided to passengers who were waiting.

There were no gate attendants in the hour leading up to departure and no announcements were made. The app was up to date which is useful but as of 930 pm there was no gate attendant with a departure time of 940 pm. Not great communication. Also I know there were weather issues but all of the American Airlines flights for ORD to LGA arrived within 30 minutes whereas the United flights were either canceled or delayed between 3 and 6 hours. Our plane and crew were at the gate the whole time so I don’t believe we were waiting on them.
the food in business class it is awful, I really enjoy the upgrade to business that I receive but the food was really disappointed

I was rescheduled onto the flight last minute after my original flight was severely delayed. All the gate agents were insisting that there were no flights available and that I was stuck on my original flight until I was able to message your twitter account and they were able to assist me.

Check-in was a disaster. Attendant was using kiosk to check us in. Upgrade was available for 829usd. She made a mistake and checked my husband in for two seats and when she got back to me to have me pay for my upgrade, it was over 2500usd, THREE TIMES THE ORIGINAL AMOUNT. NO ONE WAS AROUND TO ASSIST, she called supervisor, NO ONE RESPONDED, NO ONE FROM HELP DESK COULD HELP HER, seats were going and I WAS FORCED TO PAY THREE TIMES THE 829 UPGRADE FEE, OVER 2500USD !! Unbelievable!! I was in tears. My trip was ruined. How can there be no one on duty to assist and correct issues. Then, when we got on the plane, taxiing off, there was a big scare. Plane had luggage but no passengers assigned to the luggage. How does that happen? Our plane was returned to the gate which further inconvenienced AND FRIGHTENED us, AND delayed our entire trip!! None of this was right and I expect to be refunded the difference. Please contact me asap regarding this matter. Stefanie Stoyanov 215-527-5293
DirecTV is bad and the fact it isn’t free is insane.
Get your shit together.

Not only was the flight delayed a hour(which is understandable) but typically in business class you are offered a refreshment before take off, not only did they not offer but we sat on the plane for a additional 30 or more minutes after everyone was boarded. It was not what you come to expect from business class. Business class had older seats and mine was broken

Meal choices in First Class were awful.  The first class seats on the B737 series aircraft are the most uncomfortable seats in the fleet, with no legroom, very cramped seating especially when person in front of you reclines, headrests don't work or stay in place, and seats are hard and uncomfortable.

Baggage service in Lincoln was the worst I have ever experienced.  Green tagged bags were sent to the carrosel so that limited staff was available to meet the Denver flight arriving shortly (that did receive their green tagged bags).   Resulting delay in getting all bags from Chicago was 40+ minutes.   Really bad performance for Lincoln - not expected on a 2.5 hour delayed flight.  Made for a very long night.  Especially hard in 10 degree temperatures.

no, but you did not ask me to survey the flight from Memphis to Chicago that same day which was even more delayed!!  Their was maintenance on this flight which cause it to get to Memphis 2 hrs late, then the ground crew was extremely unprepared to deal with some snow and Ice by the jet bridge.  They tried over 30 minutes to get our plane moved.  This cause us to be over 3 hrs late to Chicago.

The flight delay caused me to miss an important event and I am extremely frustrated with United, especially after being a long time customer. There was no proper reason as to why this aircraft was delayed and this drastically disrupted my plans at my destination. This is not okay at all.

Security at Newark was not acceptable. I was Premium access but directed to join a single line which include normal access. the line split at a later stage but I had already been in the line more that 20 mins when the line split. There were very few of the TSA lanes open and the airport was very busy, why cant TSA open more lanes when the lines are busy. I was aware of many people (in excess of 20) who missed their boarding times due to the poor organization of the lines.

My ticket was purchased through my wife’s Chase Card.  I was unable to check in online and when I did at the kiosk, I was told I needed verification of my carry on.  I had a very small roller and was told because it was a “basic economy” ticket, which I didn’t know because is was purchased through the Chase credit card, that I needed to check the small roller bag in at a cost of $25 dollars and if it wasn’t a roller it would be okay.  I was told this was a “new” policy.  I purposely packed for a short weekend trip into a small stroller to avoid checking in luggage.  I’m not really sure what the big difference is between a small roller versus a small bag with no rollers that is  exactly the same size.  This was definitely an inconvenience.  Flight was delayed due to air traffic which is understandable and in addition was additionaly delayed because of a ladder that bumped the plane due to wind and rain.  I usually do not complain but it was a bad start to the weekend.
If check in person says your bag works for carry on, then the gate person shouldn’t trump that decision.  Horrible

The flight was delayed out of CHI because of a mechanical issue  with the incoming flight making it late to arrive ( I think). Overall I think the delay was acceptable/unavoidable. One item that could have been improved is we were notified of a gate change approx. 4 times back and forth between two gates. Not a big deal but kind of annoying when settling down for the wait.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Understand there will be delays but there was not one announcement from the gate agents during the entire 2.5 hour delay and even a change of gate. No announcements!!

Flight was delayed due to lack of crew. Crew was late due to inclement weather, but I feel that this a foreseeable consequence of switching out crews. When an inbound flight is coming from a location with inclement weather, two subsequent flights are impacted - the flight that uses the plane and the flight that uses the crew. There was nothing wrong with our plane - we just didn't have a crew. My feeling is that I shouldn't fly United to Chicago, because the odds are that a delay is highly likley given the way in which United changes crews.
We were delay for 5 hours, no weather issues, excuses changed, and then we were held for an hour upon landing because there wasn't a gate available!
I guess there isn't much you can do about the fact that O'Hare is just an incredibly horrible airport.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: The flight was delayed and said a gate change was going to happen. However their never ended up being a gate change and no one bothered to announce a delay. The destination/flight info wasn’t even displayed at the gate. This made for lots of confusion and was seen as United simply being lazy.
The speaker on the aircraft was so loud it hurt my ears badly.  Even holding them shut it still hurt.

The seats in the 757-300s are in TOTAL DISREPAIR.  Obviously outdated, the leather was scratched/fraying/torn, seats were uncomfortable, and in desperate need of renovation.  Very disappointing for a first-class cabin.

When people spend a long time saving to afford the first class experience to Vegas and you take it away and then follow that up with numerous delays all because of poor planning/ insufficient staff, that leaves a bitter taste in ones mouth.
Gate attendants were no where to be found for many hours. They were not helpful in keeping us up to date and solving numerous problems.

Please read the previous page, somebody needs to deal with loud, beligerant customers on a flight, its not a time for a customer to ruin the flight for everybody else while they get the personal attention that they are craving. I feel bad for the little kids sitting around me that had to listen to that explicit language all trip long.
Experience at EWR airport and United lounge was so bad, I will try never to fly from there again. I had to change from my suit into flight clothes in urine soaked toilet stall with nowhere to sit.

2 of my 4 suitcases, never arrived at my destination until 2 DAYS after my arrival, having suffered the personal tragedy mentioned earlier this put us in a very difficult position regarding clothes etc etc
Poor communications about multiple delays; poor communication about changed flight
You can ask the staff to be more friendly.  It was a flight from hell! I will never fly United Airlines again!

The flight was late, the website and airport information was not updated. We waited almost an hour after we pulled back from the gate to actually take off. All the while breathing in nasty exhaust fumes on the runway. It was a miserable experience.

The TSA  security check is a nightmare. It took us an hour to pass in very long and messy lines, TSA agents are rude and don't care, no special lanes for life, elderly and pregnant women. In Lisboa after 10min we were outside the airport with out bags. I Will nota fly again to the us because of the bad experience with TSA and border Control, both ways.

Flight was delayed, was not happy with the drunk passengers cursing and puking in the row behind me. Traveling with my child and concerned I was going to be thrown up on the entire flight was not a great experience.

We were delayed because of a staffing issue, not weather. This was completely in the control of United and they flat out failed. We were traveling with a 6 month old infant and he was put through torture because of the unnecessary multi-hour delay. When the plan landed, we had to sprint to our rental counter, which was 45 minutes past their closing time, so that we could collect our car and get to our hotel. United did not offer any type of alternative despite the delay being 100% their fault.

No, not this flight. It served the purpose to bring me home even was delayed more than two hours. But, we flow quite often with United especially overseas. United meal service in the economy cabin is extremely disappointed. The food quality and quantity were so poor compare to ANA. I tried to use ANA instead of UA if I could. UA can spend one dollar more for each meal, or replace your food director, or even give us an option to bring our own food. It is getting worse and I do not understand your ad. About the improvement.
the group 1 premium boarding for Business Class Passengers is nothing special, a lot of people  not in business class are in that line ahead so nothing special
Flight staff on these long flights is rude. Not sure if it's the duration of the flight or if it is destination/nationality of most travelers to this destination that is causing this rude behavior.
Flight delayed but gate in Peoria is not opened when arrived. I needed to wait till gate open, then I lost reserved shuttle at 23:00.

The flight delay from ORD to GRU was really disappointing due to the confusion. We did not know whether should get off or stay at the cabin while a new pilot is assigned. There should have more coordination from the company to prevent this sort of situation.
Operational difficulties is a poor excuse for a 15+ hour delay.
15 hour delay is unacceptable

You have terrible customer service. Then you have the audacity to offer a $150 travel voucher? Like I would ever use that. You wasted over 16 hours of my time because of your incompetance and lack of customer focus. No thanks!
Forced to gate check a normal sized carry on, then had to wait outside in the cold forever to receive it. Unfriendly flight attendant. Crazy delay. Really tight space in plane. Broken light.
3 hours delay not due to weather is not acceptable
the wait is crazy but understandable however, it is upsetting to not get your luggage on your trip there or returning trip.  We fly all the time and have priority but always have issues with our bags

The flight was hours delayed with no text. Nobody was at the gate the entire time I was there until the flight was going to board - so there was nobody around to answer any questions or explain the delay. The machine at the front desk told me when I checked my bag. It was very irritating to just sit there and have to wait with nobody around for hours! I had to call the number provided online which ended up being booking just to find out what was wrong, which it turned out to be a mechanical error. There should have been another way to remedy this situation instead of waiting on a flight that was coming in hours later than the scheduled departure. Overall a terrible experience.
Pure misery.  No comfort whatsoever
Uncomfortable seats with worn out upholstery, hard to sleep. Also, why no reclining seats for an overnight flight?

I would recommend setting the seats to recline further. The Dreamliner seats seem to go back a bit less than the older planes, for some reason. Also, going there and back, there were almost no upgrades to first class. As one of the first on that list, it's disappointing not to get an upgrade either way.  Finally, the flight to EWR from ORD (which I was happy to be on, otherwise I would have missed my connection) was tough - I had a middle seat in the last row on the plane, that did not recline at all, and there was no room for my bag in the overhead bin, so it was on my lap. Even though it was a three hour flight, that was painful.

Final meal was to be served 1 hour and 55 minutes before landing.  It was served starting 55 minutes before landing.  I was in last seat.  Got meal and c the announcement said all service item must be picked up immediately because we were landing in 5 minutes.  Just odd.  Bad timing.  Perhaps turbulence went on during the hour gap.  Then another announcement that we were landing in 15.  I just handed my food back.  Not sure how I rate the overall service crew.  But everything else was smooth.
Loved the bed on a red eye, but awful pillow and blanket.  No food or snack.

the check agent in Lima couldn't find the approval of my service dog so he gave me a hard time even though i explained to him to look at my reservation details. they need to be more trained about it, it seems a lack of knowledge

I was sleeping in my economy plus seat. The flight attendant said I'm upgraded to first class and made me take all bags and stuff vacate my seat. When I got moving out of my seat she came back and said there was a mistake and it was someone else who got the upgrade. I was in the queue for upgrade, so I had all reasons to believe. It was so mean that the flight attendant made me go back to my own seat, it was embrassing in front of others. Bad moment
You did NOT have safe orange juice ( bottle/can ) I did not want Mumbai water. I had pretty bad ear problems.  Perhaps should offer decongestant if a person has a cold or allergy

I hate TSA, the lady in LA was hella rude and the lady in Chicago told me to take the food out of my backpack, when i asked her that LA didnt make me do that she said “were not LA” and I clapped back “isn’t the TSA a federal agency, meaning all rules apply everywhere” anyway i hate them and they give the airlines and flying a bad rep. Flight was 8/10
Not only did my baggage to to Orlando, the delivery service messed up also, so mad about the baggage service going to Lincoln and back home

While I know this follows your business rules, I had to pay an roughly four hundred dollars to reschedule my flight. I'm an Army Soldier and this flight was my first trip to see my wife after a nine month deployment. My flight back to the States was delayed 48 hrs to the weather, causing me to miss my originally scheduled flight on Friday 12JAN. When I called to reschedule and explain the situation, customer service was unable to give me any assistance or waive your rescheduling fee. Needless to say, I'm unimpressed with your customer service or willingness to go the extra mile and will not fly United again. QAfter you dragged that guy off the plane, introduced this Basic Economy nonsense and are unwilling to compromise at all, it's miraculously you're still in business.
Very uncomfortable flight sand annoying we could book a carry on
It’s really nobody’s fault but every time I have flown out of champagne there has been a delay Nick it’s very frustrating when traveling I almost missed my connecting flight from Chicago to Tampa
The only downside was there were no tv monitors so listening to the pre flight instructions were not very good

I was in a broken seat. It would not stay up and kept reclining. I have a back condition and with the flight delay and time for flight we were on the plane longer than expected and the pain was intense.
seats are to narrow and have caused shoulder pain by being crammed into the seat

The gate checkin is awful; the system does not work well at all, many people denied assess erroneously. gate staff not at scanning site but off at counter.  Worse still was the failure of this  new system  to register who was or was not on the airplane; a very major safety and security issue.  Gate staff had to come the plane delaying departure to see if some half dozen pax where on plane....they were

Switched gates which caused confusion.  Gate team distracted by re booking people on other flights so seemed like they neglected our flight .  Gate switch itself due to pumping fuel out of plane we we initially to take which seems like an organizational screw up. Then on the plane 20 min delay due being “overweight” which required two to deplane and pilot to recalculate weight.  Again this seemed less than irgamized
The plane was extraordinarily uncomfortable. No overhead space even for a backpack and tote bag, which meant no leg room with those items under the seat.

The basic economy option was the worst experience I have ever had wit United. You are forced to check a bag, you are made to feel as though you are a third rank passenger, and the gate staff was very rude.  I have flown with United for several years and even have a credit card with chase howeve after this experience I may cancel my card and strictly fly delta or American. I am throughly disgusted with your treat of your passengers

Premier check in was a mess. Had to self check bags. Only one agent was working first class check in he was excellent but overwhelmed. Flight attendant was rude. She offered predeparture drink to others but not to me. She did not offer any snacks during the flight, only drinks. Did not greet and did not say thank you after flight.

The attendant , long white hair , older , glasses was harassing us the whole morning , she told the lady checkingnus in that we couldn’t take the bag on board , the lady ( very nice ) informed us as long as it fit under the seat we could so we go to the boarding area , here comes this same lady again asking our names , we told her and again u have to checked the bag , by this time I am not happy . She left for like 20 minutes and came back and asked to see our tickets , I have never had so many problems flying before in my life , she would only talk to my husband , not me , I was so mad by the time the plane took off , I had a headache , I think they should really talk to her and she should not being harassing customers for over an hour , we did nothing wrong except booking with United at this point .   The flights were in uneventful.

The people at check in were very unpleasant to deal with! I don't see the point of on-line check in if you still need to go to the kiosk to check in! No one directed us to the kiosk to get our luggage tags so we stood in line for no reason only to be told we had to go to the Kiosk! There was an inadequate number of Kiosks available for the number of people checking in! One Lady at the Kiosk was very helpful and courteous but I did not get her name. Most of the passengers were confused by the process!
Having direct TV to pay for and no personal device entertainment is the worst idea for a 5 hour flight.

I completely understand the thin margin for profit, but the size of the space and seats are horrible. I left the plane sore and hurting from the flight. Size of leg room and space does not reflect most average American adults.

One of the flight attendants on board was EXTREMELY rude, and not only to me but I saw her treat other passengers around me rudely as well.  I unfortunately didn't get her name, but she was the older white female flight attendant working the economy cabin.  I told her I didn't want anything when she was doing service, but gentleman next to me ask for a coffee.  She yelled at him that he needed to put his tray down and then instructed me to sit up and stop filling out my customs form.  That I could finish after she was done servicing the row.  Completely unprofessional, and the guy sitting next to me felt the same way.  A colleague sitting further back on the flight said she was rude to them as well.

I have never had a truly bad flight attendant experience, but this was a first.  The flight attendant was rude to customers, rolled her eyes at customers (for going to the bathroom) and was clear with everyone that she was miserable and unhappy to be there.  She had snappy responses and a angry demeanor.  Maybe it was just a bad day, but I have never seen anything like this from a flight attendant and I fly often.
An item from my carryon bag that was stored under the aircraft was stolen.  I have prof that it was stolen.

We were volunteers for Moving to another flight due to overbooking. So we waited and they said no we had to fly as planned.  PROBLEM:  they sent one of our pieces of luggage to the other flight and we had a difficult job at destination figuring out where our luggage was at.  Lesson:  don't volunteer for overbooking again.
I am a 58 yr. old woman who is 5’3” . Your seats are so uncomfortable and cramped in economy. I can only sometimes fly first class.

When checking in at the kiosk, I received a printed something. It had the flight information and noted that check in is restricted to the gate. Therefore I proceeded to the security check where I was instructed to go back to the check in desk to obtain a boarding pass. So I went back and then again through the security check barely making it to my flight. I understand I purchased the basic economy ticket but it was very unclear on how to proceed. If the kiosk instructed me to go see the representative instead of "check in restricted to gate," a lot of this would have been avoided. Otherwise it was a good experience.

I was very dissatisfied that I was charged to check bags for an international flight. The check in representative was rude to my wife when she expressed her displeasure at the baggage fee. We will not fly United again for international travel.
The CRJ700s are awful. Yes, they are a 2 cabin which is better than a 145 or 200; but the lack of usable over head bins, closets, or a forward Lav is frustrating

This leg was fine. But on our way home (Denver to Chicago, flight 234 on Jan. 16, we were told there was no room in the overhead bins for our roller board suitcases. When we got on the plane, we saw there was still some room in the bins. We then had to wait for our luggage at baggage claim, and it took a long time to get out. I paid the extra money to be able to bring on a roller board, it was frustrating to not be able to bring it on board.
Seeing as this was a 5 hour international flight that overlapped both breakfast and lunch, I was very disappointed that meals were not included.
United lounge at ewr was very bad, disregard it's a pop-up lounge, early in the morning, there is no food except yogurt and granola

I will not fly on a United plane with the seat size the same as on this flight. We had extra leg room but the seats are ridiculously narrow. Seriously  you should think about just how miserable you want to make people.

You have made the planes far too cramped. I had a bulk head seat, but the aisle is so narrow, and the bathroom is right there, so it is just awful. Many other airlines have more room. I would not fly United again if I could avoid it.
Baggage claim was a disaster

Yes, after paying for my bags the 1 of the bag tickets wouldn’t scan. Four personnel tried to help and said they have never experienced this. My daughter has anxiety and needs to sit with me. Sine we had separate seats after checking in the night before we planned to get to the airport early to see the check in agent. The baggage in question was my daughters and she was getting upset it would not make it on the plane. The agents advised her to take a few things out and put it in a carry-on just in case.  What happened to delayed me 45 minutes in getting to the check in And could not be seated with my daughter. The agent handling the bags were not very communicative or reassuring  while we were going through this.  Someone walked her bag to the handlers because they  did not know how to create a manual ticket for the bag. Upon getting on the plane we asked how to connect the Wi-Fi. The flight attendant then told us that. We had to download the app before loading the plane to be able to get Wi-Fi. So now my anxious daughter who is not sure her  luggage was making it to our trip Had no way to watch movies or take her mind off of it for 4 1/2 hours. The flight attendant said they normally make an announcement before you board the plane but I think there should at least be signs. The delay in the baggage also caused us not to be able to get breakfast because the agents told us we needed to get going and they would handle the bag. We figured we could then order breakfast on the plane.   You were seated in the back of the plane and since both attendance started upfront by the time they reach us after an hour and a half they were out of breakfast. So no breakfast no Wi-Fi and a problem with the bags which I think can will be easily adjusted with some thought. I did not find any of the personnel at United except the flight attendants to be very personable.
Bathrooms were filthy.  Wi-fi not working entire flight, VERY DISAPPOINTED.

My flight was VERY uncomfortable. The person in the middle seat should have been forced to purchase 2 seats as his body spilled into my seat. I could not sit with my hands in my lap without being touched by the other customer’s arms.

Fights were late both ways, not weather related, just equipment problems. Missed the wedding I was trying to attend. Check in is a joke - had to confirm I had no bags (when I said I had no bags) and wait in lengthy lines to try to wave down an employee. No explanations for delays, overall bad experience. Hadn’t flown United in a while and don’t plan to again to the extent I can help it. Will pay more to fly another airline.

We were waiting 5 hours with no one there updating us on the situation.  Why was another aircraft not substituted in?  Why was I not alerted about the delay until I was already at the airport and could have stayed at my hotel longer especially since the problem came about the night before???
