That is poor communication on your part.

My check in experience was not as I expected.  I checked in online and yet had to wait in a very long line to get to the kiosk to print out my luggage tag.  The line moved quickly but there was a lot of confusion and people were popping in and out of lines, because they'd gotten into the wrong line.  Once at the kiosk, I had no problem printing my luggage tag but then found that my bag was destined for the wrong location.  This was due to a change in my itinerary which was not carried out for my entire trip.  Was this my fault?  When I cancelled my original regional flight (due to the breakdown of the regional plane), was I supposed to do something?  I don't mind self service if I know what I'm doing.  Next time, I'll know better.  I barely made it onto my planes because this regional problem and that was an unsettling feeling.  I may just drive to the major airport in the future.

Our plane was delayed for 7 hours which I know is not United's fault but the communication every step of the way was terrible.   I never received an email or sms saying our flight was delayed. I even checked the status before leaving the hotel and it said 'On time'. Had I know before leaving for the airport I would have rented a car and driven.   Then at the Gate there was only 1 announcement in 7 hours!! Thats insane.

I wish you would have asked about the January 6 flight to west palm. Luggage handling - specifically golf bags for several travelers - never made the flight. While the golf bag was eventually delivered at midnight, it was wet, covered in icey melt salt, and smelled like oil. Also, it seemed like water seeped into the bag and completely ruined a golf towel with black grease and soaked with water.  The explanation for the forgotten baggage ranged from no idea to the snow storm 3 days earlier resulted in no golf bags being loaded with other baggage.  Poor excuses. In your recent flight magazine the header read “the best companies are willing to disrupt themselves in order to remain relevant to customers.”  Based on this recent (and I stress recent) unpleasant and inconvenient experience (cancelled t-time and no golf equipment...no golf bag, no golf clubs, no golf shoes, no golf balls = NO GOLF), it should more appropriately read “companies today are willing to disrupt customers in order to be relevant to themselves.”  The intent of vaca was relaxing and golfing; the experience created extreme stress.  I’d be happy to discuss in greater detail and discuss some sort of compensation for this inconvenience.  Lmplust@verizon.net  Thanks. Lois Plust/Scott Hall

Abt security the TSA agent who was scanning bags wasn’t a bit unfriendly. My husband has a cPAP machine. We are TSA pre-checked but this service was unavailable. As his cPAP went through she flagged and and asked to whom it belonged. She announced it had to be rescanned. He said okay. She stared at him as if awaiting some other response. He said, “it’s my cPAP machine.” She said abruptly, “I know what it is.” Then she’s confined to stare at him as if he was expected to do or say something else. He turned and asked me if he was imagining some hostility from her. I said I saw it too. I’m not sure why a TSA agent would be unfriendly towards any passenger who wasn’t being respectful and compliant.
I was seated next to a very large man and wanted to knit so I asked if I could move to the exit row that had 2 empty seats. I was told no. That was disappointing.

I'm upset that Economy Basic has so many restrictions that are revealed in e-mails AFTER purchase.  What, no Frequent Flyer Miles?  Absurd.  But worse, I received an email that said if, as a BASIC passenger I brought a roller to the gate, I would be charged $25.  I was charged $35.  The email failed to mention that IF I HAD A BAG CHECKED ALREADY, THE FEE WOULD BE $35.  I figured it would save me $10 if I schlepped the bag to the gate.  United owes me $10 and an apology.

I do not believe passengers should be allowed to put small suitcases in overhead, because that is what they are. It holds up other passengers boarding, because they have a hard time putting them in overheads and it is very annoying when you have to wait for them.
Our flights and seats were changed last minute and we lost our economy plus seating, disappointed

I was able to obtain boarding pass on line. My daughters would not allow me with a message to go to kiosk at airport with passport and print there. We arrived over 2 hours before flight. There was problem with kiosks and we had to wait in long line. When finally able to access would not print and had to stand in line for desk.  By the time we got there our seat for her was given away and we had to wait for another flight. I have carry on bag always use. At boarding attendant said could not take on and had to check. When went to retrieve when we arrived the baggage claim broke!  Finally after another 1/2 hour was able to retrieve.  I've been flying United many years - this was the worse experience had (on ANY airline)

My husband and I fly to Los Cabo's 3-4 times a year. We paid for extended leg room and I was shocked at how small the space was on this aircraft and how little space their actually was. I also looked the night before to pay for business class and was told it was full. When I got to the airport again was told it was full. When I boarded the aircraft 4 seats were in fact available and 4 people just before take off were given upgrades. This is completely mismanaged. How does this happen literally 30 minutes prior to boarding and also checking weeks and days prior to our trip? Bottom line is that these old planes need to stay in retirement. They are not worthy of extra anything! It's a total rip off.
I have to say I was very disappointed in the business class lounge. It seemed overly crowded, and the breakfast food items offered were very substandard in my estimation.

I had to reschedule my flight because I would've missed my connection due to the delay in NYC of weather on Friday. When I was rescheduled I requested that they upgrade my flight to economy rather than basic economy and they weren't able to and suggested I send it a formal complaint. I also wasn't able to reschedule to a convenient airport and had to travel an extra hour to get to EWR. It was overall a very frustrating process and would dissuade me from booking with United again.
Purchased extra leg room but width of seat was terrible especially for both my husband and me with the middle seat.

flying business on this plane is a total waste of money,  nothing special about the seats,  the breakfast was very subpar.  obviously all business travelers aren't equal, as some had a choice of breakfasts while we didn't.
One negative thing was the over an hour delay due to airport issues
I was very worried about the weather in Columbus but UA handled everything very well, no worries!
The fat gay flight attendant was snarky and unpleasant. Just because your gay doesn't mean it is ok to be a jerk.
Flight attendants did some complaining about how tired they were & we not the most attendant. Flyers are tired & crabby & don’t want to hear about flight attendant’s woes
Remember that passengers get frustrated with nickel and dime charges.

this was the worst experience with an american airline that I ever had, my wife's pocketbook was considered a carry-on, they constantly wanted to get an additional 25 dollars at several points in the trip. You handled people through security like they were cattle and it was very bad. reminded me of how it went in the middle east. A terrible airline, terrible service, old equipment and constant banter of how we should pay an additional 25 dollars. Surreal

The boarding chaos at Newark was laughably bad.  Gates packed next to each other and multiple flights boarding at the same time, lines crossing each other, no place to sit, hard to tell even which flight to board.  Single worst boarding process I’ve experienced and I fly multiple times a month

I was late to my own engagement because of this flight. The gate area agent was HORRIBLE. He did not give us information accurately or efficiently. He seemed like he was waiting to tell us bad news because he knew people would be mad. He repeatedly stated that “he was frustrated too” as though that would help anyone. Two people on our flight missed weddings and I made my own family wait hours for me to get engaged. I will not be flying United anymore.

I  voluntarily checked a carry on bag from Chicago to Moline and bag was badly scuffed  and very very dirty when I picked it up from baggage claim.  This is why I am very dissatisfied with that section of my flights.
1 bag severely damaged wheel was broken into bag

The flight waited on the tar mack for over 90minutes. There was no explination as to why, except for “rush hour at newark,” and that a flight crew was assigned last minute for the flight. This is problematic on two fronts. One, why is a flight crew not assigned and why is that being relayed to the passangers.   And two, the level of  Incompetence  by United airlines  to not have a flight crew assigned and inturn passengers be punished for this by air traffic control by delaying the flight in cue to taking off, on a mistake by the airline carrier.

I don’t appreciate having my seat changed from an isle seat to a middle seat. I am a large man and the worst person to put in the middle, thats why I reserved an isle seat. You changed it without even asking.
Terrible food! Charge $10 more if you must but offer something other than dog food! You can do it - why serve garbage no one would ever eat at home?

I was in Econ+. The length of your seat in the A320 (from front to back) is so narrow I felt like I was sitting on a bench. Cutting into my legs. Seat has hardly no recline even in plus. Arm rests are so narrow you might as well have none at all. Your EWR ground staff all need training. Every agent I encountered was sour and nasty and barking at people. Your TSA line, even for pre check, is outrageous and unacceptable. I’ve flown thru most domestic airports and many third world airports and I’ve never been treated so harshly by ground staff. I will avoid EWR, and United, at all costs.
The flight was smooth, but we felt the flight attendants on this flight were very unpleasant.

We have an infant and requested the seats in row 16 to utilize the infant bassinet.  Next to us was the crew rest area.  On both flights, we were told that this was the crew rest area when our children were fussy.  We were trying to keep them happy and tried to prevent them from crying.  However, with an 8-hour flight, it's inevitable.  I felt so uncomfortable for the remainder of the flight.  A similar thing happened on the way to AMS.  I was asked to move seats with my infant during turbulence while the seatbelt sign was on.  I was so angry about this.  However, given United's reputation for issues with passengers in the recent past, I feared to say anything.

We were is row 9. When needed the bathroom, the beverage cart blocked the aisle to back. Also plane was full and there was a line at back bathrooms beyond the cart. The front was open and no one using so I went forward. The attendant wanted to make an example of me. She asked me where I was sitting which she already knew. Then despite letting me in,she proceeded to make an announcement meant to embarrass me. This was not necessary or practical. And it felt rude!

Awful, not enough bathrooms for the amount of people onboard flying over 5 hours to another country. How terrible of you to treat people like this! Some woman yelled at me for no reason at all! Apparently she was mad because people kept bumping her seat. And I am still angry your people would not attach Global Entry to my ticket! Ridiculous!!!
Not sure when this happened, but my checked bag arrived soaked (stuff inside wet)! The baggage people at the Jackson airport gave me a travel voucher when I complained

Just that the gate agent wouldn’t board without a full flight crew. I understand not wanting us to wait needlessly on a plane but because of all the curbside carry-on Check-in, that caused a further delay. The flight crew made up for it in the air, but that could have been avoided.

Return itinerary was accidentally cancelled by the airline. If I hadn’t called 8 hrs before the flight and demanded rebooking I would have been stranded for the weekend. This was completely unacceptable. I missed my son’s 6th birthday party due to the reroute the rebooking entailed.

The TSA Pre ✔️ is ridiculous. The line in EWR wrapped around and must have been 200 yards in each direction. It seems like everyone is now pre ✔️  The seats onboard were tight.  My husbands knees were jammed into the seat in front of him. The bathroom was so small the toilet was angled and I was so close to the sink my shirt got wet when I washed my hands.  There were no paper towels to dry hands. One of the flight attendants was cranky (curly blond hair) and rude.  This was not a very good experience. But, United’s reputation is awful anyway so I probably should not have been surprised.

The baggage check in area was the most disorganized chaotic experience EVER.  There were masses of people all over who were given no directions, were in wrong lines, confused, etc    United personnel were ineffective in helping.  TSA also has people standing in long queues which seemed to have no reason Even once through security terminal C’s “new set up “ seems more congested than need be.
It was quite late to take off. Hard sitting there. Poor babies were screaming behind me.

Flight attendants clearly did not have the opportunity to sleep in Berlin. Are they required to make the trip back and forth in one go ? In contrast to the flight from Newmark to Berlin, flight attendants were tired, overworked, rude and unhelpful. Outside of the meals, water was only given out once during the eight hour flight.

Seemed people entering the US were being screamed at in passport control area, by a drill sargent. No other country did this in Europe.  Also had to do Security with carry on when entering the US.  Was not made clear before leaving Berlin so I bought a couple beers to take home from the gate in Berlin only to loose them in Newark at a suprise Security check point.  They were nice but still.... not cool.  Also on the way out was almost charged $200 because my bag weighed 57 lbs. so some gifts were left at home.  You could have prorated it but that was not offered.  Flight crew was reasonable but that was about administrative controlled things were not.
Very bad flight hospitality. They need some training. Very rude!!!!

Flight attendant was rude and unprofessional . Called a customer a jerk for hitting an emergency button above his seat. I don't know if he hit it accidentally , but my position is calling customers names is never acceptable under any circumstances.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: I am grateful to have made it, but find the anxiety of flight uncertainties to be quite unpleasant and stressful.
The seats are so uncomfortable!  In comparison with your competitors such as south west, there is no leg room at all.  If you drop something, you can't even reach it.   The seats are way too tight.

We checked one bag and on return from our vacation, Newark airport lost our bag. The problem was we had very important medication in the bag. We arrived at about 1pm on Saturday 1/13/18 Our bag was delivered at our home at about 11 pm the following evening. Also, we were extremely disappointed with your customer service. Those we spoke to on the phone were extremely rude and they spoke very pour English. In all we were extremely dissatisfied with the way things were handled!!!!   I have always been very satisfied with your company and I always choose to fly United Airlines before any other airline. Thank you!

This is the worst experience we have ever experienced. We will NEVER fly United Airways again. We got to the airport 2 hours before our flight and checked our flight status many times along the way, including in the line to go through with TSA and there were no delays or alerts about delays. By the time we got through the line, our flight was delayed and we were going to miss our connecting flight in Newark to Orlando. There was no United representative at ANY of the United gates, even though our time of original departure was about 30 minutes away. So there was no one there to help us figure out how to get to the destination that we paid to get to. We were on the phone with the most unhelpful agents for 2 HOURS. None of these people helped us at all. We found up having to leave the secured area to go to the check-in area and they sort of helped us while we were on hold for over 40 minutes. After getting back through the TSA security, someone was FINALLY there to help us. Our only option was to get to Tampa through American Airlines, when we paid to get to Orlando. So we had to pay for a rental car to get to our final destination. We were stuck in the airport for 8 hours and were given no meal vouchers. WORST FLYING EXPERIENCE EVER.

Flew first class.  Stewardess that wasn’t in first class was extremely rude.   Nasty attitude and shouldn’t be handling people.  A very poor representation for United. I sat in 4F by the time they came to me for my food order there was only one item left which was also disappointing.

With the exception of one, the flight attendants were fake nice: pleasant to your face but otherwise unpleasant. They were disgruntled when i "interrupted" their gossip time in the back to ask for more water. I should not need to ask for more water in the first place, but they regularly ran out of water with 5-10 rows to go and would not refill their tray to offer water to the back. Definitely not what I expect from  the much sought after NY to LA route.

I took multiple flights with United and other airlines this year, It seems to me that the flying attendants have a poor attitude towards serving the public with basic needs during the flight and poorly trained in general. during our check-in in Newark, one desk referred to another department as 'Retarded" because we were given the wrong information. You are in the business of service and if people don't get it, they go somewhere else that simple. During this vacation, we experienced Lufthansa and United, what a difference in the attitude!! Your staff members seem "angry" at work, this is a corporate culture problem and my advice as a small business owner(dentist) with about 20 employees, FIX IT! and quickly before more damage is done to the organization.

Boarding groups made no sense. I was in row 29, group 2. I saw passenger in front of me in group 2 in row 11.  Many times aisles are blocked by people in front half of cabin - how can this be? There should be no one in seats in front half of main cabin until earlier groups fill last half of cabin! Excepting first class, Group 1should be window seats rows 30+, Group 2 the remainder of rows 30+, Group 3 rows 20+, Group 4 rows 11+, Group 5 rows 1-10, no?

was able to trade seats with another passenger so could sit with family, but not happy that flight got combined and original seats shuffled. Booked 3+ months out so could choose seats to then find ourselves in last row smaller seats. Not cool.
How about a 7hour delay?  No apologies?  No compensation?  Would you like that experience?  Horrible airline!

My experience at check-in was extremely disappointing. The clerk in front of the kiosks was very hostile towards me. He was very impulsive and shouted, even though I never asked for his assistance. I will never fly United again. This person requires serious training for customer service. Otherwise, he should be fired.
I had problem in booking on line( error message). I had to call the 800 number to complete the booking.
My biggest dissatisfaction was I had to pay $50 for check in luggage.

Knowing it is outside your control, I would comment that the signage in the Barcelona airport is quite inferior, and we were virtually lost until a grumpy women at an information desk pointed the way.  In addition, the chaos at the security check was significant.  I was stopped for further screening, and then the agent did not seem to know what to do.  She did not speak English, so she repeatedly yelled something at me, and I don't speak Spanish, so I didn't respond.  It could have been a Saturday Night Live sketch, except for the importance of the situation.  I find it difficult to believe that I am the first non Spanish speaking person who set off the buzzer of the security check, and that a person would be hired to investigate further who did not speak English.
Baggage delivery/claim in Newark is bad. Very long delays every time. 30 minutes or more.
Charging 6.95 for three pieces of cheese and a package of 3 crush crackers was sad and I will never purchase again!
Used same carry on we used for the last 20+ flts. And was forced to check it. Gate rep was unprofessional bordering on rude. Will start to consider other carriers if this happens again.

We paid close to $1800 for first class and got a one ounce bag of chips...we left our house at 8:00 am and had nothing to eat until 4:00 pm when we got to our hotel..,we could not even buy anything to eat as nothing was offered....we were offered an alcohol drink at the beginning of the flight...too early for us...we would have had a drink at 1:00 pm...but none was offered.   My husband has over 400000 career miles with United...This was the worst we have experienced....shame on you...how much does a burger or salad cost...add it to your exhorbitant fare...I was light headed when I disembarked..Going home I will buy something before boarding...when did you stop providing a meal...a mid day flight should have food ...as people have to get to the airport and have not eaten..if you said at ticketing ...just a one ounce bag of chips, we would have been prepared....your first class has no class...

Most horrible experience ever. Flight delayed two days. Waiting at gate 5 hours afte10:50 am flight was to leave. Gate agent hard to Understand @nd did not keep us up to date. I was booked on a second  flight at  1:50 and I kept asking gate agent if it had come in. He gave me mis information and when I asked  about the flight again he then said it was the plane which he had initially said was going to DC.  He said I could get on it as it was pulling away from the gate. We waited another 2 hours to get out of the airport as the 10:50am plane had all kinds of issues. The fact I was not on the 1:50 made me late to my event and cost me 127.00$ to get me to where  I needed to go.  Will rethink my united experience in the future!
Upgrade.!!! My journey with you was not worth the money spent. Disappointed

The signage in the check in area for bag check is extremely confusing. It said “drop bags” so I almost dropped my bag on the conveyor belt (after tagging it) and your staff nearly flipped out on me as if I was intentionally doing something wrong. Maybe signage should say “proceed to desk to drop baggage” as they said “people do it all the time.

Flying older 767-300 planes with a small screen in back of seat is ridiculous. When trying to view 'map' the words are unlegible the screen is so small. No electrical outlets in seats on an 8 hour flight is also ridiculous in today's electronic and digital age.

Unfortunately my suitcase was damaged. Upon arriving to our resort I filed a claim over the phone. Rita, the person in the claim department I spoke to, said that she would send the claim confirmation to my email, but had not done it. That's frustrating. We are out of the country and have a limited access to Internet.

Gate change was poorly communicated and there was no staff available to answer questions. When we got to new gate, the gate staff member basically said he was too busy to answer questions. Wouldn’t look up from his screen. Did it to us and multiple others.  Unacceptable.

Gate and boarding was terrible.  No mention of no jet way and a horrible trip for an 81 year old down three flights of steps to a bus and then up a long jet way to a small shrinking business class seat that today is not competitive at all.  Just horrible!

The service of the flight attendants was poor;  they rarely came down the aisle to provide water or even pick up trash, which is important on a long flight, especially when passengers are not permitted to bring their own water on board.  They were absent except when serving a meal.  They did not even come by to pick up trash before we landed.  In addition, the food was the worst I've ever been served on an airplane.

While the flight itself went well, the agents in your ticketing and security area were very rude. They were allowing many people to enter the security line without showing boarding passes but then screaming at others who didn’t have their passes visible. Very inconsistent and unprofessional service.  They also seemed very confused at where to send passengers, as two of the three security centers were closed and the one that was open had a broken machine.
All sentir smoothly. Food in economy premier is not very good. It's always the same..pasta or chicken and the chicken is always the same. Boring
I don’t find United airline stewardesses to be as friendly as Delta or Alaskan. They often seem angry to me.   United airport personnel at Newark are definitely not pleasant.

The temperature where I was sitting - row 17 - was unbelievably hot. Twenty degrees different from the back of the plane when I was walking around. The food was inedible and the flight crew ignored us. No offer of drinks or wine. We had to ask for everything. I bring a group with me to Israel every January and we will likely look for another airline next year. This was not a pleasant experience.

we arrived at the airport at 9:44am for an 11:35am flight that was delayed 3x til 12:09pm. we frequently checked the monitors and every single time "waiting for aircraft", then we eventually go downstairs to the gate, the boarding door is closed and we cannot get on the flight. one of the persons there was very unhelpful and blamed us. and it gets worse from this point, before it gets better. give me a call 9145128186.

Please keep the 777-200 type aircraft as long as you can for long haul flights.....the 777-300 was the worst flying experience I have ever had with united.....the EWR-TLV ROUTE IS ONE OF THE MOST PROFITABLE FOE UNITED...WHY MESS WITH IT TO ADD AN EXTRA SEAT IN THE MIDDLE AISLE? STAY ON TOP BY BEING THE SAME.
Several flight attendants were unfriendly The food was not very good

When we walked in flight, the attandent lady asked us to wait because the other one walked further to pick up something from the cabinet. He totally blocked the passenger way, there is enough space for us to pass, and there were only about 5 people behind us waiting, but we were kept there estimated waiting 10 mins. Attitude wasn’t nice from the lady from the top of the airplane. When we sit down, there’s a person sat beside us seemed had a code constantly coughing and blow his nose. We were scared to catch cold too. Wish there was a mask, I believe it would be a good protection. Other things are good, food I believe every airline has different standards. 5 hours flight one meal only, I felt hungry when I arrived New York.   By the way, just to mention, few months ago I was traveling with my boyfriend. Flight was delayed and we both complained the situation about the delay. He received a response and compensation for the delay but I didn’t. Don’t know why.  Thank you.

1) Check 2 bags and pay for 60$ ; 1st bag weight 47lbs , the 2nd 51lbs and have to take only 1 lbs extra out. very poor service and unfriendly manager. 2) accidentally bought the basic economy ticket no carry on allow. the ground staff just want to squeeze me to get 150$ for the carry-one to be checked in.  There is only one staff can remind me call online support to change the ticket just for 25$ 3) The flight delay one hour , i almost miss the connection flight
no, but I do have issues with Global Services and would someone to contact me, but I doubt this will happen

The round trip from Newark to Eagle/Vail and return was quite disappointing.  From a seat not working on the outbound flight (and extremely dirty) to the WIFI not working on the return trip, my wife and I were extremely disappointed. You need to pay more attention to cabin maintenance.

yes.  we landed in Newark after a five hour flight and spent over 30 minutes on the tarmac waiting for a gate.  That is very frustrating.  There are TONS of gates at Newark.  Really annoying to sit for half an hour after landing

The gate agent was terrible. Rude, non communicative about the reason for the delay. It was obvious when someone asked her--it was a disruption of her work. When the crew did get there--the flight attendant was very vocal about the fact that she  was sick before she came to work. Both of these employees need a refresher in customer service
Very disappointed with the gate agents for not making more announcements about our flight. The delay was 7 hours.

You took my carry on luggage with no time for me to get out my medicene, jewelry and makeup.  I started having an allergic reaction to nuts on the plane and all my meds were in my carry on.  I am so sick of people not checking bags so I get punished and almost go into a severe allergic reaction.  Kudos to the gentlemen at San Fran that assured me and got my bag to me.  I am never flying United again.

The flight I actually have an issue with was the Peoria to Chicago flight I was supposed to take before my Chicago to Las Vegas flight. It was flight number UA4714 scheduled to leave on January 13. It was so delayed due to weather in a completely unrelated city that I was going to miss my connecting flight in Chicago. I then had to drive to Chicago at the last minute to get there at the very last minute. This Peoria to Chicago flight is historically very unreliable and I question why you even have it. To only be traveling for a long weekend, any delay causes precious time to be lost. Weather is not in your control, but offering compensation for that flight and my lost time is and should be automatic.
No plugs to charge devices, cramped seats make longer flights painful.
3 of my last 4 flights have been delayed. In this case, there was no advanced notice of delay. United seems to have a consistent operational problem that I do not experience with American.
It was delayed, so I missed my first meeting of the trip.
Seamless during a stressful time

On my way going to SAN, one of the flight on 1/6/2018 flight  UA613, from Denver to Ontario, after all passengers on board, been tald the plan has a "dent", Maintenance need to clearfy the damage is within the specification, 1st been tald take 45 minutes, then another 30 minutes, then another 10 to 15 minutes, ... after about hour and half, the captain had apology too many times and still keep  been told by Maintenance " few more minutes ". The captain feel so bad and decided let whoever needs to leave the plan can do so, after the bridge been pulled over and people started de-plane, a gentle from the ground crew made a phone call at the gate to someone and ask " I have a plan of people at the gate can't leave, can someone tell me what happen", the release came in and we been called re-boarding. Finally the plan left the gate, right before enter the run-way, the plan stopped and we been told need one more paper work about load balance.  The arrived time suposed to be 8:25PM and we landed 11:17PM, I was so concern about my car rental company's 12:00PM closing time.  Of course, this delay is no comparsion with the one I experenced a week after from San Diego to Newark.
Slipping delay with poor information.

The only problem I had was with with trying to see the flight plan on the screen. I thought it was ridiculous to charge someone 7.99 just to see where the plane was, but there didn't seem like there was any other option!

no hot nuts, no hot towels, did not have the entree I ordered (said only had 19 lunches, not 20, and they were out of the chicken salad choice.  food was only a snack, not a meal.  In contrast, the United 1st class flight I flew to FL on 1/3/18 had hot nuts, towels, an actual MEAL, not a snack.  Although I was happy that the flight left FL on time, was a smooth flight, and actually landed EARLY, the in service was unacceptable.  The steward's explanation was that they were not provided with the nuts or towels.
Delayed Flight very annoying.

Problem at FLL airport: not enough seats in the waiting area.  Very problematic. We are getting too old to handle the delays in general, not necessarily related to United, but the larger system. The flight was difficult only because of a screaming child sitting directly behind my husband (we had 2 aisle seats) that lasted for about half of the flight.  It was the worst we ever experienced.  Of course, that is another thing that you have no control over.  Baggage was a bit slow in arriving, but we got to Newark 45 minutes early, so can't complain.
Club was very rude.  I had a pass and they told me I should use it another time because you didn’t have a bathroom

So the reason we were unhappy is that we got to the airport and were told that the flight was delayed 3+ hours...in the past global services would email us and let us know about the delay. It was upsetting to get to the airport early and be told that we had to wait there for 4 hours with our 3 year old son. If we had been called once the flight delay was known (the gate agent told us they knew about the delay prior to 10a we would have comfortably stayed at home longer

Wondering why there is no charge for those who still choose to take "on board" baggage with them and then have to check it.  I know the passenger reason......no charge for airline to check their baggage.......save them money.  Isn't this a missed opportunity to the airline to collect more dollars.  Charge for "at the gate baggage" that is now being checked........same as mine which I paid for when checking in.  Doesn't seem fair that folks take their luggage with them.....have it checked.......and pay nothing.  Really need to think through the whole carry-on luggage aspect of your business.
Waiting for bags in Chicago was ridiculous!  It was 45 minutes before a single bag came.  If we were catching another flight, we would have missed it.

My luggage was lost!  I did not receive it until the following evening!  I suffered through the inconvenience as my friend loaned me pajamas and I was able to wash important items!  I feel I should be compensated for the inconvenience and worry!
I was disappointed that no food, even to be purchased on a 4 hour flight was not offered. The drink service was also minimal. For a flight that long, you should offer something!
Flight attendants seemed a little tired and grouchy.
Poor snacks  Purchased food not great
The food was horrible. Strange choices. We landed at night but we're served breakfast before landing. However, the food was terrible.

Greensboro to Newark was fine.  Newark to Greensboro was the problem.  After more than the flight time in the air and I began to wonder what was going on, it was finally announced that we were heading to DC to get fuel.  We had past DC about an hour earlier, so that seemed odd.  Only after we landed were we advised that we would be spending the night in DC.  After a LONG walk up down and through Dulles Airport, we passengers waited on multiple buses for the Hyatt Regency.  (they have little buses.)  One of my vouchers didn't work, which I will have to contact you somehow about.  I arose at 4 o'clock to make the 4:15 bus back to the airport, but the little bus was full, so I had to wait in the lobby for 30 minutes for the next one.  Now, I'm getting a little bit anxious that I will make it through the halls of Dulles for my 6 AM flight to Greensboro.  I missed a business meeting on Thursday night due to the rerouting (weather related - and I get that.  No problem with changing due to weather conditions.  But, there was never any owning up to the weather situation.)  Once on board the 6 AM flight, we sat there, sat there and sat there; and was eventually told that the plane had mechanical difficulty and we would (once again) have to deplane.  Our flight would be leaving at 7 AM.  However, it was nearly 8:30 before it ever took off.  I missed another business meeting at 8:30.  The level of communication made by United and crew was not adequate.

The wait of over an hour to get our bags from baggage claim with no explanation was more than ridiculous. Many passengers were asking what the problem was with no answers.  Several passengers missed their connecting flights and we missed our bus.  There never was a good explanation given.  We paid extra for 1st class expecting a relaxing return home and ended with much anxiety trying to find out why it was over an hour waiting on luggage.  We did not even receive an apology from the United staff that was there.. When we asked what the problem was they said "we don't know, maybe it's the weather ???? What! Sad to have received such bad service for no reason.
Your employees seem particularly unhappy working for your company.  Their attitude is awful.  And we had 5 people in my family sitting in first class
Slight delay caused problems for some connecting flights...

Food Menu & Availability:   Please mix up the menu to Belize, I have been flying monthly for 3 years and upfront it is always the same meals; Beef Brisket or Mushroom Ravioli.  With NO hot food in the back? You are losing big potential revenue???  Selling the burger, turkey sandwich and salad, it makes no sense.  So all of the travelers flying Belize to Houston or Newark on connectors with close connections get no real food for 6-8 hrs?? You guys can do better

Both commuter flights were delayed at boarding time. Had to change planes out for schedule maintenance. I get the schedule but knowing the maintenance schedule, alternate planes should be ready instead of “looking” for one. It was especially poor out of Chicago. Gate announcement and changes were barely audible and poorly pronunciated. More than half of the plane was empty due to people missing the 2nd gate change.

As a 1K, I'm used to United keeping an empty seat next to me when they are available. On this flight, though there were other empty seats, a 400-pound man was seated next to me (this was a tiny regional jet with 2x2 seating). It was absolutely miserable, and completely unacceptable.
not sure why there is nothing other than "snacks" in first class...that is the only thing that was disappointing
The flight arrived early but we had to wait on the plane for 30 minutes because no gates were available, which was unfortunate.
Selection of snacks could use an upgrade. Nothing fancy but the choices are limited and not great.
Chaos at the terminal even at 5AM.
After arrival in Chicago, customs was very smooth, but waited one hour and fifteen minutes for luggage, this was after already passing customs, terrible service by luggage personal.

The flight attendants were in need of hygiene lessons such as washing their hands and themselves. I asked on 3 occasions to have my screen reset as it had parental controls. I was informed very rudely by the male attendant they were busy.  I asked before they started their food and drink and waited until they had finished, no apology. Your employees do not make an effort and on a flight over 6 hours a snack should have been provided.  More than likely that would have been a health hazard so I'm glad it wasn't. I fly all over the world and unfortunately I have 3 more flights with you.  You rate the worse airline I have been on.  Ryanair is way above you and they advertise as a low cost budget airways, but the staff are professional.

I paid $59 to move from a group 4 boarding to a group 2.  When it was time to board I was very mad that the person in front of me was group 4 and the gate agent just let him on.  I Paid $59 to board before him and felt like it was a total waste of money.  This is not right.

2 bathrooms for economy seats, what is that about 200 persons in that cabin, is definately not enough. There was a line all the time in the aisle and the aisle is so narrow, no one could pass each other. We had to step into the galley to get in and out of the bathroom to let the other people pass. This happened on both our flights, so one can only think it is a constant problem !
All the unexpected additional charges for seats and not having them pre-assigned made it a real headache.  Also the seat were very uncomfortable and narrow.
Old planes and terrible service.  Charge for everything including a crappy "meal" for a 6 hour flight?  You can do better.  You used to be an industry leader.  What happened?

my flight from Newark to Aruba was more frustrating. My family and I weren't seated together even though we booked together. They also moved my seat because the person next to me was so big he needed two seats. They gave me someone else's seat and when she wanted it they wanted me to move again to the back of the plane even further away from my scattered family. I refused. And the employees at the counter were very dismissive. Bad customer service.

To use a personal laptop with the in-flight entertainment system, a requirement for using firefox is for the laptop's version to be version 51 or older, which is quite out of date. It is not at all clear why such an old version of this browser is required and it is quite an inconvenience given the current version is at 57 and higher. I find it rather difficult to download this older version of firefox and it is not at all clear why your system requires such.
No wifi no direct tv not even a middle tv to watch a movie. Need to modern the aircraft

Newark airport is a dangerous place for travel. So many drinking stations that take too much space for walking to or from gate. If there is any accident, people will be killed because no place to run. Especially when boarding time, or get off from aircraft. Too many people in a small area

The flight was delayed therefore we almost missed our connection for Montreal.  There were no announcement on-board to advise of the change of gate.... we went to gate C131 and were told to go to gate A20.... we arrived 5 minutes before they closed the airplane door.   We were 8 people traveling together.  We are very disappointed that no announcement were made prior to arrival at Newark.  Other airline companies do that in order to help the customers not to miss their connecting fligths.

I purchased 2 tickets in March, 2017 for this flight as well as my outbound flight on Jan 5 and I selected seats 1 A&B on both flights for myself and my companion, Maureen Clarke,  I checked this flight throughout the year and the seats were the same.  As i checked in, they had moved Maureen (1B) on both flights and this was very annoying.  The attendant on the phone told me that row 1 is used for handicap and on the outbound flight, the person in !B was not handicapped. I was very annoyed at this change.  On the return flight we were able to get 1 A & B.
The flight was delayed coming into GC, but the time was made up upon arrival to Newark.  No worries.

my arrival in chicago was te problem, I am handicapped and 85 years old,  there was no assistance on my arrival in chicago  to get to my next fkight to cedar rapids from terminal 1 to terminal 3.  My son found a wheel chair and pushed me there, I would be still at the exit ramp if I had been alone.  The flight from Cancoon was fine, no problems, just the Chicago terminal.
Very dissatisfied with communication. I wanted to cancel my flight

Flight was overbooked, i already had a bad experience going to PUJ from EWR I was very disappointed that although I had seats confirmed and ticked was bought way ahead of time I didn't get to fly on the plain I bought tickets for and assigned to another flight especially that this was family vacation and I was with kids 3 and 2 years old.

Dont fly guest out of terminal 2 in havana. It is the most ratchet airport ever. The people at the gates were confused, the people boarding were confused. They were screaming out information to an entire building of people so only about 10 people heard.

Only negative was the fact that our seats were changed without our knowledge from 2 aisles in the middle of the plane to an a aisle and a middle seat in the last row...probably the worst two seats imaginable.  After calling to complain and a lengthy discussion with an agent, we were given economy plus seats at no charge.  No explanation was given as to why our seats changed in the first place.
No, I’m too tired

If there were mechanical issues as was stated, why was this not discovered BEFORE everyone boarded the aircraft? I thought the crew always does an aircraft inspection before they board (at least that is what your on board intro videos state). The more frustrating part was boarding, being held there for over an hour, only to have to deplane and wait almost 2 hours. It would not have been nearly as bad if we never boarded in the first place.

flight to connecting city delayed multiple times.  Despite traveling from original departure airport (LaGuardia) to other airport in neighboring state (EWR) my flight was ultimately  scheduled for flight following day in evening.  My trip was ruined

I lost a LG Notepad on the way to Puerto Villarta.  A Claim was opened but I was also directed to contact lost and found.  We were not successful in getting someone to answer the phone.  Three or four calls were made and no one ever answered the phone.  The LG notepad has not been found.

The basic economy class is a modern equivalent of the old world "steerage" class intended to keep the poor feeling that way and away from the landed gentry.  It is really obnoxious.  I am the CEO of a non-profit and with respect to my donors fly the most economical way possible.  I will now go out of my way not to fly United because the experience made me and the others in the "class" feel unworthy and disrespected.

A woman of a different decent had horrific body odor.  I wanted to vomit.  I moved up 6 rows and still smelled her.  Someone on the flight sprayed something to make the flight smell better but it didn't work.  Why does an entire plane have to suffer because of one person?  Several people asked the flight attendants to move the woman but they said they couldn't.  So just inconvenience the other 100 or so on the flight?  That's just wrong.
We were delayed at airport in St Kitts but had no idea when plane was boarding until we actually  boarded and customs in Newark was overcrowded and took a long time to go thru.
Disorganized check in, confused upgrade process, food selections ran out by row 11.

Flight attendant was aggressive and argumentative when asked if onboard snacks could be purchased, asked for pretzels and she didn’t come back. Considering the food poisoning on the trip to London from our food on the plane we weren’t eating that again.

Very poor communications once flight was cancelled. gate agent said to me the flight is cancelled and told us to proceed to baggage to retrieve our belongings. The flight was not cancelled but delayed until the next morning. No one advised me of this either in person or on the phone. Causing me to miss activities in NJ becasue of the miscommunications.

Our stroller and car seat didn't make it to Birmingham, so they gave us a loner car seat and stroller. The car seat was not safe and it had huge stains on it. The stroller had big holes in it. And when I went to call united baggage, I was on hold for over 45 minutes and I had to get off the phone, so I called back later and was on hold for another 30 minutes before someone answered. This is unacceptable. I finally have our stroller and car seat, but it was a very inconvenient 30 hours without it.
While the flight was five hours and did not land until after 7:30 there was no food to purchase other than a snack box. I was shocked that an international flight had no meals for passengers

Flight attendant from newark to los angles wasnt clear and doesnt speak fluent english, i felt little rude.  i was sitting  first row in economy, and first to serve lunch , which he passed two reis diss diw and then offered which  was not clear, either it is for purchase or not, and the lunch options. he did lip service, felt he was rude, instead of providing hospitality enviornment. But was amazed, with overall united food selections, gate ambience when rest of the carriers are going oppsite direction in cutting costs.
they left my stroller in miami and then filled a delayed form for the stroller. we recieved the stroller broken and has missing pieces

For years I have had Premier, Premier Exec, and last year at this time I was Premier Platinum.  Flying in Economy plus is tolerable.  Without status I feel like I'm treated like a welfare case.  The space between rows is painful.  It is so tight it is impossible to get a computer bag down into the crack between the seat and the seat if front.  I paid $1,800+ for a round trip ticket and I'm stuffed into what feels like a sardine can.  The small commuter jet for the last leg of my journey was more comfortable that the seat in the 737.
I think it is horrible that there is nothing that is FREE to watch on TV. I was not even able to watch the flight info as this even asked for payment... this is free on other airlines.

The agent at the gate in Aruba was lazy. I forgot to request a wheelchair when i booked the flight but i thought i would be able to get one at the airport as i have done in the past, my wife asked for one for me and the agent said that a lot of wheelchairs had been requested but didn't even look to see if she could get on for me, it seemed liked she was overwhelmed with working there, I have a bad back and walk with a knee brace and it was terrible waiting for security and customs for close to 2 hours in my condition.........very lazy in my opinion

It was disappointing that when my 10:55am flight the day before was cancelled, it was 29 hours until I could get on another flight. The wait time on the phone for gold members was over 30 minutes and I had to get a hotel and dinner on my own.
My little tv screen had a bad pixel on it....furthermore, the little snack is inadequate.
It’s an overnight flight.  And your seats are entirely too uncomfortable to get any sleep.   My neck hurt, my lower back hurt, and my rear end was sleep and tailbone hurt within the first hour.

Our original flights were cancelled only 4 weeks from departure, at the point when I had everything else arranged. I attempted to speak with a rep about this, but was told I could only leave my feedback via email and nobody would personally call or speak about this. I asked for some sort of recognition that this impacted several variables that had already been put into place and cost me financially. I was denied anything via email and left with a generic, likely cut and paste apology. It would have gone miles for United to say that they would recognize how this affected our trip and offered us something as simple as upgraded seating, reward ticket or anything to that effect. I am very disappointed in the service.
The attendant at the gate was not very friendly.  I needed to have my boarding pass reprinted and needed a seat assignment.  The attendant seemed a little irritated at having to service my need.

The wheelchair service was unforgivabley deficient in Chicago. I was left (abandoned is more accurate) in a  wheelchair at the wrong gate. Nearly missed my flight. I had to walk in pain carrying my backpack to find my gate and barely made it. Very disappointing and painful experience.

Yes I still don’t have my luggage my clam number is fll56526m every time I call they say it will be delivered at night it Monday morning and it not here from Saturday itWas a brand new first time ever used hard case Samsonite piece of luggage I have the receipts but no one wants to take my claim any further they keep saying that it will be delivered at night it’s not delivered do you know what it’s like to be without your things for three days and no one cares United does not care unfortunately I am flying United back to New Jersey this coming Saturday and I’m terrified I have to go shopping today for a new suitcase and all new things you people stink beyond stink how could you not help your customers
This the second time I waited for checked baggage that never arrived on the carousel, forcing me to hunt it down.  I an very disappointed with United's baggage handling operations.
Restrictions on Check in (have to check in in person) for basic economy make the experience unpleasant and inconvenient.

Flight was okay but we needed to rebook connection and would have liked text, call or email in advance. Unite d obviously knew in advance there was a delay. People at Albany checkin not so pleasant. Perhaps we were not either.

United discriminates against economy ticket holders with harassments especally flight attendants in Orange County. They harassed my daughter even though she only carried a small bag ... told her to wait when boarding for no reason... racist attitude...

The flight attendant was middle aged, African American. I moved one row up to the exit row where no one was seated after the door was closed, prior to flight instructions and taking off. She told me in a very unpleasant, aggressive way to move back as I had not paid. The other passengers around me who witnessed this expressed surprise. In the past, I have found that attendants generally encouraged more comfort when it had no impact on anyone else. If she was merely following corporate directives, albeit with a nasty tone, then she did her job and you should commend her. To me, it seemed needlessly officious and left a negative impression with me.

The seats are not too comfortable.  However, the worst part is the In Flight Entertainment.  It gets saturated as the FA told us that only 200 can be online at a time.  The 777-200 holds around 350 I believe.  So for an 8 hour flight, you can be without entertainment.  Even worse, I was watching a movie and well into the movie it kicked me off.  The FA said to "keep trying" to get back on.  Finally, three hours out, when most people were sleeping, I was able to get online.  There were no iPads to rent on this flight--I asked.  No apologies, just kind of a matter of fact response on it all.  This is unsatisfactory.

Direct TV sucks very poor selection and you had to pay for it why not just have movies or old tv shows with no cost like other airlines it may make you stop thinking about how uncomfortable your seats are well they were not as bad as the seats to Ottawa

You need to train your flight attendants to be nicer and not be so rude to the customers. The flight attendent pulled my jacket and very highly stuffed backpack out from the overhead bin and threw it at me saying it was not allowed there!!! How rude can you be!!!

I received an email telling me about the potential delays in New York and took your recommendation to change the flight along with my bosses flight. He and I can’t thank you enough for my notification. His Mother in law passed away and he needed to get home. We were able to avoid the delays in NY.Thnaks!!

Flight was too full making it very stresful due to the design of the plane of maximum profit but minimum customer satisfaction. I was in the last row of seats that did not decline due to poor design with another older passenger next to me with her dog for 6 hours straight with no room to move nor get up being in a window seat. Very unpleasant flight indeed.

This is the first time I've written a comment about a flight and I feel compelled to do so because the experience was very unpleasant.    At check in the employee ignored me twice when I asked about seating and was overall grim and unhelpful. Flight attendants were consistently brusque and rude on this flight. The flight attendant handed out pretzels without looking at me and my traveling companion. When I asked about dining options the attendant said angrily, "I told the people beside you we have nothing left. There is nothing." The attendant acted like it was an imposition to buy anything, and I was afraid to ask for water when the drinks cart came around. There was hardly any food to buy on a 5 hour flight during dinner time.   Every flight attendant seemed on edge. Another attendant dropped an empty cup on top of the person sleeping beside me and laughed and didn't apologize. The same attendant shouted up the plane that they needed immigration forms in English as she was handing out the forms in Spanish and people couldn't understand them. It was a very unpleasant flight.

We had seats in row 4 by the economy galley. The flight attendant there made noise throughout the flight. Light on during overnight in our eyes and constantly crushing water bottles. Most annoying flight. I could not sleep all night. Not what one should expect flying first class and paying I’ve triple of economy

My travel bag was taken away because the wheels caused it not to fit. Have used this bag for more than 10 years. The seats are extremely tight and uncomfortable. Felt a 5:17 should have had more than a snack option to purchase. That is a dinner time flight.

It was hours late. No staff at gate to work out connection issues due to multiple delays. Missed my connection to PDX and had to spend the night in Chicago. I'm 6'3" and paid extra for an isle seat with extra leg room for my Chicago to PDX flight. The Roanoke delays cost me a decent seat and my replacement flight stuck me with a middle seat in economy with no extra leg room on a 4.5 hour flight and luggage didn't make it with me!!

You changed our original flight from one that left at 1:30 to one that left at 5:30. We had 4 babies that were up way past their bedtime by the time they got home. The whole flight was filled with babies. Terrrible schedule change. Also, my husband and I have the United Mileage Plus Explorer card and we are supposed to get a free checked bag for him and for me. The  agent at PLS only gave us a free checked bag for him, not for me. We have had problems with the the agents there before. They gave my husband a ticket two years ago with our 1 year old grandson’s name on it instead of my husband’s and when we realized the error the gate agent wouldn’t change it even though she was the same agent that made the mistake! It caused us to miss our connection in Atlanta. Terrible, incompetent, rude service.

The aircraft was half full.  Some passengers tried to spread out in economy plus and were told by flight attendants to go back.   I did not need to move but I thought it was greedy and obnoxious to send people away from empty seats.
The airport itself was less than organized. Not an issue with United itself but made for a unhappy experience for a first time to St. Lucia  The airport needs serious expansion

unhappy about the problems with my booking and lack of reimbursement following multiple flight cancellations prior to St Lucia trip. This had knock on consequences for the flight back, making check in a stressful experience.

There was no catering on the ground in St. Lucia so despite it being advertised as a flight with inflight food available for purchase (and no email stating anything to the contrary) there was no real food for purchase despite it being a 5 hour flight
I am average size.  Sitting next to big people is difficult; they spill over onto you.  This guy was not heavy, just big.  He had a cold and this proximity means he coughed on me and I got sick.

I wasn’t originally on United, but rather American. Due to a maintenance delay, I missed my connection. I was rerouted to United. I check a bag on American, and was told by their agents my bag would be sent to United. I get to Pittsburgh and no bad. The baggage agent said that only 5% of those bags ever make it. He did a great job getting my bag back in less than 24 hours.

My bag was sent to Austin Tx and there weren't any United employees at the White Plains airport when we arrived. I had to call 5 times to an 800 number and most of the people on the baggage line couldn't understand me and the connection was poor I couldn't hear the person on the phone. United never followed up to let me know they sent my bag to White Plains. I just received my bag at my front door 2 days after I arrived, and United never called me or emailed me to let me know my bag arrived at the local airport. Customer service for lost baggage is almost non existent. This has been a very frustrating experience.

I was traveling with a Ski Group. When we arrived in Norfolk, there were a bunch of SKI Bags and other baggage missing. After some time at the Luggage claim, we were told that the missing luggage items were likely still in Chicago. My Ski bag was one left behind. Since there were about 15 people in line to fill out claims, the Baggage clerk handed out slips of info so we could file claims online instead of waiting even longer at the airport. I took a slip, traveled home and tried to file a claim online. There was no place to file online. Turns out I had to call in to a CS Rep to get the Claim started and to receive the "File Number". I indicated that I would pickup the bag once it arrived in Norfolk. I also agreed to receive TXT updates about the status. Once the CS Rep opened the claim, I received a TXT confirmation that said I would be updated every 12 hours on the status. The next morning I checked the online status page and it indicated I needed to check back later. Later that day, I checked back again at the status page and it indicated "Baggage located and arrived at Airport". A few hours later, I was going to go out to do some errands, and since I had no direct notifications or calls about the luggage, I checked again. The online page still had the same message. I called the phone number to check status and it indicated "Baggage was located and is en-route to airport". Since I was unsure, I did not go to airport to try and pickup the item. The next day, I checked both online and via Telephone again and both maintained the same contradictory status info. During the two days, I received no telephone or TXT updates at all. Later in the afternoon on the second day, I called the phone number again and status was the same, "En route". I asked to speak to an agent, and finally the agent confirmed the baggage had been delivered to Norfolk Airport at 8:30AM the previous day. Finally, that night, I went and retrieved the bag. This was a pretty poor handling of the missing luggage claim. Yes, it was delivered to Norfolk the very next morning, but the Online and Phone systems provided contradictory status info and no status was directly provided via TXT or phone during that time. this was not a pleasing experience.
The crew members were doing their job no apologies for the delay were voiced.

Was not thrilled with the curt announcement " Immediately take your belongings and de-board the aircraft". Never given a good reason for this extreme inconvenience other than an unruly passenger had to be removed. So you had to convenience 200+ people for 1 person? Seems like there must be a better way to handle this. Boarding is a pain. Twice for the same flight is a horror.

There’s a reason the United ceo was just named one of the 10 worst. He’s absolutely clueless. I’ve had upgrade certificates that I’ve tried unsuccessfully to use for a year- including both legs  of this trip. Despite giving his customers an useable perk he also prohibits the extension of these certificates. At some point customer  good will translates to profit. Something you people are oblivious to. I’m also baffled as to why you continue this ridiculous survey campaign. Nothing changes or improves. I’d say things have gotten even worse in the past 12 months

Our flights were rescheduled multiple times, departure airports were changed multiple times and the process was brutal.  I spent hours on the phone with different United reps.  Most seemed helpful, but when I went online after the calls, in several cases the system did not reflect what the rep had told us.  Our original flight was cancelled about 12 hours before its scheduled departure and we were put on other flights, but these were later cancelled due to "weather".  Had we been able to fly slightly earlier in the day, we would have made it to our destination on time.  When our replacement flights were cancelled, United hid behind the "weather" issues and refused to offer any compensation for either the day we lost trying to get on flights, the $100's traveling back and forth to the airport or the hotel penalties we incurred when we failed to make it to our destination.  Even a taxi voucher to get us home after the final cancellation would have gone a long way towards making us feel better about the process, but airport staff denied the request.  In addition, although we booked as a family on a single reservation, we were split up because United's system mysteriously bifurcated our original reservation.  Since United claimed they were unable to combine the reservation after it split, it became unnecessarily challenging to manage the situation.    Our last flights were good, but the process wasn't great from a customer relations perspective.

Fist the plane was late, then no one told us that they changed the gate number, no announcement was made, then once we finally landed there was no gate available for our flight or the plane in front of us. Shockingly bad communications, I expected more from United.
Actually my flight from Chicago to narita delayed more than 2 hours on Jan 6 and I missed transit flight in Tokyo.  I had to buy another ticket. Is there any voucher for the delay?
It took 45 mins for me to get my baggage and exit the airport, very poor overall.

Horrible, horrible, horrible.  We will be contacting you in regards to our trip from Burlington Vt. to Newark, NJ to Montego Bay.  We missed our connecting flight in Newark due to an airplane malfunction in VT.  Had to take 4 flights to get to Montego Bay.  We had to sleep in Charlotte overnight and did not get our baggage for 4 1/2 days.  How can you even justify this?

As a United Miles credit card holder with one time passes to use in a limited period of time, I am extremely disappointed and feel betrayed by the fact that upon arrival to to Club to pass the time during our 4 HOUR departure delay, we were denied entranced.  The sign claimed that one-time pass holders couldn’t go in due to limited space. When I went in the club to inquire, I noticed it was not anywhere near capacity and at that late hour there were no other United flights that night.  When I inquired at the desk, the worker still denied us entry. Given to circumstances, the club should have taken the facts and allowed us entry which I pay for and deserve.  Very poor customer service. Please educate your employees and don’t just train them.  By the way, we experienced the IDENTICAL treatment when our flight was delayed in Newark on Friday January 5th from Newark to West Palm Beach by over 4 hours.  Denied entrance to a half empty United Club at a late hour of the night.

This is the second time in 6 weeks that we had a major flight delay. This time it was approaching 4 hours. When we heard that the new aircraft was leaving Newark for Fort Lauderdale we left the president's Club 2 have a bite to eat for dinner. It was only after we ate that we were told that we were entitled to two $10 vouchers. We very much so appreciate that United everything in both instances to provide us with a new plane and new crew but the delay was most difficult for not only us but a lot of people we're depending upon family members to pick them up because it was way too cold and others who were actually flying the next day or should I say in this case the same day. I think we should have been compensated for the major delay

On my flight from Newark to Tampa I received my bag and a zipper was broken and on my way from Tampa to Newark another zipper was broken. My bag also could barely roll on the floor without wobbling and stopping and nearly dropping. When I left to Tampa my bag was working perfectly fine now it’s horrible. Destroyed.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Changing gates last second, horrible communication and not assisting/directing passengers when gate changes were being made.  Absolutely horrible.
Luggage was damaged on MCO-ORD or ORD-FAR. Broken roller wheel on luggage.

I'm really upset at check in because I had check in my BOOKBAG as a luggage. This is unfair since people had bigger bags as carry on. I don't think a backpack/bookbag should be considered a luggage. Really upset I been flying with my bookbag for a long time and never had to check it as a luggage.
My bag was not delivered with the plane but came a day later and was badly damaged

Yes, My carry-on luggage wouldn't fit in the overhead or under the seat!! I told the flight attendant that it did not fit under the seat. She said you have to go back to the gate to get a tag!! I ask her first for a tag. So I had to go back to the gate and get a tag. The flight attendant was rude to me and found out when we get to Akron and waited 15 minutes after having to get out of plane down the steps outside and freezing weather because they took off the regular luggage first then the carry-on. Also, she was rude to other passengers!!
when i booked the trip my seats were assined together, but during check in we had separated seats, the check in person in Cancun was rude and very unprofessional
This flight was fine.  Unfortunately I have several bad experiences with United that I avoid flying your airline when possible.  Customer before boarding has been terrible.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: The bag belonging to Laoise Tyndall was lost and did not arrive in Dublin. Extremely disruptive

THE SEATS WERE TERRIBLE THEY ARE HARD AND NO LUMBAR AT ALL. I WOKE UP THAT NIGHT AT HOME 3 TIMES WITH LEG CRAMPS AFTER GETTING UP SEVERAL TIMES WHILE FLYING. TO LONG OF A FLIGHT FOR THAT SMALL OF PLANE.

Our flight attendant was very rude and lazy. We were not even offered preflight drinks. She took almost an hour just to get us our first beverage after we took off. She was just lazy and always thought we were putting her out.
I felt your cabin crew where very scruffy and unprofessional in how they looked and served there clients .
Over all it was an ok flight but when I got to San Juan I had no baggage because it was not put on the plane in Newark so I had some problems with that
We were delayed 45 min. Due to problem with aircraft.  We did not find out till after boarding.

What good is it flying first class, and your attendants congregate up front and chat for 2 hours while I'm trying to rest? They were so loud, everything was dirty or not working, it's just so regretful to consider United as a higher class airline but the service was absolutely horrible. Going back to Delta.

Dinner salad and appetizer served half frozen ... breakfast fruit served half frozen.  Bathrooms doors signs block most of the flight with weird papers by flight attendances ... still not sure why.  Service rushed ...
Just no tv is a shame Missed football
Cabin space is excessively small, I’m 5-5” and I was very uncomfortable in my seat. Every movement the passenger made sitting behind me bad I felt.

The service was terrible. They put my baby’s diaper bag somewhere and refused to locate it and bring it to me when I needed to change a diaper, and use the bottle in that bag to feed her. The adult food was terrible

I continue to have Global Services personnel at O'Hare contact their equivalents at GRU about to help assure my bag comes off somewhere in the first grouping of bags.  One thing about GRU is priority bags do not have priority and in fact three trips back my bag was literally the last bag on the belt of a 100% load factor flight.  GRU blames this on improper loading of priority bags in the bag containers at ORD.  ORD blames it on GRU.  The reality is this - their is a real problem occurring at GRU that does not happen at other stations (including non US locations in the other 60 countries I have been to).  Rather than blame each other, I suggest someone work to solve the problem.  This is a real concern.  Please note I did not let this impact my rating.  But, at some point, if this is not addressed it will.
I had a booked a flight with one stop. You changed my flight to Include 2 stops. How can you do that? That is just plain wrong.

I was never notified of my gate change. I ate at a restaurant and scanned my boarding pass into the iPad which was suppose to give you flight information or gate changes. And didn’t. By the time I went to board I realized it was in a different terminal I sprinted and had to take a bus and got there a minute before the flight was suppose to leave and no one was there. Luckily the customer service agent got be on the next flight out. But it would have been nice to get some sort of notification of the change. I got possible weather delay texts but nothing about gate. Which is extremely frustrating cause I didn’t get to my destination until 12:30am the next day
I was disappointed with new plan no one can solve the technical seat problem. For long flight.

the new "improved" 777-300, even in economy plus, is a disaster.  Shaving off the 1 inch from each seat is so uncomfortable I have to sit with my elbows in line with my body.  The traytable is so narrow I can't open my laptop and have a cup of coffee on it.  (I'm 5'8", 178# and  use a 13" MacBook air.

Boarding process was sad and chaotic. My carry on bags were completely taken apart so that although I was first on line in first class boarding I was not able to board until was into group 2 or 3 boarding. Nothing was found of course. And the airplane was sad and the food and beverage were sad for a 7+ hour flight. Clearly United does not care about this market. I would check American or try LAN for future trips to South America.

i was rejected or given an excuse every time i requested water.  i could barely speak cuz my throat was so dry and itchy, but flight attendant made sure i was turned down each time. This happened for the first 5 times i requested water. Then I was told to just walk to the back of the air craft and get the water myself.  Very poor service. I will never recommend United to anyone anymore.

Food has consistently declined in quality in both economy and business class. Flew economy for 16hrs, was very cold and there was no extra blanket. My blanket was taken away by someone while I went to the bathroom and I was told there were no extra blankets as it was a full flight.
All good, but bathrooms were disgusting
Seats are bad.
attentadants were horrible. A lot of attitude with no smiles . The worst i have experienced
check in attendant was very unpleasant with other customers trying to checkin I  had no problem but felt bad for other people
I hate greek yogart
We were told there was a mechanical problem. Then delay. Then takeoff. No explanation. No communication. Very unsettling.

The gentleman seated behind me had asked for extra leg room and said he had paid in advanced. However, he was seated in a regular seat, and since his legs were quite long, he had no choice but to "fold them" in order to not spill out into the isle, which he was told he could not do (cabin crew). Very early in the flight, I noticed there was an empty seat at the front of the plane, but it took the crew member a fair amount of time before she offered it to the gentleman (who was not a young man). She then proceeded to warn him that it might be cold in that spot. He remained where he was. Since he was seated behind me, I heard him complain during most of the flight to his partner. I felt for him (and felt him), as he pushed into my seat with his knees. He was simply encouraged to write to the airline and complain that he was not given the seat he had paid for. I am corroborating his story, in case he does contact United. This was a elderly gentleman from England. This was surely not a pleasant experience for him, and this is very unfortunate.
I was very unhappy that I could not get a seat assignment in economy but had no trouble with a fee for economy plus.
Staff very rude

The problem was the wait -- we had boarded and waited on the plane for at least 30 minutes until the flight took off.  All they could tell us was it was not a mechanical issue but a baggage issue, which made no sense.   And they had to keep the aircraft door open the entire time, at 10 degrees outside.  It was unpleasant and many people knew they were going to miss their connection in Chicago.   I had a good amount of time between my connection and was not concerned for myself, but surprised that it took so long for a baggage issue.
The cabin crew really are very rude with the guests they make too much faces when they ask something even if u ask for mor Water they got upset ....
it is difficult to download the mobile pass. the wifi access is cumbersome and not effective. the airplane seats are not very comfortable. not a fan at all of the baggage policy

There needs to be an easier way to check-in luggage. I had to go in two lines, one line to make a payment on kiosk and then a second to pick up tag and drop off. It doesn’t make sense as it’s a waste of time to have to wait in two lines. Fortunately, the time wasted waiting in two lines didn’t affect my boarding as I have TSA pre-check.

I actually changed my flight that day from a later afternoon flight to the early morning flight because I got several notifications that the later flight could be delayed or cancelled due to weather in Chicago.  I needed to get there due to the funeral of my daughter-in-law’s mother the following day.
Seats were not in best condition and not comfortable. No pillows and blankets in business class
I sat next to a six foot+ tall man for who the close proximity of the row ahead must have made for a torturous journey.

Seeing that we were 1.5 hours late from taking off, due to your mechanical failure, not weather, you could have given us a free snack, extra miles, or both. The delay caused us to miss a intracoastal boat tour that cost us $42. Very disappointed. Please call me at 847-917-8701. You did absolutely nothing to make up for this delay. Bad public Relations. Myra and Joel Bauer

There was an absolutely terrible snack thing. AND it was the only item available. It had NO nutritional value, and in fact was so loaded with sugar as to be unhealthful. The second ingredient didn’t even attempt to be food, “Glucose Syrup”!!! This is my second trip with United on which I was served this travesty. I am sorry that I do not have a choice of airlines. I am going to send it to Nutrition Magazine hopefully for their discussion in print. (I am a health professional)
The first class breakfast was horrible

the in flight experience was great, but the treatment by your agents at Chicago O'Hare Airport was awful. The agents ignore the passengers needing help with your checkin machines and when they finally come to assist they are extremely rude and make you feel like stupid.
