I flew economy from Fort Myers to Chicago on American and they American Airlines agents were very attentive and even though the ticket purchased was the lowest fare, they did not treat you different from the rest of the passengers in first or business class.  It is a shame because I travel at least 10 times to Chicago and this is the second time flying economy with United and the treatment at Chicago O'Hare has been awful both times.  I don't know if I will subject myself to the humiliation again.
The only disappointment was that there were no meals for lunch. We were only offered snacks. We weren’t interested in the breakfast when we first started our flight. ☹️

I was very disheartened at check in. My father is 98 years old with very limited vision. The check in agent at security was rude and entagonistic due to my father’s license being expired. He is a WWII veteran and he was put through a stressful security check. His license was a  picture ID dated 2014. He no longer drives. A supervisor was called and did the security check herself. I believe poor disgression was used based on his age. He posed no threat to this flight. Other than this experience everything else was satisfactory.

Although the stated rules are that passengers are limited to two carry ons, those with more are allowed to board.  It's aggravating for passengers to have limited themselves to two carryons, and then see others (not first class) breeze on with more.  I am sure that the gate attendants do not like to stop passengers who have more than two, but it's not fair to those of us who are abiding by the rules.

May want to "fine tune" emails on "travel disruption warnings". Said ORD would be a problem on 1/14-15.  After checking weather, it was apparent only light snow was forecast and not until 1800 local.  We passed through ORD with no problems.  Some customers might find this concerning.

VERY DISAPPOINTED - United Club LOUNGES WERE NOT OPEN TO ONE -DAY PASS HOLDERS. Tried visiting both of them in the C terminal at EWR but both had signs that One-Day was not being accepted. We had 2 passes that expire at the end of Jan 2018 which we were not able to use. We intentionally arrived early at the airport to use the Lounge for Breakfast but instead we spent a half hour walking to one lounge and then to the other only to find out we could not use them. We have no other travel plans this month so the passes are a waste. At very least we should have been informed they were not available before we left home and possibly given an extension on their use.
Glad to be here but disappointed that I lost money in the movie not working
hate the automated checkin!
Gate personnel were disorganized and borderline unprofessional
Glass of water, screaming baby to the right and kid kicking the seat. Papers in the seat pocket. Jumbled audio system. Very unpleasant flight.

Flight attendant ordered a passenger to be removed because he asked her to please stop talking to him after she interrupted him while while he was talking to another flight attendant.  Why are your people so unprofessional?

The food is shockingly bad, both quality and quantity. I have been flying this route for many years and although the food has never been great it used to be slightly better and you used to get more. For a trans-Atlantic flight where tickets cost £1000 + its a disgrace  what you serve. You should be embarrassed. For the main meal we got a tiny omelette and for the light meal it’s a tiny, greasy sandwich which has shrunk in size compared to a couple of years ago. You also used to get a bag of chips and a chocolate but they have disappeared.  Also the airlines stewards/stewardesses are often rude and unapproachable.  The toilet was dirty and no paper towels.

I travel internationally usually twice a year.  This is the first time I have been on United in sometime.  I am shocked at the lack of food, drinks and entertainment that are provided on board.  On the way to Mexico, the flight attendants doled out water like it was liquid gold.  no breakfast and having to pay for entertainment is absolutely unacceptable.  Unfortunately, I am flying to Hong Kong in March on United but after that, I will never book again.  Foreign carriers are much more considerate of their travelers than trying to save a few extra dollars for their investors.  Terrible,, terrible, terrible.

There were 4 open first class seats.  As a gold member I am usually upgraded if open as I was going to Dublin.  When I asked they were not accommodating and extremely rude.  You need to train your customer service people or get some that know how to interact with  customers!

the GSO to EWR on 1/11/18 was a disaster from an equipment standpoint. The flight was so screwed up that your computers didn't recognize that I took your delayed flight on my first leg and it subsequently "UN-confirmed" my return flight. I got to spend 30 minutes on hold and talking to your "off-shore" reps just to be able to check in for this return flight in the survey.
Really disappointed at the stewards response when I advised the headphone port wasn't working he just shrugged his shoulders. I wasn't the only person this happened to

Yes  The flight was delayed by 4 hrs I received an email saying I could change my flight plans with no charge. I called customer service and cancelled 3 /4 of the people flying, and the agents confirmed 1/4 (me) was booked on the flight the next day and even got confirmation number. Because I generally expect incompetence from United, I called back a few hours later to confirm as I had not received confirmation email   Upon calling, I was told that all 4/4 of the flights had been cancelled and I had not been rebooked. Had I not called I would have shown up to the airport without a ticker.  This is completely unprofessional.  I had to spend 45 mins on the phone to then rebook a new flight for myself for the next day.  With the combination of poor customer service and delays, I will plan on using other airlines. I expect United to go out of business in the near future as there are many better alternatives.
delayed 2 hours due to mechanical issues. Insane
The check in was an absolute disaster. I would continue but don’t feel confident that anyone is willing to listen

There was a flight attendant with glasses who was nasty and rude. There were several pieces of gum stuck in the front pocket of the chair but I didn't find out until after the gum got stuck on everything I put inside and ruined my book. Also one of the flight attendance yelled at me which I didn't appreciate at all.
Seated in row 30. Wanted to purchase food but by the time they got to me they only had fruit and yogurt left from the entire menu. Very poor. Also they did not have enough customs forms on board

There was a woman on board who only spoke Spanish and thankfully I was able to translate for her and help her through customs, but it was very uncomfortable to know that neither United nor the Winnipeg Airport had any resources for patrons who did not speak English.

The flight, and the service aboard were fine. The food was ok, but a bit scanty. Our worst experience was the delay in receiving our baggage in Newark. It took at least 45 minutes to an hour for our bags to arrive. This seemed excessive.

There were 3 gate changes, time delay and the aircraft was dirty. As well, and saying this with respect to all...there was a very heavy traveller that took more than one seat. The other passenger could not sit in the adjacent seat and had to ask if there was another seat...it was embarrassing and likley humiliating for both parties as well could tell other passengers felt very awkward. Not enjoyable from start to finish.
Poor food options (only a sandwich), poor service when serving beverages (slow and they only gave me one glass of water even though I asked for two)

Food for breakfast and lunch was available for flight, but crew was hesitant to serve breakfast later in flight stating heated for too long.  They may want to stager the heating process of foods to reduce the risk.  Or ask people if they want food what will they prefer and a possible timeline.
gate experience was a bit disorganized..... there were no boarding group signs at the gate..... seems  b1 gate in PBI isn't usually a United gate I heard.......
Gate was disorganized.  No lines, just everyone milling about.
Flight crew were late arriving which caused a delay. Seats were so tight it was very uncomfortable.

It is absolutely ridiculous to offer a flight that does not allow you to sit with a small child. It makes zero sense to not allow seat assignments prior to boarding. What is that accomplishing? My husband had to threaten two different customer service employees to get a seat next to our 4 year old daughter. United obviously does not appreciate the business of those with children so we will be taking our business elsewhere. I will also make sure to tell anyone who will listen how terrible this airline is and warn them about this bullshit “economy” flight.

I got a text from United that my 10:10 am flight may be canceled die to weather so I rebooked through Newark on Saturday night. Sunday morning the 10:10 flight was listed online again so I called to rebook it. Young man could not find flight to rebook. So I threw my stuff in my suitcase, got the hotel shuttle and went to the airport. Agent tried to find the 10:10 flight at the kiosk but could not. It is now 9:30. Suzanne at the help desk finally confirmed the flight, got me the last ticket and gave me two boarding passes for my connecting flight to Buffalo because the earlier flight to Buffalo was overbooked by 24 people. Got stopped on my way through pre-security for a small pouch around my neck to carry my passport and cash. Asked if it was a purse, a purse??? And then made me put it in my backpack before proceeding as the minutes ticked away. REALLY! Got stopped at security who proceeded to unpack my entire backpack and run it through xray a second time because he was looking for binoculars that were on a different passengers xray. REALLY!! As the minutes ticked away. Did make my flight and arrived back in Buffalo by 5pm compared to midnight if I had not taken my original flight. After traveling from Christchurch to Auckland (2 hours), then Auckland to Houston (14 hours), then have my original United flight changed so I needed to stay overnight in Houston, then have my new flights back to Buffalo changed due to weather, I will avoid United if at all possible. Suzanne was the only shining star in all the chaos.
There was no accountability or transparency provided for the delay.
The United staff at LAX at the baggage drop-off looked a bit "dead in the eyes" and made no verbal contact.
I got food poisoning, as did the woman I was traveling with

Not allowing me to bring a bag that was 2 inches larger than 9x10x17 in one dimension is absolutely pitiful and predatory. I will never fly United again unless I am offered a full refund of the bag that I was rudely forced to check. The fact that it was the ONLY bag that I had and I was still not able to bring it on the plane for some undisclosed reason (when others also in basic economy were allowed to) is flatly infuriating. United should immediately change this predatory practice.
This was the most cramped airplane I’ve ever flown on, with absolutely no legroom. I marked “satisfied” because the flight was smooth and on time, but the seat was exceptionally  uncomfortable.
Main attendant was surly and unsmiling.  First class attendant was not nice.  Coach attendant was nice.

I don’t know why I bother because issues are not addressed, but I do not appreciate choosing and paying for the aisle seat on the bulkhead row only to see it changed when I printed my boarding passes.  I don’t know who the rude man was that got the seat- obviously an employee or elite member because he did not pay for drinks or snack boxes, but he spread his legs across the aisle and put his belongings in front of my husband and I. My husband has severe arthritis and difficulty with his knees and is most comfortable in that seat.  As I said, I do not think it’s fair that you give it away.
No, other than the seat power not working, and freezing to death in my seat, everything else was fine.

The flight attendant would forget to give a meal or a snack to the person sitting in the same row as me by the window. There was an empty seat between us but she had to get the flight attendant's attention because she would just forget and move on too quickly. In addition, the condition of the toilets were disgusting. We ran out of facial tissues quick and there was urine all over the ground and on the seats.
I just bought a new android tabletand found out you don't support later version of Android. Not good!!

cabins were dirty.  toilets were extremely dirty all the time.  cabin crew had no intention to maintain cleanliness of toilets and or cabin. they don't care.  Where as other airlines crew during flight care and maintain cabin cleanliness and toilets.

The reason I don't give higher marks to the Frankfurt-Newark flight is that I have terrible memories of my outbound flight (Newark-Frankfurt on Dec. 27) - with the gate employees being absolutely horrendous - scolding me for standing in line too early, refusing to tell me which line to stand in and not acknowledging if I was even in the correct general location for my flight - which left very late.  One extremely elderly passenger standing next to me got the same rude treatment and was standing for almost an hour in line for Frankfurt - and then almost missed her actual flight to Zurich - after the door had already closed for her flight, I had to beg them to reopen the door for this woman and let her board - no thanks to the awful gate personnel - and I personally carried her luggage to make sure she could rush to make it throught the door.  She had been in the wrong line all along.  I regret that I didn't get the name of the most rude employee - she was clearly on a power trip and took glee in throwing her weight around - almost enough for me to decide never again for United.  Thankfully, coming home was very pleasant and a welcome contrast to the outbound trip.

The ski baggage clerk was hurried and not helpful. The assistance clerk was very helpful, a lady, thorough and empathetic. My seat was terribly uncomfortable. It was an old model Im sure with a head pillow attached that forced me to sit with my back hunched forward because I couldn’t lower my seat in the exit row. May seem petty but I have back problems and 2 hours in this seat really hurt.
Why the hell was my flight delayed by 3 hours. That’s unacceptable
I experienced another flight delay due to mechanical issues with little to no help from customer service. Very disappointing to lose another day hanging out at the airport.

I was extremely disappointed that not only did we have a 13 hour delay on the way to LAX on 1/6, but we had a 3 hour delay coming home to EWR on 1/14.  Their were multiple delays that weren't always communicated through the app or email.

I sat in 2B...middle tray between seats was dirty/service was poor given only 12 in first class/attendant was not engaging and spent more time upfront alone than servicing passengers and her hair needed to be brushed?
Plane was so small and uncomfortable.. no leg room and seats were hard...

I don't travel often but was dismayed when the price of the flight increased almost twofold from one day to the next.    How is that possible?    I was also dismayed that while paying $480 for a flight to Atlanta I was charged another $25 each way for a small carry on bag.    I felt that the airline took advantage of the fact that I had to travel for a memorial service and had few options about when I could go.
When my husband and the woman next to him put down their tray, it was sticky with crumbs on it.  The overall cleanliness of the plane was very poor.

I made a change in my return immediately upon arriving in Newark on Friday. Unfortunately, the agent I dealt with did not fully complete the transaction (though she did get my $200). As a result, I was unable to change seats (I'm platinum level and was in standard economy) nor was I able to check in without the help of an agent upon arrival. This sadly resulted in a less comfortable experience and meant I had to get to the airport earlier than planned as neither your website nor the app would allow me to check in, change seats or anything else as it said I had no ticket to match the reservation.

The front cabin was hot, which actually welcome as I usually freeze. I doubt you'll change it, but making the seats narrower back to front is awful -- really uncomfortable for any flight more than two hours.
As a platinum member, because of this terrible experience, I am looking to change my preferred air carrier.
You damaged my suitcase by breaking one of the bags 4 spinner wheels. $50 towards a furlture flight doesn’t begin to cover my expense to replace or my frustration. Not acceptable.
The technical issue that caused the delay should have been spotted before we boarded the plane.  Very frustrating to board and sit there for a long time with very little explanation.

traveled first class, last row, isle. Curtain to main cabin was constantly open, noise and constant traffic to and from 1st class toilet from main cabin was annoying. Also, last moment (after door was latched) upgrade and seating of very ill main cabin customer to next to me was unpleasant.
Horrible experience trying to check in online very unclear what bags can be carried on the whole process of checkin was horrible
I didn't like the layout of the plane. Only 1 aisle with no area at the back to go to stretch or stand for a while.

The African American front cabin stewardess was very rude, unaccomodating, and unhelpful. I needed assistance with my luggage as it wouldnt fit into the smaller than normal size above cabin, and she was awful. She didnt help explain anything apart from taking my bag and running with it quickly to the front with zero explanation. Then when I asked, she was abrupt, cut me off and said it will be handled. She did this all with a sarcastic smile.   Which is far from what one would expect from 'flying in the friendly skies.'  Your airport personnel at Bozeman, who check in bags could do more with communicating to the customers. They had lines / queues of people who checked their bags and lined up to get their bags stickered and taken, to only find out at the front that they were doing a 'come to the front when your name is called.' which was completely inefficient and caused chaos, especially when you have families, with children, tons of luggage to include ski/ snowboard gear. I must admit this was the most horrible checkin process I encountered and I travel globally. Worst part, was how this is a small airport yet it was still chaotic.  Next up, United is great at sending updates via text and email. But when it came to finding out my gate was changed at bozeman, where was my update? None were provided and I almost missed my flight due to a lack of airport reader boards that provide gate information.  I gave united a chance on this trip when I normally fly Jetblue or American Airlines when I travel regionally. I was let down on the experience with this trip.

This flight was delayed due to aircraft maintenance.  That is not an acceptable reason for a delay, especially when the delayed inbound flight was the first flight of the day.  If you are taking care of your planes, this shouldn't happen.  As a result, I missed my connection and spent three hours in O'Hare waiting for the next flight.

The food was worse than normal. The breading on the Taos Chicken had not been made correctly. It was gooey not crispy. The snack turkey sandwich was made with one very thin piece of turkey and the cheese was very thin too! Why are you cheating us on quality when we fly to and from China? Very disappointed!!!
Disappointed that the gate checked baggage had to be picked up in baggage claim vs the jetway.  The ground crew at DSM are inconsistent and usually inefficient, unfortunately.

Did not like the fact that I was not allowed to bring a full sized carry on; only a small bag and purse. Baggage fees to check my suitcases were higher than other airlines. Distance between my knees and seats was tight and I'm not tall!  Offering a crushed bag of pretzels on a 4 hour flight was disappointing; at least offer some protein (nuts or trail mix). Enough complaining - United brought me home safely and on time after a very stressful two weeks following the death of my mother.  Thank you!
Check in process in Bozeman was very confusing. Also,  we made an error in number of bags and was charged $35 because they did not know how to reverse this.

The baggage claim experience in Newark was terrible.  Waited for over 30 minutes for checked bags.  Nothing showed up.  Had to go to baggage claim customer service before a representative checked to find out the cause, which was a stuck carousel.  No announce was made I checked and asked the representative to make the announcement.  Had my bag delivered the next morning ( 15th) at 7:15am. Baggage claim in Newark is always terrible.

Again tall guy at 6’5” I’m in the last row where I could not fit my shoulders next to the guy next to me who is the same high and sit next to the flight attendant in her seat for take off it was a super tight fit. The husband and wife in front of us tall guys the entire flight was forceably trying to recline there seats even though they couldn’t due to our legs be in the way. They did not stop from us asking or the flight attendant asking them. It lead to a very painful and uncomfortable flight.

I resent the tiered fares:  the lower your fare the more uncomfortable you are.  We sat in Economy and the seat in front of me was less than 12 inches from my nose.  The arm rests have to be climbed over to get out.  The aisles are so small even the average sized person hits shoulders, legs or elbows of other customers.  The bathrooms are miserably small and paper towels were overflowing out of the receptacle.  The miserable little bag of pretzels were stale.  We do not fly often and it used to be a treat.  Today it is simply a miserable experience from a comfort standpoint and I resent paying to check in luggage.

CAN YOU TELL ME WHY THERE WERE TWO ELDERLY LADIES (OVER 70) AND WERE OVERWEIGHT IN THE EXIT ROLL AND ANOTHER SEATED NEXT TO ME IN THE EXIT ROLL THAT WAS VERY OVERWEIGHT, HOW COULD THEY POSSIBILITY ASSIST IN CASE OF AN EMERGENCY, THEY COULD BARLEY FIT IN THE SEAT
OLDER ADULTS AND OVERWEIGHT PEOPLE SHOULD NOT BE SEATED IN THE EXIT ROLLS, I THOUGHT THE PEOPLE SEATED THERE WERE THE ONES THAT COULD ASSIST IN CASE OF AN EMERGENCY.

This was the worse experience I have had on a United flight.  The flight attendants were not friendly at all except the youngest blonde new hire. Seats were double booked, I was asked to give up my paid Eco Plus seat to move to a Eco seat with no compensation.  I booked my specific seats early enough to get what I wanted and paid extra.  It was all handled very poorly, too many people involved and it became chaos with the flight being late leaving the gate.

Flight attendants were jerky and unprofessional not helpful at all and when you asked them a question they would roll there eyes in discust and acted like asking if we could use the bathroom before landing was the stupidest question in the world. Not thrilled
The seats were uncomfortable, the seats were dirty with the previous passengers garbage and hair gel and NO ENTERTAINMENT!
I was forced to check a bag.  The same bag I take on every flight for the past 10 years.  It fits.  I know it fits.  I was forced to check it and I was very unhappy about it.

The problem with the flights was the pilots.  you need to include a category for them in these surveys.  It took almost 1 hour into the 2.5 hour flight before the pilot came on and said anything.  Specifically, when was the arrival since everyone was wondering as we took off 45 minutes late.  Further, we sat on the runway awaiting takeoff for 45 minutes and the pilot did not say a word - wht the hell was the delay for and set expectations for how much longer it was going to be.  then once we took-off it took another 30-40 minutes before he gave a terse update on arrival time.    very poor communication by cockpit

Baggage claim for our skis in Newark was a shit show!   Terrible!!!! This was a non-stop flight from Jackson Hole to Newark.... one would think Newark staff knew what to do with all the skis... but NO!   Absolutely ridiculous!!!!!over an hour to get skis!!!!! VERY DISAPPOINTING!!!!!!

Nearly missed my connection. No time to buy food for dinner or use restroom. Pilot referred to map of Newark being in seat pocket but there was no map of any airport and I was very unfamiliar with Newark. Fortunately for me the arrival gate changed to much closer to my departure gate or I would have missed my flight. Had to stuff my SMALL carry on under my seat so I wouldn't have to wait on jetbridge for it. This trip was a medical emergency for my mother, and we were charged so many fees and double miles used for a one -way ticket. I usually fly Southwest to St Louis, with none of these issues or discomfort. By the time we pay fees, baggage charges and buy a return ticket (NOT on United), I could have bought a Southwest ticket for about the same price and earned miles instead of using so many. Nothing FRIENDLY about your skies.
The was no room to sit and a delay to get on the plane
Both pieces of luggage have damage and broken items inside luggage because of damage
Hmmm, not that flight. However, I am curious why no survey request was sent for Jan. 6 flight to Manchester?  Very displeased with that one.  Checked bag lost for 5 days.  Unacceptable.
The restrooms were disgusting!! The walls were covered in some yellow/orange spills. The smell was horrible. And this was in first class!!!
lack of food in coach not good
thought flight attendance lacked in there role -- worst flight -- they just sat most of the flight

I was also very displeased with your baggage claim service. I just bought a new piece of luggage for my trip and when it came off the conveyer belt it was all scratched up and had black markings all over it. When I brought it over to someone at the customer service desk he immediately dismissed me saying that the markings on my bag were just wear and tear. This man who is supposed to be representing your company was very rude and not at all willing to hear my complaint and just dismissed me.
Gate experience chaotic. Crew switched to another flight and no staff knew what was going on. Departure time kept changing.
I expect a response to my concerns.  Broken seat, broken Direct TV, coach passengers accessing first class bathroom, and inedible food.
No food. Just unhealthy snacks.

Awful gate area in Liberia. Gate 1. Late arrival of aircraft. Very slow boarding bc no jetway and staff allowing people to carry on way too large bags. No gate at Newark. Them no door crew. Very slow baggage
The bathroom arrangement is terrible.  There s no reason why the front section of aircraft can’t use front bathroom. We had a line of 10 people cramming into the back portion of the plane.

Plane was 45 mins late to board. Took off 45 mins late. Got in Newark only 23 minutes late then there was no gate available. Holding on runway for 35 minutes. Then when there was a gate available there were no people to unload/direct plane to the gate. Customs 50 minute line.
I sat in a row near the bathrooms which smelled very bad.

I gate checked a stroller when I boarded the plane in Puerto Vallarta.  When I got off the plane with my family we waited in the freezing cold by the plane door on the jetway for the stroller.  I have two daughters aged 4 and 2.  The temperature last night was 15 degrees. I was told to wait there for my stroller by the plane crew.  The stroller never came. We waited almost 30 minutes in the freezing cold for the stroller.  After 30 and everyone left the plane including the crew I was told the stroller was sent to baggage claim even though I gate checked it and I was told to pick it up at the plane door. My family was freezing standing there and then to be told the stroller will be at baggage claim was ridiculous.  I then had to carry my daughters from the plane and through immigration which was awful.  I had a great trip to Mexico but my flight home was terrible. It really ruined the end of my vacation for me and my family.  This was a terrible experience and for this to happen when it is is freezing out is a disgrace.  I will be contacting the proper authorities and will be waiting for your prompt response. Thank you.
I got an upgrade for my 20000 miles. Unfortunately my wife did not. I was unhappy when a fight attended refused to serve a glass of wine to my wife who was sitting in the main cabin.

Configuration of the cabin and how close together the seats are makes for a very uncomfortable experience.  It felt dangerously Close.  No space even for a water bottle in the seat pocket.  No space on the tray table for a laptop.  All together just too cramped - the squeeze was taken just too far on this aircraft.
737-800 or 900.economy, 6 across, very narrow aisles.  Dangerously narrow aisles?
More meal-like options for vegetarians.  Very unpleasant boarding experience due to belligerent personnel.
There was almost no communication on the delay, only at the end there was some info. For a delay of almost 2 hours waiting in the plane before departure, that is not acceptable.
last year we arrived at the airport in puerto vallarta and it was complete chaos.  we arrived this year to find everything very organized.  all went smoothly at the kiosks and at the check-in desk.
We waited over an hour for baggage to arrive.  Extremely frustrated given the flight was delayed in the first place and there was no apparent reason for the delay in luggage.

Again, it was one of the worst flights I have ever taken. Something was wrong with the plane - the bathroom was broken and there was a loud whistle noise throughout the flight. The plane is so small that you can hardly function. Thank goodness I paid economy plus, but I cannot imagine what the others were going through. I cannot understand why United would provide such terrible service. One of the flight attendants was also extremely rude and should not be working in this position - I do not know her name. The others were fine. I have used United for years, but I will not use your company anymore. It was a terrible flight. Also, no in flight entertainment for a five hour trip? And the food for purchase was awful. Shame on you, United!
The staff was very rude in Punta Cana. I could see that they were not happy and I just didn't like the experience and how I was spoken to.
boarding messy could not hear annoucements, lines not clear by boarding group
really poor food and food choices

Newark Airport security was a disaster. I waited over an hour. I was also told that although I am TSA pre, that only works 95% of the time. So this was the 5% of the time that i didn’t have TSA PRE on my boarding pass and had to wait on a 90 min line. I almost missed my flight.

Flight attendant was not very attentive.  He never smiled once during our 16-hr flight.  When asked for refilling water, he told me to wait for the next beverage cart comes around.  I never heard that from a business/first class attendant in any other airlines.  Disappointing service for an expensive flight.

The checkin at the airport was very disorganized. There was a line of hundreds of people and the staff were slow and did not seem like they knew what was going on.  The security from checkin to the gate went smoothly however when we got to the gate it was a horrible experience.  The flight that was before us had not even boarded yet, when we were supposed to begin boarding within ten minutes on the following flight.  The gate was backed up with a total of three flights, therefore everybody was standing around looking for answers and the people at the gate did not provide any answers to people as to why the flight was delayed when the aircraft was sitting at the gate and how late the following two flights were going to be because of this one flight.  We ended up being an hour late, nearly missing our connecting flight to Boston in Newark. The flight attendants were very nice and helpful, however the people at the gate made for this to be a horrible experience.
no seats at aruba terminal delay 40 mins
Check in person was very rude and curt.
45 minute delay at newark due to a fuel truck blocking gate

United bought Continental, our former airline of choice, and you ruined it! We used to live in Houston and used Continental for everything. We now live in NYC and chose to try a flight home from Dallas. What a mistake. We had to check our own bags that we had to pay for. TSA was understaffed for a small size day so we had to wait about 20 minutes to get our bag checked by the only bag checker to find out we had a cork screw in our carry on with no knife in it. The plane was old and had no TV! We will use our Uniited miles and move on! Thank you very much for asking!
There is always a delay.  This time was oxygen mask issue.  Every time I fly there is at least an hour delay in Newark with United.  Really bad

There was a one hour delay due to cockpit equipment malfunction.  I asked for assistance in fixing my Direct TV.  The female flight attendant did not assist.  During the flight, I experienced several other issues with the flight crew.  The snack was basically thrown at the passengers next to me (middle and window seat).  The same flight attendant (young male) served my wine without a glass (small bottle).  When I requested a glass, he seemed to be annoyed and bothered.  Lastly, I needed my medication which was in the overhead compartment.  I retrieved it and due to settling, I could not close the overhead bin.  I tried several times.  The flight attendants were busy serving drinks so I waited for them to reach my row before asking for assistance.  When the female flight attendant reached my row, she loudly exclaimed, "Who went and opened this and did not bother to close it".  Like a young child, I meekly responded...."me" and apologized that I was incapable of shutting it and was waiting for her to reach me for assistance.  The disgust was obvious and embarrassing.  Considering recent allegations toward United treatment of passengers, I would have expected much better treatment.  I was so humiliated.

There was a long wait on the tarmac after landing due to our gate being occupied by another plane. Apparently that plane had issues which delayed its departure, and there was also some sort of problem with the equipment used to push the plane away from the gate. There were similar issues when we left Sioux Falls on 1/12. While waiting for our gate to be available, the air temperature in the cabin was turned up to an uncomfortable degree. When we were finally allowed to deplane our gate-checked luggage was released to us at baggage claim rather than at the gate. That was another long wait for any luggage to appear. We were stuck at the airport for over two hours after landing. At least we were not forced to miss connecting flights, but it was still an unpleasant experience.

The flight was delayed due to an earlier flight being late and the flights the rest of the day were trying to catch up.  This would have been useful information to receive.  I kept seeing waiting for aircraft flashing on the board but I was not sure if it was coming until the plane finally arrived.  Passengers do not like delays but the are unavoidable so keeping us informed helps keep our frustration to a minimum.  I would appreciate compensation as a result of the delay.  What can you offer me?

Aircraft looked old / dirty - was not cleaned properly. There was no room in the seats (and I am only 5'1"). No seat back pockets. Our flight landed 40 min early however we sat on the airplane for 40 minutes with NO information as to why or when we would be at the gate. Had to pay to watch tv...... the free wifi did not work. Very dissatisfied. Horrible experience.

I was very disappointed with my experience at the EWR airport.  We landed in EWR on schedule and even 30 minutes early, however there was no gate available for us.  The ground control did not anticipate this and did not reassign us a gate until 20 minutes AFTER we were scheduled to land.  Once we got to the new gate, our original gate had opened, but we needed to be towed in.  The tow broke and we were unable to park at the gate for an additional twenty minutes.  After arriving thirty minutes early, we sat on the plane for over an hour and arrived over thirty minutes late.

I have flown with united for years and while I know some things are out of the airlines control, yesterday we landed 30 minutes early and had to wait 1.5 hours for a gate which needed a tow. This tow then broke and we had to wait for yet another tow to pull us into the gate. This resulted in people missing their connecting flights and personally, I missed an extremely important dinner. This is usually never the case but I am extremely disappointed in my experience yesterday.

Landed 30 min early-sat on plane 1 hr 10 min because of gate problems, planes in alley, and broken tow-in vehicle! Absolutely unacceptable in 2018!! United at  Newark has to get act together! Second flight booked with United in past year, both disasters!

The flight left on time and arrived30 minutes early. Unfortunately the gate we were suppose to go to was occupied. We had to wail until the plane left. Then we were told that the plane had mechanical difficulties and they were heading to another gate. When we finally got to the gate the plane had to be towed in. During the towing process, the tow bar broke and they had to wait for a replacement. Finally got to the gat3, now 40 minutes late!  To make matters worse, there were a number of passengers who had connecting flights. The flight attendants made one announcement asking passengers to remain seated and let those who had connection leave first. But this was made 15 minutes before the plane got to the gate. Then everyone got up. Connecting passengers started screaming, but the flight attendants did nothing. Finally another announcement was made. But a little too late. The flight attendants could have resolved a lot of irritation if they would have repeated the announcement in a timely manner. I was lucky I did not have a Connecting flight. Many others did. I’m sure they missed them. Shad.

First class flight attendant was not up to United’s high standard.   First she tried to block my overhead storage for the use of First Class passengers even though I had bulk head seat.  After I was upgraded to First Class I asked her if she could hang up my coat.   She ignored my request.

I FUCKING HATE the 10 minutes of marketing bullshit you force the crew to read over the speakers.  Stick to the the legally required safety information and then shut the fuck up. I don't want to listen to some harpy voice pimping all of your stupid shit for the first 10 minutes I'm on the plane.  It makes me want to hurt people.  I know we're all trapped in your plane, but that doesn't mean we consent to be forcibly marketed to with whatever bullshit you're selling that week.  Seriously, just make sure we're all safe and ready to go, then shut the fuck up.
Baggage claim delay was awful
The seat didn't recline properly. The landing was awful. The two flight I had we're so bad I woke up the next day in so much pain I could barely move

The fact that there was faulty electrical on the flight - no entertainment and either all cabin lights on or off for the duration of an 8.5 hour flight - is inexcusable.  It made for a very uncomfortable and boring flight.

Man sitting next to my girlfriend and I was incredibly drunk when he boarded the aircraft. At one point he grabbed my girlfriend’s arm to which I told him to keep his hands to himself. I informed a stewardess who said she couldn’t do anything about it. As the flight continued, he was served three additional beers (one was free from the flight attendant). The man ended up urinating all over himself towards the end of the flight. I would’ve expected the CSA or flight attendants to stop the man from boarding the flight or even stop serving him alcohol. Really disappointed with the lack of good judgement.

There was a dog that was yelping for quite some time on our flight and then went to the bathroom. The cabin smelled horrible after this. This is unacceptable and disgusting and disruptive and needs to be handled in a different manner in the future.

Not only were the checkin attendants extremely not helpful but they offered no help and gave wrong information which caused a delay of 1.5 hours.   When I went to the customer service counter after we finally got through security - 2 reps who had no other customers refused to help, look me in my eyes, and basically said they are completely powerless to help.
Sat in the very last row due to the fact that I wasn't aware I couldn't select my seats and it was extremely loud and smelled.  Very disappointed.

I have flown first class many, many times on United.  On this particular flight, the flight attendants were, hands down, the worst we've ever had.  We've flown first enough to know the routine - hot towels, then a drink with warm nuts, then half an hour or so later, dinner.  This is usually followed by the offer of more drinks or water or coffee.  On this flight, the two male attendants came through with the hot towels about 30 minutes after takeoff.  Within 15 minutes of that, they served drinks and the nuts.  The nuts weren't warm at all.  Before we could even start eating the nuts, they were setting dinner trays down.  It's like they were in a rush even though it's an average 4 hour flight.  I didn't order dinner, but my wife did, and she hadn't even had a chance to eat the nuts when the dinner tray was put in front of her.  She told me her dinner was barely warm.  She was hungry though, so she ate it.  She did tell one of the flight attendants that dinner was almost cold.  I couldn't hear what he said to her.  Once the dinner trays were cleared, we didn't hear or see from either flight attendant the rest of the flight.  they never came around and offered more drinks or even water.  In fact, they closed the little curtain up front, and that was it.  They were just terrible.  Never had such an awful first class experience in my life.
didn't have enough communication from crew about how long delay would be, when we would arrive (in order to tell people picking me up) and no offer of water during long, hot delay

It was very cold on the plane in our area. People tried to protect themselves with  winter coats and hoods. I talked 3 times with 3 different crew members, they promised to fix this but nothing was done, no one came back to me with explanation. As a result, both of us got sick and still cannot recover. Food was awful at high cost.
No problem on this flight back but lost my golf clubs on flight from Newark to Ft. Myers on 1/7/18.

You need to tell your customers if their seats are being changed or not. Only to be told on the plane that our seats were changed, NOT next to each other is unfair. I would not recommend flying United.

The flight was delayed  - first for a half hour, then various other amounts of time as the plane was "in the hanger" for mechanical delays. We were three hours delayed -  no other planes to substitute ?? I arrived at my destination at 11:30pm for no apparent reason
The flight was uneventful but the attendants said they ran out of certain foods offered but the big problem was the temperature of the cabinet.  It was very uncomfortable.

I didn't appreciate the fact that they called my name over the loud speaker to ask if I would switch my first class aisle seat for a first class window seat all so that some guy could sit with his 20 year old daughter. I declined but someone else changed leaving my "new neighbor" to be a guy who was 400 lbs, sick as a dog and said "sorry, you are going to have to move out a lot b/c I have to pee a lot!" I can't believe I got stuck in the bad situation all b/c someone else had United playing "musical chairs" with us.  Tot op it off, the guy and his daughter never spoke and slept the entire flight!!!!
Plane had no amenities It took over 40 minutes to get to a gate after we landed. Terrible,
A very large person, not fat, set beside me. I had to lean out into the isle the whole trip. I paid for a full seat not a half one. By the way person setting beside me was a crew member dead heading.

The female gate attendant was very condescending. I asked her about the upgrade list and she told me that there were 6 people ahead of me.Basically saying I had no chance in hell of getting an upgrade to first class. I was treated poorly.

Flight attendant in the main cabin, J-K-H aisle conducted herself in an unprofessional manner on several occasions.  Ignoring PX requests, and appearing to resent having to move in the aisle.  Appeared disoriented and unbalanced on occasion.
Flight attendants are constantly burdened by doing their job.  Terrible attitudes. Unfriendly.

Baggage charges were high. We had a bag that was overweight by 2lbs and were charged $100- even though the week prior- we were not charged at all. Personnel that took our baggage did not take the time to discuss or understand our needs and were only rushed along.

My KindlePaperwhite was stolen during my flight 958 on 1/14/18 from ORD to LHR. I was holding it in my lap while I slept. When I awakened, both it and my pillow had disappeared. I searched my bags, pockets, the seats, and the surrounding area thoroughly, multiple times. I asked the flight attendants for help. They made an announcement on the plane, but no one would return it. I asked people sitting around me, but no one saw anything.  I'm very upset about this. I was not behaving irresponsibly. The flight attendants were not helpful, even though there were few people on the flight who could have taken it.
My luggage is in Newark, I'm in Costa Rica without my goods, a bit angry

I was on the UA flight sponsored by Air Canada. When I got to the airport, my name was taken off the flight by AC without any notifications sent to me and UA said I’d need to speak with AC myself to fix it even though I was running out of time. I almost missed my flight and had to run across the airport to get on the plane. It was terrible.

It was very frustrating and sad to have to deal with no screens for personal entertainment. While the plane offered to use your personal device for entertainment, but there are many problems with that. 1- advanced notice should be given at least 24 hours with very clear instructions so people can download the United app at home, not at the airport, where some people may not have the data to do so. I received an email only 2 hours before my flight took off, by that time I'm already in route to the airpot.   2- It was terribly inconvenient, I often look forward to just plugging in my earphones and watching a movie. This made it tedious and time consuming, many people had questions and concerns  3- For some phones, when the headjack for ear phone is being used, you can not charge device at same time. This left me with an empty battery by the time movies are over, makes people choose between charging or watching entertainment .  4- people/customers around you sometimes may not carry or want to use headphones, the person behind me was watching movie on speakerphone, does not create a quiet environment for people surrounding them. Overall, I would prefer to stick with the screens

United should reconsider the Basic Economy option. I picked it for the first time and was very disappointed with the WHOLE experience.  I understand that with this options there are restrictions but the savings was not great and I happy with the way I was treated.
The flight attendants where not the nicest. And I felt they where rude and just kina of threw things to my wife and I
The flight arrived early, a glitch with baggage (apparently there was a bag blocking) led to a delay.
No.  We travel to Chicago almost every 3 weeks for cancer treatment.

1.  When the gate changed three times, no one/no one informed the passengers on the PA that there was a gate changed!!!  I almost missed my flight!  2.  Once seated, the pilot never got on the PA to inform us as to what was happening on the ground as it continued to snow.  These items are not too much to ask for and I expected to be informed.  I, along with other passengers, were irritated!  Black flight attendant was rude.  Very disappointed with United this trip but then, that seems par for the course.

I was seated in last row of plane I was extremely claustrophobic could not move my chair back could not get up to go bathroom Horrible experience  Left plane with backache Never again Also to have to pay for tv? I couldn't even reach for my credit card  Really back row ppl don't count? I should be compensated for my lack of services

My flight was not well controlled at all. The ladies next to me were making out and basically in each other's laps the entire time. No one was listening to the flight attendants and pilot saying to take their seats when there was turbulence and people were crowding by my seat instead. There were people shouting at a game behind me and everyone in the plane jumped every time because it sounded like something was wrong. The group of guys in front of me were obnoxious and loud and constantly moving about the plane. It just seemed like the attendants did not have a handle on anything going on. The service was fine, they were polite, just not paying attention or taking charge.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: One flight attendant (Dan) ruined our experience.  I was traveling with my wife & two kids.  Dan was passive aggressive & I confronted him.  He does not seem happy with his job.  He complained to me that he could not be certain of his response to me because he was not provided the right tools by United.  our discussion was about my daughter's peanut allergy.  Which we take very seriously.

My luggage was broken. The wheel is lost with a piece of material attached to the luggage body. It is big trouble to carry 2 luggage’s without a wheel. The luggage service just say no responsibility for any wheels.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Seat 33A and 33K should be marked as "limited leg space" on the 777-200 when sold, there is the emergency exit mechanism that is limiting the leg space and for an extra paid seat it is a limitation. I would have paid to get the 20A or 20K instead of the 33K. Also people from basic seats jumped to the plus seat after the take off and that made me feel like an idiot for having paid extra to get less leg space. Disappointing experience

The gate attendant actually kept us up to date as the departure time kept sliding.  I flight that was due to arrive in Norfolk at 9:14 pm actually arrived at approximately 12:25 the next morning, January 18.  It was a perfect storm of the incoming flight being delayed by almost an hour and the outgoing flight crew not arriving until approximately 8:45, by which time a near blizzard had started at O'Hare.  That created a need for de-icing, which seemed to take forever.  I know these matters were largely out if UAL's control, but it nevertheless was aggravating, and it made for a lousy work day on Monday.  So, I understand, but I was not happy.

I booked the flight because my reservation was not available in the system. This was a result of me missing one leg of my round-trip reservation and therefore my entire trip being nullified. I was disappointed that communication of this policy was nonexistent. I was not able to get any credit for the $104 I paid for the existing Chicago to New York flight I had originally booked. Furthermore, if this policy had been communicated clearly beforehand, I would have been able to purchase a new one-way ticket for a lower price much earlier on. I missed my flight on December 16th and was only notified of this policy at the check-in desk on January 14th. Had I been informed about this policy sooner once I missed my flight on the 16th, I would have had an entire month to purchase a new one-way ticket for a much cheaper flight. I paid $201 to book a same day flight to return to campus for my first day of classes. It was an overall disappointing experience for me, which I regret greatly as I have been a loyal customer for several years.

A luggage cart collided with out airplane rendering it non functioning.  Given, this was already after we had returned to the gate after leaving the first time.  We taxied for an hour and returned after the restroom on the plane was not functioning.  Eventually this flight was delayed 5 hours.  We again taxied for almost an hour.  It took much too long to de-ice the airplane, and our pilots timed out.  After we again returned to the terminal, we were all put on a later flight.  Which, was delayed, and which also taxied for an hour before we took off.  This was by far one of my worst traveling days.
received an email receipt for a purchase I did not make, but the passenger next to me made. Obviously just a minor error based on seat arrangements.
Flight attendants were rude, no paper towel or tissues in the bathroom as they were “out”, I was not given pretzels and had to go back and ask for some, one of our bags was lost, flight was delayed

It was quite disappointing how delayed the flight ended up being. We sat at gate after boarding for approximately 30-45 minutes due to refueling and only 2 people helping unload/load bags associated with the aircraft.

It didn't seem like the flight attendants were terribly informed about policies around baggage. I was given different information three times about how I could stow my bag kept having to move things in order to accommodate the new directive. It was very disappointing because I ended up with the arrangement I had begun with - bags in the bin far back in the plane while I was in the front.
Its a 5 plus hour flight. A small bag of pretzels + half a cup of soda with tons of ice is Ridiculous. Reconsider pricing. I rather pay upfront then to worry about small transactions onboard.

I was disappointed that i could not use the United Longe since i had a day pass which i get with my credit card. I went to the airport early so i would have time in the lounge. I had to walk to another terminal since there was no lounge by gate 108
The flight itself was fine but our luggage did get lost and not make it to our arrival location which was a bit disappointing.
For the price of the business class seats the experience that came along with them was absolutely horrible. Not worth the price of admission. Was extremely disappointing in the quality of the cabin.
Gate agents had a terrible attitude were unnessarily difficult. Forced me to check a bag I carry on all the time.

Plane  was at EWR for at least two hours before we boarded yet the FC section was not clean. Peanuts and other debris on the floor near my seat, in the tray for drinks. The seat in front of me was broken and kept reclining past maximum into my lap despite the fellow doing what he could to make it sit up. I couldn't use my lap top because of this problem and had his seat inches from my knees.
We had to fly through turbulence so there was no service on this flight, it was only 35 minute flight so it was no big deal.

My poor husband was wandering around terminal 3 looking for me with our 1 year old son and could not find us for almost an hour. Worried, only to be told Mych later was in terminal 1. You apparently depart out of 3 (where all your signs tell people to go) but fly into 1!  You took an okay flight experience and made it miserable at the end. I will not fly again with United in fear that I will be mislead. Especially after I paid an additional $134 for a seat upgrade and the plane was no where near full.

The flight had a number of issues that were dealt with very professionally by the pilots and attendants. Prior to the take off I was upgraded to 1st but not told until I asked. The experience at Concourse C in Newark was terrible. I tried to use my pass to the United club and was refused entrance. The entire experience was terrible on the concourse as well as in the Club area. I will try not to fly through Newark in the future!
Absolutely bad service. Wouldn’t recommend United unless absolutely necessary
It was delayed and there wasn't good reason or good communication.
The aircraft looked and felt older.  The seats were not comfortable at all, even in Economy plus.  The cushions were not easy to sit on for a lengthy overseas trip.

On our flight to MSP, a guy smoked a cigarette in the bathroom during the flight. The flight attendant asked him during the flight if he just smoked a cigarette in the bathroom, and the guy responded yes. After we landed, nothing happened to the guy - he was able to walk off the airplane. This is a serious federal crime, and the guy should have been in trouble. What would have happened if the smoke alarm went off? Luckily we arrived in MSP safely, but it was kind of worrisome for the rest of the flight.
Flight attendants very rude and unatentive ... drinks service very poor very mean
The tsa security point in Newark was horrible. There was one tsa huminoid trying to sift through 10 persons belongings. A line formed and a damn near riot broke out.. The people at the check-in were

I am very thankful for the air sick bags. I became unexpectedly sick and needed the air sick bag. I was very grateful it was available or that would have a really mess. Please don’t ever get rid of the air sick bags.

Unfortunately, I didn't select the correct options (flight and arrival experiences) and your survey doesn’t allow one to go back.  The temperature during the flight was ungodly hot to the point I became nauseous.  After telling the flight attendant it took way to long for the temperature to come down.  Although the flight left Newark late we arrived almost on time however we could not get off the plane for over an hour because the jet bridge was broken.  The pilot said the Memphis airport said they were having issues with this specific gate all day.  So why use it at 10:15PM?  I would imagine there where many open gates.  Additionally, we were told it would be 5m – 10m several times until we finally were towed back and proceeded to a new gate.  I believe we finally got off the plane around 11:30.
We used a global system upgrade for the flight and were unaware of the new changes affecting these upgrades.  We were disappointed to get upgraded minutes only before boarding.

This flight was delayed first due to a delay of the crew's arrival and then miscommunication between personnel. After a very long day of traveling it was incredibly inconvenient and we were not in any way compensated for this. Beyond that, United's rates for any changes is outrageous and we will definitely be avoiding flying United if at all possible.
No problem
no i wish i was told about this problem and could have avoided having my clothes wet.
aircraft was dirty, late and the agents were harried and not interested at all in anyone's issues
I still have not received my luggage two days later, and the agent was very rude on the phone and provided inaccurate information that did not reflect policy on the website.
Customer service in Newark Airport was horrible !! Rude and unhelpful !

This leg was much better than the one from London to Newark, which was deplorable.  I paid the same upgrade amount for both and this was close to worth it.  Seats are not comfortable and pitch is minimal.  Biggest problem was my daughter and I BOTH got food poisoning on the flight and were sick for two days afterwards.  We fly a LOT and will try not to take united again.
Horrible Customer Service

Yes was very upset didn’t have my kosher food and was treat as dog bringing the food from economy class with no fork spoon knife and told me here take , no tray no nothing !!!! Gave me 15,000 miles that I dont won’t have 2,222,000.00 and offer me $275 electronic certificate, when I am global 3rd year in a row , when 1K customer that didn’t have kosher food on January 4th got for it $200+ $300 (maybe you should check it somebody I know and I can approve it  Very upset as paying full business class over $7000
Blond female attendant on her 50-60’s (covering rows A to E) was extremely impatient and rude.  Clearly not happy doing her job.
Noticed difference at gate where group 1 and 2 were marked but no other groups. Less confusion after boarding began for grp 1 and 2 passengers.

I was scheduled to arrive in Las Vegas Friday night and didn't until almost 11AM the next day. I was flying out Sunday night so my weekend trip was cut way too short. Delayed notifications, poor communication. I arrived at the airport at 4 and with all the delays, the flight didn't leave until 930PM. It took me 20hrs to get to Las Vegas.
There was a gap of 15 hours between meals served leaving most of us starved
rude and discourteous personnel; no food available for more than 9 hours

UA cancelled UA4691 ORDCMI and did not provide any protection to get me to my destination. They told me I can go standby because there were 4 seats left however refused to book me since the only seats left were extra comfort. I asked if a manager could override this and was told no. I asked if they could use a rule 240 and book me on AA ORDCMI and was told AA was sold out. I was offered a flight on Tuesday even though I start veterinary school Tuesday  at 8AM. I offered to go into BMI but was told standby only. The only way to get from ORDCMI is using Peoria Charter or Illini Express. One does not take animals the other only allows 1 piece of luggage and I had 2 plus a cat. The only seat left on both buses the entire day left 5 hours after my arrival and didn't take animals. I ended up leaving my cat behind with my mother, my emotional support animal to be exact. I took UA910 into ORD but not sure what to do when I got there. At 2am my mother was able to book me on the 845am AA ORDCMI which had plenty of seats, although the price was $272.00. Now I am in CMI and my cat is in LAX. I need my cat here.. The only solution is for my 60yr old mother to fly my cat to me. Please redeposit the wasted points we used on this flight so she can do that and do whatever you need to do to get my mother a roundtrip ticket LAXCMI so she can bring my cat to me, preferably by this weekend. It will be a 24hr trip,which is also a lot of stress and strain on her not to mention the inconvenience and time she will have to take off work. Although the flight was cancelled due to air traffic control, UA picks the flights they cancel so the bottom line is you cancelled my flight and never offered protection of any kind.

The flight attendants on this flight were not particularly pleasant. Years ago when I switched to continental from Delta, it was because of  flight timings and direct flights to Newark, but I had also experienced a fairly decent crew each time with some flight attendants being outstanding. This flight had one flight attendant with the worst attitude I have seen. While she used the word please, her tone was consistently rude to all passengers. Unfortunately, their badges are not prominent enough to read the names so I do not have her name.
Such a stupid reason to be delayed could have been avoided.
we were not offered a snack on the flight, which seemed quite odd to me and was disappointing
horrible seating codition made worse for me with oversize passenger bringing his oversized package

Baggage drop off at Nashville was unorganized and took over an hour which caused delays at TSA which in turn resulted in us running barefoot to our gate and almost missing our flight. We left articles behind at TSA Bc we were so concerned with missing our flight. United staff there needs to get themselves together. An hour to drop off bags is unacceptable. It was the most stressful experience I have ever had at an airport.

We missed our connection in Chicago due to a broken seat that needed repaired prior to take off. This was the first flight out of SDF to ORD so I don’t understand why you wait until your passengers are loaded to fix a broken seat; this should have been checked prior to loading passengers

This was the worst flight I ever had. The flight attendant offered two meal options in first class but when I asked for one of the options they said they ran out. How do you run out of food in first class. The flight attendant accused me of giving my drink to someone in coach when I was traveling by myself.  Told her that the other attendant took the glass but not the bottle but she did not believe me. She then stopped serving me at that point. Even the people sitting around me said the attendant is very nasty to you. She came around and asked others for drinks and food but ignored my orders.  Very disappointed. Will not use United unless I have to.  No one will probably read this message but if someone does please consider additional training for your attendants. Considering the price of my ticket in first class the right thing to do is ti rebate my trip.
Just a really gross experience. I felt like I needed to shower after sitting in those disgusting and filthy seats.

I was extremely disappointed to find out we had to each check our carry on sized luggage for a $25 each fee. I will never fly United again. For that, I could have checked a huge suitcase and not a small tiny carry on suitcase. Will not fly United again as we spent a total of $100 for our luggage round trip! That’s ridiculous!!!!!!!!

The flight was fine, the aircraft was fine, but the new blue (fake leather) seats are like sitting on cardboard boxes.  I had worked 50+ hours on a show in New Orleans for the last three days and was almost up all night before this flight.  I couldn't fall asleep because I had to keep shifting.  Very uncomfortable.
The boarding process was horrible. They were testing a new method for boarding. Go back to the 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 numbered lanes. Your new boarding is like American...which sucks.
Terrible service ! People of  this brand always were rude and in a rush ! also, When I bought the tickets, they charge me with some extra fee
The flight attendants named Jimmy and Jeff were extremely rude.

Hello:  The flight was fine. We were a little bit behind schedule, but the pilot managed to get us to PR as fast as he could.  I felt safe during the flight. Prior to our take off, we waited for over 40 minutes.  During this wait, I couldn't help to overhear the conversation 2 of the crew members were having in their cabin.  This conversation make me feel VERY anxious, since I am afraid of flying.  The crew member "Rey" was telling a co worker about how a Delta flight waited for so long and took off without "de-icing" the plane, and apparently, when that happens the plane does not get enough lift, so they crashed.  He then added in a sarcastic tone, "there were many survivors, like none".  I obviously felt worried and horrible because we had been waiting for a while and I had no idea if the airplane was properly defrosted or whatever.  The person he was talking to even replied something about him being so negative.  I think this obviously was an innapropiate conversation to be having in front of the passengers or when they can hear you loud and clear.   Also, the food and beverage passed by my seat, and I don't know if it had to do with the fact that I was seating in the last row, but they didn't stop to offer me or my sister who was sitting next to me.   After the cart was put away a very nice crew member offered me something to drink and brought me water.  As I said, the flight itself was good, but the service I thought was extremely disappointing and the crew member was insensitive and unprofessional with his comments.  Regards,  Ivelisse Aponte

What seemed like a normally scheduled flight turned into an 1.5 hour delay with NO forewarning. At the gate, things appeared to be operating as normal despite a late board (with no mention of the tardiness). Then once aboard, deicing took some time but I was most appalled at the lack of awareness for passengers. I would hope any future flights will have better communication of this both in-person and electronically (I never received any notice of a delay).
Lack on informations Unpleasant employées at the Airport (Newark ) and on board.
Frustrated when the flight continued to be delayed. The delay times were very inaccurate. It started at 10 minutes delayed and eventually grew to 2+ hours delayed.

Got a text message that flight was delayed.  10 minutes before original departure I got another text that flight is on time.  As a result, I barely made my flight and had to plead with the person working the gate to let me in.  She did not handle me immediately as she was doing other stuff.  She knew the urgency and the stress I was dealing with but did not seem to care.  Although your policies state that persons should be at the airport two hours prior to, I was in the parking lot when I got this text literally minutes away; a very small airport XNA is.

The reason for my low scores, was simply the flight attendant showed up 30 late, which cause the whole process of loading to be delayed.  Since the weather was bad, it cause a delay in deicing and lost our slot of takeoff into Chicago.  I don't know why the flight attendant was late, but it cause  more stress in the day.
It was a smaller aircraft, but had more set & lag room.
Unhappy with loading method.  Go front back to front it would be smoother.  Also, flight delayed and gate changed.  Never told until time we were to board.
All the passengers were aware of the bad weather and had made it to the airport in plenty of time.
I hate the E145 product

Pro:  The pilot was very personable and entertaining.  He kept us informed throughout the flight and even got us to Chicago 9 minutes early despite the weather. Con: The desk attendant in FLL was not personable or helpful AT ALL.  I unfortunately dropped my class ring outside of the Budget rental car drop off area, and was trying to get information about who could help retrieve it.  It was bad enough that the gate agent behind us he desk could. or give me a number or location for lost and found, but he was unwilling to help obtain this information for me, and was very unnecessarily rude about it.

The communication from United to the passengers once we deplaned was pitiful.  We were forced to stay in the area for 4 hours, when we could have gone and eaten food.  then there was another hour delay because of no food on the plane...catering was not ready....this is poor logistics management.  The passengers would have been fine with eating breakfast for lunch and not delay another 75 minutes.  You caused me to miss a very important business dinner by arriving late and I had given myself 3 hours of additional time and you needed 5.  I think safety is paramount and I was fine with switching planes and having a delay, but at least half the delay could have been mitigated and allowed the passengers to go away from the gate.
After take off no problem, before take off almost a disaster

We pushed back from the gate 10 minutes early, and then sat 10 feet from the gate for 1 hour. During this time, there were not even announcements made to let us know why we were stuck. I understand that weather can cause unforseen issues/delays, but the lack of communication is unacceptable.

The only problem I had was with how narrow the aisle was and how narrow the seats were. It was next to impossible to pass through to get to the bathroom. Once at the bathroom there was no space to allow one person to get out so that the next person could get in. If for some reason we hit turbulence at that point, people could have gotten hurt.   I never have problems fitting in seats, and I barely fit in my seat. I get smaller seats equals more passengers but it's getting a bit ridiculous.

I am most especially dissatisfied with the takeoff time. The flight was delayed for about an hour, which just made the journey a little rough. One minor additional inconvenience was that one of the flight attendances did not ensure that she asked each row if they wanted snacks. She passed about two rows (mine included). But the attendant serving the beverage ensured that he asked everyone and patient enough to receive responses and made eye contact. I really liked his demeanor.

Firstly it is outrageous toTrivialize the safety demonstration the way you continue to do so - NOBODY watches it, even those that start to This is not helped by the blatant Boeing advertisement at he start - essentially single sourcing your aircraft guarantees higher prices in the long term and higher fares for customers ( I am a stock holder in both ual and Boeing btw, but speak as a customer) Lastly it is preposterous to keep us seated on the plane while the gate agent has to call for HI immigration/ agriculture forms because your company is a) incapable of having a supply on board (presumably you knew we were flying to Honolulu today? We all did!) b) it was beyond somebody to do fix the problem during the 11 hours we were en route, the captain’s words of advice ? “We arrived early so it’s not a problem”
Pressure Liberia Customs to add additional people. This is the third time we flown into Liberia Airport and it has been always the same.  Over hour and half delay to get out.
stop being greedy there is no leg room in the plane and it become a lousy experience. we try to buy food and they ran out of Sandwiches. Terrible trip from start to finish
The staff at the Newark airport were rude and not helpful at all.

PLEASE - stop making the plane seats so darn close to each other. I can't believe how close the row in front of me is - i feel guilty putting my seat back because I'll be practically laying in their laps.

Yes.  The Red Carpet "Pop UP Club" at Newark Airport is an insult to Red Carpet members.  No milk for cereal, no bagels (in fact, no bread of any kind) and NO BATHROOMS.  You are treating your Red Carpet members as if you do not care if they are Red Carpet members or not.

Flight attendants are very RUDE & AGGRESSIVE. She was screaming from front of plain to the end . Toilets doors are not working . They could at list suggested to use busyness cabin restroom. After all no passenger deserve this kind off service after they pay that much money for they flights . BAD BAD BAD

Was not able to have my meal choice was told clients have priority even in First Class. Attendant served all guests before us then returned to them with a bread basket and we were not served a anything yet. Then we were told we could not have the warm meal there was not enough for all..12 people? Half galley I was told. FIRST class ...very disappointing.  Also no TV's for a long distance flight is also very disappointing
Plane was very hot ,that was only negative thing.
The plane was dirty - garbage on the ground and food - and this was the first flight of the day! Bathroom garbage was overflowing within the first hour. Gross.

there was a connecting flight that was late and you held up our flight because you wanted to get them on there.  2 freaking hours.  you lied and said it was a wedding party, it was not.  2 freaking hours.  we had a party of 9.  would you have held the plane for us?  I doubt it.  Lied and said there was not another flight.  There was.  I checked.  I really doubt I'l fly united again unless you are my last choice.  and guess what, we travel in a group of 10- 20 people.  Get your act together.

The attendants when in the back galley of the plane were using foul and inappropriate language at a volume where those seated in the back few rows could hear.  They were speaking poorly of another co-worker.  They were cursing very often.  Service was actually quite rude in a way that was quite unprofessional.

For flying business/first I would have expected the flight attendants to be more attentive and responsive to request.  Rarely were they asking for beverage requests and did not have the snack/beverage cart easily accessible during the flight in the galley.  In addition, slippers were not offered and the food was inedible.  Sadly disappointed as this was my birthday trip. Even the flight to Paris the service was disappointing however I didn't receive a survey for that leg of the trip.

Panama City flight checkin was one of the worst I have seen.  No self-serve kiosks, United personnel guiding people to the correct line were surly and not helpful, inadequate number of employees at the counter resulted in over 1 hour line just to get boarding passes.  Since we had no baggage to check, this was all very frustrating.

We were very disappointed to learn that the only food for the 9 1/2 hour flight was a choice of purchased items offered only once - during the first couple of hours of the flight. This was not explained to us either verbally or via written information.  We were not aware that we were to go back to the galley if we desired to have food or drinks. Even beverages (other than water)  were only offered at the beginning and 30 minutes before the end of the flight. This makes for a very uncomfortable flight. We were also disappointed to learn that the plane did not have personal screens at each seat. Other than renting (for 10 bucks, no less) an ipad, there were no options for entertainment. We have never before been on a long flight without free entertainment. Because there were no screens, we also were disappointed to learn that we would not be able to track our flight, keeping track of where we were on the map, and time and distance from place of departure and to place of landing.  We have always had this option on trips over the Atlantic. Why not the Pacific??  Not what we expected from United Airlines!

Two things.  ORD-PVG is a long trip - 14 hours.  I feel that the bathrooms in Business and First or for all should be kept cleaner.  Second item -- and I reported this to the FA, I found a broken glass in my meatball.  I was chewing on my meatball when I discovered the piece of glass.  Not good!

We were given very little information at the gate desk about the delay (timing, additional info).  Basically we were left to fend for ourselves and call customer service to come up with a solution.  It was very frustrating sitting in limbo with no information being provided.

My flight from St. Louis to ord was 5 hours late. The gate agents and the lack of Information provided were awful. Two separate planes that we were going to use had maintenance issues. We boarded and deboarded twice. What should have been a simple 45 min trip home ended up being a 6 hour ordeal. Definitely not happy or satisfied with this experience
The bad delay experience was that the EVV runway had ice and snow despite the fact EVV personnel had several days to plow.  The plane got stuck.  Weirdest experience ever.

United luggage checking policies are extremely annoying.  When the airlines started charging for checked bags, that was very annoying.
