And now that there is this fare category where you can't even use the overhead bins without paying extra is even more annoying. Doesn't sound very friendly for the friendly skies.

1) My seat was so uncomfortable that it caused my lower back/tailbone tremendous pain.  It physically hurt to move and try to make myself more comfortable. 2) Like my first-leg flight, my 5 year old daughter was seated by herself in the middle of the cabin while the rest of us were seated in the back of the plane (and not together either).  Not acceptable at all.

1 out of 4 bags on EWR-LAX did not show up (3/4 where sent ahead on an earlier flight). The baggage recovery people at LAX ignored our request to pick up the bag at LAX the next day and gave the bag to a delivery service with the wrong address in the wrong city, with the delivery service "unable" to return the bag back to LAX until another full day had passed. On top of that, when I called the lost baggage 800 number the bot said that there was "no information" on my lost bag, but the person at the baggage claim had indicated that the bag was already loaded onto the next EWR/LAX flight. So we drove for an hour back to the United LAX baggage claim late that evening just to get an update (after trying to get info from the 800# but always getting the "no info" feedback). The person at LAX indicated that the flight had been delayed for 4 hours and that was why the bag had not shown up by the time the first person had indicated earlier that day. The 800# is USELESS and FRUSTRATING and WASTES PRECIOUS TIME. And the lost baggage people don't communicate with the people who are routing the lost bags to their proper pick up locations and they're inputing erroneous info into the system (wrong city with no such address). Your lost baggage process is really, really BAD! And that's from a million miler who's thinking of using Virgin America for the 5X EWR/LAX trips I make a year.
Very poor service and bad attitude from flight attendant named Caroline.
Your customer service is absolutely horrendous. I may never fly your airline again after being treated with such disrespect. You really need to train your staff to treat customers properly.

I waited over an hour for my one bag that I checked. Only to not get it.  Before I left the airport I called global services who told me to leave and would transfer me to baggage for delivery addrsss. Baggage said my bag was there so they would not deliver it, though I had already left airport. I came back to airport only to find global services would deliver. So now 1.5 to 2 hours later I was leaving airport again still without my bags and waited until the next day to get it. I was utterly disappointed in the service.
Paid extra for economy plus. Entertainment screen broken- asked 2 attendants about it and was ignored. Had no book and had hoped to watch a movie on a day flight. Poor customer service!

You need a better arrangement for check in at O’Hare. The kiosks are too close to the bag drop and no one knows how or where to line up for the bag drop. Too many inexperienced travelers make this chaos every time.

The gate agent was rude and demanded that I gate check my briefcase. I fly often and know it will fit. I informed him of such and he told me to take it up with the flight attendant.  Not a pleasant way to start a trip.
Seats are very uncomfortable in economy plus and leg room limited. Also, no Wi-Fi on the 145’s. Don’t believe 145’s should be used on flights over 2 hours.

Flight was delayed from 10:40am until 5:30pm with NO explanation except to sat waiting for aircraft. Customer service was no help, no one at gates to explain delays, numerous gate changes with no announcement except on boards or phone apps. Bad weather but that was NOT the reason - we finally found out after getting on the plane from an attendant that it was because of 3 planes that had mechanical issues that could not leave departure city to connect with us. We only wanted to get the correct information and be told what was going on - no one at United would tell us.  I asked to cancel and get my luggage back and was told NO.  Last time was posted at 6:10m - went to get something to eat and 5 minutes later we were told leaving in 20 minutes so we ran back to gate - did not leave for another hour. Vert disappointed in United service.

The United service has declined to the point where it is a huge irritation to fly United, and completely unreliable.  On the way to Barcelona I was delayed a total of 9 hours.  There was no apology, no information.  Our flight from Newark to Zurich was 4 hours late, causing me to miss a 3 hour 40 min connection in Zurich.  I then had to wait 5 hours for the next flight.  In Newark there was virtually no information given to us, and every time we asked, we were told that they knew nothing.  I was told that if I was concerned about my connection that I should go to customer service, where there was a two hour lineup.  The service on at your desks and on your flights has become rude and downright hostile.  It was sadly so obvious when I transferred to a Swiss Air flight and was treated responsibly and respectfully.  There are no protections for the passengers flying on the US airlines and you clearly are taking advantage of that.  If this had been a European airline, I would have been responsibly compensated for the delays.  All I saw from United was unbelievable arrogance and rudeness and 15 Swiss Francs.  After I complained you offered me a $100 coupon - for stretching a trip EWR - BCN to 30 hours!!  And, then checking area was madness.  All I had to do was drop a bag as I was fully checkin in and I had to wait in lines for 45 minutes.  I've watched your airline decline, as I've been a loyal United customer, to the point where it is embarrassing.  I'll be looking for a different airline to be loyal to now.  United is an embarrassment.   And no, I will no longer be suggesting your airline.  I'll be telling people to fly another airline where they can be treated with respect and to steer clear of United Airlines.

Though the flight was extremely delayed, and flights scheduled for later in the day left before my flight, the communication throughout the process was adequate. It wasn't exceptional, just adequate. I assume there was some kind of mechanical issue with multiple aircraft to cause this kind of delay. But the root cause was never communicated. I'm not sure why United tries so hard to keep customers from getting the whole story.
Very bad seatpitch in Economy  Class

I am not happy with the check in procedure to board plane.  I always get 4 and by the time I am able to get aboard there are always problems with bringing on board my small carry on.  The attendants do not monitor the first groups of passengers so the overhead compartments are filled with coats and personal items so there is no room for later passengers to store their carry on baggage.   It is not a fair system.

I had an aisle seat and even when I would lean into the seats I was still getting bumped by the flight attendant. What really was frustrating was that I never heard an apology or even an attempt to avoid contact.  I opened up my tray table to rest my book on and it was filthy. I looked around and noticed how unkempt the entire cabin was... just looked and felt grimy.  I was pretty surprised at the poor experience. Unfortunately I do believe this will impact my choice in airlines for upcoming trips.
The temporary United Club in Newark is awful. It is dirty, overcrowded and noisy.

The airport experience at both O'Hare and DC National was disappointing. At O'Hare there was a gate change about 40 minutes before scheduled time for boarding to a gate in a different terminal/concourse. It was a long walk. At DC National the ground crew was not ready for the flight's arrival and had to be called by the cockpit. We sat on the plane waiting for ground crew. Why is that?

Our business class seat area was very unclean, I even have a picture of the yellow ear-wax tainted ear plugs that were left in our seat areas (9J and 9K, I believe).  This really tarnished our business class experience, and made me think future upgrades/purchases of business class may not be worthwhile. Also the bathrooms were not fully clean, and it seems like maybe the cleaning activities during turnaround in Amsterdam were cut short.  The old, yellow ear-waxy earplugs are something I'll always remember from the flight, quite unsettling and gross when you expect business class.  Thanks, Elizabeth OBrien, traveling with Stanley Orszula
Flight delayed two hours and getting updates was woefully inadequate

This airline sucks! I will never be taking United. There is no doubt that the service you guys offered are horrible, will definitely be sticking with Cathay next time for Hong Kong. Charged me 100USD for a checked bag, where almost every airline allow 2 checked bags for flights to HK. RIDICULOUS AIRLINE!
Its very upsetting that I offered to upgrade to business and the effort that the representative put in to help me with the upgrade was poor.

We were delayed due to weather, understand that but there was little to no communication to the passengers. The gate agent at O’Hare spent most of the time down the ramp with the crew. Baggage claim was deplorable at CMH. Almost an hour to get our bags. Inexcusable. Will avoid this airport in the future.
Communication was very poor and difficult to know when the delayed/ cancelled flight was going to go.  The gate agent was difficult to understand.

upon landing within 6 hours I was incredibly ill.  My dr said it was either a 24 hour virus or food poisoning.  I ate the appetizer, miso salmon dinner, a cup of noodles for snack and the frittata on arrival.  I also ate a truffle upon arrival- which I note was expired- the packaging stated an expiration date of 1.6.18 (I travelled on the 13th)  Not sure if that was what did it, or something else but it was not a pleasant 24 hours upon my return.

You separated my boyfriend and me (and we specifically bought our two tickers together so that we could SIT TOGETHER) and gave us horrible, uncomfortable middle seats apart from one another for both of our flights. This is ridiculous. If people buy ticket together, SEAT them together. Your practice of forcing people to pay extra just so they won't be separated is absolutely disgusting. I'm never flying United again and will recommend the same to everyone I know.

Long delay on arriving aircraft from Dayton then very long delay on the taxiway.  The CRJ200 aircraft was very worn and not comfortable.  The flight crew didn't communicate nearly enough and the flight attendant was not what we expect from a United crew.  Totally opposite to our flight from BTV to ORD 4 days earlier.  Very disappointing.

The reason I was so dissatisfied is that we arrived in Chicago about one hour late, which was fine, because the aircraft left late and we were not boarded yet, so that was fine.  However, after touching down in Chicago we did not get to our gate and disembark for about one longer.  There must have been some issue with the gate related to the snow.  But the lack of communication from the captain and the staff was hugely frustrating.  They maybe came on once and said were we delayed.  That was obvious.  They need to establish a regular update cadence, my suggestion would be every ten minutes.  At least that way you would know that the crew acknowledged the inconvenience and was trying to make the best of it.  When you are forced to sit and get no update all you get is mad.  This happens frequently at O'Hare.  I travel frequently and assume you decide to take off and land knowing there is n gate ready so you can announce an on time arrival.  What you need to be measuring is an on time de-boarding.  Communication, even if inconsequential, is better than silence.

I wasn't traveling to Chicago I was supposed to get to Fort Smith Arkansas not only that but you couldn't even get me back to South Bend after my flights were cancelled.  I had to take a bus.  And it has now been 4 days and I still do not have my luggage.  My Luggage actually made it to Fort Smith.  Now had I not went back home I would have been 4 days with no clothing! Yikes!!
I am a 6'1 male. I understand airlines are out to make money. I do think it is unfair that I pay for a seat and my knees are up against the seat in front of me. It makes for a very unpleasant flight.
food bad, limited carry on space is deplorable.

United Airlines has been my #1 choice with flying anywhere. I have booked over 10 flights for myself and others with this airlines. However, I have a small travel roller carryon luggage and boarding the flight yesterday before getting to my seat i was told “I HAD TO CHECK MY LUGGAGE BECAUSE THERE WAS NO MORE ROOM ON THE PLANE.” I had valuables in this luggage that I didnt care to go under the plane and asked can I check first before because this happened to me a few times proir to boarding and there was a few empty over head compartment space? I was told NO! I gave my last name, stepped to the side and took out a book and my tablet, and put a TSA master lock on the pocket zippers, I also locked the bigger compartment of my luggage with the combination already attached. There were two gentlemen waiting to take my luggage under the plane and the young lady who told me I had to check the luggage, standing with my new luggage print out. When I received my luggage in Newark the lock was cut off. The line to make a complaint was very long and the person I was traveling with and riding home with, our way home was already there waiting.
Unfortunately my bag was destroyed by the conveyor belt and was delivered  to me at baggage claim in said condition.
No wifi - plane was too hot, seat uncomfortable

This flight was incredibly disappointing. The airplane was out of date and there was not much as far as amenities. There were no snack boxes on board to purchase, and as a 1K, this flight singlehandedly has made me consider switching airlines.
Was announced by the crew that due to lack of food on the plane that we would be compensated via unitecares - site not currently identifying our flight (UA 1552).  Very poor.

Hi, there was no food loaded on that flight! It was over 4 hours, I had to take my medication with some food but they forgot to load the food for purchase! Therefor I was left hungry and not able to take my meds till I landed! Very disappointed

flight attendant Jennifer was rude, confrontational, and made a scene in front of other passengers.   She needs more customer service training.   This is not the in flight experience that us frequent business travelers are looking for at all

I was disappointed that although I had requested a RPU when boooked, others were upgraded above me.  There was no explanation that I was able to receive when I called to understand why this happened.  Additionally, as it was my son traveling on my miles, as there was no upgrade, there was a fee for baggage that was not able to be waived.  I would think at a Global Services member, this small charge should have been waived.  We are approaching the end of the year and I have upgrades that are about to expire.  This has happened before as well.

despite booking months in advance, my wife and I were separated stuck in middle seats and were not allowed to search for new seats when I checked in 24 hrs in advance. was in last group to board - little space for personal items. disappointed

Too crowded with little personal space. My wife and I flew economy. We get constantly reminded that we have no benefits and no carry on and can't even guarantee that we sit together. That is not customer care even fro your lowest fares.

Original flight on 1/10 from ewr to Knoxville was not good. One piece of my luggage never made it onto the flight. That bag contained all of my grooming equipment. I was unable to groom for clients on Wednesday afternoon as planned. Those clients had to seek the services of another groomer and i lost $275 of income. This trip to Knoxville was for the national cocker spaniel dog show. Tracking my bag was a run around. No one knew where it was. The flight was not fully booked so there was no reason my bag should have missed the flight.

There was no vegetarian option.  Flight attendant was not helpful. Flight attendant did not circulate through first class cabin offering water or any other beverage. This is not the usual United experience.
Flight attendant was very rude.

Flight was delayed and missed a meeting in Kalamazoo. For a non-weather delay, passengers should be compensated accordingly. Really dissatisfied with the service, especially with having to get on the plane and then wait well over an hour to move.
Flight attendant was very rude & short with passengers.  She kicked someone off the plane for being rude.  She was Not a good customer service person

The gate attendant was very rude to other customers who had questions.  It was unfortunate to experience as I don't fly United often and was discouraged after seeing this as I am looking for a airline for my business travel and international travel.

Car seats (even the FAA approved seats) do NOT fit appropriately in the economy cabin. If you install seats rear-facing then the person in front of you can't lean their seat back. If you install seats front-facing then the person in front of you gets kicked the entire flight by the child's feet. STOP stuffing passengers onto planes like sardines. Flying is incredibly uncomfortable mostly because airlines don't allow for passengers to have enough room, just so they can stuff as many people as possible onto the plane.

Also we were in row 9 abc&d and by time they got to us my son and daughter were able to buy classic snack boxes then we were told they ran out! in row 9!!!!!!  we also asked the steward for more water -we were told to wait (which was fine ) BUT he never returned the rest of the flight with the extra water we asked for!!!!!!  horrible horrible horrible flight!!!!!!!!!!!
The delay was unavoidable as it was due to weather but the aircraft was old and tired. I wouldn’t mind seeing the CRJ200’s retired. Small seats, small overheads.

Delay caused by overfueling aircraft for conditions.  This resulted in aircraft being overweight and ultimately had to be defueled.  Had ground operations done their job properly, flight would have been minimally delayed.

I am a 1K member, I was sitting in first class, and I felt the FA did not make me feel like a valuable customer. She seemed irritated throughout boarding. She asked to take my coat and then stuffed it indelicately into an overhead above my seat. Normally when the FA takes my coat they hang it up, if I had known she was going to be rough with my coat I would've kept it or put it in the overhead myself, but I would not hand my property over to someone to watch them rudely manhandle it.
Sat on the runway for an hour for plane de-icing but there was no communication about why we were sitting there. Flight was also delayed.

@ Newark, the United employs were inattentive and rude near the baggage carousel. Many people were missing bags/luggage and the employees just didn't care. Rolling eyes, condescending speech, nearly zero effort to help. IT was beyond frustrating just tryi

Not only was it delayed by an hour we then had to circle in the air for about 45 minutes at the end. United Airlines is always terrible. I fly with you because you are cheap but it is never worth it. Honestly the worst airline out there
The lady at the security check point was so rude, unprofessional and inconsiderate

Probably beyond your exclusive control, but we sat on the tarmac for a full hour before a gate became available. The flight was exactly on time.  It makes the flying experience very unpleasant.  I would ask that you drive some change in this area as this if often systemic. The flight was otherwise very smooth.
My tray table was filthy. It had stains from drinks. Looked like the plane had not been clean in a week or too. It was disgusting. It is not the first time your plane is disgustingly dirty.

I am just upset because my flight the week before was canceled due to winter storm Greyson and work. Was trying to avoid the weather issue so I rescheduled my trip for a week later and had to pay an additional $275 on top of my ticket price. Total of around $600. I had flight insurance but AIG told me that my flight was not covered. On top of that my rescheduled flight got canceled again and put me behind another day so I lost more money because I missed my pick up at Newark a day of deer hunting that had already been paid for. When try to reschedule to get on another flight customer service was not good at all and I kept getting put on hold for 20 min at a time when I tried to talk to a manager. Very frustrated and will not fly United again.....  Jeff Tinsley Quality Manager

The food was awful and the cabin disgusting.  The bathrooms were small and not very clean.  We departed on time and arrived early so that was the one saving grace.  I fly frequently and United has become the worst airline.
Used Global services to go the security checkpoint. No bins. Needed to put my mink coat on the dirty conveyor belt. Asked for a bin but was refused.
I reported a lost item and have hear nothing yet. I was very disappointed with the left on board number I was told to call. The man on the phone was very difficult to understand and not helpful.

the seats on the flight to cancan were the tightest I've ever experienced. I am small (5'3" and 135 Lbs), and I was uncomfortably mashed up next to my neighbors, who were also small women. If I was uncomfortable, I can only imagine how bigger people feel. The flight on the way back to Chicago had a little more room.
The printer at the Newark airport printed out someone else’s boarding pass. It was very scary!

I have major complaints with my trip to Detroit.  I realize I bought a basic economy ticket and should have read all the fine print.  My son did not fly out with us to Detroit.  On reaching the ticket desk, I mentioned this to the agent and was told to not check him in and he would still have a seat back. Then, when I went to check us in for our return, Sean did not have a ticket – even though I was told he would when we left Newark.  I called customer support and was told I did not have a ticket, since he did not fly out and that was considered a change.  The reps told me the agent at the desk was not correct and I had to buy a one way ticket for $173. Reason I was not happy with United and will definitely consider not flying with United again unless absolutely necessary >I was told by a United employee that all I had to do is not check him in and he will have a ticket back.  I realize I did not read all the fine print, but I would expect a United employee to give me the correct answer.  That expectation was incorrect.  And as I told the customer service rep, it should not be a customer’s job to know United employees responsibilities.  If that agent did not have the right answer, she should have told me to ask another United person or call a rep – NOT give me an incorrect answer.  If I had known he did not have a ticket, I would have had him go home with the people he went out with. >If my ticket gets cancelled, I would expect at least an email that my ticket is cancelled.  Because Sean was a no show, my ticket was cancelled.  I heard nothing from United with that information.  It should be part of the system to notify a customer when the ticket is cancelled. >In my naivety, I did not consider this a change.  I considered it – me paying for something I did not use (the flight to Detroit). >Lastly, the customer service reps were very confrontation and not helpful.  One rep – Millie – even questioned my parenting skills and how I could let my 14 year go to Detroit with another family.  She also asked how a 14 could drive – which was ridiculous.  These comments caused the conversation to escalate to a point where I said things I actually apologized for.  I will not have a customer service rep question my parenting or any behavior.  That is ridiculous and very poor customer service.  Also, I asked to speak to her supervisor and Millie told me she did not have one.    Until I refused to talk further and asked many more times, did she transfer me to another representative.  Given the environment and travel being a price driven market, I would think United would have better customer service and treat customers properly.  I am more angry at the way I was treated on the call and given incorrect information than anything.
Just keep people informed of what's going on.  1 hour/20 minutes sitting at gate with jetway pulled after already 3 hour delay and no information is not cool.

I have already submitted a letter of complaint.  The flight landed, but we were not allowed to de-board because of gate problems.  We waited 45 minutes parked in front of the gate area.  We missed our connection by minutes - no effort was made to help us.  This was the last flight home.  We ended up renting a car and driving home in poor weather.  Our checked bag, however made the flight.  United handled this all very badly.

Your First Class overhead bins do not have space for bags specially those like me seating on the bulkhead seat. Flight attendant wanted my bag to go on a bin in Economy away from me. Your on board food options are very bad and scarce there were not many options - I am used with the “basket” on American flights which have lots of options including fruit. But I have complained so many times about your food options on board and see nothing ever changes

Not sure this can be improved but the wi fi access was very spotty. A notice should be given if it is not accessible at a certain time before descent. Also, I didn't receive text alerts regarding the delay going to Chicago.
Stop flying the ERJ145. The plane is horribly uncomfortable. On flights longer than 30 min it is unbearable.
Crappy to know updates from gate agent. Lack of time of departure at gate
Gate was moved and no one told any passengers. We were delayed because we did have a flight crew and no one knew where they were.

The gentleman sitting in the middle seat of my row did not fit. The arm rests had to be put up so he could fit and even then, I only could sit on half of my seat. I understand that this is a sensitive issue, but if one cannot fit in an assigned seat, one should have to purchase two seats.

My flight sucked so much because the standby traveler in the window seat next to me decided to use me as her personal backrest to sleep. So uncourteous and even when I said something and moved constantly to shake her off of me she just gave me a nasty look but continued on. She also was wearing leggings!
The De icing took a long time considering 2 days before you knew the weather was going to be bad.  I almost missed my connecting bus.

the lounge had  no paper and very little food. the area that they have food was moved and they had soup in a certain area. The lounge by the gate had nothing to eat and just soda and chips. Very disappointing

The plane I was on, which was the same plane and seat I was in from Newark to Charleston, had either a dirty window or was very scratched from where the jetway docks to the plane so there was very limited view out the window.

* When checking in at LIR, I was told that my bag was four pounds overweight (at 54 pounds), when I had checked in, it weight 44 pounds and I purchased no additional items, feel there was something incorrect about the scale * The line at immigration and customs at Newark was incredibly disorganized and long and there was little assistance in understanding where people should go to the point of people being quite heated
not enough leg room crappy, overpriced food terrible wi-fi, also a rip off
Departure delayed causing frantic dash across terminal to catch connecting flight.  cramped cabin. lost luggage on flights to and from Liberia.  hard to believe.  not good.

We tried to apply a Regional Premier Upgrade, both ways to SFO and back. No chance. Being 1K, we ended up below 10 or lower in the upgrade list.  We have been unable to use the upgrades in 14 months -either we were upgraded without them, or when we tried to use them they didn't work- and now we will lose them because they expire at the end of the month. My point is that those upgrades are basically useless. The rules are so strict that they are impossible to be used, if only a limited amount of upgrades can be used on each flight. It is wrong to offer them and make it impossible to use them.
The flight attendant didn't offer free headphones.  There was no snack service, probably due to time of flight.

United changed my seats from row 9 to 39B.  I couldn't sit with my children.  Flight attendants overserved gentlemen in seat 39A (counted 7 whiskeys). He was drunk and inappropriate on the flight with me.  No one stopped serving him.  Ski bags were sent down carousel 9 instead of sending to odd size baggage, thereby damaging skis.  Didn't make any sense at all.  This is third trip in a row with united with baggage being lost, delayed, mishandled or missing.  I am god status and long term traveler with united and very disappointed in recent experiences.  Note flight to San Francisco the wifi was spotty and the televisions were not working at all.

Delays and missing flights due to the crew not available on time is frustrating.  Not to mention everytime I fly into Chicago, it takes forever to taxi in which causes very little if any time to catch my next flight.

The new seat covers are horrible. Who wants to sit on an unbreathable fabric for 5hrs! It is extremely uncomfortable as perspiration makes the back of your shirt and seat of your pants wet/ damp. I have no idea how this fabric was tested and thought to be a good idea. Totally unsuitable.

I live in Chicago.  It takes about 1 hour via private or public transportation to get to ORD from the city.  This is a common experience for many Chicago residents.  I received an email that the flight was delayed almost an hour due to weather (late incoming aircraft).  I can understand that as it was poor weather that day.  So when I had extra time, I continued on my day.  Just by pure happenstance, I checked the flight status ~30 minutes later and now, with the help from another plane, showed the flight ON THE ORIGINAL SCHEDULE.  At that point, I had to rush to the airport, almost missed my flight, only to release by the time I got to the gate, it had been back delayed an hour.  I appreciate the extra effort to try and get plane out on time, but HOW WAS THERE NO NOTIFICATION SENT TO LET PEOPLE KNOW IT WAS BACK ON TIME??!?!?!  That literally should be against FAA regulations.  To top it off, once we got on the plane, we sat for another hour while it was de-iced.  Can't this be done while we are not crammed in the plane?  Terrible pre-flight experience.

I payed for extra legroom, two rows back from first class. That meant I boarded last. By then all of the overhead in my area was full, leaving me as having to check my very small bag containing just comfort items such as blanket and food, as they said my purse had to go under the seat in front of me. This is so unfair. I always check my luggage and am horrified at what others are allowed to carry on. I paid extra and those with super economy tickets used my bin space. I am considering using Delta Comfort next time with assigned overhead. I really like United but the complete disregard for those of us who paid for extra leg room was insulting.
flight was delayed on the tarmac, uncomfortable economy seats.

It's interesting that you ask us to answer questions about lots of things but not about our trip.  The flight was 30 minutes late in boarding, and still had to be fueled.  We departed 45 minutes late and I missed my shuttle to take me to my final destination.  There were no apologies.  The pilot zoomed off the plane with no "good bye" and apology for making us so late.  Boarding is done too late and, given the number of bags folks bring on board, it's impossible to store them all so that makes for even more delay!  Make checking bags free and folks will return to checking bags.  I was really unhappy with the delayed arrival of my flight into Phoenix.
The Newark embarking was HORRIBLE.  They had us on the ground in the smallest area and did not have the lines set up for 1/2/3/4 like most places do. Very dissatisfied with Newark.
There was a delay leaving Chicago which happens but when arrived in Newark, there was no gate and passengers sat on plane for close to an hour waiting for a gate.  Unacceptable.

The delays leading up to the departure made no sense. The plane was in the Chicago airport for over 2 hours and it was late moving from the international terminal to the domestic one. The staff kept telling us that the plane was on the way but it was not. I am sure they were receiving misinformation but it was unfortunate as all the passengers were getting very antsy.   We were also delayed on landing in Newark. We had a gate and then the plane at our gate had a mechanical problem which was really frustrating. We then got switched to another gate but that plane had yet to push back. We were on the runway for over an hour and 15 minutes waiting.

Seat pitch is inadequate.  Boarding process, especially handling of gate checked bags, is ludicrous.  On four flights in the last two months, all the roll on bags in Group 4 & 5 were gate checked.  Why not just tell people in advance that is going to happen?

The pre-check area at Newark is very congested and disorganized. People coming off the air train and escalators pile up and nothing is able to move. Once past the congestion things move better but it's a horrible experience up front

No meal in first class is unacceptable. I want a refund for all 4 seats I purchased for 1st class upgrade. Bags of chips and bananas for a $500 upgrade is unacceptable. If no refund, I will start using American and delta! Jwan42@yahoo.com. GYK57110

I had booked first class fare for the entire flight from Portland to Chicago, Chicago to Pittsburgh. I paid expedia for the entire first class fare. When I went to confirm flight I was only first class from Portland to Chicago and economy from Chicago to Pittsburgh even though I payed ffor firts class. When I called both expedia and then United It was told too bad but could pay upcharge of 400.00 for the second flight even though I payed first class fare. My Husband needs leg room due to a physical issue and so I had to buy up to economy plus for an additional 160 dollars. I find this very dissatisfying as I use United as my preferred airlines.

Poor employee communication/providing updates regarding delays on tarmac in ORD after landing and waiting for gate to open.  Flight was already 2 hours late and additional delay on ground in ORD was heightening tension of passengers.

Originally I was sitting in a window seat that I had booked, but had to move because the person next to me started throwing up. I was then moved to a middle seat, which was uncomfortable, but the real issue was the person sitting next to me. They had extremely strong body odor and also took off the shoes and socks to make it worse. I had to sit the whole flight with my scarf wrapped around my face because it was nauseating. The person also did not respect my space and had his arms fully on my seat. Unfortunately, it was an extremely unpleasant flight.

The flight was delayed and while the staff and pilots kept us updated, it was frustrating to hear that we had to wait, then because we were waiting that we had to be de-iced, then because we were de-iced we lost our place in the take-off line, etc..
The window was broke so I had sun beating on me and couldn't work on my iPad. I am always tsa pre approved, not this time....  I wrongly got charged for my luggage.
very bad experience. one of the business seat didn't recline... no lounge at Punta Cana airport.  THe luggage was delayed in Newark airport for more than 40 min.
The seat and floor in my area was dirty with food and crumbs. Lately it seems more often than not the cleanliness of the cabin is not good
Flight attendants were not the nicest.  They overlooked me to serve me a drink and looked annoyed when I called out to them.
my phone is with the airport lost and found. Have spent more than 2 hours on hold. system is weak

We sat at gate for a lengthy period of time with no explanation.  Then we taxied to de-icing.  40 minutes late departing.  Sitting in a crappy economy seat with nothing to drink/eat or any entertainment is not good.  Why don’t you make those seats even smaller!
The flight attendants didn't seem much interested - looked bored during the safety talk.  Based on the apparent attitude I would not have felt comfortable if the event of an emergency.

Upon arrival to DAY, it was announced that all "green tag" (i.e. carry on bags that have to be gate checked due to aircraft size) would not be delivered on the jet bridge as usual, but delivered on the regular carousel.  I had to wait one hour for my carry on bag to arrive, thus putting my total delay at four hours.  Unacceptable.  United's regional carriers are incapable of on-time operations and therefore make the whole United network unreliable and one I must seek alternatives to.  Checking to see if American will status match, as out of PHL, my home airport, I would be able to avoid regional carriers most of the time on AA.
All delays are crappy and inconvenient. The communication wasn't ideal which caused a lot of frustration and anxiety amongst those who were waiting.
Stop overfilling flights.  It sucks

The F/A spent much of the flight in her jump seat playing Candy Crush on her phone. I witnessed this twice and so did my travel partner when we went to the Lavatory up front.  She also forgot to bring my travel partner’s meal.  He had to ask for it.  A bit disappointing and not really much care for a First Class Service.

I'm very disappointed with the service and experienced on my flight from STi to Ewr. First of all my flight was for Sunday 14. When I get to the check in counter I was told that I'm not able to board the flight and that I need to re-scheduled for Thursday 18. After speaking with several representatives from the company they were able to put me in the next day flight still having to pay $40 fee. This is not good customer service at all. It's very inconvenient for who travels and for the person who's picking at the airy port having to go out of their way and make last minute changes.

I would like to say that the women's bathroom in Newark was pretty disgusting. There were several inflated toilets that might have been stopped up and a lot of hair in the sink.  Maybe a lot of people were off because of MLK day, but otherwise, the airport has a big problem.
No mobile check in with a carry on is very inconvenient, the seats were quite small and I’m not a large person. Also the flight was delayed 30 minutes
The embraer planes are horrible.

The plane was at the gate for 3 hours prior to the flight and yet n one knew there was an issue that would cause the aircraft to be taken out of service.  Flight was delayed almost 3 hours, communication was poor, when aircraft was swapped- it was same aircraft- but my seat was changed.  There was limited food once we did take off.  Overall experience was underhwhelming
Once again negatively impacted by operational failures. Maintenance / equipment problems were discovered last minute requiring an aircraft swap and 2.5 hour delay - AGAIN.

Air travel has become a painful experience.  I avoid it at all costs in my personal life.  I will drive 12 hours a day to avoid air travel on my dime.  And the my experience on this business trip only makes me want to avoid air travel more.  Top complaint:  Seats way to small and uncomfortable. Flights out of and into Chicago were late. Sat in plane 1/2 hour or more waiting for gate. Security is always a pain.  On the plus side your employees were very pleasant.

Jammed on the aircraft for a 4.5 hour flight. A 747 for such a long flight is unacceptable. And no movies unless you purchase direct TV is not good customer service. Furthermore the Newark airport was not accepting one time United passes...no reason given. What’s the point of applying for a united Visa then. Yes, I was very disappointed.
flight was delayed and I received NO text notification - also when landed in Columbus sat on runway for an hour and only offered water
I received no email updates about gate and delays while in Chicago, except for one with the wrong gate.

My flight experience was overall terrible. Initially, I was impressed with the check in at O'Hare (the step 1, step 2) as everything was very clearly labeled so I knew where to go. But the flight was delayed 2 hours, we went past Columbus and circled back, and we had to wait on the Tarmac for 45 minutes because there were no available gates. Then, to top it all off, the bag I checked planeside was sent to baggage claim, so I had to wait with tons of other people for their bags which is what I tried to avoid by checking it planeside. I was supposed to get home around 7, but I got home around 10:30 PM before work the next day. It was not a pleasant experience.
Bad experience

Ordered a bbq chicken sandwich; it wasn't on the cart when I paid for it.  I had to ask 2 different flight attendants after waiting 15 minutes and another 10 minutes before it was delivered.  and it was terrible.  There was almost no chicken and it had been microwaved so long the bread was dry and hard.

We departed out of terminal A Had to “check and drop” bags (very inconvenient).  Attendant was Very Rude..he was on the phone the whole time.  Looked at me and said “are you going to hand it to me”? It was on wheels! Very disappointing.
The snacks were poor.  A bowl of nuts for first class...really?  Your competitors offer a basket of choices with nuts, chips, fruit, cookies, etc.  Again...very poor
My bag was lost on the way there. I had to snowboard on the mountain with a rental snowboard that was awful and put a damper on the whole trip.

Flight was as usual satisfactory.  The dinner meal was O.K.  but the so called salad is tasteless. Two of the chooses for the main meal are pasta or vegetarian both of which usually involve pasta. The sandwich served later is greasy and unpleasant - not worth having.

Seats too close/pitch.  Have to keep arms pressed to side so middle seat has somewhere to put arms (I had aisle).  Always completely full and people abuse overhead bin space.  Check roll-ons more thoroughly.

Ref: Passengers -  Mr Jason Gardner: Mileage plus #JK639753 Ms Alicia Ramnarine: Mileage plus #ME708345  My concerns are outlined below.  Departure flight - Jan 9. 2018 1. over an hour delay sitting on the runway with no offerings of food or beverage.  The delay was a result of issues with the plane.  The fact that no one came with offerings of food or beverage for an 8am flight led to severe discomfort and turned our 11.5 hour experience to beyond 13 hours.  2. When the plane did finally take off, we were told there was no Wifi.  This led to failure of being logged on to work on the flight and resulted in delays in my workload.  3. FREEZING temperatures on the BOTH the departure and return flight.  The departure flight to Newark was on Jan 15th, and an OVERNIGHT flight.  The freezing temperatures on the flight kept us up the entire flight and when we asked if there was anything that can be done, the response was simply no.  We would have expected that the attendants be willing to accommodate even in the form of offering us another blanket. However, that was not the case.  The point of the overnight flight was to be able to sleep as both Jason and I had work the morning we landed.    Jason and I kindly request that you review the above concerns and reach out to us to discuss further.  We request that this gets escalated to management and reviewed accordingly.  we can be reached at 347.228.8860 for further discussions.  Your truly, Jason Gardner & Alicia Ramnarine

The flight was Freezing. It was so uncomfortably cold on the flight. I had one blanket over my legs and another blanket over my head while I was wearing a hooded sweatshirt with the hood over my head and I was FREEZING. It was so uncomfortable that I will not forget that experience when booking another flight and will look for other airlines to fly when traveling.

People were allowed to bring carry ons that were too big, causing other people that boarded after them to check their correctly sized ones. Flight attendants couldn't shut the overhead bins some of the bags were so long. Those bags were turned sideways, and small bags were taken out and forced to be checked.  There was no legroom. I am only 5'7" &my knees were up against the seat in front of me. Made for  a very unpleasant flight.
i think basic tv should be included for the amount of money i paid for my flight.  I had to pay for basic tv;  unacceptable
The plane itself was old and quite tired. The seats were not comfortable, and the overhead bin space was inadequate. Not ideal for such a long flight.

Yes both my trip flying to Ft Lauderdale and the return it was extremely frustrating that I paid an upcharge for my seats to get as close to the front of the plane as possible, row 12 going, row 20 coming home, and in both cases I had to put my carryon bag 10-12 rows back from the row my seats were at. Ridiculous, I am paying an upcharge for a bin over my seat or very close by. I actually was late to a meeting because I had to walk back 12 rows to row 24 to get my back upon arrival to Ft Lauderdale, and it cost me atleast half an hour when you figure in getting off plane, getting a cab etc. Why pay for the upcharge in seat if my amenity is not offered. The flight crew should monitor that, there were plenty of people from the back of the plane who insanely put their bags towards the front not by their seat, I witnessed it.
baggage service at Newark was terrible. my flight was 20 minutes early and I ended up waiting for an hour for my golf clubs. totally negated the early arrival time. unacceptable.

I had a claim at the baggage area from damage that had occurred to my bag when coming to FLL. The gentleman was very condescending and rude. I walked up cheerful and asked if he worked for United and he shook his head no (supposedly jokingly) and then did not even ask me about what happened or what I wanted. He came out with a "replacement bag" and gave me a huge attitude when I didn't want it. He got snippy saying everyone else is happy to take a replacement bag, that he was doing what I asked, when he in fact never even asked me what I wanted. I told him I thought he was speaking to me inappropriately. He then started to change his tone.   This after I already had a very bad experience on the way down from EWR. The gate attendant forced me to check my bag when others got on the plane in groups after me with much larger bags! He yelled at me and was inappropriate as well.   United also moved my mother and I from each other the day before the flight. When we asked to be next to each other we were told no. My mother has communication issues and cannot speak loudly. I have never had such a bad experience flying ANY airline as I had this past weekend on BOTH my United flights. I am appalled by the way I was treated by the majority of the United attendants I encountered.
seating is an insult to the human body.   a 5hr flight for my 6'6'' torso requires a chiropractor

Overcrowding and lack of overhead room makes flying unpleasant at best. My wife had to hold her coat the entire flight. That is unacceptable. And don't tell her to put a $2500 shearling coat on the damned floor under the seat!
Those small RJ are dirty, uncomfortable, and the waiting to pick up your bag on a sub zero jet way is so premitive.
The A319 is a very poor plane. The over head space is FC is TERRIBLE. The FC seats are not comfortable and the table is almost impossible to lift into place.
The “food” is disgusting. I was on that plane for 5 hours and you offer cheese and crackers.
Clearly my flight ended in chicago because ur asking about my flight from New York to Chicago, but my luggage went to Florida and I was told I booked to go to Florida, very unhappy

What happened was there was a maintenance item not taken care of before we tried to leave Newark. My main issue was we sat on the plane at the gate for over 2 hours before the problem was fixed. Why did you handle it this way? Why not just let us sit in the terminal until the problem on the plane was fixed? It was a battery pack needing to be replaced that controlled the emergency lights. The guys sitting in the row where the battery pack was had to stand in the aisle for most of the 2 hours while the repairman tried to fix the problem. Don't you think that is kind of ridiculous? The plane had been flying all day - why did this become an issue partway through the day? Don't you guys fix these things at night before people board the plane? Obviously we are glad we made it there safely, but I don't understand why it was handled the way it was.
My itinerary got cancelled twice. Never flying United again.

I knew my flight was going to be delayed before you delayed the flight based on my plane being delayed 2 flights prior, yet you did not delay my flight until I arrived at the airport. When it was delayed it was an unrealistic time as when my plane took off it was estimated to arrive at 5:27 pm, how could we depart at 5:41 pm? When we were in the midst of boarding they mentioned that we were delayed until 6:24 pm due to maintenance. Being I had a connection this was not appreciated as this was my 4th attempt to fly home due to delays and missing connections. The last thing I wanted to do was board a plane and be trapped on it and then flown to Chicago where I would be stuck in an airport. Thankfully I was smart enough prior checking in to change to the last flight giving myself an initial 3 hour layover which was cut to just about 2 hours. You might want to review your program that chooses when a delay is shown and how you calculate it. I knew sitting at the bar that we would not be taking off until at least 6 pm and we actually pulled away at 6:15 pm.
Luggage, I fly from Spain, checking luggage back in, the guy scanning the luggage, very rude, I should of taken his picture.  Very unprofessional.  Not good
Get better on the delay times.  It changed 4 times with it as late as 6:30 PM, then back to a 20 minute delay.  It was WORSE on the orignal flight
Flight was so delayed to Ohare that we missed a connection. We ended up booking a different airline for the following day because flights were not available.
I would like a full refund or another ticket . my experience was absolutely awful and I think that something should be done about that since it was your companies fault completely

The gate experience at Columbus Airport was very poor.  We landed and ended up waiting for almost an hour before we could be brought into our gate.  For a smaller airport, it was shocking to me that it took this long to get to the gate.
No real concerns.  Was disappointed to see the flight attendant smoking after we were out of the terminal and waiting for shuttle.  SAD!

employees need to know information about the flight and delays and keep us updated, we were left waiting for 6 hours with basically no information. unacceptable. no conversation of compensation of them offering help, ridiculous.

Gate area was confusing for passengers ... there were regularly announcements about three different flights and the board changed between two flights causing additional confusion.  If the inbound flight isn't close (it was repeatedly '5 min from landing) for over half an hour...then let people walk about...gate agent put fear into them about leaving area.  Spend more time on the ground in the plane than air.  Ridiculous that arriving airport had no one to direct us on arrival....almost half an hour waiting for a gate at CMH.  I expect that at ORD - not CMH.

there was an aircraft change And my seat had been changed from an aisle seat I paid to choose to a middle seat. I informed the employee at the gate and they informed me there were no seats available though passengers who came off the standby list received aisle and middle seats. This is incredibly unacceptable and I am very disappointed by my experience as I was not provided with what was fair.

No accomadation was made for malfunctioning (annoying flickering, not able to turn off) movie screen on back of seat.  Screen froze, called attendant, she pressed on screen and confirmed the screen was frozen and informed me, "I would have to live with it."  I asked if I could please have the screen covered in someway to reduce glare and annoyance factor for myself and other two persons sitting in my row, to which the attendant replied, "Now look I told you that you would have to live with it."  I had to hold a magazine up against the screen for three hours...  It was the manner in which I was spoken to and the fact that no effort was even made to figure something out that would help.  I found it very unprofessional.

Delayed for 30 mins was just the beginning. Sitting in the plane for another hour was even worse. I barely made it for the connection flight from Newark to FLL. I had to catch a bus to end up running to the gate making it within 5 mins of the plane leaving.

Inform your customers of non-weather related delays earlier so they can take the train. It is frustrating to pay 5x the price so you can get to a destination sooner only to arrive much later than a train.

Need to do a better job of communicating delays.  Boarded plane with a projection of an arrival time of 10 minutes early.  Before the boarding process could be completed, a ground stop was issued.  I understand that weather changes, but that seems to bit some poor communication.  Delay was explained as a FAA issue, then it was ORD operations.  Who knows

Bathroom was clean generally but smelled of pee (middle of the aircraft economy plus area bathroom)  While getting off aircraft, flight attendants were very lackadaisical and cold - could tell they didn’t even care to really say goodbye but were feeling forced to say it...really big turn off.  No eye contact, no smile, muttering something way that couldn’t even be heard ...best not to say anything at all If you don’t feel like it genuinely. Perhaps genuine ‘say it like you mean it’ goodbyes are only saved for first class passengers?
The problem was the weather. My plane from ORD to CLE was 2 h late arriving. We boarded and then it was close to an hour before we took off due to some sort of problem starting the engines.
flight was delayed about 2  hours, and no notification was ever sent via your mobile app about this.  Disappointing.
Flight was delayed at departure gate, delayed on runway, and didn't have a gate ready at ohare. All in, was late by over an hour.
Seating space is poor.  Since Large person in front of me the seat leaned way back and was uncomfortable for the flight.

The real issue with my flight related to retrieving my luggage in Dayton.  It was over an hour (after arrival) that our luggage finally made it to the carousel.    I was with 5 other well-traveled colleagues who were also very surprised/disappointed with the delay.    Relative to the delay, there was a single notification over the intercom notifying the passengers of the delay (this came some time after people arrived to pick up luggage.  In addition, there was absolutely no United representative at the luggage pick-up to address people's concerns/questions.   I normally have excellent experience with United but on this flight, I was very disappointed. Regards.

I sent an email about getting a refund for my bag as I was not told correct information for this flight. I only took this flight as I had a delay and because of this delay I missed a flight back in LAX with another airline and so I had to purchase this flight.

Everything about the flight was fine except for the delay. The last four flights I have flown on United have been delayed. I know that the circumstances are unavoidable but it is starting  to get frustrating

Flight was 4 hours late. Updates were almost non-existant. Plane heat/a.c. was broken. Pilot announced it. Had I known I would have switched flights.  But the doors were locked so we were all trapped with it. Why was the flight 4 hours late? No one knows. Lazy, dumb, unhelpful gate attendants. Wouldn't even look for the information. I could see if they looked and it wasn't available

I got an update by text two days prior to the flight that delays were possible in Chicago.  I called United the next day and was told unless I got a further update, the flight is ontime.  I checked several times in the morning and early afternoon on the mobile app and the flight was listed ontime.  Went to the airport - the monitors said "on time".  Then we all lined up to board at the designated time, and then and only then were told we might be delayed.  we waited for an hour and then boarded.  We almost missed out connecting flight in ORD.  And the worst part was that the weather and conditions in Pittsburgh were way worse than Chicago.  And we had no time to get to the next plane - we almost missed it.  This seems like a huge serious of mistakes and miscommunications, IMO, and almost forced us to spend another night before getting home!
The business class section was terrible and uncomfortable.  No entertainment and one food selection (Mac and cheese!)
I was at the airport at 3:30pm for my 5:55pm flight to Richmond. I reached my hotel in Richmond at 3am the next day. It was horrible. No flight crew for our flight.

The flight crew was lazy. The worst I have ecxperienced in a while. The person making announcements was so slow and seemed to never stop talking, the entire taxiway... they were so lazy with the service

1hr flight took 7 hours. Poor gate announcements. First announcement about our flight came 30 mins after it was supposed to depart. Gates at Sioux City and O'Hare always have another plane on it. Always stuck in penalty box jammed into United's tiny seats. The legroom is so small you can't even fit your suitcase under the seat in front. Pay to board. Pay for more legroom. Just a terrible, terrible experience flying United now and I'm a former 1K flyer with over 500k lifetime miles. Southwest is who I fly now.

It was my first leg on a Transatlantic trip. The flight was delayed an departure. I was requested to gate check my carry-on because of the size of the aircraft. I requested to have my bag check through to my final destination because of the limited connection time, it was not done. I had to wait for my carry on which made me missed my connecting flight and had to spend a night at a hotel on my expense for a failure of United.

Upon arriving to Orlando from Newark, our luggage was not at the baggage carousel. We arrived to Newark 3 hours prior to departure so we found no reason for our luggage to not be aboard our flight. Turns out our luggage was placed on the flight that landed immediately after our flight did. We were not in a hurry to be in any particular place, however if we were it would have been inconvenient considering we had to wait an extra hour for our luggage.
There were only two electrical outlets for three seats. The people sitting next to me were not interested in sharing

I am sure you already know this, but the boarding gate area was nutty. Having one lane for 1s and 2s is just asking for trouble. And there was trouble!! I do not judge the gate folks for leaving us on our own, you'd think travelers could handle the complexity. But it was a little uncomfortable. But we all got on the plane, of course!

While we sat on the tarmac waiting to depart and about 20 minutes into the flight a baby was incessantly crying and screaming and the mother changed a soiled diaper at her seat which filled the adjacent seats with a very unpleasant odor which made the takeoff a little more nerve wracking. I know these situations cannot be helped at times.

Please be more accommodating and understanding of itinerary changes made on the day of travel.  No customer should be threatened by being thrown off the plane if I didn't immediately pay extra money.  Ridiculous!

I'm not a fan of United offering cheaper flights without the luxury of a carry on bag. When I book my flight on Expedia, it's misleading because I don't realize I've chosen the cheapest option without baggage until I'm ready to check in for my flight. I used to associate United as a premier airline alongside American or Virgin and knew what I was getting when I booked my flight, but now I view United as a cheap airline with limited amenities.
It is difficult to travel on long flights without any option for watching movies or shows, especially, when the flight get delayed by an hour.

I actually sent a message to Customer Care about the baggage handler who took care of my gate checked baggage.  He really went the extra mile and I hope he gets a positive for it.  I knew it was a small plane but did not realize that every carry on would be gate checked and that led to some problems as I was carrying 3 pieces of very breakable Swarovski crystal.  Here is a downside to the gate check that I did not realize would occur.  I had to wait about 10 minutes for my bag on arrival in EWR standing on the cold jetway.  I wonder if there is a different way to handle that, or a notice to passengers that no carry on bags would be entertained on the flight....  Also, while the flight was smooth, the seat I had was so small....I felt crushed in by it.  Maybe that is also normal, but I think I will avoid this plane in the future.

This was homebound.  I remain perplexed as to the number of bags allowed on airlines when charges occur for those of us kind enough NOT to bring them to the gate.  No one should be allowed to take space in the overhead bins that isn't directly over their seat - unless and until everyone is in their seat.  I had less than 6" of leg room on my flight until someone sitting next to an empty seat allowed me to put my bag under that unused seat - all room was taken overhead by selfish multi-bag owners who put both bags overhead.

I think that the bag policy is absolutely ridiculous and very unfortunate. Additionally, I found that United, both my flight to and from Newark, were a bit disorganized - there was definitely a lack of communication. Furthermore, the staff was not extremely helpful on either flight and seemed a bit stressed.

We could not hear the gate agent at all.  She had the microphone practically in her mouth.  No one could really understand her.  Also, she boarded everyone at once, so to the extent we had a priority boarding group (and therefore room left on the plane for a carry on bag), it was useless.
Basic economy with no seat change or carryon is disappointing
We landed ahead of schedule; however, we ended up getting off the plane about 30 minutes late due to a mechanical failure of another aircraft!  this is very disappointing

The flight was delayed several times and once we were able to get on the plane, the door froze open, so our departure was delayed again. Then my luggage was lost for several days! No compensation for any of this ?!?
Legroom is terrible. I won't fly United again unless I have to. I come off the plan sore and just feeling physically poor.
The flight attends weren't friendly and we're talking about how much they hate there job. And the people on the air plain.

The crew really were not good, passengers had too many carry ons and the crew did nothing to help organise where they would fit which meant it was a nightmare trying to board and it took so much time to our already very delayed flight.

As an extremely frequent flyer, basic economy is the worst cost-cutting measure I've experienced on any airoine. It reminds me of Ryan Air, an extremely low budget airline I took as a student. But the difference is those flights were $30 and I knew what I was paying for. This was $200. Plus the flight was extremely delayed because of a delayed United plane and the flight attendants were rude and my seat recline was broken. Will avoid United at all costs in the future.

The issue was that once we arrived in Des Moines the jet bridge was broken/frozen. Due to the fact that it was midnight, it took 1.5 hours before we were pushed back and could go to another gate. This was more airport related, not United. In fact, the pilot immediately told us that we would receive some sort of compensation from United because of the problem. I've already selected my travel voucher.
Uncalled for is all I have to say. It was a nightmare of a trip. I travel a lot and this was the worst!

Thought survey was going to loop back to other areas. So, two problems: 1. food was quite poor; 2. despite website saying Economy Plus had free alcoholic drinks, attendants restricted things to beer and wine--didn't necessarily need a drink but website-attendant contradiction is, I think, a problem.

The flight attendant was not kind to the woman sitting next to me and it appeared to be racially charged as she did not treat any other passenger in this way.  I am a frequent business traveler and was very disappointed to see this especially as she was the head attendant.  Poor example especially on MLK day.

It isn’t the gate people that stink it’s the lies that they are trying to tell for the delays. Weather in Richmond really. The people getting of the plane from Richmond said they were told the delay was due to crew.
No a horrible experience when traveling under time sensitive conditions....dying grandparents in hospital
United Club (or lack thereof) in Newark is incredibly frustrating.  You pay $1,000 per year for a service that doesn't exist.  The "pop up" club is a joke.  Very disappointing.

From the massive delay to the way baggage claim works and the fact our bag got left going to RDU and than massive delay to get our baby car seat. I'm very dissatisfied with United and would probably consider a different airline on my next travels.

Very long delays for deicing followed by very long delays waiting for runway for takeoff, apparenly due to some runways being closed for snow removal. We sat out there so long I thoght we were going to need another deicing. I still don't know why we didn't. Combination of waits and longer than expected flight times in small uncomfortable seats left me with sore ribs for the next 3 days.

Due to plane's mechanical fault, we were made to wait on the plane for 1.5 hours. Could have let us waited at the boarding area where we can get  dinner and drinks instead of waiting in the cabin hungry and frustrated.
Flight extremely late. I had an appointment that evening and it all screwed up. I missed all my appointments that evening
There was garbage in the seat back in front of me so it was unpleasant to reach in the pocket and find dirty tissues, napkins and wrappers

Some of the flight attendants were attentive once she was injured however the male attendant was absolutely clueless about that fact that she was injured and continued to harp on the container being able to close.
The Fasten Seatbelt light was on for most of the flight and the seats become a little uncomfortable (sore butt) on a 5 hour flight.

This flight attendant obviously not familiar with this flight or destination - overhead announcements not applicable to landing in a small airport.   Of the 7 legs of our trip, this last segment ORD-RST was the most disappointing all around. It is unfortunate that limited flights to RST cause very long lay-overs (causing extra expenses for meals in the airport and lots of wasted time) but when there is a 2.5 hour delay added to that without any explanation given, plus poor gate communications and a clueless flight attendant and needing to gate check carryons, it makes for grumpy passengers. I love flying in/out RST, but these annoyances compound and make me rethink my options.

The delay was PAINFUL, and the quality of information about what was happening at the gate was unsatisfactory - the departure times changed several times, and the new pilot and crew didn’t even know when the inbound plane was due to arrive. Adds stress and frustration - the more information that can be shared the better!

My flight was the budget economy flight with no carry on and middle seat. Worst flight ever! I had to pay for a bag that should have been carried on. Too many restrictions. The only reason I booked this flight was because it was made at the last minute and cheap. Do not offer this type of flight to anyone! You make someone feel like a second class citizen because they didn't pay more money? The choices of seat and baggage should not be decided upon by you. Choices should be given to the individual.

The problem was the delay. Evidently weather affected all the flights that day. But I was dissatisfied that there were not more connections to MCI. I had to wait 10 hours after my flight from Europe before I could get home. I won't choose my next Europe trip with that delay.

The flight was fine but the economy section was really crowded and uncomfortable. In these long-haul flights it is important to have a little leg room. I could not use my laptop throughout the flight because the person in front of me had reclined their seat. While this was an inconvenience, the more important point is the health concerns that arise from sitting in cramped spaces for at least 13 hours in a row.
DELAYS AND BAD CHECK IN SERVICE

These aircrafts are so small and painfully uncomfortable. Also, I wish the board at the gate reminded you there is NO beverage service on a flight, so you could plan accordingly. I would have bought a second bottle of water before boarding if I'd known I'd only be offered one half glass of water.

Terminal A in Newark is terrible.  No TSA Pre-Check at security and the gate area is over crowded and uncomfortable.  When boarding this flight, the gate agent boarded groups 1 through 3 almost at the same time, which provided no advantage for those who paid for group 1 or 2 to board early and access the overhead bins.  The economy plus seats in the Embraer 170/175 aircraft are very uncomfortable. The flight was on time, which was wonderful.
the fire alarm went off in the terminal twice while i was there

The baggage claim took 50 minutes from landing to receiving my bag. They unloaded a flight that landed after us before our bags were on the carousel. Between getting delayed 2 hours, I was not home until 3 hours after my originally landing time. As a student, I have now suffered in my morning classes because of this late arrival.
My bag did not make the connection in ORD, even though we were continuing the same aircraft. My trip was only one day, so having a lost bag sucked.

I usually enjoy flying United and have never had an issue with the airline. Unfortunately I had a very rude flight attendant for my flight on Monday night from New York to Chicago. I was seated in business class and when I went up to use the restroom the flight attendant rolled his eyes at me and told me to "better make it quick," as he assumed that I was not seated in business class. I understand that mistakes happen but he did not apologize and then proceeded to ignore me throughout the balance of the flight. I was not offered a refill for my glass of water and did not appreciate being treated so poorly. United is always my airline of choice but this was a very unpleasant experience.
There was a delay that caused me to miss my flight to IAD so I had to go to DCA.  The gate agent was very informative throughout the delay and very accommodating on the rebooking.
Poor communication - very disorganized
The flight attendants were very unprofessional and disorganized. It was embarrassing to see really.

We were sitting towards the back  and flight attendants were constantly talking and we were not able to rest.  it was 9:30 PM flight from Chicago to Washington Baltimore and we wanted to rest while we were  flying but could not.  This Natalie happens only this time  But also those flight attendants who works in the back part of the aircraft date sits and talks all the way to the destination and that’s quite annoying to those passengers who are sitting in the back close to that Yele but also those flight attendants who works in the back part of the aircraft date sits and talks all the way to the destination and that’s quite annoying to those passengers who are sitting in the back close to back. On this flight I got to know their life story I got to hear one of flight attendants wife’s story.  Because it was bothering me I had to just let myself in to hearing their conversation which was better than being annoyed. This has to stop in my opinion. Chatting a few minutes is different story but this is not like that. They are even annoyed when passengers ask for something bcz it stips the flow of their conversation. —-United will start to control this , I hope.
The plane was really small and was very very delayed for no apparent reason.
My seat cushion, 1C, needs to be replaced.  It has lost its resilience an you sit in a valley causing back and leg pain.
The crew at the check in area was very impolite and had a bad attitude to help us. I was quite pissed at that moment!

1/15, Flight 2062, EWR > BOS: Gate agents were pre-checking bags at gate. When on-board, many overhead bins were available. I asked for a gate agent as I desired to put my carry-on bag in a bin above my seat. A lady who identified herself as the gate manager approached me and began to talk to me in a lecturing manner. She dismissed my request and refused to answer my questions. She spoke to me in a chiding and incredibly rude manner. She said she was “trying to push the plane out on-time, and it’s people like me who delay everything.”  I asked what she meant by “people like me” and said, “Chinese people.” (I’m not Chinese.) I was stunned and speechless. Passengers seated in my vicinity started getting upset and began vocalizing how rude and racist she was. Then, she deplaned briskly. How will you address this horrible experience, United?

United lost my bag in Newark when I had 3+ hours before my connecting flight. I was leaving Weds morning at 6am for a business trip and needed my luggage but didn’t have it. Very disappointed in United. Extremely difficult to get a hold of a physical person to explain what happened to my bag and why it got lost and took so long to locate it.

My husband is 62 and I am 60, and we are in reasonably good health. Previous to this flight, we had flown 10 hrs from Fiji, followed by an 11 hr layover in Los Angeles. We really wanted an earlier flight to get to our ultimate destination of Columbus Ohio, but there was nothing to get us out of LA earlier.  My husband, although quite able bodied and Mobile, has a herniated disc. He was assigned a middle seat. The nature of our ticket did not permit us to get a seat assignment in advance. My husband ended up with sciatic so severe that he could barely walk, with very intense pain. After arriving in Chicago, we inquired at the gate about getting more accommodating seating seating.”, and truly felt dismissed and brushed off.

Although I am Boarding class 2, my connecting flight was late. By the time I entered aircraft, I was told no more room in overhead bins for my carry on bag. I have never understood how other seats/customers can use the space over an assigned seat bin. I was forced to check my carry on, which took 35 minutes to retrieve at baggage claim. Very disappointed.

My comforter and quilt had to be replaced because it was foul smelling. The lavatory tap was not working. The meal menu was wrong! We got a different chicken dish than what was claimed in the menu. Absolutely terrible experience, after paying ridiculous prices for Polaris. I plan to report this on social media as nobody should go through this

Initially the flight attendant was very rude considering I had my 6 yr old son with me. Overhead compartments were full and asked me to step to back of plane with my carry on while my 6 yr old son was left to stay in his seat by himself.

I had to miss work because of my cancelled flight, which was scheduled to be in the early afternoon on 1/14 and was cancelled due to "a problem regarding the crew members." The only next available flight was the next morning. The United Reservation line was extremely helpful in trying to find us the best option, but they were unfortunately very limited.

Due to the more than 1 hour delay, the there were few passengers that were in danger of missing their connecting flights. Arrangements should have been made to allow those passengers off the plane first to arrive at their gate in a timely manner.

The flight was more than 1 hour delayed due to the need to rearrange over head baggage. The over head compartments were too small to fit every passenger's carry on luggage, thus the flight attendants gate checked all carry on luggage. However, not all seemed to fit, they then had to take out baggage from the over head compartment and squeeze a few random carry on luggage in the over head compartments. Arrangements should be made ahead of time to account for every passenger possibly bringing a standard size luggage since checking in luggage is no longer cost-efficient.  In addition the delay caused some passengers to be in danger of missing their connecting flight. Arrangements should have been made to allow these passengers to get off the plane first, to arrive at their gate in a timely manner. My next connecting gate was in a different terminal and very far from my arrival gate. I had to run, since I knew they were boarding the flight already.
It bothers me that I broke my bags and do not assume the costs

Schedule updates were very poor.  To get a more accurate probable departure time I had to monitor the incoming aircraft.  At one point our departure time was still showing as before the incoming plane would land on it's previous flight.
The awful wait times at priority security checkpoints at ohare. I almost missed my flight! There is nothing priority about it! Shameful and this has been this way for the past 6 months!
Very rude, unfriendly and ignorant United Airlines check-in in Chicago
I received several emails with different dates for the departure flight. It was very confusing. Even the customer service reps we're confused. It made my flight unnecessarily difficult.
It sucked! On top of equipment delay, catering caused further delays.

Delaying the flight further because of the catering for the flight is unacceptable. The crew at the gate seemed completely uncertain about how to handle the situation. It took them forever to even offer us a $10 meal voucher. Very poorly handled.

The security line and management was very poor. There were hardly any signs of where to go and there were a lot of very confused passengers. The hour to wait on line was one thing, but the lack of signs instructing people where to go was unnecessary.

si, realmente me parecio que la localizacion del gate no fue la adecuada,dado que no habian lugares confortables en donde senterse pocos asisientos de metal y los otros eran sillas altas o mesas. el tiempo de arbodaje fue muy extenso y canson. Durante el vuelo el personal estuvo muy amable como siempre en todo.  ese Gate C75 es muy incomodo.
