Flight delayed was not acceptable as  we lost a lot of time waiting at the airport. The delay was dragging out for a long duration and we ended up moved to the next flight.

Although there was a maintenance delay that was probably going to be solved, there was no offer to put passengers on a different flight or compensation.  I've experienced these types of delays (multiple hours) and other airlines bring out drinks, snacks to distract the passengers from the delay.  Also it was unprofessional for another pilot to argue with the gate agent about getting a seat on the plane since he had to get to his flight overseas.  Overall, was glad we were not on the plane for the 3 hours but it was still bad timing at the beginning of a long week.

Flight attendent said no slippers onboard and were not friendly (again this is my first time having a bad attendent experience on Polaris ever). Meal service wasn't great (and usually is). Seat was filthy with crumbs and nuts.

I travel a lot and there seems to be an issue with the United seatbelt warnings.  I totally get why a captain will put them on - its for everyone's safety, but with United it seems to be used as an excuse to control passengers and stop people going to the toilet. Ours was on for almost 4 hours !! with not an ounce of turbulence in sight. In the end people had to actively complain about it to get it off. It caused quite a bit of distress on my row as people were actually in pain waiting on the alert being switched off. Just having it permanently on for the duration of the flight is not a good flying experience. It should be used only when really needed.

We were delayed nearly an hour and I made my subsequent connection to Honolulu with single digit minutes to spare.  This delay was by the explicit admission of the pilot, that he and the co-pilot were slow and late getting to the airport.  Granted there was poor weather, but every passenger on the packed plane planned accordingly and made it there on time, but ALL of us paid the price not for snow or mechanical issues, but due to lazy United pilots who didn't want to leave their hotel in a timely manner to account for road conditions.  Terrible.
I had one of those international upgrade vouchers and it didn’t work but there wasn’t room in business. Not a huge deal but just thought it was weird
My bags were damaged. And these were brand new bags. They came out broken and black dirt and grim all over them.

I had my service light on for over FIVE hours.  I turned it on about two hours into the flight as I wanted a snack of some kind.  After an hour, I walked back to the rear galley and found no flight attendants.  None. The rope barrier was up preventing me from going to the front to First Class.  As no one came by for another two hours, I went back to the rear of the plane again, this time quite hungry.  Again, I could not find a single member of the staff.  No one came to answer the flight attendant request bell for the entire flight.  I even turned it off, then on again three or four times to see if anyone would notice.  Eventually about an hour before the flight ended they came out to delivery us an afternoon snack.  I’ve never been on a flight when I felt so ignored by the staff. God forbid we had an emergency of some kind and a passenger needed assistance.
Landing was horrible I thought we crashed when landing, my head hit the window very scary and uncomfortable

It was a HORRIFIC experience. Our flight was to board at 8:49 am and depart at 9:39 am. You think somewhere along the way someone from United would be smart enough to pick up a phone and notify us that our flight had gone through not ONE but TWO aircraft changes in Orlando. We were delayed 3 1/2 hours ten minutes AFTER boarding time. Now that flight had to have been scheduled to leave Orlando for Newark circa 6 am. Doesn’t it seem like common sense to notify us that our flight is delayed knowing that this information was probably available to those on the ground in Orlando around 5:30 am? Or is blatant stupidity your priority for loyal customers? I’m truly appalled by this entire experience and I’m a mileage plus member.

No information was provided at the gate regarding the delay until almost the original take off time.  For a 2.5 - 3 hour delay, as a frequent 1K flier, I’d have expected somethjngveoukdbe offered for having to dine at the airport, not to mention having missed a work meeting, for what was clearly not a weather related or other uncontrollable delay.

Poor weather in Evansville. Snow & ice. Unavoidable . The problem was the small regional airport did NO runway approach clearing or treatment. Our aircraft got stuck on the approach for 2 hours. They attempted to pull us out. First “tug” got stuck as well. They brought in a bigger “tug” that pulled us to a clearing and made it back to the gate . They re iced again then re attempted the flight after clearing the approach. Why didn’t they clear before we attempted the first time. I question the judgement of the airport management for allowing this to happen as well as the airline captain & personnel for attempting the flight with these conditions. Huge safety error. While weather is uncontrollable, passengers board and take off assuming these issues are dealt with ensuring safety first. This was clearly not the case on this flight.most of the passengers on board were frightened to continue the attempt and would rather have had the flight cancelled. Shame on Your crew for allowing this to happen.

Awful experience. Red eye flight, my seat in economy didn’t recline and I didn’t get reimbursed from moving from economy plus to economy even though Customer Service told me so over the phone. I’m disappointed.

Food was not enough, me and my collegues were starving when we left the plane. After a while there is no service anymore for more than 4 hours, that is not acceptable. 6 hours between meals is way too long and the second meal (a small sandwich) was tiny.
the food purchase options should be wider. there are allergic people; in our case allergic to cheese and milk and for that reason there were no options to buy from the US. to Santiago.

I was right by the bathroom and every time someone used it I can smell it by my seat. The area also smelled like urine maybe something can be done to avoid smelling those horrible odors. It was extremely uncomfortable and unpleasant
Very disappointed. Prob a my gonna switch to delta
The food Sucks!!! Absolutely terrible!!

Original flight was cancelled.  New flight was significantly delayed.    At check in the agents didn’t seem to know what had gone on at all - boarding was still showing at 10 am even though it was 1 pm and the flight had just been delayed further.  Delay updates were sent to my phone but were in minutes.  Who wants to figure out how long a 277 minute delay is?  Why can’t you automatically convert this to hours or better yet just give the new take off time.  PA system at MDT Airport continues to be poor in the B1 gate area.  You can’t hear what ever is being said regardless of where you are seated.

The problem was the plane was imbalanced and they needed to move people from the first 4 rows to the back.  Other times this was required 2/3 of the passengers were in the front half of the plant.  This time there were only 3 open seats behind the first 4 rows and 2 people from the first 4 had to move.  The agent was not very polite about it.  Did not respond with appreciation when I and the other passenger moved.  No one wants to move, you can easily offer a drink ticket or two.
Retired military not active was very dissatisfied about have to pay 75 dollars for checked luggage.
first class ticket up about 100 since the last time i flew. no hot towels, no cup of nuts, fruit platter for lunch, nothing like it was

I had to wait a very long time for my luggage at FLL. And when it came, my TAGS WERE "SOMEHOW..." TORN OFF.  ALSO--  I learned from the senior gate agent at Newark that they are not allowed to play around with jerking around First  Class passengers. You'll recall on a previous flight--I always PAY FOR AND FLY FIRST CLASS--this little girl grabbed my CONFIRMED boarding pass and THREE TIMES attempted to move me around. Finally this man (Supervisor?) came over and after I told him what this bimbo had done, he restored me to the opposite bulkhead seat. That bimbette was trying to move me around to accommodate a bunch of those awful upgrades from back in coach.  I HOPE SHE GOT FIRED. SHE SHOULD HAVE BEEN!!!!
My suit was damage with little of white wine for an accident from the attendant with the seat in front of me.
Anytime you land without incident is a great flight!

No But I have a comment about Flight 3562 on jan13th. There were no working toilets on the flight to NYC. This was strange since the plane was worked on all night for other issues. The gate was changed at the last minute and no plane was at the gate, The crew and staff had no idea where the plane was coming from. So about a half hour after scheduled time the plane arrived  from the hanger and maintenance still had to come on the plane to try to fix warer issues. Very bad overall performance.!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I will never fly United first class on a canada air plane ever again and if you do not reach out to me to compensate me, Ill never fly United again.
The "beef" dish for lunch (cherry sauce??) was really one of the worst airline meals I have had

On my flight there was a large man who sat next to me and took up half of my seat. It was extremely uncomfortable and my entire le and lower back went numb. I am still experiencing pain from the disconfort.  I do not understand why you would not accommodate your customer better.
My priority luggage did not come out with my wife’s. I could not believe how many “non-priority” were delivered before mine. I wasn’t happy with the delay.

The late flight text did not give me enough notice. Moving my connecting flight led me to an unessary delay at at Ohare because there when many other flights available whithin the 6 hour overlay that I was forced to endure.
FLIGHT ATTENDANTS REDUSED TO GIVE TWO MINORS FORKS FOR THEIR SALADS THEY BROUGHT ON ... only for first class passengers.  Outrageous discrimination... UNACCEPTABLE

the food from Tel Aviv to Newark was inedible. The choices for the main meal  were awful and was unable to eat them. Who serves salmon on board a plane? The vegetarian meal that I got instead was also dreadful. There was no decaffeinated coffee available even though many people drink decaf. Also the restrooms became filthy towards the end of the flight with garbage overflowing and no toilet paper.
The plane did not have outlets for electronic devices.  The wifi signal was very poor.
Communication of the delay was last minute. Required extended walking from club to gate and back again. First class seats on this plane are old and uncomfortable. Meal was awful.

My seat was 38C near the restrooms. The stench of urine was overwhelming and I was sickened during this flight. At the end if the flight I told the rear stewardesses about the odor and received a blank stare with no response. I am still amazed at this more than anything else.
seats are very uncomfortable.  gate A in NJ is the worst of most of USA major airports
Arrival in terminal A is awful.  Terminal A is a chaotic mess. It’s gross.
Gate employee was pushy about  checking bags  No charger beneath seat.
2 awful experiences in a row consistently worst airline and no one seems to care

I paid to upgrade myself expecting I'd have a better experience.  The last flight had such dirty bathrooms it was disgusting.  I didn't want to get sick.  So I paid extra to get worse treatment and everyone in economy in First since the attendants were too busy on their phones or complaining in earshot of customers that UAL isn't as good as it used to be.  Yes, sadly your customers know.  I thought your staff might be more discreet than complaining in front of your higher paying customers.  I demand a refund and something better.  If you choose to ignore me again, I'll go to social media and contest with my credit card. No entertainment at all, no wifi, no lunch, no help from attendants.  I paid to upgrade to First.  It was horrible.  Nothing worked.  No food.  They offered Economy lunch since they ran out.  13 people from economy went through the curain, past the attendants who were on their personal devises and used the restrooms in first.  They made it a mess.  When I fly in economy, no one is allowed in First.  Yet I had a line of economy passengers coughing on me as they waited to use First bathroom.  Attendants never stopped them.  They were so busy on their phones an older lady also in first asked me to clear her lunch plate as I waited for bathroom.  I want a refund and a free flight.  Or should I go on social media to demand it is improved?
Make your damn seats with more leg room and stop making us pay extra for reasonable leg room.!
I fly all the time.  I am exploring option to switch to another provider tired of poor service

I hate that you decreased the leg room, very cramped seating.  It's awful that you have to sit on the tarmac where you can't even shift in your seat.  I flew Allegiant Airway recently and there was so much leg room.
Flight was delayed and none of the outlets worked in the gate area for us to charge our devices. This is unacceptable.
Those CRJ planes are awful to fly on.  They're so small and uncomfortable.  Yuck!
I was dis-satisfied with my flight because I was forced to gate check my bag, when the plane had plenty of overhead storage available.

My flight was supposed to be the day prior.  The flight was delayed and we weren't going to make our connecting flight in Denver.  No one could tell us if it was delayed for weather reasons (the weather wasn't bad) or operational reasons.  So we had to book a hotel in Bozeman for the night.  Is there any way to get reimbursed for this hotel expense?  I am assuming that the delay was operational.
Your first class cabin ran out of food options. We had 5 seats out of 10 and none of us could have edible food. We had to get boxes from the back and the steward was very rude.
Service was fine, not fantastic, this plane was very cramped and uncomfortable

As I was deplaning the airplane, I misjudged the timing as I was exiting and apologized to the man I overlapped with. He became very aggressive, and began to shout at me and call me a bitch. The entire walk down the plane, he verbally assaulted me. The flight attendants did nothing. I felt threatened, and I was afraid for my safety. The pilot and crew watched this happen, and said nothing. I asked him to stop yelling at me, and he continued. I ended up running as soon as I got off the plane because I was afraid. When you see a female passenger being verbally assaulted by a male passenger, intervene. Do not allow this to continue.
Carry on check in is a disappointment

You ruined the entire experience by confiscating my backpack, putting it in baggage and charging me $25.00 for the experience of getting humiliated by your policy to squeeze pennies. You should NOT be doing business with EXPEDIA, and I’m really upset with UNITED.....IT’S REALLY A TYPE OF FRAUD////// JEFF SUSSMAN, ESQ.

Somebody needs to have a talk with flight attendant "Gordon". After another flight attendant confirmed there were four other complaints besides mine regarding the WiFi not functioning, he said that his was working fine before he started service. To make this short, I was called a liar and I confronted that and "Gordon" told me to take it down a notch and he wasn't going to put up with it. A passenger behind me then told him that HE needed to take it down a notch and noted that he had a bad attitude from the very beginning of the initial complaint. I'm not going to get into the back and forth as it really doesn't matter. If a flight attendant is having a bad day, they do not need to take it out on the passengers.
Baggage claim staff and procedures need to be re-evaluated. Service is lousy. And if you check Ski’s it is the worst experience
Bathrooms could have been serviced in flight. It was a bit torn up after the first drink service and the second one didn’t help.
Seat area was so dirty that I avoided visiting the lavatory which I heard was also unclean

You have the check in kiosks all clusterered together with no room to move. Then you have only one baggage drop with all these passengers trying to maneuver around those clusterered at the kiosks. When you finally reach the bag drop you have a very rude agent there barking at people.

despite using a United credit card, i had to pay for why luggage. the checkin counter said they could not refund the money.  when called united i was told i now have to go to a website and have it processed from there.  ridiculous.

When tray tables are noticeably dirty, what other dirt and germs are there we did not see?  Our family was split up even though we requested not to.  The snack included in first class was really disappointing.

The lavatory was filthy. This was 30 minutes into the flight. It appeared the trash was not emptied from the previous flight. The food in 1st class was a box of cheese. The flight attendant offered nothing from the back of the plane and seemed annoyed and stressed throughout. Water was not even offered on a 4 hour flight!

The maintenance level of aircrafts is disturbingly poor. We were first made to board one plane, and then asked to deplane due to maintenance issue. We were then told another aircraft was ready in the gate next door. Turns out, this aircraft had a maintenance issue too (which we found out only close to an hour later). Finally, the third aircraft we were put on was to arrive an hour later than this. The fact that two consecutive aircrafts we were supposed to board were both suffering from maintenance issues is quite disturbing. Also, when there is a delay, information must be provided to customers on the expected delay time. Instead, the screen at the gate/information in the app keeps adding 10 minutes at a time to the delay, which is not informative at all. Since we do not know how long the delay actually is, we cannot go to the lounge or elsewhere and are forced to hang around in the crowded gate. The lack of information to passengers is very  dissatisfying. In particular, once we were made to deplane from our first aircraft and waiting for the second aircraft, the gate agent disappeared down the air-bridge for almost 30 minutes leaving the passengers stranded with no updates -- and this is after we were lead to believe we would be boarding immediately. This is highly unprofessional. The gate agent cannot just disappear in order to avoid giving information to passengers waiting at the gate for a delayed flight. This is just unacceptable. Also, in general you really need to improve your on-time performance for flights to smaller airports. Out of 4 flights in my entire trip this time, 3 of them were delayed and only 1 was on time. This flight was delayed 3.5 hours, and my flight from Chicago to Champaign on 12th Jan was delayed 16 hours leading me to have to spend the night at Chicago. The fact that 75% of the flights in my itinerary were delayed, and only 25% of the flights left on time is a serious problem -- in my eyes, this is a failing grade. Do a LOT better next time.
Aircraft sucks and should be taken out of service.  Horribly uncomfortable

While boarding the flight, even starting with the pre-boarding, everyone from the flight crowded around the boarding area and the gate agents didn't say anything. It created such a clustered area and it was impossible to get through everyone when it was actually your time to board. I know this has become common practice in airports but that doesn't make it right. It bothered me that the gate agents didn't say ANYTHING to try and get people to stop crowding the area.

Yes, one I landed at Newark International I came across the rudest United worker at the counter when I was trying to ask her if I would be able to receive a voucher for a hote because i had no way of getting home due to the very delayed flight.The women proceeded to tell me why I didn’t just wait for the train at 5:30 am (it was 1:00am when we landed). I was baffled and tired that after travel for nearly 8 hours with United that the worker at the counter did not want to help me. She also threatend me that she would not give me a voucher if I gave an attitude, which I did not, the women was room from the start when I arrived at the counter. Due to this rude experience I will most likely NEVER fly with United again.

The issue really wasn’t the connection from Chicago to Boston.  The issue was with my first flight from KC to Chicago.  It was delayed well over an hour due to weather and mechanical problems.  I was told that I would still make my short connection to Boston from Chicago.  I had minutes to get to the gate, C28, running from C7.  I got to the gate and it had already closed.  The gate agent showed no empathy and just booked on the later connection.  He made no effort to try and find alternative solutions even on other airlines.  I missed the entire afternoon of meetings by the time I arrived to Boston.  No issues on my return travel to KC.

I am united frequent flier and I think it’s so frustrating that I have to pay for Wi-Fi. Also I am a larger women and the seat belt didn’t fit me on this flight but fit with room on the way there. So frustrating and embarrassing.

I was shocked at the lack of amenities and food in first class considering the flight down was the complete opposite.  There was absolutely no organization at the gate for boarding... they moved people onto the plane in a the fastest time possible and were more concerned with moving things along than in how comfortable or satisfied a customer was. We had no real service in first class until we got up in the air and then it was a drink and some chips from a basket.  I certainly do not consider that first class.  I feel like all i paid extra for was a bigger seat.  We were in the airport over 2 hours before our flight and upon arrival in Newark, our "priority" tagged luggage came out after the majority of our flights luggage came out.  I am very disappointed with this flight.  If someone is really reading this i would like to hear from customer service regarding this horrible experience.

Atlanta airport was VERY disorganized and they did not start boarding until 1:30, then wanted to rush everyone on board, even though the plane was sitting at the gate at the 1:02 posted boarding time. The lines to board were utter chaos.. At least the flight landed on time.

There is no wifi. How can a business person work? Air Wisconsin is a very bad representative for United. The pilots do not communicate with gate and the aircrafts always have maintenance issues. I am very disappointed with United outsourcing to them for rochester. It makes me want to fly American until we get a main line again.
Your delay information was not timely. I.e. I received an email when I was boarding the delayed flight.  To let me know my flight was delayed.
Very long delay with no explanation as to why the plane coming in was so late.  Made me wonder if it had been a mechanical problem on the plane used.
Considering there was a two hour delay, we were updated by the gate staff about the delay. Also getting the water and snacks helped .
On time departure while other flights in our area of the airport were being cancelled. Arrived early in Chicago, Avoided all weather.

The only inconvenience that I had is that in order to get to my connection flight we had to get out of the terminal and go through security. Traveling alone with a baby is difficult so having to do it twice is very annoying. Also it was confusing to get to the terminal because of the lack of information signs.

This is my second flight in a row where the agent at Security said my carry-on luggage was the appropriate size (after having me fit it into the little metal container), yet when I get to the gate, the agent rudely insists that I check my bag. What is the point of twice having agents test the size of my bag? The lack of consideration for passengers and everyone's time is extremely disappointing. To boot, the agent at the gate was noticeably irritated that I was reluctant to check my bag. I told her the security agent said it was fine but she didn't like that. Customer service was extremely lacking and your organization should be ashamed that gate agents rudely contradict what their colleagues said at security.

While I understand that flight attendants are busy with several functions they must perform, awareness of the passengers should be one of them. There was a large group that flew together from a company called Wework. They were all loud and I understand that can happen. However there were two gentlemen in back of me that were loud the entire flight and at least 25% of their language was foul and unacceptable. While I was not particularly fond of it being yelled in my ear throughout the first four hours of the flight, the two young girls (approximately 10 and 7) sitting across the aisle should not have been exposed to it. My wife, watching a movie with headphones on, was not able to hear the movie several times from these two gentlemen who were swearing just about every minute of the four hours when they were somehow defeated in their mobile video game they were playing. In speaking with the dad of these two girls after the flight, his concern was the same as mine. If we had addressed the issue with either the gentlemen themselves or called attention to their behavior to a flight attendant, we would have probably been targeted not just by the two gentlemen, but the other 10 to 12 people they were flying with. We had both decided that we would suffer through it in order to not create an incident which would further an already negative experience. However, their behavior was so consistent and ongoing, that there was no way that at least one of the flight attendants wouldn't have heard it. At that point, I would have hoped that they would have directed the gentlemen to control their behavior in a manner that was more appropriate for an airline flight with families on board.
No food just snacks.  DId not eat before flight from John wayne to ord which is four hours.   Was suppose to have food for purchase.   I was told there was a snafu with food service.
Snack was horrible.  The flight attendants talked/joked with passengers a bit too much that they didn't look too professional
yes.  Ron at check in in Orange County was the rudest most despicable man ever.  He called me an idiot.  was unhelpful curt and a poor representative for your airline

About an hour out from Phoenix one of your flight attendants, approached and confronted a problem passenger. He turned around for help and went down - appeared to also have seizures. A Dr on board quickly jumped in and started doing chest compressions. What concerns me, was the lacking response time and lack of involvement/knowledge of the remaining flight crew. It took them over 20 minutes to retrieve after multiple passengers, including myself, asked for oxygen and if there was an AED on board. It just seems like they were ill prepared for this type of situation. I am doubtful your attendant survived and sad if such a loss occurred. He was on a few other flights and I saw him go over and beyond to interact and engage with kids on an Orlando flight just a week earlier. Regardless, I would strongly suggest you review your inflight emergency training requirements. I would also suggest having all emergency products stored in the same location to reduce any redundancy and loss of time. The oxygen tank for this flight was in first class and the AED appears to have been stored in the rear of the plane.

On this flight, one of the flight attendants collapsed in the aisle and a doctor on the plane performed CPR for 20 minutes as we landed in Phoenix.  On top of that there was some type of altercation just before or just after the flight attendant collapsed that resulted in a passenger being taken off the plane by police.  I hope the flight attendant survived, but CPR for 20 minutes does not bode well.  As you can image, all of this was a bit upsetting.

It would be better to have a wider aisle in the event someone needs to be removed from the flight for a medical condition. I would not like to see a very sick person near death being dragged out again.

Yes, There was a medical emergency +/- an hour out of Phoenix.  There was a very troublesome encounter between the male flight attendant and an extremely out-of-control passenger.  I believe the flight attendant died as a result of this encounter.  I could go in to much more detail but don't know how much space I have to do that.  I was "very distressed" about the aspects of this incident, and how it was handled both regarding the dead attendant, the remaining crew, and the passengers who witnessed this terrible occurrence.  There was NO debriefing, only a rush to get the dead person and the passenger who caused all the disturbance off the plane (the passenger was escorted off the plane by police officers).  After deplaning I saw the passenger and a policeman sitting way across the aisle from the gate.  After the dead attendant and the passenger were removed from the plan, the remaining passengers were just sent on their way with any word about the outcome and the circumstances.

There was a disturbance on the plane when we started our descent into Phoenix. Unfortunately no one told us what was happening. I have been told by other passengers that the male flight attendant involved in the disturbance with two passengers had a heart attack and passed away on the plane. This was an extremely traumatic experience and not knowing what really happened is very troublesome.
I have already voiced my concerns via your website and posted on your site.  You have to find them and respond.   This flight was beyond traumatic!!
We experienced as passengers ...apparently a flight attendant suffered a seizure and died? There was no medical exp. people on board. That was tough to see.

The flight was fine until the end.... when there was an unruly passenger and then a male flight attendant collapsed! This all happened right next to me and I'd really like to know what happened.... Based on what the people who were performing CPR for 20 minutes said...the flight attendant probably died. This is absolutely heartbreaking and it would be nice if the passengers of this flight could receive an official statement from United about what happened. This was traumatic for me and all the other passengers involved.
The legroom in economy is not great. I'm about 6 feet tall, and my knees were very sore from pushing against the seat in front of me.
flight was also delayed leaving due to a light not working properly in luggage area. If plane was delayed so long why did know one recognize the food cart missing?
Had a horrible check experience
I want compensation for my flight delay of 5 hours. Ridiculous.

I filed a formal complaint because I Was stuck in the middle of an argument between 2 of your employees.  It was the worst and inexcusable. I will never fly united again and will tell Everyone I know not to fly your terrible airline. Plus I'll be tweeting about my miserable experience
Two hours delay  no coments

The flight itself and service provided was fine.  My problem had to do with the chaotic check in process.  Not enough agents to handle the amount of people checking in.  Very uncomfortable waiting in line.

United, and all airlines in general need to get control of carry on bags. Just because I'm in group 4 for boarding doesn't mean I should have to cram my bag under the seat because someone in an earlier group put 2 bags in the overhead and left no room for others. I saw this on all 4 segments of my trip. What if all we folks who reserved aisle seats, refused to let the center and window seats out to use the bathtoom. Maybe I'll start a movement. Each seat should get a set space, period.
Flight crew not very friendly Not like the friendly skies
Tiny seats were awful.  No leg room.  Awful when you have to sit in the middle and you have a big person in the seat next to you whose body parts happen to hang over onto my side.
Two of our zippers on our luggage were broken and bent. Luggage is expensive and this is very annoying.

It was quite stressful that the airport air train was not working: we were delayed 55 minutes in getting to the gate, which was not obvious where gate 97 was (downstairs instead of in the main concourse). Also, figuring out the economy check in AND gate access were on level 2, not 3 was not clearly marked in Newark.
No but return flight to EWR delayed 2 hrs with no explanation.
In spite of the possible weather problems, made it into Asheville early.  Very smooth landing
The first class seats were very dated and uncomfortable and not competitive.

The flight attendants were not friendly, they seemed distracted, and were very rude when my row mate asked for an additional drink. They were also talking about how annoying some of the passengers were, totally unprofessional in my opinion.

The service on board was non-existing. I got served one glass of water (not even peanuts!). The last meal was served 2h before landing in EWR. Once on the ground, I had to rush through passport control and security, getting to the gate just in time for the messy boarding. No time for eating anything and no food served on this smaller segment. I reached Boston that I was about to faint. Also, going outside and back inside security area forces to leave water (I got on the plane). Guys, whoever is in charge of these things: FIRE HIM/HER. You need fresh thinking. You are decades behind any European, Asian, Gulf airport. Worse flight I've ever had.
not accepting the one day club pass at Terminal C in Newark is unacceptable!  You have to be kidding with making passenger take bus to Terminal A to use that facility.

It's extremely disappointing that Platinum status does not make you eligible for first class upgrades.  There is really no difference between Silver, Gold or Platinum besides boarding slightly earlier. It really does not encourage me to have brand loyalty when other airlines offer this perk on all of their domestic flights.  I was very displeased when I discovered this and I will be considering other airlines for my future flights.
only negative is the consistent delays getting to Newark.  Every afternoon flight into EWR is delayed.
Check in staff was very rude and not helpful at all.
Garbage plane. No wifi. Uncomfortable. Too small. Horrible

My flight was delayed due to weather, but I was not given the option to disembark, even after t he flight was delayed past the point of there being any chance to catch my connection. As such, I was forced to get a hotel in Chicago at my own expense when I could have stayed with family in Houston.
I thought erj145s were bad.  The “new” crj200s in this route are even worse and a reason to look for new options.

I cannot believe that your flight attendants allowed two men tk have a make out session in front of my two boys and I.   It was disgusting behavior and it went on throughout the flight.  The flight attendant was right there conversing with another passenger and she saw what was going on and did nothing to stop it.   I will never fly united again!!
Fiasco at gate when jet bridge would not work. Waited 45 mins to disembark.

I took an earlier flight and my baggage was supposed to be pulled and loaded on the earlier flight.  It was not which I completely understand.  The worst part was the fact that Springfield United  supervisor on duty told me my bag would be delivered to my hotel room that night.  It was not and I ended being late for a business meeting the next day...and wearing the same clothes from the night before.  I was extremly upset because what she promised did not occur and in fact my baggage was still at the airport the next morning...which I had to retrieve because no one called me to tell me that the baggage service did not pick up my bag.  The baggage tracking indicated "the bag is now with the baggage service slated for delivery."  The supervisor at Springfield should be admonished.

Yes, the flight was delayed 2 hours, time is very important and I wasn't' even offered a complimentary snack or complimentary beverage of my choice. I don't mean what's normally included, every passenger should have been offered wine/beer and full snacks for the lost time, I can tell you with no uncertainty that your competitors are providing better service in these cases.

Very poor service for first class passengers. Not at all worth the amount of $$$ we pay for the ticket. First of all the flight is delayed then in the flight my seat was 5A with so much litter on the floor and then they didn’t have any veg food and finally bags arrived after 30 minutes on the belt.
Please don’t apologize multiple times for incompetence in fueling plane.    Really makes experience worse.
The food was one off the worst I have ever had
Horrible service and over two hours late.  And you would not let me carry on my small bag.

your survey clearly overlooks the main problems.  3 of 4 of my flights from Columbus to your hub in Newark were delayed and the other flight was canceled.  If you look at my last year's flights more than half were delayed or canceled.  The baggage claim at Newark is also the slowest of any airport i have been to.    I am going to PHL from now on and taking my business to American.  United is the worst airline and Newark is the worst airport; officially by the way.  I happen to agree with everyone else.  United sucks, and improving the way to order food isn't helping.

The seats are TOO CLOSE TOGETHER, even in economy plus where I was seated. I was on the aisle and there was a 6'1" 240 lb man in the middle seat (he offered me this information). He proceeded to have 6 drinks and broke my headphones getting up to use the lavatory. And I did get up to let him out. It makes us feel like trapped animals.

I had a connecting flight to Newark on a separate ticketed reservation.  Due to the mechanical delay on this flight I missed two connecting flight options and did not arrive at Newark until 12:30am and I had a reservation at Classified at 9:30pm.  The day prior my outbound flight from Chicago to Ft. Wayne was delayed over two hours then postponed until the next day at 7:30am.  I moved to the 8:50pm departure which was also delayed two hours.  I arrived at Ft. Wayne five hours after my original scheduled arrival at 2:00am.  I arrived at my hotel at 3:00am.  This trip on United was a disaster related to mechanical delays and the crew running out of hours.  These delays were not attributed to the weather.

Flight delayed - not weather related.  Was originally booked on 2:50 flight out of St. Louis to Chicago - but that flight was delayed early in afternoon until after 5:00 p.m.  I was put on an alternate flight; however, that plane was delayed in Denver - not weather related - from 4:00 p.m. to 5:23 p.m.  When the flight landed at O'Hare at 6:30 p.m. there were no gates available.  We were stuck on the plane on the tarmack for 40 MINUTES!  At 7:10 we were finally given a gate.  Very frustrating - I missed a very important 6:30 meeting (that was only 12 minutes from O'Hare) that I would have had no problem making had the first 2:50 flight not have been delayed OR if the second flight would have even made it to the gate at 6:30.  Extremely disappointed with United.  Certainly not the fault of the captain or crew.

The flight was good. The seats were so tight and uncomfortable. I was also upset that the person who checked my children and me onto the plane would not allow me to bring my carry on to the plane. I fly often enough to know that it would have fit on the plane and there was plenty of room on the plane to put it. It was extremely inconvenient because I was traveling with 3 young children and had to walk a long way to baggage claim and then all the way back for a car rental.
terrible communication as to boarding, check in was ridiculous and we barely made it on time to our connecting flight. never. again.
Food was worse than ever personnel in Shanghai were rude

Why are menus given when there is no food on board? Flight left Aruba 4:30 PM to Newark 8:30 PM.  Hadn't eaten only to find there was no food on flight. Arrived at gate 7 minutes early only to find another pane was in our gate and once we got into gate they couldn't get ramp connected so we were stuck another 20 minutes

I was very disappointed with the check-in. I had checked in online and was awaiting my upgrade confirmation. I was next in line and went up to the gate 20 minutes before boarding and the flight attendant said the only seat left wasn't properly working and that she needed to check into it. She went to look at the seat and then came back and told me it's not working but if I wanted it as is, then it's mine. I asked if there was any discount considering i was paying and using miles. She said no. So I said to go ahead anyway. She walked around for a few minutes then went to her computer to process it and in that time someone at the front ticket counter had given away the seat. I ended up not receiving my upgrade and on top of that, the gate agent said "it wasn't confirmed" even though she had told me it was mine if I wanted it. It was disappointing to not be upgraded even though I was set to be upgraded and even worse to be given a non-truthful answer, and no apology at all. I am a loyal United customer and this was completely unacceptable.
disappointed with delay in departure due to poor scheduling of de-icing process.  created stress over making connection
Did not care for the delay in leaving Manchester.

The fight attendant assigned to the back by me was not cordial. She also confused me with another person who was also Asian, assumed that I was in the wrong place. It was embarassing. She also did not acknowledge or apologize for her mistake.

The gate agent was absolutely terrible to me when I attempted to get on a standby list for another flight.  Despite having an extra seat, she would not allow me to list my name.  I called customer service twice and was told I could list standby, yet gate agent would not allow it.  Her explanation seemed incorrect and my request for a supervisor was ignored.  I just wanted a clear understanding of why I could not be listed or pay a change fee to get on that flight and she was refusing to help.  Terrible customer service.
For a flight that is 7+ hours both ways, no meal being served and having to pay for tablet rentals is ridiculous. When I fly to Europe these amenities are always included.
The flight delay was an inconvenience.
Food was horrible, service in 1st class was poor.
The organization of the boarding priority lines is poorly set up and creates confusion and arguments amongst passengers . This is poor planning

I was sitting next to a very large individual. They were so large, the arm rest was pulled back and if I were to pull it down, it would have hit him on the inside of his should blade. Therefore you can imagine how much he spilled into my seat. He literally took up 1/3 of my seat. This is absurd! It was very uncomfortable for me - I was partially in the aisle and everyone kept bumping into me but I couldn’t be in my own seat bc of the person next to me! I am also a frequent flyer (86k miles in 2017) and expect to have better arrangements.  This also can’t be comfortable for the larger person either. As people are getting fatter in our society, something needs to be done to accommodate them - not only for their sake but for the people that sit next to them. I didn’t say anything to the staff to try and be polite but if this happens again, I will have to say something.  Offer overweight people a second seat at half price! Maybe they have a doctor’s note - but it should be required they have two seats.  I am severely disappointed in your service.

Original flights cancelled due to Houston not having enough deicing equipment (big joke), sent from Denver to Aspen to Chicago, and finally to Jacksonville over 2 1/2 hours late and spent hours on the phone changing the horrible itinerary that was assigned to me that would have left us in the Chicago airport overnight with no voucher for a hotel and would have lost an entire day with my family in FL.  RIDICULOUS to say the least!!!

The aircraft apparently had some minor maintenance problems upon its late arrival to the gate. We were told we could expect 5, maybe 10 minutes delay, it was over 40, with no other announcement. Long delay on the ramp with no information, then another long delay in the penalty box, again, little if any detail. I think this all happened at cabin crew, they should have done a much better job of communicating.
economy  -> basic economy = dumb, dumb idea.

My wife was experiencing sickness and dizziness. When we asked Catrina, the flight attendant for assistance, she very rudely ignored us. When my wife collapsed to the floor outside the bathroom she refused to offer any assistance and told her to sit in between the bathrooms and "get out of my way" in the galley.  Unfortunately, I did not have my cell phone to record the experience.  The other flight attendant reluctantly offered a cup of ice.  This was the single worst customer service experience I have ever encountered on a United flight.

You should not be charging 75 to take an earlier flight.  This allows you to resell the seat (even protection from other airlines if they experience delays).  And allows the passenger to avoid delay from weather or missed connections as the seat on the later flight is now open.   One less passenger to protect if the original flight cancels.   If anything charge that for a missed flight.   Just ridiculous that a biz traveler must pay this if their schedule enables them to go earlier.  Makes me want to change allegiance to another carrier

I requested a wheelchair, which was there for me, but no one was at the desks. I had to wait a quarter hour on my feet, which is difficult for me. Then when people showed up they said I was top late, which I wasn't - the flight was delayed and there was over an hour before it left - and eventually I explained I didn't need to check any bags and was already checked in on my phone, so they took me to the plane at last.   On the plane I asked a steward to please poor my larger bag in the overhead compartment for me, she told me "if it's too heavy for you, it's too heavy for me", i guess it never occurred to her I was disabled. Anyway another passenger did it for me, and he gave it and my cane back at the end of the flight.
The embrear jets are horrible.  If I had options, I would fly a different ai rt line just to get away from the embraer.

It is impossible to do any work in economy when the person in front of you puts their seat back.  I'm 6'4" and I couldnt put my small laptop on the tray table as I couldnt see the screen as the laptop was literally in my lap.   I fly Jetblue whenever I can as they have plenty of room on any seat on the plane.   Would it hurt uniteds bottom line that much to take a row or two of seats out of the plane to make the trip bearable?

terrible ramp and baggage service in Rochester. Terrible terrible. Gate said to be occupied when we were the ONLY plane in the entire airport. Waited 25 minutes to unload the plane, then another 30 minutes for green tagged bags. Over 1 hour to finish a flight with a small number of people. Unconscionable. Awful airport service.
My flight on Friday 12th January was delayed by three hours and the gate changed from B21 to F14.  Utter chaos.  I was never asked to complete a survey on this flight!

As usual, the flight was delayed.  For all of your talk about "being concerned with my safety" how safe am I when instead of getting into the airport at 9:00 PM, putting me in my room at 11:00 PM at night, you get me in at 12:00 am and I get in my room at 2:00 am.  I am absolutely fed up with your company, your service stinks!  O'Hare is your home airport, and your on-time departure and arrival is terrible.  I find it absoultely a slap in the face that as a silver member, I have to pay $75 for standby on an earlier flight, but when you make me late and put my life at risk, I get "sorry that you were inconvienced"  its a joke! I now drive anythime the trip is under 5 hours.....5 HOURS!  What does that tell you about your service? As usual, this will be ignored, or I will get some trite letter telling me how sorry you are and next year it will be the same nonsense.

Very uncomfortable experience, specially on your newer aircraft. I'm 6'0" and my knees almost hit the seat in front of me. I just cannot get comfortable. Older planes have more leg room than your new ones! What's up with that??!! You should be improving the flying experience, not making it a torturous experience!  NOT HAPPY!!

I was forced to check a bag because I was told after I got my ticket that my ticket required me to check luggage.  Aslo, the trip from Chicago to Los Angeles the bag checkin experience was terrible.  Long wait just to chreck in and not enough staff.

Biggest problem was poor communication. Passengers learned more from their personal devices than gate attendant. Didn’t help that everything at BHM was closed due to perceived weather. Which never happened.

I did my pre check I had all of our bags accounted for.  Once we arrived at the airport we were forced to pay an additional $265 dollars for bags that I still don't agree with.  If we weren't in such a time crunch I would have fought the charges with a manager.  Also, with a group of six people (all tickets purchased by one person, at the same time) you would think that we could have had some seats together on the plane.  But we were literally scattered about the plane for no apparent reason.  For these two reasons I will not travel with United again unless it is my only option.
No room between seats. Very uncomfortable.
It's ridiculous that you only allow one personal item and have to pay for all checked bags and pay for wifi. We had to wait 3 hours which was a big inconvenience.

The departure process at the ORD gate was about the worst I've ever seen for United. We were not given clear updates on why the flight was eventually delayed more than an hour. Although the monitor said equipment issue that was never stated by the gate agent. They changed their minds multiple times on how many doors they would use to load the airplane, and realized very late in the  process that the catering had not been finished.

I had to fly last minute for a funeral. I purchased an economy flight,  as last minute flights are expensive. I learned that with an economy ticket, I had to check my carry on (I only needed a carry on for my 29 hour stay) and pay a $25 fee to do so. This is a very inconsiderate business model. I will never fly United or recommend it to anyone.

Our first flight was delayed - sat 1 hour on board before take off - and therefore had no time between boarding connecting flight. Was unable to buy food in airport - and there was ONLY snacks available on this DINNER TIME Flight. This is not the first time. Very very annoying.
The pilot needs to practice her landing! It was a horrible experience unlike my flight to Newark from Ft. Lauderdale
Plane was on the older side and kind of dirty and disgusting. The gate at the airport was too.
Planes are in desperate need of being updated. Seats are torn, they are dirty and do not reflect the brand.  Additionally constant delays due to flight crew not being there is unacceptable!

I was upset that my luggage did not make it from Newark to dc. It went through secondary screening (which is crazy considering if I had picked it up after customs I could have got on the next connecting flight with no check). They opened my bag, put everything back I a mess and things got broken. Nothing of value but upsetting to me

The gate attendant was extremely rude  She even got in the plane to tell me to take a seat as I was heading ba k yo my seat If a flight attendant tells me it’s fine  Rude  Need training for your gate agents Terrible boarding process
Dinner . . chicken with rice . . was disgusting.  I usually don't complain about airplane food, but this was spectacularly awful.
Food was not good and seat and tray were dirty

That flight was fine but my 1st flight traveling to Ft Lauderdale on January 9th was disgusting. I was in the 1st class cabin in seat 1B. There was gum stuck to the center console the tray table and center area was filthy dirty. I was disappointed and disgusted.

information regarding the delay was slow in coming and was incoirrect and was changed several times and no information was given as the the cause of the delay even when asked as to why the incoming aircraft was delayed no answer was forthcoming

This survey is REALLY for my flight from EWR to PBI on 1/12.  IT WAS HORRIBLE.  It wasn't the worst experience I've ever had, but as far as communication, it was an epic failure on your part.  The line to get to security due to a fire earlier in the day at the airport was ABSURD.  The airport/United staff knew nothing, or told me all flights were grounded, when they in fact were not.  I can't believe I made the flight, and I can't believe it was on time. I can't believe nothing was communicated hours prior to the flight to let travelers know to get to the airport early.  There was no alert on the app, no email, nothing. If I missed that flight,  I would have been responsible for changing to another flight and that is unacceptable.  I was so disappointed.

Boarding is chaos.  People allowed on board with oversized carry on.  2/3 or more of flight in Boarding Group 2- the boarding system doesn't work and causes more stress to passengers as some people cut lines- go back to boarding by rows.

Our delay from PBI was lengthened by every passenger being allowed on with 2 pieces of carry on / personal items, which only after they didn't fit were taken and gate checked. As it was a full (oversold even) flight, taking some of those from later boarding passengers and gate checking them immediately might have prevented this. The Captain and cabin crew told us that we needed to be boarded and wheels up by 1930 to meet a revised departure time, when clearly trying to fit more carryon into the bins than would ever be possible on a full flight was going to make that impossible. Moving to gate check earlier may have made this possible and avoided the additional delay into Newark.
Space between seats is horrible

The flight attendants were not very attentive, and spent most of the flight having personal conversations in the galley. As a First Class passenger, I expected more. At one point, I had to get up and ask one of the flight attendants for a glass of water. She had her dinner, crossword puzzles, and cell phone spread out, and gave me a dirty look (as if I was bothering her). I thought flight attendants got paid to actually service the passengers, not themselves.

Figure your shit out... every part of my flight both trips where messed up by delays... they weren't weather delays they were stupid delays like another plane at the gate we were supposed to go to because everything is so disorganized.
Horrible boarding experience. I paid extra to be able to use overhead bins but no space was available. Paying extra for economy plus should give you priority boarding.
Horrible flight agent and flight crew! Not the service United is known for!

The flight attendant lied to us and told us its a full flight when it was nearly empty, not even half the flight was full We came with 2 babies and we asked if we can have their car seats if the plane is not full and they rule us is full when we got on the plane and we were the last ones on we saw the plane was empty.  We did fly with United on the way to Atlanta and the plane was also empty and the flight attendants were so nice and they let us have the car seats.  I don't know what the flight attendants cared if we had the car seats if the plane was so empty but we were really disappointed.
I got extremely sick o couple of hours after I got here. I got sick from the food on the plane.
There's a new class of service that does not let us carry on anything and I would have not been so angry if I had been told about it up front

I was forced by the self check in kiosk to check my luggage and i did not need to. The United employees told me to go online and request a refund and it will not submit. It is very frustrating that I cannot get my refund for a service that was not rendered.
The flight was delayed almost 3 hours. Not a great experience

broken baggage system in the aircraft pit delayed the flight.  mechanic had to come aboard to fix a seat headrest that had separated from the seat.  Whats going on with maintenance????..  Not very encouraging.. seems like cost cutting or not paying attention.  Hope the rest of the plane is maintained properly.. This is all in the aircraft logs..  I fly 75 k a year so i know when its right or not..

I used upgrade to 1st class because you put me in middle seat in economy. No meal served in first class for 7pm departure. Arrived in Chicago late and hungry.  The delay was maintenance related.  This is third flight in 2 months that has had maintenance delays.  I think you have cronic maintenance problems.
It was delayed due to mechanical problems.  Caused significant delay in my itinerary.
I didn't enjoy that there were no tvs on the plane
At the gate the personal do not allow me carry my carry-on. Very rude attitude.

You sent my bags ahead when my flight was delayed yet you NEVER TOLD ME.  I waited and waited at baggage only to find my bags sitting way in the back.  The NEXT MORNING I received a text saying that you sent my bags ahead.  Irritating.

The woman who sat next to me (I was supposed to be in 22A and my boyfriend was in 22C so I asked the lady if she wanted to switch, so she took 22A and I was in 22B) was on the phone the ENTIRE 5.5 hour flight.....   I suspect a satellite phone because it never disconnected, I never saw her take a phone out to log onto wifi, etc.  And she was yelling into the phone.  When the flight attendant told her to stop, she said she was talking to herself (which if true, I am deeply concerned about her mental stability and feel that the plane should have turned back to the gate and she should have been escorted off).  The flight departed at 9 pm ET and NO ONE within 5 rows got any rest as she continued to yell into the phone for the entire flight.  It was absolutely awful and the flight attendants made no effort to stop her other than to give us free alcohol.  Such devices should not be allowed and I think all of us would have rather taken the 30-45 minute delay to have her removed from the flight rather than suffer for the 5.5 hours.

Quite possibly the worst food I ever had on a flight.  I had requested vegetarian food and I called United to confirm.  But I was told that it was not the case.  Flight attendant told me that had opted for sea food so I will get his veg food.  Food was really bad.  appetizer has tuna.  Seriously?? Main course was just as bad.  I bet economy had better food.  Flight going to India should have much better choices.  You should fly Lufhansa Business to get some ideas.
The gate agent gave little to no information about the flight delays, what to do and where to go. Her english was not understandable and the gate seating dates back the to 80's. very uncomfortable,

The flight was rescheduled for 12+ hrs the last minute.  The personnel had no clue and could not help. The next day the flight was delayed again due to reasons like crew arrived at wrong gate, crew is confused about the timing for the flight, etc to the extend that the United lady at the gate was very frustrated as well and blamed senior management of United for the chaos.

Gate personnel were terrible: unfriendly, unprofessional, and bad accent voice (hardly to hear/understand what she was announcing).  Flight attendants were even worse, looks like she was in training? She was slow and not very helpful.

I used business economy and paid to check my carryon. I asked about my business satchel at that time and was told it was fine; however when I reached the gate,  the gate attendant was so rude and threatening. Unbelievable!!

i rang for assistance 3 times and was not answered. thankfully, it was not an emergency. otherwise the service was good. my main complaint is that my premier economy seat, which had adequate legroom, was soooo narrow that it was extremely uncomfortable to keep  within the confines of the armrest. the man next to me was not fat, but definitely impinged on my space for much of the flight. i didn't complain to him because i saw that he was very uncomfortable in his seat and couldn't help it.

The gate agent was upset she had to work the morning shift, lied outright to a United passenger connecting in Chicago to Germany that there was no overhead bin space.  She had no idea, was never on the airplane and there were 8 open spots but she threatened to take the lady off our flight if she complained more... made her remove her personal items from her carryon right in front of us...  outrageous, just because she was forced to work the morning shift.

The captain on this flight for the entire duration of the flight kept the fasten seat belt sign on. There was no turbulence.  The only reason was to keep people sitting and shifting the burden of responsibility in case one had to use the restroom to the passengers. I couldn't pee for over 4 hrs. It was torture. Additionally the flight attendants were enforcing this at every instance. People were sent back and asked to take a seat. Horrible experience on the flight.

I generally fly First Class, and I have increasingly noticed that the attendants on United fail to promptly assist first class passengers with settling into their seats.  I expect that during the early boarding for the first class cabin, at least one attendent should be waiting, with hangard in hand, to take overcoats and suit jackets.  This failed to happen on each leg of my trip this past Tuesday, and I was forced to hold my large, bulky costs in lap for 20 mintues until regular boarding was over -- and then I have to ask a steward, twice, to take my coat.  Shitty service .
My initial flight was cancelled and my family of three were reassigned to a new flight and were seated separately. Very frustrating situation.

Since you've stopped the direct flights on Tuesdays from ORD to SYR I now have to fly to EWR then to SYR, with a 1 hour layover in EWR so on-time performance is key. We were nearly 30 minutes late leaving ORD due to some reflector tape coming loose on one of the doors then waiting for mechanic and then the paperwork. Then we landed at EWR 20 minutes early but couldn't get a gate and got to the gate 15 minutes late. I then had to shuttle over to terminal A for my flight to SYR and got there just in time for boarding, but found the inbound was delayed but then we were late getting to SYR. Your scheduling is costing me time and money and I'm not very happy with you right now. It adds unnecessary time and stress to my weekly commute to SYR.
Food service was extremely disappointing

I had no issue with the flight attendants. This flight was delayed for over an hour because our pilot did not show up. This was extremely disappointing as it turned my 1hr layover into a mad dash through the Newark airport. I know I was not the only person in this boat as a couple siting near me had no idea if they were going to make their flight to Japan. The only reason why a 6 am flight should be delayed is due to weather or an airplane malfunction. After waking up at 3 am the very last thing one wants to do is find out their flight is delayed (for any reason).
The only issue was the breakfast offerings in business class--raisin bran cereal or omelet with spinach--not a wide or tasty selection. Breakfast was a disappointment.

Knowing in advance what the weather was and the time of day, the airlines should have been prepared for de-icing and they were not resulting in a great backlog and an hour and a half delay that led to me being delayed for meetings.
My flight went smoothly. I have no complaints whatsoever.
We were stuck on the plane for 15 minutes upon arrival because of a problem with the jetway but I don't believe that was United's fault.
restroom is worst.

My flight was delayed for 2 hours due to "weather". However, no storms started until long after we arrived at our final destination. This was completely unnecessary and delayed my husband and I getting to work on time. Completely unacceptable.
Poor planning from ground crew and operations caused delayed flight

Survey me about my flight on 1/16/18 from Chicago to San Diego (#651).  WORST FLIGHT EXPERIENCE EVER!  Flight our of Rochester  to ORD was delayed. Flight from Chicago was delayed.  Diverted from San Diego to LAX and bused to San Diego. Diversion would not have occurred if flight had been on-time.  I arrived 4 hours late (2am) and had to pay for a Lyft to my final destination as my scheduled ride was no longer available.  The passenger next to me on the flight from Chicago to San Diego was very obviously on drugs (the guy went to the lav 3 times and each time returned all "twitchy". I would have rather sat next to a crying child).  When arriving at LAX no gate was ready to accept flight and we were delayed again.  Announcement said gate agents would direct us where to go.  All the gate attendants were on the phone and no directions were given.  I have never experienced a more disorganized and poorly managed team (I use that term very loosely in this case).  I will NOT be using United again as a result of the horrible service I received.
Four plus hours delayed, which turned a 5 hr travel day into a 13 hour plus travel day with a month old infant. No food vouchers or other compensation offered. Totally unacceptable

I was disappointed that there were no private TVs on the seats for cross country flight (both going and returning). I did not download the United App and did not want to purchase internet, therefore was unable to watch "free" movies and television offered on my iPhone.
I tried twice to give flight attendants an empty bottle of Diet Coke.  Both refused.  Acted quite annoyed.

The basic economy ticket option, where you have to pay extra for a carry on suitcase or a second small bag, is ridiculous. I bought that on accident not knowing I was getting a basic economy ticket and couldn't sit next to my boyfriend during the flight. On top of that, I had to pay $50 at the airport for a backpack because I was already carrying a purse. WTF? Completely ridiculous, since both bags could've easily fit under my seat. This is such a stingy policy. Don't turn into the cheap airlines like Spirit where you have to pay extra for every little god damn thing - you're already in deep shit with your PR disasters, dragging people off of planes and stuff. But hey, on the plus side, soon you won't even have to resort to that, since no one will be booking with United.

OUR FLIGHT WAS DELAYED ABOUT TWO HOURS BECAUSE THERE WAS NO FLIGHT ATTENDANT. That's pathetic! The fill in flight attendant was nice but this situation should have never happened. DO BETTER. I was significantly late to work because of this. So unacceptable, have a higher standard.

I was very dissatisfied with the gate experience in Rochester. This was a flight that required gate checking our bags, and I fully expected to pick up my bags at the gate when I landed. However, we were told that because of "customer complaints of the cold," bags would be retrieved at baggage. I'm a 1K flyer and regularly fly to Rochester, including throughout the winter.  It wasn't very cold AND if people think it's cold they should check their bags. Many of us do not want to wait at baggage for our bags. That was the first problem. The second problem is that we waited 50 minutes for our bags at baggage. It was a very unhappy experience.   One additional problem:  when we left O'Hare there was a delay and while we pushed back from the gate early we sat on the tarmac about 10 feet from the gate for about 15 minutes with no update from the flight deck. Normally, the pilots are very good at updating passengers but on this flight we didn't hear anything from the pilots during the flight - nada, zip, zilch.  Thank you, Kathy Nordmeyer
Only problem was flight delayed about one hour

poor communication about delays.  Had too much fuel on the plane for a short trip and had to burn off fuel for 20 min on the tarmac after a 1 hour delay for de-icing and other maintenance issues.  Seemed very disorganized.
The no carry on fare experience was not positive
Able to change seats with no problem
Everything went smoothly and pilot Handled the plan with no problems.
Disappointing how dirty the cabin and lavatory were.

i think the airline should have suggested kids section to inform other passengers if they want to sit int he back of the plane, for example, they will have to endure children. if not, they should pay extra to sit up front. we had a very bad experience with other passengers not wanting to listen to kids games....so steward told us to put away...and then my 4 year cried for 3 hours...i'm sure whoever complained, was then even more "excited" to hear her screaming for 3 hours....if passengers have expectation that flights are sleeping zone...they will never be happy....
The plane was so dirty, there were stains and marks all over the walls, on top of the horrific smell.  It was disgusting
We had a delay taking off problem with water and something mechanical. Also disappointed there was no Wifi available missed that function.

We were three people flying, 2 adults and a child (4 years old).  We were all separated, unacceptable for a 4 year old to sit alone.  I had to fight significantly at every level to sit with him.  Unacceptable, we booked in advanced.
Late flights becoming more typical.  Not please with United.

Friends advised us not to fly United following all the negative publicity of last year, but we were willing to give United A chance.  We did not want to rely on public bias. We were very disappointed.We will avoid flying United in the future. Two thumbs down on customer service! Worse flight ever( and my husband had flown many rough flights when he was in the military). But you do have decent coffee!
6 hour delay on Wednesday, cancelled flight coming home on Thursday. Unacceptable.

The return flight was cancelled (a 4pm flight) and I was sent an email at around 12:30that day to inform me I had been booked on a flight the next morning. Really? You had nothing else but to in convenience me to have to get a hotel at my expense when you knew at 12:30 that my flight was cancelled?  I called my travel agency and switched to American Airlines who got me home the same day. Won’t fly United again if I have other choices.
The flight from Newark to Washington was from hell. The flight was delayed for 3.5 hours.
The experience at the airport in Newark is bad.  Having to get off a plane, grab suitcase, and climb on a packed bus to get to the gate is hideous
Horrible from start to finish

column26: CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: The choice of food was very poor. We had a previous early flight and no food expecting to get a breakfast box on this flight.
No updates about delay.
The leather was peeling away from the floor/wall borders, making the aircraft look shabby. There was no microwave, so it seemed rather thoughtless to serve oatmeal. (Cold!)
Flight attendants were very rude, disrespectful and judgmental
Flight attendant service was very poor. They were very "shallow" in only covering aisle seats and often missed passengers sitting in the window or middle seats

it was the new seating you came out with a few years ago.  My understanding is you are considering changing them. they are TERRIBLE in every way. not comfortable, too close together, there is almost NO seatback pocket to store anything. it's TERRIBLE. please change these out . I like united and am a silver member, and try to give very satisfied reviews, but every time I get these seats I will be giving a very UNSATISFIED  review.  it's worse than gestation stalls for pigs.
Every time I fly I board in group 4 and have to gate check my bag. I hate that

United did a very disappointing job of making sure my checked in bag made it to me and me only. As a result, my suitcase has been lost or stolen for over a week with absolutely no leads or updates whatsoever. You guys need to think of some way to implement security protocols at baggage claim
The meal was the worst food we have ever had served on a flight
The one tiny meal provided during the 7.50hr flight in economy was of very poor quality and the snack provided in the last hour of flight was a piece of pastry with a mysterious substance inside

I was in the lavatory and two flight attendants [female and male] banged on the door [while I was going to the bathroom]. I answered when finished and they yelled at me [in front of other passengers] and asked if I was smoking [an alarm was going off somewhere] -- I said no, I don't smoke and never have and motioned to the lav. The female flight attendant then yelled at me and said smoking was a federal offense -- and again I said I DO NOT SMOKE. I later heard another flight attendant say that the alarm was on the upper floor of the plane. I believe that I deserved an apology.

This was an overnight trip so I packed everything into a very small carry on luggage. At the gate I was told I had to check in the bag because space was becoming limited. Once I went on board and everyone was seated there was plenty of overhead space! Why do the flight attendants not estimate better? I had to wait for my luggage which is why I did not want to check my bag in. Very inefficient on your part.
The seats are not clean. Undersurface of seat is covered with dust. Toilet is not clean.

The return flight was problematic. We took off an hour late for weather reasons, I guess. (It wasn't fully explained) and then when we landed we waited another 45 minutes for a gate. Many passengers missed their connections. And again, it wasn't explained why.

One crew in mainly in the first class had a terrible odor from her hair or ? and every time she walked by it was horrible order and lingering smell. Nobody should wear any obnoxious smell when they are serving in the small limited space.

My daughter and son in law missed the flight because of bumper to bumper traffic. They dropped me off at the gate and I ran all the way but they had to park their car and take the shuttle. I was very upset they couldn’t make it And the United agent on the phone was not very helpful discussing our options. It cost them a lot to travel the next day and be charged a change fee plus higher fares. I also saw the pilot enter the plane after me. He must have been in the same traffic that we were caught in. I don’t know what created the traffic backup  poor help fro  United
Gate experience was terrible, unprofessional behavior will absolutely make me look elsewhere when I fly again.  Flight attendants seemed bothered and rushed.

on flight entertainment.....SUCKS! Get it together, would it kill you to put on basic channels? I didn't see one tv in front of me that had a different channel so Ill assume nobody is paying for basic tv.
One of the flights attendants was really rude with passengers and disrespectful

boarding process was chaotic and the area to line up was not organized well--the lines were out into the main walkway and it because it took so long the lines blocked the walkway and it was just "messy"
Packed like sardines in not only uncomfortable but potentially dangerous in case of a needed evacuation as such tight quarters. No personal service and filthy bathroom.
We sat for an hour and a half on a freezing airplane prior to take off.  With the weather what it was, they should have had the passengers remain in the airport.  It was extremely uncomfortable.

there was not a good way in your survey design to allow me to express my dissatisfaction. There was great communication about a 2 hr delay but the fact that there was a 2 hr delay caused me miss part of my planned business activities while in Chicago.
Disappointed with seating.  In the center seat was a very oversized person that took up a 1/4 of my seat (and had to have armrests up). Very uncomfortable flight.
Worst experience of my life
I rebooked form a cancelled flight to Asheville due to weather. The Greenville flight was cheaper but didn’t receive any credit and had to rent a car to make my appt. in Asheville.

Flight was fine but not enough legroom. Clients won't pay for upgrades so I am stuck squeezing my 36" inseam legs into the seat. When the passenger in front reclined her seat back, I had no choice but to sit sideways. No chance of working on the flight in that situation.

The seats were so small it was horribly uncomfortable especially after sitting an extra 45 - 50 minutes waiting to take off after everyone was seated. They had the heat cranked up so high that it was a very hot & claustrophobic cabin. This discomfort began with that & made so much worse by the small seats. Gave the feeling of being crammed into a tin can!
We left a few minutes late but arrived at the  Arrived in IAH on time but sat on the runway for quite some time. This made it difficult to make our connection.

My confirmed business class ticket and seat assignment was canceled without notifying me and without refunding the payment. Since no bus. class seats were available, I had to buy an Economy Plus ticket. To add insult to injury I had to pay a change fee and got no refund of the bus. class ticket!
having to pay for the flight map is terrible

When asked for people give them carry online I had nicely volunteer.  They got my whole carry wet sitting in the rain/snow.  It was brand new for this trip. All my stuff in the front pocket get damage.  Sad Sad Sad.
THE TRAVEL FOR ME THE LAST 10 DAYS HAVE BEEN HORRIBLE AND HAVE HAD TO CHANGE AIRLINES TO REACH MY DESTINATION. NOT HAPPY AND MAY CONSIDER ANOTHER AIRLINE.

I Juana Deautriell, passenger seated at 37F, on flight 1470 had a very embarrassing and degrading experience with in of your employee named Eridanias. I approached the counter to inquire about boarding time for the handicapped.  I'm on my final stage of breast cancer where it has spared. If you look at me automatically you can tell that I'm terminally ill. As I approached the counter to ask the question your employee Eridanias was rude and unprofessional to me. She was raising her voice claiming that I had too many carry- ons(she was referring to my lunch bag ).she was embarrassing me in front of everyone because she was loud and would not let me say a word. I was in shocked to be treated with such disrespect as a human being. Finally, she said very loud, "Are you listening to me?" Responded, yes, there's nothing wrong with my hearing. It's you that didn't give me an apportunity to ask my question.  At that time she wanted to know my question, but at this point, I was SO embarrassed and felt belittled by this person that all I could do was just walk away.
