I'm a 58 year woman, mother of 4 and grandmother of 3. I'm a doctor and I'm respected and loved by many and this experience broke me heart. I know that no one well read it, and if some one does, nothing would me done. Sincerely, Juana Deautriell.

We called to change our flight due to an email about an upcoming storm. The phone representative informed me of a flight for 1/16 at 6:20 PM although our confirmation email was for 1/17. I spent several hours on the phone correcting this error resulting in us back to our original flight. I wasted several hours on the phone vs spending my final day on the trip with my family in NJ.

Terrible communication about length of deicing process. When first left gate we were going to be an half hour early. After close to two hours  waiting & getting deiced we arrived well over an hour late. Poor communication as to various delays.
Not having full support at 615am to check in the Newark flight because the Houston flight was delayed is horrible customer service.

Flight was poorly stocked for food or drinks. Not a single coca cola available. Flight attendants have become very unfriendly lately on all flights. Very disappointed and I have been flying United since 2001

We had reserved  our seats 10 months in advance, but the day before the flight we were moved, and separated.   Very dissatisfied with that. Also few flight attendants didn't seem to friendly or helpful.  I know they deal with a lot of problems but we are the customers and should feel more welcomed

Our flight down (EWR - PTY) and flight back (BOG - EWR) both had problems with the seat-back video system. In the first case the whole system was down for all the flight. In the second just my screen was down until they rebooted the system. I don't understand why I should have to pay for wifi. The aircraft used on these routes are old and tired compared to competitors.

I have never experienced that kind of poor service in business class. The flight attendant (Paul) never smiled, wine wasn't offered we had to request it when we figured it wasn't forthcoming. The cheese platter was supposed to come with Port and it was never offered, the choice of dessert wasn't given, they ran out of linens--altogether a disaster, for that class--totally unacceptable.
The plane looked new, but the head rest design was so uncomfortable.  Really made for a long trip.
Only disappointment was the food selection. Raman noodles or chicken and rice. Didn’t spur my appetite so I ate very little on the flight

Maybe this is not where to write this! I had to pay $75 to change my flight to this one, and when I arrived at the gate it started with delays due the aircraft having maintenance issues, the delays continued to get worse - and rather then just tell us to go to the next flight they waited to the last minutes. Then come back and run for it, or wait here that they found another plane but we needed to wait for it to arrive. It finally get's there we board, close the doors and oh wait not enough gas - pull back up open the doors and get more fuel. So it cost me more money to only be delayed to arrive 2 hours later.

Our flight attendant in first class pretty much humiliated us. I had my dog which is an emotional support animal and I was questioned the second I stepped on the plane about the age of the dog and why I had him. On top of it I believe it was the co-pilot that came in to check my paperwork for having my dog in front of everyone because the flight attendant was questioning the crew as he said. I find this completely unprofessional behavior. We have flown many times with our dog and this may have been THE WORST experience I have had!
Missed my business meeting due 1 hour delay

I was charged $100 for for a 17lbs overweight bag. This seems petty to me when you consider the infrequency this occurs. We have many chooses in air travel and accepting an overweight bag from someone once may set your airline apart for people who have been lifetime customers.

the flight was 3 hours late taking off...then we did not get our 1st class meal for really no reason????  then they lost one of our bags...I feel I should get a refund you did not hold up your end of the bargin so why should I have to pay you full price/miles?????

When we arrived in Key West we had to wait almost an hour for our baggage, which derailed our plans to get from the airport to our hotel. We were given no explanation, just an I don’t know we are short staffed I guess

I was harassed by a woman who was scanning tickets on the way onto the plane. She yelled, held up the line, embarrassed me, and spoke down to me. I had done nothing wrong, except I was unsure of the baggage rules. I had a small bag I could have put into my larger bag, but she just kept being rude.
I was concerned about the possibility of bad weather in Boston ... but it didn't occur and there was no flight delay.
Flight was delayed for an hour due to a lightbulb change and another maintenance problem before we hit he deicing process which put us another 20 minutes behind.
Poor aircraft condition, repair should have been overnight, plane sat all night at Newark, only after a Passanger  complaint was repair started, lost 1 1/2 hours all for no reason
Seats are too close...no legroom...a tiny packet of pretzels are a pathetic snack offering...you pay chefs as consultants,charge ticket prices and give out toddler-size snacks?REALLY?????
Delay, no information about the flight. No staff at the gate to ask questions. On internet stood it was canceled, eventually it went. Absolutely unclear. Also none of the shops were open to get food
The plane was old and not very comfortable. There was no wireless or entertainment which was disappointing. Baggage in Chicago took a while.
I am very dissatisfied that I was charged $50 to carry on my bag.  I have been treated unfairly by your airline!  Doubtful I will book again with your airline.
My wife was violently sick after the flight; the only thing she had eaten that could have caused that was the Asian Veg meal ahe was served
The flight was delayed 30 minutes, and then it took it 30 minutes to park, which forced me to miss my next flight.

At check it united employee made check in a bag that I have carried on several times. On my way to Tampa I had no problem. Did not like her tone. Made me pay 25.00 dollars I didn't have. Tried to explain to her she wouldn't want to hear nothing. Very disappointing. Would like a refund for inconvenience.
The weather was not great, but the plane was on time. The landing was a bit hard. But all around great flight.

There was no organization at checkin, or security. Lines were crossing and people were stressed. Someone directing people would have made it a lot better. The attendants at the bag checking areas were not very nice either. Our bags were also lost. This is the second time I’ve used United for Business travel this year and the second time my luggage was lost. This disrupts business plans greatly. The baggage claim customer service weren’t very nice either. The plane was nice, and customer service over the phone when I needed to change my return flight was nice.
After a delayed connecting flight with no time to stop to eat, expected food in my flight but all we got was a bag of cheaps in first class!!! Unacceptable when I paid over $1,000. For this flight!!

In final approach, pilot had to divert and fly around.  Unfortunately, after landing, the Chicago based flight attendants started cracking "We're going to crash" jokes to the ground attendants. Completely unprofessional!!!

Disappointed at having to sit on the tarmac for almost 2 hours. Understandably, the plane had to be de-iced, but we sat for quite some time prior to that. Additionally, the incoming flight was late getting in, so we were delayed before boarding the plane and then we had to wait even longer.

I wish you would ask not just about the people in the field - how about UA corporate? It's very frustrating to sit in the waiting area, staring at a web site that says you're leaving "on time".... when it's 10 minutes _after_ the flight was supposed to leave. You really need to get your IT up to speed. Most of us travelers understand delays, but we cannot abide by inaccurate, misleading ETD's.
Horrible connect and also still havent received my luggage!!
There was no in flight beverage service (or food) due to the freezing weather at Houston. This made for a very uncomfortable trip

Yeah it was horrible . First leg I had a seat in row 12 and was fantastic . More room and was comfy . going to Seattle for four hours had a window seat in 23 . Felt cramped and clostraphobic and couldn’t move . Almost had a panic attack . Seat in front of me was right in my face . I looked when I sat down that the three seats in that row that the one at window Is considerable smaller where I had to sit . Was horrible
There was a baby crying most of the 3 hours of the flight. It was very annoying when I am trying to get just a quick nap in. Flight attendants didn’t even talk to the family about the noise

Although the ERJ145 aircraft cannot carry normal rollaboard bags, I was charged extra for checking my bag to Dallas.  Other passengers took their bags through Security and then gate-checked them for free.  When the itinerary equipment requires checking, you should waive the check bag fee for normal rollaboards. To add insult to injury, entering the US at Newark required that I pick up my bag for Customs.  Gate-checked bags were returned to their owners promptly at the jetway, but I was forced to wait over 20 minutes at the regular bag carousel for mine.  So I paid extra for the inconvenience.

I had to drive from Rochester ny to  Newark due to a snow storm and on my return flight your agent in Denver refused to help me  and just check my bags back to Newar and instead sent them to Rochester. This was a huge  pain for me. Also my ski back had a rip in it and can no longer be used. I own my own business and this left a bad taste in my mouth all the way around. I always thought the customer came first. Tom Smith
It seems everyone we came into contact with was very crabby and did not enjoy being there. From the security to the flight attendants. Worst service I've encountered yet.
choice of snacks not very good, seats do not provide adequate room, no wi-fi for most of the flight, there should not be a fee to watch a movie or TV

There was no food on the plane, forced to check and pay for bags that would have fit in overhead, couldn’t get TV purchases to work for nearly 2 hours, no WiFi.  Basically, I haven’t flown United in a while and likely never will again.
cabin was cold.  snack choices are very limited for someone trying to avoid salted items.
The terminal at Ft. Lauderdale was terrible.  The Flight board was not working - we walked the wrong way to find the Gate.  We were up and down escalators and elevators.

We had a problem with the arriving gate in Chicago which was F7 and we needed to go to B18. When we were there they announced our connecting flight was changed from and from B18 to E6. We had about ten minutes to get all the way back and with our luggage and dog it was very hard and we had a difficult time to move quickly like that.
Horrible flight attendant service.

A dog was seated behind me. I’m highly allergic, and knew not to mention it since I could be told to leave the jet as seen on the news when I woman asked not to be seated near a dog due to allergies. I’ve learned from other flyers that pets have more consideration than other customers. Brought a mask in case I was seated near a coughing person, but had to wear it so I wouldn’t sneeze and have an asthma attack. Very sad that Owners with pets have more rights than those who don’t.

Yes, my flight to Chicago was fine, but the loading of passengers was chaotic .  Why do you let passengers with with bags that are over sized on the plane?  You have the templet for sizing right there.  If the bag does not fit MAKE them check it.  Our take off was delayed due to no more room for bags.  So some people had to return them to the gate.  What a mess.
Distance between seats is uncomfortably small.  We could hardly  move our legs, let alone read a paper or magazine.

There was no accommodation for weather issues in Houston which had been going on for multiple days and check-in was chaotic. It was during the bag check that my bag was re-directed on to a different flight which resulted in its failure to reach my destination.

The airport experience in Houston was a nightmare. United opted not cancel scheduled flights even though they had limited staff to handle all the passengers trying to check in. It was very chaotic and unorganized. United lounge would not accept my one-time pass. My luggage arrived at my home the next day at 11:15 pm. I had medications in my suitcase that I needed and did not have access to. The communication on the website tracking my luggage was very poor. My whole experience with United for my entire Houston trip was a disaster.
Flight was extremely uncomfortable and unorganized along with it was not clean at all .. very disappointing as due to this I will not use United airlines again

I was a victim of very rude and abusive behavior by a United agent at check-in in MCO.  I do not know this individual's name, but he was young and of Asiatic appearance. I had packed my bags to a maximum of 23 kilos,  which is the limit United cites in Europe.  They weighed about 23.1. However this lout weighed them in pounds. They came to almost 51 lbs. Thus according to him they were overweight (less than half a kilo).  Because of the dishonest United policy (23 kilos does NOT equal 50 lbs) this guy insisted that I take some stuff out of bags.    What disgusting customer service.  Even the airline Ryanair, famous in Europe for being tough with customers, allows passengers a leeway of ONE kilo (that's 2.2 lbs) in their bags.  I was a Continental Airlilnes Frequent Flyer since the early 1990s.  I am so sorry that rip-off United bought them out. Your customer service is SHITTY  and your employees such as this creep' in Orlando are garbage.  I won't be troubling you with my business again. United Airlines = Pigs.

On our trip from Newark to Punta Cana the flight crew was very inexperienced....immigration forms were handed out at very end of flight the steward didn’t know which forms to distribute exiting the plane was a disaster it was unorganized as we were able to exit aircraft from front and rear exits....the flight crew was occupied discussing their private lives.  Returning to Newark we didn’t even get a pretzel
the seats are uncomfortable. I had a little bit of back pain . The quality of the seats are very cheap and uncomfortable.
on board delay was frustrating.

I had to travel 14 hours and then after we had to de-plane I was not allowed to carry my carry-on again (though I had it the first time).  There was poor communication on when the plane was re-boarding.  I got NO text or email alerts though I signed up for them.

I was seated next to a man and his nine month child.  The child screamed at least three hours of the flight from YVR to ORD when the Dad did not give the child constant attention.  It was so bad that fellow passengers came up to me as I deplaned and told me they were so sorry for me.  United should do something to isolate passengers that are so disruptive.
Old aircraft ! Not very clean especially in first class seats!! Tray tables dirty..
The flight attendant was the nastiest most aloof individual I have ever encountered in all my years of travel.

I have a difficult time either hearing or understanding announcements.  This is with any airline I've traveled.  I hear some fine, but not others.  On this flight, I could hear the pilot's voice.  I caught part of what he said, but I missed much of it, and I was listening.  Same thing in the airport.  Sometimes I think it's the speaker system, but sometimes it's the person's voice.  They need to speak up.  I decided on this last trip that I was understanding  the female voice (from another flight that I did not need to hear....but her voice was crisp and sharp).  It was more difficult for me to understand the soft spoken men with fuzzier voices...or not so sharp.   I am not young with perfect hearing, but I'm not old and deaf either.  Both on the plane and in the airport, there are other noises.  I don't know the answer to the problem, except to tell them to speak up and enunciate.  Or if there is such a thing as a better sound system, use it.

Flight attendants were not aware that we had to fill out a customs form prior to arrival in Toronto. There was a big jam at the customs area due to passengers not receiving the customs form prior to arrival. It was unprofessional and I felt frustrated that the airline to not realize that customs forms are required upon arrival at Pearson.

The gate agents were terribly rude. She demanded that I check my bag which I do not every do. My bag is plenty small to fit under the seat in front of me, but she demanded everyone check all their bags. The had no control of the gate room. Agents were rude and unorganized. I spend 7 years at United and had to take control of a gate room because she couldn't even recognize there were people from two different flights trying to get on one plane. She threatened to call PD on a customer for expressing frustration. I purchased F cabin down and Economy Plus back and will still stuffed into boarding group 4. Another bad example from United which is why I no longer have my status with you. I fly UA when I have to, not because I choose to.

Although it is extremely understandable that flight were delayed due to inclement weather, not only was getting INTO the airport a struggle, navigating through the chaos inside was a nightmare! No organization whatsoever! Took HOURS to check in and get through security. Flight was delayed multiple times then a cracked windshield was detected. While grateful it was detected on the ground, it was a major inconvenience to all of us. We weren’t offered anything extra for our troubles. It covered both lunch and dinner times and a measly small cup to drink and a handful of pretzels was what was supposed to tie us over???  Additionally, even though there had been ample time to load my luggage, (for which I paid a $25 fee to transport) , it did NOT make it to Chicago with me. Unbelievable! I called to receive a credit for my $25 and was told that was not an option. How easy is it to take my money but when an error is made, somehow it can’t be returned??? Not good, United, not good at all!

The flight was delayed several hours due to a late inbound aircraft. When we finally boarded, we were about to taxi when one of the windows shattered. We had to deplane and wait for a new aircraft (total delay was 3+ hours). When trying to go standby on another flight, the gate agent for the 3:43pm flight refused to take names or help explain how we could go standby.
My suitcase was broken and destroyed. I want United to refund me for this inconvenience.

Wasn't my original flight.  Was originally scheduled to fly to Denver, but due to a delay would have missed my connecting flight.  Then from Chicago, my only option was DCA instead of IAD.  Had to incur an additional Taxi fare to get home and pick up my car the next day.
My luggage came out damaged and extremely dirty with white powder all over it
Dirty aircraft &  terrible food, what else is there ?

Left bags in Chicago instead of sending on my flight to Chattanooga.  Representatives on the phone did not know the policies for delivering to the hotel and this made me wait up for the delivery.  The next morning I found out they do not deliver between midnight and 8:00am.  I had items in this suitcase that were necessary for work and no priority was given to get me my bags until 12+ hours after if arrived in Chattanooga.   When I returned home I noticed that my bag was damaged.  The frame is bent so obviously it wasn’t handeled with care.
Poor communication about the delay at the gate in Newark.  Announcements were infrequent and not really loud enough to be heard.
I was very dissatisfied since my flight on Tuesday, January 16 (UA994) was cancelled and I had to pay for an extra night in a hotel and lost a day of work without any compensation from United.

My checked luggage came back completely opened and with a broken mug inside. United Baggage Services blamed TSA for going through my bag and yet other than the mug, nothing seemed to be out of place or any sign that TSA had gone through it. The staff in person and via Twitter seemed to not care that my luggage came back in that state. Feels very careless of your team.

The airport experience at Newark was not good. I got on line after my flight was 4.5 hours late, because I missed my connection (last flight to Syracuse.) They decided to close the line right before I got to talk to an agent. I had to then find another open service desk. The plane was delayed at first for mechanical problems. This caused me to miss my flight and still United refused to give me a hotel voucher even though it meant I had to spend the night at Newark and wait for a flight in the morning. Since I had to arrive at my destination before noon, and your flight wasn't going to get me there in time, I ended up having to then take a bus from NYC at my expense (in addition to the hotel and car to get to NYC to get the bus.) I have already filed a complaint.
I was almost bumped from flight (someone gave up seat).  This should not happen.  I bought tickets month in advance.  Gate attendant handled it well but overselling flights is not a good practice.

You Nickle and Dime everyone. Now we have to pay to watch a movie ?, I could not even get free music or a movie to pass the time like we used to and to top it off everyone in coach is squished in...geez take out a few seats as we are not sardines in a can is how we feel and you know it raises tensions on the aircraft, flying is not enjoyable anymore
Why do you no longer offer food on the Orlando-Chicago flights? A bag of chips and drinks for a 3 hour flight is a little lame.

I rated food and beverage as poor due to the fact there was no snack/meal in First Class on a 2.5 hr flight. I don't believe a bag of pretzels qualifies as a snack. Had I known, I would have brought something on board.

I had 2 passengers next to me that put their carry on luggage on their seats when overhead space filled up and they stood there. Couple that with screaming babies and kids throughout the flight made for a very long 3.5 hour flight back home to Chicago from Cancun. Overcrowded airplane with very little leg room and a narrow aisle to get up to navigate to the rest room was not fun at all.
Flight steward was chatting audibly I’m front of plane. It was not business related and was annoying. I was half way back in the plane and it was distracting.

One main problem was our flight was delayed due to mechanical problems. We were sent to three different gates to find our plane. The entire group of passengers were hearded along from gate to gate. It started after the time we were originally supposed to board the plane at the first gate. From a C gate to a B gate too. Not close.

The airport experience was terrible. I was traveling alone with my service animal. I checked my bags curbside, had to go in and the agent let me know my service animal wasnt on the res. I know she is on my mileage plus profile along with required documentation. Se told me to call petsafe which after 10 minutes on hold was told to call the accomodations desk. Another 15 minutes on hold and the agent was rude and said my letter wasnt in my profile. Only after starting to cry and told her i was flying home from my fathers funeral(he died on my birthday) she suddenly found it. Then back to the airport where i went to the priority line since I was flying first class(paid not upgraded) and was told I had to go to the first class counter which was at the opposite end of the terminal. I said to the same original agent that she gave me wrong information regarding petsafe and all she did was shrug. No apology. Service and compassion was extremely poor! Very disappointed AGAIN!
The seats were awful. I got off the plan with pain I both my knees. Sorry I can't afford economy comfort

There was an appalling experience at the lounge.  The flight was delayed and the indicator board  showed awaiting aircraft.  It went straight from this to "boarding closed" which meant we had to run to the gate and just made the flight.  Appalling.  I know the other people in the lounge felt most annoyed about this.

The one disappointment I had with the trip was the two hours it took me to get through security.  Due to this I would not recommend anyone travel to or from Atlanta when snow is forecast.  The performance of the airport staff was ridiculous.  They were totally unprepared despite the weather forecast!  This was not a surprise.  Totally amazing.
No outlet power in economy plus is ridiculous.  It’s particularly annoying when the first leg of the trip offers it but the same craft coming back does not??

We arrived in Chicago and our bags did not.  Come to find out they were left in Houston! I flew to Chicago for work and had a work function the very next morning.  We had NOTHING but the clothes on our backs so we had to go to the only store still open (a Target with only 30 mins to closing) and buy clothes, undergarments and personal hygiene items at the cost of $270.  Our luggage did not arrive until 3:00 pm the next day.  An extremely unpleasant experience!
It was a terrible boring flight
Needs to be clearer communication when there are delays - no communication is frustrating for travelers.

My only problem with this flight was that it was delayed for over 2 and 1/2 hours causing me to miss the event that I changed my original flight , to make. I'm not sure why we were not put on a different flight to arrive closer to the scheduled time.
Women's restroom @ Newark near A21 was disgusting.  Horrible smell and filth yet the housekeeping staff was standing in the adjoining service room.  Unacceptable.

The attendants had attitude and were ill-informed. I asked about a dish and was told very adamantly by the flight attendant that it had no meat (I don't eat meat), just shrimp and vegies. But when it came, it had meat so I couldn't have. I mentioned to other attendant and he was very curt and said he wasnt the one serving so I had to wait. By the time she came the other dish (a salad) was no longer available. So even though I was in first class, I was left with nothing. And their attitude and lack of service/empathy was a total turn off.
Get mainline aircraft back from MHT to ORD.  These small RJ's are horrible!

The only male flight attendant provided very unsatisfactory service. With the tiny trays, there is very little room to mix a drink.  I spilled tomato juice on my lap.  I notified the flight attendant who was in the aisle next to me that I had tomato juice on my lap and needed some napkins.  He responded,"Yes I noticed and you got some on me."  He did not provide the napkins.  He then took some napkins and started wiping his cuff,  I again repeated that I needed some napkins and got none while he checked his pants further.  I asked a third time and got none.  Finally I just grabbed some from the cart.  It was pathetic compared to the concerned attendants I'm used to.

Yes. Your airline refused to allow me to switch flights departing from Tampa (which was available and would have saved me 4 hours of travel time) vs. Ft. Lauderdale. After being on the phone for an hour, and expressing my dissatisfaction, your airline wanted $800 to switch. I can understand paying a small fee. However, $800 would have been ridiculous! Especially since another passenger was allowed to fly for $40 for her trip. Your people &  policies were rude regarding this manner. I’ll be taking my business elsewhere going forward.

Original flight was via Houston, flight delays in Houston forced re-route via Chicago, had to exit gate, retrieve checked bag, check in and pass TSA a second time, then endure an extra hour of flying time. Seats in the A320 was not good, but the 737 was not fit for humans. How is it that car seats can be comfortable for tens of hours but a 737 aircraft hurts after less than an hour?

We arrived early for our flight due to early disembarkation from a cruise ship.  When I booked the flight, I purposely chose a later flight to allow for any potential delays, but that turned out to be not needed.  United had seats of the earlier flight but refused to reassign us without a fee of $75 each.  I think that is ridiculous because doing so would have benefited you at least as much as us.  Taking an earlier flight provides United with the opportunity to use or sell the seats on the later flight.  As it turns out, that was very important that day due to weather delays are rebooking.  So, it was a bad decision for United and super annoying to me.
This flight was over 2 hours late and then there were additional issues loading bags which resulted in additional delays. Not great experience.

Over the years I have made several Round trips from Sioux Falls to Chicago and back. NOT ONCE HAS THERE BEEN AN ON TIME DEPARTURE IN EITHER DIRECTION. The average delay is in excess of TWO HOURS. It seems united treats Sioux Falls as a necessary inconvenience. The regional jets are old and uncomfortable and are among the smallest in service. My most recent flight on Jan 16 departed 4 hours late. The return flight just one day later was 2 hrs and 45 min late with 4 GATE CHANGES! If I performed that poorly in my job I would have been fired long ago. There was a time when United was a good, reliable carrier. No more! Claude Summers

The United team member at the gate called for anyone sitting in the gate area from my flight.  He then walked away immediately but I had gotten up and spoken to his cohort and said he made an announcement, what was needed.  She was clueless and said it had to do about connections which would not effect me.  About 30-45 minutes later I realized there was a Chicago flight ahead of mine that had been delayed and I asked if I could come aboard and the same man said, "Did you check a bag?" which I did and said so.  He then said no I couldn't because of my luggage and said he called for people in the gate area earlier and I could have done it then.  I was sitting in the gate area the entire time and had never left, he did.  He should have told his coworker.  I was so annoyed.  Not only had I come the 2 hours early for my flight but I then had to wait the delay for my flight.  In the future, United should atleast compensate the cost of my luggage or pay for wifi, something.  It's my time (other people's time).
Lying down bisiness class seats should be made available

My luggage was destroyed beyond repair.  The fact that your baggage handlers can treat a priority surfboard like that is mind blowing.  I am beyond upset. I understand a small crack and have had those issue in the past.  But the damage done on this trip is beyond comprehension.  Especially for a first class flyer.  I am disgusted.
Nonstop commercials on the "entertainment" screen without an option to turn the screen  off was TORTURE. I covered it with the emergency procedures card.

Continental was great. Every United flight I take has a delay: 1) flight completely cancelled, and missed several lucrative $7k days of work that will never come back, 2) weather delay, a month ago, 3) lost luggage for two days, two weeks ago, 4) early landing, wait over an hour for luggage. What a terrible way to run an airline. We fly JetBlue all the time- barely every a problem. Why is United so terribly run? Miserable dread to be a passenger w United almost every flight.
Why do the flight attendants feel they need to yell at everyone? It's really quite tacky and unpleasant.
I was thrilled that I was upgraded to Business Class but in the process my kosher food request was dropped or lost. I had no food fora 10 plus hour flight!!

The flight was superior because it was less than half full.  For the first time in years, I didn't feel like a sardine in a sealed can.  And it was the main reason the flight crew was able to extend such professional service.  UA needs to end the practice of overbooking flights and perhaps to reconfigure the seating in economy class.  (FYI, I am rather thin but a full flight with overweight passengers directly in front and behind you makes for an uncomfortable contentious situation.)

I was in Economy Plus (seat 8C) - the gentleman in 8B was VERY heavy and did not fit in his seat which means most of him spilled over into my seat.  There was just no room for me to sit there.  I had no choice but to go to a middle seat in Economy where I didn't have enough room to open my laptop and do any work.  Disappointing experience.
Economy seats are too small and uncomfortable.  Flight was delayed and did not arrive on time.

My flight attendant was downright nasty. I will start with when I got to my seat which was in row 1. She was nasty when asking what I wanted to drink. 2. I asked if she had a blanket when she had a minute and she nastily responded "I will check when I am done with my service here, you will have to wait" in a nasty tone. 3. She asked me what I wanted for dinner, and then came back after 30 minutes of taking the entire business class cabin's order to tell me that they were out of my choice. This is unacceptable. Why did I pay to sit business class to be treated like crap? Unacceptable. I will now fly Delta from here on out.

I’d like to know why it took asking 5 different flight attendants to get a solution to the fact that the seat next to me had no working light. When asked they all said okay I’ll fix it then nothing. Ugh. It was very annoying and unnecessary. It is dumb small problems like this that makes me wonder how the attendants would react to a big problem.

Delayed 3 hrs for weather?  It was clear at Newark Airport.  The people at Newark Airport who take the bags from the plane for people waiting in the jet way for their roller bags show NO sense of urgency whatsoever.  25 min to get my bag.  Very disappointing.

Your surveying is missing the point. My experience, and I'm sure others, is influenced by if the plane leaves on time. There could be rose petals laid out as I arrive, but if every time I fly to, or fly out of,  Newark I sit for hours, then I'm very dissatisfied. It's that simple.
The plane was extremely cramped, no overhead even for a backpack & no WiFi/pde

The plane was in deplorable condition.  My business class seat was disgusting: smeared with stains, dried god-knows-what from previous passengers, grime and crumbs everywhere.  The 757s are in DIRE need of a cleaning and refresh.  The only reason I was “satisfied” with this flight is because the flight attendants were pleasant and the flight landed early.
Gate was not ready in MKE, spent 30 minutes waiting for the gate. VERY DISAPPOINTING!

Plane was over 2 hours late, was an older version of the short haul jets and looked like it was just taken out of mothballs; the outside temperature in Newark was close to zero and the  plane landed in a remote part of the airport. We had to wait in the wind and cold to retrieve our luggage, then got on a  bus for a fifteen minute ride to a series of outdoor ramps we had to climb, with luggage, to get back to the terminal. The plane was fill, but United always seems to put the worst equipment and personnel on these short haul trips to Buffal0, which must  be extremely profitable in light of the high charges for a one hour flight. Why do you continually do this, and insult and disappoint your passengers?
Just dissatisfied because the flight was delayed. Nothing United or their staff could do about it.

The area under my seat was barely sufficient to hold my computer bag.  As soon as we took off, I put it at my feet so that I could put my feet under the seat in front of me.  The back stuck out about 1 inch into the aisle.  The flight attendant told me that it was blocking the aisle, which was ridiculous.  She was pretty rude about it.  I complied, shoved it back under the seat in front of me, and had a very uncomfortable flight.
Poor service and old aircraft. Very disappointed

I was in seat 7C. The light did not work. The seat would not decline and I was not in an exit row. Neither flight attendant did anything other than saying they would either tell the captain (which made no sense) or would write it up. My impression was I was bothering them by asking. The male flight attendant told me to push the button. His response to my question, which it was obvious he did not listen, to was push the button. My experience was he treated me as if I was an idiot and had never flown.    I look forward to your response.   For an almost three hour flght I believe there could have been two beverage passes. There was one pass which start as soon as it was possible. I would like to know United’s policy and beverage service during a flight as to how many times passengers would be asked if they wanted a beverage. As his was a night flight, it seemed as though the crew just wanted evryone to go to sleep.

Flight was delayed since the flight before was late leaving the gate not allowing our flight to dock. Should have opened a new gate, if not available should have had signage or announcements that our flight would still leave from this gate, very confusing

There was ai conditioning the whole time that was landing on the people in the aircraft. Even if not directly, but it was easy to feel and that made me sick. I now have to recover from a very aggressive flu. Also, the seats were not comfortable for a person my height (187), I could not stretch my legs completely even if I was flying business class...terrible experience, I don't think I will fly United anymore.
Very delayed for no reason. Very long wait for luggage. Awful
the service behind teh desk at the gate was apathetic, not very helpful, and didn't even allow us to pre-board when they were well aware we had two young kids. Did not appreciate that.
Gate agent did not allow my carry on onboard but let many other larger bags. Agent even was nasty to a United employee traveling. Checked bag was returned to me with missing handle

Boarding the flight an hour early versus the normal 30 minutes resulted in Global Services members having no room for their luggage.  Boarding started even before it was listed on the boarding card.  Ridiculous.  Everyone sat on the plane waiting for 20 minutes.  Why board so early?

Flight Attendant was rude and racist.  I mean it! He only bothered me because of my nationality.  He kept on pushing my foot several times and it was not in the middle of the hallway (more that 4 times).  I don't like my foot being pushed like that, he should have just told me to move it.   When offered a drink, I was not able to finish it completely (had few ml left), he screams loudly "so much waste" only to me.  I found this racist as the person who was on the next seat did not want their drink either but your flight attendant  was fine with that because they were not Asian.  I am a citizen of the US and demand a fair respect.  United Airlines still has not changed its behavior or racist behavior towards passengers, especially slight attendants.

The delays both to and from Newark were completely unacceptable. The unconvience tume and time again for your customers is not acceptable. We have been sitting on tarmack for 30 minutes. Suppose to leave Newark at 3:50pm. It is now 5:15 and we are still in NJ. Customers should be reimbursed for this horrible experience.
The backage took a half hour to come out and the flight was delayed hours. Terrible
Due to the extreme delay I nearly lost my hotel room, and was late for an important meeting. No type of compensation for my time was offered, which was ridiculous.

I was very upset about the delay. I didn’t get a notification until I arrived to the airport!  I could of stayed longer at my destination instead of waiting at the airport. Which had no electricity to charge my phone. Plus I was charged a late fee by my car service because I got in so late!  So over all not happy with my return flight.

My complaint is in regards to United Airlines' predatory policy of charging $200 when one can't make the outbound flight in order to get on the already-paid-for return flight. It may be in the "fine print" but it violates common sense, thus the majority of customers encountering that situation will go into it unaware. I feel cheated and disrespected, and I will not be flying United any longer. Additionally, the customer service representatives on the phone where mostly unhelpful and in one case rather insulting.

I was booked on the 5:05pm which was delayed due to mechanical issues with the bathroom. There was an announcement that said to go down to B9 to get on the 6:05 as they had space. I did that and was informed that because I had a basic economy ticket they would not let me on. By the time I went back to B3 they had move the flight to the C councourse without any online updates - no push notifications nor updates on the app - and I missed the flight. The whole experience was very frustrating.

our 1st flight was delayed so much that we were going to miss our 2nd flight. We are a young family with an infant and rushing over from 1st flight to 2nd is very hard and complicated with so much luggage related to infant food and diapers. We had no way of knowing our 2nd flight was also delayed by 1:30 hrs - and rushed for nothing. We didn't have a US sim to go online on our personal phones and check the status and the first monitor allowing us to find out was after customs after we had already run and rushed. :(

I think it’s utterly ridiculous that my flight from Newark to Phoenix was no where near full yet I was still told I needed to check my carry on bag that met all requirements. When I proceeded on the plane I was told multiple times the flight was full hence why I had to check my carry on. Yet, there was at least 15 empty seats and PLENTY of room to store my carry on over head. In fact, the middle seat in my row was empty and the over head storage compartment only one ONE carry on bag in it. Very disappointed. I missed my car service due to the fact that I had to wait for my checked bag to come and arrive in Phoenix.
Long flights need lots of water service for people trapped in their tight seats

Memphis has to get their stuff together..  first jetway was immobile as it was “frozen.”  Can they not check equipment before an aircraft blocks in?  Then they apparently off loaded the bags before deciding we had to push back for the broken jetway and taxi to another gate...  so, at baggage claim we are standing waiting for our bags... after a long wait at the claim the overhead monitors indicated had our flights’ bags, a csr came over and told us our bags were down a hallway...  a narrow hallway as it turns out...  Memphis continues it’s less than stellar customer service.
It was a smooth trip, but the lack of stereo functionality was annoying.

An unmitigated disappointment.  From aircraft delays to limited information from gate agrents.  Any flight I take with United is delayed.  This one was near 3 hours.  Very frustrated and disappointed.
The air was constantly too hot in the cabin and the seats are terribly uncomfortable.

The lack of information was comedic. I personally had to tell the gate agents that the gate had been moved because I was watching the info on my United app. Unfortunately the app did not notify me of the change -- I had to just keep looking at it. The info on the displays about the incoming flight were totally misleading and not accurate. I used FlightAware to check the status of the inbound plane. As a very frequent flier and 1K member, it was very frustrating!

I asked if I could change my seat and was rudely told I cannot even though there were empty seats on the flight because I had purchased a basic economy ticket. The gate attendant then tried to charge me $50 for my carry on even though I am a united explorer cardholder.  it was a very unpleasant experience.
Food was poor. I took my own dinner which was just as well as there was no hot meal I would have eaten. The breakfast croissant had jam but no butter. No option to purchase additional items.

Baggage claim experience at O'Hare following flight was extremely disappointing and not acceptable.  Took 40 minutes for bags to arrive.  This was a flight that landed after 11pm with no flight congestion at this time and an almost empty airport.
Newark is a dirty airport. First experience there, but i’ll try to avoid flying through there again!

the gate at the newark airport was pretty grim. The c concourse wouldnt take the one day club passes so we had to wait in the gate area for 4 or 5 hours total because the flight was delayed. So that was just exhausting because we had come from Europe and were tired anyway.

There was a lack of communication with 90 minute delay and when I say lack I am meaning no one was at the gate when the delay got longer longer to notify and answer any questions.  The lack of service was appalling.  I expect more especially with the last flight out of the night and my need to be there for business in the morning.
The servirte is really bad

After the delay of almost 3 hours, I got on the plane. It was not very crowded, but I was in a row of three with 3 people in it, one a large man. When the doors closed I got up and moved up to a row where there were no people. The flight attendant came and asked me if this was my seat. I told her no, that I had moved up. I have a bad hip, which is going to be replaced this month, and sitting in that crowded seat was uncomfortable. She told me I could not sit there, and had to move back to the row that were not designated extra space seats. i understand having extra space seats that customers can pay extra for, but  14 rows seems a little excessive. Given that there was no one who was going to pay for that seat obviously, there was NO reason for me to have to sit back in the other seats. This is going a little too far, and it does not make me feel positive about United. I am a frequent flyer, and have been for many years, but this trip soured my perception of your company I am sorry to say. Calla M. Crafts
Our suitcase was lost and still has not been  recovered.   Since we are traveling to several cities, this is a real inconvenience.

disappointed that there was not cereal remaining for breakfast.  Sorry, but the omelet was gross as hard and tasteless.  The croissants should be discarded as an option since they are ALWAYS hard and undesirable.

The food was terrible. Dinner was acceptable, however the breakfast offering was awful. The croissant was hard, dry and stale. I’ve flown on many airlines and to many destinations both long and short haul and this was probably the least appetising offering I’ve seen.

My bag did not arrive with my flight to Albany last night at 1am, so I returned to the airport today to pick it up. There was no one at the United Baggage office, so I walked to the ticket counter and asked them to help me. They were rude and tried to brush me off by telling me to go to the baggage office.  I said there was no body there and asked if they could help me. They went behind the wall and came back and asked me for my baggage claim ticket then returned behind the wall.   After a few minutes they said to walk back to the baggage office and someone would meet me there. I did that and waited for about 5 minutes, but nobody arrived to open the door (I could see my back just a few feet from the door).   I returned to the ticket counter and said no body was there and asked again if they could help me. I asked to talk to the manager and he came from behind the wall and told me to go back to the baggage office. I said "no, I did that already", now you go get my back and give it to me. He was rude and said to go back myself. I told him that this is why the customer service was so bad at the counter, because he set a poor example. I told him that I have Premier Gold status and they all treated me like shit. I asked his name and he would not provide it. I asked to talk to his boss and he would not provide that name either.  All this time, there were no other customers at the counter. Just me and they didn't want to help.  Very poor customer service!  I really want to talk to the person that runs the Albany NY ticket counter team. This needs to be resolved, so other customers don't get treated like I did.

I had a flight from wilkes Barre pa to connect in newark. I was never notified that this flight was delayed 3 hours until I showed up in wilkes Barre airport. Due to delay I was not going to make my connection in Newark. When talking to the worker at the front desk I was told "give it a good shot" and basically bye with no other options. I decided to cancel my 1st flight and drive to newark. I cancelled at the front desk and drove to newark. When I arrived at newark they told me my 1st flight was not cancelled in the system and no notes were entered explaining the situation. I barely made my newark flight so I had to park in short term parking in order to make it which will now cost $40/day.
The fligts attendents were rude, unhappy, bad humor, spoken loud, the portuguese and spanish speakers were rudes and impolite. The breakfast had a terrible bread.

The seats barely recline, and when all of premium ecomony is empty it seems ridiculous that one cannot move to one of those seats. it is obvious the customers are saying they refuse to pay for extra leg room.
not enough leg room for a 5-hour flight. sorry, but it's really unacceptable.  1-2 hour flight would be fine but when three average sized men are seated together it's crazy.
Economy plus was extremely uncomfortable.  This was no upgrade over coach.

Its unpleasant to hear the flight attendants disagreeing and being loud about it.  We were trying to sleep and their dialogue was disturbing.  I understand that people don't always get along, but voices can be heard behind the curtain.

Premium economy on this flight was a joke.  What did we get?  A few inches of legroom?  The food was awful.  The worst was the service.  When my husband asked a flight attendant for water, she replied that she was the trash lady and couldn't help.  When I asked for a second cup of coffee for breakfast, I was told no, that they don't provide that.  This was the first time the flight attendants haven't offered more beverage for breakfast on an international flight--14 hours from Delhi to Newark.  You should check out Lufthansa's premium economy which we flew from Frankfurt to Delhi--superb in comfort and service.  If this had been my first United International flight, I would look for another airline on my next trip.

The Food! I received a chicken dinner and a cold vegetable salad. The veggie salad contained some kind of extremely hot pepper. I started sweating and crying uncontrollably, this is the hottest thing I have ever eaten. I couldn't eat anything else and had to get a cup of ice. Ruined my appetite and was quite upsetting.
My flight was delayed about 3 hours. Most of that time was spent inside the aircraft on the tarcam which is very uncomfortable.

I did not like the person who was at the gate taking tickets. She was not friendly or kind. She also singled out a couple of people for their luggage which fit and let others with larger bags go on board. She did not smile or welcome anyone. I was disappointed.

YES: 1) the gate person started a fight with the service person pushing an elderly person in a wheel chair...she was the first person pre-boarding. I was first one in line on premier boarding group 2......so I could hear and see the interaction very well. Quite a pissed gate person in her behavior. 2) The airplane was full to the last seat. The person at the gate allowed passengers to bring their bags on board while there was no space. The flight attendant in the back started a fight with a young lady because of her bag. The young lady - non experienced traveler - had just come from a funeral...very untalented from the flight attendant. The young lady started crying. Her elderly neighbor finally stepped in and helped the young girl through her emotions. I was sitting the row behind. There was no apology, no little sign or gift from the flight attendant to repair the situation. 3) The gate personell and the on board personell did not work together in the loading of the airplane.  4) I am a Senator at Lufthansa and fly 100 k to 200k (sometimes 700k miles) per year with Star Alliance. There was no fresh food available to purchase for me.

the loading was dysfunctional and a complete disaster.   Other attendants stop from bring bags on board. not this crew  bags brought on board had to be turned around all the way from the back it delayed the packed flight and it was a complete cluster.

All of the workers at baggage claim and check in guided me to the wrong area so it was difficult to find where I needed to go. Some were rude when you asked questions, they weren’t even paying attention at security. The security was talking to each other instead of guiding the line. The flight attendant barely spoke English. The plane was very small and tight. WiFi did not work.

Normally I have few complaints flying but on this particular flight there were a large number of flight attemdants flying and the crew on board paid more attention to them tagger than passengers. Unfortunately for me theu ocxupied thevtwo rows in front of me and I had backs of other cree members to me for quite some time.  Personal space is scant flying ao just imagine someone hovering in that space a large majority of the time. To top it off, they bypasaed many people with beverage service and sad to say dis not aeem at all concerned with passenger needs. Definitely not the typical United flight I have experienced before
The plane was VERY uncomfortable.  Seats were awful.   Hard and lumpy and exceptionally narrow.
Bad communications about changes and timing.

Flight attendant was not friendly.  I was unable to find where to plug in my phone charger and she was annoyed to respond, and still could not give me enough information to figure it out - she just said - right between the seats.  I could not tell whether it was on the floor, on the seats themselves, in the armrests, or what.  It was also dark enough in the cabin that I could not see where it was.  I never did figure it out.

My primary dissatisfaction with the flight was the delay. The message sent to me was that this was an Operational delay, in which case, I feel that United could have prevented it. The notification about the problem occurred well before the flight was scheduled to depart, meaning there was potentially time for you to correct the problem. I use United for business travel and missing meetings due to airline delays is not very helpful.
I was disappointed at the lack of space on the plane and that the plane was delayed taking off causing a 4 hour delay to the next available flight.
Smooth flight considering the bad weather....snow storm.  Arrived early.
Left on time and arrived early. But I do not like the $25 fee for checked bag. The food is not good. Finally, your charge for movies is terrible.
Where’s me bag?   248 hours later and still no bag, medication, and clothing?    Sad

I actually left the 2 hour flight with leg and neck pain and cramps.  The seats were so uncomfortable and I was actually in pain from being squeezed into the seat.  I don't experience that on other United flights, including the Embraer aircraft.  Hope those aircraft are removed from your flight asap.

I am EXTREMELY upset about changing gates 30 minutes before the flight takes off. We went from gate 95 to 136. We had people with us who were unable to walk that far. I heard that United was doing this consistently but I didn't believe it until I experienced it. Very disappointed.
I hate paying for bags. Therefore, if I’m desperate or it’s the cheapest overall then I will fly again
Flight attendants were very rude and inattentive.

The Mobay immigration process was not at all smooth, and personal snarly. Of course they are government employees, only saying. The form we were given in flight was not acceptable. Must be a problem of communication.
The person who checked my bag made me feel unwelcome and was uncomfortable.  I was her problem.
First class breakfast was sub par my wife was not able to have her preferred selection. Really poor customer service for a first class flight.

I think the comfort in the new plane is AWFUL! I am a 5'10" female who is slender and the seats in economy are ridiculous. ( I did pay for economy plus on my departure flight which was better but not great) I question how an overweight person would be able to negotiate the unbelievable cramped space in the new bathrooms on the plane. Will they have to start wearing Depends????

The male flight attendant was very scattered mentally.  He gave my husband and I the wrong drink order after we repeated it twice.  I noticed he gave someone else the wrong drink order.  Not a deal breaker, unless there is an emergency and he needs to think quickly and act quickly.

One flight attendant in economy was not listening to my needs. Asked for a coffee and cranberry juice. Only received cranberry and attendant moved to next row. Found this rude and making this a disappointment in my mind.
the flight attendants were horrible
Delay for take off and delay to arrival gate

Second time we have flown with United.  We hardly ever fly.  Last February we used United to fly to Seattle.  It was awesome.  This flight very disappointed.  We fly first class..expensive, but need leg room.  This flight only offered one breakfast selection.  Not hot meal.  Were told that Platinum flyers get first choice, there were limited breakfasts available.  Very disappointing.  The flight it self...very good.  No issues.  Also, we do not have personal devices for entertainment.  No screens on flight from Chicago to Tucson.  Again very disappointed.  We will be flying back to Cleveland in February, we have round trip tickets.  Not sure next adventure we will fly United.  Very disappointed.  Thank you for the first experience last February.  We could not compliment and tell enought people the great experience we had in first class.  This flight, did not feel special at all.  Mainly take first class, my husband is petrified to fly.  First experience excellent.  This one..not so.  Gerard and Margaret Valley

Because of the length of the flight the bathroom became quit dirty.  I am not sure how that can be taken care of, but last spring my wife and I took a trip on Japan Air to Japan and the bathroom was never untidy or dirty.
Priority bag came off dead last

For some reason my TSA clearance, even though I am a frequent United flier, and my TSA number showed as valid in United's computer, did not print on my boarding pass. The stewardess at the check-in desk saw it was showing in the computer but she just could not jprint it out. She said for me to just ask the TSA security officer to look it up on his computer (that he could) and there would be no problem. When I got to the TSA security guard and repeated the United's person's directions, he told me she was lying ("she just wanted to get rid of you") and had me go through a rigid security check (opening my suitcase and taking everything out). It was a horrendous experience.

Not your fault (i.e., could have happened on ANY airline), but this red-eye was absolutely wretched.  Usually as Premiere Gold in an exit row, I'm flying with road warriors who know how to behave.  This flight was ruined by two drunk young ladies in the exit row ahead of me.  They talked with their neighbor--loudly--for the first 2 hours of the red-eye, despite complaints by other passengers and weak attempts to address their behavior by the flight attendants.  The final 2 hours of the red-eye included 3-4 rounds of spilled drinks by the drunkies (including one all over my leg and shoes), selfies with the bright light of their camera shining in my eyes, and an aisle filled with their dropped debris all night.  Again, this could have happened to any carrier, but what a miserable red-eye, with maybe 10 minutes of sleep TOTAL.  How is one supposed to function after a trip like this?!?!?

My flight to Chicago was good. Even though I was supposed to leave the day before. I was supposed to be in Cleveland by 7 pm Wednesday. Not until 130...we were told we were being delayed till 630 since there was no flight crew. So I wait, 630 comes around we then are told AGAIN that now we are delayed till 1030 the NEXT morning. So now I have been delayed for 5 hours which I could handle, then i get delayed a day. So I have to miss work. I rebook my flight for the next day. I paid for a first class ticket to both destinations. I only got a first class ticket to Chicago. Not to Cleveland. I never flown with United and after this i don't think I will again. I feel the staff knew hours before we were not going to have a flight crew. And everyone on that flight waited...and for what. Just to be told we are not flying out till the next day. I didn't feel there was enough staff support to help or accommodate. Just brushed it off. Very disappointed. Not worth the money. Since i didnt even get what I paid for.

The gate agents in Allentown are absolutely bored and do not care about how they come off to customers. One did not know how to work the system or reschedule flights, while the other was divulging way too much information - like the maintenance man wouldn't "walk over from gate seven for a ten minute fix" which led to frustration when we found out that we had an eight hour delay for a rescue air craft.

The flight crew was understanding and shared in our frustration.  There definitely was a lack of timely information coming out of the airport.  It was comical to watch them fumble around trying to notify maint. and to hear them complain to each other that there is no maint. on staff at that hour and they had to wait for the tech to come in.  Then 1.5 hours later the maint. tech still hadn't walked across the runway to look at the plane.  Super frustrating to overhear this all play out.  I felt like I was flying out of a remote Antarctic location in 1959.  The painful delays caused me to miss all connecting flights in Chicago and had to rent a car to drive the final 3 hours to my destination.  Painful.
One of the bathroom was sealed shut, out of order.  That left just one in the back of the plane.  That's the first problem.  The second is that it was ridiculously cramped.  Not enough room to move.
your audio system is horrible. I couldn't understand any instructions given over PA system either in the terminal or on the plane.
Older black flight attendant with gray hair was extremely rude
Annoying that you charge for television. Especially since I payed for it since there was a movie I wanted to see that I didn't get to finish before landing. Waste of money.
It is appalling that we all waited two hours to depart because the crew could not shower. The gate attendant informed us all. We all had water issues too and we showed up in time. This is ridiculous.

in NO, with a TSA precheck,  still had to take off shoes and  take out computer... since TSA is a choice and is paid for,  what is NO's problem with not being able to handle 2 different lines. Also no information has to the 1.5 hr delay in taking off,  even personnel at the gate could not say why!!  The crew was in a nearby hotel,but did not show up on time..  terrible communication all around....very annoying and definitely not customer friendly!!!

Our flight was delayed 90 minutes and we were told by the United gate agent it was because the flight crew was delayed due to the inconvenience of not having water at their hotel. They were staying at the Marriott across from New Orleans airport. The entire city was without water yet all of the passengers were able to get to the airport in time for the flight. When we finally boarded, the captain said the delay was due to operational issues. We know this was not true because the gate agent shared on several occasions that the flight crew was delayed because of their inability to get ready prior to the flight at the hotel. This could be the most ridiculous excuse I’ve ever heard.
The aircraft bathrooms were filthy. Service rep at check in was unprofessional

We were told that the flight crew was late due to 'water issues' at their hotel.  In my opinion, the inability to take a shower does not justify having a hundred customers be delayed for an hour and a half.
Poor choice of in flight entertainment. Movie selection was terrible for a 6 hr flight.

the flight attendant where very rude and not helpful i told Linda the attendant about passangers blocking the aisles and she did nothing!! they where all in the back of plane and did not want to be bothered   I told the male attendant about power outlet and he did not do nothing was is going on with these workers !!

There was a 2" roughly circulate gummy spot on the arm rest in the console of my seat. I am unhappy that there is not included entertainment unless I bring my own device and that you use direct TV that stopped working when the plan leaves the US.

You need to retire the old embraer jets. They are uncomfortable, climate control stinks and it’s a miserable experience. I am 1k and it’s incredible frustrating to fly on this aircraft.  Next time I fly to St. Louis despite being 1k will likely take southwest.
The flight attendants were unpleasant, unfriendly and not attentive.  This was the first time in a long time that I was disappointed in United.  The flight crew needs to have an attitude adjustment.

The space of the seating is completely unacceptable I fly international for the most part and I think it’s decent but the domestic flight felt like I was physically abused in how tight you are backed into there you can’t even use the remote on the chair which was another horrible experience.... to make matters worse....

The flight to DC was fine.  But the return flight (which you have not asked about) was terrible: long delay and poor communication re: that delay would lead me to give a much different rating for that flight.
No just the bad breakfast , and the bad flight attendance

My experience was very bad at Ohare. I am 70 years old. Our plane was late getting into Ohare due to maintenance and pilot issues . The gate we arrived in was all the way across the airport from my gate to go to Charlotte. I ran and walked with my suitecase getting to the gate just as they were closing the door.  This was terrible....I have never had this happen in all the times I have flown which is extensive in my 46 year career. It makes me think that whoever decides these gates is clueless. I am very unhappy with a United.
The bathroom on board is way too cramped.  I am an average size person and had a hard time moving around in it and the sink just splashes the water around.  It makes the lavatory looks dirty.
The people on that flight were horrendous! We had a miserable trip which I have written you about in another letter!
Very disappointed
One of the flight attendants had a negative attitude. For example, did not want people to wait for bathroom in rear galley, but it was difficult to get around others in aisle.

United's absurd airport security line was just out of control!  Getting to the gate was such a challenge, that we will be avoiding this airline as much as possible from now on.  Attendants were rude, pushy and unnecessarily just in the way.  Many seemed to have no purpose whatsoever nor did they even appear to be properly trained.
Not happy about the new bag charge policy for basic economy.  Won’t be flying United again.
I will never fly United again! Newark terminal C check-in experience was the worst of my life. Unacceptable for flying in Business
Flight crew were late which caused delay. Then we were like number 20 to depart, which wasted over 30 minutes plus the delay. Weather was not a factor.

For such a long flight it was disappointing to be on such a small aircraft, no TV screens, unable to connect to United WiFi to watch movies/TV, etc, difficult to even stand up in the lavatory, no hot food served in first class.
the wait to fly was horrible! the plane was not ready at all in any of the flight we took and they were delayed which made it horrible to make the connection flight

The flight was great, and on time. Unfortunately, the baggage handling at Sioux Falls was horrible. I checked with the ticketing agent, they seemed to not really care. Nor took any initiative to investigate. A flight from Delta arrived after we did and received their bags in a very timely fashion. I grew tired of waiting and left the airport to get a meal. . When I returned about an hour later, the luggage was available.
People deserve an explanation. Why is the plane an hour late to arrive. Why are we sitting on tarmac To say too many planes trying to leave is stupid and scary, are t there schedules
Primary reason for the dissatisfaction is that the flight was delayed 3 times and ended up being 3 hours late by the time we took off.

Gate agents called boarding and had all passengers go down jet way and board a bus to drive to the actual aircraft. All passengers were held on bus for 20 minutes in front of aircraft. Then, without explanation, bus returned all passengers to jet way in order to go back to gate. Turned out there was no crew for the flight. Why would they call boarding and put us on the bus if there was no crew to fly the airplane?  Horrible service. Horrible communication among United’s personnel.

1. Do not load all the passengers on a bus if your crew is not at the Gate or on the plane.  2. Have the crew on the plane at the proper time to enable departure. 3. You train your agents to say the right things ( we are sorry for the inconvenience) but you did not offer refunds or anything to compensate folks. 4. There were no return flight seats available after this flight, from either Greensboro or Raighleigh. Three of us from the company ( TE SubCom) were forced to pack a 4.5 hour agenda into  3 hours in order to be able to return home. The option was to stay overnight was not possible either because flights were booked the next day.  Also the return flight 4813 was late, the flight attendant claimed luggage was on the plane when it was still sitting on the trolley, and asked passengers to stowe luggage under the seat " so as not to delay the flight" while the flight was already two hours late. Basic common sense is amiss in operations.  If the ticket was $200 this would be understandable, but these kind of glitshes for a $400  two hour flight ( I realize some of the money is in fees and taxes) seems unreasonable.
the overhead was quite dirty. The overhead airfilter had lots of grime around it
Just all round not very pleasant.. aircraft was unclean and staff just going through the motions. Not rude but not very welcoming either.

The seats on United flights are 1. very uncomfortable, 2. too close together, and I'm 5'3", 3. make it difficult to locate and use the power outlet. my seatmate was a tall person, and using the power would be impossible because there was no room to bend to put a charger in the outlet and no room to leave it there by his legs.

The plane departed 45 minutes late due to redirection of us taking off going north instead of south.   The passengers next to me had an infant and the mother was breastfeeding the entire time. I was trapped at window seat and realize it would be discriminatory to demand no breast feeding but I felt confined and trapped.  The bathroom smelled like smoke. I told flight attendant.    The aircraft was hot the entire time no matter if you adjusted air.   Just awful flight.
Sat on the runway for over an hour. No extra service from flight attendants. Captain gave explanation but still very frustrating.

I was 30 mins prior to my departure on the 1st leg and the airline personal would not let me check my bags.  I spent $31 to take the bus to Chicago.  Lost mileage on the 1st leg and no offer to reimburse.
Horrible service

We changed our inbound flight and apparently when we did our return flight was unbeknownst to us downgraded to coach after we paid full price for a round trip business class ticket. This is completely unsatisfactory and the customer service agent would not help us and refused to transfer the call. Have never been treated so poorly. We will never fly Untied again if it can not be resolved!
The people at gate were absolutely terrible
Got limited beverage service at the very beginning of flight and the 45 minutes before landing.  One small cookie at that time on a 9 hour flight.  Ridiculous!  Water was served often.
the flight was too expensive for such poor in flight experience.  not happy at all.
Stop routing fights through Newark, the airport never gets planes in and out in a reasonable manner.
Seats are in humane.  Tea agents rude and hostile

Unfortunately , we were not told that there were no more movie screens at each seat and instead a space to put an i-pad.  Not knowing that, we did not download the United app to allow us to go onto the United app and watch movies.  If we were told all of this, we would have brought another i-pad and downloaded the app beforehand.  It would be great if United could include this in e-mails and on the website.

It was an OK flight. I don't travel United too much anymore due to higher prices and quality not commesurate with price charged by United. The Continental staff just aren't equal to original United staff.

Terrible welcome crew arguing with ground staff.  2 formal service on a 15 hour flight, crew absent the rest of the time.  Crap business class seat, unimaginative menus.  Honesty versus Far East carriers your service routine is appalling, your staff attitude dreadful.  United is the worst long haul carrier I fly with by some stretch

Flight attendants were particularly rude and impolite. I selected an aisle seat but when I checked my bag at the airport I was told my seat had changed and I was put in a middle seat. No explanation was provided and this is extremely frustrating. Not to mention the economy seats are intolerably small for someone 6’ 2” to sit in for a few hours. I will never fly United again.
Flight delay due to crew members delay
very bad. would be nice if i got a half a refund really was the worst flight.
People were bringing ridiculously large bags as check on & it caused a lot of problems and a delay in people being able to get to their seat. Check on bag size measurements need to be enforced!!!

We sat in the Madison baggage claim area for at least 20 minutes; the carousal never started.  A Delta attendant told us that the bags already came but we knew that wasn't the case.  My husband went upstairs to ask that a baggage claim representative come down to assist.  Our bag had flown on an earlier flight and he had it locked in the office.  I wasn't notified and I didn't think it was allowed for your bags to fly on a different flight.  I received a text message at 8pm that evening stating that my bag had flown on an earlier flight.  I landed in Madison at 11:30 am!!!  WHAT THE HELL????  I'm very disappointed in United for allowing my bag to fly on a different flight and for not notifying me until approximately 8 hours later.
Only complaint is that beverage service seemed to take a long time and none of your fabulous cookies, only pretzels
the on boarding process is chaos and no one from United to assist/organize. people cutting lines - fighting with one another-terrible!!
Flight delayed over an hour because pilots were delayed on previous flight. Bathrooms were dirty

The airplane was the most uncomfortable plane I have ever been on.  There was next to no leg room.  My wife is 5 feet tall and she could barely cross her legs.  I spent most of the flight with my right leg in the aisle.
I don't like cold sandwiches for snack, prefer cup noodles or nuts and crackers!

Aircraft configuration for seats 1A and 2A makes it very difficult to access overhead storage. Given the fact that I have Premier Boarding I am usually on early, however with seat 1G, if I’m not first, then I will need to travel well down the aisle to store a backpack, and then its very disruptive for the boarding process to make my way back to my seat.

I did not appreciate having to board a bus and transported to a plane a half mile away. Then disembarking from the bus, with luggage and carry-on to the steps to go up to the plane.  Aircraft was uncomfortable. Between watching my footsteps from the stairs to watching my head as I boarded the small plane, I just did not like the aircraft nor the boarding process.

My only negative was that I bought a boarding upgrade for the flight due to winter travel and need for ensuring overhead space. Turns out I was on a small plane for which almost everyone had to check baggage at the gate since the plane's overhead bin was too small for most bags. I feel I wasted $30 on a rather useless upgrade. I will now pay much closer attention to the type of plane as I have taken the Charleston to Chicago flight (and return) 6 times in the last 10 months. Realistically, I wished when I checked in online that the priority boarding upgrade came with a disclaimer about space limitations of the plane I was to be boarding.

my flight was endorsed to Air Canada..Air Canada had problem with my booking no. or ID..It took awhile for them to figure it out..So i missed my direct flight to Toronto, Canada and instead rerouted to Chicago..Travel time was doubled..

I tried the basic economy for the first time.  I did not pay attention at all to the limitations of this class of flight and didn't like having to pay the extra fee to check my luggage. I would try it if I was just flying for a day trip.  I don't like to check luggage, would have had less of a problem if I could have gate checked my luggage even if I had to pay the $25.
It was extremely unpleasant lining up to get on the flight.

I am very disturbed that I lost an aisle confirmed seat in Economy Plus and was reassigned a middle seat for a 12 hour flight. I have very large shoulders and was uncomfortable the entire 12 hours. Something happened in the system but my mailed itinerary showed a confirmation of my seat choices.
Boarding with lines for group 1 to 5 is very poor system.

Flight was delayed more than 2 hours.  Was not notified until arrived at airport.  Checkin person rebooked me but I don’t believe I was given all the possibilities.  And the airplane was quite dirty.  The area between my seat and wall was full of food particles.  Plane could use some deep cleaning.

After arriving to check in we learned of a significant flight delay (~2 hours) at the electronic kiosk.  This delay caused us to miss a connection and re-orient our entire trip. This was especially inconvenient given that the flight time from the west coast to the east coast is already a long flight.    We received no advance notice of this delay via text or email. When we asked the agent to check on other flights to see if we could make our original connection in Chicago we got an annoyed look and were told that we were being rude.
