Nothing like "I realize your frustrated, and I'll try to see what I can find." It was not the best customer experience.    After this we put two large bags on the scale (in succession, one at at time). They were each 1 lb. overweight. The agent insisted we remove items and take them in our carry-on to get each bag to 50 pounds.  I realize this is a policy, but these bags were not 55+ pounds and on other occasions with United (and other airlines) a bag within one pound of the limit was deemed acceptable.    Once on the plane, the pilot informed us that there would be a 45 minute delay because of crowded airspace at Newark and we'd be waiting on the tarmac.  This delay, which I realize is not in United's control, nonetheless jeopardized making our connection in Newark to our final destination in Albany.  (Fortunately we were able to make the connection.)     All in all it was a sour trip, from the delay which we were not notified about, and the ultra-picky bag weight experience, and further delay on the tarmac, it soured the whole trip.

I am extremely disappointed in not being upgraded. When I booked the entire 1st class was empty.  I signed up to use expiring global upgrades.  These were apparently ignored.  This has happened too frequently in the past years resulting in no upgrades and the certificates expiring.  Essentially they are generally worthless.
Aircraft had mechanicsl problems flight was delayed

There is a MAJOR problem with the airline not controlling the carry on each passenger is allowed.  Most people try to abuse the system, and the airline acts like there is no problem with their policy.  Change the policy and enforce the rules.  EVERY passenger should have some access to a portion of the overhead. Or just do away with the overhead.
The seats and lack of legroom are ridiculous.

The plane was old but got me from point A to point B.  However, my biggest complaint is delay.  I had delays on my return trip last night due to the crew not being present.  I ended up losing nearly 4 hours of my life on this trip.  And this reminds me of why I had been a very loyal Continental customer for years but transitioned due to similar performance in the past.
Plane was delayed, chair broken

I got a United (Chase) credit card because I will be doing extensive travel to the East coast.  However, I lost my cc so had to book this flight on another Chase card.  They would not honor the free back even though I used my new United card to pay.  Very frustrating to hear policy jargon and no exception.
Rude flight attendant- male, glasses, bald. Poor treatment of Gold Star Alliance members unable to move seats after door closed.

There were three small children who yelled and cried the entire flight.  Finally I asked a flight attendant to talk to the parents but she said she didn't feel comfortable saying anything to the parents.
The United airline staff at Newark airport were horrific and unprofessional.
I've NEVER had to wait hat long at the gait (more than half an hour) for a gate checked bag.  No updates, freezing cold without lights on, and staff not caring that we were waiting.
In flight meal quality was not attractive.  F-class Salad was taste not so good. Over-all meal service degraded from previous meal service for F-class.

Flight attendant although, personable, was simply rambling at a very fast speed when speaking over the intercom...so fast reading from her phone and you could not understand her. Asked her simple questions and she did not know the answers about the flight or the aircraft....one of the worst I have ever seen on any flight , on any airline.

We purchased seats w more legroom, but when we got our seats they were in 3 different areas. Me, my wife and 4 year old were out into different rows not even close to each other. So my wife managed to get 2 seats next to each other for her and my son, I was given a seat, B, with a woman w a infant next to me, scratching me and crying. I’m tolerable because we have a child, but not really fond of other people’s children scratching me because well, It’s gross. Baby fingernails... yuck

As I board the plane the attendance Anthony Brown stopped me and demanded that I consolidate my three items, luggage, computer bag and purse. There were two ladies in front of me that had the same three items and were allowed to board with no consolidation requested. That was another lady board shortly after I carrying three items. We were all in first class. As we exited the flight I can confirm that three ladies had three items.

Yes its more my flight from ORD to IAD.  I took this flight, was delayed for an issue with the plane, moved gates, was late.  Once on the plane we were told that the computer was not working and all people on board were not registered and would need to do it manually with their phones. When I landed United cancelled my flight IAD to ORD because of a no show status. They said I was not on the manifest and was a no show.  I explained for 30 minutes and finally reinstated the ticket and wanted to charge me more??  Anyways now I did not get credit for the flight out.  Unbelievable you had that many issues and made it so difficult for the customer.

Uncomfortable seats... way to narrow. My shoulders are wider than the seats so I get bumped by everyone passing by. (It's not me, it's your narrowing seats!) I witnessed your flight attendants being rude to other passengers.
I was traveling with perishables also that went bad because I didn't get to where I needed on time.

There was a flight delay...  we received an email message that the flight was delayed for ONE day to 1120 am Friday June 19th...  ad the local display board at the gate said a one day delay as well...  we couldn't find a rep at the counters and went  the United Lounge who gave us input that was wrong...  that flight was only 35 minutes takeoff delay...  but when we got on flight, it was actually a lot longer delay to take off.....  we waited on tarmac a long time to take off...  and we landed an hour late.....  The agent at the gate repeated several times that the plane had no entertainment system operating...  maybe time for Republic operators to do some investment in maintenance...

Flight attendant pulled my jacket and that of my wife from overhead compartment and just dumped them on my lap without explanation. She came back later to put them back after I asked if there was a rule to not allow jackets in the overhead compartment . Then when serving drinks, I asked for one without ice. I saw her pour one with ice and i said I prefer no ice. She said “it is not for you” in a very curt manner. She then gave me a drink without ice, without saying a word. She offered the women beside me and others the full can but excluded me. It all sounds trite but it was obvious that for some reason she disliked me. I told the woman beside me that I was not getting along with the attendant and she responded that it was obvious to her. Perhaps, the attendant has a bad feeling toward senior citizens.

There was a gentleman sitting in 8E,  Who was sitting in my seat as well as his own, and had my right shoulder, chest and arm pinned to the seat because his body did not fit in the seat.   Additionally he was not wearing the seatbelt because it did not accommodate his body.   Not only is this emotionally physically and psychologically uncomfortable and unacceptable,  this is a serious safety concern!!  I’m planning on writing a written complaint to the FAA.   There was a period of turbulence on our flight and had the turbulence gotten any worse or there had been a need for an emergency landing there would’ve been no way for our row to exit safely.   The seats have continued to reduce in size and dimension and currently united is not requiring passengers to fit in their own seat.   This is not a one off experience.   Frequency and severity of the situation continues to increase.

The plugs for head phones need to be replaced.  I paid for the tv service but the connection wasn’t good.   I constantly had to hold my headphones in a certain position to have sound.   Very frustrating
You lost my snowboard bag... AGAIN. I’ve flown four times with you in the last 3 weeks and twice, you’ve lost my snowboard bag. And the kicker - both were direct flights! Unacceptable.
Not United's fault however delays in / out of Newark are bad, and ground services, waiting to get to gate after landing, waiting for jet bridge operator etc are unacceptable.
Sick passenger (104’ temperature, cough, sneeze) allowed to board and infect 175 other passengers
DISSATISFIED WITH ON LINE CHECK IN.  WAS UNABLE TO CHECK IN ONLINE SINCE I HAD NO BAGGAGE.  HAD TO STAND IN LINE AND CHECK IN AT AIRPORT.

I was flying positive space on this flight so this isn't as big of a deal for me, but I would not want it to happen to a customer. I was upgraded to First before all passengers checked in. When I arrived at the gate, I found out I was being moved back to Business. I requested my original seat (an aisle) but it had already been given away so I was stuck in a middle seat. As a positive space passenger it was frustrating, but to a customer it could be infuriating.

YES!!!    I paid good money to sit up front, (third row back in main cabin)   when I am allowed to board the plane all the carry on bag compartments were full even though no one had filled the seats below this area.  I had to go as far back 6 rows with my carry on to a bin that I had to shift some luggage to make mine fit in.  This should not happen, people who have seats in the back of the plane use these bins instead of the bins where they are sitting, which leaves no room for the customer who paid extra to sit up front to put their luggage.  On the return trip was even worse, I paid extra to board earlier which I still had to wait in a line, when I entered the plane I encountered the same problem, but this time it was even worse had to go further back.  I wasted my money to board and sit up front for the convenience, easy entrance and exit.   NEVER HAPPENED!!!!!    Had to struggle thru the crowd to retrieve my luggage.   Could the airline  flight attendant be more vigilant and control this from happening in the future!

It was a tough flight with a ATC delay for this only IAH to EWR flight of the day and this was a 757, weird. People were scared of missing connections and the plane had not been cleaned. There was gross tissues and a used headseat in the seat pocket and dirt on the seat. The merger has just lowered quality.
Burger was cold and gross, the seats are so so tight and small unlike other airlines. Very disappointing with seat size and room.

Never understand why priority bags do not come out first?   This system has been in place for many years but yet priority bags continue to come out later than normal bags.  Either how Chicago loads the containers or how Hong Kong unloads but it makes no sense this many years later. United still has a problem with priority bags.  It does not speak well of the airline
Even though I was in economy plus the back support in the seat was poor and I was in pain for much of the flight.

My reservation for my wife and I was split into two reservations so that I could be eligible for an upgrade.  No option to reverse, change seats or refuse upgrade so that I could sit with my wife.  Her reservation downgraded to Group 4, etc and did not reflect my status and the entitlements of a companion (my wife) traveling with me on the same reservation.
The airlines stewards (both of them) were extremely unprofessional and rude. Worst I have encountered

Flight from Chicago to Orlando was fine.  The flight back to Chicago was very dissatisfying.  The seats were very uncomfortable.  When I asked for a pillow, I was told they don't have any for "this cabin."  This made for a painful flight that continues to the following day.  Also the Wi-Fi wasn't complimentary like the flight going to Orlando (don't understand why it would be different).  Lastly, you didn't have any breakfast options for purchase.  Customers could only purchase snacks for the morning flight.
stuck 1 1/2 hours at passport control so had to run to catch connecting flight.  And NOTHING to eat.  How about at least some gluten-free snacks?  5 hours with no food is ridiculous.

The check in was horrendous. Complete stand still. Then when we are about to check in the person handling us was slow and made several mistakes. I told them 1 bag to check and they printed for 2. Each step in the process from line to check in was overwhelmingly too long. The airport was hot and stuffy and several other people were affected too. This led  to many people complaining and it was totally appropriate. I don't know if more people were needed to handle or equipment wasn't working properly or what, but it was intolerable to say the least. I honestly felt like I could collapse at any time from the hot humid air and the crammed situation with all the people waiting and complaining. Security was not too bad and boarding was ok. The flight personnel were good, but once you start on the wrong foot it is hard to get back on track. This check in was my worst ever experience in flying. I have traveled with many airlines in past and prefer United, but not for this trip. Other airline check ins were moving, yours was not.
Ridiculous to have to pay for movies on a 5 hour flight. Already paying for luggage and food. Not to mention they ran out of food before they got halfway through the cabin. Ridiculous

You folks have to do something about the number of animals you let on the plane. This flight the people in front of me had two dogs. The staff at the beginning of the flight approached the people three times trying to understand the need for the dogs. the people said one was a cabin dog and the other one was for emotional support. The dogs were never in a container and were out the entire flight.  A flight I took a few months ago a large dog was walking up and down the isle on its own. The flight attendants had no idea who's dog it was. The dog walked by my seat while I was eating and tried to jump up on my tray. the flight attendants had to make an announcement  to find the owner. A male a few seats in front of me claimed the dog, he said he fell asleep and the dog walked off. I have heard  passengers complain about being allergic to the pets and complain about having to sit next to them.

The flight attendants (two) were not friendly when asked questions ( one question about DirectTV and seat screen; another question about late arrival into ORD and time to make connecting flight). Both interacted with me as if I were causing them an inconvenience.

There was an earlier flight to SDF and there were 3 open seats.  They would not let me fly standby without paying a fee since I am not GOLD status.  There were no other passengers taking the seats and could understand if there was an opportunity to fill the seats with others, but that was not the case.  Paying $70+ for a seat on a flight that is not full, knowing that I already paid for a flight back on the same day 2 hours later, is ridiculous.  Also, it took me 20 minutes of waiting to get this ridiculous answer from the gate attendant since he was missing and not at his post 20 minutes to takeoff!!!  Looking forward to flying another airline in the future due to my experience and interactions yesterday.

The flight was an hour late. We only had carry on, by the time we boarded the overhead cabins were full so we weee told very rudely that we would have to check in our bags. We told the lady at the check in that we had expensive, breakables in our bag hence why they were carry on, she rudely answered there was nothing she could do. As a result of the bag going underneath, our glassware ended up breaking. We found this out after waiting for our bags for a very long time at the baggage claim.
I travel this route every 2-3 weeks.  Always the same food.  Suggest changing it up more often.  Also, the cushions in the seats are worn out and uncomfortable.
The worse flight in my life the delay was tooooo long

The flight attendant accidentally spilled coffee on me when she was reaching for the pot. She gave me seltzer to try & get it off my white top & a complimentary snack box. I understand that accidents happen, but am disappointed that the white blouse I was wearing back from a business trip is now stained.
Flight attendants were apathetic, bordering rude in every aspect of their interaction with me and other customers around me.
The flight was delayed and that information was conveyed but it kept changing and there was no communication about the new boarding time so we had to keep checking
The seats even I as @ legroom seat was bad no comfortable at all very narrow craft .Very bad

Small delays everywhere added up to a long delay. Delay getting on the plane. Delay due to maintenance issue. Delay taking off. Delay finding a gate at the arrival airport. Broken escalator leading to the air Tran and no steps only a long line waiting for 1 small elevator.
Horrible confusion loading plane
You should have Personal screens for everyone, the online thing was bad
The meal was unacceptable.  Small quantity, no dressing offered for salad, not worth the price paid for first class.
Drink cart made it back to Row 37 only 15 minutes before the plane landed on a 2 hour flight. There was no turbulence to delay serving.
Bring Polaris cabin until then this is the worst experience and product in the industry
It was disappointing that the flight was delayed and I missed the family dinner I was flying to New Jersey for

Lost my bag again. I had to check my bag on ramp. No show at final destination.  You lost my bags bothe coming and going on this trip. You people are like your company arrogant and condescending. The flight attendants were so large they could barely make it down the isle and bumped virtually every person.

Well the pilots made up a lot of time - here’s a beef - your app says flight is on schedule, u get to the airport all indications are the flight is on schedule you get on line to board and puff there is no plane at the gate and all of a sudden bingo the flight is delayed like what. Cant you just update me. You make yourself “batty” getting to the airport on time to be delayed. Seriously Side note, the flight attendants were not at their best.  When they served coffee, i asked for milk not 1/2 n 1/2 milk they barked no we do not have milk really what if i wanted a glass of milk come on its not that unusual a request to open a small container of milk and let a pay8ng customer have milk with their coffee
Flight attendant was extremely rude. Bathroom was unbelievably disgusting. Dried pee all over the floor, toilet, everywhere, smelled disgusting.
Frustrated with delay

The gate area was crowded/small so there wasn't much room for the normal lines and signs for groups to line up or know where to go - so the gate area was chaotic and disorderly.  Makes for an unpleasant boarding experience and angry, pushy, anxious passengers.

Waited 1 hour for a late flight and then after the plane moved on to the run way -- it returned for further delay because they said the weight was too lopsided.  In addition (and even more concern) my suitcase did not make the flight.  I know they were in a hurry to get the plane loaded because the incoming flight came in late -- but living out of town and NEEDING some things in my ticketed luggage --- it created problems for me.  I went back to the Sioux Falls airport at 10:30 and still no suitcase. The airline had my suitcase delivered the following morning.  I told them I wanted to PICK UP my luggage but was told it was already assigned to be delivered and nothing could change that.  It made this flight very inconvenience for me.

I had a window seat.  The windows were filthy and disgusting on the inside, looked like they hadn't been cleaned for months.  Also the pockets on the seat in front of me were dirty, and the packets were full of trash, cracker and candy crumbs, really awful.
The pilot also had a very rough landing. Plus, there was a panel right in from of my seat on the wall, that came lose. That’s not comforting in an airplane.
I would think that the planes are more modern now and the technology that is offered would work.  Also the customer service was just bad.
Late as usual. Rude disorganized flight attendants

Repeatedly late and we are not informed two hours before so we can leave our home later.  Crew knew and didn’t show up early. Communication at gate poor . Good weather ... air traffic is bullshit. Why isn’t the gate traffic managed better. Given fluvseason and the plane sitting at the gate for two hours it should have been sanitized. I got sick after flight..which was empty as everyone who could transferred to earlier flight which was also late. Late seems to be status who for UA
With all the illness out there cleaniness is important.  There was dirty napkins left in the seat pocket, crums in the seats, nose marks on the windows.  yuck
I’m a 6’2” man, I have NO legroom in your seat configuration (check my post on I- onlyforward51). You seriously packed me in

I was very unhappy since my seat had changed when I checked in for my flight. I was booked in Premium Economy but when I checked in, my seat had changed and I was in Economy. I called United but there were no other seats. The person couldn't explain the reason for the change. I am fairly tall and sitting in economy is not comfortable since my knees hit the table on the back of the seat in front of me.  I do not understand why my seat was changed.
flight stward john was very rude

In Burlington I paid an extra $63.00 to get a seat in economy plus on my flight from Newark to Seattle because I am 6'2" and I had injured my back.  When I got to my seat the leg room was great but the seat back would not recline because it was just in front of the exit row - the attendant at the counter did not inform me of that and I was not able to change seats - I was not happy nor was I very comfortable.
Annoyed by the delay. We rushed to get on the plane and sat for almost an hour before take off.
No wifi was a surprise and disappointment.

After departure I noticed that the 4 exit row section (12 seats) in the isle in front of me were all empty. I moved from my aisle to one of those isle seats so that the person in the middle seat could have more room. The Flight attendant said UAL policy not to allow that or pay a fee. That’s an anti passenger policy. I realize there is an upcharge to reserve those seats when u book a flight, but once airborne, I’ve never had such an negative experience with moving to an empty tow. RECONSIDER.

We booked FC and selected seats in Sept/Oct 2016 for this Jan 18, 2018 flight. About two week prior to the flight, we looked at the reservation and saw that our seats (3 and 4D) had been taken away and we had no assigned seats. Reservations and 1K desk could not help us secure assigned seats. We were told to keep checking back. When we pay for First Class and pick our seats we do not expect United to assign them to other customers and not even notify us that this has occurred. This leads us to distrust the service being offered as First Class on United.
Although i am a GS and was flying Business Class i was waiting more that 45 minutes to my suitcase to arrive to the belt - this is NOT the first time i had bad experience
Very disappointed. Both my flights were delayed and had to sit on the tarmac for almost 45 minutes both ways before getting on the runway.

My company travel policy says I have to buy the cheapest economy flight.  I can usually pick a United flight anyway for scheduling reasons, but I can't choose a more expensive United fare on the same flight.  So I was stuck with your "Basic Economy" ticket on my trip:  a red eye from SFO to Newark and the return a few days later.  I have Gold status, but couldn't pick a seat.  Stuck in a middle seat both ways.  Not even the ability to PAY YOU FOR AN UPGRADE!!!!  I got to the airport early for my return but couldn't fly standby on an earlier flight.  Then it's just a stick in the eye to find out I don't even get any qualifying miles for the trip.  I will fly this route frequently but will stop flying United if I can't avoid your really pathetic "Basic Economy" service. The way you implemented this fare level is really bad for business travelers but since it is the lowest fare on Expedia, I can't pick something better.  You are not thinking about the impact to 50,000 mile a year travelers when you introduce this.  I have flown over 750,000 miles on United and don't ever remember sending you a complaint before.  But I looked up my forgotten AAdvantage account number the moment I got home.  Get rid of Basic Economy or exempt Silver and up from it provisions or you will loose our business.

Was not satisfied with beverage selection in Business Class.  Flight Attendants said they only had what they flew down with and were not restocked with any beverages in Mexico.  Many passengers were not happy there was limited wine and beverage selection.

To deplane & then be reboarded was inconvenient but also didn’t encourage us about the maintenance & communication between United & it’s clients. Wasn’t a secure feeling. Maybe someone could have at least offered free internet/entertainment? Just not a pleasant experience & coupled with the boarding problem with carry on luggage not being allowed. Same pc of luggage allowed on this flt & fit overhead No Problem. Would like to be reimbursed or somehow compensated for the inconvenience coming & going for myself & partner Carmel Urgo. Thank you for your consideration.
delayed without explanations, on a good weather day.

First, the flight from Newark to Chicago was delayed, then the wifi didn't work. Because of the flight delay, once I got on the flight from Chicago to San Francisco, there was no luggage space in first class, and I had to check my bag. Because bags are delivered particularly slowly at SFO, I had to miss a talk I was giving in the city. Not a pleasant flying experience.
We have had two flights in the last 2 weeks and one was 4 + delayed and this one was 1 1/2 hours delayed that does not make for a good record on your end What is happening to your airline

Unclear which group was boarding next in Boston.  Gate only had lines for 1 and 2.  Nothing on the monitors for what groups were boarding.  As Group 4, I ended up being one of the last passengers to board and needed to check my bag due to no overhead bin space.  The gate agents only checked my bag to Chicago rather than to my final destination.  I am still waiting for an update regarding my lost baggage.
The lack of notification of delays in advance of the flight’s departure was a problem
I am very tired of getting put in Group 4 boarding because I prefer an aisle seat.   I’ve got 956,000 miles with United and am tired of being treated as a second-class citizen.

Poor information management at the gate. No info provided about the flight bring delayed until about an hour ahead. The aircraft was sitting at the gate the whole time yet the flight was labelled as delayed due to air traffic control

The two hour plus delay was very frustrating, for the vague catch-all reason of "Air Traffic Control."  I realize this is not United's fault but it nevertheless adversely  impacts the customer's flight experience.
Gates were too far apart. Both flights were onetime but I nearly missed connections and will have the same problem today.

The food has been gross lately. Why do you always include a heavily spiced option? The chicken encrusted with HOT spices should be eliminated. Who eats that? And the cold Asian chicken salad is worse than high school cafeteria food. I thought United was trying to up their game when it came to food?
How come I wasn't notified that the flight was already delayed before I ever got to Manchester airport.  I wasted more than 4 hours in the airport instead of seeing patients.
I called for slight compensation and i was denied  1.5 hours delay!

poor service experience compared to the outbound flight 807 from IAD to Beijing.   the attendants were not very helpful, a little dismissive.  my food options were not available and i concessions were provided.
Very disappointed
There were crushed nuts all over the floor and around my assigned seat when I arrived onboard.
Staff accommodated the bad weather
Very miserable flight attendant in Business/First and awful meal

Yes, the staff at the gate did a terrible job in managing the overhead compartment space relative to the passengers already on board.   1. It was a full flight, and they did not figure out they needed to gate check bags until after the line had already backed up for minutes.  2. I was on line and about to board the plane when they realized there was not enough space. It caused a 20 minute delay.  3. When they finally got bag labels, they were servicing people who there after me, so I had to wait another 10 minutes.  4. On top of this, the flight home was delayed, it is ALWAYS DELAYED ON THE WAY HOME.  5. I am going to swtich to Delta.

Gate agent wasn't courteous.  I had a two carry on pieces in the proper dimensions (one for under my aisle seat and one in the overhead bin).   I also had my small pocketbook out as my cell phone was in it which had my boarding pass.   The gate agent wouldn't allow me to put my pocketbook back into my under the seat carry on bag.  She said that I would just get it out again once onboard the aircraft.   The under the seat bag was small but had enough room for my pocketbook to fit under the very small under space for the aisle seat.   If she took the flight with me, she would have seen that the carryon with my pocketbook back inside were under my seat for the entire flight.   There was plenty of overhead bins for all passengers on the aircraft.  The gate agent used a very nasty tone with me which I didn't appreciate.   Very disappointment in her behavior towards me.
No room for carryon bag at the gate. Forced to check bags even though they were properly sized.

On all of your flights, the PA announcements over personal headphones are VERY LOUD. Probably hearing-damaging-loud. When I see the PA announcement on the video screen, I pull my headphones off in a panic, lest I be assaulted with the ear-piercing, brain-numbing announcement at nuclear levels. Is that adjustable?

The pilot flew very low. I always saw the ground, we never went higher and I was in excruciating pain as my ears were totally closed and my head throbbing. My hearing did not return until today. I couldn't hear announcements about luggage delay... The pulot said there was turbulence but I didn't feel any just horrible pressure from flying so low.

In general, priority baggage handling is largely ignored by baggage handlers.  Consistently across the past two months, other bags have come off the line well ahead of priority bags.  It is disappointing to have an expectation set that is rarely met.

Terrible plane, very uncomfortable seats.  Pitch of seats made by back hurt.  Too narrow. I had a heavy person next to me touching me the whole flight.  No place to stand. Difficult to walk through narrow aisle.
The boarding process was a bit chaotic. due to the lack of space on the gate area.

It was frustrating that I ended up needing to check my bag once on the flight. There were only very small spaces left in the overhead bins, so my bag was not able to fit. I realize that this happens some times and there is not much control on the part of the flight attendants. However, what made this more frustrating was that many of the bags that were already on the plane in the overhead bins were much bigger than my bag, and sizes that I highly doubt would have fit in the sample bin sizes that are provided before entering the aircraft, while mine easily fit. On a flight I took with United last week I was also required to check my bag because when the ticket attendant asked me to make sure that it fit according to the spaces made for checking before entering the plane it was not able to fit, so I had to check it, understandably. Based on my previous experience, I made sure to travel with a smaller bag that would definitely fit for this trip. I would have expected this to be the typical way that things are handled, however, based on this experience, it is not, as there were many bags bigger that did not have to be checked. I got stuck waiting in the back of the aircraft until all other passengers had boarded and were able to sit down, until someone could take my bag to be checked, which I do not believe that I should have had to do in the first place.

The flight attendant was extremely disrespectful. I fly a lot and know what customer service is like and should be. She was rude, her answers were short and I felt like I was a waste of time, bothering her.

One woman freaked out and was hysterical speaking in Portuguese about how she didn’t want to die and didn’t want to fly on the plane. We were on a full flight. Not sure how difficult it is to reroute people into different planes, but at the 1 hour cut off, maybe just rebook people onto other flights? This was the only direct flight and I know it is a pain to retrieve luggage, but we were sitting at the gate for over 2 hours which was making people anxious.
CRJ 700 is a poor airplane to fly the ORD to ATL market - cramped, luggage is a problem, Seats are uncomfortable n

The flight was significantly delayed due to mechanical problems, but the reason for the delay and/or projected departure time was never shared.  It was very frustrating.  Even the flight attendants didn't know what was going on.

i know problems happen, but this problem should have been discovered before passengers boarded.  waiting 3 hrs in the airport (with access to food, restrooms, walking, etc) is so much more manageable than waiting 3 hrs in a window seat!
the two hour delay in departure seemed to have no other cause than poor planning by the schedulers.

Unfortunately we sat in coach instead of economy plus. I injured my knee trying to get to my seat.  It is cruel and I humane to have passengers sitting in coach and have less than one foot between the seat in front of you and your seat. If we needed to get up to use the rest room, we were barely able to leave our seat without injuring our back or knees. It is criminal for United to treat its passengers so poorly. As a result, when we fly in the future ( at least twice a year, and we have the explorer card, we will be forced to,pay an additional fee for economy plus to spare us injury.  We have noticed the seats are very narrow, too.

Lining up for groups at the airport is a mess. It is impossible to know what group line you are in.  Also, the economy seat on this airplane are terrible! I am only 5'8" and my knees were scrunched into the seat in front of me. I was so uncomfortable. Plus my regular sized briefcase barely fit the width under the seat and can no longer roll down the width of the aisle. I understand the need to make the most of the available space, but this plane configuration went too far.
Staff at the security checkpoint guiding folls to TSA and gate agenst was not at best. Mostly rude and abrupt with travelers
The seatback TV is a horrible and dated product. It's time to remove them so all of your fleet have the same product which would be PED.

Missed our first attempt at landing. Heard the pilots say an alarm was going off under 10,000 feet. Had to circle and Land again. Kinda concerning? Ground service in Richmond was awful, but ground service in Richmond is a joke always. Terrible.
No thank you.  The black gentleman checking in the customers was not friendly, not helpful and had not the greatest attitude.

Seemed like flight attendants were not that interested in service.  For example I asked to buy a food item at the second time beverage service was given. The fight attendant just acted annoyed and dismissed my request.
Very Bad Coffee
All your CRJ200's should be broken up and sold for scrap. Most uncomfortable aircraft ever built.
My luggage has Been destroyed !!!! And I don t know Howard to raise a complaint

Took flight from Newark to Paris for business.  The company pays a lot of money for me to fly in business so i can sleep on the plane-was very hard to sleep-I was in seat 1A-close to where the flight attendants hang out and where the food comes from-the curtain was never closed-so was always light and flight attendants talked fairly loud the entire flight-as I suppose there’s no where else for them to hang out.  I tried the ear plugs you offer on flight and eye mask-i could still hear voices with ear plugs and eye mask was uncomfortable to wear-didnt sleep entire flight and landed and had to go immediately to work meeting with no sleep-

The seats on this flight are poor. I did not fit length wise at 6'1. They are very cramped additionally width wise through the leg are to the feet. The proximity/separation to the passenger next to me is dissatisfactory. Compared to Air France, ANA et al the seating arrangements feel cheap and laid out to maximize profit to a level that your customer feels disregarded in the calculation. It was disappointing. My wife is a 1k member and near a million miles and recommends United so i have booked a few Paris flights and a Tokyo flight. I regret doing so.
flight attendant in coach was not great. not friendly and could not get a cup of water from her. she seemed to be in a very bad mood.

I was delayed in Jacksonville, so therefore I missed my connecting flight to Buffalo. Therefore I went to the counter, and told them that I needed my luggage to come out at Newark because I wasn't going to make my flight. The women at the desk asked me what color my bag was and what kind of bag it was and assured me that my bag would come out at baggage claim in Newark. Of course when I got to Newark my bag was no where to be found. Then I went to the baggage claim office in Newark, and the assistant was very rude, and said if I wanted my bag I would have to wait two hours for it. I asked him if he was able to have it delivered to the Newark Marriott directly across the street, and he said no. Keep in mind that this was at 11 o clock at night. So therefore I had no clothes no toiletries, and none of my medication for that night. Thankfully my bag did arrive in Buffalo this morning. Also I traveled on First class back from Jacksonville, and the airline did not offer to help me out with anything including the hotel I had to cover that night. Also I had the worse meal of my life on the plane. I ordered a Asian chicken salad and the salad literally had 3 pieces of lettuce on it with gobs of shredded cheese, and cold soggy chicken. I expect more out of United especially when I am flying first class.
United is not good company anymore. No room, really bad seats, poor service, expensive with no reason, delays are a new norm.

Airline confusion at the gate about lack of room for carry on baggage caused my travel partner to get very upset and she lost her license. Loss of her license prevented her from being able to secure a prepaid car.

Luggage was slow in coming, I had 2 of my three bags not make it I went to the office at terminal A and asked, the women was not friendly, just looked at me and said go next door and she will open the gate. A women opened the gate and my bag was sitting on a stopped conveyor belt, I said that was bag, she said go get it, just rude
took an ungodly amount of time to board the plane...the worst boarding experience i have had; Southwest boarding was a better experience; staff on plane were rude

I mentioned to steward about the screen not shutting off.  I said I have been trying all day.  He said back you been seating in that chair all day trying to shut screen off.  My wording was not correct.  I should of said seating there since boarding -40 minutes. He could not help. I think he had a long day but his comment irritated me the rest of the flight.

The flight was delayed due to wind in EWR and none of the United websites or flight boards were updated to show the correct departure time. The departure was wrong and no one bothered to update which would have made my flight experience more enjoyable and time more productive.

The plane was disgusting and the service at Newark was awful. Why do we have to wait for a gate crew? Why does it take so long to get gate checked bags? Why have planes that can't properly handle overhead storage?

It was over an hour late, and the only information we were given was "due to the late arrival of the aircraft" which is meaningless, it's half a step better than " we are going to be one hour late because we are leaving the terminal one hour late" - people want a reason, it was due to fog, mechanical failure, staff shortage etc. etc. etc.

Date: 1/18/17 Flight #: UA1246  (Fort Lauderdale > Newark) Mileage Plus #: FJ360459  It was a packed flight with only a few open seats.  I’m sitting in seat 30D next two a mother/father and 22-month old child.  The father was sitting next to me with the baby on his lap and he says – I have to apologize up-front as my child has an ear ache and he screamed most of the last flight. As the plane begins to move away from the gate the baby starts to wail and upon take-off his screams of agony can be heard through the entire plane.  The screaming last for quite some time and I would often let the father out to walk up/down the aisle to try and conform the child.   I don’t fault the child or parents.  I’m a father of 3 and I know how difficult it can be to travel with children.  But what happened next was inexcusable.  About 45 minutes into the flight I got up to let the father out and I noticed that there was an open seat toward the front of the plane.  The mother/father wanted to lay their child down and I offered to move seats to accommodate.  I brought it up to the flight attendant – Who responded:  No, I’m sorry.  That seat is economy plus and you paid for an economy seat.  And I was told I could NOT move…unless I wanted to pay for an upgrade.  Wait…what?!?!  I couldn’t believe what I was hearing.  Nor could the passengers around me.  For some reason, the flight attendant thought that the airline would lose money – or perhaps she thought she would lose her job – if I was allowed to move to this seat.  The baby continued to scream…and scream.. and only subsided for a very short while on 3+ hour flight.  In short, the baby screamed the entire flight.    What exactly do you think economy plus is anyway?  It’s the same seat with slightly more leg room.  I wasn’t asking to move to 1st class…just a different seat to help accommodate the parents, baby and I….not to mention all of the other passengers that were forced to endure the situation.  I ended moving asking some folks to shift economy seats and move a few rows ahead.  This further irrigated those that were asked to move.  United boasts about exceptional customer experience – and being all about the passenger and flight experience.  United – You failed at the expense of several passengers.  And why – because you lost sight of passenger(s) satisfaction over the incorrectly perceived notation about cost and/or airline process.  To rub a little salt in the wound – I stopped by the united customer service desk on my way out and relayed my disappointment in a very kind and courteous manner.  They couldn’t have cared less and told me to call united when I got home.  I have no doubt that I will receive some form of automated message in response to this complaint.  And maybe a coupon for a future flight.  Unfortunately – I have already booked several additional united flights for me and my family.  Once completed, you can rest assured knowing that I will not fly United as long as I have an option.  You can go ahead and close my account, my mileage plus account and flush your points down the drain.  I plan on sharing my story to all who will listen.  You failed United.

The new 737 was brand new — BUT THE SEATS ARE TOO  SMALL.  We had premiere seating seats. Space was very tight.  The rest of Cabo was even worst  and every w looked miserable. We all felt like sardines one looked miserable. .  Flung is painful!
We stayed at the gate for two hours with little to no information from staff and rude behavior from the flight attendants. No water was offered and no compensations were made for the two hour delay.

The pitch on the economy seats is ridiculous for an individual 6'2". My knees were up against the seat in front of me which was very uncomfortable. Could not find a good comfort zone for the 4 hr and 30 minute flight!!

I fly literally every week, United has the least comfortable seats in the entire industry. It shows they don’t care. The other thing that bothers me is how often, how long and how unbelievably loud all the stupid pointless announcements the pilot and airline attendants make. I had to close my ears it was so loud, and being that it was a nighttime flight they correctly assumed people would be trying to sleep, and turned off the lights. But made an announcement every 15 minutes.
The seats are so uncomfortable. The swayback position pushes your head forward.

Seating room is extremely tight.  I am only 5'9" but I have to squeeze into my seat and my knees almost hit the chair in front of me.  The space between me and the seat in front will not allow me to work on my laptop.  4 hours, wasted.

I find your lack of customer consideration deplorable. I recognize the catch-all "air traffic control" is a simple "Get out of jail free" card for you in terms of delaying or cancelling flights without any real ramifications for your customers, but that also manifests itself in your company no real consideration for the disruption your lack of service causes. The 800# call center people and the gate agents are fine. They do their job and put up with us disgruntled travelers just fine. I pity them and the crap you put them through. But that you so rarely deliver on the simple promise of delivery people to a destination in the time YOU claim you can, is shocking. Actually it isn't shocking. And that's sad. Perhaps if enough people stop using your airline because your continually fail to hold up your end of the transactional bargain, then maybe you'll do something about it. But I'm not holding my breath.

based on the use of the app for checking in, there is now very little interaction with people in order to get on the plane.  not saying good or bad, but i didn't interact with a human to leave anyone a complement.

The primary reason for our dissatisfaction was the hostility of one of the flight attendants towards small children.  I don't know his name, but he had a waxed mustache that curled at the sides and I heard him say at one point that he was from Phoenix, Arizona.  He showed absolutely no empathy or sympathy towards people with babies and bordered on the surly--had he been more understanding, we could have gotten our son to fall asleep, which would have meant that our flight (and those of half the plane who had to listen to a screaming baby) would have been a much different experience.  If you have a flight in which there are families with infants booked, I would not recommend that you assign him to work it.  We taken multiple international and domestic trips on a variety of different airlines and have had exactly two very negative experiences with flight attendants and young children.  Both times, these were United airlines, too.  'Flying the friendly skies'?  I'm not convinced.  And I'm definitely not impressed.

I paid $229 for this F class upgrade.  I am a 1K but it was clear I wasn’t going to make the upgrade list.  The entire F class experience was entirely disappointing and not worth the money.  Boarding drink order taken at 7pm.  Delivered at 7:25pm.  Drink delivered after push-back.  Three minutes later, F FA was asking for empty cup.  Really?  FA saw I had my two coats on my lap twice.  I offered him my coats to hang up.  Both times, he refused saying, “I’ll be back for your coats.”    Boarding was chaotic.  F FA was watching the chaos and not doing anything about it.  She was holding people from boarding while F class pax were waiting for their boarding beverage.  No effort to hang up coats.  F FA did nothing to make sure seat backs were in the full upright position before take-off.  Pax in front of me was reclined throughout take-off.  Direct TV ran the promo trailer video four times through take-off and leveling off.  Take off was around 7:30pm, Direct TV programming not available until 8:10pm.  F FA enjoyed his bottle of UA water in the view of F pax while none of the pax had their drinks.  “Me first, you second.”  Catering boarded insufficient meals.  F FA told me I had a choice of Chicken Tandoori or a Snack Box.  This is a flight that is nearly three hours.  I didn’t get dinner at ORD because you advertised it as a dinner flight in F.  I guess because I am a 1K the FA “gifted” me the chicken tandoori.  My seat (4E, 737-800) would not stay in the upright position.  I had a lot of work to do and needed to type.  I cannot type in the recline position.  I re-adjusted my seat countless times during the flight.  The toilet seat would not remain in the up position for a male to urinate.  Ugh.    First drink ordered at 8:15pm.  Delivered 8:35pm.  Dinner order given 8:15pm delivered 8:50pm.  What the heck takes so long to deliver drinks and dinner?  It’s now 9:20 and no offer of a beverage refill.  Bottom line:  I paid for this upgrade and I do not think I got my value for the flight.  I am much more forgiving when I am given the complimentary upgrade but the service on today’s flight is not very different from my complimentary upgrade flights.  UA is wearing me out.  I have the same status on DL and I get MUCH better treatment on DL.

Security checking at Newark airport has considerably deteriorated in the last few months. The line was very long although there were check point that were not utilized. The flight was late again - which seems to be a standard feature of this flight. On board, I had someone sitting next to me who had no chance to fit into his tiny window seat. He was miserable for the entire flight and landed complaining of pain in his right leg that he could not move for the duration of the flight. His left shoulder and leg were uncomfortably pushing against mine and taking up my space. I could also mention waiting too long for bags in the jet bridge with freezing temperatures. A bad experience end to end.
Decided to check carry-on since gate staff warned about likelihood of overhead bin space being very limited and probably unavailable even before I got on the aircraft.

Very poor service when arrived in Columbus.  Waited long time for gate crew.  Then, the gate didn't work--but the gate crew refused to give plane a different gate.  Arrived late due to weather, and then another 40 minutes to get off of the plane.   Completely unacceptable.

We were delayed upon arrival at CMH due to yet another jet bridge maintenance issue.  This was on top of an hour delay due to air traffic, which I realize is not in United Airlines' control.  That said, waiting over 30 minutes for maintenance to fix the jet bridge so passengers could deplane and then waiting another 10 minutes for gate checked bags only to find out that the baggage handlers had sent bags to baggage claim was really frustrating.  It was late and really unacceptable operational execution on the part of the CMH ground crew.  Really disappointing!

Delayed 2 hours and then when we landed at Columbus the jetgate to get off plane was broken so we needed to wait another 30 minutes on the plane even thought there was an open gate next to us didn’t get into hotel until 1:00

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: THE A20 TERMINAL IS TERRIBLE,   LONG TSA LINES, NO "REAL" PRECHECK    POOR FOOD OPTIONS   IF YOU HAVE A DELAY YOU ARE STUCK.   ALSO GATE WAS POOR IN GIVING UPDATE  LEARNED MORE ON MY PHONE APP  BLAMED ON WEATHER IN THE SOUTH YET THIS PLAN SPENT THE DAY IN THE NORTH EAST
Seating was awful no room. Very uncomfortable

There was one specific flight attendant who was rude, made rude facial expressions and was generally not nice to several clients.  It felt like whatever she was doing wasn't fun for her and to service the passengers was an inconvenience and a burden.  I am gold status premier with United and I have never seen a flight attendant act so rudely in all the many flights I have been on.
TSA line was 2 times longer than economy line. Flight was 2 hour delayed. Plane was dirty. Seats are getting smaller.  Captain informed passengers of new information in a timely way.
I was supposed to be in an economy plus seat according to the seat map when I booked my flight, but the seat was not economy plus on the aircraft. Terrible experience.

United does not have happy employees.  Gate attendant were brusque and unfriendly. Flight attendants were going through the motions abs acted put upon. Business Class Service subpar. I will avoid UA international business class in the future.

I requested a vegan meal at the time of my booking. I was very disappointed that on a 15 hour flight I was not provided with a meal that met my dietary requirements. It is extremely disappointing and ridiculously unreasonable why this happened. For 15 hours you provided 2 complete and one snack. How is a person suppose to be comfortable with this?!
Seats were incredibly uncomfortable. Flight was delayed almost 2 hours. Awful.

The plane was almost delayed two hours. It was supposed to only be 60 minutes and then that later jumped to 100 minutes.  They also stopped allowing roller carry on bags after boarding only 2 groups. It was the worst flight we have had.
A late flight that was delayed even further ..... made this trip difficult for me,

The most frustrating part of my delay was that I asked if I could change flights to an on time flight leaving 30 minutes before my updated departure time with delay. I was told I could not do this since I had a checked bag, even though there was still an hour before the flight was scheduled to depart and the original plane was delayed, meaning my bag was not even on a plane yet. When I got to Pittsburgh, I found that my bag was already at baggage claim because it had arrived on an earlier flight! This was very frustrating, as I my ride could have been there to pick me up at least 30 minutes earlier, instead of getting home after 1:00am and having to work the next day. I understand that things can happen, including delays. But receiving information that wasn't even accurate and then having my luggage arrive earlier when I was told it would be an issue was very frustrating.

United very regularly delays this flight from EWR to CLT and a 2 hour delay that late at night is very inconvenient, tiring and wasteful of business traveler's time - also, without enough notice, I waste hours at the airport vs staying in office and leaving closer to actual travel time.  Furthermore, my seat area had lots of trash including dirty tissues, and given heavy flu season, I can only imagine the germs that I have been exposed to.

I travel extensively, never had a more uncomfortable seat - hard as rock,  so tight - with the seat in front of me back I could not move & my daughter & I are petite.   She complained that her back hurt.  How about an upgrade on the way back?    We have a trip to Portland coming up seriously thinking about Jet Blue
It was unfortunate about the delay in departure. Also the delay at PBI in getting luggage
Plane was extremely hot before takeoff  Maybe seat power outlet was so loose that the plug kept falling out with gravity pulling it out
I was forced to check my bag, which you broke and lost my luggage lock.
You should let people sit in the empty seats! We were all squashed together in 22 and beyond but there were empty seats everywhere in front of us! That’s crazy not to move people 😖

Felt discriminated against due to not being paged for final boarding. Was told I was unable to board due to doors closing but saw where they allowed someone else to board. I can not believe you all would hire agents that will disrespect customers and automatically assume you as the customer are wrong over a mistake a fellow coworker has made. I will NEVER use your services again if this is how your employees treat customers

The flight attendant was very rude. He spoke to me in a condescending manner and made my entire experience very unpleasant. He also seemed irritated to be serving me. Based on his interactions with customers, he is ageist.
Delay is understand able but the lack of information is unanacceptable.

the terms and rules must be flexible because the limit of 23 kilos a novelty for the Brazilians even so adding the luggage since we had the right to 12 bags gave us the average of 23 kilos per bag but the union official stayed an hour and a half obliging us to make and redo the luggage to reach this weight in each of the bags, it was a horrible experience because we had 4 children with us took an hour and a half to get ready and almost missed the flight. We were sweaty and very tired on the flight was a experience.

The flight attendants were rude and one was on her phone while people were trying to board. There was one man who was extremely dis respectful, and rude. I am a loyal Alaska air flyer, and it is incredible how poor United’s on flight staff is compared to Alaska. If I have my choice, I will avoid untied from here on out. Customer Service is everything, and if they were just nice, I would have no complaints
The food is really bad I cannot eat anything on these flights.

The food and beverage service was terrible.  The crew only offered water once- that is unheard of on an overseas flight.  The flight attendants were rude and unresponsive when they were supposed to be helpful.  Not only was water not offered but they did not even offer beverage service to every row during meals.  The mid flight snack was put out in the galley- there were 2 liter water bottles but no cups to get a drink with.  My husband went back to the rear galley mid flight to ask for water and the flight attendants were back there eating.  They acted like it was a bother to get water.  We saw them rarely throughout the 12 hour flight and my husband was awake the whole time!  The quality of the food was terrible- overcooked and overspiced- the only thing I could eat was the roll and butter.  I am not a very fussy person but this food was not good.

The plane had mold on the lower area where I believe there is venting. It was nasty to look and see that when I have a mold allergy. And I was in first class. And what happened to the warm towels? The seats are so close I was practically lying on top of the man between myself and the aisle getting up to the bathroom because he was sleeping.

I did not enjoy "Sharing" my space to the large man in the middle seat.  Redeye flight and he kept hitting the buttons on my armrest turning on my tv Vey annoying how he sat too with legs extended into my space.
I suggest you don't have your piece of shit scumbag CEO Oscar make a cameo appearance during the preflight videos. That lowlife asshole only reminds me how much I hate your fucking company.
Flight crew had one rude member - she was short with people as they boarded and very rude to me when I indicated that I knew where my seat was. Demanding in a gruff manner to see my boarding pass

Squeaky cabin, could not sleep. I am vegetarian, requested same, there was no dairy milk alternate, could not drink tea. I did not eat dinner because it was late, morning break fast cottage cheese curry was full of salt. TV Monitor kept getting shut down, I did complain, no one cared. I asked for extra blanket, the person requested was not very polite, made me feel as if it's big deal. The person next to me ordered drink, came after 45 min. Over all, one travels in business class for comfort but I was disappointed.
Some of the flight attendants were rude and unprofessional (eg. Talking about guests that were right in front of them, not offering assistance with issues)
Dinner was really bad- veg. Seat was very cramped and uncomfortable. The ewr-bos seat was way more better than bom-ewr!!!
Hate to complain about this, but the food choices were not great.
Waited in wheelchair section NO ATTENDANT or wheelchair to gate. Baggage checkin lady very rude to wife as she was checking my bag
It broke down had to leave plan. Waited an hour or so. Almost missed connecting flight. Had to run from 1 to 18 to get on board.

I will never book basic economy again . I traveled with only a lap top bag and was forced to purchase a carry on @ $25 each way so that I could check in . Unacceptable . Hated everything about the basic economy experience.

My luggage was searched by TSA on the flight from Tampa to Chicago.  I was transporting a gas lighter wrapped in paper and packed in a cardboard box.  It was opened for inspection, I presume, but the lighter was literally savaged and hence cannot be used anymore.  How do I file the claim?

I was disappointed that I had to pay for WiFi even seated in first class. Also my laptop device wouldn't play the entertainment available. Rather than 4 hours enjoying a flight, I ended up working on my laptop and reading.

My luggage was delayed for 36 hours, with no explanation. The customer service rep was very unhelpful...did not seem to care about my problem. I requested a  refund for the baggage fee and was told "that was not refundable". That response is not acceptable and the rep was rude about it.

My husband sustained a serious facial injury due to a floor maintenance problem at Gate F23 where we landed.  The rest of our trip was cancelled due to his hospitalization.  United agents have been kind and considerate, but I wish this had not happened.  United must insist that the safety of passengers in airports is also considered.  This was a totally preventable accident.  People waiting at the gait noted others tripping as they came off the escalator.  No one said a thing or fixed the problem, and we faced serious injuries: a concussion, broken facial bones, lacerations, and a badly bruised knee.  My husband is presently hospitalized in Chicago, and we are not in Fort Lauderdale as planned.

I get you want to get as many seats as you can on a flight and charge fees fir more room.  But my gosh the seats are barely wide enough for a teanager let alone an adult.   I sat on the isle seat there was a man near window and in center seats.   I was lean over into the isle that every time someone went down the iske i got bumped.  It was no fault of the two men. They were need big people. It was because the seats were not wide enough.  Three and a half hours of leaning trying to keep in my own personal space and being bumped.  For the money you spend on tickets it would be nice to get a seat that you don’t feel like your sitting on a strangers lap.
Due to selection of isle seat, no overhead room for the only small roller bag brought on flight, no room for my feet with bag under seat.  Flight attendants failed to enforce baggage policies.

The flight was cancelled on 18th  due to technical reasons.  This was unfortunate but we were given no information, just that we needed to go back out through border security.  There was no one from United after we go off the plane to help us. As a result passengers were wandering around looking for what next to do.  I eventually found the United desk after wandering around Toronto airport looking for it.  When i did find the desk, we were processed but it took 35 minutes to rebook my flight.  There was no sense from the ground staff that passengers were highly inconvenienced, very tired and needed expediting.  very poor after flight cancellation service.
other than the temperature, the flight was OK--we had to wait half an hour to be de-iced, but I don't think that was United's fault.

Return flight from Boston on Friday was delayed, and notification occurred when we were on the plane.  Very disappointed to have to sit on plane for 90 minutes when i could have been more comfortable in the airport.  Delays on Friday afternoon seem very common and not sure why issue persists without any improvement.
Seatback was dirty and bathroom was dirty
The hostess in the United club in Newark is rude and nasty and think she is above the customers  And plain out disrespectful

I flew 1st class and the last two trips I've taken the food in 1st class was awful. For a little extra room I should fly business and eat prior to boarding the aircraft. The trip prior to this one the breakfast was so bad I couldn't eat it. This time it was edible but terrible!
Bad food options. I expect a little more than 2 boring biscuits on a flight that lasts more than 5 hours.   Also no internet or inflight entertainment
Staff at the gate was not nice and not helpful
You might want to take a page from other carriers and stop making passengers come to the airport to check in so you could charge $25. Fool me once shame on you,  twice it's on me.
Most uncomfortable seating I have ever experienced. No recline AND no leg room.
Our flight was delayed because the aircraft coming in was late. Our flight attendant was extremely rude

The food selection was bad - kale and tomatoe quiche was undigestable - over cooked - the food selection was not very good as the alternative protien slection was not along my taste buds - the flight to Chicago was a bad selection as well

Flying has become an unpleasant experience. The space between seats is uncomfortable and beyond small. I could go on about my dissatisfaction which grows any time I have to fly coach. I understand my feelings aren’t uncommon and unfortunately are the norm.
Not even given a tiny bag of peanuts on a 6 hour flight. You are literally the worst human beings.

The seats were very small with no leg room and not much cushioning. I am short and had trouble fitting in the seat so I can't imagine how a tall person could get in one of those seats. My laptop battery ran down but there were no electrical pugs near my seat.
To bad you don’t offer Free Wi Fi for all. The cost for a Router is cheap and draws more passengers to UAL.
On time and no delay
I panicked while landing and I asked for a bag because I was feeling sick and I was completely ignored and when someone did help they were rude as hell
Terminal 2 is a disgrace, endless walking an insult to older passengers.
Was very disappointed disappointed that I could not get into the presidents Club it was closed

First class bathroom and seats did not seem especially clean. There was a quick turnaround from incoming flight but I would expect these to be cleaned more thoroughly (especially during cold and flu season)
Dirty tissues left in seat pocket. That is nasty.
I don’t like all the restrictions about carry on sand bag checking.  Will not recommend United to anybody
The woman at the gate was very rude making us check our carry on baggae clearly ignoring other people with bigger bags

There was only one drawback to the flight, but it's a very serious one: the physical discomfort of having absolutely no legroom and sitting on a cheap plastic seat.  I actually was happy that this flight didn't have a personal entertainment system so I didn't have a screen literally a few inches from my face.  I've flown hundreds of flights, domestically and internationally, and our United flights to and from Ft. Lauderdale had the most cramped and uncomfortable seating I've ever experienced.

The flight went smoothly, however, a bit disappointed in my “restroom experience”. It was necessary for me to use the restroom, however, there was a line in the back of the plane. The front had a vacancy but I was told I couldn’t use that one by the flight attendant. I had to awkwardly wait in the aisle until my turn. Also disappointing, the toilet did not flush nor was there water to wash my hands. Gross. Bad experience to say the least. Otherwise, no complaints.

Bathroom was dirty. The flight attendant made a comment to my son after he returned from the lavatory that he went in the wrong time since he was doing head count -Not Friendly and Courteous to passenger!!

as a 2 million miler 1k member I receive regional upgrades. I have now tried about 7 flights in a row to use my second upgrade from 2017 and have not been successful. I fly about 1 to 2 times per month between Newark and LA and back. Since you changed your policy and left JFK it is almost impossible to get upgraded even using the regional upgrades. Your new polices are terrible for frequent fliers between these airports. So much said for loyalty. This is why I am unhappy.

when we booked flight we had 2 seats together. when we got to airport we were separated and need an agent to seat us together in the last row. The same happened on our return flight to EWR. This was very disturbing

When the plane is full it is very crowded and uncomfortable. The seats are too close together. Also there is a box under each isle seat (probably for the seat wiring harness). It blocks part of the area where one stows underseat bags and leaves no room for ones feet.
The smell of the cabin for the entire flight was vile & absolutely disgusting.  I felt like I was swimming in a porta potty holding tank !
The flight is 5 hours international. It is ridiculous that you don’t  offer free movies or at least tv. American and Delta do and I will book them as long as they work with my schedule.
Was in business class and was disappointed at the cleanliness of the restrooms when I boarded. The cleaners on the Dublin side did a terrible job.
First, the flight attendant was verry angry and unprofessional when i asked her the meal choice. And much more. You should revise your cabin crew standards

TSA inspected my checked bag and left the contents in a MESS.   The bag was full of equipment, so I understand why it was inspected.  TSA made NO attempt to put the contents back as they were.  Totally unacceptable.

Whenever I fly to or through ORD, there is always a delay.  This very annoying and I usually avoid flying there.  You also need to provide better communication on what is g oi Nguyen on with yourv delays.

Forgot to mention that the cabin became freezing during flight and it could not be adjusted so I had to wear my coat.  Also I just realized that the flight that had the engine problem that I mentioned earlier was the flight I took from ORD to MSP on Wednesday, 1/17.  Sorry.
Stop using those airbuses for such long flights...first class was awful
The lanes for the different boarding groups were haphazard and I stood in my lane but no one ever opened the rope. I had to cut in front of others and they weren’t happy.

The flight attendants did not do their safety checks either at take-off or landing.  The couple in the aisle and middle seat in my row had their laptops open, one seatback down and my exit from the row in case of an emergency was not clear.  If the airline would just explain to people why there are rules at take-off and landing, for the safety of others, perhaps they would respect the rules.
Once in Newark, the priority bags came after the normal check bags. Why get status and stick with your airline when the minimal benefits I get aren’t even honored.  Very poor work on your part.

Flight attendant was not customer focused and somewhat rude at times.  She must have gone into the overhead bin above my seat at least 15 times during the flight to retrieve and return personal items from her bag which was stowed there.  Extremely annoying when trying to focus on work.

It is a shame that for a 5 hours international flight you have to purchase food. The pilot kept seat belt sign on for 90% of the flight, claiming that turbulence is expected and the flight attendants tried to enforce this. There was NO turbulence.

Having flown many times per year business class India to US and return, I was expecting same business class seats (and configuration of 2 - 2 - 2).   Business class seats on this flight 2 - 4 - 2 were somewhat disappointing as they were quite narrow and not as comfortable as the business class "pods" I was used to.   These pod seats were described as "first class" seats.
I asked to redeem Regional Premier Upgrades. Again we were denied  I have tried a couple of different times to redeem without success. Why do they expire if they cannot be used?

There was a family that was very difficult for the flight attendants to get a hold of. They had to make at least 10 announcements to ask them to be seated when the seat belt sign was on, and half of the family sat in the main cabin and half sat in first class and the main cabin family member were ALWAYS visiting with the first class family, standing in the aisle, not listening to the crew, being loud, kicking and elbowing us, and it was just an incredibly horrible flight. I am very disappointed.
Food was awful! Also flight attendants didn’t ask me if I wanted something to drink and also were rude to me when I woke up from my nap and asked for my lunch.
Why there is not free movies to distract us?

I have a carry-on that fits under a seat and yet they took my bag at the gate (I was group 4). On the flight I see the overhead space occupied by coats. It continues to irritate me that there is no effort to accommodate carry on bags.

Part of this goes back to my poor experience the week before (which amazingly you never asked me to survey) but over the last month of flying I have become more and more disappointed with United, and I have to be honest you have lost me as a customer. I may not be one of your Business class customers who flies all over the world on a weekly basis but I was committed to you and flying very frequently over the last few year, and your phone and online customer service have become completely horrible. You should never blame a customer for anything as an excuse to not help them.

I had a bad head injury the day before our flight, my doctor told me to get a CAT scan to ensure that I could fly safely. Trying to contact United and arrange to postpone my own and my wife's flight because of this potential medical emergency was nightmarishly difficult. In the end, your representative told me that I would have to pay $350 per person just to postpone the flight for a few days, and then try to appeal for reimbursement. A simple note or call with my doctor or the hospital ought to have been sufficient. Fortunately the hospital cleared me to fly, otherwise I would have had to try to cancel/reschedule my flight around 5 AM with an unhelpful and inflexible customer "service" representative. That is the kind of run-around I might have expected from some cut-rate airline, not after paying full fare for an expensive flight.
The seats are painfully tight.

The woman who checked our bags in the morning was extremely rude. She would not help us with questions we had regarding travel as a military family and traveling with children.  She told us "go ask someone else" and was very mean. Made the rest of the day horrible for us.

Some flight attendants (not all) were not the friendliest I’ve encountered. They had the body language of “I do not want to be here” and the flight attendant making the announcements was not welcoming and spoke as if we were little school children that deserved a lecturing for misbehaving. We are your customers, not children in a classroom.

Mechanical Issue caused a delay then mechanic didn’t sign paperwork causing another delay. I had to run to catch my next flight. The flight attendant did give me direction for where I needed to go when I got off the plane. And ... I made it.
Mobile site ugly

You lost my bag on the flight to Lisbon. Someone vomited in the galley area - not your fault but it completely stopped all service for rest of the flight in business class. A real bummer based on buisiness class ticket cost.
you couldn't squeeze the seats closer if you tried. not even enough room to open a hard cover book let alone a laptop. its not just United. Time to complain to the FAA.

Seat was incredibly uncomfortable, cramped, tiny (I’m an average-size female. Bought the ticket class without seat selection so ended up in the middle - will never do that again. You need to do something to keep down the number of people who put luggage in overhead - de-boarding took forever. Also gate agent should do a better job screening out the oversized luggage that people continue to bring onboard, which take up an unfair amount of overhead space- people who follow the rules then sometimes can’t fit their luggage.
Flight service was below the normal standard.  No offering of pre-flight beverage, difficult to get attention for refill,
Need to replace the old over compressed seat cushions. Once you can feel the metal framework below when you sit, it's terribly uncomfortable.
Flight was very dirty and did not look clean. For it being a horrible flu season I eas very disappointed in th filth on the floor and windows.

Purser on this flight was unhelpful and very negative attitude.  Plane hadn’t fully boarded and she was rude to older passengers. Announcements were rushed and abrupt, attitude of “not my job”.  I asked for water and she looked like I was inconviencing her.  Lied to me about water bottles, told me they don’t have any, then 1 hour later, other attendant was passing them out to people.  Being a 1K flyer and knowing the routines I was not happy with how she treated people in the Business class cabin.  Very poor attitude.  She didn’t want to be there and it showed!

The coach seats are way to tight.  I'm not a big person by no means and I could barely fit in them.  Add an inch or two to make them bearable to sit in.  I will not fly United unless there are no other options.  This was one of the worst experiences I have ever had in coach seating, comfort wise.  Let me know when you add a few inches and I'll consider flying United.

Like many other United flights, Very bad experience on board. Rude flight attendants (And I am a 1K for past 10+ years), bad service (asked for coffee, got tea), BAD food, Smelly blanket, Dirty restroom.
Terribly cynical, apathetic flight attendants in business class.
Food really wasn’t very good for Business class.  Red wine was ice cold!  Not good.
bad service, period.

Not that its a big deal but it sort of sucks when the folks who got upgraded get to chose their meal over the folks who paid for business class. I had to order a box of food b/c i don’t eat gluten and everyone else took the salad...:(

my seat was very dirty, the seat pocket had used tissues and garbage along the bottom.  the floor around my seat was dirty with wrappers etc.  Also, before we took off I used the bathroom and it was absolutely disgusting and that was before the plane even moved.  very disappointed
No continues to be the same problem

I was annoyed when I pulled my suitcase off the carousel and the wheel was missing!  Atjacksonville airport I went baggage service area mainly to get some duck tape to cover up the gaping hole. The signage there was poor. I went into office not realizing that I was not in the United baggage service area. Waited in line and then was told I was in delta office rather than United. Ugh!  Went to next office and had to wait 30 minutes and just wanted duck tape. Finally it was my turn and I showed the worker my suitcase and she gave me a brand new suitcase!!!  That was great but I waited about 45 minutes
Gate areas in kc are terrible, I had to run. There is poor seating and no food
