flight attendant was not friendly.  Snack selection was sad selection and no offer of other snacks offered in Economy when someone declined anything in the basket (which was all sugar and carbs).  When i inquired, she replied "this is all we have".  I then asked specifically about the snacks that can be purchased before she got me something I could eat.  This is not "friendly skies".

When I arrived at Terminal 1 to check my bags(10:30 am), I was directed to go to gate F27 in Terminal 2. Gate F27 is a very long walk. I had my hat and top coat on and the temperature was very warm. After arriving at Gate f27 there was an announcement that the gate Had changed to Gate C6. A 20 minute walk. I am a senior citizen and no assistance was offered nor was there even a gate agent at the podium. I went to customer service and they said it wasn’t there fault and acted as if I was bothering them. Terrible!,,, I had a another terrible experience flying from Yyz to Ord. You are a my last choice to fly from now on.     Bruce Brandt
I had to pay far too much for my fly because of United’s computer system glitch. No one at the airport or on the phone could rectify the problem and I was stuck overpaying.

Newark airport is horrible. I must have passed 5 parked electric transport carts on my walk from the furthest gate to leave the airport. I’m disabled (not enough to use the profoundly bad wheelchair service) and saw several passengers who could have also used a cart.  If every airport was like Newark, I would stay home.

The food was beyond horrible!  With three blankets, my feet were still frozen sitting in an exit row.  The flight attendents served food, handed out a bottle of water, and then I did not see any attendents for at least four hours.  Never did one walk by to ask if everything was ok or if anything was needed.  The next time attendents came by was to serve a marginal tasting sandwich.  I was not sleeping on this flight.  Completely unbelievable that no attendents came by.  It is not like they could leave the plane.  On the trip on to England, the onboard movie did not work for the economy travelers.  My ticket was over $1700.00, so it's not as if I was riding free.  Horrible experience.
Lunch choice was very limited. No sandwiches. Tapas were not available. Would prefer audio visual screens at each seat.

The RDU airport experience was a bit rough. First, there was apparently an air traffic control delay. The crew then vanished, and it took a while for them to find the missing crew member even after we were cleared to board/leave. There was a lot of disorder in the boarding process. Everyone seemed to line up regardless of what their group number was, which made it a bit awkward cutting everyone with our Board Group 1 tickets.

we will NEVER fly United Airlines again due to ticket clerk at Louisville airport overcharging us for luggage and screamed at us when we asked to take some things out of the bag (which was only 1 lb overweight) and she refused to let us take a shirt out to make it right.  NEVER AGAIN!!!

I already wrote about this but your basic economy is a sham and a vile money grab and you should be ashamed to offer it. All of your staff were amazingly kind and helpful. Your inability to bring on overhead baggage is stupid and rooted solely in price gouging and has no bearing on expense whatsoever.
Seat terribly uncomfortable.
The flight was fine but the price I had to pay to fly home for my mother, who died 4 days after my flight, was outrageous.

The service on this flight was extremely disappointing. They did not have my vegetarian meal aboard, even though it is in my profile and confirmed, and as a global services member, I expect it to be noted. Additionally, I had to get up to ask for water and drinks during the flight as no one came to check in the cabin once meal service was completed. I went the entire flight with no one checking in except for the 2 meal service times, when I didn't have an appropriate meal. A very frustrating and not what I expect from this flight, which I've done many times in the past.

I've been on this flight and aircraft before and know that your Economy seats are the most uncomfortable in the skies.  Getting an aisle seat is critical for me so that I can stretch often by standing up.  Yet your booking policy does not allow me to get an aisle seat without paying an extra fee, and since my company travel policy requires that I take lowest fair I'm not able to pay extra for an aisle seat.  So getting stuck with a center seat is my worst nightmare.  Then to have a tiny screen that's hard to see in any light, grumpy flight attendants, and insufficient bathroom capacity, it adds up to a very poor experience in the air.  By comparison, literally every other airline I could choose to get where I needed to be is superior in each way... they just do not qualify as lowest fare so I cannot choose them anymore.
No, but I had a bad experience in the airport from Newark to Fort Lauderdale
My seat back in front of me was filthy. Have no idea what crud was on it but it was absolutely gross
One of the worst flights I have ever taken because of the heated cabin.
No hot bevarage. I wanted have hot tea. Attendant said water has iced and frozen, but I did not think so. She was just lazy to prepare hot water.
Horrible. No ac power. Poor WiFi. Screen didn’t turn on. Business trip was hurt because of this.
Seats were so small, the leg room was terrible and the flight attendants seemed annoyed by everyone. And the bathrooms were gross

Ridiculous delays from the Newark airport again. Not sure this is entirely United’s fault at this point, but I will not be going out of Newark anymore. This flight wasn’t spectacular enough to change my views on United due to my terrible experience on the first leg of my flight.
The service at the counter to check in the bags was horrible, the guy was rude and he went through unnecessary steps even admitting they were unnecessary prior to completion.
Flying into Newark is frequently a problem. Something needs to be done about the delays which were not caused by United [this time]

Are you kidding with that Newark C130 gate? You now need to ride a bus and go outside dragging your luggage in the ice and snow to get on and off the planes. Your on-time performance and equipment reliability for the EWR - > GSO and GSO -> EWR flights are horrible! Always delayed or cancelled. Very, very frequently equipment or crew issues. and now you make the gate experience really horrible with this C130 gate. I make this journey all the time. Delta is looking much better folks. If you don't want to fly between EWR and GSO, just say so and stop doing an unacceptable job of it.
Delay doe to mechanical problem
The plane had a mechanical issue.  I had an issue on the outbound flight and both planes on the return flight had issues.  So 3 out of my 4 flights had issues.  THIS IS TERRIBLE!  WHAT IS GOING ON?
The system for  claiming bags on the jet way is awful. Ruins the entire experience

The food is VERY disappointing   While I dont typically rely on eating on plane, I didnt have a choice this time   The flight attendents bwgan service in my row (7) and barely stopped to asked if antone wanted anything  I had to stop her and ssk what menu was available and she looked at printed info and told me what they had abd she would come back   She forgot about me, so when I had to push for service to find out they no longer had any options keft as yiu only carry 3 of eac of 2 hot sandwich/burgers  while I know it was an honest oversight, I find it unacceprable that you do not have more of each item abailable   6 total for a full plane of 150+ ppl???

Before we even left home, the times of our flights were changed 3 times. The last change moved us to leaving at 7:50 on a Sunday morning, which was very inconvenient. Then the flight home was delayed for over an hour. Not liking United very much at the moment.

Service was mediocre- only came around once after lunch for beverage requests, and didn’t seem interested in passenger hospitality.  The lunch in business first was horrible (dry, tasteless salmon) with dessert consisting of an undercooked cookie that had a strange consistency (perhaps it was cooked in a microwave). Beverage service was spotty, and there were no snacks offered beyond the initial hot nuts.
The boarding of the plane was a disaster. Something needs to be done with the boarding procedures and the overhead space. It’s awful. One of the parts of flying I despise.

My experience with trying to use miles on this trip was outrageous.  I was on the phone with the Filipinos two days for 1-1/2 hours being put on hold for more than 25 minutes at a time while employee consulted with a supervisor.  Finally they put me on this flight and going through Chicago on my way to LA was not what I wanted to do in January of any year.  It was a frustrating experience and United was not flying friendly skies those two days.

My wife is premier silver, and she was forced to check her roller at the gate, even though people after us were all allowed to take theirs on, none had any level of loyalty with United - then it shows up in Atlanta with the whole wheel housing busted off - obviously we are furious since everyone else was allowed to keep their rollers on the plane - then we take it to the United baggage handler who tells us wheels aren't covered.  It wasn't just the wheel, the whole plastic casing was busted off.  It was a miserable and unacceptable travel experience.  I'm platinum on Delta and rarely fly united because I always have problems (last flight in July was delayed 6 hours).  I'm at a point where I won't even consider United for future flights.  It's just a terrible experience all around.  The flight attendants were very nice, though, so please don't let this review effect them - just every other part of the process that is controlled by United.   Thanks for busting my $200 samsonite roller and making buy a new one when I never should have had to check it in the first place - there was so much room overhead that I had my backpack up there, my son's backpack and 3 coats. Ridiculous.  Just a terrible process.

I had a very unpleasant experience with a flight attendant named Gazella on our return flight # UA1446.  My 2 year old was sick and uncomfortable and had finally fallen asleep in my lap. In order not to disturb her, I was sitting with my knee and foot slightly in the aisle. Passengers had no trouble passing, the service cart had no trouble passing, and other flight attendants did not mention any issue. Others on the flight had their toes just as far in aisle. Gazella addressed me rudely twice, asking me to move my foot. I did my best without waking my baby. Again, my foot was only sticking out a couple of inches. Gazella then walked by my seat and stepped directly, slowly on my foot, hard. She was wearing black clogs. She did not acknowledge that she had done this. I was shocked by this action, so on her next walk down the aisle, I asked for her name. I have photo of exactly how I was sitting for reference.  I understand that for safety reasons we need to have the aisle clear, and that a reminder of this rule would be well within the rights of any crew member. What is unacceptable is the obvious intention to cause physical injury as a way of making a point. There were 2 others who witnessed this action and were just as shocked as I was. This issue was in addition to United losing one of our suitcases for 6 days. This has been reported separately.  I have already submitted a feedback form online and will be following up with United by phone and by mail to the Grand Plaza Drive address in Texas. I will additionally be sending letters to the United corporate offices, to Oscar Munoz (CEO), Scott Kirby (President), Robert Milton (Chairman) and Andrew Levy (CFO).

Flight attendants were not very happy and rude.  All I asked for was ice for my cranberry juice.  Plus when I asked for options for food all I received was "We have chicken, chicken and more chicken".  Not a very pleasant experience.  Glad that I travel American Airlines on a regular basis.
The flight attendants were polite, but looked really tired and/or bored.  Flight was mid-afternoon, so that was surprising

The passenger in the seat in front of me decided that getting on a plane while sick was a good idea (without a mask).  Since planes are a petry dish, I now have the flu and am missing some important work

Your service is horrendous. Check in workers were not helpful and were rude. The gate area does not seat nearly enough people and you already limit carry on luggage and there was plenty of room on board for carry ons but your gate workers made people gate check luggage. It was not necessary at all. I will NEVER give you my service or money again. You price gauge for an uncomfortable experience. Despicable.

Although this flight was ok, my flight UA687 on Wednesday 1/17 was absolutely ridiculous! 3 hours delay of departure time due to a curtain replacement!!? The aircraft was at Newark airport at around 1:30pm and why the curtain cannot be fixed before the boarding at 3:10pm?? After we board, we sat on the aircraft for over THREE HOURS before it took off, eventually took off around 7PM after a CURTAIN IS FINALLY fixed!!?? and no flight attendant even touched or used the curtain during the flight. One of the worst experience ever.
Smooth ride but tight no problem

It might be time to limit reclining seats. They only cause problems when inconsiderate people in front of you, who are already in Economy Plus seats, fully recline into our regular (tiny) Economy space.
Big problem with you charging $11.00 for a mediocre hamburger. Not a great selection of food either. Highly overpriced.

Flight attendance service was terrible. One of the flight attendants offered me to put my backpack on one of the business compartments before taking off and when I asked the  flight attendant in charged of business section for my backpack he was really rude telling me I was not allowed to use that section. I am a United Aurlibes frequent traveler and I know United main weakness is the lack of customer service from flight attendants but this time they went beyond my expectations.

I was put center seat using concur. I have window as my setting and had to sit center seat. I’m very wide and can’t fit well in middle. Don’t know if it was concur travel or United that errored but not happy.
Flight attendant wore heavy perfume.  Big problem for those of us with asthma and allergies.  Really uncomfortable.

The seats were unbelievably small and uncomfortable.  You all squeezed so many people in that I felt for the people who had the bad luck to sit next to an overweight traveler or a tall and big boned person.  When the person in the seat in front of you tries to recline it is painful for someone with long legs.  Often the recliner bangs his/her seat back against the legs of the person behind him/her thinking there is an obstruction.  It is my husbands legs that have no where to go.  The reclining of seat backs should end as long as you have squeezed all those people in the body of the plane.  I will try to choose another airline with more more and options next time.
Another disappointment on lounge there. No capability and frustrated.

The flight attendants came around for trash about 10 minutes after the beverage service.  Then they did not come around again until almost the end of the four hour flight.  Frustrating to have to have tray tables down that long to hold the trash.  Also, despite purchasing tickets months in advance, you sat our family of four (2 adults and 2 children) 20 rows apart, and my husband and eight-year old son were not even on the same side of the plane in their row.  We were sitting next to a teen who was separated from her family.  Very frustrated and will try to avoid United from now on.

weather and traffic control were both referenced as the reason for the delay.  seems like a cop-out as there was no weather even remotely bad and there is ALWAYS traffic of some sort a EWR.  Just frustrating to announce this info shortly before flight is scheduled to depart. unfortunately seems par for the course now.
The charge for carry on bag is extremely bad business practice !

I would choose another airline where I could get assistance checking in and tagging my bag to AVOID the computers. EVERYTHING TOO automated with no choices. The recorded / closed loop message at check-in seems highly impersonal-lends an air of cold automation in stead of a HUMAN voice.

I have never seen a less efficient boarding of a plane in my life!  It didn't help that flight attendants started closing bins that were not even half full.  But then they sent people with bags that didn't fit back up the jetway to the gate agent??  It was so slow and painful.
Could not use the united club which was very irritating
Failed to identify us as TSA Pre-Check and did not have us identified as needing a wheelchair
The seats are too close together. There was puke on the wall. The flight attendants are overworked/tired thus sassy.

The 3 pm flight seems to offer some difficulties for United as a whole.  The incoming flight was late and the crew was late.  The Flight was a bit late leaving the gate.  That said the pilot did a fantastic job getting in line and getting to Greensboro as quickly as possible - kudos to the pilot.  The flight attendant had to deal with some unique circumstances - a passenger who would not follow instructions, some debris/litter on the landing gear, and no jet way once on the ground in Greensboro.  The big issue (unsatisfactory) was the jet way in Greensboro.  Even if you are contracting with PTI or whatever the contractual circumstances may be, the jet way took 60 or so minutes which is almost longer then the actual flight to deplane.  if the airport is open they must have employees.  It is unacceptable to say you are open for business with 2 employees when you need 12.  The flight was therefore unsatisfactory.  Certain things are understandable and if the jet way operated under normal circumstances the flight would have been about 10-15 minutes late - not great but acceptable; however to be sitting at the gate for just over an hour is unacceptable.

Why did we have to wait 50 minutes after arrival for someone to move the jet bridge so that we could disembark?  After finally getting off the aircraft, we had to wait another 20 minuts for our baggage.  The total wait time equaled the flight time. You ought to be ashamed of yourselves and consider compensating the passengers for the lack of customer service.

Upon arrival in Greensboro, no one was there to drive the jetway to the plane.  So, we sat on the tarmac for 60 minutes without being able to depart the plane.  This is unacceptable.   Delays for weather or mechanical issues are to be expected (on occasion), but I don't expect to be stuck at the gate due to insufficient staff being on hand or complete incompetence in teh staff that are there.  Not a happy customer.

We boarded the flight half way through the process. We were 4 of the 8 seats in first class. There was effectively no space for our carry-on. The flight attendants did not help solve the problem even though I was traveling with children. Another passenger helped me move luggage around to make space reasonable close to our seats.

The United app had the wrong terminal listed so I checked in at the wrong terminal at Newark and went through security! To go to the other terminal, I had to exit, take a train and then go through security again. Very annoying!! Why does the app not update? I will never trust it again.

I was annoyed that the flight was delayed because i did not receive a text about the delay and I had to log into the app to see it. It was a half hour delay.  I confirmed with the CSrep at the Club that the boarding time would be later and he suggested when i should head down. I followed his directions but when i got to the gate they had already boarded groups 1 and 2 and they said i had to tag and load my bag for baggage claim because the overhead was full. I have experience this before and I suspected there were open spaces. I told them i wanted to get on the plane and determine for myself if the overhead was full but they said i missed my group 2 boarding and had to tag my bag. when i got on the plane, just as i suspected, there were spaces and specifically the space over my seat was available.  There were other spaces too.  Waiting for the baggage caused me to be stuck at the airport another 40 minutes, and my kid was waiting for me to come home and feed him.  Things have improved some due to the passenger bill of rights from the not so long ago days where i have been trapped on a continental or united plane one time 12 hours with no food and only limited water also people yelling at you to sit down any time you tried to pee, but the process could be a lot more efficient. It is especially disheartening because there are so many ways to communicate with passengers yet the communications that could ease the aggravation when flights are delayed are still non existent or sub par.

Let's see - the check in in Atlanta was a zoo.  They called all boarding sections without letting anyone on the plane.  Ridiculous.  The flight was an hour late.  When we got to Newark, they kept us on the taxiway for over ten minutes.  I had to use the rest room.  Your idiotic prissy flight attendant wouldn't let me use the bathroom, and then had the gall to make an announcement about it.  An overall horrible experience.  The seat in the plane was nice, though.
Flight attendants were very attentive but also made a ton of noise in the galley and weren't particularly friendly
United's coach cabin is too tight very tight.  worse than Jet Blue and Delta.  very cramped.  never again

I was delayed at check-in while the agent tried to figure out why United would sell me an economy plus upgrade that wasn't available.  She processed a refund for me, but I was delayed on my way to the gate as a result of united's screw-up and had to gate check my bag, extending my trip by at least half an hour on a Friday night.

The flight from atl to Newark, the WiFi had serious issues! Only got to see 20 minutes of the movie because of the issues.... then when I got home found out someone (Not TSA) stoke 2 bottles of 100 proof capt morgan spiced rum. Very upset...called and was to,d after going through the entire situation, including whoever took the items, did Not lock my suitcase back.  That now...I HAVE TO GET A NUMBER AND GO FILL OUT A FORM. JUST TO GET BACK WHAT WAS MONE TO BEGIN WITH! HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! Not the rep, the process. Why do I have t9 fill out 3 pages of info, because someone who works for YOU...STOKE MY STUFF!?! I am very pissed off  - this is twice, the first time 1/2 bottle of rum, so not soo mad...but this time 2 Full bottles. Can’t you screen your people better before hiring them?
The landing was too hard and jolting. The impact cause pain in my spine. I complained to the pilots as left the plane. I had the feeling from take off to landing that the staff was hurrying.
7 hours for a mechnaical problem, with no solution in sight is unacceptable.  Will fly AA to destinations where UAL doesn’t have a fuller schedule of flights in the future.
Negative

The flight crew did a tremendous job.  Even got us to Chicago nearly half an hour early.  Believe it or not, by the time we got to the gate - we were late!  That happens nearly every time I fly United.  Unfortunately there are no other options at the same time and I fly every week.  It is difficult to find something more poorly managed.  The week before we had to wait for a gate and then wait at the gate for over 20 minutes to have someone move the jetway in place.  All for a flight of only 45 minutes in the first place.  Gross incompetence would seem to be the only viable explanation.

The gate service was very bad, no announcement for the original flight departure time delay. no announcement for the second delay of departure time and the gate change. no help for the passengers to find another plane. After the second delay, I searched the flight status in Newark airport and find another flight to Houston. I want to the gate for this another flight. From the screen, this plane still had a lot of seat available. but the gate service refused to add me to the standby because that flight will departure soon--even i explain to them that my original flight was delayed twice without announcement. I waited 5 hours in the Newark airport and finally got on the plane. This delay was due to mechanical problem in the United plane. There was no re-fund and no coupon voucher to the passengers. i was very unsatisfied with this travel experience with United airline gate service.

It is incredible the lack of professionalism of the people in the gate before boarding. The plane was late but they did not do a minimal effort to pass the proper information. Really bad, bad proffesionnals
Rude flight attendant. Mismanagement of overhead cabin space causing trouble to several passengers.

Had two bags to check in. Total weight of the two is within limits, but one of them is 52 lbs i.e. 2 lbs "overweight" (mind you - the total weight of my two paid-for bags was less than 100 lbs). Was offered two options: either pay 100$ (one. hundred. dollars.) for the 2 lbs or re-pack my stuff and go to the end of the baggage drop line. I think this is insane.
For some reason there was no hot or fresh food on this flight - some snafu in Newark?
Smooth sailing.  I was disappointed that there were no option for chargIng personal devices on board.  For a cross country flight in this day and age, this isn't acceptable.

The TSA pre checkpoint was not open in Terminal A on Friday afternoon - the security line was ridiculous.  I'm not sure why I can't always be sure that there's a TSA pre security line in Terminal A.   It does not make my travel experience start off well.  The information at the gate was very bad on this flight - the inbound flight was delayed and there was no indication that our flight would be late (which it was) and what the current status was.   Once we were late, the flight information disappeared on the gate monitors and the gate agent actually yelled at people and told us not to ask ANY questions until the inbound flight arrived.   The app didn't have update information either.  I'm not a happy million mile passenger after this weekend's round-trip.

Gate Agents we’re not forthcoming with keeping passengers up to date about delay. Without app we wouldn’t have known anything, it almost seemed as though she had a attitude. As well as the female flight attendant, I understand she was tired or upset about the delay but it pretty much affected her mood during the flight and she was extremely unpleasant.

Flight was delayed over 1 hour.  I did not receive a notice about the delay.  So I sat at the airport for an additional hour.  After I boarded the aircraft I received the notice about the delay.  Shameful.  After we landed it took approximately 30minutes to taxi to the gate.  Simply terrible.

Flight was originally delayed. Then boarded in time. Then sat on plane for45 minutes without being asked if we wanted water or anything. It was sweltering and many people dick. I felt myself getting sick sitting there. Very uncomfortable

It was not made clear that the premier extra payment I made did not cover premier security. As it was hearthrow, the most major airport in Britain, I expected this to be in the list of applicable airports. After all, you knew where I was flying from- if it didn’t include Heathrow, you should have said : you implied the considerable charge I paid would cover premier security. I felt very dissatified that I pointlessly paid £46 for nothing at all worthwhile.
I can see when a flight arrives early we may have to wait for a gate but 45 minutes sitting in the penalty box is overboard.
When going to Newark the lady that checked me in was very rude and acted as if she did not want to do her job. This was the only bad experience I dealt with. Other than that I was satisfied.
I fly 2-3 international flights per month  With united only  The service became worse every flight  Always late , horrible food, unpleasant staff

I was extremely disappointed when my seat assignment was changed without my consent or knowledge. Had I not looked at my boarding pass on my phone minutes before boarding, I would not have known. That was very inconsiderate of United. The seat that I was being changed to was not a better seat assignment and I was not offered any compensation. Had I been offered some sort of compensation, such as an upgrade to economy plus, I would have gladly changed seats.  I was very disappointed in how United tried to steal my seat out from under me.

The flight was delayed by over an hour, despite the aircraft being available.  The gate agent stated that it's always the case that the flight is delayed, due to air traffic.  If that's the case, why isn't the flight simply scheduled later?  Having passengers spend an extra hour in the gate area is simply unacceptable.
Very disappointed in first class. Mediocre food and service.

United keeps very old equipment still going in their fleet. Many times my flights get delayed or even cancelled due to mechanical problems. Newer and more state of the art are desperately need in United’s fleet.
Plane was small, cramped and crowded. It also looked dingy, dirty and worn.
The delay because of air traffic is unacceptable
The new seat configuration is so uncomfortable in coach.
Seating is way too tight. This is the biggest complaint from everyone I speak with.  Flying has become uncomfortable
Boarding and disembarking terrible.  Length of time horrible.
I really do not care for basic economy. Through Expedia, it isn’t clear that tickets are basic economy without the ability to reserve a seat
On both legs the flight was delayed due to late aircraft or due to Maintenace. It was the most horrible experience. The customer experience has diminished and your treated as cattle.
Food is a disgrace. Vile and revolting.
Flight was quite delayed with no real explanation. And not kept informed

I don’t think many people pay attention any more anyway but the attendants spoke so rapidly on the PA system that it was almost unintelligible. I think it gives the bad impression that they don’t care much about the messages or the passengers.

I did get upgrade notice 2 day before my flight to first class. When checked in I did it through my mobile app.  My seat was not asigned and the app asked me to see an agent. While at the gate the app assigned my seat to be 3G.  Also while ate the gate my name was called by an agent who told me that I was been downgraded. I asked her to explan the reassons why, she told me the aircraft was changed to a smaller plane.  (checking at the seat map I think  I was lied to and found her aggresive and distant and unresposive to my questions) I dont think I was never able to get a direct / correct answer as of why I was downgraded and I feel unhappy and frustated.   I was so upset that I forgot to collect her name.

This whole experience vindicated, yet again, my belief that United Airlines is still too arrogant to notify passengers ahead of time that their flight is being delayed.  It shows that you don't respect our time.  Had we knew ahead of time our flight was running late we would have altered our plans for the night other than wasting our time waiting at the airport.  #Bad_Business_United_Airlines

Not only did I experience a flight delay from Ottawa but the same thing when leaving Chicago. I am a Platinum member on another airline so I spend a lot of time in the air. The commutation during both instances was terrible. Nobody offered any updates and a gate agent was rude to a couple of passengers, even walking away and ignoring him when he asked a simple question.  After a lengthy delay like this nothing was offered to the customers that were flying direct ( example; Water, snack) and I would have thought that a meal might have been offered on a flight of this length especially after the delay. Figure the passengers spent an additional 4 hours in the terminal, not counting the time they arrived at the airport to go through security. I realize I am just a small fish in a large pond but my company spends a lot of money on air travel and us employees do choose the airlines we prefer to fly, this experience with United as well as other experiences I have had in the past, puts United LOW on my list. I am curious to see if I even receive a response to this.
Did not care for the delay
Air cabin was hot  on this flight!!... extremes are bad..too cold its also bad.
Shabby aircraft...umfortable seats and very poor selections of snacks in first class

My bags were gate checked at Newark and the wrong tag was put on my bag. Bag is lost and not at home airport. It has been 12 hours and no updates despite stating bag with wrong tag was located in a Chicago and placed aside to return. Would simply like an update on the bag return to me.
you must change the planes - American Airlines, even Delta Airlines have new aircrafts. I have time not flying with United, and I used to fly with United.

Incredibly rude flight attendant. I felt as though he was irritated I was there. Just before landing, when he’d forgotten to give me my jacket, I asked for it. I might as well have asked him to swim across the ocean in winter.
The delay was due to late crew. Can’t United get another crew? You kept 100 customers waiting for 2 hours!!!
Your seats are getting to the point of being torture for anyone over 5 '6" and 130 lbs. I couldn't wait to get off that plane.

It was unexpected and disappointing to find there were no TVs in the seats, and not even an old-fashioned drop-down screen from the ceiling. Adding insult to injury was the fact that United charges for internet access even when there is no in-seat TV offered! The only personal device I had was a mobile phone, and there was nowhere to charge it, so I could not drain my battery watching a free movie on it. Just cheap and shoddy all around.
No reason was given for the delay

Terrible flight. First, flight was delayed 30 mins. Second, there was an intoxicated (not sure if he was on drugs or alcohol) but the passenger was EXTREMELY  disruptive, cursed, would not stop talking loud about all of his personal issues, and would not obey the rules. He did not wear his seat belt even though the steward kept telling him to put it on.  He should have been kicked off the flight. Lastly, the plane overfueled and was too heavy to fly so we sat for another 30 mins while we burned fuel. Horrible experience.
I will not fly united again, you don’t take care of your customers and both my flights were delayed
It was very bumpy and scary flying at night time around the Rocky Mountains.
The gate agents in Newark were very rude!
Movie choices were poor.  The food was terrible.  Served cold
The waiting area at Gate 88 in Newark is dirty, uncomfortable and cold

Gate attendant was very rude. Also started gate checking bags in group 2. The bags were clearly fine for the overheads, and there was still room in the later groups.  I am a Silver elite member and pay for premier status. Forced gate checking is unnecessary especially when we pay for premier status!
seats are too close and uncomfortable. Not safe

There was no apparent reason for the flight to be late taking off first off. Delayed, not delayed,  borded then delayed again.   Once we finally left, a big group we’re tight missing 2 connections, the one going to Providence was missed but our flight was only a few gates down so we all ran down to catch it to find out the United employee closed the door 4 min early and said there’s nothing he can do (even though they pushed back early).  Maybe a dozen passengers missed their flight that could’ve made it if they would’ve kept the door open normal time.   Even though most airlines I fly (Delta mainly) would call down to the other gate to let them know there’s a big group running a little late because the flight was late for no reason.   The guy literally laughed at us and said there’s nothing he can do. Big time smart ass!!  After zero help at customer service desk, we chose to rent a car to drive 4 hours to Boston. We weren’t offered any credits to help pay for the $400 rental car, not taking a leg or Just wasting our time with miserable customer service

I have flown this same route/flight twice on the 6:15/6:30 flight- once on November 17 and once on January 19.  Both times the flight was delayed - the first time being a 2 hour delay and the 2nd being a 1 hour delay with neither caused by weather related issues.  This is unacceptable and an issue that needs to be addressed.
Male flight attendant was very rude, not friendly and unapproachable

Newark is a terrible airport. The cramped seating area with insufficient and not working charging stations, horrible overpriced food. The least United could do after such a long delay is waive the DirectTV fees for the flight.

Arrived at Harrisburg. Said they could deliver green tag bags to jet bridge. They will be st baggage claim.   When belt finally started.  15 bags came out before the first priority yellow handle bags arrived.  Green tag bags were last.  Very disappointed

There was no question on what the issues were at the airport but flying business and being a Senator I got absolutely no support from gound stuff at check in with my suitcase which was damaged on the way to Newark by United again. I was left to wrap the damaged part of the suitcase by tape myslef and told no scissors were available to cut it off. Then when asking the person taking care of loading the check in luggage on a trolley to get off the suitcase baove mine down for a second to have access to mine, was told he wouldn't!!! so I had to do it myself which I found unbelievable. My colleagues watching from a distance while waiting for me, were completely apprehensive but could tell you what they saw if needed. To continue, we were three flying business coming from Europe, two of us flying back and one continuing within the US, so our third oclleaue was not admitted to the lounge as they were flying domestic, no exceprion was possible, and out  of courtesy the rest of us left the lounge as it felt very impolite to leave one of us outside. Further, noone from the cabin crew seemed to really care about equipment not working, I am convinced it happened on an earlier flight but noone made me aware, suggested I change seats (was possible, of course awkward if you find out only when everyone is having their dinner). Not a nice experience, it's a shame for all the flying I have done incl. United.

If you are using headphones plugged in to the airplane armrest the announcement volume level is painful.  The regular PA system is sitting at 75DB but headphones plugged into the armrest physically hurts.  This is unacceptable.
The baggage check experience at Newark airport was poor. The seats on the plane are small (narrow) and uncomfortable
Check in was poor.   Check out the video of the area.   Lazy and not attentive
DELAYED DUE TO “MECHANICAL” PROBLEM
Horrible old aircraft.

1/15, Flight 2062, EWR > BOS: Gate agents were pre-checking bags at gate. When on-board, many overhead bins were available. I asked for a gate agent as I desired to put my carry-on bag in a bin above my seat. A lady who identified herself as the gate manager approached me and began to talk to me in a lecturing manner. She dismissed my request and refused to answer my questions. She spoke to me in a chiding and incredibly rude manner. She said she was “trying to push the plane out on-time, and it’s people like me who delay everything.”  I asked what she meant by “people like me” and said, “Chinese people.” (I’m not Chinese.) I was stunned and speechless. Passengers seated in my vicinity started getting upset and began vocalizing how rude and racist she was. Then, she deplaned briskly. How will you address this horrible experience, United?

It was unacceptable for a flight that was only 39 min duration to be delayed 2 hours. If there was an accurate delay time from the beginning, I would have purchased another flight. Instead it went from a 20 min delay to continually dragging on, and I missed my business event that night.
The seats are way too tight - makes for a bad customer experience!
I always find the TSA workers quite rude.

Re: carry on luggage - we were the last people to be allowed to carry on our small bags. Lack of space. Purpose of carry on is just that - to carry on, especially those items (meds, contact lenses, important papers, etc.) that should not be checked. So now you have to worry about whether or not your CARRY ON will be checked. AND if it’s checked it’s not GATE CHECKED so you end up at carousel.

My Regional upgrade did not clear.  I was in seat 10, stuck in the window (I dont like window seats).  And then when I asked for chicken sandwich, they were already out of them!  4th row back?   And then no chicken wraps.  ANd having to pay for DirecTV is ridiculous, especially for 1K's who are stuck in the back when their darn CERTIFICATE upgrades don't clear!!!
Lack of information on the delay and no indication of departure other than agent provide an estimated time of departure.
Gate experience was frustrating as the times were not being updated even though it was delayed. The gate continuously changed throughout the course of a few hours which was irritating too.
the worst flight ever. didn't get a meal and steward didn't seem to care.

The lounge in Newark is probably one of the worst I’ve been in. Uncomfortable, over crowded and very poor amenities. Take a look at Air Canada in Toronto or for top quality, Emirates in Dubai. Plane was late, as usual and the food on the flight, well $2 a head?

It was the most uncomfortable seat ever especially when being pregnant and not being able to lean back a little bit. Also having the TV in front of me right in my face. And being so uncomfortable that i had to take the next day off from work to rest .

Yes.  The gate agent working this flight was awful.  The flight was delayed repeatedly for a maintenance issue, ultimately departing about 90 minutes late.  The delay grew in 10 to 20 minute increments until it was about 50 minutes late, then a decision was made to provide an alternate aircraft, which was going to arrive a few minutes later at an adjacent gate.  The gate agent was largely absent from the gate area after the original boarding time, occasionally returning to make announcements as the delay extended.  Once a decision was made to provide an alternate aircraft, and that the delay would extend to about 90 minutes, I learned this from checking the status on the United app; the agent did not make a timely announcement.  The most infuriating part of this delay came when we were finally boarding the alternate aircraft.  The agent began boarding with the customary pre-boarding for families with small children, uniformed military, and Global Services members.  Several folks boarded.  At this time the agent became distracted, engaging in what appeared to be a casual conversation with another gate agent.  We waited at least two minutes through this conversation, when clearly boarding could have continued, before passengers just got frustrated and approached the gate to board.  He then realized that perhaps he should continue boarding folks on this flight that was already delayed 90 minutes, and called for Group 1 to board.  This agent displayed a complete disregard for the frustration of the passengers who had to endure this 90-minute delay.  We wanted to board and get on the flight to get going, and he needlessly delayed the boarding while he was engaged in what clearly was not an urgent conversation related to the flight he was working.  I was very unhappy.  I have considered sharing this event in a separate note to the United 1K voice department, but I hope you can pass this information on to the correct supervisor so this gate agent is counseled on his behavior.  Delays happen; that is a fact of air travel.  But agents should at least be attentive to the passengers, and sensitive to the frustration of the passengers who endure the delay.  This agent definitely was not.

We were not served a meal on the plane even though we were traveling first class, our flight was delayed an hour and a half for reasons still unknown, we were forced to switch gates twice; it was very discouraging.
I AM SO FRUSTRATED WITH THIS AIRLINE!!
It was unbearably hot!! It made me sick.  One of the flight attendants was very rude also!

The seating was really tight. I am only 5'5 and it was quite uncomfortable. Even the width of the seats was tight. We had pre booked our seats but when we checked in for some reason my seat had changed. I didn't notice in the rush to check in but when the ground crew came to the gate they managed to change my seat to an aisle one but unfortunately nowhere near my husband, which was disappointing.

I was extremely displeased with the no carry on policy for a completely empty flight that was delayed 3 hours due to an inbound aircraft. Not only was it not communicated to me that my ticket disallowed a carry on, on a completely empty and delayed flight, I was unable to just pay and still carry on my bag to avoid further delays. Due to this extreme nickel and diming I will not choose United unless absolutely forced.
Disappointed with your policy. No logical reason at all

Very bad service ! I had one handbag less than 7 kg and the people at the gate did not allow my bag inside there was a huge scene and the airline should mention before that they do not even allow even a single handbag are you guys out of your mind ?

There were a couple of disappointments that were faced on the flight: 1) The call centre gave wrong information that an additional bag of 70 pounds could be purchased at the airport. Once I reached the airport the option was declined by the staff. Given the frustration that had set in and arguments that followed at the counter, I was finally allowed to carry a 50 pound bag at a 150 US Dollar charge (which seemed absolutely expensive)  2) Secondly the check in at boarding gate had very long ques with just one counter /given there was a full flight capacity there should have definitely been more service available at the gates 3) The food on the flight was disgusting - the indigestion one suffered post the dinner was unbelievable. This definitely needs to be sorted.  Arrival into Mumbai is 9:40 pm - Why is a breakfast served?
The only thing I didn’t like was the extremely bright LED personal lights. The harsh light hurts the eyes and is extremely disruptive as a passenger.
Staff at gate exceptionally rude to others who wanted details about the delay. Combative and unprofessional. Would not fly with you again.
Need power at seats; disappointed we had to pay to watch Direct TV on a brief flight. Would not pay for that.
It is frustrating that flights still show as on time when the inbound flights are substantially delayed.

I am very disappointed that the flight schedules have changed starting March: there are no more late evening flight from ORD to BWI, and the morning schedule has been changed as well. Unfortunately I will have to use another airline in the future

Yes they lost my surfboard, it did not make the connecting flight.  Once it was delivered  it had damage and my board bag was ripped.  I find this ridicules due to the fact I had too pay two hundred dollars each way!!!!!!
I am not impressed with the business seats. They are not truly flat. Where the back and seat meet are not the same level when setup as bed
First time I was seriously disappointed. I upgraded to economy plus and found the seat to be small (tiny) and hard.

I was seated in a middle row, middle seat, in economy plus/ Unfortunately, I was seated next to a very obese person who was also seated in a middle seat.  My guess is that he was in excess of 400 pounds! This made the flight extremly uncomfortablefor both of us. In my mind, there should be a company policy to avoide such cases. Had the obese passenger been moved to an exit seat, or even an ile seat, it would have been a tolerable situation. The flight crew just looked the other way and did not try to resolve the situation.
Check in area services are extremely poor. No customer service at all. Those workers can care less. Horrible service
Crew was rude, I’m Gold member, but receive th worst seat even after trying to check in 24-hrs in advance
Airport has nothing open at that time, it's dark, sort of spooky & very disappointing.

Security gave me a very difficult time. It seems like few Asian Americans fly from Guatemala City to the U.S. because the customs officer grilled me for 20 minutes. He did not believe that someone born in Taiwan could be an American citizen. He said “but you are from Japan” even though on my U.S. passport it clearly states that I was born in Taiwan. This was incredibly insulting. I am not of Japanese descent and neither is anyone in my family. Being a law-abiding, legal citizen of the United States this was an extremely offensive way to be treated. Everything else was great with the flight experience except being treated like a criminal and accused of being Japanese (both of my grandfathers were soldiers who fought against Japan in World War 2!)

Your service on board is one of the worse. your flight attendants do not show compassion, and consider passengers as a burden. You are in the business of transporting humans, not cattle. I travel the world in different airlines, and I objectively rate United as the worse in customer service. Please learn how to serve from the younger asian airlines like Jet airways, Emirates, and Singapore airlines.

The connecting was very illogical. We missed the connecting flight because it took us very long to go from one terminal to the other, claimed the check-in luggage and re-checked in the luggage again. It also took the UA staff very long to change our connecting flight and the new connecting flight was delayed due to broken aircraft. All of these result in a bad beginning of the new year and a bad start of my first-day work in the new year. I'll try to avoid UA in the future.

The flight was scheduled to leave at 2:20 am in the early morning, a difficult time to travel to begin with, but it eventually left at 4:30 am.  United knew 6 hours earlier for certain that the flight would be at least 2 hours delayed because the incoming plane from Newark was delayed by that time.  Yet, no advance warning via email or text.  No announcements whatsoever at the gate.  No apologies.  No beverages or other service. No compensation.  Nothing.  No one cared.   And so we were stuck with a 3 year old and a 6 year old in the middle of the night at an airport where everything was closed.  I'm a Premier 1-K member and I'm in utter shock and disbelief.

Yes, our flight was over 2 hours late. The ground staff at the gate never informed us. We all kept waiting there, until around 2:00 I realized something must be wrong. I looked up the flight and it showed the airplane had not yet arrived. Still, the ground staff said nothing. They also posted nothing. We fly a lot, most times with United and I have never experienced anything like that. The flight departed 2 hours later and they never explained anything or apologized. One passenger got angry because he couldn’t make it to work in time. Instead of explaining to him, one of yr flight attendants berated him and threatened to call security.  My husband missed a work day and my daughter missed school. But, I really hope this does not become part of the norm. It was the worse customer service I have ever seen!
woman seated next to me was so large, her body surged over the arm rest.  I had difficulty raising or lowering my tray and she did not move.   She should have been charged for two seats.
The crew maintained a positive customer disposition given the uncontrollable dependency that resulted in delay. MLI operations did not look good and failed on 101-level execution.

I understand the delays but the problem was there was NO communication within the Columbia airport about what was happening with the flights... no announcements, no updates on the screen.  The United App was NOT up to date.  The only way to know what was happening was to wait in the line at the United desk and then ask for an update...  I think they were busy and overwhelmed but they could have answered EVERYONES ??s by making announcements .   I was also disappointed that my text notifications from United were non-existent.  I got one throughout the entire 21 hour delay.

I missed my flight the night before because the only way to check in was via self-service kiosks -- fine, I do it all the time -- but the lines were long and (in my particular line) only 1 of the 3 kiosks was operational.   And some in-frequent flyers didn't know how to use it, so that ate up time, since not enough attendants were around to help.  Later, I saw that there was a bank of kiosks off to the side that were almost empty, but again, there were no agents directing the patrons to the open kiosks to ease the jam.  And forget checking a bag -- just the line to DROP OFF the bag was almost 20-25 minutes.  I've been traveling 10 years around the world and NEVER missed a flight til this mess on 1/1/18 at Terminal C in Newark.

This was the first flight of the day - 6 am. There is no excuse to have seat, tray , and wall of plane covered in sticky red stuff ( probably cranberry juice). The plane should have been cleaned before being put into service. I didn't like becoming sticky too!! Also, I booked a 9:10 flight originally and was changed without my consent to a 6 am flight. Not happy!
The security people at Orlando airport were rude and unprofessional.

Our flight was delayed and we boarded into a completely freezing airplane. We had to wait for an hour until the airplane was ready to takeoff and it took an hour until the airplane was not freezing anymore. We were all freezing since there were no heat in the airplane. The flight attendant tried to find us blankets, but there were not enough blankets for everybody. I got sick from this flight since I was not wearing a coat or boots, and it was completely freezing in this plane ...
Totally dissatisfied with rebooking and extra charges

My femur is longer than the distance between your seats. This is the tightest distance I have ever seen on an airplane. This is uncomfortable, painful, and demoralizing as a human being. These feelings I get when I sit in your seats translate directly into how I perceive your brand. If I am unwilling to pay extra to upgrade to higher classes, feel free to deny me of extra perks and benefits, but do not deny the basic comfort I should have sitting in a chair. You put me in physical pain and that is absolutely unforgivable.   I know these comments will fall on deaf ears, and that's fine. Your business has demonstrated a lack of these basic considerations for years now, and I expect nothing out of you. Nothing.
I feel I do surveys and no one listens   I always fly business even international not good

We were transferred to Miami because of an overbooking of our flight out of Key West.  I purchased my tickets through United for flight from Key West to Orlando and then from Orlando to Newark, however the flight from Key West to orlando was overbooked by Silver Airways.  Why you are affiliated with this awful airline is beyond me.  They overbooked and kicked my wife and I off their flight about 10 minutes prior to boarding on New Years Day no less.  They did not have a concern about us missing our connection in Orlando.    Where I am upset with United was that there was a direct flight from Key West to Newark leaving around the same time.  The gate agent showed 3 seats available on this flight, however when I called United, they said that it was completely sold out.  The logical solution was to move us from an overbooked one stop flight to an available direct flight to our destination.  United was able to switch our Orlando connection to a Miami direct for the following morning.  The Miami flight was fine but just frustrating that it took us an extra day and a half to get home.  Please remove any association with Silver Airways.  Terrible service.
The seats are really small and I’m little. The guy next to me was fairly average size and he couldn’t help but encroach on my space. I was a little annoyed but kind of understood...
No problem with those exceptions

My laggauge was missing and it was in other fligth and was broke and open. It was a new lagguge was the fisrt time use it. And now I put it in the garbage.. I told them and they said is tno their fault.

I have TSA precheck, but for some reason it did not print on my boarding pass in Portland or on the return flight from Burlington. In Portland they added the TSA precheck to my boarding pass. In Burlington they refused to do it, even though I had the numbers and the letter from TSA. There is a shorter line for TSA precheck, which I was not allowed to use. This is unacceptable. I paid for the precheck and should be allowed to do it.

I was disappointed upon our landing in Chicago that we could not deplane right away because there was another plane in our gate (and it was delayed), so we had to wait for them to depart, making our arrival later than scheduled.

airplane is WAY too small.  The size is not comfortable - my backpack would not fit up in compartments, I had to shove it under the seat in front of me which left no room for my feet.  It is definitely NOT designed for someone with a disability like me.  Very unhappy the spaces.

The delay was awful after the red eye from San Francisco. It wasn’t posted when I deplaned and the shuttle wasn’t running and I quick walked from the C terminal to the F and discovered that the flight to Greenville was delayed.
No text notification of 2 hour delay!  I understand that illness can occur unexpectedly, but I could have avoided a lengthy stay at the airport if you had used the system we all sign up for
Bad seat, no WiFi. I feel that I should be compensated, I flew first class, very disappointed.

I gave low marks because I paid $165 to upgrade my seat to an emergency exit row, but still got stuck in group 4 for boarding. As a result, there was no overhead space by the time I got on the plane, and I had to gate-check my bag. American and Delta both include priority boarding with upgrades to emergency rows.
Airplane was awful, a cheap 2nd rate older plane, terrible service all around.
Check in it is the worst part, too slow !!!
Attendant was very rude, she brought me the wrong breakfast and then couldn't fix it bc it was sold out. In first class felt like i was annoying them
Lap child behind my seat was extremely disruptive with screams and constant kicking. Toddlers should not be allowed as lap children. Should require own seat as are too disruptive.

Sat on the tarmac at O'Hare for over half an hour upon arrival and consequently nearly missed my connection.  Would have missed it if it was not itself late.   When asked flight attendant to contact the connecting flight and ask them to give additional time before door closure, I was told this is impossible.

The flight arrived at Chicago on time, but the gate was not available for about 30 minutes.  Most people on this flight have connection flights to catch.  We almost missed our connection.  It's an evidence of poor management on gate arrangement.

The delay was absolutely ridiculous. To being delayed, then boarding the plane, then sitting on the plane for nearly and hour to then being deplaned and the re-boarded. whole thing was a mess. wouldve rather never boarded the plane in the first place with knowledge of a maintenance issue that still needed to be resolved. The "Quick Fix" was not quick at all.

They deplaned us due to a maintenance issue after being on the plane for an hour and then re-boarded up 15-20 minutes later. I was very disappointed with my experience as this is not the first time maintenance issues led to very long delays and we were deplaned a lot faster than this time. We couldn't do work since no wifi on plane either. Wifi on all planes is strongly requested.
Yes, the customer service in Newark, are so rude, dont line to explain the procedures with baggage machines to register them. ROA A., this girl its fatal.

We did not recieve our bags until 50 minutes after we landed. At one point, the belt stopped and the United baggage agent called for assistance, but no one in baggage answered the calls so she had no informaiton to provide to the customers. Also, once received our new large duffle had a rip and was so dirty that it looked like it was dragged along the tarmac. I let the baggage agent know and provided my information, but I could not wait for them to file a report. I have not yet heard from United.

The flight was delayed several hours which I was very displeased with. In addition, I received no notifications about the delay and no notification of gate changes which made it difficult to predict any changes.

Hate personal rude about request to change seats for the 2 of us could sit together. Open seats were available. We purchased the Basic Economy ticket and felt disregarded by employees because of it. A little politeness would go a long way.
The economy bright yellow no nag screen on check in made people behind me in line get frustrated that I needed to wait for a rep to check the size of my checked bag before I could print a ticket.
I'm 6 ft 1in....the seats are too damn close.  It's literally painful.

Old plane. A very dirty plane when we arrived in it. Some of the Flight attendant/staff looked tired and worn out and not very friendly. Not impressed with first class United flights. Will rethink my next time I fly out about choosing United.
The plane was not clean.  There was an empty liquor bottle rolling around.  Others garbage in our seats.   Not clean.
United aircrafts are very old. My swag was not clean and to pay for business class tickets and have an old Plane and old seats was very disappointing
Stop losing people bags

you have decided to oursource  baggage employees and hire an overweight woman who could barely walk much less put ski bags on a trolley ..  this isn't efficient use of time... think is this what customers want to see..
The breakfast cookies are horrible nothing but horrible . You can't give out a small muffin...How cheap can you get. Give people a terrible sugar cookie
The flight attendant was rude and did not acknowledge the individuals in the back of the plane.  Bypassed those in back for beverage service with no explanation nor follow-up.

The layout of the business class cabin on the 777 is not very good. Seats are also too close together for business class, no separation with adjoining seat. Absolutely no room to put carry-on under the seat. Also, our seating assignments were changed after we booked, so our party of 5 was no longer all sitting together. Backward facing seats are unsettling.
Give your customers more seat room or you will have riots erupt

There were 4 babies, 2 of which screamed the entire 4 hour flight.  It was the worst flight I have ever experienced.  I would spend $100 extra to be put on a flight where it would be guaranteed not to have babies.
A bad experience from beginning to end, and a reminder why I only choose to fly United when forced by outside factors

We were 6 pounds over and were $100 USD.  Considering we were international travellers travelling domestically the luggage limits are too low and costs too high.  When I booked  the flight there were no costs regarding luggage to be found.  The air hostesses on the flight did not smile and were not helpful to fellow travellers when they had issues.
Customer service call center does not understand English. Total incompetence. I’ll never fly united again.
Waiting for 1/2 of our luggage bad transfer from previous ROC to Newark apparently
I think i said enough but in general it was a hell of a nightmare.
Just was confused at first taking the shuttle bus to terminal as wasn’t sure my luggage would go there or to terminal a where I departed from. No one seemed to know.

Upgraded to first class from business class...however wife and I were given seats apart from each other and had a small dog as well. fortunately another passenger swapped a seat with us so we could travel together.  Nobody showed any kind of concern at the gate when I raised the issue at the gate and we were left to our own devices to solve the problem created by the upgrade.  Not good customer service, in fact really bad.
TSA was terribly slow.Had to wait about 15 minutes just to get my belongings after I placed them in a bin.

While at the terminal decided to get something quick to eat for breakfast on the restaurant in the middle of the hall, service was terrible, first there was problem that the person in front of me accidentally paid for my food, that got resolved then had to reorder, when I reordered half an hour later I ask where is my food waitress says "we accidentally served it to the wrong person", she then comments we will just give you a refund and no food.    Once I get to the gate the lady there says "there is no more space for your carryon in the plane you must have it go under", I ask "are you sure there is no space because it has happened that they say there is no space and at the end of the day there is space",she says she is positive, when i get to my seat the above head compartment was empty not one bag, I look to my left and it was exactly the same EMPTY!!   This was a very dissatisfying  experience, usually I fly in through UNITED every 4months when I get a break from school but lately I have preferred driving an hour to JFK to fly through Delta or JetBlue.

Disappointed to arrive in the early hours only to find out the flight was delayed.  The updates could have been a little more honest in nature. Flight attendant was not as friendly as other flight attendants
I hate the small planes

From the time the maintenance issue was identified on the plane - it took more than 90 minutes for there to actually be maintenance people there assessing the situation.  That was unacceptable and led to a long maintenance delay (regrettable, but understandable) being even longer!!
We landed 25 minutes early but, there was no gate available for 40 minutes. This is the 3rd year in a row that we landed early from Mexico with no gate available.
Incredibly rude flight attendants and barely any food for a nearly 8 hour flight.

One female stewardess could not have rolled her eyes any further back into her head when we asked for COMPLIMENTARY drinks. Furthermore, there was no duty free, snack trolley and no attendant left food for people who were sleeping. Generally it would have been expected to leave it with a passenger say adjacent. This was not the case. Also, choice of food was not great. You had what you were given, and if you didn’t like it/couldn’t eat it, then there was no alternative
Regional aircrafts are in dire need of cabin updates. Everything rattles and many seats are ripping which is a bit embarrassing.

This flight was booked for us after our initial flight was delayed and we were unable to be re-routed the same day to arrive on the 1st.  This occurred at 9am and even though we were willing to drive to other airports within 2-3 hours we were still not able to get a flight for the day we originally booked.  This was the SECOND time this happened on the same trip and we were not given any kind of compensation for the airlines inability to help us.  We should have had the cost of our ticket refunded or given coutures for future flights or at least at the bare minimum been given upgraded seats and service such as drinks for the flight we were put on the following day.   We specifically had avoided the 6am flight out of BTV because of the distance we were from the airport and how difficult and costly it is to arrange transportation at that hour as well as what a cluster it is at the airport at that time.  I believe that numerous people missed their flight from BTV to ORD
Disappointed that are like luggage was left in Chicago.  Did not get it for 36 hours.  This caused us much stress because we were in Mexico for our sons wedding.  No urgency on United's part.

We asked the stewardess what time we would arrive. She was extremely rude. She said “do you have a device ?”  I didn’t know what she was talking about. She kept repeating that same question at least three times in a rude way. Needless to say the girl next to me said that her phone wouldn’t connect to the app. We asked a very simple question that could have been answered quite easily. She just walked off and wouldn’t tell us. It was bizarre to say the least.  Also, when the plane landed the girl sitting next to me got up to get her items and the young man that sat across from her pushed her and she fell. He said he did it on purpose because she was in his way. This was an assault. The girl was really shaken. I told the steward and they said there was nothing they could do   That is outrageous, this was an actual assault.  Honestly I’ve flown every where in the world. This ranks as the worst flight I’ve ever been on !   I would never recommend United to anyone. By the way, I told other people what had happened and they weren’t surprised, they all said UnitedAirlines is horrible.  The pilots of the plane, 2 women, got off the plane when I did. I told them what happened  and they weren’t surprised about the stewardess that was rude. They had heard that before about her. The pilots were excellent and very professional.  It was the cabin crew that was horrible.  Not to do anything about an assault and being rude to your patrons is unacceptable. The description of the rude stewardess : older, heavy set, short grey hair.  The steward was a male , dark hair.  Hopefully you will read this and and do something
The flight attendants were so rude to one person. The person asked if she could throw some garbage away and the flight attendant made fun of her!  It was incredibly unprofessional.

There was zero communication until the last moment. The flight was initially delayed. Then continually delayed and we were kept in the dark about what was happening. Once we got a new plane for the trip we had to wait for catering. Then we boarded and sat on the tar mat for 3 hours because of another maintenance issue. We were advised we had to deplane, then were abruptly told to stay put. No reason why or advising of what was going on by the captain or the crew. Once the issue was solved the plane sat parked for well over an hour because of the paper work delay. I completely understand there are lots of working parts and regulations and safety that need to be considered. I appreciate that. However, the process was never communicated to the patrons. We sat on the plane for 2 hours (after being delayed for over 3 hours) and didn't understand what was going on or why until the very last moment. The whole process was unprofessional. And after everything nothing was said or done to acknowledge the inconvenience. I'm not looking for free flights, flight credit, free food or booze. I was just looking for an acknowledgement from the staff that we waiting over 5 hours and that they were, on behalf of United, sorry. We got nothing.
The seat was so uncomfortable- very little legroom
Cabin was extremely cold upon entering.   With outside temperature -8degrees this is expected, but was not comfortable until quite a while into flight.
These new seats are extremely uncomfortable making trying to sleep painful and difficult.
Food was very bad. I expected much better quality on Polaris. The club at Newark is awful. Poor service, very bad food.
See description of delay because of other plane’s mechanical problems in previous section.
one cranky stewardess; horrible food; COLD (!) red wine.

I was fuming that the security personnel at CDG wouldn't let me supervise my $5000 watch go through X-rays so that it doesn't get stolen as they insisted I removed it from my wrist. I've had items stolen in the past at airport security checkpoints and I don't understand why they made a big deal that I wanted to let other passengers go ahead of me while I ensured no one touched my belongings on the trays before they entered the X-ray machine. Instead they forced me to abandon my things, conducted additional searches as obviously I was a "dangerous" person for not wanting my $5000 watch to get stolen... I understand this isn't related to United. UA personnel at the gate yelled at me as well though when I showed up for boarding when they called "Group 1" although I am Platinum and Group 1. Flight was missing a couple of flight attendants. This happen. One of your employee who wasn't on work schedule volunteered to help out his colleagues. That was nice. Your replacement of a lunch meal by a mediocre breakfast on your UA56 which I fly regularly may be a nice cost saving measure but isn't great v. the service / food I can get on AF.
Flight crew was late, not a good start to the new year, first flight and a delay...

CRJ200 is a miserable aircraft.  Would prefer the ERJ 135/145 to the CRJ200.  Seat space, even in the comfort zone is terrible and I am not a fat person.  I am tall and sit jammed in against the bulkhead.  I will take an extra 2 or 3 legs of travel just to avoid this aircraft.
One of the flight attendants was quite rude to my son

We once again tried to use club passes but couldn’t because the club was under renovation and the temporary club was too small so the passes would not let us in.  These passes have been more trouble than they are worth!  Starts the travel off on the wrong foot. Don’t give them if I can’t use them!!!

Flying first class on morning flight & breakfast not eaten because not all food available no choices. Very disappointing as I’ve been finding a lot of disappointments on many of my recents United flughts

I was traveling with 3 children and they removed our seat assignment without emailing us and were very rude when we requested to be put back together. I can’t imagine trusting United with standing up to seating assignments as this is now the second time this has happened without a warning. What’s the point of reserving seats or stating that we are traveling with small children???
The flight was very good but the delay  hard to understand. To blame on low temperature it sounds ridiculous.
food quality poor, nothing warm for breakfast

United needs to get rid of the ERJ jet, we were boarded onto the plane then the pilot noticed by walking outside that the nose gear was too low.  Then everyone got off and they "recharged" the shock absorber.  Then we were held because the push machine battery died.  I would agree that things were cold however, I never was off loaded from a plane because the shocks were low.  THE ERJ kills the customer satisfaction for your customers

Overall, I have never been more disappointed with United and issues surrounding my travel intended to be a 50th anniversary celebration for my family.  About a week prior to departure, United released all of the seats for the males in my group who have the same name, but who I carefully documented passport numbers and Sr, Jr and III classification.  It took several agents to resolve and no one was able to explain who authorized the change in my record and said it should never have occurred.  I used close to 1 million mikes for this trip and expect better service.  Had I not been diligent about checking my reservation, they would have had no seat assignments prior to arrival and this took me several days and hours to resolve.  Upon returning from Rome, one of my bags which was supposed to have priority handling did not arrive.  An agent called to confirm that my bag was on flight 41 on Wednesday, Jan 3 and would be delivered to my home.  I received a call late in the evening indicating the bag did not arrive and would not be delivered.  I have talked to several agents at the priority baggage desk since that time and no one can confirm where the bag is because the tag had been scanned previously.  This has been a major inconvenience especially to my mother who is not a frequent traveler and is highly dependent on the contents of her bag to work.  Again, one of the worst experiences and so unfortunate it was associated with a milestone event for my family.

The food and the food service were  below par, disappointing.  The food was really bad. I had the chicken with rice and asparagus.  The chicken was overcooked and dry.  The asparagus were mushy.  The flight attendant  (a lady on the left side of the aircraft in the Polaris section)was not very attentive. For instance, she never came for a second drink service before serving the main meal.

This is regarding my flight on UA 86 (Newark to Shanghai, Jan. 2, 2018).  After sleeping for 7 hours, I awoke to a dark cabin and wanted a cup of coffee. I pressed the call button -- the small chime sounded and the call light above my seat went on. I waited and waited.  No one came.  I switched it off and then pressed it again -- the small chime sounded and the call light above my seat went on. Again, I waited and no one came.  I repeated this action and waited and waited... EIGHT TIMES.    Seated in 8L, I could actually SEE the flight attendant in the Galley, IGNORING the call indicator light on the ceiling.  As a UA Million Miler and current Platinum Mileage Plus member, I want you to know that I fly this route OFTEN and this is NOT a unique occurrence on United's flights. It happens ALL THE TIME.  Your cabin staff seems to feel it is beneath them to respond to a call button and provide any kind of service, even to a passenger traveling in your so-called "premium" BusinessFirst cabin.  To your lazy and overpriveleged cabin crew, I have only one question: If you resent the passenger call button, what are you doing working in a service industry? AND What if a passenger is experiencing chest pains or some other form of distress?  Are they expected to CRAWL to the galley area for help?  I've flown United for DECADES and I'm sad to say that NO AMOUNT of comfortable Polaris bedding or gleaming new Polaris Lounges will compensate for the passenger being ignored and resented.  Finally, as an American, I am ashamed at the shoddy level of service provided by American employees at (what should be) a "legacy" American carrier. Where is your PRIDE?

We were waiting for almost 40 minutes before we took off and they didn’t let us know what was going on. So that was more of an annoyance than anything else. Also estimated land time said 1:07 even with the delay but we actually didn’t land until like 1:35 and we racing to the gate for a bit after that. Now, I know that’s apart of travel but when ppl are scheduling rides for you the estimated arrival time should be correct.

The flight was over an hour late taking off.  We were told it was because of baggage handling problems.  They said they were short on baggage handlers due to the holiday.  They also said bags were put on the plane that shouldn't have been put on.  Both of these reasons were not acceptable and fully within the control of the airline.  Very disappointing.
