We kept getting different reasons for the delay - replace windshield wiper, mechanical problems, board in 20 minutes - and finally a plane change. This was after an hour delay getting from SGF to ORD which turned out to be moot since the ORD to RAP flight was delayed anyway.

yes the check in counter for global services was a nightmare!! there were two people checking in a very long line.  To be honest they were incompetent and didn't know what they were doing- the manager was checking in other people at the kiosk- really it was inefficient and a disaster.  Not to mention it took so long that we had no time to shop grab a coffee etc- we had to go straight to boarding.  As a long time United flyer this trip was very very disappointing!!!

All passengers were lined up for boarding, which was to begin at 9:30AM CST. We were informed at 9:24AM CST that our flight would be delayed 2.5 hours. It is incredibly frustrating to be informed so late, not be told the reason for the delay, or be offered any assistance for flight adjustments or further connections.

It was ridiculous that there was a 2.5 hour delay where we were told to move gates across different concourses/terminals twice.  When we moved the first time, the desk agents were very rude when asked to verify that we were at the new correct gate and then left so we could not ask any more questions.  Then, we just happened to get lucky that someone came back early and told us that we were moving gates again and, while our flight delay was decreased and that was good, we then had very little time to get to the new gate.

Passport control in Lisbon was 1 hour long.  Despite of United Airlines Priority printed on UA Boarding Passes personnel of TAP (Star Alliance partner) had refused to allowed us to proceed  to fast track.  Only TAP passengers had got OK.  Not United Airlines.  Very disappointing

The seats space is toooo small. I had two large men sitting next to me. I could not sit back in my chair comfortably I was resting on the other mans shoulder and jammed into the window space. I finally had to turn my body towards the window  but keep facing forward. I twisted my neck muscles and had neck muscle spasms most of last night. I tried to get aisle seats but none were available. It is terrible

I was extremely disappointed with the excessive delay and expected much more from United. I am unsure if I will fly them again given my flight was delayed over two hours and we spent an entire hour on the side of the runway.

I will not be flying United on this route. Whatever United Express carrier you are using is a disaster. Poor maintenance, filthy planes, and broken seats. I was delayed over 6 hours. I believe I am entitled to compensation.

Was not notified that flight was delayed before I got up at 4:30 am. Mechanical failure and then flight cancelled. No help rebooking on later flight which itself was delayed, meaning that I arrived in Beward6 hours late, missed two appointments

The flight was 1/2 hr late leaving Greensboro. I reached the gate for my connecting flight 2 minutes before boarding closed. Very stressful. I ran to the gate. I am 75 so it wasn’t helpful to be late.
It took off on time and landed early. Flight was smooth with no problems.

We ended up taking off 30-40 minutes late after leaving the gate.  It wasn't really clear why we had to experience such a delay.  For those passengers that had connections in Chicago, it created a lot of frustration.  For those of us that were only traveling to Chicago, it was slight inconvenience.  Some more clear communication on why we had to be delayed so much would have been nice.
Los aviones deberían tener pantallas para uno entretenerse sin recurrir a nuestros dispositivos móviles
We find the seats to be very uncomfortable.  Bad for people with back problems.  Someone needs to design a seat that offers back support and foot rests.
The initial purchase and seat selection was horrible.

The reason I was dissatisfied with our flight from Madison to Chicago was because we sat on the Chicago tarmac for over an hour because they did not have a gate for us even though there were many gates opened for a united aircraft to go to. Many people were missing a connecting flight and we had just made our connecting flight just in time to board. This was unacceptable that we were on the plane for an extra hour because they couldn’t find a gate to put us and as I stated before there were many open gates. I am truly dissatisfied.
1st class lunch was very poor

con # A77QPD Dec 20 UA 241 seats12C ,12D, we missed then flight with UA 1263 seat 38B 38A not happy and luggage arrived two flight in front of our arrival that is not safe for the travellers.  on Jan 2 we booked  UA 278  A77QPD with seats 10C 10D, end up with taking seat 37B,37C with con # A77QPD and AL3FZJ  separately and  paid $25 for first checked luggage  very unhappy with UNITED ,
Pilot inconsistency on speed! Descending way to fast making many passenger complain of ear pressure pain.

The flight was delayed by more than 2 hours and we did not get correct updates on why the flight did not take off at the scheduled time. Also after the flight arrived on Terminal 2 in Chicago no one on the plane was able to guide us as to where our baggage could be picked up...Please let your flight attendants announce that when the UA flight lands at a different terminal than Terminal one. It is very confusing as O'hare is a big airport and it is frustrating for passengers to walk from one place to another in search of their checked in baggage..

You dont find a solution to any of the severels problem we have with your airline. We trip a lot and we never in the life found so unkind emploies . Im realy disapointed to have taken a ticket with you

Both my wife and I are Mileage Plus Members and loyal customers. As such, I expect more than the average traveler. We were on the list for First Class seating, and as usual didn't measure up in the eyes of United; a crowded flight so probably to be expected. However, while attempting to check our bags United attempted to charge my wife a $25 check bag Fee in spite of her UMP status. We had to go to a alternate line (six customers deep) to latterly plea and prove our case. After being told three times how wrong we were, we finally established our duel UMP status and received the rightfully earned checked baggage allowance. It seems that by adding our names to the First Class Upgrade "Crap Shoot" (A $150 add'l bet) allowed United to bifurcate our reservations and place us on separate reservations in spite of both UMP #'s on the reservations. Bad bad process and experience.
flight was fine. I detest Newark Airport though and will avoid using it whenever possible. The restaurant experiences are horrible there. The signage is inadequate making everything worse.

I thought one of the male flight attendants was a bit rude.  He stuck his big stomach into my face while letting a someone pass in the aisle, he elbowed me once, and ignored me several times when I tried to hand him garbage when he was passing by.  Also during meals and drink service he tended to overlook me.  I don’t know, I could’ve just been my imagination, but getting elbowed before even taking off and then the belly on my face 5 minutes later kind enough set a bad tone.  I think others noticed this too, of course I didn’t say anything.  I didn’t want him mad at me for the rest of the flight.  He was wearing a full suit uniform so I think he might’ve been a supervisor.  Maybe he wasn’t feeling well, I don’t like to make anyone’s life more miserable, and being in the service industry is very demanding.  Bless him...

I've flown this flight many times, it is always understaffed, the food is subpar and there are not enough snacks throughout the flight-- not even available for purchase. The aircraft itself felt more shaky and flimsy than any other plane I've been on through areas of turbulence. The seats were extremely uncomfortable.
To long of a delay . The delay was almost as long as the flight.
Changed gate #'s several times, confusing unless you watch caarefully. The Big Board was wrong.

Pre boarding of wheelchair occupants should include 1 family member - not 8-10 family members ranging from 10 to 40. I was in window seat. Middle seat was sold to a mad 7 feet tall and who weighed at least 350 lbs.  He was enormous and should have been in 2 seats!  Ruined my flight!

My bag was not on the plane due to curbside staff that stand under the UNITED sign but are not united employees.  My bag arrive a few hours after my flight.  It was supposed to be delivered within a day and now it is 4 days later and I STILL do not have my bag.  They keep saying they have over 400 bags.  They've said this since Tuesday.  Did you not hire the right company or enough people at the company?  I'm incredibly disappointed.

My bag was 2 pounds over, as someone who is struggling with a shoulder injury i was unable to move anything to my personal carry- on. Your $100 overweight bag fee is INSANE. Because of that i will NEVER book with United again.
The flight attendants were rude and their uniform looked very unappealing, no one looked put together.  The man flight attendant was a bit flirtous that made me and the attendant quite uncomfortable

WiFi: I used miles for wifi during the flight.  It worked but was extremely slow.  There were a number of web pages that I had to wait multiple minutes for them to cycle (not streaming, just doing basic searches).  Also, at the end of the 2 hours, I realized that I had 22 emails stuck in the outbox that.  Understandable to have slow wifi when it's free, but not acceptable when I'm paying for it. RE Chicago Baggage Claim area:  the women's restroom was one of the worst restrooms that I have used in a very long time.  The smell was awful - some women waiting in line were using scarfs to cover their nose/mouth.  Also, only 3 stalls at a restroom location like this???  I waited in line for over 10 minutes - my husband had time to use the bathroom, plus collect all 4 of our bags from the claim before I was done.
terrible entertainment screen on 767, also terrible choices.
Smallest legroom I've ever seen. Ridiculously uncomfortable, and there was used gum on the wall. A disgusting plane.
Seat space in economy very poor unless you paid for economy plus, no plug ins for charging does not compare with jet blue or Alaska air I travel 4x per year to seattle
the bathrooms were not clean at all. the seats and the seat trays were quite dirty.
Food was horrible, disgraceful.  Barely edible.
My bag a t-shirt, and underwear were shredded somehow and completely destroyed.

Should NOT have to pay $150.00 for one extra bag on 2 first class tickets from a ski resort city...You are gauging your paying customers! Baggage VERY SLOW retrieving in Chicago Flight attendant had a negative attitude!

When checking in at the kiosk prior to security I required a United representative's assistance. I am a Mileage Plus Primary Card Member and even when I buy a basic Economy Fair I can still take on my full size carry-on bag. I attempted to have a United representative clear this for me at the kiosk and she was INCREDIBLY rude to me. Yelling at me and telling me that I was wrong even though I had called united the day prior to clarify and I also had the message on my phone app that said if you are a mileage plus primary card member you can still bring the carry-on bag. She embarrassed me in front of other customers and when I asked for assistance and to speak with another agent she just pointed at someone 25 feet away and then walked away. She didn't apologize and was very rude. I was very upset with this experience. It makes me not want to fly united. The second agent immediately cleared me and helped me to print my boarding pass. I mentioned that this woman had been incredibly rude, but we couldn't find her at the time and I needed to leave for my flight. It was a VERY upsetting experience.

Your customer service and how you run your business is shameful!  To be treated the way I was because of your problems is terrible.  I don't have this problem on delta or Hawaiian airlines, which i will fly from now on.

I usually sit on the aisle, and in these newer planes, there is an unfair amount of space under the seat in front of you.  The window has tons of space for their carry on, the middle seat has some, and the aisle gets the smallest and then in addition has the entertainment box, so my tiny backpack couldn't even fit!  This has gotten worse over the years, and I don't understand why the 2 boxes can't go under the center and window, if they are going to have the most space there instead of the aisle where there's barely any space to begin with.
Very shocking experience. The in-flight crew was the worst I’ve ever experienced.

The oversized luggage pick up area at Newark is the WORST and most inefficient that I've experience at any airport.  Furthermore, you need to add a water bottle refill units in terminal C (e.g., Elkay ezh20) - get with it, United. Even the Bozeman Airport (with only 8 gates) has one. Additionally, you don't have charging ports at each seat. Don't offer private entertainment on my personal device and not offer charging. Short sighted and stupid decision making.
Delays ruin your business.
The aircraft felt tired.  The seats were not comfortable for a family long flight.
Very rude flight attendants
Awful economy seats with hardly any space. Can’t imagine why streaming is free on some flights and we are required to pay for direct tv on others. Very unfair

The flight attendant had on so much cologne it caused a health problem for me.  I was in the first class cabin and he was in the aisle doing his job but it meant I was exposed to the excessive cologne for a period of almost four hours.  I had a serious migraine and broke out in hives.  Please, please ask your flight attendants not to wear scented products.  For people who get migraines, have chemical sensitivity or asthma, the presence of the products in a small, confined space can cause serious health problems that can last days.  It should be company policy.
the airplanes need to have phone chargers. they are not technology friendly and lack greatly in this department

As we sat in our seats there were several people in Economy Plus that changed seats on there own. The gate agent asked everyone to go back to their original seats. The woman on the isle two seats in front of me (her assigned seat) was trying to sit back in her seat but there was a woman and a child in the isle and center (they had 2 center seats) the flight attendant told the woman that was suppose to be in the isle to go sit in the center seat because the child was young. The woman in the isle did but was not happy. I am hoping the flight attendance did something for her after she went back to talk to them after the seat belt sign went off. She did return to the center seat.

baggage handling at Newark was unacceptable. First two of our bags with priority tags came out some time after bags without priority tags started to be delivered to the carousel. Our last bag (also with a priority tag) arrived at the carousel  a full hour and a half after we landed ! With two young children at this hour of the evening after a long flight this was totally unacceptable and made our trip home a nightmare.
United is the worst run and most unfriendly. Learn from Delta, Jetblue. Get TVs

Apparently I was a know show but the scary thing is that I was on that flight.  I flew with my 8 year old daughter and husband to Visit family.  We took the flight I booked (we were all on the same reservation) and went through all the check points as usual to board a flight.  When I went to check in online the night before our return flight I noticed I was no longer listed on the reservation which was on my mileage plus account.  I called customer service and they said I was marked as a no show.  I have my boarding pass and again went through all the normal check points.  Now I have to take extra steps to get on a flight I was supposed to be on but let’s talk about the bigger issue.  The fact that I was on one of your flights and you guys didn’t even know it.  Also, why didn’t I get any notification from United asking me why I didn’t make that flight or if I still needed the return flight or at least to contact customer service.  These are big problems.

The food in First Class was inedible.  The beef was tough (I couldn't chew it), the bread was stale and hard, and the breakfast omelette & sausage was disgusting.  This is the worst experience that I have ever had in First/Business.   Even though I have been a 1K for years and years, I am considering switching to a different airline.
The food was the worst I ever had in business much less first class. Very disappointing.  Have had much better experiences overall on AA to China. I am a United fan. Was very unhappy.

We have flown business class in  no less than 8 or 10 other airlines.  Of them all, United is the worst!  The plaes or outdated, the seating is outdated, there was on entertainment system on the Fligh #1553 on Dec 26 ( Newark to San Jose Costa Rica), the food on  #1553 was barely edible ( we would have been better served if you gave us McDonalds Egg macmuffins), and on flight  #1081 ( Costa Rica to Newark) the food was just awful and there was a shortage of food in the business class menu.  We ate sandwiches from the coach service.    So, In short, we only fly United when there is no other option.  I suppose I will never hear from you, and this criticism will fall on deaf ears.

Our flights were delayed going to our vacation destination and returning. On the flight back to Chicago, the young male flight attendent was rude to several passengers telling them to sit down or else the flight will be delayed. The plane wasn’t even close to taking off at the point and the passengers were simply trying to find their correct seats.

The flight boarding and departure were delayed with little to no communication on the reason for the delay or anticipated boarding departure time given at the gate. Your online status also was not updated from "On Time" until after boarding had begun.
My dissatisfaction stems from an unexplained over half hour delay of arrival.

Chicago was the problem – the gate changed, and no one walked  The few steps from the final gate to the cancelled gate to make a clear, loud, verbal announcement. Never heard it on the  overhead, almost missed my flight, and had two  rude united women at my final gate

I booked my flight through Expedia. I did not realize until after I had booked that I would be flying Basic Economy. I think Basic Economy is awful. I never travel with large carry-ons and almost always put my carry-ons under the sea. I was forced to cram my handbag into a small carry-on bag to comply with your rules, when both the handbag and carry-on could have fit under the sea. My daughter could not bring both her computer bag and backpack, which she always travels with. This was hugely inconvenient.

The baggage delivery process was the worst I've ever experienced in 20+ years of flying for business and personal travel.  As a priority customer, I still waited 45 minutes for my bags to be delivered to the carousel, and then one of my bags was delivered to the oversized carousel despite being normal size and weight (and in fact smaller than two of the other bags with which I was traveling).   I was traveling with two young children and it made a very sour end to our vacation.  As a long-time customer, I'm completely disappointed in the experience.
So tired of being “nickeled and dimed” by your airline. We couldn’t even access our flight path without a credit card!
I am a small person and was seated next to a large man. I was so cramped my neck ached all night after the flight. Your seats in coach are way too small to accomodate tall or overweight people.
We were delay from an inbound aircraft and air traffic. We sat on the aircraft for 55 minutes until we were able to take off. Very frustrating.

The aircraft was dirty. The flight was extremely delayed and there was no clarity on the reasons. The flight was held up because 4 passengers boarded late, they should have been put up on the next flight.

You destroyed my ruggedized plastic/metal guitar case and refused to replace it. It was shattered in multiple locations and the metal band was bent. It appears to have been thrown very hard. Your customer service agent never even apologized, had no comment on whether this meets your standards for customer service, and simply repeated that you weren't liable. Your customers trust you with their lives. My baggage was destroyed in a way that is not just negligent; it appears *intentional*. If you do not make this right, I will never fly with you again.

although the flight is only 3,5 hours, we were in Premium Economy...the whole aircraft did not have free entertainment or wifi allowing personal device entertainment...it did on the way over...in this era, all flights should have this service....

The seats are really too small and close together.  For flights in excess of 3 hours, the human body needs more space.  The average American CANNOT be comfortable in such tight spaces and as we age, the inability to move is dangerous in terms of blood clots.
I Know its not your fault but the man next to me snoring was very unpleasant:(

I'm tired of dealays due to Chicago. I checked before I left my house and it was on time. Then it was delayed 3 times and I almost missed my connection in Chicago, which was also delayed. Very disappointing!

3 hour delay is not acceptable with no real explanation why. And just about every flight I take on United recently experienced some sort of delay. It’s disheartening. Will start looking into other airlines at this point.

The baggage experience was a nightmare and clearly no baggage handler realizes what a priority tag it.  About 15 of us waited over an hour and a half and the signage indicated that Jackson Hole flights baggage was all delivered.   So we lined up a lost baggage for at least 15 more minutes and then the remaining bags were delivered.  The service was very poor and highly frustrating.  I was charged double for my car service home because of their excessive wait time and would hope that Unit d reimburse me for the expense of and extra $45.

Sat in business class. Served ridiculous bagged snacks. Flight attendants offered drinks and snacks only once then just sat in the first class cabin talking to each other. Never came out to see if anyone wanted anything else. Seemed annoyed when people asked for drinks. Absolutely ridiculous service after paying so much for a first class seat. Very disappointed.

I was disappointed that we were told we had purchased a basic flight for almost $800.00, and we had no recourse to fly standby without paying another $250.00, and that didn't even guarantee us a seat on an earlier flight.  We thought we purchased an A.M. flight, to realize we were on a P.M. flight.  This was so upsetting to us as we had tickets to a matinee show that we missed, not to mention cutting our trip a day short.  Yes, it was our fault, but, a mistake that could have simply been rectified due to the fact that the morning flight, at the time we realized this, was wide open.  Unfortunately, Chicago had bad weather and the cancellation of flights the day before created a situation that caused the morning flight to become full.  I was very glad I didn't pay to upgrade our tickets, and than find out we would have never gotten on this flight anyway.  This policy is dispicable and feels like you are gauging your passengers, and we will  use your airlines only if everything else fails in getting flights from other airlines.  To think that a seat to San Antonio is not a full fair ticket at the price we paid, was more than disappointing.  The fact that you wouldn't do everything possible to change a ticket whenever possible is very disappointing.  We all make mistakes, this was one that could have been corrected very easily to make two passengers happy.
Too many dogs on the plane which is a ridiculous policy We waited 1,5 hours for beverage service as we sat in seat 38B.  The seat was horrible..
O’Hare is horrible to leave from. Have never left on time from this hub.
Very dissatisfied with lack of TV screens and the losing of WiFi.  Also, if you purchase a Business Class ticket you should not run out of food.
There was over a 2 hour delay and we were offered nothing in return for the inconvenience. I only had a few hours for a meeting and was not able to attend .

The baggage claim in LA was ridiculous. There were 2 flights for the baggage claim and for some reason nobody was picking them up. So with your automatic luggage system, no new bags could come out. We waited 50 minutes to get our luggage! Absolutely ridiculous!!! And no attendant was around to help the situation.

This was the worst flight I've been on in a long time...and I've been flying since I was a child, and am now 59.  As soon as I sat down, I called over a stewardess to show her how filthy my area was!  It looked like there had been a toddler in the seat before me, with food smeared all over, and crumbs on the seat and the floor.  The pocket in front of me was torn, and the brochures in the pockets in front of me and my son looked like they've been in use for years.  I wouldn't let him touch anything.  I couldn't sleep, or sit back because I didn't want to touch anything...and this was a 5 hour flight.  The stewardess told me they had even called the cleaning people back on board, and took photos of the inside of the cabin, because it was so disgusting.  The cleaners refused to do anything, because "they didn't want the flight to be any later than it was".  You should be ashamed of yourselves having customers sit in such disgusting, trashy surroundings!!  I was shocked that United allowed this to be this way.  My ten year old son was made to feel uncomfortable as well...as I wouldn't let him touch anything!

Our original flight was delayed but we were never sent any notification so arrived to find it changed without our notice. Therefore we misssd our next flight and had to reschedule on a much later connecting flight. There were no weather issues in Syracuse so we were very frustrated with this change with no notification. We sat in Newark airport almost 5 hours.
Newark checkin personnel were rude and not very helpful at all

We had several delays.  Not all of them were within your control but overall we were an hour+ late.  (1. Two medical incidents on the inbound flight used up all the portable oxygen containers.  So we had to wait for another inbound flight to 'borrow' theirs.  Seems odd that you didn't have any spares at the airport.  2.  We had to be towed in to our arrival gate, which caused a further delay 3.  We had to wait for someone from the port authority to move operate the jet bridge, which caused yet another delay).

I wasn’t happy with the flights because 1) 45 minute delay before take-off due to lack of safety equipment available to be able to take-off 2) EWR flight control get us from de-planing for ~15-20 minutes due to a change in arrival gate then lack of jet-bridge personnel. We ended up over an hour delayed by the end of it.

We were flying for 34 hours from Asia when we landed for our last leg back to DC in Chicago. We were at our gate and the gate agent said we were going to be late b/c we were waiting on a crew and that crew was in the B Terminal (flying in).   They then came on and switched us from F to B which is a good walk b/c the crew is closer to that gate and it would speed it up.  After sitting at B gate for 20 minutes we were told the aircraft had a mechanical issue and that was known and it could not fly.   They then cancelled the flight 20 minutes later.  When asked why we couldn't go back to our original gate and plane, we were told that that plane was now reallocated to another flight.  I then had to rebook for 5 hours later into Baltimore which is an hour from my house vs 20 minutes.  It cost the 8 of us 180 dollars to Uber home.   You all made terrible decisions without checking on the status of the plane which created a terrible experience for my family and cost us real money.   Get your act together when you are moving 180 people to accommodate 5 flight personnel.   Awful

fine even with delay although information could of been consistent, at times the boards at O'hare were out of sync with your android application.  Even with gate change and then canceled gate change.  Could of provided more information on why delay happened, really didn't find out until pilot informed us on plane what delay was about.

The food options were horrendous.  I had a noodle salad with side of beef and it was so stale, cold and completely off putting.  The wine selections for first class are “last class” quality and the fact that the airline had one restroom inoperable with a packed flight made for an extremely tense and unpleasant experience - passengers were being held up to use the restroom waiting in long lines.  The attitude of both flight attendants in first class were also unwelcoming, not friendly and were both fairly flippant in their remarks.

Yes my baggage was lost on the departing flight to Seattle, and my turbo wireless headphones were missing from my bag. Both flights were delayed. No wheel chair assistance for the second time once at Ohara. I feel I derserve an upgrade as as disable person I had no help with my bags once getting to the airport and the baggage claim clerk saw I was disabled and would not even help me put the bags on my cart. Cart driver drove me to the baggage claim and told me no wheel chair help for you. I deserve a first class upgrade for this bad experience.

We left for the airport ahead of our flight because the app said we were on time and our place had left for SFO and was scheduled on time as well.  When we got to the airport, our flight was delayed 2.5 hours because of a late inbound plane.  However, the inbound plane was actually on time according to its schedule.  So they took our plane and used it for another flight making us late in the process.  This is ridiculous and unacceptable as we had to sit in the airport for 4 hours when this clearly was known we were alerted.  What good are notifications and the "where is this plane coming from?" information if they are going to be changed this dramatically 2 hours before the flight?  No other flights from SFO to Newark were delayed and another plane took off before us which could have had only an hour delay instead of our 2.5 hour delay.
Wi-Fi experience was poor. Your app doesn't work with my phone, my internet connection was slow and spotty. I barely got anything done due to poor connectivity.
Equipment problems made flight an hour late. Gate computer had problems accepting infant boarding passes, holding everyone up. Very stressful when connecting through O’hare

I made a pre-booking and ended up paying higher price for my ticket.   Later due to flight delay, my rental car pick up reservation has been cancelled. Where I again ended up paying higher price for rental car.  This is a quite unfortunate experience which I haven't expected from united airlines.   Even my next flight has been delayed.   I am frustrated at the moment.

There was a nasty old woman who was the flight attendant. She kept harassing me in particular about every little thing. I noticed I was the only she constantly harassed about my phone being plugged into the outlet band where my bag was. She tried to harass a man about his bag, but he pushed back and she stopped. She was a vicious mean old woman and should not be a flight attendant.  Someday, someone is not going to tolerate her bullying, and you will have an incident.
typical, normal flight. Disappointing ending after landing.  No estimated time of reality to dock  - - just a first 5 minute estimate after landing that turned into 35 minutes.
This is the second flight the flight attendants haven't been the friendliest. Probably will not fly united again.
We were delayed and almost missed our connection.  Fortunately, our connection was also delayed so we made the flight.

The flight from Newark to Cancun was ridiculous - delayed almost two hours for what the pilot said was a non-necessary, non-safety related and cosmetic-only interior repair that clearly should have been done at a later time.  Crazily outrageous.

The flight attendants were the rudest and most surly buch ever. From the woman who got on the intercom and sounded like she could NOT wait to be done w us morons to the woman who threw a cup of water toward my 5 year old son and the woman who couldn’t stop yammering w her colleagues to allow me to step out of the bathroom. That crew was the worst. The drink service lady said “you know you have to pay for that” when I ordered a drink. Yah. This wasn’t my first rodeo. And then when my husband told her he was 1k, she totally brightened like only THEN could she be bothered to be pleasant. I would take another flight to avoid those horrid women.

Check-in was brutal. 2 attendants for premiere, 1 attendant for everyone else! Unacceptable.  Kudos for clearly identifying boarding group lines on EWR-HAV. Not so good on HAV-EWR. (Is 3-4-5 one line or three?)  A disorganized, inefficient (and unnecessary!) process for checking carry-on bags. (There was still plenty of room in the overhead bins when we boarded.) Plus, you should mention that the bags will go to baggage claim.  Flight attendants were grumpier than usual. This is seldom the case.   And why even bother with those little bags of pretzels?

the wichita gate, although the information was posted on the gate board, staff did not show until after the flight was scheduled to leave.  Many people did not have resources to change their flight and the gate agents were less than helpful with changes.  Telling one passenger she would have to contact the airlines ( Air Canada) regarding her connecting flight when she purchased the ticket from Canada.   The male agent was dismissive to her but very helpful to another male passenger.     This is the second time within two weeks this same flight was delayed in Wichita which caused problems and rebookng for connecting flights.   And the reason we were told was weather, " not our fault, nor will you be accommodated in Chicago if you miss your flight"   This gate attendants were not gracious.   I realize this delay was beyond their control, however, we understood that and I felt they were very unsympathetic and the demeanor of the male agent was most disappointing.

The check in and gate experience at punt Cana was very slow and extremely disorganized. There was no sense of urgency to assist customers, there was poor communication ( and I speak Spanish) and customers stood in extraordinary mixed and long unprioritized lines. I always fly United and this was by far the worst representation and airport experience in Punta Cana. Needs supervisor oversight and leadership.. terrible.

I am a Premier Silver member and each and every time I fly United our luggage suffers damage. Each and every time. This doesn’t happen at other airlines with this frequency or extent of damage.  Also, there is no reason to have the cabin temperature so high that it takes several passengers to continually complain about the heat before someone adjusts the temperature. We pay way to high a price for airfare for this kind of service and luggage issues.
Unnecessary delay of 1 hr due to poor logistics.
1 announcer was made that hat flt was delayed. The aircraft intended for our flight was used for another flight . I heard 1 announcement in the 3.5 hrs I sat at A26A . Not good !
I was disappointed the flight was delayed for almost an hour.

The food is terrible, it got worse even from last year in my opinion. I travel often and all of the other airlines have better food, I couldn't even eat one of the hot meals at all. Also where did a side salad/cheese and dessert disappear from the main serving plate?
Rude customer service. Rude flight att.

The flight crew had very little interaction with the passengers. There was literally one announcement that lasted a total of 15 seconds. No seat belt sign, no welcome on board, no we are in turbulence. The aircraft interior was dirty and tired. At least run a rag over the interior from time to time.

My bag did not make the connection, but I did. I don't see how that was possible considering I had a layover in Denver, with time to spare. My bag did not make it to Newark until almost 4 hours after I landed, and this is unacceptable.

The attendants were nice, but appeared over worked. The food choices in first class were not diverse, were served cold. The seats were not comfortable,  not too much leg room, and bathroom was a mess. Luggage at Newark took over an hour to retrieve.  It was not a pleasant travel experience,  which is unusual for United.
We have two million miles on American and thought we’d try United but you are actually worse.     Soon the legroom you reconfigured again will not you to even sit down.    And I am thin

I loved everything about the fight.  My only complaint is that the floor seemed "not clean". I can't say it was dirty, but I had a window seat & the area on the floor to my left seemed full of crumbs, and who knows what..I'm sure it's difficult to clean, but still, I kinda of felt that if something fell I that area, I just couldn't pick it up for fear it would be contaminated...

very difficult getting a beverage on the flight.  I had to keep asking for water. luggage was very delayed.  came on two different carousels- one not marked.  most regular luggage came off before priority luggage.

The Newark airport was a nightmare in terms of overcrowding. This overcrowding was not due to holiday travel, but poor terminal design. For example, a flight boarding for Hong Kong took up 1/2 the main aisle as there was no other space for the passengers to line up to board. This overcrowding was very very difficult while traveling with a baby in a stroller.

On my last couple of flights flying Economy Plus, including my flight on 12/22/17, I received not only a complimentary meal, but also complimentary alcoholic beverages.  I was surprised on this flight that although I received a complimentary meal, I was charged for a glass of wine.  This inconsistency is puzzling.

what is happening with airlines and baggage and carry-ons? pay for baggage? and this flight specifically said "no carry-ons". not only were there *lots* of carry-ons, there was lots of room left over for mine. so my extra fee for my carry on was completely unnecessary.  this is very aggravating and unfriendly.   the people doing gate boarding even stated "those in group 5 cannot have as much carry on as those in other groups." really? with all that extra room in the overheads?  please tell me you can stop the madness.
Our flight was delayed. The food in the plane was awful and our baggage arrived very late!
I flew first class and really was disappointed the service was fair and then food was fair I found nothing special about the service I have flown before and things were much more special
United’s app is disappointing. It doesn’t update in real time and I almost missed my flight due to delayed updates about a changed date.
Delayed, hot, cramped, not enjoyable.
Check in desk staff and TSA security were extremely rude and unhelpful. Boarderline mean. They were a huge negative experience for me and my family.

I was charged $650 for one oversized bag -- the expense of which was driven by an error.  The oversized package was then damaged and i will need to pay for that.  Moreover the flight was delayed both ways and the service on the return flight was probably the worst I've experienced ever.

The organization and seat coordination might've been the worst I've experienced in my many years of travel. Multiple people were literally moved 3+ times on the plane, others were placed in seats so when the person with the actual seat ticket arrived, they had no where to sit, etc. People who were planned their seats to be next to each other in advance were split (without notice!) to accommodate young families who didn't plan well. It was frustrating, took a long time and was sad to watch the vacation "glow" get killed off of a dozens of people. J Lopez (gate agent in MIA) seemed to be randomly changing seats and then snapped at others (me included) when we asked for seat guidance. I'm a regular flier with United but this experience was really awful.

everyone had duplicate seats once they were already on the plane.  it was a train wreck mess trying to navigate aisles and onboarding passengers and get off the plane to get a new seat, and then think i was getting upgraded and then not get upgraded, and actually had to sit in the 20 which was not the seat i picked out.
The WiFi connection was horrible. We stopped watching our movie 20 mins in because it kept stopping with a blank screen
The pita chips and hummus snack is terrible. It is not worth $4.99 for five pita chips and hummus that does not taste good.
My bags arrived 3hrs after I arrived in DC. I sat in the airport for 3 hours waiting for them to arrive. By far my worst airport experience thus far.

I don't recall who the pilot was, but there was a strange acceleration and break-check that I've never felt before and I know Engine 2 had issues prior to takeoff so I was not happy with how rickety the whole flight was.

Gate staff in Fort Meyers lined passengers up in groups more than 25 minutes s before they started boarding. This practice of having everyone line up and mill around created a lot of additional stress for everyone after having the flight delayed for several hours. In addition, my travel partner had his seat reassigned and no one at the counter was able to tell us why. I have recently begun traveling more frequesntly for business and have always been a loyal United customer but the quality of service, the size of seats and lack of legroom and the inability  of staff to keep customers from carrying on far too much and too large items makes me reconsider which carrier I will use in the future

I was extremely uncomfortable the entire time and i'm just really disappointed that i had the end my vacation this way. I had to change my flight to the next day because none of the reschedulable time frames offered were doable.

My baggage did not travel on the same flight as I did, so I was without some important items overnight. When my baggage did get delivered to my house, I was awoken at 4:30 in the morning by the delivery person. This is extremely rude and inconsiderate, especially after having an extremely long travel day.

WiFi didn't work, but I was anticipating using it, so it wasn't a big deal. Others may have been more disappointed. Also, apparently lighting panels on several rows wouldn't turn off, so an announcement was made toward the end of the flight that those passengers would be compensated since they had been unable to sleep on the long flight due to the lights.
The lack of reps at check in was really painful, wasn't able to speak with anyone about changing my seat until it was too late.  Also your overweight rates are insane and unfair.
The gate attendants could have kept the passengers more informed on the status of the delay. No communication = frustration.... anytime someone asked a question the answer seemed to be I don’t know

This flight is delayed every single time. The same exact flight I take once a month and it has been delayed every single time. Usually the aircrafts are in decent condition, this trip the aircraft was very old and uncomfortable.
very disappointed that the flight was delayed almost 2 hours because of scheduling issues

Baggage Claim needs logic.... two SFO flights and one LAX flight had bags all come up to one carousel at same time.... i was looking for the hidden cameras to see if this was an on purpose to get airport rage flying.... there were approx 140 bags from an earlier flight that were intentionally stacked in front of the drop point from the conveyor so passengers couldn't get to where the bags were dropped.... remember, this is after midnight, all passengers just flew 2,500 miles.... courtesy was not present - despite what your baggage report shows, my phone shows the call that we had landed was placed at 00:20 and the call that our bag with the Priority tag was the last bag off the three flights was placed at 1:10am - no excuse for that time lag and certainly no excuse for jamming three widebodies of customers into one blocked carousel....

there was an overall lack of communication around the delayed flight, managing passenger connections and management of expectations. there was no weather and people were being told at ASE that it was weather related and they would not be looked after once in Chicago. overall this 2 hour delay seemed to be severely mismanaged and security and the overall airport did not seem equipped to deal with the traffic. TSE pre check was checked in secondary to non TSA precheck and waited 25% longer. overall as someone who flies in excess of 175K miles a year on United and AA this was not a great experience.

The bathrooms were dirty and not up kept by the flight attendants.      I cannot believe that for spending thousands of dollars for a flight that NO FOOD IS PROVIDED by United Airlines and that even in Economy Plus - there is only food for purchase on an 11 HOUR FLIGHT.   Unacceptable.    You should be ashamed of your airline.

The gate we left from in Chicago had no seating group/lane markings and it was kind of a mess. No one seemed to know what was going on and why we weren’t boarding, the gate attendant didn’t give information or make announcements.
They did not let me upload my suitcase because it supposedly did not fit, being that it was of the exact measurements, the staff was very rude

My flight was delayed for non-weather reasons and then I was going to miss my connection flight. The best option of flight for me was to switch from Dulles airport to Reagan airport and leave later in the day. This second flight was also delayed. Instead of landing at 3.30 I arrived in Chicago at about 6.45.  I landed frustrated and disappointed with my experience. I have never not had a significant delay or problem when I’ve flown with United. At this point I’d rather pay more to fly with a more reliable airline.  Very disappointed.

We had a situation at the airport which we required assistance with and the customer service desk were extremely rude and un-helpful. Basically refused to help us or point us in the right direction at all. Very disappointed also with the charging of luggage outside of fare price!

Landing was terrible (people all around were being sick), the seats are just too close to the ones in front (it is impossible to get comfy), I could not read because my overhead light was not working and they turned off the cabin lights for most of the flight, I could not watch a movie as the screen in front of me did not work, could not sleep because the screen next to me could not turn off. We were also sat on the plane for nearly 2 HOURS before we took off due to a door for putting water in the plane being iced closed. It was one of my worst flight experiences.
Flight itself was fine. I do wonder, however, why it took over twenty-five minutes for the first bag to even appear at baggage claim. That, combined with the delay was a bit irritating.
Seats were extremely uncomfortable and I am very displeased with the almost 2 hour delay.
I was appalled at the baggage overage charge - a checked bag up to 50 lbs was supposed to cost $25 - Was 6 lbs over (Total 56lbs) and was charged $125!!!  Overly excessive!
Baggage service in Newark was a disaster.  And your team was rude.

My family and I (and all the passengers on flt) had to wait over a hour for baggage. When we asked as to why, we were told that there was a man power shortage. ABSURD.  Maybe pilots and flight attendants should have to check their bags so they know how passenger suffer

Baggage took an hour to come out, with no updates on status from staff. They had no idea what was happening!! Re boarding, flight was listed on time 5.20 departure, then changed to 6.20. But they started boarding at 5.15 for 5.45 pullback with no announcement of changed plan!! Almost missed flight but happened to walk by gate and saw boarding.

I will be filing a request for a refund.  We did not receive the email that reminds us of the time of the flight and allows us to get our boarding passes.  Hence we missed the flight.  I was charged approx $500 additional dollars to reschedule the flight 7 hours later.  The flight would not have been missed if we would have received the customary notice.

The 757-200 was ANCIENT. The windows were peeling from the wall. The lights are a buzzing flourescent yellow light. The plane looks so dingy and dirty I felt like my seat might give me a disease. The smell of the cabin was like a gross over-perfumed cinnamon candle that made me feel sick to my stomach. I was stuck in my biz class seat bc i couldnt get to the aisle from my window seat because the guy was sleeping and i couldnt step over him. The inflight entertainment is ANCIENT and cracking. This plane should be decomissioned it was so filthy.
The flight from Chicago to Toronto was delayed by 4 hours and that's why I gave it a "very dissatisfied' rating.

Horrible experience!! Due to the delayed flight to Newark, the remaining connecting flights were not possible to make. Airport personnel in Newark was disrespectful, rude and unaccomodating. We had to purchase a new ticket out of pocket to get home. I'd like someone from upper customer service management to call 9109224326 and speak with my daughter Radmila who can provide more details. This is unacceptable! Demanding refund and further review. My baggage is still not located.

Luggage pickup was a mess.   They didn't inform us with arrival at ORD Terminal 2 that baggage pickup was in Terminal 1.  I got to the Terminal 2 baggage area and saw sign to go out side over to Termina 1 (in sub-zero weather).   Then because our flight was an hour and a half late there was no carousel posting for where our bags would arrive.   Watched the screen for nearly 30 minutes and then another passenger found the carousel with our bags.  It never got posted to the arrivals screen.   Arrival was on Jan. 2.  At one point they were showing our arrival as Jan 3, Arrived with time.  They they got it switched back to Jan 2 arrival.   Kinda ruined my first impression of directly flight service Chicago to Asheville.
Dissatisfaction was due to delay in departure
The check-in at Newark (tag bag, etc) was extremely chaotic and it didn't seem very safe.

Why can't I turn off the display screen that was right in my face? This ended up to be a red-eye flight due to flight delays of over 2 hours. Sleeping was impossible with that screen flashing commercial messages constantly. The seats were incredibly uncomfortable and I am a very small person. My husband was in agony.

Well it was delayed so we got pushed to 9 am the next day. They paid for our hotel, but the vouchers they gave us for food weren’t accepted at the restaurant there so that was annoying. Our flight the next day left an hour late. It wasn’t the best experience overall.
Horrible smell
The check-in is not good except the luggage drop.
Baggage lost and not delivered as promised. This failure to follow through with delivery has been quite expensive and inconvenient.
It was the most horrible experiance of my life having to wait two hours with many passengers at the gate waiting for my luggage missing my business meeting...

baggage claim services in Houston were terrible.  my family left a bag in the overhead compartment on the plane.  we didn't realize this until we were in baggage claim.  I went to the baggage claim office (2 in Houston on right and left sides), both lines were long, so i ran up to ticket counter to ask if they could contact plane or gate.  I didn't want to wait in line, because i was afraid the plan would depart with my bag.  Unfortunately, the ticket attendant told me i needed to talk with either of the baggage claim offices downstairs and that they would have to have the bag brought to me.  I went back down to baggage claim and the office on the right side still had an extremely long line, so i went to the office on the left side.  After waiting to talk to someone, i finally was able to describe what had happened and they told me there was nothing they could do and i needed to go to the other office on the right side.  I even mentioned that the line was very long and i was afraid the plane would depart, but the attendant told me there was nothing she could do.  At this point, in frustration, i called the global services line and they connected me to an individual at the airport who was EXTREMELY helpful. this individual contacted the gate and had the bag brought to me.  It was a very frustrating experience!

The purser treated me like a criminal. A  very courteous and efficient flight attendant told me I could move to row 11. When I was sitting in 11d seat. The purser came up to me and demanded my boarding pass. I stated that the flight attendant had told me I could sit there. She came up to my seat and supported my assertion. He demanded my credit card so he could charge me $150 00. He then made threats that I would questioned by airline officials when we landed. I was embarrassed and very upset by his rude and officious manner. On an unrelated issue he was rude when I asked earlier on the flight if the seatbelt light would remain on as we were one hour into the flight and had not been turned off yet. He retorted that he had been too busy. I have flown on United for 45 years and have never been so rudely treated.

My husband asked for a extra drink as we just had to run to this flight before the doors close as all of our flights were delayed and when we wanted to get food at the airport the cashout machines didn’t work. The flight attendent a male was so rude to my husband his name was like claudio or something and he  basically told my husband “sure we will do another round, not like your going to die of thurst.” Never in my life have I had a flight attendent be so rude!
Si mi maleta no llego en el vuelo aparte que me atrasaron 1 dia de vuelo, las aeromosas no fueron atentas
Disappointing Global Service experience. No acknowledgement, no difference.

My bag containing a lot of our baby items was delayed.  It was very inconvienient.  I understand that these things happen, but there wasn't any weather or delays so I don't understand why there was an issue getting the bag in LGA.  I am a Gold member and this was not a pleasant experience at all.
Flight time delay. Arrival gate delay. Flight attendant seemed unfriendly.

Even after a delay in Omaha, the arrival at Newark ended up on-time.  However we sat on the plane for 30 minutes outside the gate waiting be towed in.  We were told they were understaffed.  Then we waited nearly an hour to get bags with no information other than people having to seek out the baggage claim office and simply being told they too were understaffed.  Sitting at baggage claim at 11:30 pm with 4 kids waiting for bags after having landed at 10 was completely unacceptable.

I usually leave positive reviews so I hope this will be taken seriously, but we were shepherded around to three separate gates and two separate planes to finally get off the ground, two hours after our original departure time. Then once we landed in Chicago the baggage claim took absolutely forever. Also, the check-in area in Houston had so many temporary barriers up it was unnecessarily difficult to navigate.  It's not usually that way. Please get rid of them. This is a small thing but it was the first annoyance that stuck out in what ended up being a very frustrating day. Admittedly, I was already cranky from earlier legs of my trip that added to the length and discomfort of my travel day, but to be delayed and shepherded around like that with no gesture of compensation (until AFTER I'd already paid for the Direct TV) has left me with a bad taste in my mouth toward United.

Bag check was chaos. It was under staffed and the computer were slow. You need more language support and line management–there was no line management. And what made matter worse is that at one end of the terminal it was empty. You had the staff, but no direction.

When approaching the desk to inquire about my mileage number being applied to the fight the woman at the desk rudely snapped your flight is delayed and hour with out me finishing my first word. Flight was delayed, had 4 children durning dinner time, on flight 3 children in front of us were offered a snack box and other snacks to hold them over and offer wasn’t extended to us.

The flight itself was fine. There were two things that could have been improved: (1) The device entertainment might have been fine but I didn't get to experience it because I didn't have headphones. Why not include in the booking confirmation a little note that says that there are no screens on this flight but there is in-flight device entertainment? That way people would know to bring headphones and would be able to download the app over Wi-Fi. (2) That's peanuts, though. By far the biggest problem, and the reason I would not recommend United at this point, was the check-in experience. I was on a Basic Economy ticket, so I could not check-in online. I was on a very last minute ticket, flying down to Florida to visit a critically ill grandparent. I needed assistance at the airport (quickly approve my luggage, see if I could switch to PBI to meet another cousin who was flying in) and there was NO ONE to help me. Every single person I asked redirected me to a different desk. No one took ownership of the problem, and I was very pressed for time, and running around in circles trying to get help. It was just a terrible experience. Then when I got to the gate, there was a long line, because boarding was delayed. I couldn't get anywhere near the gate to speak to the flight attendants, so I asked the attendant at the gate next door (who was just standing there not doing anything) if she thought I had time to go to the restroom (per her vast experience and likely ability to just the length of a boarding line). Rather than say "looks like 10 minutes but maybe don't take the chance" or "well what time is the flight" she actually barked at me that this was not her gate and she can't help. How do you train your flight attendants? What is the deal?! Overall by the time I boarded I was miserable and am not looking forward to the possibility of having to interact with your staff again.

dinner was not good.  Couscous is awful and should be removed from the menu.  The chicken meal was also not very good.  Yogurt for breakfast was not good - switch to a different brand please.  Offer something other than croissants.   seats are too small. quality of screen is not good - too dar.

We were offered drinks as soon as We were on the plane but none were brought till after the meal. Unfortunately the meal wasn't very good. The only down side to the flight. Also didn't expect to have to tip the disabled assistant in the airport either.

Very little information conveyed as to the real reason for the flight delay that led to our missed connection and forced us to spend the night in Chicago.  The gate team did a good job in making alternate plans.

We waited for 40 minutes once we landed, supposedly for a gate to open up. That was almost as long as the whole flight! It made me late for my hotel arrival, late for dinner, and late to get to bed for an extra early departure the next day.  My main complaint, however, is that in October I booked a round trip ticket ORD >UIN>ORD on United's new service to Quincy (operating as SkyWest) for Dec. 20. Then there was an unexpected death in my family and I had to move up my reservation to Dec 8. I live in Shanghai, and the United connection to Quincy was my last leg. Unfortunately I was told SkyWest doesn't fly on Saturdays, which was the day I arrived in Chicago from Shanghai. So I was forced to rent a car and drive five hours after flying 15 hours from China. Why would SkyWest not operate on Saturdays?

No one apologized or explained the delays, as seems to be my usual experience with United. I have been flying with you guys for almost 30 years and I think it's time to stop. Service is getting worse and worse.
entertainment section is really worst. It is asking me to swipe the card after selecting the movie but it's not giving any cost information anything at all. less movie collection really sucks

We were told that The United Club was  NOT available to us even thou we were traveling 1st class and had passes. The seat in front of me, 1A, was broken and went back so far that it was almost in my lap for 4.5 hours. UGH

The following are specifics that occured on this flight:  1. When i got on board i was not offered an amenity kit but everyone else was. Even after i requested for one 2. During the pre-meal beverage service, i asked for sparkling water. The flight attendent used her hands to put ice in the glass. She then poured sparkling water which didnt fill half the cup. This made her go back to get more. She brought back a glass full of clear liquid  then filled it with more sparkling water. I soon drank it and it was alcohol! Keep in mind i am underage and it was overall unsanitary. I called her back and she just took the drink with no apology and later no replacement was brought. 3. The meal i got wasnt my first choice which was given with no apology or explanation on why i didnt get my first choice. In addition my utensils were dirty so i pushed the call button and waited but no one ever came. When i finally got the attention of one flight attendent she rudely told me to hold on . When she finally came to me, I told her about the dirty utensils and she abruptly took them away from me and gave me another set by tossing it on my tray with no apologies. 4. After finishing my meal, the flight attendent took my tray but rudely took my unfinished drink on my tray and slammed it on my table. I placed drink on tray because i was finished with it. She walked away without an apology. 5. While waiting a lengthy time for dessert, lights were turned off as if the service was completed. After 20 mins it was eventually turned on and dessert cart came out. 6. When i was offered dessert, i was yelled at. When i replied she yelled back "what". The ice cream was rock hard and my original brownie was dropped on floor. Flight attendent replaced the brownie but no apologies were given. 7. Throughtout the flight numerous service items were dropped on the floor by flight attendents.   Overall flight attendents had bad attitudes and showed poor customer service. I am very upset because in the end no apologies were given to me by any of the flight attendents. Instead i felt unappreciated the whole flight. This was my first flight where i was very dissatisfied. I hope these issues will be reviewed and addressed. Thank you for having the time to read this.

I'm shocked there was no personal device entertainment on this flight. To have to pay $9 for directv for a 3 hour flight is absurd. Plus the movies don't start on demand which is even crazier. The seats and leg room keeps getting smaller. When I got up from my window seat and both people next to me got up to let me out I could barely squeeze out of the row! I am 5'3" and 140 lbs for reference....its crazy how you are not thinking about the customer's experience yet you're giving us a survey. I can't imagine you actually have teams that run this program - do they actually report out the text analytics from these verbatims? I doubt it.

The flight was terrible - the flight was delayed 30 minutes because the bag loader was not functioning.  The taxiing to the gate in Newark was delayed 15 minutes because the jet bridge could not be lined up to the plane.  Bags took 30 minutes to come off the carousel, which is completely unacceptable.  Overall, a flight that boarded on time ended up being 20/30 minutes late plus another 30 minutes late because of baggage issues.
Flight was very uncomfortable due to hear and lack of water. The male flight attendant was also quite grumpy.
Very    Quite chaotic. Both in columnus and in newark, we were invited to get on, leave and get on again on the plane as the time of the delay could not be estimated.....

This was hands down the worst experience I have ever had flying. Now I understand why this Airlines has been having a bad reputation recently and it really shows with the horrible customer service, delay and lack of alternative flights to leave the same day. Not only were we delayed due to technical failures on the flight for over 2 hours, we missed our connecting flight, the flight attendants had attitudes when we asked them questions, they misplaced my husbands checked suitcase in Brussels airport (which ALSO took us over two hours to wait for), and we are booked the next day to leave (when I had to cancel my university exam and my husband had to use all of his vacations days), in addition to us having to repay and rebook our train back from Copenhagen to our home town. By far the worst experience. I will never fly with United Airlines again and I will never recommend this Airlines to anyone. Such a waste of money and being a Star Alliance member, I regret signing up with this company.

Airport check in was terrible. We were all in separate lines for each machine and the one I was in line to use broke. Your employee said there should be one line to avoid this but the was no rope system set up to guide people. Airport was also very crowded and the one employee there was running around like a chicken with her head cut off. The 2 hour 15 minute delay taking off was terrible. Why did we even board just to sit there at the gate for that long? To be fair, your employees were giving people a chance to get off. There was also terrible turbulence  (although you can't do anything about that). But it just made the trip even worse. The whole thing stunk. Plus the flight was packed. Thank goodness I didn't have a connecting flight. I can't even imagine having to get on another airplane so soon after that flight.

We will never fly with United again after the treatment we received in Brussels airport - after missing our connecting flight to Copenhagen due to delay. We were going to fly back to Copenhagen at 9.35, we received tickets to Zurich and then Copenhagen at 15.00 instead, meaning we would arrive in Copenhagen at 19.00 later that day. Though, when boarding for the Zurich plane, our tickets, which we received by United personnel in Brussel were not valid. We were left to go to the bagage claim, get our luggage and find United personnel in the departure hall to help us. None of the United partners wanted to help us, as the United personnel was not available in the afternoon in Brussels airport. After a two hour phone call with United, one of us were able to get a new ticket for a plane at 21.00, where the other two had to take a night in Brussel and not able to depart before 9.35 the day after. We were left all to ourselves and no one wanted to help, this was the worst I have ever experienced by any airline - and we were only left with a compensation of 14 euro in the airport. This is not at all acceptable after staying in Brussels aiport for 12 hours (and for two a night at the airport hotel).

The gate attendant in Milwaukee demanded that I pay for my carryon. She said if i didn’t i could not board. When I asked her to get her supervisor, her attitude went from rude to defensive.  My daughter and i were last group to board making her even more adamant we follow her orders or the door would close in two minutes.  I’ve been traveling for the government for the past year and have never had this as an issue. The bag was in regulations and could’ve just as easily been green tagged.  Her unprofessional attitude and behavior almost caused us to miss the flight and her threats were ludicrous.  This is how you lose customers. One employee should not feel they have power to dictate over the customer.

I paid for the business upgrade and the experience was nothing it should ever be, temporary club in Newark in disgusting condition to luggage arriving 1.5hours after touchdown despite priority tag. You should be ashamed but I guess you do not care...
Flight was delayed 3.5 hours. No meal voucher was issued. Lack of info. Shitty customer service

We were in line to board and were told to sit back down because we may be a bit delayed - perhaps an hour per the gate agent. The information was a bit sketchy at first, but then we found out that the captain who was scheduled to fly the aircraft was unable to fly - I believe that his license had expired. After waiting around for hours, we were told that a new captain was being sent on a Jetblue flight from the NY area. We were supposed to take off at 7:06 and did not depart West Palm Beach until 11:20 PM. The service was absolutely unacceptable. I have Celiac disease, the snacks given at the gate were not gluten free and was not given a food voucher to purchase food in the airport, yet was given a $30 voucher to United for a future flight. This service is absolutely unacceptable. I would like to be refunded for the flight value equal to $357.20 ($315.20 + $42 Economy Plus Seat). The voucher of $30 will not be used as I will not be flying your airline again based on the service I was provided.
Terrible experience with even worse communication
Besides being 4 hours late and no Pilot, not really. Being a 1K flyer this was very bad experience.

Premier check-in was very disorganized;  security has United signs for separate Premier lines as well as a TSA pre-check lane.  Neither were open.  I know the TSA pre-check is out of your control.  You should not have United signs showing a separate line if not available.  Baggage in Chicago took just under and hour.  Premier bags not off-loaded first.  I appreciate the harsh weather conditions and staff not being able to be outside for too long.  However, not one agent working in baggage claim made an announcement.  One woman was working right next to claim 14.  Several people asked what was going on but again, no announcement.  That lack of courtesy is why I scored this trip so low.

You Miami terminal is as bad as LGA. Nothing out of Miami is to you normal standards out of any of your hubs. Security did not have TSA Line, I was with a Global Service Passager and there was no GS line. Terminal smells, restrooms had no papers...

The gate moved. Passengers had to take multiple buses in the freezing cold after already being delayed. The new gate was a very far walk for the elderly who complained. Then we had to board a ramp and wait outside in the cold for s long time.
30 minute wait to get bags.   Very bad.

The gate area was small and dirty. Dogs were not in their cages as required. I don't like having to pay for flight maps and games on Direct TV. Flight attendants were not friendly and were not very visible.

I made a mistake when booking and thought I had a 7:15 AM flight but it was 7:15 PM with arrival at 11:09 PM which actually turned out to be 11:25 P M.To change flights there was a penalty of $400.00.   We are 2 seniors and had to drive a considerable distance in the dark in unfamiliar territory.  Needless to say the experience was not a good one.

the flight attendant skipped our row, I didn't care but the two others in my row were bothered by it.  Again, I stress that the seats are too close together and it makes people angry and upset.  I am confused by you want a plane of mean people.  The bottom line can still be met by offering a pleasant trip.

When a flight is delayed due to the fault of United, if you're not going to provide compensation, the least you can do is offer free inflight entertainment. Free Directv and/or internet would have gone a long way. Typically a JetBlue flyer, I have come accustomed to having these "luxuries" for free! If you want to charge, that is your choice, but whats the harm in providing fro free due to a delay. Scrambling to arrange transportation prior to takeoff was one trouble that could have been avoided had I not had to pay for internet.

This was the worst flying experience I've had in over 20 years of commercial travel. I'm not upset about the plane breaking—that's what planes do—but I'm extremely upset with United's lack of communication. With my silver status expiring this year, I'll have to give serious consideration whether to give my continued business to United or switch to another airline. This was terrible service on the part of United.

I paid for premier access however the boarding pass didn’t reflect it. I asked the UA club concierge to print me a copy of the receipt and confirm with the help desk that all was in order. She even wrote it on the boarding pass. However at boarding time for premier access the gate attendant didn’t let me board even after showing the receipt for payment and the note written by the UA club employee.  I went back to the counter who confirmed everything to be in order that it must be a glitch because of me changing flights, so she walked me to the gate and then I boarded, way past the premier access boarding. All she had to do was look at the printed receipt to confirm but she chose to inconvenience me and exclude me from rendering a service that I had duly paid for.  My UA#RV496311.
Newark airport is a mess...  Need more real places to eat at.  Not a fan of the eating set up..
The seats were the most uncomfortable ones I have ever sat in on a plane. My back was aching just from that short flight. Rethinking future flights with you.

I was unhappy that my seat assignment changed.  I booked months before and put myself and my spouse next to each other.  Our seats were changed without consulting us and was told it had to happen.  As a Platinum guest, and with seats/reservations booked together - I was disappointed in this change.

One bag sent to Rochester NY.  Flight from Lexington to Chicago 3 hours late due to plane problem originating in Chicago. Missed connecting flight and had to wait another 2 hours for later flight to Portland. One bag made it, one didn't.

The lack of information on the delay, incramental 15 min time extensions was a mess.  I could have sat in the United Club if the untied club offered the ability to provide updates for domestic flights that were severely delayed.  Instead I spent most of my time at the gate miserable.

Flight was late departing Chicago.  Crew, particularly the flight attendants, were detached and seemed careless, disgruntled, disinterested and unhappy with their work.  Made few trips, other than the planned cart service and trash collection, through the cabin to offer water or just pass through.
I felt it was odd that there were no alternatives offered or compensations given for the 3 hours delay, late at night.

Gate issues caused our delay getting out of Chicago and getting into LAX on time. We were told the 777 plane in arrival gate at LAX was waiting for a single passenger before closing their do and pushing back. I was disappointed that they chose to make hundreds of people wait to accommodate so few passengers.

Flight to and out of Chicago we’re both delayed. Causing a rush from one gate to the next only to wait in line for an hour.  Plane was discovered to be not clean halfway into passenger boarding which caused another delay while they had to return to clean more. In flight entertainment system has a poor selection and the show I was watching kept stalling and freezing and having to restart. Baggage claim seemed to take a long time in Calgary. Also the flight time got changed after I booked it, then with the delays I ended up arriving in Calgary hours later than I had originally booked for. Not a great experience
Although the staff worked very hard to clean a bodily fluid issue on the row behind me, it was still a very long delay and very unpleasant to experience up close.

at the gate they attepted to take our bags stating there was no more room in the overhead compartments. They argued and refused to give us an option or even check to make sure.  When we got on board there was absolutely plenty of extra and empty bin storage available.  NOT ok

This was the almost the worst flight I have had on this regular flight I take to Columbus. The aircraft was 2 hours late. By time I deplaned and made it home, it was 12:45am. I had to go to work the next day. I get up early so I barely had 4 hours sleep. Needless to say I was exhausted the next day. And I still feel tired a day later. I can’t take this United flight if you can’t get this flight out on time.

Our flight was so delayed that I didn't leave the airport until 3am, after picking up my baggage. I was so incredibly disappointed in United, and will consider every option before traveling with you again. I've come to realize that all of your bad PR is true.
No need to buy the premier access from Miami: useless  We paid for nothing
The cavin asistance were totally unnice and the food horrible
There was no Hemispheres magazine. The salad was under cooked and there was no appetizer and beverage course before the main meal.

When our flight is delayed it is important to keep your customers informed. There was no information given as to why there was such a significant two hour delay in this flight. Very frustrating when flights are delayed due to crew availability issues

It was annoying having to wait for 30 minutes for the bus to head to the airplane on the Tarmack. If I had known that the busride would be more than 5 - 10 minutes, I would have deboarded and tried to get a seat on another bus.  I was stuck carrying heavy baggage for longer than necessary after already having waited over 8 hours due to delays.
Rudest flight attendants I’ve seen in years
poorly marked areas in Newark, difficult to find the way from baggage drop off to the gates

I will never again fly United or go through Chicago or Newark! My experience with the flight attendants and the people working at the airport was the worst I’ve ever experienced in any airport/airline!

1) when plan was loaded for departure from ORD United decide to wait for a flight coming in. I Was 1.5 hours Late to Orlando. On return I arrived to airport 35 Minutes before flight b/c of a jack knifed semi on the road. I could Have been on the plane in 12 minutes but attendant did not allow It? My upgraded alternative flight did not have a meal. One attendant was a bit rude. Unusual...
Very uncomfortable seats. Too narrow and not enough leg room. poor selection of snacks for purchase. The ones I got were very small and not going together.
So sorry it was delayed an hour but not under any one's control.  Also had a little difficulty trying to sleep--need one of those neck pillows!

Flight attendants were very unattentive...one saw me trying to fix my broken seat and just sat there watching me struggle. They seem very unhappy that they are working a long haul flight... My seat was broken and did not fully recline.....not a good flight at all
Again, checkin staff is useless.  You had 3 agents working 6 kiosks, and after stating they could not help me, they proceeded  to pull others from the kiosks to a computer to ticket them.
