Baggage claim took a very long time once we arrived in Washington D.C. the wait time was very long and disappointing. On top of that, the zipper on my luggage were destroyed.
I checked two First Class bags in Chicago.  In Nashville, one came out third in line & the last came out 5th from last.   No biggie, but frustrating.

I checked in using the machine in the terminal. It printed out the wrong boarding card: wrong name, wrong destination. Didn't notice till I got to bag drop. Had to queue again and check in second time.
Food dire as usual. Not inspired by movie choices.
Security was horrific! Would have been dreadful just adults but with two kids as well was incredibly stressful. Other airports manage not to be.

My sister and I were not seated together which was absolutely ridiculous. The area around me smelt like sick. The cabin members were rude and kept telling me to sit down so they could pass when I went over to speak to my sister (when there was no terbulance). It then became a bumpy ride and the crew never told us what was going on (was it bad weather? Was it expected?). When we landed it took so long to get off the plane that even though we landed an hour early it didn't make any difference. An extremely poor experience.
security in c terminal not very good people rude and impolite sent me to wrong line  despite having premium access
The breakfast was very poor.

The flight boarded on time, but once we got on the plane, our flight took a very long time to get up in the air, causing the flight to be delayed and land late. We were not told why, which was very frustrating. Additionally, once we did land we had to be pulled into the gate. While this was happening, there was very high-pitched noise that was consistent and painful to the ears and those around me said they were being driven mad by it. The flight itself was fine, but the takeoff and landing experiences were very unpleasant.

El personal que recibía las maletas para ponerlas en la cinta GROCERO Y DESCORTES . De muy mal modo nos dijeron que una de nuestras 3 maletas se excedía 1 kg y que debíamos quitarlo. Cero tolerancia y educación.  Además, como no tenían cinta desde la balanza hasta la cinta principal, levantaban y ARROJABAN sin ningun tipo de cuidado las maletas, a la vista de todo el mundo, sin importarles nada. VERGONZOSO. Una compañía como UA no puede permitirse este tipo de desprolijidades. La cordialidad debe comenzar desde el momento del check in y no solo en el vuelo.

First thanks for this survey because I want to send my comments about two issues. 1) The gate C120 (Newark), I think it isn´t for an international flight. There was no space for the lines of the groups and the people. 2) When we arrived to Buenos Aires Airport, Ezeiza, it was a strike of porters. Sure this isn´t a United responsability but I think United need to know how to move with this problem. Perhaps this problem happens one, twice or ten times per year in Argentina, but the people who was waiting the luggage, in that area can´t buy water or something to eat. We were waiting 5 hours to finally get our luggage, so I recommend for the future an active position from United. I´m Argentinian and I understand some things, but it were american people who came to Argentina to get a Princess Cruise, and they were 75 years old. I think United can do more than a wheelchair to wait 5 hours.

Our flight itself was fine and we were very happy to arrive early in BsAs as we had plans for the afternoon. However, due the work stoppage by baggage handlers we spent FIVE very frustrating HOURS waiting for our luggage.  Our plans for the afternoon were ruined and we were unhappy.
Terrible experience with security staff. Attendant pushed my bin back prior to being scanned causing it and the contents to fall in the floor, she was very rude.
This was the worst service that ever had.

It was irritating that I got an email saying to arrive 2 hours early because of TSA delays and I was through security in less than 5 minutes. So I was stuck waiting an extra 30 minutes. And then my baggage was taken from me at the gate. But there was tons of space on the plane. (My coat was the only thing in a double overhead bin) and then was one of the last things to come out, after waiting 30 minutes and changing baggage claim areas. So in total, seemingly needless things wasted a hour of my time, which leaves me annoyed. Other than these things the trip and service was great.
Chaos at the gate. Really shouldn't combine boarding groups 1 and 2 into one , and woefully insufficient space. Gate announcements not audible.
I will not be flying United in the future if I can avoid it.

Not sure if it why, but baggage check-in at SFO was quite chaotic, several bag drop stations were un-staffed (leading to long lines at the few that were open).  I did not get a "Priority" tag on my bag although I think I'm eligible.  At the gate (at SFO), the boarding lanes/departure times were such that the lines for boarding for two different flights were long and inter-mixed (and at times blocked the exit of the moving sidewalk), which created a bit of tension/irritability for passengers trying to board.

The service upon check in and boarding was relatively rude. My flight from Portland, the staff was kind and accommodating, but upon leaving Chicago the experience was quite opposite. The flight was disorganized and boarding and in boarding were particularly difficult.

The plane and bathroom was not clean.  Upon arrival there was quite a wait for a repairman to fix the baggage claim turnstile.  During the flight there was no offer of water or a beverage.  On the flight from Newark to Seattle, the bathroom had no running water to wash your hands.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: My bad was ruined by the trip.it was ripped by the belt system somewhere
the food was quite bad.  breakfast "eggs" were a mound of something that didn't look presentable
The flight attendants on that particular flight need to change jobs, if they don't like being in the service industry.  All of the flight attendants in Business - First, had poor attitudes.

We were delayed out if SFO by 30 minutes due a "minor maintenance issue". This was a huge plane and many of your customers, like us, had a short changeover in Chicago.  We were late in Chicago by the same amount of time we lost at SFO.  Based on the documented cruising speed of the 777 and the nautical miles from SFO to Chicago, it's quite apparent that the pilot chose to conserve fuel and forego the opportunity to make up the lost time.  May have saved fuel but you really hosed up many, many customers.  I thought this represented a bad management decision.

The airport experience was not the greatest - baggage handling was muddled up at EWR, and priority baggage delayed , post which the security line was long , with global services perks difficult to avail because of the crowd
Uncomfortably crowded, ridiculous fees for every little thing, unpleasant experience overall. I used to enjoy flying, now I dread it.
It was a red eye. everyone basically slept, no services were provided like drinks or food so no comments but no complaints either beacuse I bought a basic economy ticket, there were no expectations.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: I didn't even receive a glass of water on my flight from LAX to ORD.  I was supposed to be in a lay flat seat from SFO to ORD, instead had to be rerouted LAX to ORD with no lay flat seats AND an hour delay (that could have been avoided if ground operations had their act together).
to plan in advance to avoid delay before departure

The flight attendants were a little unprofessional. I could hear all the conversations and criticism of the ground staff for the issues with lack of coffee cups on the plane.   Also, the bathrooms weren’t very clean. What looked like green grime was all around the seats - almost like rust off the metal fitments. Same in two of three bathrooms.   Generally the plane felt very tired.
The food and drink service in Economy Plus was very disappointing. The flight attendants didn’t seem to care much about the service, too.
My flight down was a horror story. If it wasn't for the return flight I would never have flown UA again.
The overall experience was negative. From not having any passed snacks to the plane dripping water on me the entire ride, it was very unpleasant. I will think twice before booking.

The no carryon bag I did not know about ahead of time and was a big pain at 5am to take items out of my bag and jam it into a small personal item box in order to get my ticket with my only other option to wait in line and check the bag for 25$. I would have gone with another flight for more money if I knew that was the case ahead of time.
Denied entry with certificate to United Club in Newark, seats way way too small resulting in a horrid flight, luggage came out at wrong carousel and a few other things as well .......
The overhead reading light did not work.  I mentioned to the steward but he didn't offer to reseat me. It was difficult to read since it was an early morning flight.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: Not overall happy with your media experiences.  Paid for TV is not comparable to your competitors and Direct TV stinks!  Your cabins and seating are due for major upgrades and my seat area was not clean upon my arrival and was not as comfortable in my seat.

I really had extremely BAD experience with TSA..... as they think they are official and proficient.... they are not...at least the person that don't honor the Green Pass I was issued going or coming...since my wife was part of my team on this trip... He made her take her shoe off and we were not treated with respect leaving Vegas (at the early hour!) they need to wake up and put the discrimination logo behind them ....
Economy basic in seat 30 was bad.   The leg room was very bad.  The seat was uncomfortable.  I’m 6’4” and the economy seat felt as small as any airline I’ve flown.
Food was horrible  Flight attendant 👩‍✈️  service horrible  One was chewing gum all the time during the flight... that is not professional .

The staff at the Santa Ana airport check-in desk for first class/Premier 1K was very rude - I am a gold member trying to purchase an upgrade to first class, and she directed me away as if I did not belong in this very exclusive line. She said that line was for first class only (before asking what class of travel I had - judgement based on external appearance wasnt appreciated). As someone willing to spend the money, I left the desk with a very negative opinion of united service, and had to find a kiosk and figure out how to buy the upgrade on my own.

Since I incorrectly identified wi-fi as my problem (not true) I want to now correct to say my problem was with in-flight entertainment. I had the latest app on my iPad and watched a movie.  Terrible disruptive connection.  It would stop and I had to restart and find the spot to resume about 10 times throughout the 2-hr movie.  Not fun.
Only complaint was that the TV screens are too close to eyes and made me car sick! I should have asked an attendant how to blacken the screen, i suppose. We got in early and flight was smooth.
No.  But my pre-flight experience on my return flight from Ewr to Jax was beyond disappointing.   I have not been treated so badly in many years

My one disappointment was in Chicago.  I had a short connection time - landed at C17 - and walked down to C 3 or 4 to take the shuttle buss over to the E gates.  But the shuttle has been discontinued.  Thanks so much for keeping us advised!  Really stupid!
Very frustrated with the 3.5 hour delay

The plane was clean but I don’t like anything about the main cabin. The seats are so close together that you can’t get to the item under the seat in front of you like your purse for example . And if you drop something, you can forget about picking it up. In addition there is no place to put a bottle of water at aholder for a magazine because the netted basket is so tight and the United way magazine holder does not expand .
The row of guys behind us were making some very crude remarks that people around us didn't want to hear. They were gay and making some very nasty sexual remarks that were not appropriate in public.
It took one hour and 20 minutes to receive our luggage that was marked priority.  Very disappointed

The Basic Economy fare is a joke. Getting slotted in boarding group 5, unable to bring even a small rolling suitcase to be checked curbside without at $25 fee is unacceptable. I realize that the overhead bins on the plane I flew were smaller, but to charge someone to do something that on any other airline I can do for free is ridiculous. To restrict even printing out the boarding pass for group 5, and no other group, makes no sense. I will not be flying United again under this fare class, if at all. Most of my trips are shorter and I prefer a carry-on bag and am more than willing to valet check my bag at the plane.
I flew first class but when I got to the air port I asked an attendant where to check in and I was cut short and was told just to stand in a very long line to check my bag. I was not impressed
We were delayed 2 hrs at ORD. By the time the flight landed in LIR, the bathroom was gross!

I purchased a toasted sourdough bread sandwich with cheese, sausage and egg. It was not satisfying. While it was warm, 1) the toasted sourdough was stiff and hard, 2) the sausage and cheese were very bland, and 3) there were no condiments (no salt, pepper, or salsa). I will not purchase it again.
Check in process at the airport was horrible. We did not know where to go or what to do. Signage was not helpful. Bring back PEOPLE!

I was originally travelling on UA3767 to UA3821 with an ETA back in ROC 09:51AM. Maintenance issues affected the original aircraft for 3767, which was made evident after boarding. We de-planed and was told another aircraft was being brought over. it took quite a while for this to be a reality and if I heard correct announcement, then this too had mechanical issues. Via the Mileage plus desk I'd booked a later departure out of ORD via Dulles back to ROC, but with further delays to 3767, changed plans again and went MKE, EWR to  ROC. I had no issues at all with the revised arrangements. MY BIGGEST MOAN is the same old story of lack of information and the frequency it comes from gate agents.

The flight attendent was not helpful with helping me place my bag over head once my bagged area was already take. The person behind me placed two bags in the conpartment over head witch should not have been the case. A little help would have been aporeciated.

My bag was checked in premier access in Newark never arrived in Sarasota Very Very unacceptable the  phone communication to locate my bag was also rude and very unacceptable. Customer Service should be top priority when a passenger needs your assurance. No one cared  I was speaking with someone from India about my bag totally unacceptable if I had not been persistent I would never of gotten my bag but I will tell u my career it totally customer service and oh how dissapointed that u don't treat your passengers in a special way!!!

I think your economy checkin policy stinks. I think that is ridiculous that you are forcing people to check in at the kiosk to confirm they don’t have a bag. It’s really inconvenient for someone who doesn’t need to check a bag to get forced to go the counter. It’s already difficult to travel with the security process. Why maybe it more inconvenient. I will avoid your airline in the future.

tow bar broke backing away from gate and then the pushing vehicle rammed the nose gear and we ended up back at the gate.....waited for mechanics to come and inspect if there was damage.  TOW BAR Breaking is the part that's at issue...shouldn't those be inspected for cracks and signs of wear?

Funny I wasn't asked about my bus ride from ABE to EWR. Just because I didn't make the bus from ABE to EWR my ENTIRE flight and my return flight was canceled? I'm not sure you should assume I won't be making any of my flights because I missed a bus.....not a phone call nor an email, UNITED just cancelled ALL my reservations.

My flight from SLC to Chicago was one leg of my return flight to Charleston, SC. In between my original flight to SLC (Jan. 13) and return flight to SC (Jan. 20) my son turned two years old--his birthday is Jan. 19. I purchased round trip tickets for my family and did not know that I needed to purchase a ticket for my recently-turned two year old son. After I boarded the plane and the plane was getting ready to depart, a flight attendant asked how old my son was. I told her that he had just turned two the day before, that I am active duty military, and that this was my return flight home. The flight attendant staff determined that I needed to pay for my son to have a seat--even though there were unoccupied seats on the plane. I was charged $895.00 for the ticket. I didn't feel like I had an option to not pay for the flight because I was already on the plane and felt that if I refused I would delay everyone's departure (it turns out, after I paid, that we sat on the tarmac for 2.5 hours because the hitch broke while we were being towed to the runway). I was not told that there were other options and that a later flight, which would have arrived in Charleston around the same time as my flight, was available for half the price of the ticket that I paid for my son's flight. I felt like I was held hostage and had no option but to pay for the flight. I will not recommend United to others, nor do I wish to fly United again.
Ridiculously small aircraft and very uncomfortable seats
The sound system at the ORD gate area is not very good with all the background noise in the airport it was difficult to understand the gate agents instructions.

Was very disappointed in the flight attendants (especially the purser).  I sat beside a lady who brought on a dog (not in a carrier).  She had the window seat.  The lady behind her in that window seat and I informed her that we were both allergic to dogs.  The lady with the dog was trying to change seats with the gentleman in the window across the aisle but the purser came back and rudely said - we don't have time for this - we need to get the cabin door closed.  The last people had just walked past and were still in the aisle putting up bags.  When the lady tried to explain about the dog and our allergies - she threw up hands and walked away.  Her actions and the entire encounter were observed by everyone on the plane (my partner was sitting in a row towards the back.  She obviously did not care about me or my fellow passenger with allergies.  Her behavior was unprofessional.  I was surprised that the lady was allowed to bring a dog not in a carrier on the plane.  She also had the dog in her lap for the last part of the flight.  I started sneezing at that point and left the plane with red eyes, etc.  I was not happy.

I was unhappy that the computer selected two random seats for myself and my flying partner putting us at opposite ends of the airplane. It was only because of the gate attendant that we were able to sit next to one another. I found this to be an inconvenience.
United club at Newark is horrible. The worst among all airline. Poor ambience, poor level of service, indifferent staff and on top of that charging for a beer!
The bathroom was old and fixtures were falling apart and was very dirty

We sat on the runway for 45 minutes waiting to be de-iced... yes, in Jacksonville, FLORIDA. First, we couldn't get manager approval for de-icing (which manager??). Then, the de-icing truck was out of fuel (why??). Finally, the captain moved the plane into the sun, which I had been suggesting already (but the crew should have thought of since we are in FLORIDA). Ultimately, the plane was not even de-iced. We just sat in the sun for half an hour. It was embarrassing.
The security process in Newark was HORRIBLE.  The agents are rude and it was extremely disorganized.
International flight and still no pillow, blanket or food. Next year, no seats?
Couldn’t find United Club. lack of directions. If not available, would have been nice to know. very disappointed. Not service we have received from United in past.

Flight itself was great, but overall experience was weak. TSA precheck line was too long. Bin system for bag scanning impedes flow, especially when nobody removes their empty bin. Pop up club at EWR gate C124 was sad.

The flight attendant serving us was not friendly and appeared not to be enjoying her job. She refused to give my husband a cup of coffee outside of the regular service when he went to the back of the cabin to request one, saying he should wait 20 minutes until she came through again. She was generally not friendly and did not smile while serving us throughout the flight.
Get more low back support in seats. I'm sure that I'm not the only one who suffers with low back pain.

2 things. The united club would not accept my pass during renovations. Now it is going to expire on 2/28 and I won’t get to use it. The lack of moving sidewalks in newark airport has made the walk to the gates very long for people with mobility issues. All that retail makes $ but no sense for the traveler having to walk all that way. Also, the people who pay for a seat assignment (not basic economy) should be offered to  move up to the extra leg room seats before the people who paid the basic economy fare are assigned those seats.

Since I experienced a 2 hour delay on flight 1790/ CE07VD and a 4 hour delay on flight 991/HWG01P on October 19th 2017 and never receive a survey or any consideration for the headaches it has caused me. We were transferred to 3 different planes before actually taking off 4 hour later than scheduled.  Consequently I am seriously considering canceling my mileage plus card and no longer fly United.  You should be surveying the good with the bad and accommodate when it goes bad.  I have been a Continental/United customer for over 40 years and my last 2 experiences have been the worst.   You probably don't care about this single passenger but please look into your maintenance procedures. Something is not working properly and requires managements attention.   Very disappointed Paul Criscione paulcriscione@verizon.net
Seating space is very limited.  Going through Custom was very long so we had a difficult time finding our luggage.

The flight attendants in the first class cabin were extremely inattentive.  They spent 90% of the flight on their phones/i-pads and did not come through the cabin once to ask if there was anything I needed.  One spent about 10 minutes spraying air freshener in the galley area.  I was very disappointed.
I have never flown first class and not been given a meal option. The meal had no taste and palled in comparison to the American Airlines flight we were on a week ago. Just disappointed.

The airport security experience was terrible (Term A).  One lane open for over 100 people, no line differential for pre-check approved customers.   Not United issue, but maybe you can put pressure on them.  Always this way at Term A- EWR.

My checked suitcase arrived damaged when I got to PHX.  There was a tear on top, the handle side was bent in and the baggage tags were torn.  I took it to the baggage counter where Beverly Johnson agreed that despite the suitcase being an older American Tourister model the suitcase was in good shape, except for the side that had been damaged. She, however, said that she could not do anything because the suitcase was not torn and could still keep contents intact.  She did ask me to keep the tag and send a note to customer relations.  Her thought was that since the suitcase was a soft side, was not as heavy and  it was probably placed under heavy suitcases in transit, it sustained the damage.   My thoughts: -A cardboard box could also hold contents in it securely, I just happen to prefer suitcases when I travel - I can take normal wear and tear in baggage handling, but now I have a suitcase that I cannot use . It is a little frustrating.
The plane was small and smelled. In addition, no on-flight tv monitors, headphone outlet, cell phone charging outlet, and lack of snack options compared to other airlines that I used during my trip.

The flight was over one hour delayed, it took us 40 min to clear customs and thereafter we had to wait an additional 45 min for a bags to be delivered. This made the connection extremely stressful. The attitude of the employees at Newark is appalling. Not at all helpful or understanding of the fact that people, unsurprisingly, do not want to miss their connection.
Only disappointment was no hot water for tea or coffee so I drank water.
Always seating on the tarmac for 45 minuets or longer at Newark hate it there may have to flying American at of Philly
The flight attendant was very unfriendly To the point of being rude
There is a door bell 'ding' on the CRJ aircraft that is meaningless to passengers and entirely too loud . . . it hurts my ears.

I am extremely dissatisfied with the recent change in the leg room inside the cabin. I had a 1 year old baby in my lap, which I paid additional money for. My space was incredibly cramped the entire ride, and the person on front of me put their seat back before the plan even took off. United should be ashamed of themselves. Tickets purchased with an infant in lap should be placed in a seat with acceptable leg room. My baby was axhausted and miserable the entire ride because she couldn’t get comfortable. While trying to feed her mid flight numberous Times, I was having to slouch my body in order to keep the baby and I only in our space. I was left with an extremely sore back to start our vacation. How disappointing. I am truly shocked that United would do this to their customers. Shameful. Needless to say, I am already dreading our return flight. I will not fly United again with a lap child. I am very dissatisfied.
Extremely dissatisfied with lack of leg room. Most uncomfortable that I have ever experienced

I was very disappointed ours delay on an aircraft that came in a day before.  also when we got to Newark we could find our luggage on the belt.  eventually after one full hour we found it standing on the side.  3 hours later I got an email that the luggage came in on an earlier flight. this email should have been sent out as soon as it was sent to avoid the anxiety we had to experience until we found our luggage.  very poorly handled.

We boarded on time but sat away from the gate for a considerable period with no clear explanation except that maintenance would be with us shortly. That went on for more than an hour. We were told the lavatory system wasn’t functioning. However when we returned to the gate we were allowed to use the onboard lavatory. Maintenance finally came onboard and after much discussion and some confusion including contradictory information we were allowed to depart. As well the gate agent seemed unwilling or unable to provide connection assistance or information to those passengers that would be in jeopardy for their connections. All in all, United was very poor in the area of customer service and providing passenger awareness. As a 1K member of United I find this to be well below my expectations and a huge disappointment.
Horrible service.  Pilots and crew were dumbfounded.
Too much hype about Polaris, but actual experience is worse than other airlines' business class.

After such a circus promoting Polaris Business Class, I decided to try your route instead of my often times flown Swiss Airlines (since my primary choice of airline does not fly directly into Geneva). I will NEVER fly United ever again, for personal or for business. It is simply a joke the service, the cabin, everything, to passengers paying significant sums of money to fly and enjoy their time in the air. There is no direct aisle access for so many guests, and those situated at the front of the airplane on the windows have HALF the size of space than others on the aisle because of the configuration. This is not exactly helpful for tall long legged guests. The food was awful, and when I asked for something to not be brought to me because of an allergy, the flight attendants acted almost insulted. They continued to act "insulted" when I asked for a glass of champagne with lunch. They never came to refill my water glass (or any glass), I had to ask for dessert, I had to ask for a bottle of water. Everything. And don't get me started on the state of the bathrooms. Absolutely horrendous conditions. Simply put, you have lost me as a customer forevermore.

The checkin wasnt very clear. First I checked in online, I received an email that it wasnt possible to check in online but I did receive a code for my luggage. Then at the airport the kiosks didnt accept me either and they didn't need the code.. The food and drinks inflight were ok, but the staff wasnt very friendly.

The only problems, the breakfast choices in first class are not good.  I would rather have something normal like the burrito from the menu.  In punta Cana, they do not offload the priority bags first.  Flight attendants were good on this flight.
This was our first real vacation in 32 years and the flight was a horrible way to start
Flight attendant very rude.

The seats were so close that my knees were crushed when the person in front of me leaned back. I'm only 5'6" tall so this was TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE. I had to put my feet into the aisle so my knees were not crushed and then constantly had to move them so as not to impede flight attendant or passenger movement. Totally NOT COMFORTABLE OR RELAXING.

The cabin was way too cold. I had long pants and a long sleeve shirt on and even with multiple blankets felt cold the entire 9 hour flight. Also, disappointed that no meal service was included. Soon I expect to be charged for the air that I breath.

The seats are just too small   I am 5’10” tall and weigh 145 pounds. The knee room is totally insufficient and even my thin frame doesn’t fit between the arm rests. This may be my last year using United. Your seats may be no worse than other airlines, but other than voting with my feet I am powerless.
I upgraded to first class but the food was very poor

Business class passengers had to wait for almost 30 minutes after economy to board due to some broken first class seats. The crew offered $2k compensation for anyone willing to give up their seat and fly coach...this is less than the price of a first class seat! Finally someone volunteered, only to find out that the seat had been finally fixed. Unacceptable given that the flight had arrived from its previous destination almost 6 hours prior.

Incredibly uncomfortable and cramped seating. I had an aisle seat and the middle seat passenger complained every time I moved. As a result, I spent the entire flight turned toward the aisle. This meant flight attendants and passengers were continuously banging into me. A terrible experience. I usually fly Southwest, and there is no comparison.

We flew basic economy and the fact that I cannot check in online is painful.  I AM NOT checking in a bag and nor do I have a carry on.  Not all travelers are MORONS that don't understand this.  Your process is painful for rational traveling public.
Baggage claim wait time was unacceptable and then discovered that luggage was damaged

I had paid for an increase fare class to you use my global upgrade and I was awarded it.  At the gate I was removed from the seat and told in front of everybody that my fare of $1450 was the lowest fare and I was removed from the seat.  I was threatened that if I board and take my seat I would have been forcibly removed from the plane.  I was flying with co-workers and it was the worst service I have had.   I have reached out to customer service on the 20th and I have not heard back.  I paid extra for the flight and have lost the global upgrades within days.  NO One has reached to talk to me or make it right!!
My Personal TV was broken. To me that is not acceptable in a 4 plus hour flight.
Dogs on board???   Sick hacking woman, stinky guy.   There should be screening for sick and stinky people.  No animals !

After boarded the lead flight attendant asked what I would like to drink?  I replied cranberry juice but no ice and a head set when you have a chance, he jotted that down on a piece of paper and went on to another passenger.  But when the cranberry juice was served it contains ice!  Not a big deal, as perhaps this is the way it should be served?  The headset never show up until later on when I requested again from another FA.  The same head flight attendant came and took my lunch order, again he jotted down on a piece of paper but during meal serving I was simply skipped over from the others thus no food was served!  He did replenish my cranberry juice  two times but somehow forgot that I had ordered for food?  I do not recall whether the gentleman sitting next to me had ordered lunch?  Perhaps he did not therefore figured we must have already finished thus no need to be served again?  Since this is a short flight therefore I did not bother to ask about this as I would think he and his colleague would have figured this mistake out?

My son asked the flight attendant (woman, spoke Spanish) for a vegetarian meal, because the "chicken" they offered me was in fact Thai curry chicken and I could not eat it.  She told my son that she would check at the end to see if there were any extra meals and let us know.  She never came back.  How rude and unprofessional.  Even when she passed us, she looked right at us, never mentioned another word about the food.  I was starving until the end of the flight.  Please train your staff properly or hire some competent staff.
The staff at the baggage drop off were not very friendly or professional.  Security staff was rude and two of the flight attendants as well seemed to be miserable.   Not a good impression.

My connecting flight boarding pass wouldn't print and the agent at check-in gave me misinformation. Basically said, because it was a partner airline, the boarding pass won't print. The United Club agent looked at it and told me that was wrong, it wouldn't print because my reservation was all messed up... but she was too busy to actually do anything about it, so suggested I just wait until I get to Tokyo to work it out with the agents there. I spent my 14hr flight stressed about whether or not I would actually be able to make my connection. The way this was handled was completely unacceptable, especially considering the fact that my fare was $7k. Not to mention, this was an issue that I had called in to address TWICE before my flight, both times the agents over the phone said it was resolved (it obviously was not).
The plane was soo dirty numerous seats had trash from the flight before the over head bins where dirty it was just dirty. Everything else was fine. Flight attendant was nice plane just wasn’t clean.
one fligth attendance was very rude
The seats (economy plus) were just not comfortable enough to sleep. That’s a lot of hours without any good sleep

Yes! I found out on printing my ticket that I could not bring any carry on other than a purse, or pay 50.00 to upgrade to standard economy! I was unable to bring my medications in the cabin with me, and had to put them in checked luggage subjecting them to theft or loss (Several have to refrigerated). After calling about this I got many text messages saying my flights had been cancelled. I sat on hold for 30 min while they tried to see why they were cancelled, uncancelled, recancancelled and uncancelled again!! I was forced to totally repack everything hrs before my flight! Upon boarding for my flight, I need extra time due to disabilities. I was asked by the gate attendant "Are you really disabled?" What!? Because I couldn't take my cane D/T to the no carry on rule, I am questioned about my disability! I can barely walk, have a hard time with balance and getting up and down. I have lymph edema, neuorapathy, Diabetes, asthma, and cancer! As an RN (Retired Now) I was horrified by the whole ordeal!
Passengers continue to ‘push the limit’ on carry-on luggage on smaller planes to get around paying luggage fees. This not fair to honest passengers who check their luggage and pay the fees.
There were mechanical issues that were corrected in a timely manner, but during this time the air vents were blowing warm air and many people were complaining is the heat which was uncomfortable.

I paid extra to upgrade to first class and it was a coach experience. United didn’t have enough food in first class. I got stuck with a fruit and cheese plate. I strawberry, 3 pieces of chees, 2 wrapped crackers while everyone else got chicken. The attendant misrepresented the food.  She took my Oder— I was 4 th from last to order. Then she came back and said oh- sorry we ran out of chicken when we got to you. Then proceeded to give the 3 men after me all the chicken. Maybe this sounds petty - but it’s the being lied to I resent. I want my money back.  I work for a division of Warner Bros and I refuse to fly United. Last time I flew in August you lost my luggage. I am sorry I tried you again.
Toilets very worn and missing parts--makeshift fixes.  Seat broken and paper towels inoperable.  Passenger seating is at the lower limits of discomfort, approaching torture.
I do not like how you have to pay extra for a seat. Between baggage and seat charges the cost of flying has gotten very expensive.
Listed preboarding throughout the delay.  No notifications on app, board at airport, or customer rep
Delayed departure due to some confusion over who was on flight or missing.  ???
Flight was delayed because maintenance could not timely repair a pilot seat.  Took an inordinate  amount of time to repair and communication with gate and customers was very poor

I could barely move in my seat and I'm not a big person. The seat in front of me was so close I could barely use my tray. The beverage cart and attendants kept bumping into us all as there was absolutely no room Having no power outlet with the only entertainment option is to access on your device in 2018 on a 5 hour flight is ludicrous.

Just two feedback items for the future, the remote control should not be on the arm rest as elbows easily touch it naturally, please put it on the other tv.  Nothing against united here but orlando airport's security check in setup is awful as the funneled shaped lines draw frustration to flyers.  Some people get to the front 30 minutes before others as the lines are not equal
Flight was delayed for more than 1 hour due to aircraft maintenance. Gates where changed, plane was not cleaned, etc. bottom line not a very pleasant experience.

This was my first time flying with a stop over in Chicago, and from the time I left Phila. to get to Houston, I spent 11.5 hours until I reached home.  Not a pleasant experience- especially with no weather issues!

My flight was the first leg of a flight to Kyiv with the Chicago - Kyiv on Turkish airlines. Despite United and Turkish being members of the Star Alliance I couldn't check in my bags all the way to Kyiv and instead had to take them off at Chicago, haul them over to Terminal 5 and then check-in there on Turkish! Paid USD 100.00 for the bags too. I had one e-ticket number for the whole flight but the United computers wouldn't even show the second leg and hence couldn't even check-in online all the way. Very disappointed and feeling angry.
Only one bathroom in the coach section of the plane was operational.  The one that was working, was a dirty mess.
Cabin was tired looking.  Old and dirty.

Our flight was originally from OKC to Newark transferring through Houston. So far any time we have attempted to transfer through Houston it has been a disaster and our flights have been cancelled or rerouted. Luckily Ray in New Orleans made sure we got rebooked directly from New Orleans preventing us from having to deal with Houston. Never again will we attempt to go through Houston. Houston is awfull and the worst airport to ever travel through.
The AirPort screen had the flight delayed and it was on time because of this we almost lost the flight , gate atendant was very rude to us
Horrible to fly us in a small metal tube with no audio or video or internet for 3 hours, UNREAL for what I paid!

It was too long of a flight to be smashed in a booked plane that was so small! I had a window seat with my back to the bathroom, and half the plane used it during flight. I was uncomfortably smashed in the corner and it gave me anxiety to say the least. A bigger plane should be used for such a long flight.
My husband and I were in the last two rows...but this plane can be very uncomfortable even closer up...too little recline in most seats.   But again no recline in either mine or my husbands

Baggage process was chaotic.  Line was out the door waiting to check in with no United employee to direct passengers.  No one knew they had to check in first at the kiosk, pay the baggage fee, then get back in line and wait for the assistant to call your name.  Causing a 40 min wait to check bag even though you've already got your boarding pass.  Knowing I still had to go through security, I was stressing out that I would miss my flight home.  After my original debacle and missed flight from Newark to Bozeman (due to overbooked flights in Albany).  I had little faith of making it home timely, as my flight out caused over a 12 hour delay to get to destination.  (Confirmation# D7WKDV) .

We had a long check-in line due to a tour group from another country.  I would like to comment on our Jan. 3 trip from Newark to LA.  It was terrible.  The air flow in the cabin was nothing but hot air.  Everyone was over-heated and germs were spread through the hot air ventilation system.  I am susceptible to germs as my immune system is weak, I therefore got a very bad cold and infection due to this issue.  The incredible was they put blankets on each seat as if we were going to freeze....unbelievable!  This is the first time I have ever experience such poor air ventilation on any aircraft.  To fly that long distance with poor ventilation was UNACCEPTABLE and should have been rectified prior to our boarding.  Very Dissatisfied!!
The seatback screens were not very responsive, and the cabin announcements were MUCH louder than the movie soundtracks (to the point of being deafening when announcements were made).
No leg room space even in the sitting upright position. Lowered tray table and it hit my chest. I am 5'10 and 190#. There is no way I could exit the aircraft in an emergency egress.
No room for my carry on, it was hard to get settled while waiting for the flight entire plane to settle before being able to gate check luggage. Ugh
It seems that I have caught a flu on the plane since now, two days later I am sick with fever and cough.
Not sure why I paid an extra $4.50 per checked bag in Punta Cana. I did not have the opportunity to pay in advance as I did from Newark to Punta Cana. Also not informed of the price difference.

I'm a senor who required a wheel chair and I had one small suitecase that I normally take on board with me. This time around since I was in a wheel chair I was forced to check it in and they charged me. I should not have been charged. Others had similar suitecase and they took it on board. Then when I got to the gate they offer "free" check in luggage. It's not right to do that to a sick Senior that was following all the rules.
The plane was dirty, the walls had a dirty appearance.

TSA EXTREMELY RUDE AND INEXCUSABLY ACCUSATORY .  Older male TSA officer told me that the entire hold up in the line was my family’s fault.  Blaming myself and family for their inability to properly handling a patron with medical disabilities.  I expressed my dissatisfaction with his accusations and told a senior officer whom said she would address his terrible conduct.  01/20/2018 @ JAC 11:15 am.  I trainer TSA employees should not be allowed to handle disabled patrons.  Horrible employee conduct.  He should be sent back to training.  He needs education in medical conditions.  Dr. Gregg Taira. 301-793-2546.  Gstaira@gmail.com
Don’t change seats to try to get more passengers. I stopped flying AA because their seats and staff are terrible now.

Food on outbound flight was inedible (chicken on beans and corn). Chips and pretzels on inbound flight was insulting.  No lunch on a 12;45 flight?  Really?  If you are going to degrade service to the point that with a first class revenue ticket I need to buy lunch in the airport why must I discover that fact in the air?

Flight was delayed leaving Mexico City, causing us to miss our connection at Newark to Hartford. Thus, instead of reaching home, and being able to sleep in our own beds, we were marooned in Newark overnight, stretching the discomfort of travel into two days. Ugh.

For an international First Class experience, this was one of the worst United has to offer. The flight was extremely delayed, and it seems ridiculous that United didn't have a spare aircraft in Houston to send over instead of waiting for the old one to be fixed. Thankfully, we didn't have a connection to make, but what about the passengers who did? There were only 2 meal options, and no printed menus were given out. Even the warm nuts were old or stale.

I paid extra to fly with the person I am dating the very first time we went away together. Our seats were confirmed together going from Newark to Belize in first class  but on the way back we couldn’t get seats together on first class together so we paid extra for economy plus. Upon arrival at the airport 3 hours before our flight we were told our seats are not together and I can’t do anything about it so u need to talk to the gate agent. When we got to the gate agent she said she would fix it for us and when the plane stayed to board she still had done nothing for us. When we were told we had to board she she rudely handed my our boarding passes still in separate rows and another desk agent yelled at us that she was never able to have done anything for us since the flight was full and if you want get on the plane take the boarding passes. It was awful experience considering the flight down and vacation (first flight and first vacation together) were outstanding. Left a nasty gross taste in our mouths and it really sucks

Line up at the gate was a bit disorganized. The crew assembled the group corrals late, and then made us stand outside the corrals, instead of in them, thus defeating their purpose, as other people just walked up and cut in front of us where we had been waiting as directed by the crew.
No, but my wifi going out to ORD was horrible.

Far from going the extra mile, the flight attendants were quite rude and inattentive both before and during the flight.  At the gate, they were loudly gossiping and complaining about their schedules / passengers / aircraft delays, etc.   During boarding, an old lady in business class asked one of the attendants for help lifting her luggage. She responded: I'm not going to do that, find a strong man to lift that bag. Turned around and left.   I was in business as well, so I was expecting to have my winter jacket hung up during the flight. It might have slipped the attendants mind, which is fine. When I asked a passing attendant to grab it when she has a moment, she said: no, I'm busy, and left. Finally during taxi, the purser noticed and took it from me. With apologies, to her credit.   During the flight, the attendants again were largely gossiping out front by the cabin, again, loud enough for their complaints to be heard by at least the first few rows of the aircraft.   At the end of the flight, of course I had to ask a fellow passenger to grab my jacket for me.   So quite a poor experience overall.
Need more than dry stale pretzels.  I was so hungry and I hate pretzels.

Awful. Awful. Awful. Ground operations. My son waited where told by an employee and then different employee opened door unto his head and yelled at him. I was enraged and told the employees! Makes me want to use midway
One of my suitcases return from baggage completely destroyed. The entire  front is ripped open.
The problem was my stroller was damaged. How can I make a report to claim with my travel insurance?

Upon the late arrival we were still hoping to catch our connecting flight that was departing in 30 minutes.  Upon touchdown nobody was able to tell us if there was a chance of us catching our connection or if it was possible to delay the plane (since 25% of the connecting flight's passengers were on this delayed flight) so we ran through the airport still hoping to make it in time.  Once we cleared customs and were forced to wait 15-20 minutes for our checked bags to arrive, United agents showed up with hotel vouchers and tickets for an afternoon flight the following day for some members of our group.  For some reason they didn't have anything for my husband and I and the first agent I spoke to was rude and unwilling to investigate or remedy the situation.  A second agent I spoke to later returned with the tickets and a hotel voucher for a hotel different than the others in our group.  Our traveling group of 8 immediately informed the agents (on both sides of the customs gate) that we were not interested in the following day's flight or the hotel vouchers.  Due to family illnesses and other scheduling issues we were not willing to be delayed by the 15+ hours.  We needed to get home as soon as possible and were willing to drive the 3 hours instead of waiting until the following afternoon.  Even though two rental vehicles were going to cost less than the hotel vouchers, no United agent wanted to listen to our requests and offered to do nothing else for us.  Their response of "there's nothing I can do" and you'll have to go to United's website" were not appropriate answers to give passengers stranded at an airport late in the evening who were willing to offer United an alternative, lower cost solution to the problem.  We were all deeply dissatisfied with the customer service we received upon arrival in ORD.

As a global services member I am extremely disappointed that once again I can’t use the upgrade awards you pass around.   I made these reservations months ago and had three legs to my round trip journey and didn’t get updated with my certificates on any of them.   When I booked this flight there were plenty of seats that were open in business class...  very misleading and disappointing
We were told we will receive compensation for the inconvenience of no wi fi availability

Ten minutes before we were supposed to board, we were told the flight would be almost five hours delayed.  We never had received an alert on our phones even though I received an alert to check in so u had all my information.   There was no apology at the gate and the attendants basically just said not our fault.  Unacceptable.   If we had been notified earlier we could have come to the airport later, not gone through security and or had more options.   The hardest part was that since u had our luggage we felt we had no options but to sit there.   We were not given any food vouchers and only given junk food which I do not eat and the food options at that option once through security were limited.  Even once we boarded so many hours later the pilot didn’t apologize and say how sorry United was for our inconvenience.  We missed an important dinner and it was never even acknowledged that people might have had plans.  Once we were approaching the landing he pilot did apologize for getting us home late but we were not treated like valuable customers during the entire delay we were treated like u didn’t care about us.    While I understand mechanical problems happen, they seem the norm on airlines lately and if there is a delay I would expect much better communication in this day and age and compassion.  Also if I was announcing a five hour delay I would immediately offer things to make that delay more palatable and I would make sure my staff was sympathetic and apologetic first an foremost and that the passengers were made to feel like United actually cared.   Even the passengers who had connections weren’t given the kindness they deserved.   While mechanical problems happen, they should not be the norm and when they happen it’s thhe way airlines handle it that makes u respect or dislike an airline.    United failed for this one
Excuse you.  You want my opinion after a 5 hour delay.  Very dissatisfied.

I was delayed 5hours at the west palm airport with very little info from the gate attendants. I got most of my info from your United app. As a mileage plus member this was the second delayed flight in the last two I took. Both for mechanical difficulty. Very disappointing.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: Flight attendants were not too good either, they didn't even bother picking up trash until the end.  Really bad service.  Bad experience.

It was a shame that only one type of meal was available since there were only 6 pieces of Salmon on board for a first class seating of 20. Additionally, they ran out of Vodka as well... which if you sit in the 5th row, leaves you with a second class feeling. This is a shame because we purchased our tickets rather than being upgraded by mileage. Just a bit of a disappointment for us.

The bathroom is a disgrace.  No room to maneuver, can’t bend down to clean others mess, no water from faucet.  Your CEO should use it for 2 days and I’m sure he would implement changes next time feasible.

Could not get boarding pass on line at hotel, why? The security process leaving Aruba was terrible.  THe check in, airport entry, Aruba process out, USA customs process, all combined for a very poor and to long (time and lines) experience.
1st class seats in row 5 did not recline very much. Disappointed that the extra fare did not provide extra comfort.....and certainly not any special food. And, only 1 choice for row 5.
Airplane was inside in a bad shape - looked as it would be 20 years old...
The boarding process was extremely chaotic because they did not have a separate boarding process for first class instead grouping all of Class 1 and 2 together.
Air smelled faintly of vomit when boarding and initially seated. Disappated over time but still enough to be unpleasant.
Worst gate experience of my life, way too little room and gate for so many people

The experience was horrible!!! The scales that weigh the luggage was rigged!! no doubt about it..I removed stuff from my luggage snd it weighed more after! Also trested us with such disrespect when we wanted to pay for our luggage in cash instead of debit..telling us our wait is now gonna have to be longer..Our son is special needs and they handled our situation horribly..i want to put a complaint about the staff at the airport..the technician for the equipment and the luggage handlers!!

one flight attendant in particular was extremely rude and essentially didn't want to perform her job. Complained about any request and used poor body language to show she was displeased in general when doing tasks like handing out water when requested.

Had to pay the extra to move up to Business Class.  The legroom in economy seem even smaller than before.  The flight attendants did not have a friendly attitude.  They did not seem happy to be there.

The flight attendants really are not friendly and are poorly made up.  Women’s hair and makeup is a mess and they are not friendly at all.  Men were fine. I could never think of going to work looking the way they did and act as if asking for something from them is A bother.  If they dislike their job I am sure they can find a position that does not deal with the public.  Maybe an office job?

I was very upset that my bag was not put on the plane. I received a text on landing that my bag was placed on the next flight. This was a very big inconvenience and was unacceptable. The bag was checked in over 1 and a half hours before the flight.
We were in row ten and  light attendant have no pretzels or anything left. And did not have a smile on her face at all.  And this flight was delayed one hour and 20 minutes. Everyone was hungry
Very disappointed in the way I was treated during luggage check in. Flight delayed over one hour. Reason was maintance. No updates until boarding
The aircraft was so dirty and shabby that it smelled bad.  The staff seemed largely indifferent except for one nice steward
the negative was we had to wait for almost an hour for our luggage at ORD. That is way too long, especially at 8pm.
I was disappointed that I could not buy a meal. I was the next aisle after 1st class and while they were dining I was starving.

W e spent over 8 hours at the airport in St. Lucia on January 20, much of it in stifling heat in a small area we were supposed to wait in to retrieve our luggage.  The conditions were prison like.  Everyone was dripping in sweat.   After finally getting our luggage , we were forced to stand in another line for 3+ hours to get hotel vouchers.   I gave up and made my own hotel arrangements.   This was competely unacceptable and unhealthy for everyone involved.

Original flight on 1-20-18 was cancelled due to mechanical problems. Airport and United staff did a horrible job of handling the announcement and then the details of where to go/what to do. Absolutely horrible. Fortunately nobody seemed to have gotten hurt, but the chaotic scene at the gate was really bad. And it could have easily been averted by staff members with training and common sense.

When the incoming plane arrived at St. Lucia which was to take us back to Chicago we were advised that the plane required maintenance.   From that point on there was no communication from any United Airlines staff.   We waited hours in a terminal that virtually had no air conditions and was extremely hot.   No United rep ever came to tell us what the problem was, St. Lucia airport staff told us nothing and then the flight was cancelled.   United did a great job of finding us a hotel to stay in but unfortunately it was an hour and a half away from the airport.   All said and done all the other flyers said that the worst but of this snafu was the fact that there was no communication from United as to what was happening during our ordeal.  This was a complete failure on Uniteds part, and very disappointing.

We were left for 2 hours in a terminal that was 100 degrees for 2+ on top of the normal waiting time after the flight was canceled. The United gate attendant was an idiot and would not tell us what was happening so no one had any info.  When they let us out we had to wait in another huge line for hotel vouchers. After a 1 hour 45 minutes busride we got to hotel after 830pm.  The hotel was not equipped and many people were not able to get any food until 10:30pm.  After a 12 hour travel day United sent the buses back for us at 9:15 to return to airport for 1:30 flight we once again had to wait for for 3 hours trapped in a one room terminal that has no air and feels like 100 degrees.  I’m not exaggerating since all of the men’s shirts were soaking wet.   I asked the gate agent for good vouchers since we would have nothing since breakfast until a late dinner. She said NO. We would be provided food and drinks on the plane ride home. Problem is no one told the flight attendants that so there was no complimentary food or drinks. Just soda. Another 12 hour day with one meal.  The supervisor in St Lucia lied or was too lazy to check or didn’t given a crap.  We were so poorly handled. United thinks they are so great by offering us $200 voucher.  That is a joke. It cost me that in extra money/ childcare and lost wages.  I am not happy.  Mechanical difficulties happen but they handled the problem very poorly.

An unwillingness to seat (together) two full fare paying customers It is extremely poor customer service.  To be told the only available seats (seated together) were in priority plus, for an additional charge was inconsiderate, greedy and lack costomer focus.

I fly on Frontier & Spirit from Denver all the time. I carry on an under the seat bag and a computer bag  on most flights with no additional charge. Your gate agent charged me for my bag and checked it in with the rest of the luggage under the plane. I probably will not fly United again because of your baggage policy. Also your flight attendants gave water to the first 10 rows . I was in row 18 and did not get any service. I expect that from Spirit but I have always considered United a full service airlines, but no more.

I was a bit surprised the flight attendants didnt do a final safety check prior to landing; there were seats reclined, people with baggage and canes at their feet; cabin lights not dimmed; crew bags in the last row of the main cabin on the seats (not secured) and in the aisle/row on the floor not tucked under the seats; it was a little shocking  considering the cabin staff were pleasant enough and accommodating during the flight; they just seemed to be young and not quite at the level in terms of safety Ive seen with other UA/CO crews; def a reminder that passengers look to them to handle emergencies and quite honestly I didnt have much confidence in their abilities; I believe it was the end of their trip and they appeared  to be over it at this point; just to fully disclose, Im a former flight attendant/FSM/Inflight instructor and Inflight Supervisor for CO so I pay attention to these details; Im not looking to get them in serious trouble, I just think they need a little reminder and closer supervision

Your staff in Bon aire was ill trained. Self check in was not working employees had us standing outside the line are for an hour as they could not get there stuff together. I attempted to upgrade to first class. The new employee did not not know what she was doing and did not ask for help till it was to late. When I asked for First class she charged me $89 for Economy plus. When I saw the ticket and asked why it was incorrect she looked confused. She then refunded my $89 and charged me $119 for first class upgrade. This was for the wrong flight it was for the newark miami flight. She then proceeded to refund the $119 without my knowledge or consent. Then finally charged me for the correct flight. The boarding process at the gate was another disastor. Your flight attendant in fist class was blatantly staring at me as I waited for service using the call button for 15minutes as she was talking and eating with another crew member.

Tyhe United Club disallowed my wife, an Elite with nearly 2M miles, from bring me into the EWR club! Longina Phillips, my wife, was returning to SYD 2 days hence, but no flexibility is really quite stupid!

Our flight was delayed leaving Des Moines to Chicago. Upon arrival we were able to make our flight to a Key West, but our baggage did not make the flight. Our baggage arrived at 8pm the following day. We were offered no compensation for the lost bags

While the seats were not very comfortable, our decision sit in aisle seats, one in front of the other, saved our sanity.  We have had difficulty with people being unwilling to keep their seat backs in the upright position, which has caused much pain on my husband’s knees, which already touch the seat in front.  Is there something we can do to keep people from leaning their seats back?

1. The plane smelled really bad!! 2. It was very small and cramped up!! 3. They ran out food and snacks!! 4. The staff weren't pleasant!! 5. Overall this wasn't a good flight for family and I!!!  You guys need to do a better job on customer service, as supposed to keep charging and rasing the prices up!!!

I was disappointed in the time before United decided to substitute another aircraft for the one that was having a comm problem.  Also, the gate agent was not very informative keeping us advised of what was going on with the problem, and the announcement of the gate change left us wondering after hearing only "Flight to Milwaukee F 11."
THere was an awful smell of jet fuel in the back of the plane.    It was very harsh on lungs breathing.   It disappated after take off but was not good.   There were a lot of children on the plane.
I flew first class and the dinner was horrible, I could not eat it.  It was cold and the salmon had a bad taste so I did not eat it.
They took my carry on and checked it. It met the requirements but let others take even larger bags on the plane my prescriptions were in there and they didn’t care after I told them that

The only problem we experienced is that there was a Cat on board in the seat behind ours and both my wife and I are allergic to cats. We have both suffered from allergic reactions for the last three days, we are now on the recovery side but it caused us much discomfort and unexpected expense.  We would have said something to the flight attendants but we did not see or hear the cat until we were in the air. Because cat hair is notorious for causing allergies, where I put responsibility on United is to notify passengers that an animal is on board and allow concerned passengers to take alternative steps. We would have selected a different flight to complete our journey because we are highly allergic to cat hair.  I hope you understand our concern and look forward to hearing from you.
I was VERY unhappy after running to the gate lasted on my Boarding Pass to discover it had been moved. I *BARELY* made it and I am an older, heavy guy and this was an awful experience!!!
We flew with brand new luggage.  My wife's luggage was damaged.  Very disappointing.

I was traveling with my grandmother and on her iterinary it states she needs a wheelchair from the moment she arrives to the point where she boards the plane. The was not a wheel- chair or attendant waiting for her at EWR airport nor at the fll airport. I hope they will be one for her on our return the 27th of January. I was really upset cause my grandmother has difficulty breathing and she also has torn cartiledge so it becomes difficult for her to walk the distance.
Was given wrong snack box. Was not asked if I wanted a receipt and when I requested was told it would be emailed (it wasn’t). Now I can’t expense the meal for work. Flight was approx 30 mins delayed.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Our gate was changed but never updated on the app. The security process was redundant with no logical process. (Likely not anything to do with you guys.) Self check in with bags is unnecessary and time consuming. Leg room is atrocious! I'm 5'4" and barely had room to move. My husband is 6'2" and his knees were digging into the back of the seat in front of him with the seat pocket metal bar jabbing into his knee caps. (I fear flying with my 15 yo who has longer legs than his father.) the outlet was great to have but very difficult to access especially since you have no room to move in your seat. Why don't you get the full can of soda any longer? The flight attendant who was passing out snacks forgot to give my husband and I pretzels yet served the woman next to us. I also do not understand why airlines charge for 1 checked bag especially when you are flying out of the country.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Awful experience in Aruba.   No gate, no organization.   It took over 3.5 hours to get  through security customs, etc., to our R9 Gate which did exist.   Never ate or hydrated.   Aruba to EWR is a wicked mess.   I probably will never go there again.

Flight attendant was rude. I asked for water and hot tea. He gave me the water and moved on. I asked 2 more times for tea before he gave it to me with a comment and then ignored my request for sugar before moving away.

Shanghai-Newark is a very long flight and probably one of the most expensive tickets to buy. It is not acceptable that you keep running very old planes on this route. Ironically you are advertising the new Polaris business class experience, and on the ONE flight where you expect it, you find an old, uncomfortable plane. Not acceptable United! Also, if you are flying Business class and you tag the luggage priority, why was my luggage among the LAST ones to show up? Not acceptable United.

Your boarding procedure is overly burdensome to your customers. In addition, for the last 3 flights your gate agents have announced that there is no overhead storage room and forced passengers to check bags when upon boarding there is plenty of room available. This deceit is disgusting.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: security situation at airport leaving aruba on 1/20 in the afternoon was ridiculous - too many flights scheduled within too compressed schedule. Disorganized unfair lines, not enough room to line-up. Awful. Never again for us.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Aruba terminal experience is horrible.  Extensive delays in processes leading up to gate.

On flight from Newark to LA on 1/11/18 flight was late to leave by 30 minutes, in part due to in air entertainment system not working properly. Once in air half of plane had screens to watch, my side of plane had no screens, no TV or movies to watch. On flight from LA to Newark the prior flight from Houston landed late, took forever to deplane, and we boarded perhaps 45 minutes late, and it took even longer to get airborne, and we landed at least 30-45 minutes late. this is the first time that i experienced issues with timeliness on both ends of a cross country flight, and none of your questions in your survey remotely covered these issues. Due to previous flight being late our flight was not properly cleaned, plane smelled, bathrooms got dirty very quickly, and attendants were not as courteous as usual.

I consistently experience bad experience with luggage at Miami airport. It took almost 45 minutes after touch down to get 1st bag. I was talking to other passengers while I was waiting and they all experience long delays for baggage to arrive at Miami airport.
Paid for priority pass for check-in, but was directed to economy, despite clear sign for priority pass check in. Snacks for economy consisted of bun or rice crackers - not a great choice.
Seat in Economy plus was not able to decline, which is bad on a 14 hour flight

The airport experience in Shanghai was not pleasant. There were a lot of staff present but the baggage check line was not open. Then I was not given clear instructions at all when asked to review my luggage.  It was confusing and not handled well at all. I expect more from United staff no matter which country I am in.
Everything was fine but Ive flown to Beijing 2x in the last month and the film selection is getting tired how often do you change it??

On my flight (1676) from EWR to LIR on Sat. 1/13/18 with United. I left my Kindle Paperwhite in the seat back of the seat in front of me. I realized this as soon as I passed customs. I immediately went to the United desk. The plane was still at the gate and had not even begun boarding for the return flight yet, but no one would check for my reader. I was told to file a claim with United but given no email address or phone number for such claim. Overall, I am very disappointed with that experience!

Boarding process was a sad joke.   But the biggest failure by United was to fail to cater a 5PM, 5-hour flight.  The cabin attendants were a joke -- never offered snack boxes to Economy+ (my seats at a 1K and two Platinums in row 12 D-F and none of us were offered.  When i went back to ask if there was anything available, the two attendants said "they only gave us 8 sandwiches".  I asked if there was anything else and they said "maybe".  Then ordered me to stand back in the aisle.  They opened the locker and there were at least a dozen boxes, so i bought one.  They never offered the others to anyone, but i told nearby passengers who went back individually.  The attendants offered one beverage service and one water run.  Bad attitude, bad supervision, bad service, bad flight.  Another horrible job by United.  Jeremiah Riddle ND934591
Seats were reassigned  Lost economy plus Had to get new, but worse, seats at gate

This was supposed to be a short flight (45 minutes). We arrived in Newark and had to wait on the airplane for an hour for a gate to open up. This is ridiculous. People missed their flights. Shouldn't there be an alternative plan for this?
Seats are too small. Economy class is ridiculous. Charging for carry-on luggage and my first checked bag is not appreciated. It will keep me from flying when I can.

I am very displeased with the service we were given in regards to our baggage. My car seat was damaged on our flight, I was told a toxic substance was spilled on it, and it was unsafe for my child. I filed a claim, but was told I could get a loaner at the airport. Upon landing and speaking with a baggage representative, I was told they could not give me a loaner car seat because a claim takes 30 days. I asked what the suggestion was to get my child home and was told that they couldn’t help me. I couldn’t put my child in the car seat with toxic substance all over it, but I also couldn’t get a loaner car seat. We were forced to drive home illegally with my infant on my lap instead of safely in a car seat. This is absolutely ridiculous.
Seat 28D..TV broken and seat on bottom left uneven and uncomfortable

The ORD-LAX leg of this reservation on 1/18/18 was a HORRIBLE experience. The TV control system was not functional- I could not turn the TV off so I had to endure watching the advertising clips over and over again. The crew were not helpful. I asked for a red wine which was not available for purchase. Crammed spaces. No overhead space. HORRIFIC flight overall.

The flight had no snacks and no food for purchase. This is unacceptable. It's not enough that we are nickeled and dimed for everything, the least an airline could do is make sure that the few "luxuries" customers do get are available during the flight. There was no Direct tv or wifi. and to top it off my luggage was damaged in transit.
FELT LIKE THE STEWARDS WERE NOT IN THE BEST MOOD AND THE NO FOOD ON A FLIGHT THAT LEAVES AT 545 SHOULD HAVE FOOD ALSO PEOPLE BRINGING ON LYGGAGE ARE JUST ABUSING IT AND THROWING STUFF IN THE CABINS

Old out of date plane. Terrible uncomfortable seat. My rump hurt after an hr. Food uneatable. No TV. Pilot was good. flight crew did the min. Not worth the money in any way. Would not use your airline if anyone else flew direct to Las Vegas. I may even take a flt with a stop next time.
Old format business class seems so dated. Overheads don't fit luggage, seating area seems too close to neighbor with no privacy.  Need to upgrade to new format.
It was extremely cold on the flight and very uncomfortable due to that. IT was just freezing

Hi, I was travelling with my wife and my daughter, she is an infant of seven months, no attention at all was reserved to the baby. not in the airport and not in a plane. I will never travel again with your company and I will use all the social to tell to everybody my bad experience with united.  sorry about that, but there is no excuse for the worst treatment you give to us.
My flight was pleasant, but it is what occurred prior to me boarding my flight is what is disturbing to me.

My wheelchair was damaged again for the second time in just over a month. While the repairs from the first damage aren't even fixed yet I now have to file another claim for further damage to my chair. Also my checked bag went through a TSA inspection and the locks were never put back on my secured bag. Leaving my medical equipment and expensive video equipment unsecured. Very displeased with my experience.

Security was completely unprofessional and almost lost my shoes, coat, and wallet because they pushed one of my bins through without the other but wouldn’t let me go through the xray machine until ten other bins separated my first and second bin. At this point my shoes, coat, and wallet were taken behind the divider to be inspected but as the divider was transparent I saw that nobody actually inspected it and my belongings just sat there for 15 minutes before being returned to me. As for the flight itself I was in an aisle seat, which I don’t typically mind, but the man sitting in the middle seat was seated separate from his family so he got up seven times during a three hour flight to go and mingle with them which was expressly irritating because he knocked my things out of my seat each time he had me stand up so he could get in and out. The attendants did nothing about it, despite many of his excursions occurring while the fasten seatbelt sign was lit. The flight was probably the least restful one I’ve ever had and security was probably the least professional I’ve ever had.
The food was horrible
Just that the flight was delayed in Chicago and my baggage arrived damaged to Monterrey.
Delayed delayed delayed.  The departure time kept getting pushed back.

I was disappointed the the “Polaris” experience. You made it seem as though I would have the seat (individual pod type) shown on ur Polaris website. However this Polaris was no different than Business /First I have flown in the past. The blanket and pillow were not that much more special than in the past and the meal was actually lessor quality than what I have had in the past. Basically all you did was change the name from Business/First to Polaris. Very disappointing.
One male flight attendant was particularly rude. Told us to be patient after we had already waited 2hours. Without hearing any feedback about the problem we had informed them about.
My disappointment is that I don’t think the fasten seatbelt sign was off for more than 15 minutes at a time.  Very hard to get up and use the bathroom when it keeps being lit

The plane for a trans Atlantic flight was very small. I had recently undergone spinal surgery and was shocked at the size of the plane. Getting in and out of my seat was difficult. The plane was also incredibly hot. So hot it actually melted a family sized bar of chocolate. There was also no food/drink menu to help with my choice.

I almost died trying to get to the gate because I didn't realize it was so far from the TSA Check point and my flight was leaving.  Was over at American airline looking for keys I left from a prior flight and after waiting 45mins for a manager to come check the lost and found my aircraft had already started boarding.  Had to take a train to the terminal.  Going through TSA was fairly easy but then I had to go down starts walk a 1/2 mile then go up stairs and my gate was all the way at the end.  My asthma was getting bad literally had to ask a young lady pushing a empty wheel chair for assistance and she tanned to the gate which was a minute pass the boarding cut off but they still had the door open and let me on.  At that point I was having a full blown asthma attack.  But everyone was so assisting especially the flight attendants they came off the plane and ask if I need water and said they can get me a straightback wheel chair to board me.  I explained I just needed to use my inhaler and sit for a bit and my asthma attack would decline.  I was allowed to sit in a exit row and mild air a flight attendant checked on me.
