They was very attentive the entire flight especially the older lady of them all.  I felt like if something was going to happen they wasn't going to let it.  Put me at ease I ordered a movie got a snack and the rest of the flight was smooth.  I will be traveling united for now on
My bag did not arrive , I had to spend a night in a hotel wait around for my bag to get home, no explaination of what happened, and not happy because of the extra costs incurred

I had the worst flight attendant in my entire flight experience. Arrogant. Red haired, thin, young, male. If there was a name on his tag it was turned so it couldn't be read. He had me put my purse (NOT OVERSIZED) in the overhead, while other passengers had similar sized items on their lap. Never smiled once - so unlike normal United flight crews. Bad reflection on United.

I arrived at La Guardia Airport at 1240pm on January 20th. My flight was scheduled to depart at 2:20pm. I checked my bags and paid $25 for my first checked bag and $35 for my second checked bag. They were each under the 50 pound limit. My fellow passengers and I boarded Flight UA745 but we never left the ground because of "break problems." Long story short, passengers were told to deboard and meet with customer service to arrange alternative transortation on a different flight. Because there were no flights at La Guardia going to my destination United Airlines customer service ended up shuttling me to Newark Airport. That same day, I checked into flight UA506 at Newark Airport. This is when things started to really become aggravating and extremely frustrating for me. When United Airlines weighed my same two bags at Newark Airport they suddendly became more than 3 pounds each OVERWEIGHT. I had no added ANYTHING AT ALL to my bags before weighing them at Newark. Not only had my flight been delayed ans I was going to have to stay overnight in San Francisco in order to make my connection to Redmond Oregon the next day but now I was repeatedly being told by a United Airlines representative that I had added to the weight of both of my suitcases on the trip inbetween La Guardia and Newark Airports!!!! He also repeatedly said that I would have to pay $200 for my suddenly overweight luggages. I didnt have any problems in La Guardia checking in my bags but so much trouble in Newark. While I was still at the counter protesting against this United Airlines representatives demands, I called United Airlines customer service and spoke to a supervisor. She said she agreed with me and in order not to miss my flight she instructed me to transfer all of my "overweight" items into a single suitcase and be charged one overweight fee instead of two. She also told me to file a complaint about this as soon as you can and you will be reimbursed for the $100 excess weight fee.  After this experience  I wasnt happy at all and vow to never fly United Airlines again until this situation is handled properly
Condensation or somerring else leaked from overhead light area in front on my row.  Didn't appreciate the liquid splashing backward on me.  Attendants did dry the area with napkins.

A number of emergency exit row seats were left unfilled as United has dangerously decided to monetize them.     ((on the flight from Boston to Newark on the 13th January ALL were empty!) >>After the plane  ditching on the Hudson  and my colleagues description of how important the exit row passengers were in assisting the deplaning I am very concerned about  the emergency exit rows<<<   gbuckley@fas.harvard.edu 164 Renfrew St.,  Arlington, Mass. 02476
The plane was old seats were ripped and the plane looked dirty plus we had to walk outside and take a bus when we deplaned which I did not like
Food was not nice just a mix of things not sure of what it really was
Food was really bad.  i didnt eat any of it.  flight attendents did not provide much service at all.

This is the first time I’ve experienced the flight attendants being inattentive. They completely skipped over my husband while serving the first meal, and then when he asked for it gave him tremendous negative attitude. They were not available for cleanup as much as was necessary.
Food was horrible. Snacks were the worst
I travel to India alot - can you have a food option that doesn't taste like Indian food? I don't understand why we are forced to eat Indian food going & coming back from India.

I think you'll believe in starving the passengers. The hostesses have been quite rude in my past travels on United. This idea of just having self serve snacks in the back is highly unacceptable. There should be a hot breakfast served on the plane on such a long flight.
TELL YOU CABIN STAFF IT IS THERI JOB TO BE EHLPOFUL TO PEOPLE AND NOT SIT IN THE BACK ROOM AND CHIT CHAT AS IF THEY ARE ON VACATION, VERY POOR PERFORMANCE.
Yes...the amount of money to pay for baggage was rediculous. Our guitar was damaged. It was a nitemare flying with you guys

Our child car seat was delayed almost 36 hours. The first caused appeared to be the Houston Oversized baggage agent who showed no urgency to to get our bags on the plane.  He didn't check the flight bag tag to see when the flight was leaving.  When we told him the flight was leaving in just 30 to 40 minutes just waved us off.    The second problem was the baggage delivery service.  The were very delayed in both the pick up and delivery of the bags.  Although, the folks on your premier baggage line were friendly and tried to be helpful - there was nothing they could do because the delivery company would not respond to phone calls.  One of the agents who tried to call the delivery company for us told me he hasn't been able to reach the company by phone since the beginning of the year.  There seems to be a problem with the arrangement that you have with the delivery company.
The seats were so hard. They killed my back. Disappointing since everything else was great.
Gate area is poor.  Way too small.  No bathroom beyond security.  No jet bridge.

The flight was changed because of a text received on 01/20 at 10 pm.  The replacement flight would have us missing our cruise.  Our bags had extensive damage.  When friends and family ask about our cruise we will include the nightmare that United provided.  We traveled in a group of 8 and they will also express their displeasure to everyone.  Our return flight ended up being cancelled we missed an important meeting on Monday.  Just pathetic.

Waited 40+ minutes for our bags. It’s too long.  Otherwise flight was fine. TSA at ewr on the outbound on 1/18 was a disaster. I’m sure people missed their flights. That experience alone would drive me away from booking UA out of EWR in the future. It was terrible.
There was no personal device entertainment on my flight. I'm not sure why, as this flight was over 4 hours. Disappointing
One of the most unfriendly flight attendants I've ever experienced, she was equally curt to everyone, so bad it was almost funny.

I sent in messages on twitter while I was on flight. I paid for a first class seat and the flight attendant was unbelievably rude. She offered me two breakfasts- I chose the vegetarian option and she said- “oh actually I can’t give that to you, you aren’t a preferred customer” I then asked her for anything that was vegetarian and she flicked the pamphlet at me and said- “you can look for some snacks” it was so off putting and I was completely embarrassed by how awful she was treating me. I had dirty silverware for the “tray” without breakfast she sat in front of me.  The whole experience was pretty awful.

I waited in combined line for Groups 3,4,5 as indicated on sign. First on line thanks to 20 minutes standing. When it came time to board, agent insisted that myself and several others move to the back of the line to let Group 3 pass, losing our spot at front of Groups 4 & 5, even though there was plenty of room for Group 3 people to pass.  When we pointed out that we did as instructed he made us stand off to side and wait for all Group 4 without bags and threatened not to let us on at all.  Thought United better trained staff since dragging passenger off a flight but doesn't appear so.  Disgrace in the skies. A shame that such a good airline turned so bad.

Although the plane was clean, the seats were not very comfortable. Your flight attendants were professional, I recognize that their job is hard and stressful, however they could work on their customer service and people skills.
The aircraft was a 50 seat RJ. Very uncomfortable and cramped. Flt was delayed into Newark for no reason. No wx, but still an ATC delay
at 6'2" 225 lbs, I am not exactly a giant. Seats are terribly uncomfortable.
There wasn't any free entertainment or food available. Every other international light I have had has had this service as a complimentary item. I was very disappointed about this aspect

There was something wrong mechanically with the first plane we boarded and the maintenance was going to take longer than anticipated. The flight left almost 2 hours later than anticipated and that was unexpected but we were able to get on another plane that had no issues and the flight was fine. I feel that maintenance checks should be done a little sooner than take off to avoid delays in flight. There were multiple people on the flight that had connections two other places and or to catch a cruise and those things are timed. I know that some things are not in our control but I feel the delay could have been avoided if the checks were done sooner.

The food in first class was atrocious. For breakfast, a " deli sandwich"  was inedible. It was the worst food I have ever been served in over 40 years of flying.  Besides, at 8am in the morning, this is not breakfast food.

The women who was checking tickets before boarding was extremely rude. I have a normal size carry on bag and was the 1st person in line for group 2. She told me that I would have to check the bag as it was too big. I then told her that I fly all over the US and never once had this problem. She again, said it was too big. I placed it in the bag holder and showed her that it fit. This was after back and forth and other people on line having to pass me. Once on the place there were bags double my size in the overhead. I felt like she picked me out of the crowd and I was embarrassed and she was rude.

Never spoke my name or recognized my Global status also stopped my wife and told she should check her legally sized carryon!!! Only person the female flight attendant stopped and I had to tell her she was wrong and I was Global Services and I put the carryone long way into the space without problem! Why the flight attendant picked out my wife when everyone else was carrying oversized carryons I do not know
There were only drinks served, not even a free small snack. I find this very disappointing.
Flight attendant Marie was impatient & very unpleasant when asked about available food options. Many items in the menu were not available.

The seat and surrounding area was dirty. I had to wipe everything down before using it. Spills of some type of fluids were on the seat, tray table and the seat pocket. Dirt and Food crumbs were on the floor.

There was much confusion as to which baggage claim area we were supposed to go to.  I find the seats quite uncomfortable, very hard and curved forward,  and miss the pillows. ps... I sat in Extra Comfort!
Flight attendants were okay not the best like ANA

You jam seats so tightly in these new aircrafts that an average person can’t even fit! Especially for a coast to coast trip, and everyone is trying to understand why US travelers are so angry. I was and still am in back pain from this 6 hour trip, horrible!
Seating has gotten tighter! Crying children. No TV except for payment. Very sad

The major reason for our for our dissatisfaction, was the condition of one piece of our luggage.  When we got to San Juan it looked like a gorilla (like that old commercial) had stomped all over it.  The piece was dirty and ripped.  One the return flight, when we got to Pittsburgh, that piece was damaged EVEN MORE!  The pull up handle was broken and will not pull out anymore! That piece is useless now and we'll have to buy a new one.
Smallest business class seats that I ever encountered.  AWFUL. No space at all. You should be ashamed. Coach worse

Yes, your seats in coach (where we ended up even though we booked and paid for 1st class ) totally sucked. They were without a doubt the worst seats for comfort I have ever been in  with 30 years flying under my belt. The landing at ORD ( chicago) was pretty bad. The plane hit the runway pretty hard and bounced and then tried stopping really fast. ( Probably "land and hold short" instructions from the tower. Yes I know about LAHS landings because I too am a pilot .  I was most displeased however about losing my 1st class reservation because you had faulty equipment which caused a delay getting the plane to Honolulu in the first place which in turn caused us to miss our connecting flight out of SFO, which in turn ended up in our being in coach because there were no more 1st class seats available on the flight we got stuck on. This is the 2nd time we have had problems with United equipment problems coming home from Hawaii. The last time we were stranded in Honolulu for 3 days to fend for ourselves. I am not a happy camper with United and will make sure I let everyone I know about this poor experience. I will also be considering other ways to get to and from Honolulu from now on.

I travel alot and unfortunately due to this horrible experience aboard your aircraft by Yvette and flight crew I will not chose anothwr flight in the future my return ticket is first class I will be trying to cancel that and fly with another airline carrier who places passenger and customer service as a priority

When I check in on the app, you ask if I want to buy a bunch of extras.  I say no. When I use the annoying the kiosk to check a bag, you ask the same questions again.  This slows an already slow process.  I expect you response to this comment will be to offer even more extras on both the app and the bag check kiosk.  At least I’m setting a low bar
Quality of food was very bad.  The plane was relatively new and clean but the food was inferior to Delta. And even inferior to American, which I would heretofore have thought impossible.
smallest ass plane i ever been on negative legroom

The lack of in flight entertainment was disappointing. Having to pay for DirectTV was upsetting. It is free on Jet Blue. Also there was no personal device entertainment so I could not continue watching the movie I was watching on my first flight which was annoying.

Actually this is more regarding many flights. Especially where they have touchscreens in the headrest of the seats. Some folks just don't get it, and in stead of a gentle touch to the screen, they tap it real hard, making the person in front getting very annoyed by all the head bumping going on behind him. Know what I mean?  Besides that, sometimes the screens do NOT respond to a simple touch, either the fingers are greasy or the screens are dirty, and should be cleaned regularly.

Get it together. I changed gates three times in 45 minutes across two separate terminals (B to C). No matter how early I try checking in I am always in boarding group 4. Boarding groups at the final gate from which we departed had groups 3-4&5 in one line, but the gate staff had us load as separate groups, causing all sorts of chaos at the gate and the line. Security gate staff at the front ticketing area wanted all bags consolidated before reaching the departure gate which made finding and producing documents and tickets much more problematic when you reached the TSA agent 5 minutes later. And also made NO SENSE since I have to unpack everything again to place on the xray machine. Stupid and without thought to process.
Legroom not enough for tall people. Knee pain
Horrible.  We left the gate and taxied around the airport for 20 minutes.  We left late and arrived in St. Louis late.  Unacceptable.

I'm hoping someone in management get to read this. I have flown 7 different airlines all over the globe and United is not good compare to the others. Your business class service is below economy service on other airlines. On this flight specifically, the flight attendants were terrible, I felt I was bothering them all flight long. No smiles, attitude. Really a poor performance.
when in Chicago check in was hectic no person to check you in only the kiosk. machine also didn't take cash I had to buy a visa debit for 5$. I know now but that was frustrating
the food was terrible and not worthy of serving

Flight attendant told me that my breakfast choice would not be available, even though I was the 2nd person that she asked.  I then noticed that she offered both choices to everyone else in business class.  Everyone else got their choice...I did not, even though I was the second person whose order she took.  Sexist?  Ageist?  Racist?  Hard to tell.

Reason for the overall negative review is because I was required to pay for my checked luggage when I had already paid the fee at the beginning of my numerous flights.  Why am I financially penalized for not being able to able to connect flights in what your company deems a timely manner.  You make the flight schedules, not me.  And trust me, I would much rather not have long layovers.  It is my opinion that this was nothing but a cash grab and has completely soured me on booking via your airline and would not recommend your airline to others.  Refund my second baggage payment of $25USD and I may rethink my negativel opinion.

The one thing that annoyed me to no end was the amount of items in business class that were wrapped in plastic. Even the pen was in plastic. Its a total disregard for the environment. I'm not a freak about the environment but it was so overboard and made so much trash in a small space. The other thing is that other countries have the stewardesses pull their hair back in buns and it looks so much better. These stewardesses and this wild wavy hair back in pony tails and we are really behind on this in the states. You can spot a US stewardess from a mile away bc they look like hell. HELL. Truly. The chic factor is totally missing. And, the food was gross.
The seats are HARD as a rock.  Also, one of the flight attendants seemed tired and kept jamming the beverage cart into various seats at such moment that I was worried it might loosen it lol.
How is it right that o went out of my way to reserve 3D a solo middle seat in first class and was moved to 7A against the freezing window and close to the loud kitchen.    Unfair!!!

I flew first class and the breakfast meal was not good, wi-fi didn't work for almost 3 hours and there was no tv, movies, etc. I did not get the value of flying first class on this antiquated plane. Your competition is way ahead of you when it comes to flying first class.

Yes. The flight attendant was the most unfriendly and sour faced one I have ever encountered. He never cracked a smile and was downright unpleasant. When I boarded the plane he didn’t even say hello. Throughout the flight he was frowning the whole time. Unacceptable.

Check in experience on both to and from Palm Beach as ridiculous. All travelers were separated and I made no such request upon check in.  My reservation disappeared from electronic had to get paper boarding pass.  The check in attendant in Kansas City wanted to charge me $150.00 because she checked my wife's bags in on my boarding pass when I was not even there.  Then she blamed my family for checking them in on my boarding pass.  Snacks are unacceptable a they were all processed foods, chips or sugar raisens, carbs absurd.  Offer some alternative that is healthy would be a suggestion.  Growing tired of lack of customer service focus at united.

We don't understand why we lost our reserved seats 4A 4B just a day before our flight We got 3A & 3F .  If it wasn't for the gate agent I would be able to seat with my wife  It was not an aircraft change or schedule change ...the seat assignments we just remove an I have the paper trail of my reservation  Not a happy camper
I am not happy with United frequent flyer program as I'm not able to travel United all the time and therefore I lost my travel points because of this I will use an alternative Airline when possible

The flight attendants were rude, kept on talking to each other throughout the flight. I paid a lot of money in order to enjoy some sleep in business class and don't need to hear all their personal problems. I should never feel like I am bothering them, yet every time I ask for something I feel like I work for them and not the other way around. Sadly, your long-haul service is below international standards, especially with your EWR based crews.
I was in first  class and the food was horrible, bland and unpleasant.
Personsal entertainment wi fi didn't work.  Seems like a cheapout.  And no usb power outlet.  Wtf
There are ways in the customer service industry to communicate to client without showing your personal dislikes to the current situation. That was missing there.

Due to this delay I missed all available Air Choice One flights to connect me home. I lost the value of the plane ticket, the cost and time for a family member to drive and pick me up then drive home, three hours each way. I had to be home for Monday morning.

The United Club capacity issue in Newark must be addressed. The club near gate 75 cannot properly service all of the passengers in terminal C. Expecting passengers to pay a premium for access to the club and then packing them into a restricted space is not good customer service and will not inspire loyalty to United. Please consider adding additional space.

Why do you guys overbook flights the way you do! I paid extra money for economy plus seats, made sure my carryon was a tiny backpack, and yet during boarding the constant stress was whether there would be space for my carryon or I would need to check it in - stress brought about by the repeated announcements from the United reps that the aircraft was full, could we volunteer to check in bags, some of us would be forced to check in etc. etc. I have already reduced my carryon to almost the size of a personal item despite paying $$ in order to be able to carry on an item and even then I might have had to check in my luggage because you have overbooked your flight or not made enough provisions that everyone who paid for the carryon convenience would be guaranteed that convenience!  This is such bad practice and very, very stressful to your customers. Please stop such practices. If you take a customer's money for an economy plus or whatever class it is, then it's your responsibility to make sure the customer is guaranteed every service and feature they paid for. Thanks!
You cancelled my flight at 3am and rebooked the next day at 10pm. Lousy PR Flight maintenance Nonsense Need to get your act together I fly frequently and the was one of my worst experiences

Connecting flight to MNL NH 819 via ANA was terrible. We were stuck in NRT due to snow storm, boarding was very long, made us sit in the plane for 2 hrs, then sent us out due to delay, made us stand in line for another hour to board then cancelled. Told us to go to immigration & pick up all our luggage, carry it with us till 7am next day & re-Check the bags in with different tags. No assistance to rebook flights, language barrier is terrible. We were told we were on our own to find alternative flights. Never again will I fly via ANA

Changing seat assignments and requesting upgrades seems to be getting more difficult. When did one have to request an alternative seat assignment more than 24 hours prior to departure? In the past, when I checked in, I could check to see if there was another seat assignment available. Something has changed and it's not for the best...

I know this is not an entirely the airline's fault but I had a most unpleasant experience on this flight.  The flight was not full so I carefully chose my seat which had empty seats at least one in advance.  However, during a long annoying wait (1.5 hours) on the ground at EWR (in order to unload wrongly loaded luggage) , one couple who were originally seated at 28 EF insisted to sit next to me (28 AB).  As I didn't want those seats taken by them (that means no single extra seat to stretch out while most of other seats in that area had), I asked them to try others.  I would say yes to them, if I was asked to give up only one out of those two empty seats, but they demanded VERY aggressively as they HAD to sit together next to the window, so I HAD to give those seats for them.  I resisted for a while but I gave up arguing with such rude people and tried to find a better seat myself.  Luckily, I found 22BC empty so I moved to 22C, after agreeing with a passenger at 22A.    After a while, I learnt that 28EF were not 'Economy Plus' but normal 'Economy' seats, I reported to one of the cabin crew that they were not entitled to move to those seat (28 AB), without paying extra for upgrade.  She (Japanese lady) promised to work on it, but I am not sure if she ever spoke to that rude couple and they paid the extra for 'Economy Plus'.    I had a wonderful time in NYC but this most upsetting, unpleasant incident ruined my happy mood completely.

My flight was delayed by over an hour. I received an email after sitting at the gate for over one hour. You knew that this flight was delayed, why didn't you notify me earlier? I did not need to sit at the gate to wait for the flight to first leave Newark to pick me up in Savannah. Shame on You...

I seated next to a person who took up more than just his seat.  He physically was in contact with me during the flight because he overlapped into my area.  I do not wish to be touched by strangers.  I think that having purchased my seat, it should not also include another person.  I was incredibly uncomfortable having my space invaded and being in contact with a complete stranger.

I was traveling with my sister for my husband's funeral. He passed the day before. We selected seats next to one another. At Check in our seats were separated. I am also recovering from bronchitis. My doctor said not to drink cold liquids. I requested water and the stewardess gave it to me full of ice. I requested another as I was not well and could not drink cold beverages. She said leave it there and never came back. 1
sadly, the seats in economy really are uncomfortable for such a long flight

When I travel Newark to Orlando I got same bags and they allow me as carry on But when I return to Newark from Orlando they charged me for luggage and also they talked really roundly  I am very disappointed
Old plane with a very limited service on first class. Bathrooms were very uncomfortable.

In addition to the lack of Wi-Fi on the flight and what appeared to be a blatant failure to communicate in a forthright manner, the power outlet in my business class seat was intermittent. Throughout the flight, I had to unplug and plug my AC cord into the outlet in order to power my laptop.

Traveling with my wife on different tickets number, we were again separated when the plane was changed and the seats re-assigned... Not the first time and changing seats and letting us know when it’s too late to re-arrange is just showing how you do not care and let the computer with no AI decides. It happened on the way in and the way back.
At baggage claim my luggage was ripped very bad.

I was originally booked to fly SGF to DEN.  -Flight delayed multiple times due to mech problem; pilot & agents claimed mechanic "wouldn't answer the phone" and then "refused to come to work". This is ridiculous -I knew I would miss connection and I waited 25 min in line to rebook -1 of the 2 agents was obviously junior and caused extra long waits as she struggled -I asked for a lunch voucher, denied -An hour later, agents announced hotel & meal vouchers available. Couldn't stand to wait another hour in line so decided to leave and stay overnight with family -Called United to rebook and asked about my luggage. Agent told me to go to baggage desk at SGF, but none exists. Went to ticket counter, empty. (See attached pic; please check time stamp and geotag). Called United again. Told same: go to baggage counter. Rep eventually found a United person at the Delta counter (?!) who said they would bring my bag up immediately via elevator. Waited 40 min for bag. This is a TINY airport  Next day, back at the airport for SGF to DEN. - Flight delayed due to weather in DEN. I know you don't care about passengers inconvenienced by weather, but it was just ONE MORE INCONVENIENCE -I knew I would miss connection and so I called United to rebook. Agent suggested I fly via ORD because weather in DEN was detrioriating -But then desk agent in SGF told me she had already booked me for a later flight via DEN. I told her a phone agent had told me weather in DEN was getting worse. Desk agent told me "it's not my job" to consider weather in rebooking. Terrible customer service - I ended up flying SGF to ORD  ORD to SFO - Delayed AGAIN, by >1 hr, due to weather - And then we sat on the runway for nearly 30 min (I could have bought myself some dinner in that time, instead I had to buy $$ dinner on the plane) - Finally landed at SFO well after dark. Too late to take public transpo. Had to book a Lyft care, more $$  Terrible experience start to finish. The worst was the shoddy customer service. Get your message right, be honest, be prompt in communicating, know your airports.

The flight was fine.  I just am always uncomfortable in the seats on the plane, I am 5'10" which isn't overly tall and there is no leg room.  I think it is absurd to pay extra for leg room in addition to all of the other fees added to travel.  Unfortunate as it detracts from the overall experience

My suitcase was broken (after it finally arrived- 4 hours later) on the flight down to Fla. I was told United is not responsible for handles that are broken by your luggage handlers. To me, this is unexceptable.  The United official was abrupt and uncaring. These are not good representations for your airline.
Flight attendants were not checking aisles or much else. The food was horrible. I have been a customer for many years. The service has really gone down hill
I missed the opportunity to tell you about my flight from Newark to Tel Aviv. The staff in the airport was rude condescending and bordering on being racially inappropriate. Was beyond disgusted

I travel alone, have artificial hips and a brace. Therefore a pat down is required which I understand is necessary. I do not want to use a wheel chair What stresses me greatly is that my handbag must be left on the conveyor as I wait for a female to examine me which takes a few minutes . If you are traveling with someone they will take your handbag, alone I'm stressed  looking over my shoulder praying no one takes my handbag. Is it possible an  alone traveler  might claim a handbag and have it near during the pat down.

Very narrow seat for a business class fare; too many announcements, some repetitive Food of inferior quality compared to competitors;pre-arrival snack had suffered from exposure to frost; raw vegetables very dry and black; Overhead bin very narrow to put a standard in cabin small suitcase

column26: TECH OPS-LATE TOW UP TO GATE
column79: The agents at Gate 88 at SFO were awful OR those who were informing them were AWFUL.  Weather at SFO was beautiful.  Aircraft arrived night before.  Even though there was no plane at the gate at 11:20am when the flight was supposed to board, there were no announcements at all.   When there was an announcement it went something like this - the plane is in the hanger.  We can't get in touch with anyone at the hanger.  We have no idea when the flight will leave.   2 hours later we left; and up until the plane arrived at the gate there was zero informative information regarding where the plane was or what was happening.  Really one of the worst customer experiences I have had with United, and that is saying alot.

column26: TECH OPS-LATE TOW UP TO GATE
column79: Tell the gate crews to not speculate about timing when they have no valid information. Stop the creeping delay syndrome. People hate it. Until you have genuine boarding and departure times, don't even post an estimate.
The Gate in Phoenix was too small for all of the passengers.  We went to the United Club with One-Time passes but were denied entry as it was full.  That was disappointing.

I am 6 ft 5 in. tall but was stuck in a middle seat in Economy Plus, so I was not particularly comfortable.  Another annoying thing was that even though I have Premier Platinum status I was not allowed free entry to the United Club at Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport.  I was told I can only get free entry if I am going on an international flight? Why the distinction?  If you have a loyal, frequent flier why not allow them United Club membership for free no matter what type of flight they are taking?
Very dissatisfied with the new process of no carry on bags. Will probably never fly United again.

Flight attendants do not enforce the notion of keeping your jackets and small bags out of the overhead storage until everyone has boarded. I wish they did. They also start telling everyone the overheads are full and bags must be gate checked when there is still space left in the overhead compartments. This has been a significant frustration in my recent flights. Once I had to drive to another airport to pick up my gate-checked bag (it was a weather issue, but is i had not gate checked it, I wouldn't have had this problem, and even though they said the bins were full, they weren't when I actually got on the plane. I don't feel like I can complain in person (which I would do in a civil manner), as I am afraid of being labeled a "troublemaker," and I might get removed from the flight. This has become more of a problem recently, which I why I'm taking the time to make note of it for you now.

paying £1,400 for a flight with an airplane that doesnt even have inflight entertainment that is suitable for the year 2018 is just embarrassing. small screen, cant select movies, cant pause a movie to go to the toilet or get a drink or take a nap. your inflight app didnt work on my phone or laptop - lots of limitations where it works. the seats are old and not comfortable at all. cables sticking out underneath seats. I could go on and on. I paid significantly less in the past for long haul flights on new airplanes with a significantly better experience. this flight was not worth the money, I wouldn't have paid more than £500 for such an old plane and bad experience. what was also annoying is the fact that I had the same old plane with the same poor inflight entertainment and seats on the way back. upgrading your fleet would be a good step in the right direction. particularly if you are charging customers £1,400!!

Wasn’t able to watch movies on my phone although I had the app and all the latest updates on my phone. The LCD screen was also not working. I was able to change seats and watch a movie. Overall i was disappointed with the WiFi and faulty LCD screen.
Flight was delayed for over 30 minutes, which also happened on my flight from Chicago to Houston. Not good with timing.

The cabin was very dirty.  I had to ask the flight attendant for a napkin because the previous passenger left their chewed gum on the arm rest.  Along with dirty napkins, and food wrappers in the seat pocket.  I'm a vegetarian and they ran out of the vegetarian dinner option before they got to my seat.
No monitor OR power supply is simply unacceptable on any seat - much less a premium seat.
I don't fly United unless it is the only option. I understand not wanting to gate check bags, but being stuck in an airport for hours without it makes me anxious.

There should be a regulation of some sort, at least on the smaller planes, that if a person is over a certain capacity they must buy 2 seats. The entire ride I had half a seat and left the aircraft with back pain and discomfort. Definetly not worth the money that was paid for my ticket.
I'm all for improving the snack boxes, but beef jerky and gummy bears in the Select box is a terrible combination.  Won't be buying those anymore (I actually looked forward to the old version).

I was flying with my husband and two children under the age of 3. The day before the flight I received a text saying my seat assignment had changed due to a change in aircraft. I was split up from my husband, toddler, and lap infant. I had to ask the lady in their row to switch seats with me and she gave me an attitude. My seat never should have been switched. And the flight attendants told me there was NO change in aircraft...so I was lied to. The overall experience was incredibly stressful, especially since I have a fear of flying. I ended up in tears on the air craft. Don't lie to me. Use common sense when moving someone with the same last name as the 3 other people in that row.
I hate kids, can we make it so they travel in baggage?  Parents these days are lazy d-bags.  Stupid kid kicked my seat entire time and mother did nothing but smile.

My main disgruntlement was caused by what I perceive to be intentional mis-communication of the flight time we passengers were going to actually experience.  My wife and I arrived before the recommended 2 hours ahead of the scheduled departure in order to be sure to turn in our rental car on time and get to our gate without any rush and stress. It seems to me that UA must have known even then (about 10:15 a.m. or so) that they had plane issues which were going to greatly delay our planned 12:26 p.m. departure for Chicago from Miami.  Yet, the sign boards for scheduled departures showed our flight as being ON TIME.  Then, as we started approaching an hour before the scheduled departure time of 12:26 p.m., the sign boards indicated that the flight was now delayed (no reason given) for an additional 45 minutes or so.  A while later that initial delay was extended to be more like an hour plus.  Finally, as we  got well past our originally scheduled departure time and into the delay, the sign board was once again updated to indicate that the flight would be just about 2 hours delayed.  It wasn't until then that the gate check-in crew announced to the crowd that there were mechanical safety issues with the inbound flight and that was the reason for our delay.  Our flight crew (captains and attendants) all arrived right about the time the inbound flight finally arrived at our gate.  That was shortly after the Miami gate folks had arranged for free snacks and drinks to be distributed to all the waiting passengers (this was about 1 1/4 hours after our originally scheduled departure and about 2 3/4 hours after my wife and I had first arrived at the gate).  The captain introduced himself to the crowd over the loud speaker at that time and explained that the airline had faulty equipment which needed to be swapped out for a working airplane that could safely get us back to Chicago.  I realize that unforeseen things can go wrong.  I know that planes need to be maintained and that there will be problems arising from time to time.  There is no reason, however, for the overly long wait to communicate to all your UA passengers what is the problem and when it is going to be fixed.  The ON TIME message should have been changed at least one to two hours before it actually was.  The inbound flight information should have been conveyed to those of us who were waiting at the gate.  I strongly feel that the airline should reimburse us for some portion of the cost of our ticket.  We met our end of the bargain - we were there over two hours ahead of the scheduled departure time and ready to go.  The airline failed to live up to its commitment, however, and we were late in getting to our destination by a significant amount of time.  Flying down to Miami, we took Frontier Airlines.  We left our O'Hare gate right on schedule and landed ahead of the ETA in Miami by about 15 minutes.  United should do better.  We paid for a higher level of service and yet we received a worse ride for our money than on the trip down to Florida on a "low cost" airline that you compete with.  I am very disappointed with our experience on your airline and will think long and hard about booking any future flights with UA (even though we have been long-time Mileage Plus members and generally work to maximize our points under your frequent flyer program).  I feel sad for the low level of perfo

No announcement from United, my wife heard our plane was delayed from another lady in the restroom. This had never happened to us before so we had no idea what to do. We were told by another passenger to go and talk with gate attendant. We were told our plane was broken and our flight wouldn’t take off for 2 and half more hours than it was supposed to. This made us miss our first connecting flight.

Just sad that one delay messes up everything and has a ripple effect on downstream flights. Why can't this issue get solved? Or have a backup plan when a plane does have a mechanical issue. Maybe you all should consult a specialist from Disney. They know how to exceed expectations.

The PA at the gate in Bozeman is broken forcing the attendants to have to yell to provide information. This was confusing and the flight was delayed so crucial information was difficult to obtain. For example people in Groups 1 and 2 were processed to board but then sent back to the gate from the plane by the flight attendants because the plane wasnt ready to receive customers...it was very confusing!

When we checked in at Bozeman the monitor indicated a delay in departure.  We mentioned this to the check-in agent and she indicated there was no delay.  After we went through security we checked immediately at the gate about the delay and the gate agent did confirm a delay which would cause us to miss our connection in Denver. So she rerouted us to Chicago.  Disappointed the original gate agent did not handle our concern regarding the delay.
The food is horrible and the updates during the delay were non existent
Your flight attendants are the most miserable in the sky.  Not one person looked like they wanted to be working the flight.  Really a terrible face for the company.
The floor by my seat was filthy -- had all kinds of food trapped in between the wall and the metal seat piece.

I hate the fact yUnited Airlines now charges extra to get the opportunity to choose a seat or one needs to wait until one gets to the gate to be assigned a middle seat.  VERY disappointing!!!!!!  Other airlines do not do this.
No movies available and flight attendants said they would reset the system but never did or did not communicate that there was a problem.
737 seats are too small. No arm and elbow room. Two passengers seated next to each other fight for the seat’s arm rest and space.
I had a screaming child sitting next to me for most of the flight, which made it very unpleasant
This probably goes under aircraft, sorry.  I had economy plus seating.  My knees were touching the seat in front of me.  This is getting ridiculous!   Stop squeezing your customers

The queuing at airport to board is a disaster, because of  limited space for 1,2 ,3,4,5 lines they ask only come up  your number is called, literately a BUM RUSH, need to revamp, this does not work, all of your veteran customers were very upset. Just wanted you to know.
First flight was mechanically delayed, had paid for upgraded seat.  Was not reciprocated on next available fight to Newark.   Still waiting for my refund

I would like to see that anyone with an oxygen carrier is seated in economy plus as a definite . On the way to  SanFrancisco there was a seat problem and we were seated in economy and my husband was really  angry  he had no leg room  i booked the flight and could not understand why we had no seat assignment . My daughter looked over the reservation and noticed it the night before and tried to get us economy plus seats . that was not possible at that point .
Let’s stop jamming so many people into a plane. I’m of average build   Any one more than 5’5” must be very uncomfortable on flights longer than an hour.
you need to have someone assisting at the chaos
The seats were still covered with crumbs from the previous flight and the headphone jack had a broken piece so did not work. The flight attendant could not have cared less.
Loading method negates advantage of boarding group 1 when buses wait to fill.so that is not ideal as storage was a problem once boarded for first class.

I had an issue on the first leg of this flight as well in first class, but for this particular flight, there was no champagne on the way home, so we weren't able to enjoy a mimosa and there wasn't regular coke (soda) only diet. There was not enough food on flight TO Nassau in first class either, so I was extremely annoyed being that this is a small cabin, and the fares are high enough that every item should be available for each passenger, not just "1/3 of the cabin".

The seats did not have enough legroom  The upgrade options were too costly  I took the exit row Wu Due seat on the way out and it was drafty and the arm rest was only a partial arm rest , very uncomfortable
Newark baggage claim is the worst!!!! I have traveled all over the world and I consistently have to wait the longest for my luggage in Newark
I’m a small woman 5’2” and 115lbs and those seats are awfull ! My back was killing me and I don’t have back problems I wish you would revisit the design there is something very wrong there
Wheel chair is on my profile. NO wheelchairs available and had to walk to the gate. Makes it very difficult with my leg braces and cane to do any distance.

When we left Newark to go to Orlando Jan 13 UA1939, the terminal was complete chaos; passengers all over the place, United employees looking bewildered and not at all helpful; a very poor experience, very different from Orlando. Newark needs major work and your people need to get on the ball. It looked like I was checking into Spirit or the old Peoples Express airline. The terminal was not ready for the passenger volume and it showed.

Unfortunately, I couldn't travel next to my wife on this flight because of United's system limitations to put us on the same reservation. I got an upgrade; she did not. Gate agent wasn't helpful resolving the issue either.

We had to wait in the "penalty box" for 35 minutes once we landed waiting for our gate to open. This made for a frustrating awful experience. Absolutely horrible service to have that happen for a 45 minute flight.

The flight was okay, it was the boarding.  Paid good money to sit up front so to enter and exit the plane sooner, and additional money to get quicker boarding.  entering the plane (front row), found all the bins for luggage were full, needed to place luggage as far back as six rows behind me which made it very difficult to get back to my seat in front and same problem when plane landed and exited the plane.   Flight attendant should be more observant of passengers that sit in the back of the plane should use the bins in the back of the plane, and small items should be placed under the seat in front of them, not in the bins taking up room for larger luggage.    {NOT A HAPPY CAMPER}

One of the airhostess Lisa was extremely rude. She was picked on only me for no reason at all. She went on to say that I don’t know the rules and was warning me for possible events that might happen that I know I will never do. She should be taken off the flight !
I am not tech savy, so that is why I failed to use the wifi.

flight delay information was spotty and very much delayed. there was no continuity of information between my phone app and the info at the gate. no way to know which was correct, so it was impossible to know whether to try to get on a different flight

One flight attendant in particular was extremely rude.  Sitting in row 9, I could hear her yelling (actually yelling in a rude tone) at a customer in business class about what the customer wanted to drink. It was so apparent and prominent that people sitting all around me found it surprising and even made a joke about it.  She was very unprofessional and rude when coming through the cabin to collect trash and prepare for landing. Overall, I was surprised and very disappointed to see a United flight attendant act this way.

Unfortunate delay prior to takeoff due to a "mechanical door" problem concerning baggage.  I understand these things happen...but then a ridiculous wait for baggage upon arrival in Toronto.  Staff had no idea what was going on, no information was shared with travellers.  Unacceptable.  Some type of voucher or compensation should have been offered.  In this competitive market of air travel, your company can't behave like this, it should not go unrecognized.
seats are a little tight and the toilets have become uncomfortable smaller... not good.
because of a death in the family, I had to change my Mon flight to Sun. Having to pay over $400.00 doesn't sit well with me.
They didn't have security lines open are you kidding me no prior notification we would be sent down to the slow mo line aost missed my plane

Carry on baggage checked at the gate continues to take a very long time get at Newark.  It's almost always 25 to 30 minutes now.  There is no sense of urgency and it seems to me they do their best to actually slow it down.  Are there standards that should be met and if so is anyone monitoring those standards?  Newark Terminal A is such a disaster in so many ways and this does not make it any more appealing.  The TSA Pre line is rarely opened on the way in and the existing setup without Pre is very inefficient and time consuming.   It's an extra 45 to 60 to get in and then I have to wait 30 + for my bag on the way out because there is no adult supervision and accountability of the ground crew.  JFK and LGA are close to my house and Delta is an option that I have started to think about.

I was disappointed to hear one of the skycaps who was nearby when I was checking in outside refer to another customer as a "cheap bastard", presumably because he wasn't tipped.  It was unprofessional.
We sat on the runway/tarmac for 30 minutes with no explanation from the crew.  Seats continue to be too close.  No legroom.  Terribly uncomfortable in economy.

The new seat you are putting on your plane are getting worse and worse from a comfort level perspective.  Everytime I get off a plane (I had 160 flights with you last year), my back hurts unless I am in first.  The seat is short from front to back and there is zero lumbar support.
The number of delays are disheartening.  Of the recent flights I have done in the last year, probably half were significantly delayed.

1.  It would have been nice to have received any notification of the 2 hour delay.  We signed up for that (2 separate itineraries and email and text notifications and nothing received by anyone).  Waiting at an overcrowded extremely hot and humid foreign airport is unpleasant to say the least. 2.  A surly United employee cut the line, a very long line, and then began verbally abusing those passengers who complained as to why she cut the line.  She was not working the flight.  She even went so far as to tell my children (because I was one of the ones complaining), that she feels sorry for them having me as their father.  I very much OBJECT to that.  That is uncalled for, disrespectful and quite rude.  Shameful to say the least.  She then went on to say things to other passengers and their children that I could not overhear. I ama General Counsel of a prominanet company and I have always carried myself with dignity and respect.  My comment to her was appropriate and professional to voice our objection that we stood on line for over an hour in the heat patiently waiting our turn and she jumped the security rope and forced the ticket agent to take her first.   Frankly, at our company customer service is first and employees are second-- we all know that.  Perhaps one needs to emphasize that principle to United employees.
I fill out these surveys many times, nothing changes, I hear nothing from you, you keep sending me surveys, do you not realize this makes the customer experience WORSE?
2.5 hour mechanical delay with very poor communication about the delay.

Plane was horribly delayed due to a variety of reasons.  Stuck on the plane for over an hour.  One of the flight attendants seemed to have a problem with being asked to do her job.  Lavatories were dirty, no one went in to check and tidy up.
We had a long time waiting to take off: 20-30 minutes. The pilot gave no explanation to the passengers for the delay (which apparently was just a long line of backed-up aircraft).

I never received any notification (other than at the gate) that my flight was delayed. Typically, I receive a text message or email notifying me that my flight is delayed. When I got to the gate, I found out we were 2 hours delayed. In addition, there was no warning that we were boarding earlier than expected. I almost missed the flight because of this.
With the delay of nearly 2 hours nothing was done in the terminal not even a water was offered. The flight attendants did not seem happy to be on the flight.

So, the flight was delayed by close to two hours. Normally, on flights from ORD to SFO there are two full beverage services, one at the beginning and one about one to 1.5 hours before landing. This time there was only one beverage service. Nothing else. Given that the flight was delayed, with many people just sitting in the waiting area, the least United could have done is up their beverage service rather than scale it down. The crew should have apologized, understood that people might be hungry and thirsty and provide two full beverage services and may be come around once or twice with water and juice. Nothing like that. Very disappointing.

My gate was switched and the plane left 10 minutes earlier than it was suppose to. My name was never called while I was two gates away from where it was switched. I was checked in by 345 pm past security she still missed my flight.  I had to wait 5 hours for another flight to visit my ill grandma for which passed away.  I'm very very disappointed in this airline and I will not be traveling with them again.  I have and will continue to tell people about my experience and how this airline failed miserably.
The attendant that was at the aircraft gate -was extremely rude .

Airplane so small- no space for my carry on luggage. Therefore, I had to gate check it, and I had to wait 15 minutes for the gate checked luggage to be unloaded.  Because of that, I missed my NJ Transit train back to NYC and had to wait 40 minutes for the next one.

Did not appreciated the child who screamed most of the flight and stood on the seat and front of me so he could scream back at his father in the back of first class I pay extra to fly first class for comfort and to not deal with unruly children an adult would have been dragged off the plane for acting that way  Just because it was a child does not make it ok or cute
The boarding process was ridiculous . No pre announcement.

I traveled with a duffel bag and a rollerboard.  I was required to check my rollerboard and only carry on my duffel in spite of the fact that I had flown to Orlando with both as carry-on.  There was open overhead space at take off, which I found even more frustrating.  Ultimately, I was stuck at the baggage claim waiting for my "VIP" tagged luggage for more than 30 minutes, which was time better spent with my family.  Very disappointing.

Don’t treat star allowance gold members like rubbish in every way. Paid for economy plus seats and booked row 12 6 weeks in advance. Cannot checkin on line it makes me go thru full thing to end then says NO. Find out seats moved by United so we don’t even sit in same aisle to row 10. Called and tweeted United to get rude generic response. NO the aircraft didn’t change - it was the same one with row 12 occupied by others. NO I won’t move to a window seat to hedge bets on the aircraft might give me an aisle. Lied to on checkin and again at the gate when I tried to get the seats moved. NO there were not a couple sitting in row 10 - NO u didn’t ask anyone to move like u promised u would. I asked someone myself and managed to at least sit in the same row as my husband. Just because we r not United gold star alliance (Air cda) u treat us like dirt And take our money to give us not what we booked. U gave us a lot of stress, non stop lies and wasted our time. NEVER fly United again wd rather fly a non star alliance airline if need be. Disgusted. No wonder United has such bad reviews.

It was very frustrating that we had to delay boarding because this flight was over booked and they needed 2 people to come forward to give up seats and then one of those people still got on the plane.  All of the stress of people talking about it and the waiting and then the one still got on there.  The person working the gate didn't seem organized and that even added to the stress and delay.  United is our airline of choice for our company and I truly like flying United, but this really left a bad taste in my mouth as I didn't have a choice of getting to Chicago for work and couldn't delay my departure to the next day.  thank you

On the pre-flight side, flight was oversold and couldn't board until volunteers were found, which caused a little delay.  At one point we were scolded for not volunteering, and I couldn't because of an 8am meeting the next morning in Chicago.  Not a major ordeal, but it's not my problem that United sold 2 more seats than they had on the plane - and didn't appreciate someone insinuating that I was being selfish because I wouldn't help out when the fact was I simply couldn't.
My only disappointment was not being able to see the NFL finals on Jan 21.

Why we had to endure undue stress of finding out the day before our flight that one of my daughters no longer had a seat on the plane and had to wait til we got to the GATE to find out if she did indeed have a seat.

The gate boarding process was a total fiasco. They were boarding two flights at the same time. This lead to confusion and people boarding late. Several announcements were made that the gate agents were only boarding one flight. Then somewhere in the middle of boarding that flight, the gate agents decided to board my flight. I was in first class and boarded late because I thought that the first flight was still boarding.

I was very disappointed that I was assigned a middle aisle seat 5D after calling United and at the airport when I checked in the seat was changed to 11K.  Not sure why the Global Services rep assigned me a seat reserved for pilots.  I gave up my first cabin seat for the last row none center aisle.  Not good
the seats were bad , worn out , not comfortable for first class

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: We boarded and sat at the gate for about an hour and a half due to a "computer issue".  What was worse is that the captain announced that people were free to get up and roam the gate and we had to wait an unnecessary amount of time to get everyone back in their seats.  Understandable that this happens, but for the duration of the flight, the flight attendants seemed miserable and at one point, I went to go to the bathroom and both carts front and back were in the way of several passengers and we were just told to wait, which I did in the isle for at least five minutes, as did others.  No acknowledgement for the inconvenience, just "go that way because I'm going to be a while", then the other flight attendant said the same but "I'll be much longer than her".

The meals were frozen & the flight attendants cooked them for 45 minutes but the food was only slightly warm. The person next to me experienced the same problem. Neither of us could eat the food & so had to go hungry or pay for a snack box

So the flight went well however an interesting thing happened. Somewhere around group 2 boarding a pilot got on, went to the bin over the exit rows where a predominance of premier flyers tend to select to seat, took out someone’s bag and gave it to them then put his bag in and kept on walking. There was nowhere for this passenger to put this bag and it would not fit under the aisle seat in front. It was obvious to everyone what had happened because the pilot took such a long time doing this that they actually made an announcement about needing to get seated or miss the slot to take off.  WTF?
The gate agent was extremely rude.
Boarding was annoying.  More than half the plane group 2.  Others boarding extremely delayed

After running through Newark from a delayed flight from Lisbon and narrowly making our connection, we were very disappointed when they were almost completely out of dinners for purchase though we were seated less than half way back in the economy cabin. Then had to run through Denver similarly because the flight was late - and only were ever able to get snacks over about a 10 hour travel period.

The information about the lateness of the flight was very poor.  First the plane is delayed for 15 minutes, then 45 minutes, then pulled up to a 15 minute delay, then pushed back to a 1 hour delay.  Very frustrating.

The combining of boarding groups 3 and 4 into one lane creates chaos. Passengers in later groups should not get in line and then be annoyed when others have to cut in front of them for an earlier boarding group.

I was very dissatisfied with my experience at the gate in Newark, New Jersey. The gate attendant was disrespectful to me and harassed me about my carry-on luggage. It really put a bad taste in my mouth about flying with United.
Wanted to use my United Lounge Passes , counter person referred us to a different airlines lounge but would not allow us to use the passes and the 2 passes expired on 1-31-17. Not Happy!

Yes, after the flight was delayed 3 hours, I moved to another flight. Then at the gate, the gate agent looked at my bag and said it was too big and had to be checked. Look at my profile. That very bag has been carried on - on virtually every one of those flights. She was very bitchy and I could get in an argument and maybe be dragged off and denied boarding - or gate check my bag. She did not even check the sizer (into which it fits) and I was really disgusted with her - and UAL by then. It took an extra 50 minutes to get my bag after the flight. A full hour and three minutes to get in the car. I would not have booked my flight to Tokyo on UAL last week had this sorry experience happened first. You should send this gate agent on a permanent vacation.

Flight attendants did not offer anything to drink before takeoff.  I had to go ask for water so that I could take medicine.  Then they only offered drinks once in a 3 1/2 hours flight, no offer to refill anything.  Food was way below United standards also.  There was no salad with the meal and no spinach with the polenta/lentils entrée, which I know is supposed to be there as I fly so much.  Overall, I boarded the plane hungry and very thirsty because of being in a hurry, and it was the worst food and beverage service on a business class long flight that I've had in years.  Captain kept flight attendants sitting down for no reason for the first hour of the flight, even though there was no actual turbulence, just threatened turbulence. This contributed to the problem but even in the 2 1/2 hours after that the flight attendants service the meal and drinks once but never came back around even once.  Very poor service.

I paid extra for the economy plus seat.  I had the economy plus seat 11A reserved.  I was then changed to 32A the day of my flight from Denver to Newark.  Frankly this is unacceptable.  I pay additional for a service I expect to get it.  Short changing customers is what I have come to expect from American... not United.   The Ladies at the United club were able to fix the problem quickly because the flight was not full.  That said someone else was in my origional seat.  If United makes a habbit of this I will start rethinking using United exclusively in the future, regardless of my total lifetime miles.
The attendants at the gate at Quebec said we would board by seat area, but failed to call out those areas. Everyone just got up and headed for the plane. Really?

1) I do not like this move to using personal electronic devices instead instead of in-seat entertainment. It takes up valuable limited space on your traytop instead of being built in. I miss have the moving map and flight details function, which on the unitedwifi site, doesn't exist, where also the only information was rudimentary FOR ANOTHER FLIGHT. Also, the streaming choices are limited and 2nd run compared to Delta Studio and most other modern airlines. 2) The gentleman in the row behind me started to watch a violent TV show (or movie) on his device WITHOUT using earbuds or headphones. The whole area of the cabin was shocked, but the flight attendant did nothing except make a lame joke, which was ignored. The FA decided to put 10-15 people's enjoyment of the flight over her refusal to adequately deal with the situation (possibly because she was scared of a confrontation with a large man which is no excuse).

Pilot said after 10 min circling DTW due to "weather ." weather improved a bit and he'd "give it a shot" referring to landing in fog. I've never heard a pilot say this but it was not said in apparent jest so it was alarming.  The stranger sitting next to me and I were both uncomfortable for the next several minutes until we actually landed. It's too bad the pilot didn't provide reassurance rather than anxiety laden  words when we passengers had no control over the situation and I've subsequently read that all major airports are equipped for planes to make safe landings in low visibility fog. The pilot should be counseled on how to speak to passengers under such circumstances so this does not recur.

The one thing I can complain about is: we asked about upgrades to first class and there were to seats available but the attendant did NOT have the option to let us pay for the upgrade...that was a little crazy to us. we are members and are always 4 or 5 to automatically upgrade but if a person wants to purchase a available seat in first class why not?

Yes - I was upgrade (which was nice), but the FA didn't offer a beverage at boarding (he stopped at the row in front of me), and then had no idea what the meal options were. Unfortunately, I'm one of those pain-in-the-butt folks who have some weird dietary needs, so when I ask "what's in that?" I really need to know. Are FA's not provided with a brief description of the meal they're about to offer?

You really should push out the gate change information earlier. At 3:25, my app still showed Gate 83, so I walked over to 83 which was boarding a flight to Boston.. the gate agent looked up the Seattle flight for me and told me it was gate 132, My app was still saying gate 83. It was  hard to get to gate 132 before boarding was complete, I managed to get on with group 3, so I managed to find space in the overhead, it worked but the stress is not fun. I am not sure why but I quit getting texts with gate change info about a month ago, this makes the app being up to date even more important.
Seats are extremely uncomfortable and way too crowded together.  1 hour flight my back and legs were aching because of the terrible seats and lack of leg room.
Boarding groups need clearer delineation. No one could distinguish between groups 2 and 3 and lines were blocking passengers attempting to pass.

The flight departed late which meant I was was lucky to make my ORD-CLE connection at 7:40 ONLY by running from arrival gate B5 to departure gate C21.  The plane arrive early from SNA to IAH, but for some reason departed late from IAH.  My whole itinerary G86PB0 was just a mess from the start.  I fly United frequently but you booted this itinerary.  Missed golf on the way down and frustrated with the delay on the way back.
The movie selection was not good.  Would love live tv and better internet.  The internet service was bad

On my flight from Newark to Houston, I was asked to check my bag at the gate due to lack of space. When I picked up my bag in Houston, the front was covered in grease. This is a new bag and now it's ruined. Spills should be avoided or cleaned up and bags shouldn't arrive in that condition.

I would like to explain my negative experiences. At the gate, I was the first person to board the aircraft after the gate agent made the announcement that no expanded carry-on rollerboards would be allowed on the aircraft. I was targeted by the gate agent for having a bag too large for the plane and was made to check my bag. Bear in mind, I have flown with this bag on all United aircraft for the past 6 years (as a Global Services member three years in a row and 1K each year before that). I fly A LOT. This bag was not expanded and would certainly fit in the overheads of this A320 as it has for years and years. On top of this insult, I saw many people board the plane after me with bags that would not fit in the overheads. I was irate. Secondly, during the food and beverage service (I was in economy) the flight attendant was extremely rude to me and told me I needed to order a certain way - instead of telling her I was GS at the end of my order and showing her my boarding pass, she condescendingly told me I needed to tell her first that I was GS. This makes no sense - she would look me up at either point either way and should not matter one way or another. She then insisted I was in the wrong seat because she had trouble locating me in her device. Turns out I was in the right seat after all. Surprise. I also saw her treating other passengers with flagrant disrespect bordering on derision. It was appalling. And to make it even worse, she was training a new flight attendant. Is this what you want your trainees to be taught?

Your new seats are NOT comfortable- and you are squashing too many customers into a plane.  Bathrooms too small.  Aisles too narrow- and dangerous because passengers need to stick out their feet and belongings-- I would be concerned in an emergency space is so tight.  The changes you have made make traveling a chore. A bag of pretzels just doesn't make up for all the cutbacks.

Originally made the reservation 9 months in advance and at that time wanted to use miles to upgrade to business class.  I never got upgraded despite when I made the reservation there were no business class seats sold.  it is always difficult to upgrade using miles as not all flights allow an upgrade.  This is very poor customer service.

when i was asked what my meal preference was i told the purser that i was vegetarian and would like the pasta option. he then came back to me after asking the remaining three row of first class and told me it wasn't available. so you are telling me that you use preferential treatment when it comes to dispersing food? that is very sad. i would hate for the media to learn of this.
flight was fine, but i am very unhappy about the cutback in the number of nonstop flights to and from Chicago / PWM
After paying over $300 to fly one way and then to be asked to pay to watch just the news is really cheap.  Very disappointing.
Yes, I will be reporting this through the online customer service complaint option. Terrible service provided via phone by representative. My family and I will never fly with United again.
The group line up is so disorganized.  The area is too small so all groups were mixed up after the area that had the dividers. Many customers were complaining and confused about that.

You began charging for baggage because of high gas prices, that was years ago.  Since everyone want to avoid a bag fee they bring it to the gate.   Not only was there zero space for anyone because everyone tried to save money I paid for economy plus and there was  I spot for any of my items and I politely checked my bags.  You need to stop charging for bags as it causes delays and frustration for all your passengers and make for a very poor experience.   Also why do I pay for economy place and board in group 4.   This is why I usually fly American
nope.  all great.

The first class seats and overhead space on the A319 are terrible. There is never enough room in the overhead area for everyone's baggage. The seats are not comfortable and you almost have to be a body builder to lift the seat trays up from the arm rests.

Flight landed  a few minutes early, gate was occupied due to "paperwork". Eventually assigned new gate. Plane stopped short, had to wait for a tow. Then waited for ground crew. 45 minutes from landing to exiting the plane, frustrating.
Flight attendant was nasty. Never offered anything in first class until meal served.plane landed on time but there was no gate available. Sat on tarmac for 30 minutes.

It was a comedy when we arrived at Newark. The survey should ask about arrival experience. Gate wasn’t ready. Moved to new gate. Gate bridge couldn’t reach. Plane had to be towed after everyone stood and got their bags. Took almost an hour to de-plane. I was an hour late to my appointment due to Newark airport gate arrival/availability. I wrote global Services to complain and was only provided a “sorry” but no explanation.
The clerk at the gate was very rude

Miami airport employees were no help at all - I travel frequently, but not to this airport.  It was difficult to locate the baggage claim and when I tried to get on an earier flight standby, no one could assist.

There were many instances of gate confusion, our gate changes last minute before our flight from Newark to Miami and then our gate was unavailable when we landed in Newark and we were left taxiing looking for another gate to arrive at. This is both vary inconvenient and uncomfortable, we are left waiting with no information or access to restrooms, food, or entertainment.
Flight attendant Tina was not in her best mood that day.

We landed on time and got stuck on the ground at EWR waiting for a gate for 15 minutes, then they parked the plane in the wrong spot and had to move it again.  30 min delay at the end of the trip is not ideal.
I was forced to checking my bag at the check-in which. I had a small carry on. I saw people carrying bigger bags in cabin then the one I had. Don't know why I was asked to check-in and pay.
airport check in service no good,on flight was no coffice nither juice provide for the breakfast.

The bathrooms in the business class area were very dirty.  Nobody cleaned them during the entire trip. And not enough bathrooms in the business class cabin, considering the number of passenagers in the cabin.  The layout in the business class cabin is crowded. I’m not impressed with the side by side seating.  I would prefer American Airlines business class cabin layout, more privacy and space for each passenger.  I’ll not be taking United for future travels.
you guys have to do something about the food....its horrible...

Couldn’t make the first leg of my flight from Chicago to New York so my flight back home was cancelled without my knowledge. Had to buy an all new flight the day of. Very frustrated and will not be flying united again.
I appreciated the direct flight to Maui but I won't be flying there on united again. In flight services for a 10 hour flight were the worst I've ever been on. It was shocking.

You switched our seats to middle ones after we selected specific seats when we bought our tickets and then to charge 5.99 for Direct TV Service after you already don't let us bring on checked bags and tickets are expensive is kind of bullshit.

United club is a disgrace.  The main club is under construction and forced to walk to end of another concourse to arrive at a temporary joke of a club with no place to sit , bad food and warm drinks.  Furthermore I am told that when construction is complete it will be a “Polaris” club that I will not have access to.  So I can look forward to future inconvenience disputes the fact I pay a premium to be a member of Unite Club.  I think you folks need to rethink this strategy as it’s not going to sit well with most members.
We arrived significantly early..great! Until the jet bridge wouldn't work and we lost all that time and then some.. frustrating.
We were delayed an hour due to a cargo door issue which made us miss an appointment. That is where the dissatisfaction was.

Yes!  United Express to/from STL is often terrible for many reasons, but this trip had a few extra bad things:  We landed at around 6:45PM (still on time) but didn't get to the gate (A16) and off the until around 7:20PM (late).  We sat looking at an empty gate (A21) for about 20 minutes, but apparently we HAD to go to A16.  I'm sure it's because there was not sufficient staff to bring us in to A21 while the SFO flight was still at A16, but it was ridiculous nonetheless.  Then, when we finally got off the plane, we had an extra-long wait for the gate checked luggage.  We were finally free of this flight about an hour after landing at this non-hub airport.  Bad.

I thought the captain/attendants were a bit callous to the experience of the travelers. For instance, they barked to the people boarding to step into their row as soon as they find it to let others pass. But when you have 2 people already sitting in your row, there is no room for you to get items out of your bag that you need at your seat in order to put the carry-on bag into the overhead bin. So people have to block the aisle temporarily before they get the other 2 people to move so they can get in. If there were empty seats, or more room in each row, it would be possible. But the current tight seating, large passengers, narrow aisles, and full planes do not allow room to move. The crew could have been more empathetic to the issues people in Economy seating deal with.
Ongoing problem of waiting for an empty gate at LAX to park at is an aggravation.

We were supposed to connect through Chicago to Milwaukee. When we arrived in Chicago we discovered that the Milwaukee flight was delayed by almost 4 hours, and scheduled to depart at 11:00 PM. We were travelling with a 15 month old and a 4 year old who would not have dealt well with that situation at all. And we also have had experiences with these long delays turning into cancellations, which would have made life even more difficult. Taking the bus with 2 young children was also not an ideal option. So we spent almost $400 to rent a van and 2 car seats, and drove north ourselves. THAT particular part of our United experience was less than satisfactory.
There were issues at check in.  There were issues on arrival.  overall, not the best experience
Newark baggage claim is the worst! Waited an hour to get our luggage.

Flight attendant humiliated a passenger. He needed the warning from her but it could have been handled differently and not so publicly. We were also delayed over an hour for a crew change due to the need for instrumentation with the foggy weather.
It’s rare that we’ve been on a flight from O’Hare to MKE that we arrive in MKE without some issue be it long delays, lost or damaged luggage

I understand that fog rolling in will create a delay in the flight, however I do not feel it was well communicated to the passengers.
