We all knew we were late taking off but were not sure why or how long the wait would be.  It's frustrating not knowing. Also, when the flight attendants spoke it was pretty impossible for me  to hear them/understand them in my seat over the noise of the plane.  Which I'm sure lended itself to my lack of knowledge during the flight.

You lost my bag with all my clothes and supplies needed for class and work the next day. It was a huge inconvenience. The Richmond airport was a ghost town. Only people on my flight to Newark were there. Therefore, there is absolutely no excuse for forgetting to put my bag on the plane. Horrible service and a huge pain in the ass.
The food is really terrible.  Compared to other airlines you have to work on the level of quality.

Flight attendants were nice as usual, but I think the problems I experienced were outside of their control.  The seat (21 C) had a lump in the middle that continually caused my legs to fall asleep, I had to wedge the pillow and covers underneath to make it more tolerable.  There were no outlets so I couldn't charge and use a personal device for entertainment, I had to use the seatback entertainment which is lacking, and became uncomfortable to watch when the person in front of me reclined.  I should add that I make this flight often, but almost every other time it was on a 777.  This flight was on a 767, so I was not accustomed to the more antiquated cabin.  Lastly, the food, both dinner and the breakfast were bad.  For the dinner I got the chicken (which I have had before) but it was cold in some parts (not consistently heated) and the rice was a big clump.  The breakfast croissant is usually warm, soft and fluffy, but this time was as hard as a rock.  I barely ate anything on this flight.  As I stated earlier I have flown Chicago to Brussels with United 7 times in the last year so I have come to expect a certain level.  This was the worst experience I have had thus far.
Gate personnel very rude and absolutely unwilling to give basic information (potential for seat change)

Bad service mood: a lady waiter, offers service to other passengers, but ignores me openly for many times.her bad service mood show her discriminate me openly, she never repeat her word (other passenger helps her to repeat if I did not heard her clear. When she speaks to other passengers she can smile, when she speak to me, she tied her brows.
2+ hour delay, people waiting for boarding with poor communication, then extra wait for gate upon arrival
The food was awful, the staff seemed tired and were fairly abrupt.
hated that there is no gate and you have to bus to terminal
My dissatisfaction largely stems from the fact that I paid to change my flight from 9pm to 6pm and then was delayed for over two hours. Waste of time and money.

your survey doesn't allow for airport experience upon arrival at EWR.  Do any of you guys ever travel?  there are departure and arrival experiences that can be very different.  SAV was great.  EWR is a freaking disaster.  Took 20 minutes to deplane and get inside, then Tram to rental car took forever to arrive.  "3 minutes til the next tram"  NOT.  Landing to getting to National Rental almost 40 minutes.

Too many seats. I was flying with 15 students and seniors. ALL of them including myself had a horrible experience. We felt like sardines crammed in a can. Even my wife who is an average 5’7” had her knees up against the seat in front of her. I am 6’1” and had to turn my legs into the passenger next to me’s space in order to fit in the middle seat. United’s greed for adding more seats will quickly lose passengers. I and my group will chose other flights on other airlines so as not to have this experience again!
Additional delay at Denver for available gate was disappointing
Very very disappointed. I didn’t sleep at all after knowing that the ACU was faulty.
breakfast in coach was not that great.

Boarding the plane is an unpleasant experience because the passengers carry on too much luggage and the roller suitcases are too big.  Finding sufficient overhead space is difficult and dangerous.  Either you start to better control what's brought on board, or pressure suitcase makers to design a smaller standard roller suitcase.
The flight attendants all seemed to not enjoy your job (they were not smiling at all)

Negative experience from older plane. Cramped seats. Very few lavatories detected. OK for this flight, but not if there had been tarmac delays. No jack detected for audio music as on many previous flights.   Bearable because this particular flight was on time. But it would have been problematic had there been tarmac delays, which seem quite likely.

12 hours after my flight landed in Munich, my luggage is still lost. Very stressful as I had to rush to buy some clothing for important business meeting. How can you not at least know where it is? Several of us whose trip started in St Louis have lost baggage.
Lost my bags and had no wifi. I should absolutely be getting refunded for this experience.

Food choice is poor.  Both meals chickenin cheese sauce and ravioli in two sauces are mediocre and for frequent flyers on this route, very repetitive! One time, this meal is fine.  Every time, it's repulsive.
flight attendant must have been having a bad day.  not a single "please" "thank you" "hello"
The check in agent was rude and the flight was delayed. Both flights on roundtrip were delayed and all customer service agents we're rude

This is a red eye flight.  Besides leaving the lights on for 2 hours after take off and 90 mins before landing a large number of the crew (5 or 6) was loudly chatting for nearly the entire flight.   I admit it must be boring to watch a cabin of people sleeping.  But get the hint. We want to sleep!!!    Also put chair upright with about an hour to go and no one bothered to ask if I wanted a drink or food.   Just poor Polaris service.

Horrible experience. The airport was about 85 degrees. The plane model was in need of repairs and we were delayed at least 2 hours plus. Communication through united app or emails was horrible. Delays not updated. Creating travel issues for family members. VERY BAD SERVICE.
It is frustrating when delays are caused by mechanical problems.  I got home at 2 am (since we don't live close to the airport) and had to go to work today, so I'm not happy with United today.
Poor customer service at Stl gate, delayed plane arrived early and was not paged to gate for boarding. Seat was given away to standby too early.

The flight continued to get delayed, but the staff neglected to inform us as to what was going on/the cause. We were traveling for business, so we were very worried that the flight was actually going to be cancelled, but none of the staff would tell us what was going on. Would have been nice to been told why we were delay and what the plan was going to be.
The TSA was very unprofessional, ignorant of protocol and procedures, and almost forced me to miss a flight that I was 2 hours early for, because of  their incompetence.
5 hour delay due to nonfunctional plane  Arrived 330am to spend day taking care of cancer patients  No lounge  Snack cart with water  Very poor customer service

The plane was dirty and not cleaned properly. The experience with this flight was an absolute nightmare considering I had to be in manhattan, ny for a 7am meeting. what was offered and given as an accomodation in terms of points and e voucher are unacceptable.

Only small bottles of water was offered during the delay but 20 minutes before boarding started the gate agent pulled out a cart of soda and drank it in front of us...we should've been offered soda and real snacks during the 6 hour delay.
Very disappointed the flight was delayed over 5 hours. As a result I needed to hire a car service to drive me home at 4:00 am instead of a family member picking me up. Totally unacceptable.
There was no clarity as to why there was an hour long delay. the plane was dirty and it was clear that the flight attendants were frustrated
Experience at Newark was awful; no seats; long delay; few updates.

Information. that is all passengers want. Why can't the gate crew know what the maintenance issue is. It give passengers a way to determine if they should look for a different flight or not. I never understood why maintenance cant share the reason for the maintenance with the ground crew. It is ridiculous. If I as a passenger knows that the issue is a light bulb vs a tire or other larger issue, it give me options to address my travel needs. Also, the gate agent told me the she made an announcement because maintenance told her to do so. The announcement was: "Our flight will be departing at 7:15pm". This was made at 6:50pm with no one on board yet. I asked if she had ever boarded a 737 and had it leave the the gate in 25 minutes. She answered, naturally, "No". So I asked why she made that announcement, and she said that is what maintenance told her to say. What kind of system is that? You need to re-asses you entire operation and how you deal with your customers.
Unfortunately the stewardess was very rude.. and pushed me to get to first class. I don't want to  think it was intentionally.. Just that maybe, she was preoccupied..
My bag was severely damaged, handle completely riped off,  TravelPro Magnum Xl.
No TVs on board and the Tv on my way down to Floriida was broken.

departed on time; arrived on time BUT flight crew had to come from another aircraft and difference between arrival time of that flight and departure of our flight was on 45 min which delayed boarding.  IF there had been any delay what-so-ever with the crew's inbound flight, we would have been late in spite of having an aircraft available.

The actual flying experience was the worst I’ve had in a long while. I fly regularly for business and pleasure and the experience was below that of most of them, the in flight turn just off the runway was so tight while descending that it made me dizzy for the 1st time ever and while we didn’t experience any bumpy turbulence, we dropped several times about mid way through the flight that made it extremely uncomfortable. Most people on the flight made gasps/ groans  out loud.
The attendant spoke in broken English and was very hard to understand.  If there had been any emergency, I doubt if anyone would have known what to do.

My friend and i were verbally and almost physically assaulted by a black man when boarding upon reporting this to a male flight attendant he was even more disrespectful than the guy that assaulted us. Flight attendant til us to stop “bitching”  or we wouldn’t get on the flight.  We were completely scared and intimidated not just by the black male passenger but also the flight attendant.  Even when the other passengers attempted to tell the flight attendant about the guy  he was rude and didn’t care to properly handle the situation.  Please contact me directly 2016478311

The security line in Orlando is literally a danger.  The amount of people waiting is most likely way above occupancy limits and probably a fire hazard, something should be done to limit the crowds on busy days.  The seats on United are claustrophobic. There is no wiggle room, and I am not a big person.  I feel bad for tall or heavier people, they are spilling out of their seats onto other passengers. These cramped quarters lead to short tempers and bad travelling experiences.

It was a difficult check in process, because my 13 year-old daughter was separated from my original reservation, and when your system did that, my known traveler ID was dropped, and your system would not allow it to be added back on.  Your employees tried, but the system would not allow it to work.  This was frustrating because I could not go through pre-check, however my 13 year old daughter was allowed.
There was a group of about 12 that was very rude to those around them.  Kids were climbing over seats and blocking the aisles.
No it was a horrible experience.

To reiterate: the hotel i stayed in was horrifying. I feel bad for the employees because it seems like poor management by the company that owns the hotel, and they are just doing the best they can with what they have to work with. All that aside, not a place that I’d send customers I wanted to get back.

I upgraded my business travel at my own expense in order to fly in first.  My coworker flew economy and was stuck between two people who took both the armrests and all three required more space than is provided in economy.  She was miserable and in pain when she arrived.  Your economy seats are far too narrow for Americans.
Cabin appearance was not great seats where dirty and so where belts my screen didn’t work and it was constantly freezing cold on board for the whole flight

Why not always offer personal device entertainment? The idea of DirectTV is horrible since we have to pay additional and the offering is poor. Tired of seeing only this option and not personal device entertainment.

I was extremely disappointed about the baggage claim service. I bought a new luggage for this trip; By the time I checked in  my luggage from Newark, it was still in a new condition.   After we arrived Portland and received my luggage, it was broken.

These new hard seats are really uncomfortable to take a nap in.  And I don't like having to pay for carry-on.  I don't like the a la carte method - carry on should be included in the airfare, and   It feels sneaky not to include it.

This flight ALWAYS seems to get canceled or delayed, and it is truly pathetic!!! I really hope that in the future, this does not happen again for it has happened to me & my family the past 3 times we’ve booked this flight. The flight attendants were snappy and rude and I was not pleased with how they treated us on the flight. Thankfully we got home, but there always seems to be a problem with this flight (“weather”, “technical difficulties”, etc.)
I can't wait until you replace those old Embraer jets.  They are small, cramped, and from what I've read, incredibly fuel inefficient.  No wi-fi on board, they are terrible planes.

A lot of confusion as to whether or not the flight would be completely cancelled or not, as the flights at nearby gates to South Bend and Grand Rapids were both cancelled.  Very poor management of the situation and communication could have / should have been much better.  The flight ended up being delayed by 1.5 hours due to some combination of maintenance and fog.
WiFi access issues. Couldn’t access without a google account. Very disappointed.
Long delay waiting for other flights to come in.  No compensation given for this inconvenience.

There were over 200 people who arrived to the airport to catch this flight on time, but after we boarded the plane, the ground staff made the decision to hold us on at the gate for almost an hour past departure time so a few people could make a connection.  This was very frustrating for many of us and infuriating to others.  I don't know who those people were, but when most of us are late, we miss the flight and catch a later one instead of holding up an entire flight of people late at night.  Many of us had to work the next day and were trying to get home and did not appreciate being delayed an hour for a few passengers.  When I read the note from Oscar Munoz in Hemispheres that you're trying to improve customer service, this is not an example of that.  If this keeps happening on a regular basis, I will choose another airline to fly.  There are lots of choices out there in case you guys hadn't noticed...
Yes.  Lady at gate was horrible.  More than rude she was awful.  She would make me not wanna fly United.

I am enraged that I was not able to have my checked bag upon arrival to Madison. The United team seemed to randomly select bags that were "worthy" of making it on the plane and it upsets me that mine was not one of them. I was told there was a weight and balance issue on the flight but this was not handled in the appropriate manner. Guests should have been warned of this inconvenience prior to entering the baggage claim area. This was very unprofessional and disturbing to a customer, like myself who flies United frequently. I am still awaiting the arrival of my bag, as each hour increases the level of my anger. I would normally end this with a thank you but this situation is not deserving of such a nice closure. GET MY BAG TO ME SOON!!!!!!!!!!
I just wanted to tell you that pretzels are disgusting and I was sad that we didn't get the stroopwaffles that we got on the way TO the DR.

The problem we had first of all we were delayed on the trip on 1/17 and then on the way back again we were delayed missed our early connection and on the flight we were booked on after that it was delayed so ended up getting in Louisville at 1:30 took us forever to get a ride to get a vehicle ended up getting home at 2:30 had to call in late to work so it wasn’t a good experience
Communication at the gate related to delay was poor.
The crew advice fight was full, but they had empty seat and I had to stay seat on the dirty seat.
The seats were very dirty. Crumbs and dirt inside the seat area.

The people working at check in were extremely rude and would ignore people checking in to talk amongst themselves, I overheard their conversations and they were personal not work related and heard swear words in their conversations which made me extremely irritated and uncomfortable that what was the reason we were not being helped. I have never had this experience with any other airline. When they finally did assist people they were extremely rude and acted as if everyone was a bother to them. On the airplane, the crew was very nice but in every announcement they made mistakes and had to keep coming back on to make corrections, it doesn't make a flyer feel very safe when the crew isn't prepared and seems to not know what they are talking about. I have never filled out a complaint before but this stuck with me after my last flight, I travel a lot and have never had this experience before.

Upon arrival in Grand Rapids, the jetway was either malfunctioning or inoperable. Rather than rolling up some stairs and ushering able bodied passengers into the terminal, we were all kept onboard for 45 minutes approximately, causing further delay to an already delayed flight. No compensation or alternatives were offered at any time. No food or drink was offered despite the delay keeping passengers on the first (INOP) plane until concessions were mostly closed in Chicago O'Hare. No timeline was ever disseminated to passengers. We were just vaguely told to go to gate B2.

If a passenger asks a first class flight attendant what kind of beers are available, they should not respond with "Well did you look at the menu?"  STOP BLAMING PASSENGERS AND TREATING THEM LIKE AN INCONVENIENCE.  It's a reasonable freaking question!!!

Overall a decent flight but the cabin was a little dirty and the food selection for lacto ovo vegetarian was not good (I wish they would give the choice because the pasta served would’ve fit my dietary needs and would’ve been preferred to the Indian meal).

We sat in row 22.  In front of us, many seats were empty, including the exit row 21.  When we asked the flight attendant about moving up, she brusquely told us we could not as those seats were higher priced than what we had paid.  Putting aside how ridiculous that is given the seats were empty, the flight was departing, and no new "buyers" were going to suddenly show up, what about the safety concerns?  No one in those seats (row 21) meant no one was instructed and ready should the emergency exits be needed.  I highly doubt the attendant, if there was an emergency, would be able to make it up the aisle, pushing through the higher-paying, panicking customers, to release the exit for those of us in rows 22 and higher.  You really need to review this policy from a purely safety point of view.

They should check ahead of time to make sure everything on board works. Too often I haven’t been able to plug in and watch anything on the screen because it’s broken or too loose and keeps falling out. I was so looking forward to relaxing with a movie and very disappointed when I couldn’t which has happened way too often. The woman next to me also couldn’t as hers was broken as well. Can’t maintenance check these ahead of flights? Why offer something that’s too often broken and non functioning?! Ronnie was the first attendant who cared and went out of his way to make things better!
The kosher food options were quite poor and the walk up bar that Polaris advertises was almost non existent

1. There needs to be some better arrangement for getting on the aircraft (1,2,3,4,5 lines). People were lined up before any number was called, creating avic. Everyone was standing and creating problems with people entering the previous numbers when called eventually. It should be based on seat numbers not by 1,2,3,4,5 class. I was in the middle of the plane but was one of the last people on because everyone was up way before the employer called anyone's number.  2.I made a point to pack lightly, I paid extra for reg. over head. Before enter the air craft it was told that there was no more over head so that anyone moving forward had to have there luggage (over head) checked... and that it would not be available back in Newark outside the door but would have to be picked up and the luggage claim. When I got on the plane- there was plenty of room in the over head luggage compartment. This was so frustrated. The employer checking our boarding pass before entering the aircraft- was rude/nasty. Yea it was late 11:06, but no need to be unfriendly.  3. My seat was changed. I made my ticket arrangements months before. There should not been any reason why my seat had to be changed. My friend paid for extra seat room and an aisle. The only seat available was a window reg. seat. You can imagine how angry she was. She paid extra and got a reg seat. She bought the ticket because she has anxiety. Just plane rude, she paid for her tickets months in advanced and before me. How does this happen. She now won't fly United. You screwed yourself.  I always trusted United, No so much lately!  RK
despite a great flight and crew, it is very upsetting when in first/business class and paying so much more to be sitting next to a toddler who ended up screaming most of the beginning of the flight

There was a medical emergency on the flight, and it is understandable that the crew would focus on the emergency as their highest priority. But along with that, provisions should be made to ensure meals are served on such a long flight. No breakfast service or hot beverages were provided before landing. This was very inconvenient for such a long flight.
Stop charging "standard" $25 baggage fees and then allowing passengers to bring "carry ons" that hold everything up. Lose the $25 fee.

Prior to boarding, arrangements at gate were horrible, and may have caused stampede while getting down on escalator. Flow of passengers to go on escalator was not managed at all. Worst experience of my life for air travel prior to boarding.
Submitted feedback to 1k voice. Gate agent behavior was rude and unprofessional

Both flights fine but I am furious you now have one flight only ( EWR ) in the mornings from PVD. Awful!!!! ORD and IAD were always an option and you have killed both!!! This is inexcusable. You are causing me to look at switching to American now. No Chicago is unreal!!!

On the way to and from Chicago the overhead bins were full even though the plane wasn't fully boarded. If I'm going to pay for a full price ticket that includes a carry on and personal item, I should not have to be forced to check in my luggage. United needs to do a better job of monitoring how many pieces of luggage customers are bringing on so the rest of us aren't forced to check luggage which has the potential of being lost. The flight attendants are also rude and treat passengers like schoolchildren. Terrible.

It’s frustrating as a business travel to be forced to check baggage when you are boarding the plane. On my past 2 flights I have been forced to check bags only to get on the plane and see that there was plenty of empty overhead space right above my seat? What can be done in the future to avoid this or to know this in advance so that you can build in additional time to deal with baggage claim etc.
Lost luggage in Ewr. Baggage was delivered 29 hours later. We would like consideration of $50.00  Refund. We check bags to avoid chaos of overhead bins.  Losing our luggage was inconvenient.

two items: 1) I was in seat 11B, the flight was at 6:05am, so it was dark outside and the cabin lights were dimmed.  My reading light was so minimal that I could not read.  I believe other lights were OK, but my light was not useful. 2) I believe our plane was hit by lightning.  Many of the passengers discussed what the flash and bang were, but there was no announcement from the captain.

For an aircraft of that size, there's no excuse for only having 13 rows of economy plus seating other than your pure greed to jam packed more people on to that flight. I have frequent-flier status and was stuck in a middle seat with my knees in my chin!

Why are planes that travel to major cities at peak time use a plane that crams in passengers and definetly not enough over head space for eveyones bags.  In group 2 there should b space but since it was a small space there was not and i had to waste my time to wait for.my bags?

Baggage claim to retrieve my belongs was very dissatisfying. The terminal I landed in was in a total different terminal where I picked up my luggage. No one told me that all luggage was being transported to a different terminal and I had to wait 30 minutes after my flight just to retrieve my bag. Very disappointing

The tiny plane was incredibly uncomfortable.  There should not be a plane that only has three seats across.  I hate gate checking my rolling carryon.  I don't care about leg room-- seats need to be WIDER!!!

I was unable to put my arm rest down due to the person sitting next to me. I was in the middle seat and very uncomfortable. Because I was unable to put the arm rest down and comfortably sit in my seat I had to lean to the right the entire flight leaning into the man to my right. This cause my back to hurt and my back muscles to spasm. Flight Attendants should notice these awkward and uncomfortable situation and attempt to help the person is sitting in a seat where the arm rest cannot be put down.

United allowed an extremely large passenger to book one seat in economy. He did not fit in the seat and spilled over into my seat making the flight awful. I only had access to about 1/2 my seat making t very uncomfortable.
The head rest also was very uncomfrotable.  It was so worn that it would not hold any adjustment.  It was quite uncomfortable especially with my Directv contoller not working.
Yes, my seat was old and broken. It was as if all the springs had been taken out. Very uncomfortable in this flight

The gate agent and flight attendants were all just "meh" in terms of how they talked with people. The flight attendant serving drinks was terribly difficult to understand when he spoke to us and didn't actually appear to be listening to our requests and responses to him. All in all, "meh" sums it up for me.

Booked 2 seats together with my wife. Middle and aisle. Get to check in and we are both in middle seats. On opposite ends of the plane. The person at check in was extremely rude and did not care about my situation. When I️ got the gate the staff member was very understanding but told me that the flight was full and she couldn’t change anything. She refunded the difference because I️ paid for economy plus. She was very understanding and FRIENDLY. I’m disappointed that this happened but I’m still a big fan of United. I️ also don’t like walking onto a plane and dead heads are in aisle seats and I get moved to middle row in the back. I️ booked my flight in advance, silver preferred member, and I️ never complain about anything. I’m disappointed.

I am really disappointed in the downgrade in quality of the food in first lately, both breakfast and dinner. I expect more. I am allergic to tomatoes, so have to avoid the current hot option, so I am now getting "cold cereal" as my breakfast. Also, United used to provide a croissant or biscuit with breakfast and has cut that out.  Lastly, I am very disappointed in United's decision to remove all forms of blended whiskey from all flights, or at least domestic, as that is what I fly. There occasionally was Crown Royal and at least Canadian Club, and often they would run out after just a single drink as others on the plane were drinking it. Now, there is nothing. To those that may think that "scotch whisky" is close enough, or the same, they are not and cannot be substituted in mixed drinks.

Our flight from Burlington to Chicago was diverted to Green Bay and the crew did a very poor job of managing the incredible inconvenience this caused to the travelers.  The crew showed up at the departure time the morning following the diversion which caused us to miss our connection in Chicago to KC.  The crew simply stated they were required to have 10 hours of rest while the customers were told to be at the airport with roughly 5 hours of rest.  I will do everything possible to never fly United again.

In the middle of the flight there was a request for “medical personnel.“ I am a physician and I address the issue of a patient who was feeling poorly. I stood with her, asked questions, measured her pulse, medically assessed her condition ,suggested treatment and rechecked on the patient through the flight attendant. The first class flight attendant failedTo even offer me a simple thank you for services which I did not have to extend. I am a gold status member and my wife is a platinum status member – I found this lack of courtesy appalling     but I must say not surprising given the general poor quality of service I received from your airline with few exceptions. You have much to learn from other star alliance airline companies such as Turkish, Thai, and Singapore. I never would’ve been treated with such disrespect and indifference by them. I await your personal response.
A very long delay getting deiced in Spokane, almost missed our connection in Spokane
Our flight was delayed nearly an hour and the reason for the delay was not communicated nor was it communicated when we’d actually leave Chicago

Flying on a regional jet for 4 hours in bumpy conditions is unsafe for your flight crew and highly uncomfortable for your customers.  RJ should not be flown for more than 2 hours.  We flew 4 hours of major turbulence almost the whole time.  Simply awful as your trying to cut costs and sacrifice basic needs.

It took an extra 30 minutes to claim my checked bag at Akron.  When it did not arrive at the carousel, I went to the united counter and spent 20-30 waiting in line to inquire about my bag.  The attendant checked that the bag did arrive but was left outside by the plane.  I happened to have a tight business schedule that day so the incompetence of mishandling my bag was very frustrating.
No recognition whatsoever for being Global Services. Also poor service.
Horrible seats!!!!! Chairs barley tilted back and were hard as a rock to sit in!
These small CRJs are extremely uncomfortable. It’s unfortunate that UAL has chosen to fly them on most of the flights between ORD and MCI.

My wife was told she could only have 1 Baileys for her drink. I received curdled milk from the flight crew TWICE and as told "If I don't like it, order something else." there was a long white/blond hair in my wife's food (pictures to prove it). Flight crew was VERY RUDE. All in all, I'm NOT HAPPY at all with MY FIRST, and seemingly ONLY, experience with flying United! I don't see spending that type of money with your business again unless something is done. I would like a refund or something to make up for this. My wife had never flown first class before and I figured this would be a great present for her on our anniversary. For us to be treated this way was absolutely a slap in the face. I paid a lot of money for these tickets and this is just wrong. I'm very angry about the experience on this flight.

My flight got canceled twice. I was supposed to fly on 3 jan but my flight got cancelled twice. and had to fly on 17th jan. It was due to weather conditions but there wasn't any concrete notification of flight cancellation. thus had to return back home every single time after making it to airport in extreme weather conditions. Highly disappointed but such pathetic experience.
Your upgrade process stinks.  When 85% of plane is in group 1 and 2 that is just crazy.
Back to back maintenance problems, on both the primary and then replacement plane is unacceptable. I missed a business meeting and must question the reliability of flying United on my next trip.

It was actually my flight which is again delayed from Chicago to Springfield on Tuesday evening. I’ve been flying for 15 years, and 60 to 70% of the time my flights are either delayed and or canceled for some reason, in many instances it’s due to incompetence by O’Hare personnel. The inconvenience and frustration I have experienced over the years is inexcusable. But of course nothing will change because it never does

My flight was scheduled to depart from Gate C14. To me that means Terminal C, Gate 14. I arrived to Laguardia, parked near terminal C, only to be told that the gate is in terminal B. Total pain in the neck.
Seats terribly uncomfortable and confining.  No overhead bins available by the time group 3/4 board and deplaning took minimum 15 minutes for back of plane —  ridiculous
Gate experience at arrival was worse in that we had to take bus to gate. Whole process and time was not pleasant.

Ohare was testing you  new boarding process (removing #1-#5 lanes).   This was an example of organized chaos and NOT a recommended solution for future flights.    There were many grumbles by many Group 1 & 2 passengers.   It also seemed to slow the process.
Baggage claim and customs was very bad. In fact the worst I’ve experienced in some time. Bags came out one at a time...

Please stop serving that disgusting hot sandwich in the morning.  It is a disgrace.  I bring my own breakfast just to avoid that foul sandwich.  My coworkers and I joke about it for days after our flights.

When I checked I was place din a middle seat as I am a rather large fellow I asked to be moved anywhere I was refused As I was sitting at the gate I saw at the very least 5 otters ask the same question as well and were accommodated.This is wrong and when I questioned the woman she said "Thats how it goes " Now do you think that is the correct response and always have issues in Florida FLL
It was frighteningly turbulent and the pilots did not really tell us what was going on.  I was very scared at times and did not feel very reassured.

I was supposed to travel the previous evening but a mechanical problem delayed the flight by 6 hours. I had to reschedule (twice since I had trouble coordinating ground transportation) and the phone agents were professional, courteous, sympathetic, and efficient. My only complaint was the quality of the phone connection with them. They were a little bit difficult to understand. Since it happened on both calls, I think it's probably a chronic problem that you should address.
I don’t like your new boarding group signs. I really don’t like that cnn is on all your tv’s. Put on a neutral channel like hln or something else. CNN is annoying

Was very disappointed that even though I was only in row 11 there was VERY limited hot meal options and they only had 6 breakfast sandwiches for a 9:00am flight  that was full.  This is not the first time.

It was not the flight but the fact you charge for bags that should of been allowed to be a carry on. I was forced to check my carry on bag it would not let me check in online day before unless I did. Also a bit confusing when I got to the airport I had to check in again?

Despite my United profile showing that I require a vegan meal, none was provided. When I mentioned that I'd requested a vegan meal, the flight attendant was disinterested and offered me standard meals with dairy anyway. No alternative was provided - no food on a 7 hour flight.
Newark to Las Vegas flight barely had wi- fi. Trouble logging on & paying so waited and then did just the 2 hours. Weak and extremely slow

All good with this flight, but I have to mention of my previous week's flight from Greensboro to Newark. Flight #UA4813, has been delayed for 3 hrs and there was no prior communication. People at the ticketing counter were not so helpful, not ready to answer passengers.

The seat in front had almost no room for my in-seat bag, so I had to force it under causing things inside to become damaged.  I was on the isle and there was some sort of protective "hump" in the way.

My complaint about the cabin was I was in the exit row window seat. On Cross-country flights the exit door/fuselage gets very cold. The plane had no blankets, so I spent the flight cold. there should be some blankets available on board every long flight. Also on landing, condensation leaked from the window/door and got me wet. Not a great experience.

the commode design on this 737 is awful.  poor design that is uncomfortable for the flight crew in the galley and the passengers.  making the one in first class off limits for economy plus means a very long walk for a lot of people and no place to go if you time it wrong.  bad design.

The fight attendant asked for my drink order, then totally forgot about me. I rang the light, waited more than 10 minutes with no response. I re-rang the light, the flight attendant came and when I said, “I think you forgot my Diet Coke...” he rudely walked away without any type of apology to go get it for me. Upon return, he said nothing and handed me the can and a cup with ice. His lack of consideration in speaking to me was almost rude.
Need USB chargers in every seat for no extra charge. Dislike bag fees, too. 1 large bag per traveler should be allowed for no extra charge
The actual seats aren’t that comfortable.  As you buy new aircraft, ask shorter people to sit in them.  I’m 5’3 and my lower back isn’t supported.

The only problem I experienced was that United posted the wrong baggage carousel number in Chicago or, perhaps, staff used a different carousel than originally planned.  Passengers were not alerted and we wasted a lot of time waiting the wrong carousel.
wifi is so bad

The seats and let room are terrible. I purchased wifi so I could work but there was not room to put my laptop on the tray table. It was even worse when the person in front of me reclined. I had to try working on my lap. Wifi kept timing out and clocking.

United rep at the desk was very rude and did not help me one bit. Felt like I was bothering them. I was not expected to be treated because a card holder member. Inflight attendant was also rude and did not help with my question.

This was an older plane. The seats on both flights to and from Chicago and las Vegas were extremely uncomfortable for a 3.5 flight. These were older seats, very tight and the cushions were uncomfortable. Felt like I was sitting on a hard board for the entire time. Very uncomfortable flying experience.
Flight was also not serviced with any water.  The gate agent was frazzled, barked at passengers to board faster when they plane was late arriving.  It was just highly unpleasant all around.

Extremely disappointed at my seat changed during the night before my morning flight! Reason indicated was a last minute aircraft change. Instead of my front seat (12E), I was assigned a far back seat (22)!  And this, well after I had already done check-in and printed my boarding pass. When purchasing my flight I had paid for economy plus and selected my front seat, which became totally useless. I had to pay again to reselect another front seat. Unfair policy, and very annoying that you have to reselect and reprint boarding pass last minute before the flight!

At the gate in chicago - attendant was checking travelers’ bags indiscriminately by making traveler put bag in “sizer”. It was very uncomfortable for all travelers - as we all understood that NO ONE’s bag fits comfortably into that “sizer”. We all felt it was unjust and that we were implicated in that b/c of our silence in not sticking up for those travelers. Is that what United intends?  I doubt it. You must consider improving your communication with travelers at the gate - and if your attendants have been instructed to do this (as we all believed they were) you must have them check EVERYONE’s bag and endure the consequences of no ones bag fitting. The “sizer” is unrealistically small - the attendant - even though people’s bags fit - did not allow the traveler to take their bag with them b/c the bag touched the sides of the sizer. It was absolutely ridiculous. I, and the people around me, recognized this and were nervous, saddened and perturbed by this practice. I felt bad for the traveler and the attendant.

At the gate they made us check our carry on stating that there were no more overhead bins available. that was NOT TRUE. There were plenty. It caused a great deal of inconvenience as need to catch a connecting flight. When asked i was told it's policy to make people check bags half way through gate check in. MAKES NO SENSE. Should first confirm re lack of overhead space before forcing , or ask for volunteer offers first and when no more space advise the need to check the luggage. Left a very poor taste in an otherwise pleasant flight.
boarded on time, arrived early!  Unhappy no WiFi on that flight. Should be on all flights!

All in all, I was satisfied with my experience on this flight.  I did note that another passenger seemed to be treated badly as I witnessed the flight attendant tell them to "behave".  I don't know the whole situation but it appeared that there was some kind of disagreement,

I was very disappointed about the service! During take off my cell phone felt under my seat and I was told by Lufthansa not to move the seat as it could destroy the battery and casuing a fire. When I asked the flight attendance to help his answer was "is it my problem" and he walked away! He was not even trying to help me. Luckily I found my iPhone but this behaviour was strange.
first class flight attendant was really unfriendly and must have been having a bad day
flight was delayed for 90 mins for nothing other than traffic going into newark. so disappointing that the system is so flawed that we still can't manage aircraft traffic.
making a passenger pay for direct tv to look at the flight map is *** outrageous. Greedy ***

Why Why Why can't United get a flight to Newark on time from Memphis, last four flights to Newark were delayed, this time for no apparent reason at all, no gate announcements made except to say we were not boarding at 11AM.  I missed my trains AGAIN and was delayed.  Lastly, why did you remove the EMB175's from this route?  Seems like the 175's were more on time than the EMB145's you are currently using.  Your on time record from Memphis to Newark SUCKS.

The woman at the gate got very aggressive with a guest and then held what I believe to be a grudge.  She told me that I was REQUIRED to check my bag because it was too large yet would not let me show her that it fit in the tester space.  She became very rude for no reason even after I had told her it was okay to check my bag.  I have never had this issue before and it was upsetting and uncomfortable.

The streaming video didnt work well. I have a new iPad Pro 10.5 and im a computer engineer. The video had to "buffer" every few minutes. Causing the movie to stop. Regarding the internet, i think the price is too high. It was about $16 a year ago. $22  month ago, and now $27 ? i will pass. Considering it's very basic internet, for surf and email only. No streaming. Its too expensive.
Newark airport was a terrible connection. Due to delays, we missed our connecting flight and arrived 6+ hours later at destination. Also, Air Canada lost our luggage
stayed more than one hour and half on the tarmac due to a United IT issue is not really nice... would be nice (as AF is doing) to receive compensation. I missed my meeting at the arrival...
The food service was awful.  Very limited for a 9 hour flight.  If I had known I couldn't have bought anything on board I would have stocked up.  I will pay for food.  Please offer it.
It was a disaster.

ticket agents were seriously understaffed while dealing with the rebooking of passengers with connections missed due to the delay.  Those of us without connections could not get the attention of the ticket agent (or any other agents in the terminal) due to limited staffing.  We thought there would be a usual procedure to handle such delays such as calling in additional ticket agents to attend to the needs of passengers.  Very disappointed in this regard.

The flight, scheduled for 9:40 PM was delayed, each announcement making it longer.  We chose to book on a Monday morning flight, got a hotel room and flew on Monday. (fortunately we are flexible enough). On Monday, we learned our decision was the right one, as that flight left just prior to our scheduled departure. Our Monday flight was delayed, although only by about 40 minutes.  It would have been easier to just cancel the Monday flight when they realized the combo of bad weather as well as mechanical problems. To have arrived in Chicago at 3:00am would have been a much bigger problem.
Really poor service during our 7 hour delay in Phoenix  Poor communication  Gate agent had no regard for passengers

The frequency and content of the messages and announcements regarding the delay were poor. Not enough detail was provided and I find it hard to believe that the issue with this 737-900 was unique to the degree that not one individual in the UA system was able to either provide a remedy or scrub the flight sooner than the four (4) hours or so it took to make that decision.
Lost a Ski Boot bag that I was gonna go skiing with....which sucked that I couldn't go skiing since we finally got some snow.

Yes.  In this I would like to recognize the Global Service Rep Fausto Pazmino.  In this case, Fausto met me as I departed my flight to transport me to my connecting flight.  Unfortunately, another passenger mistakenly took my bag that I had gate checked.  The gate agent offered little assistance in helping so Fausto jumped in by chasing down the bag that was left at the plane belong to the person who took my bag.  He got the individuals cell number off their luggage tag and proceeded to call them.  We were able to race off an get my bag as the person was boarding a plane.  Had it not been for Fausto work this trip would have been a disaster.  I can not express my gratitude enough for his quick thinking and action
Other than the killer 3.5 hour delay the flight was good

This was a full flight and at boarding we were asked if anyone wanted to check their cary on baggage.  I was sitting in row 34 and after we arrived at EWR, I observed at least 5 people who were sitting 5-7 rows ahead of me taking their carry on luggage from the overhead storage app 15 rows ahead of their seats.  I believe the flight attendants should watch more closely where the people are putting their bags and if they do not sit within the immediate area, they should instruct the to bring their bag(s) to their appropriate row.  It is unfair if you board after and your overhead space is taken up by someone who is too lazy to carry his bags back to his row.
Well I wasn't happy you changed my seat.  That was unacceptable.
We were not offered any beverages in economy. There was some turbulence so we assumed that could have affected it but business/first did get service. Disappointing when traveling with kids

Not being able to print a boarding pass for basic economy is inconvenient. I travel weekly for work and spend enough time in airports. Extra time checking in is bothersome and unnecessary. You sent me enough notices to let me know that I cant bring a carry on .
Seats are much too close together. Very unhappy with the Direct TV option- very poor customer service
The food service selection was very poor.  I had the pasta salad.  Way too much corn, which is hard to digest and not healthy.  The entree had no flavor.

United you need to make some changes, you are one of the few airlines who has nothing free.  Your seets are smaller than most, you pay for wifi, entertainment and your little pack of free pretzels is just sad.
Very disappointed that movies were not available for a long flight

Security check-in was a major issue, extremely unnerving, and very concerning. It has taken me some time to process but I am extremely disgusted by the manner in which I was handled by a TSA agent. I understand that isn't under your control so I will make a complaint to TSA.
Purser was very rude and aggressive
The flight was just fine, but I did not like having to check my carry on bag or pay $25 plus an extra $25 if I brought it to the gate. This was not clear to me when I purchased my ticket.
a little bag of pretzels is bullshit.
landing was extremely rough/ hard. Hurt my back. The worst landing I've ever experienced.
The flight was fine... but the seats are too small for average size adults and the lack of legroom  makes the experience extremely uncomfortable.
snacks are terrible. pretzels are not worth opening the package.
Why were we asked to board when there was a maintenance issue? Why can you not estimate how long it takes to repair an item? How critical was the item. If not critical why did you not say so?
WiFi was very poor.

Our flight was late, but made much later because no gate was open after we touched down. We waited for almost an hour while several passengers missed their connections. The flight attendant did nothing to help those passengers find their connecting gate, call ahead to tell the connecting flight they were close, or at a bare minimum get them to the front of the plane to unload first.

The pre-boarding line-up at SLC should be better organized. The signs indicating where the groups should queue was placed alongside a wall in a way that was impossible for anyone to line-up according to how the arrows were pointing, so everyone ignored it and clustered in a mass in front of the gate desk. This wasn't a dealbreaker for me, but I did notice several people who were agitated because they wanted to be the first in their group to board and had no way of establishing that they got there ahead of others.

Yeah, the boarding group 5 was treated like second class citizens.  we were not boarded until 15 minutes after group 4, and we were threatened to be kicked off the flight if our bags did not fit under the seat in front of us.  Some aggression exhibited by the people working at the gate was unappreciated.

The 767-300 is not a good format for fliers - 1 aisle with 3 seats on either side. With baggage fees, people carry as much on the plan as possible, some boarding groups are not allowed any baggage - it is confusing and delays boarding.

please add additional agents when flights are delayed - 800# was not helpful at - basically told me I had no options to get from LGA -ORD-MSN -   I'm a college student so this was awful to be told I had no options and with 50+ people standing in line (I was 30th) - my Mom was the one that basically figured it out - not the agents.  I know I will be leary of connecting in the future from ny
The flight was delayed and departed almost 3 hours late.  This made my travel plans very difficult.

Flight was delayed which caused us to spend an unnecessary amount of time at the CUN airport. No gate number for the flights until right before boarding time.  The flight attendants were rude to customers when they were boarding the plane prior to take off. We are customers of the airline and don’t deserve to be treated like children and talked down to.
Why has FOOD become so unimportant on United? So BAD and UNINSPIRED?

my entertainment monitor didn't work  and the boarding process was horrible i was in group 2 before we were even boarding - they were announcing 4 to board everyone was mixed up   WHY would you have groups when you won't use them - people attitude is that we're all going to get on - it was terrible!!

the person in seat 3 A was intoxicated and would punch the seat back multiple times. when i asked him to stop he ignored me. he then proceeded to kick my seat. It was terrible experience and had not gotten any assistance from the  flight staff. I have never had anyone act like this on a flight, it was enough to make me switch airlines and only use Delta for my business travel. you could smell the alcohol on his man and the consistent punching of the back of the seat was unnecessary and disruptive.  please let me know how you will correct this for me.
Flight attendant very rude
Understandable delay occurred, but poor communication about time changes and I was not informed that my flight had actually been delayed to 7:45 from an originally scheduled 10am flight.
The man in the middle seat required a seat belt extender. He literally bulged over and under the arm rest well into my seat. It was horrific, and the flight was packed. 4 hours. Not fair!

Flight attendant service was poor, seat was lumpy and uncomfortable, and wifi was unusable.  United's service continues to get worse rather than better.  I'm very disappointed and will switch airlines if this does not improve.  I was offered a drink once the whole flight

The flight itself was one of the worst that I have been on in a long time.  The flight itself was very rough--there was no bad weatheI.  The plane rocked, bounced for the entire flight.  It was also very warm on the flight.

I was not happy with the service. I upgraded to a first class seat and could not put my bag in the overhead. It had small bags and jackets in there and the flight attendant refused to help me and I have to check my bag. The delay I experienced in Phoenix had more than a  monetary affect. And I had to pay for WiFi in first class?? Bad
The checkin baggage handler threw bag onto belt and even other handler said that was too hard. The flight attendents were rude and miserable. Plans were filthy and gross !!!

My wife and I had a unpleasant experience while traveling to New Orleans. There was a group of about 6 passengers that were belligerent, loud and rude, at NO point in time were they confronted by by airline staff about there behavior.

Baggage stuck on broken conveyor belt and involved in some kind of jam. After waiting over an hour without any movement on baggage carousel ( and many queries as to delay) supervisor announced luggage stuck, went to service line to file claim, when few pieces started come thru ( less than 5), then nothing again and supervisor again stated to file a claim and luggage would be delivered next day. Suddenly baggage started coming in carousel and we were able to get luggage and leave. We landed at airport at approx 5:56 pm EST and didn't leave airport until approx.8:15 pm due to this issue! Not sure I will ever check luggage again.

I responded with a neutral response for the flight attendants. They were both responsive when something was needed but unfortunately I was underwhelmed by what I perceived as not being interesTed in providing an exceptional customer experience.

My only complaint was the food selection.  On both my flight to SFO and back there were two options, one of which was Indian food both times.  Why in the world would you be serving Indian food on a US plane?  I don't get it.  I did see at least 2 Indians on one of the flights but the option makes no sense to me.

The agents were all eating. In the lobby one was eating a salad at the protium, at the gate some were eating cookies and some were eating carrots.   The gate itself was very  chaotic the PA system was useless

Only problem I encountered was a 30 minute delay because a passenger was taken off the plane by security. No one knew why and then the captain said they had to take her luggage off for security reasons. It would take some time to search for the luggage underneath the plane. Then the security person came back on the plane and was rudely smiling because we were all upset that the flight was being delayed.  One of the flight attendants even said something  to him. Then after that the passenger was then allowed to board the plane again.   Isn’t it a breach of security to take a passenger off of the plane after boarding and then let her back on?  Also security was very UNPROFESSIONAL!!  Rudely smirking and not telling the crew what was going on.   The whole plane was upset about being delayed but the captain and crew were very apologetic and tried to keep us informed.   I know this wasn’t United Airlines fault but thought you should know.
Check in on app didn't give me my boarding pass forcing me to counter.  I have Global Access and had my passport details in app.  Also, boarding process was chaotic and uncomfortable.
The person sitting behind us had a cold and now my husband is sick

The baggage claim experience at Omaha is always horrific.  It takes about half an hour to get bags every time and the flight details were not put onto the screen above the carousel.  It remained the details of the two other previous flights.

I understand the flight was only a 23 minute flight, however, I was very disappointed.  I was upgraded to First Class.  The flight attendant didn't seem like he wanted to even be there.  We were never asked when we boarded or during the flight if we would like a drink.  They did mention because of the short flight there weren't going to be any full service. The played a recorded message for instructions.  And this was first class.  Very disappointed.  Then there was a flight crew traveling to BDL and they talked the whole time dishing other flight attendants during the whole flight.  They were sitting right behind me.  Just very unprofessional if you ask me.

The wine choices are poor, especially if the white choice is always Chardonnay. You don’t have enough plates of cheese and crackers. You run out before the back seats. Often the food choices are too spicy. Many of us can’t eat that and we can no longer make requests.
being handicap, why can't flight attendants help me with putting items in the overhead? When I asked for help, I was told it's against their contract to help with overhead items.
Repeated terminal and gate change was very upsetting.  Poorest flight I’ve had in a long time.

Flight attendant (Nadine) invented a rule that carryons were limited to one bag--not one plus one personal item. She said this was an FAA rule. It is not. I had two small bags, both of which would fit under the seat or in the overhead, and both of which have been stowed successfully on every regional jet in current US use. So, Nadine forced me to choose whether I would risk the loss of or damage by rain or snow, my computer and electronics or my clothes. I am done with United.
I was transferred to this flight, and it was miserably HOT the entire trip...on top of all of the pre-flight problems.
1. Flight delayed due to no incoming crew. 2. Not much info at the gate. 3. Gate atea very shabby. 4. In exiting plane no info on number of baggage claim.

Were do I start.. The flight was 2 hours delayed due to mechanical issue and the mechanics didn't want the left side of the plane watching them work... How unprofessional can you be in a work environment that requires people to see you on a hours basis... We even left later due to additional food service requirements and there were no hot food on the plane after siding at the gate for almost three hours... I selected Untied as my business travel partner and you are far from living up to my expectation in 2018. Very disappointing experience to start the year..
They had a mechanical issue with the door. The mechanics refused to work until everyone closed their shades and stopped taking pictures which delayed us even further. Very frustrating.
Food has not gotten better despite what United claims.

I am finding that the wifi on the airplane is getting worse and worse. I tried watching a movie on United.com and it was constantly interrupted by the wifi failing. Contact GoGo and have them fix it. Craig Sokol

Arrival at a gate was just deplorable.  Outback landing, bus transport(not gate) through maintenance areas.  Arrival at a ramp appearing as if we were steered cattle to the gate.  Absolutely dehumanizing!  one hour from landing to baggage claim

Every time I have flown into Chicago something goes wrong.  Delays, Customer Service, multiple gate changes, lost luggage, you name it, I have had it happen.  I try to avoid United and Chicago at all costs because of the experiences I have run into.
Remote gate at Newark was well-managed - but obviously not a great experience for folks with disabilities or in poor weather. This may be out of your control.
My flight was delayed from both time I flew I was in an airport for 14 hours totally unexceptable I am not happy
Terrible food.  No desert.

The main reason I did not give a higher score is that my suitcase was badly damaged - one of the wheels was torn off entirely, together with its casing. The suitcase is not new and I just wanted to go home so didn't report it at the airport, but this obviously detracted from my experience.

Except for the pilot and co- pilot who did a marvelous job flying  the plane on time despite late departure , others seem to be unmotivated and going thru the motion.  We just flew flew Asia on an Asian airline and what a difference. Cabin and toilets were spotless.  Attendants were polite and attentive. They even had a menu for food served. This flight had food for purchase but no announcements were made  as to what was being  sold. Looking at the back page of he magazine which some were torn and tattered , showed Snacks were on sale . Thus is at  6 pm .  And they went thru so fast , I could not even ask. Cabin lights were also off.
Fuck you for ruining our plans with the three hour delay. At this point it's unreasonable to expect any united flight to leave within one hour of its scheduled departure.
The updates were very unclear and the delay made for a very late arrival to Atlanta

There was a rowdy, drunk passenger that the flight attendants were unable to control. Even worst, alcohol was made available to the passenger throughout the flight. This was a terrible decision, flight attendants must have realized this a little too late when the passenger began to throw up profusely. It was not flying-sickness or nauseous related, it was a straight case of the body returning all that excess alcohol exactly from were it entered the body.
I am very disappointed that as a 1k member and business class ticket holder I was not allowed to use the lounge which I had planned to in preparation for my meetings
Food was terrible, really awful.

There were two passengers in the First class cabin with phones NOT muted.  Listening to phone bings, beeps, and  burps while onboard is very annoying. The cabin is not large enough for these nuisances.    The two inconsiderate passengers on this recent flight (seats 3D and 4D)  were both upgraded to First class cabin. I paid for my first class seat 3C.  UA is not giving me positive feedback to pay for first seats if I see lower fare passengers moved up for free who then make my flight uncomfortable.  BTW: these two passengers’ phones were making noise even during takeoff. What happened to Airplane Mode?
Seating is so narrow. Makes me wonder in case of an emergency evac! You have hardly any room to move in normal circumstances, I cannot imagine how it will be in case of an emergency

I fly the EWR to MEX route often (8-10/yr) and unfortunately have not had great experiences...flights are always overbooked, aircraft old and not clean, and flight attendants not courteous. This was the first flight in over a year which the middle seat next to me was empty, the aircraft was refurbished with new seats and bathrooms clean and most importantly the attendants were very attentive. I would hope that all my future flights to Mexico will resemble the flight I took last night.

Restroom was locked for the duration of the flight and delay time waiting for the flight to take off. Brought the issue to the Flight Attendants notice and she would not even try to open and did not care as she was busy chatting with other passengers, callous.

The plane was a bit delayed getting in.  No problem.  Then we had to shuttle out to the plane which is typically no problem but in this case we sat on the shuttle for quite a long time before being informed of the holdup.  We ended up taking off nearly an hour later than expected but for such a short flight, this was not a major problem for me, although for those with connections it may have been. The cabin was uncomfortably hot, but perhaps on such a small aircraft, this happens. All of the dissatisfactions for this flight were, for the most part, out of the crew's control - minus the holdup on the shuttle which we were told was due to the crew not yet being there.  Otherwise, the crew was friendly and helpful.

The seating stunk for a business class flight for that price. The seat configurations are awful and the seat itself felt like 2 seven hundred pound gorillas had sat in them before me. Haven flown almost a million lifetime miles I find this very disappointing.
Dissatisfied that even though there were empty seats in business I could not upgrade even using my upgrade coupons

My whole experience for that trip was awful. I travel very often from stl and I’m aware of the frequent delays in outbound flights. As a workaround I always book my flights on the earliest schedule (Normaly Newark) so I can have Houston Washington and Chicago as a fallback plan. I travel most of the time to GRU. This time in my first attempt on the 21, I couldn’t board the Newark flight because of a delay due to a broken restroom. (Technical problem) then I called global services and was shifted to a flight to Chicago, which got delayed and I was moved to a2o Chicago flight that also got delayed and I lost my flight to Brazil. Because of that I had to cancel a very important business meeting , which I’m still assessing the damage of not being there but it certainly is a blow in my career. When trying to retrieve my luggage took almost 2hs for the baggage team find out thAt they were on their way to Newark on the plain that I didn’t board. Paid for a cab to bring me home and an night at the hotel due to no show....it was less then 24hs before my Check-in so they are entitled to charge. The next they I was bound to Newark again , it was on time I boarde the aircraft and was ready to leave when the stewardess told us to debark due to some delays...called global services and they moved me to a Washington flight...when I went to the gate for the Washington flight, the attendant at the gate told me that this was also delayed and they would put me into an aircanada flight...while he was finishing up my details for the transfer the gate agent for the original Newark’ flight said that they would not be extremely delayed and I could go back to that plan. Nevertheless no one could effectively tell me where my baggage was. In Newark the GS agent couldn’t be sure if my bags where on the plane or not...but a representative in SAO Paulo would expect me at the gate to let me know if the bags were on the flight or not...no one came and I only got certain they were there after waiting in the conveyor belt. I’m expecting someone calling and a descent compensation for the trouble. As you guys did really bad this time with me. Not what you preach when you told me the benefits of being a GS. Feel free to contact @ 314-258-2885  Marcos

The flight was boarded and deplaned for a what was told 1.5 hour delay and then we had no idea exactly when to come back which turned out to be about 45 minutes instead. Could have missed flight based on that misinformation.
the only complaint I have would be the very uncomfortable seats.

Didn’t like that united staff gets to board before customers.  Flight attendent boardwith 3 bags while I can only take 2 bags on board.  Of course I was the lucky person who now didn’t have room in the overhead due to her bags.  She then sat in my seat and stated it was broken that is why she took it.  After that we didn’t speak.  Customer should be first.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: At 5:10, The United App, the flight information monitors at airport, and the boarding agent all stated departure on schedule at 5:30 PM even though there  was no aircraft at the gate.  Instead the aircraft was still at the hangar.   I personally overheard the captain, also waiting at the gate, advising his crew that when he called the hangar, the personnel was unaware this aircraft was assigned to fly on our flight.  This was at 5:35 PM.  We eventually departed at 6:55 PM, 1 hr and 20 minutes  delayed.  This caused me to miss a dinner engagement where I was programmed to speak to a large group reporting to me.  Very unhappy a the misleading information on the delays.
We arrived at our destination about 3 hours past our scheduled arrival time.  The weather was the biggest problem and the flight should have probably been cancelled all together.

During boarding there were 3 designated lines. Group 1, group 2, and group 3/4/5. I was group 4 so I got in my designated line. Then the attendant called for group 3, but since I was in line I still proceded forward. The attendant said I couldn’t Board b/c it was my group, it’s a shared line. Me along with about 10 other people, had to step outside of line just for him to call our group next. Completely pointless. Once on board my experience got worse. During beverage service one of the flight attendants dropped ice on me and just said “oh it fell on the floor”. Didn’t offer a napkin, no I’m sorry. She was wrong it fell on me and I had to push it on the floor. She was extremely rude, and not welcoming, nor customer service driven.

It was so obvious that the flight would be delayed yet you did not notify us officially that it was delayed until one hour before the flight.  Then we finally get the aircraft from Omaha at 7:45 pm (2 hours after flight was scheduled to depart ORD) and then we are told we are moving gates (again) and we will not depart until 9 pm. I understand the crew no longer keep flying due to the delay but this is incredibly frustrating as a passenger. With ORD as a hub this should be much more anticipated and able for United to manage more proactively. We arrived over 3.5 hours later than planned.

3 + hour delay on departure.  The communication about the delay was poor.  Waiting on plane to arrive, seemed to communicate delay in 20 minute increments.  Finally, when the inbound plane arrived and passengers disembarking, 2 hours after our scheduled departure, the announcement was made that that plane would be used for our flight.  Another hour delay as we were assigned a new plane and gate.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: 1.Plane was brought from hangar for our flight 45 minutes after boarding time with no notification of a delay until 5 minutes after scheduled departure time.  2. United rebooked me on a next available flight thinking I would not make the original departure. I had to rebook myself back to the original flight through the unpleasant gate agent. If I didn’t notice the last minute change, I could have lost my seat.

The food selection was terrible. Having two weird chicken entrees was not a very good option. Two travelers with the same last name were assigned to different rows in a First Class cabin with six seats.
No beverage service on the flight, no explanation provided.
Flight attendant was rude. Not good service at all.
The seats were horrible. No wifi/entertainment options. No snacks for purchase. No alcohol.

Yes, I was dissatisfied with the way this was handled. I was not informed of the delay until I was already through the gate. A 2.5 hour delay is a long time for a monday and I was asked to be put on a partner Air Canada and was rudely denied by the women working the desk in the Toronto "Additional Services" desk. They seemed lazy and uncaring. I expected way more than this.

The gate area was awful and was a very long walk from the other gates; I have trouble walking and this was terrible and there was no alternative, refreshments were sketchy, seats uncomfortable, not enough outlets and climbing stairs to the aircraft is unacceptable, especially since it cost the same amount as my flight out, which was everything I could hope for

We were really unhappy that a mechanical issue had us sitting in the airport for 6.5 hours. When the crew to fix the issue finally arrived on another plane, they didn’t even have the right part so we were put on a different flight. Just very inconvenient.
The main dissatisfaction is the flight was delayed 4 hours due to mechanical issues.  We kept hearing one thing after another until eventually we were moved to another flight.

Check in at the gate was late.  Essentially the attendant at the gate did not keep an eye on the clock, and admitted that she was late to the gate to check us in.  Check in could have started on time, and the plane could have departed on time. We were 1 hour delayed.  This is unacceptable for an attendant that should have been at their station on time.

There was a large group of musicians who took up most of overhead storage with their instruments. which irritated many. Why they didnt have to check is beyond me. 2nd there was a family sitting right in front of me and (mother, daughter, children of daughter) the youngest (approx 6 months old) screamed at the top of their lungs for most of the 1 hour flight. The flight attendants couldnt do anything since they did not understand english. It was a complete nightmare. I travel to BOS at least 11 times a year for business and switch to Jet Blue last year.. now I realize why....  very sad what this flight (Boston Shuttle) has become
My flight was delayed and I had to run to my connecting flight. I barely made it. I was one minute off. After running so much while sick I had extreme chest pain. Wouldn't recommend United.
Captain made 10 unnecessary announcements all through the 8 hour flight. He never stopped talking.   This made it impossible to sleep on this overnight flight.  Very disruptive and annoying.

Captain was evening complaining. They only have one team deicing planes., Put us way behind and barely made my connection. On the flight from Chicago to KC, we sat on plane for long time because of mechanical. Very poor planning. We waited mainly for a  log from mechanics to bring back. Why  cant they use a ipad and have this sign off process instantly. That was about 30 mins. Was a 90 min delay in getting to KC and could have been avoided.

We could not believe that there were absolutely no chairs in which to wait at the gate!  not just no empty chairs, but NO chairs whatsoever for 4 gates in a row.  Why?  Another economy effort on the part of United?  Since we are in mid-seventies, we prefer to reach the gate with time left over, but have never before discovered no chair in which to wait.  Disappointed. Sitting on the floor is not easy for our age.

I'm a taller individual at 6'4" and when I asked the flight attendant about moving to the exit row(which was entirely vacant) after the boarding doors had closed she very rudely told me I couldn't move unless I bought the seat. When another passenger remarked that it didn't make sense considering the seats were empty she was very rude and snide with him as well. I've been in the hospitality industry for more than 20 years now and was completely taken aback by her reaction. I can categorically say that I have never submitted a negative review online for any reason before because I can usually rationalize a person's behavior and brush it off but she was exceedingly rude and brusque for no reason whatsoever. It was extremely disappointing.

1) flight delayed by over an hour - new plane was available, but then delayed again because they didn’t think to cater the new plane? How is that possible?  2) we land (late) and then sit on tarmac for 20+ mins waiting for a gate. Again implausible.  3) food was cold when served 4) there was bubble gum on my seat - completely disgusting  5) we were 45 mins into the flight before being offered a drink. Nothing pre departure or on the tarmac before departure  This was a really disappointing experience!

they didn't announce what carousel our luggage would be on, so that was confusing since we didn't realize there were so many carousels. they should have reminded us to check out the status board down near the luggage claim area and they didn't. good job overall , tho.
The cabin was smelling bad. It smelled like rotten wet carpet in the vicinity of my seat. I was nauseated the whole flight and for an hour after deboarding the flight.
The airplane is very noisy (ventilation disturbs considerably)

I find it extremely frustrating we were delayed due to 1. the incoming plane, 2. landing window at Newark, 3. running out of fuel and having to re-land to refuel at IAD however, we arrived (3 hours late) there in one piece, so that's a plus.

Upon leaving Dulles for Newark (on another delayed aircraft not due to weather) the aircrew elected to return to Dulles due to a large amount of runway traffic in Newark.  This is after we circled Newark airspace waiting to land.  Apprarently the aircraft needed more fuel.  Why was this not taken care of in the first place given the amount of traffic leaving Dulles and already seeing more delays ?  Upon the return to Dulles myself (and other passengers) had already missed our connections in Newark and requested de-boarding the plane and stay in Dulles for better connections the next morning.  We were denied and said we were doing a "gas & go" and headed back for Newark.  At this point, most passengers had no reason to go to Newark.  This was a very poor decision which lead to even worse travel options/delays for the next travel day.  I (along) with other passengers were stuck in Newark until the next day for no reason.  I was very un-happy with this trip !

Had to wait on tarmac before takeoff for way too long behind a line of planes. Requiring personal item (backpack) to be checked for basic economy ticket before receiving boarding pass is particularly annoying, as no other basic economy airline I’ve ever flown does this.

The pilot did a horrendous job of navigating our plane through turbulence. There weren’t any storms outside our windows and the turbulence lasted for most of the duration of our three hour flight. I’ve never been on a flight with so much turbulence and I’ve flown transatlantic numerous times.

Only saw the flight attendants when they were picking up trash at the end of the flight very quickly. They were in their seats under captains orders the entire flight due to severe turbulence for the entire ride. This was the worst turbulence I’ve ever experienced on a flight as it lasted nearly the whole length of the flight. I don’t typically experience nausea when flying, but had it this entire flight.
My case was very badly damaged upon collection
