One of the attendants was really rude. Instead of telling or helping an elderly passenger that she needs to buckle her seat beat. She looked at the elder with her back to her and pointed to the floor (bc the buckle was hanging) saying “hey, YOUR SEAT BELT! “. I find that to be extremely rude. You would never get this from SW or DELTA to say the least.
The food offered in first class caused my wife to get sick, possible food poisoning.

Everyone hates flying on 737s - they were designed to be a regional jet for short journeys and you're stuffing hundreds of people into these things, 3 seats abreast, single isle, 2 bathrooms (economy class), for 4 hours, 5 hours, 6 hours, when does it end?  The experience is like a bus in the sky - not the miracle of flight that it should be.   Top that off with seats that barely recline, no leg room, no overhead space for bags and awful experience with the entertainment.  It's just disappointing.

I was very disappointed to find out that my seat that was selected at least a month in advance was switched.  I had an exit row aisle and was moved to a middle seat not in the exit row.  I am a United employee traveling positive space so I see where the policy comes from but we should not be treated like second class citizens when required to travel on company business.  We should be treated like any other customer in these cases.
More damage to my tool box
It smelled really bad on the plain. As if all the b.o from the whole day was trapped in it

On time. Decent staff. Turbulent flight so it was a bit start and stop with the food. I was pleasantly surprised that the broccoli in the meal was still slightly crunchy (this is good) vs. mushy. It was tasty. I would have liked to have had one or two more refills of the OJ I ordered but it was fine (and the turbulence caused issues). The guy that spent > 25 minutes in the forward coach toilet should have been fined. As I said, a horribly, embarrassingly hard landing in Edinburgh. Depth perception is limited in the dark but I would think the instruments and having a co-pilot calling out height should have eliminated that but hey, we walked away.

Didn’t have what the drink I ordered (vodka soda). Ordered something else (whiskey and a coke) and the flight attendant unfortunately poured them together without asking so the drink I wanted was ruined with too much coke

The food selection was weak.  The chocolates had melted and then hardened in their package.  No way for the flight attendant to know.    I am very annoyed with Richmond ground crew.  Every time I have a late night flight into Richmond, the flight has to wait at least 10 minutes for the gate to connect to the plane.  This is not acceptable in an airport that does not have a lot of volume.
Food was not so great. Dinner was served only 45 mins before landing and it was rushed so that we can land on time. I could not even finish it and it was taken away

The flight from Chicago was very noisy. Passengers and I could all hear the aircraft squeaks and other sounds repeatedly. The most noise came from when wheels were being lifted for take off and released for landing which sounded like something braking or already broken. The sounds from the wings engaging for takeoff and landing were unbearable as well. Myself and the passengers around were skeptical and some were frightened by the loud sounds and were unsure if this flight was safe. The worst experience began after landing in DC and attempting to retrieve my belongings as well as my colleagues who had checked baggage as well. When we arrived to the baggage claim area the conveyor belt with the luggage stopped after about a minute or two in which we waited for our luggage and then we were approached by an individual you told us we could retrieve our luggage from the United room in the corner. We all lined up as well as other passengers whose luggage did not show up either and then we all were told our luggage didn't make it to DC but we had the opportunity to pick it up in the AM from the airport or the luggage could be delivered to us. We all chose the delivery option as none of us lived near the airport and had to report to work in the morning. What angered me and everyone else in the line with this situation is that the flight was not even at full to capacity and it did't make sense that so many of our luggage was not there when we needed it. Me and my colleagues were very disappointed as the other flights were no issue until we returned home with thoughts of returning back to work Tuesday only to discover none of our checked bags did not reach the destination we paid for. I have never had this happen to me before and this really changed my view on this airline in a negative way.
It is most irritating when seats recline in front of you and your knees are not in alignment with your hips because they are being pushed back from the seat.
Express flights I am not a fan of. Too small and bumpy. I do not fly much so this little plan was scary to me.

i had specifically request a vegetarian meal in my business class and my travel agent confirmed it. In spite of that i was not provided a vegetarian meal. Apparently they did not have it in the system !

The manager who checked us in was extremely rude.  Although our carry on luggage was under the weight limit and contained breakable gifts, she insisted that since we were traveling as a couple and the flight was full, that we were only entitled to bring one carry on with us on board.  We tried explaining to her that the gifts we bought would get damaged, but she couldn't care less.  I felt that she was nasty, and I would not like to repeat this experience.  She threaten us that if we try to take a second carry on with us on board she will stop us at the gate since she is the gate manager.  I was within my rights as a passenger for each passenger to have their own carry on.  My wife had private  personal items that she had to transfer from one carry on to  the other, in order to stow one suitcase in cargo.  Transferring these items in front of a crowded airport was extremely embarrassing to her. I would like some type compensation for our embarrassment and frustration.
The meals were totally lousy,  Disgusting in fact.

We taxied out to the runway only to turn around to be fueled. It cost us an hour delay. Glad pilot caught the oversight before we were in the air, but very disappointed in ground crew failing to fill the fuel and for the pilots not noticing the low tanks until we had taxied.  Also had delay in receiving my carry on baggage, which was checked in at the gate, much to my chagrin. At the airport destination, my bag was delivered to the pick up location at least 15 minutes after every other bag had been delivered.  Again, a delay which should have been avoided.

This was a re-booked flight - the one I was originally scheduled on was delayed multiple times, for multiple hours before anyone attempted to schedule anyone on different flights. It was a disheartening experience.

This was a work trip for me. A group from my company flew back all together on the red eye and I was seated next to this woman who became violently ill for 4 straight hours. It appeared she was having some kind of drug related withdrawals because she was shaking, moaning and vomiting. For FOUR hours. She was yelling at her husband not to touch her until she "got a fix" I got no sleep. Thankfully there was a seat empty in the row in front of me so I switched to get away from her. I was scared that she was going to vomit on me. It was honestly a scary experience and everyone in the rows around us looked uncomfortable. The flight attendants did nothing. They did not make her move to a row in the back and shuffle people around. The flight was not full so I think they could have done a better job of fixing the situation. It was a very disturbing flight and I hope an ambulance was called for her.
I certainly would not like to see my flight be turned around but this passenger should have been moved to an area of the plane where there was seating to accommodate her illness.

Not sure what was going on, but the last 40 minutes of the flight were kind of terrifying. The pilot let us know that there would be some turbulence and asked the flight attendants to also buckle up in their jump seats, and then it felt like the plane went into a rapid fall, with the plane not much bouncing around but instead feeling like we were very rapidly losing altitude and increasing speed as we did so. About 5 minutes into this, one of the flight attendants got on the intercom and said something completely unreassuring like, "as you can tell, this is not a time to be getting up and moving around the cabin. It would extremely dangerous." One one think, rather than giving the passengers a lecture she might instead say something to assure everyone that what we were experiencing was normal. Neither the pilot nor the flight attendants gave us any communication for the next 10-15 minutes after that, which again were a very scary 10-15 minutes. I've been on flights with lots of turbulence, but never have I worried that the plane was actually in risk of crashing. On this flight, I had that worry. I was dead asleep before the pilot made his initial announcement, and terrified after it when we began what felt like a way-too-rapid descent.

it was just an old aircraft. After flying the new Polaris hard seats, this flight was not good... bathrooms were old and very dirty. The food choices were atypically bad (i usually like the biz class options). Service was very spotty - flight attendants were functional but that was about it.

The airplane was outdated; the entertainment was old, the flight attendants did not want to service the passengers (I do not care attitude and very rude), the bathrooms were not cleaned during the flight.

The flight was delayed departing by several hours due to a power outage CLE. During the outage, there were no UA personnel in the gate area. We did not knwo what to. The few times a UA employee passed thorough the gate area, they told us to go to check-in which would have meant leaving the secure area and coming back in through the TSA checkpoint. We  opted not to do that. It could have caused us to miss our flight if they had been able to  depart. I needed to make a connecting flight in ORD in order to attend family funeral. The CLE flight did depart late . I told the gate crew and one of the flight attendants that if I was going to miss my ORD connection to LEX, there would be no reason for me to board the CLE flight. If I was not going to make it in time for the funeral, no reason to leave CLE. They assured me that I would make the connection. I flew to ORD,  I had missed the LEX connection and had to fly back to CLE. I missed a family funeral. I want a full refund. That is a lot of money for me. I flew to ORD and back for no reason.

No online check-in email notification was sent to me. I had to proactively sign on to check-in. Upon checking in via my mobile  phone I requested my boarding pass be sent via email.....and of course United failed to email/send my boarding pass.  I was not happy about that.

After checking in and procuring my boarding pass from your kiosk, I was stopped by one of your roving check-in attendants about a box I was carrying.  I am an engineer and I carry a 4' level and straight edge with me on all my flights.  She said that box was too long to fit the upper compartments on-board.  She was wrong, your compartments are almost 5' long.  I have carried this box 4' x 2" x 4" on-board on hundreds of flight for the past 20 years and I told her so.  I told her I carried it on-board from Newark that same morning (it had fit easily in the upper compartment).  She was adamant that I was not going to carry that box on board and that it had to be checked.  I should have walked away with the box at that point.  She told me to re-check in and she pushed the buttons requiring me to check the box.  She made a point of calling someone on the phone to confirm that the on-board compartments were too small to accommodate the box (the call was so short that in thinking back, it might have been a staged call, I don't believe she spoke to anyone).  I asked her to let me take the box to the gate and let them decide.  She said NO. Bottom line, the box was checked in; the on-board storage compartments were plenty long enough for my box, and I wasted over 45 minutes in Newark at 9:30 at night waiting for my box.  Your employee had an attitude from the start that I had to check that box.   You have one of two problems with that employee: either she is ignorant of the size of the storage boxes on your planes, or she was just jerking me around.  Either problem is not good for your company.  She wasted 45 minutes of my life at the end of a 17 hour day.  I should have taken her name.  Not happy with that.
Very average service onboard... clearly not engaged in her job.  Primary dissatisfaction was from waiting for over a half hour on the tarmac when we reached Chicago because the gate wasn't ready.
Basic economy was horrible. Would never select that service again. We felt as if we were second class citizens.

I have the mileage plus card and I have another MasterCard on file with Expedia and with a communication gap they entered wrong card and I have to pay for luggage. I'm not happy Person at airport would not wave fees and now I will end up paying again when I leave Cancun

Company should really consider not offering drinks to first class passengers during the boarding process. This disrupts the boarding of other passengers and is truly unnecessary for the short period of time.  Additionally, it is extremely rude for airline personnel to reach across seated passengers to shake another’s hand and welcome them on board without any acknowledgement or apology to the first passenger. The company may feel it’s important to recognize their Global Service passengers individually but this should not come at the cost of ignoring or being rude to others.
I was disappointed when the flight was delayed for about one hour without any explanation of any sort.
The ridiculously small bathroom was not clean. Not helped by the fact that numerous passengers from coach using first class bathroom.
Boarding should be from back to front to provide less congestion. Uncomfortable due to lack of leg room.

This was one of the absolute worst experiences I have ever had in my life when it comes to traveling. The gate agent in Newark was the rudest most unprofessional person I have encountered in my travel. She should not be customer facing with her attitude. She is brand destroying.
The size of the bathroom on the 737 plane was pitifully small.  I'm 5'1" and I felt very cramped in there.  An obese or tall person would have a terrible time in there.

The difference in Terminal A quality of the security experience of TSA staff is horribly inconsistent.  At 8:15AM in Terminal A, the TSA Pre-check line was closed down - absolutely ridiculous!!!!  The staff was incredibly slow on one of the two lines open, it was unreal being one of the people in the slow line.  I also resent that the "expedited" cards used in this terminal did not help one bit for my notebook and tablets.  That is also ridiculous for TSA pre-check qualified fliers.  Miserable experience.  Would not recommend United as a Platinum flier if you don't change this terminal's operations more like Terminal C.  I fly 36 weeks a year so I know the difference in quality.

I left my winter coat at the food court near gate 80 and I boarded gate 89. I realized it while being seated and rushed back. It was only a 3 minute round trip run I was willing but they would not allow it and did not agree to send someone. It was a $600 coat and did not get turned in! Yes I am upset as there was time for me to go get it before the doors closed and I had to then go back to my seat and wait patiently as others boarded. No common sense or any effort to go beyond...
Food options very limited for kids.. Just a snack no meal.

the flight was delayed for over an hour, the text came in telling me delayed but i needed to be in airport onetime???!!! then changed to on time and later back to delayed, the stewardess never smiled was very grouchy
The food is so poor as to be nearly inedible

It was freezing cold in the cabin. The blankets were thin and small. We caught a cold during the flight. Premium Economy advantages not worth the expense. No feet rest, no special service, just leg room. Food for minimal and not good. Sandwich before landing was just disgusting. Coffee was transparent! Disappointed! wanted SN Airlines, booked on their website and ended up with United.
Plane was not very clean. Newspaper from previous passenger was in my seat. Tray was dirty from previous passenger use. Attendants are not as friendly as other airlines I use.

I was bumped from my bulkhead economy plus seat even though I had a board pass with the seat information at the gate.  I was moved to a seat in the back of the plane, separated from my wife, who I was traveling with.  I am EXTREMELY unhappy with the way this was handled and that people from a previously cancelled flight were moved to my seat.

The baggage claim in Houston has been very bad for years, and it is now unconscionably awful. It was a quiet Tuesday afternoon with very few people in the airport and only two belts operational, and yet it took over an hour to get our bags. I understand there have been changes and turnover in baggage, but it is now intolerable. I have been to airports all over the world, including third world countries in all continents, and Houston's baggage service is the absolute worst of any airport on earth.  This is NOT an exaggeration. I realize this is the responsibility of the Airport, but you definitely have influence over their operations.  Thank you.
As usual horrible customer service from flight attendents

My flight was delayed for three hours because of a maintenance issue.  I was able to scramble and get on the next flight.  My seat was not as good, of course, and I ultimately arrive more than two hours past schedule causing me to miss a dinner appointment
The Milan airport is a pain in the neck...you have to walk miles to get to the gate.  Not your fault...just sayin’.
My bags where damaged and customer service informed me nothing can be done to compensate me for the damage!

Gate agents forced me to check a conforming carryon because their count said the overheads would be full.  They checked me and many others.  Once boarded there were at least 15 open slots in the overhead.  Don't artificially constrain carryons until you know there is no space.  It ticked me off and lots of other people.  It was even worse on my return flight with people with pre-tagged bags allowed to board ahead of me, and many people with untagged bags boarding behind me.  Still departed with about a dozen open spots for carry-ons.

Your seats are uncomfortable and much to close to the row in front. I am a slender 5’9 woman, and my knees were almost touching the seat in front of me. The shape of the seat plus the head rest do not encourage good posture.

On both legs dogs were allowed to board with disability announcement this was WRONG. Dogs do not get precedence. Also neither dog was in a container and one of them sat in a vacant seat. This is unsanitary and could cause problems with allergies. Dogs belong in containers
Seating very tight no leg room  Very uncomfortable and I am only 5.7

United Airlines at O’Hare has become a very poor experience.  My carryon bag is essentially a laptop bag that can hold one days worth of clothes. I’ve traveled all over the world with it as a carry on.  The security person at O’Hare was telling me it would not fit in the cabin overhead space.  Your “test” space has obviously changed so that you can force more people to check a bag and charge them.  I took out a book and some work papers from the from the front pocket and showed them it would fit in your tiny test space.  The ridiculousness of this experience was unnecessary. I had already dealt with a weather cancellation and rebooking and I was already going to be late to my meeting - adding unnecessary time/frustration to the security process just made a bad day worse.  If United is so cheap that you are now forcing carryon bags to be checked, that is appalling.  Additionally, the fact that you only have 1 TSA precheck line at the very end of the terminal with poor signage is also appalling for a large airline, who’s hub is at OHare. I started through security before I was told it was not precheck and had to go out and go back down to the entire other end of the terminal to go back through security.  I paid for tsa precheck and expect to use it whenever I travel for its convenience.  This experience reminded me why I fly Southwest instead whenever possible.  I’ll be reminding my corporate travel desk of this, as well.

Disappointed we were delayed due to no crew! They had to call a crew in as no one was scheduled! That is rediculous! The slight 15 min delay waiting on plane to come in was not a big deal but having to wait additional 50 min to get a crew in!!!! Really???? As for the crew coming in on day off they were polite and professional!

The flight attendants were too young, unprofessional, and ditzy (including the males).  They were constantly chatting about personal matters which I was forced to listen to (who is “hot”, what they did this one time, and it went on and on).
The food selection in Polaris was horrible. I did not eat entire flight because it was so bad. Your person in charge of food should be more in touch with the customer.
I am very disappointed in the food available between meal service. There should be snacks available.

Newark lost my expensive Bass Guitar. I waited 1.5 hours at oversized delivery and nothing! They didn’t even apologize. They just sent me on my way with an orange sticker. I’ve been waiting hours for its delivery. Totally bad experience.

I was downgraded from an economy plus seat, to the smallest seat row on the plane - row 7.   There is no legroom, and there was no previous announcement of this except at the beginning of boarding.  I paid for economy plus, and did not receive a seat anywhere near what was expected.
I hate those damn screens that you can't keep turned off. I don't want to see your advertisements.
poor communication of flight delay.  "Wind in Newark"  when wind was 3 MPH (even according to the pilot!)
Flight sucked! Horrible. And the bathroom was dirty

I paid for two first class tickets, had boarding passes and when went to board plane was booted off with no seat.  Your total lack of regard for your customers is finally pushing me to look at other airline options!

I travel to West Palm a lot during the year. Along with other passengers, I am so disappointed that you have decided to stop serving nuts, meals and the cookie. I pay a lot  for 1st Class.  Bad enough the only decent thing to eat is the cheese platter but no nuts or a cookie? Come on. I understand United wants  to make money but are things really that bad??
Seats are horribly uncomfortable.
Seat comfort is terrible very uncomfortable
Everything was adequate, but these seats really could use another 1/4" of padding at least. It gets painful...
The flight attendants had one beverage service during the first hour of the flight and then hid in the rear galley until trash collection prior to landing. Unacceptable on a 4-hour flight.

Communication concerning late incoming flight was poor with little hard information.  Failure to assign a push back crew resulted in a very long time loaded and ready to go despite reported 4 pilot requests for crew.

Terrible.  The flight was delayed 1.5hrs before I even got to the airport and did not know that.  Many other airlines and when I checked before I left the house for the airport, there was no delay indicated anywhere.  Flight ended up leaving over 3 hrs late, missed my first connection and ended up renting a car and driving the last leg from Newark to Wilkes Barre.
Horrible airport experience

I was VERY dissatisfied with the service provided during check in for this flight. There were not enough United team members present to assist with kiosk check in, it appeared very unorganized. In addition, the person who initially came over to approve my personal item was VERY rude and does not belong in any type of customer service position for any company, especially an airline. I asked a different employee what his name was and was told it was 'Willy'.   Other than my experience with this man and the check in process at this specific airport, I was very pleased with United. Thank you!
It was delayed and i want to be compensated for that waste of our time.
Your flight attendants are terrible, miserable, disengaged and unhelpful.

We are an older couple that do not travel much thus we needed extra help at the check-in Kiosks.  A very friendly rep (rep 1) was very attentive, went above and beyond and took time to care for our needs, however one of her colleagues (rep 2) very unprofessionally in a loud condescending voice continually kept berating rep 1 for taking time with us which sadly caused allot of stress for us. Unfortunately we were so stressed we failed to get names and would have made a very glowing report for rep 1 but a very negative complaint against rep 2.

I think it's ridiculous that you charge a fee for what should be a carry-on bag. Are people supposed to walk around naked at their destinations. If I had known that : 1. I couldn't choose or upgrade my seat and 2. Had to pay for a lousy carry -on, I would have picked a different airline or chosen a different     option on United. If I had been in group 3 or 4 and had gotten to the gate and there wasn't     enough room in the overhead, my carry-on would have been placed in the plane at no cost.     Stop nickle and diming people. Just make it simple for a passenger to get from point A to B.     I truly feel sorry for the elderly, who at the airport were totally bewildered with having to      pay for their carry-on. It's a sin what you do to those people that think they are getting one     thing and then get sucker punched by your airline.      I will always look into JetBlue or Southwest before I book a flight with United.
Horrible turbulence
Your baggage policy is NOT appreciated. I was FORCED to check my back for $25 because I had an economy fare. I call bullshit
Increasingly it is very difficult to fly United given the lack of service and the lack of the internet working on your planes.

There was little communication about the delay  -- why it was happening, if we could be certain there wouldn't be further delays, etc. Once we finally left SLC, there were additional delays at the end of the trip: first, when we were close to the airport we were told that we had to circle for 30 minutes before landing. Given that our plane had such a precise departure time from SLC, this seemed absurd and frustrating. Then, once we had landed it took more than 15 minutes for us to be able to disembark because of an issue with the auto-leveler (?). I assume that this last piece was just bad coincidence, but it added a final frustration to a long and frustrating day.

Aside from your inability to properly maintain you equipment, you baggage handling process is sadly lacking in foresight. I arrived fromSLC with many skiers. The luggage carousel for the baggage was # 2 and the skis came out about a 1/4 of a mile away, so it felt, at about # 9. Knowing that many people arriving from SLC are skiers, it doesn't ale a genius to make the carousels closer together. It just takes someone with foresight.  Between the problems going out to SLC and returning I am very dissatisfied with your airline.  Within the next year I intended to be flying my family of 18 to Israel and before that my wife and myself To India.  I would like someone from the airline to contact me regarding the multiple problems that inconvenienced me on the round trip flights.  If not I doubt very much that I willow consid33 United for my future travels and it would also mean that the time put into your questaire is not appreciated by Unites Airlines.

Seats are too narrow. Always touching the person next to you. Uncomfortable and gross.  Food cart hits everyone in aisle seats. Flight attendants with wide hips are always bumping into people in aisle seats.
The delay information should have been reported in the airport more quickly.  The app had more current information.  Being late made the subsequent logistic of my travel much worse.
Catering was bad.

I have 3 complaints one that you can’t fix & 2 that you can. #1- a man put his rolling suitcase & his large back pack in the overhead taking up space that should be for others ! #2- the man next to me smelled so bad that I was gagging for most of the flight ! #3- a lady sitting near me was coughing a very heavy cough into her hands at least 25 times ! I realize that you can’t do anything about the horribly smelly man but I still wanted to mention it . As far as people putting extra stuff in the overhead that I’ve seen on many flights , I think ther should be a way to watch for this & not allow it ! My biggest concern is the coughing lady ! With this dangerous flu epidemic I would encourage you to make an announcement that you have masks for people to keep them from spreading their germs ! Also if people could cough or sneeze into their elbow & not on their hands that would help too.
Flight attendants were not very friendly. They seemed cold and uninterested, not warm and welcoming.
the gate experience is the worst i have ever experienced

I always check my luggage (Pay the $25.00 fee) and go on the plane with my purse and a backpack which includes my laptop, however on this particular flight too many people come on the plane with a rolling luggage and a personal item (which goes in the overhead too). Because of this there was no room for my backpack, purse or heavy jacket in the overhead. These items also did not fit under the seat in front of me so I had to place them all on the floor where my feet go making this a very uncomfortable flight.
The worst attitude flight crew I have ever encountered on a flight they all had attitudes not sure what is going on at United but this crew were just not friendly at ALL
The delay was extremely inconvenient and we were not informed about the delay until we arrived at the airport.

When I checked in on-line. had much difficulty getting baggage receipt. Representative was not knowledgeable and gave me wrong information.  supervisor disconnected my call. Wasted an hour of my time. had to start process all over.
The tall blonde long hair flight  attendant who managed the back of the plane was very rude an unpleasant an no name tag
First class return was not worth the price - in addition to my husband's tray the food was options were very poor and the salmon was was of poor quality.
Food options were very poor and I asked for a sandwich from coach!

Gate attendant forced me to check my carry on bag which was within the acceptable size standards.  I have traveled with this particular bag both domestically and internationally for several years and never had been required to check it.  It was not due to lack of overhead space as I was in group 2 seating.  This was inconvenient and unnecessary situation.   Additionally the attendant was rude in her manner of speaking.  Due to Homeland Security I did not protest her request, but felt it was an unwarranted and unfair request.
The seats were miserable and the baggage fee outrageous for a credit card carrying premier member.
No wifi onboard. Request flight miles for lack of wifi services.

The plane was filthy.  I brought my own cleaning cloths and wiped grime and grips from all around the seat area.  The bathrooms were filthy and old.  All that has been is new seats but that does not erase the oldness of the plane and wear not he plane that was not fixed.  No, amenities in the bathroom.   Dirty floors and torn carpet.

Flight was delayed for 1 hour to try to fix the electrical system to plug in your ipads and phones.   If they took a vote, everyone would have said they don't care.  As it turned out, we took off without fixing and got in late.

Flight was delayed due to lack of available flight crew because of winter storm. Rescheduling new flights was not an enjoyable process. Agent had incorrect Rochester airport, then booked two out of three travelers, but then couldn't get the third passenger on the same flight. I received revised email itineraries for two of three passengers, but never received the one for the third passenger. Flight from RST to ORD didn't have coffee/tea. Flight attendant wasn't the most friendly.

the flight attendent, Allison Gonzales (nametag) was very rude. I had a small roller bag that I carry on United express flight for a quick overnight and it fits well in the limited bi space. After i placed it she came over and said she needed to remove it because there was a "new" policy (I flew the day before and had no problem) and no roller bags were allowable in the over-head. I asked why she was not removing any of the other roller bags? Mine weighed less than 12 lbs all together. She turned and walked away then came back and replaced min bag with a briefcase. The other passengers around me were also upset by her behavior. I am a 1 k traveler and I do not make a habit of taking the time to complain but something was going on. Do you have a new "policy"?  Thank you for reading this and taking action. Ms Gonzales did not say anything about a weight distribution issue but if there is a policy for that reaason perhaps she should consider losing weight herself as she does not fit well going down the aisle of these small planes. Amy Pollack.
Flight in and out of Newark delayed and weather was fine. Disappointing. Wasted time that costs me money.

Unfortunately, I had a very bad experience with two fellow passengers (a couple) who were seated in front of me. I was seated in 9B (middle seat) and the couple were in front of me in the bulkhead row - 8B (the man) and 8C (the woman). The man in 8B put his bag under his seat on my feet and when I politely told him that it did not belong there & he needed to put it in the overhead, he got very aggressive and swore at me using terrible language loud enought for a lot of people to hear! The fellow passenger in 9A also told him that the man in 8B that he was in the wrong but he continued to be obnoxious. I should have contacted the captain or lead flight attendant about this extremely rude person but I did not want to create a bigger scene & wanted to get home. This is clearly not United's fault in any way, I just felt I had to share this terrible experience.
I was disappointed that we had to pay for the Direct TV access after having been delayed going to Newark.

The flight boarded 1/2hr late because there was no United employee at the gate to start letting us board. I arrived in Chicago and almost missed my flight because of it. My flight from Chicago to Sioux Falls on January 16th was even worse. The plane had a mechanical problem that was fixed. During the repair the pilot decided to leave, so we had to wait for another. Then we sat for so long that the plane needed to be de-iced for a second time. Then we taxied to the runway and sat there for 30mins and was told we need to go back and get more fuel. So we tacked back and sat at the gate for another 30mins. I was 4hrs late to my destination. I will never fly with United again and will continue to tell everyone of my horrible experience.

The plane was a 737-800 and very disappointing compared to the 757-200 flight to Fort Lauderdale.  The 757-200 felt like first class travel; the 737-800 first class compartment felt very little different from economy.  Further, the flight stewards were disappointing:  they had little to do as there was no meal service.  Yet, they spent most of the time talking to one another in their jump seats rather than assisting passengers.  There was also a line to use the lavatory as the flight stewards declined to stop economy passengers from using the lavatory. Also, one of the pilots spent time talking to the stewards while getting snacks while leaving the door to the cockpit open - what happened to keeping the cockpit door closed to avoid terror incidents?  Lastly, and I know this is petty, the snacks available included only 3 bananas which didn't go very far - but then I noticed one of the attendants eating a banana that had been put aside for the stewards to eat which is a misunderstanding of their priorities.  The plane and the first class service on the flight to Fort Lauderdale were outstanding; unfortunately, the same could not be said of the return flight to Newark.

Flight was delayed second time for us I even called ahead to try and change my flight gentleman said no delays in sight.  Also screaming kid in back of the plane was ridiculous we need to get a quiet room for screamers this kid literally screamed the entire trip.
The late delay was unacceptable.
The flight delay in Wichita forced me to run to my connecting flight in Chicago. Not the best travel experience. Extremely stressful!

There was one thing that was very disappointing about this experience, relating to the original flight that was cancelled.  The weather at MSP was very poor on Monday, and when I called to get advice about switching to a flight the next day, although the agent was courteous, she was not as helpful as she could have been when I asked for her thoughts on whether the original flight would go. She knew (or should have known) that the five previous flights were cancelled and that all other airlines' flights from MSP that afternoon and evening were cancelled, so there was no way that my flight was going to go.  If she had communicated that, I would have switched the flight in that call.  However, because of her response, I researched the situation and found out the two very relevant facts above (especially since Delta -- MSP is one of its hubs), and then had to call back a second time to switch to another flight.  Fortunately, I got one of the remaining 2 seats.
Knowing that the incoming flight was delayed from Raleigh (2 hours), updates to the Newark to Cleveland flight did not update this delay until I already arrived at the airport.

I dislike this type of plane and the weird way these seats recline.  The seats are uncomfortable.  The plane was rocking and unsteady on the incline out of Newark.  Also, the fruit/cheese platter options ran out in 1st class.  The pasta was inedible, hard as a rock with that option.
Maintenance delay. Lengthy paperwork delay. Poor communication. Poor in flight clearance out of turbulence.

The pilot on this flight should be investigated. This was one of the worst flights I've been on and the turbulence on the climb out of Newark was 100% pilot fault. There was a storm cloud off to the right as we climbed out of Newark and this pilot turned right into it shortly after takeoff even though there were clear skies in front and on the left. I have no idea what he was thinking and the fact that he put all these passengers in harms way is grounds for a clear cut investigation. This wasn't unexpected turbulence at all. He knew what he was doing.

Flight was delayed for two hours.  There are no lounge options at this airport.   The plane is very old.   The food served in first class was terrible. Ice cold pasta, chicken, and carrots. The carrots were inedible.

The plane was so small and cramped that it was a miserable flight. The overhead bins were full and you couldn't store anything. The flight attendants were not friendly. They seemed very annoyed and irritated like they did not want to be there. It was already cramped and uncomfortable and they didn’t make it any more pleasant. I travel to Michigan often for business but I am considering driving!! At least I won’t be cramped and uncomfortable!

The flight was late coming in. The aircraft is very small and the man in front of me put his seat all the way back. When the flight attendant came along with beverages I told her he was too far back for me to put my tray table down. She didn’t even ask him if he could put his seat up a  little to accommodate me! We didn’t even get a bag of pretzels as we did on the flight to NJ! Very poor.

First of all the boarding process was free-for-all like I've never seen.  I arrived at the gate early and they were just going rogue boarding people in any boarding group.  That greatly upsets me.  I cannot tell you how upset I am that I am gold and in a boarding group with people who have your credit card.  Often I'll fly in the front of the plane and now I can't get my bag near my seat unless I go line up in group 2 before anyone else because now I'm with a million people who don't deserve to be in that line and now my bag goes behind me.  It's so wrong.  I feel so worthless. There were bags on this plane that were oversized and couldn't fit in the storage properly so people who do follow the rules couldn't get their bag in.  You have to take care of the people who are good to you and I don't feel like you do that.
Food bad

UA changed my seat from 10A to 11B, the UA baggage check refuse to help and told me to go to the gate to inquire. Why couldn't the front baggage check-in doing anything. The Gate agent only said she was sorry, but there's nothing she can do. Why were I sent a notification of my seat changed? I sat next a big guy that took up the both arm rest, pushing me into the aisle seat man. This is the worst flight I have sat in, over 4 hours I am squeezed. The gate agent told me to call customer service and ask for some points. Shouldn't she have just offer the extra points. I don't have time to call customer service and explain this situation.  I have many more upcoming trips that I am considering changing airlines. You can call me to discuss: 650.303.7463

When beverage service came around, I asked if I may have a full can of Coke Zero. Male FA on this trip said No. After paying an additional $85 for the upgraded seat, which was most uncomfortable, don't appreciate being told I can't have a single can of soda which costs you far less than I paid for upgrade.

I had ordered the cheeseburger for dinner, but I was surprised that it came to me in such a way that I had to 'put it together' myself at my seat.  I was messy and thankfully, no one was sitting in the middle seat so I could use that tray to hold the extraneous cardboard boxes and waste paper.

Something must be done about the number of economy passengers that come to business class to “visit” on this flight. There are people hanging over seats, loud taking and constant movements back and forth. It is very frustrating and the flight attendants are helpless to try to prevent it.

Having Direct TV onboard is awful - or at least give us the option to watch entertainment on our own devices.  That screen is too small and not crisp.  Just let me use my iPad.  Ugh it is terrible and a complete waste of resources to install those screens.
After upgrading to first class at $200 a ticket, we felt the plane was just tried, seats worn out, no built in entertainment, lack of extra pillows or blankets. disappointing!!

The Basic Economy check in process is a pain in the rear end. Why you would offer a discounted product that requires more staff resources is beyond me. It's bad enough to not be able to check in online, but then when I'm using the kiosk at the airport the staff are visibly annoyed at having to come over and assist me with finalizing the checkin process. I wanted to say to them: "It's your own company's damn policy you have to come over here so don't throw attitude my way." But I didn't because we all have bosses that implement stupid policies by which we have to abide.

The day before the flight I received a text message stating my seat was being changed from 8D to 24D.  Which I felt was unacceptable.  When I boarded the person sitting next to me was very large and required that the arm rest had to stay in the up position for the him  to fit in the seat.  I felt very uncomfortable sitting next to this  person when clearly he should have purchase two seats.  The tray was dirty and the Hemispheres magazine was wet and nasty.

I received notifications that my flight was delayed 35 min, but did not receive one when it was "UN-Delayed.   I almost missed my flight because I arrive at the gate when the delayed flight should have started boarding, and was almost the last one on-board. The flight actually left early.

They closed the door way to early before take off (20 miunutes) so the poor flight attendance could not take care of the first class cabin as she had to do FAA obligation. She took pre flight drink ordered but could not give them as she got busy with other thingts. She told us how frustrated she was that they did this to her.
Flight attendants were incredibly rude and unprofessional. Will not choose United again.
Boarding in Greenville ignored GS and boarded all Zone 1 at once. Gate checked bag with GS tags came out dead last at Ohare. Froze my ass off on the jetbridge

I was very disappointed that we were delayed & then you sent me a text saying I could change my arrival to an airport within a decent range & when I went to do so you wanted to charge me $75. I believed I would be able to switch for free. All your staff was very nice & polite. No complaints with you. I checked jet blue & their flights were not delayed.

How on earth can a short flight from Milwaukee to ORD that takes 11 minutes in the air have us sitting on the runway at ORD for 45 minutes before getting to the gate making me almost miss my connection.  You need to get your act together instead of causing additional stress after sitting on a shitty small RJ.   You really are a terrible airline.

No recognition of global service status by the flight attendants. No “thank you”. I asked the flight attendant for my complimentary snack and he said “I have no way of knowing you are a global service” - this is a short flight. Later I saw him selling snacks. Disappointed disgusting and pathetic behaviour.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: Very poor communication of flight delay and no help re-booking. Beyond security and customs, there was only one food option and most of the time there wasn’t a united agent present.
For first class, the catering was very disappointing. There were 3 chocolates or 2 bags of vanilla covered something or others - limited choice and quantities.
Nope.  Great flight.
no. u guys suck. ur app sucks. fix it.
Yeah.  Fuck your scumbag CEO Oscar and FUCK YOU UNITED

Hello, my poor rating for the check in was because when I arrived to ORD it was about 40 minutes before my flight and I was not allowed to check my bag due to the time. I went to the ticket counter and explained the issue and asked the ticket agent "what options do I have?" She explained I needed to take the next flight. I offered an alternative that I could carry on my bag and pay whatever fee would be associated with this because my bag met carry on size requirements. The agent said this wasn't possible. I continued to explain that it should be and would pay. The agent packed any sort of empathy and was completely unwilling to help. It was important that I make my original flight but I felt dismissed and that the agent didn't value my business. It was not a pleasant feeling.

There were supposed to be outlet plugs between the seats, but they were non-existent. The reconfiguration of the seats is too small and narrow. They are very uncomfortable for flights longer than an hour.
Was looking forward to having an outlet to plug my phone into on board - disappointed there wasn't one. Also, free internet as advertised was USELESS. Other than that, all else was great.

Our flight attendant was extremely rude to my fiancé( who is a star alliance and premier member) and I. She was very unprofessional and disrespectful to us Infront it other passengers all because I needed to move a different seat because I wasn’t feeling well. Not a great experience .
Not a huge fan of the layout of business class seating. No storage, air nozzle pointed at face causing dry mouth, etc.
Busing to aircraft at Newark (EWR) not a great experience.

The way the aircraft was set up, you couldn't tell what was economy plus and what seats were economy. The regular economy seat was small and I kept getting dirty looks from the passenger in front of me because my knees were hitting his seat (which he reclined and he was in economy plus!).  It was a long flight and I had the chance to switch to economy plus but the agent at check-in couldn't guarantee that the seat she was going to switch me to was in fact economy plus because the plane has a strange layout. It was a bummer flight considering how much it cost, probably close to $500 for a one-way ticket due to a change fee of $200 right off the top.

I had one day passes to the United club that we’re not accepted. The reason being they were too crowded which did not appear to be the case. This was the 2nd time they weren’t accepted and will be expiring 1/31/18. I feel at a minimum I should get new passes and an apology for them suggesting I go to terminal A where they might be accepted. Quite insulting knowing how difficult that would be.

Reason for low rating at GATE:  When I checked in initially, I was assigned the seat I reserved.  When I went to board at the gate, I was denied and given a new seat assignment without any notice. When questioned, no one knew why my seat had been changed so that I could not sit in the same row as my husband.  I was told that I could ask whomever was sitting in my first-assigned seat to change seats with me so that I could sit near my husband.  To make matters worse, I had something similar happen to me on my 1st leg of the trip (Chicago to Denver on Jan 20)--in this incidence, when my husband and I arrived at the airport to check-in, neither of us were given our original reserved seats and we had to sit in seats approx. 6 rows apart which just happened to be in different sections of the plane (there was a divider between sections).

Gate 88 out of Toronto is awful. The seating area is cramped and we had to walk out on the tarmac. It was raining and freezing and the ramp was very icy. Also I had not expected to have to go outside so my coat was packed in my suitcase (so as to leave more room on the plane for the bags of others).

Although i didnt have a roller board bag, they stopped  nearly half the plane bringing on their bags due to the announcer saying there was no more overhead space. This actually wasn't the case as many overhead bins were half empty and some completely empty. Although this didnt directly affect me, it would affect my future decisions when selecting an airline.

The person I sat next to wreaked of alcohol as soon as he arrived on the plane. He then was served 1 Bloody Mary, 4 glasses (big glasses, 6-8 ounces each), and brandy before falling asleep. I own two retail wine shops and have worked in the industry for a while and the signs were there to slow him down, or cut him off. It’s an uncomfortable thing to do, I realize that. But it made for a very unpleasant experience for myself.

There needs to be a psychiatric evaluation and qualifications test for express attendants and pilots.  The three of them on this flight were idiots and acted as if they had some kind of an axe to grind with United corporate and so aggressively attacked the passengers on this flight!

El día 22 enero 18 salía de viaje y me atrase y cuando llegó al mostrador de la línea ya no había nadie me habían adelantado el vuelo me comunicó a la línea aérea united y la solución era pagar $65.00 dólares no lo encuentro justo pero nada lo acepté para el día siguiente el 23 enero 18 me pasa lo mismo de nuevo me atrasan el vuelo 2/hrs la experiencia horrible uso mucho la línea aérea y siempre hacen lo mismo creó que deben hacerme un crédito por el extra que pague.. Espero su respuesta..!!
very disappointed

Reason for poor review was bc luggage wasn’t asked to be checked till we were at plane door entrance.  Seemed disorganized about how many were on flight.  Said to be full flight so luggage had to be checked, yet manybopen seats and overhead space.

The only issue I had aboard the flight was with Wi-Fi. We hit turbulence but I understand this is unavoidable. I am wondering if I'd be able to get a partial refund for the Wi-Fi since my boyfriend paid almost $10 to use it and it worked about half the time. The flight attendants even restarted the router after complaints from other customers.

It’s horrible that our plane sat for several hours BEFORE someone noticed a problem with the landing gear. That could have been address while the plane was sitting or at least while we were waiting for the crew, that sat for an hour waiting to get to a gate, to arrive

1) We sat at the gate for a long time and it took us a long time to actually take off.  No one word from the pilot.  Absolutely no explanation.  2) This was an old and tired plane.  My seat cushion was completely worn and I could feel the supports.  It did not compare favorably to the American flight I flew back to Philadelphia in which the 757 had lie flat seats and they were brand new
Poor communication skills Alternatives not provided Recompence not provided I will not fly United Airlines ever again!

The delays for this flight were unacceptable, the lack of communication for this delay was unacceptable and the cleanliness of the plane was unacceptable given that our flight was delayed an excessive amount of time and the plane could have been cleaned while waiting for the flight crew to arrive from Philly!  I will most certainly be following up with direct feedback.

I originally had a reserved seat assignment in economy plus that was cancelled and required reassignment at the gate when only economy seats were available.  I am 6'1" tall and have long legs...the economy seat spacing was extremely uncomfortable!  Has your CEO ever traveled in economy class to assess the experience?  My knees pressed against the tray table in front of me while the passenger in front of me essentially reclined into my lap, which made it almost impossible for me to work on my laptop computer.  No one should have to travel under these conditions....really!

DFW terminal E isn't very good.  There is no TSA pre check  near gate E5 that I flew out of and so you should really tell customers to arrive at the other end of the terminal to go through pre-check.  Also, the food choices are not very good.  Need some decent sit down restaurants.
Cabin pressure was not good.
When flying first why are you getting rid of TVs?!  Not everyone wants to hold an ipad. And then you charge for WiFi.  And your planes are dirty. And no foot rest. Your planes are crap.
I hate ord. Every time I fly through there I hate it. I will choose a different airline befor I fly into Chicago again.

The amount of leg room is awful, I’m 6.3inch and you are forcing me into buying extra leg room seats. The seats are not comfortable at all and on a long haul flight, I think that is terrible. I fly 2-3 times per month inside America. I use JetBlue wherever possible, simply because of leg room and seat comfortably. Considering United are one of the more expensive airlines, it’s just unacceptable
Hated having to walk off the plane into the rain.

The check in process for basic economy is terrible. There aren’t enough united employees helping at the kiosks and it takes for to get someone’s attention to help. Plus because of this process basic economy flyers are stuck in the worst seats! Twice I was assigned to the very last row next to the bathroom where I was repeatedly hit with the refreshment cart. The flight attendants were rude and took almost two hours to pass our refreshments.

The man at the gate (for boarding) was extremely rude and deliberately hassled passengers about their carry on bags.  I have a small carry-on suitcase that meets airline regulations that I have used for many years.  I had a few items in the exterior zip compartment making it approximately 1/2 inch bigger than the bag size gauge at the gate.  He insisted the bag had to be checked.  If I can avoid it, I will never fly United again.  American and Southwest Airlines value my business more by treating me better.  That guy should be fired because he has a bad attitude, clearly hates his job, despises passengers and treats them like dirt.

so we boarded and pulled away at 9pm roughly 1.5 hrs late due to gate area personnel giving pilot wrong info we taxied to de-icer, who then informed us to go back to gate to be de-iced.   this all went fairly well and timely.  However no tug drivers came back to gate to push us out until 10pm.   This is unacceptable.    This is something that never should have happened and is unacceptable, esp on an already delayed flight.      There was no other area to post this reason for being very dissatisfied....

I did not realize I only get one choice to comment. The departure was a debacle. Not only was the plane late (which happens) the ground crew made no effort to expedite our de-icing or subsequent pushback. Even the pilots were clearly irritated. And you need new movies for the streaming service. Miss Congeniality and Lethal Weapon are literally decades old and they are in the Recently Added category.

I was initially given economy plus due to my flight being rescheduled, and flight plan changed after a delay. My seat was not next to my wife as promised, so I asked if I could switch to an open seat beside her using the app before taking the flight. I was told that would be fine, so I left to catch our first flight. Despite my seat already being in economy plus, and her seat being in economy plus, it would not allow me to change seats without charging me nearly $90. With no other choice, we downgraded our seats to economy to sit with one another. I was cramped, my knees jammed into the seat in front of me. And a large man sat beside me, and despite his best efforts he couldnt help but encroach beyond the armrest into my space. I dont hold him responsible, and I made him aware of that. Your seats are too small, and the rows too close together on this particular aircraft. At least for flights of this duration, I am not pleased, and may consider other options in the future as my company also utilizes Delta, and American.
My seat at row 10 window on the right was very uncomfortable. My bottom was aching because the padding was poor. Otherwise it was a good flight.
You can't control the weather, which was pretty bad coming into Portland, but that pilot had some SERIOUS skills and put us down in a very bad head wind. Thank you!

Terminal A at Newark sucks, crappy security, crappy facilities. Plane was delayed (2 in a row - well done) - 90 minutes, not getting me to my destination until after midnight. I'm getting so fed up. No compensation. Consistently crappy service.
When I arrived on Newark, my flight was delayed for 6 hours. It took me 12 1/2 hours to get from Palm Beach Florida to Bangor Maine. My back and hips are in pain from the travel.
The check in process is horrible when attendants don’t want to help when you are at kiosk. Shouldn’t have to check in with attendant just for them to make sure you only have one personal item.

A meal should be served in first class for this 8pm flight.  One has to leave Manhattan no later than 6:15 to make the departure at LGA.  There is no time to eat dinner before leaving for the airport.
It wasn't bad at times but the sound was annoying and rest room was mess.

Very bad food in Business class. Especially the meal just before landing was horrible. The pre- meal drink service was ver poor and limited. More like a second grade economy class service. Very very bad.

The connecting flight was good.  The flight (UA5995) from SAT to ORD was not pleased at all with flight attendants.  The flight had a male and female flight attendants.  Neither one seemed friendly, no initial greeting and no greeting upon leaving plan.  The male flight attendant was, somewhat rude and not very friendly in character as compared to previous flights.  Upon serving my drink I asked may I have a can of ginger ale, he handed me a can as if it was an inconvience to him.  He offered no cup nor ice.  I said thank you and no reponse.  I was watching a movie when the sound can on on my cell, I quickly lowered the volume.  The attended, snapped at me and said use head phone, you have to use head phones.  I was apologetic and said sorry, did not expect the sound to come on so loud.  I lowered the volume to below talking level, for about 7-10 minutes barely hearing the sound.  He came back and snapped at me and said headset, use headset.  I responded, sorry if I had a headset I would use it.  he then said use the headset, peopel are tring to sleep.  It was a flight from 5pm-8pm.  I was seated in the very back 25d.  no one at 25c, a young lady listening to music at 25b, and a guy seated at 25a.  The two in front of me 24c & 24d had their light on talking with each other.  The couple at 24a & 24b, werte wide awake.  So I could not understand why, with literally very low audio on my cell, why the attentant was rude in what felt like he was scolding me without cause.  I just felt, he could have been a bit more courteous and proffessional in his manner.
The food was poor. The meat was totally dry/overcooked!!! Also the fritata with poor taste. In general the food could improve!

I did not take the first segment of my trip and united cancelled my entire trip. I could not take the second segment of my flight and had to end up paying a 200 dollar change fee to get on the second segment of my flight which I rightly paid for. Incompetence, greedy, and unfairness are words that are under descriptive for United Airlines. Total disappointment

Yes, I origianally had a flight to Chicago and was given a warning that the weather was going to be bad and to change the flight.  I tried to get a flight with friend to DUlles IAD, and was told it was booked.  IT WAS NOT.  My friends were home at 6:53 PM.  This was not acceptable.
Attendant was very rude
Food is bad
The service by the gate is horrible

One stewardess was obnoxious regarding collecting meal trash. Not my fault that she did not use gloves, and/or that the meal comes with too much shrinkage material, some of which falls on the floor sometimes. Additionally crew's presence was only during service time, and rarely seen in between. Water was distributed only once through the cabin, excluding preliminary small bottle. Snack services were marked "Kosher" which is very good, but did not have content labels. If they did - I couldn't find them. Meal quality is constantly going down (terrible dinner) with  items most people won't touch, like bread and cake, and the entree was ridiculous: ground beef on watery pasta. It really looked like dog food. The reading light at 21G was directed BETWEEN my seat and the adjacent one. Worst of the experience was an attitude by an unpleasant stewardess. There are other options to fly to Israel if this is the best United can do on this very profitable route.
Poor food, unhappy stewardess in economy plus

the lead flight attendant and one older female flight attendant were complaining out loud that passengers were bringing on oversized and overweight baggage. During take off, one overhead bin opened and a suitcase came flying out hitting one passenger in seat 19 or 20 C. The older lady came to check and complained (2nd time, 1st was during boarding) about passagners overloading bags. Then the lead flight attendant came and started to explain to the passenger, who was injured, that it was the other passengers fault for overloading their carry on bags. The passenger said the latch didn't work and lead attendant said that was not possible because they all work perfectly. He never even checked the overhead bin that opened or looked at the luggage in the bin to see if the bags were indeed overweight as he claimed. These two people were entirely unprofessional in my opinion, especially the lead attendant. You say you are changing the culture but this shows you have not worked hard enough at that change. It's disappointing because I prefer flying United.
The plane could not get any smaller or tighter. The poor gentleman next to me keep apologizing for his legs on my side of the seat
On the way out from Chicago to Phoenix the passenger seated next to me was clostraphobic it made for a bad experience on your plane
food choices poor, nothing available except cereal for breakfast, only meat calzone for lunch, what happened to salad or a fruit &cheese plate, also no dessert at all
The male flight attendant was extremely rude to all passengers
Gate attended was rude. When all passengers had boarded, I stepped to ask her a question and she yelled at me to either board the plane or stay in waiting area. Very unprofessional behavior!

Why am I paying about $800 to fly first class when they did not have any food choices or drinks? The person across the aisle ordered a bloody Mary, then there were no more left. For breakfast, there was one order of the yogurt/cereal option, then all they could offer me was turkey and I don't eat turkey. Why don't you stock your planes properly? Why charge for something you can't deliver? So not worth it!

I am very disappointed that all seats in coach are not one price.  It is stressful to have to change our seats at the time we check in and pay alot more in order for me to sit closer to the front of the plane.  I would like it to go back to the way it used to be.

The woman at the gate was extremely unpleasant and despite the gentleman telling me there were 131 empty seats, she would not allow us to bring the car seat on for our infant son, despite this being the safest option for him to travel. I am very disappointed with United.

At check in there was an error with my reservation so I had to go to the desk. There were three agents working who didn’t make any eye contact while they talked on the phone and completely ignored me which was rude. If they would have made eye contact and indicated for me to wait with a smile it would have made a complete difference.
No vodka. the breakfast was poor.
This was the first time I had a bad experience

The person in the row in front of me, threw up all over the aisle.  The mess was not cleaned up, it sat there for the whole flight, just covered with a plastic bag and blanket.  That is disgusting, I have never seen anything like it on a flight, specially NOT in first class.  I would like some compensation from United for this awful experience.
There was no charging for devices and no movies

United’s personal bag policy is confusing  I have a computer bag on wheels which is smaller than most book bags  The ticket agent said that the bag can’t have wheels   I live in Chicago and will never fly United again  The policies are inconsistent Worse, is the absurd position designed by United leadership that force their ticket agents to execute such non customer oriented policies    I fly twice a month and tried United again   After a poor experience in the past    I suggest that Warren Buffet sell his stock quickly prior to the airline tumbling in the abis   I was not alone in my opinion   Good luck to you on your pathway to offend customers   I do not believe you stand a chance surviving with such tactics

I haven't flown United in a while and was shocked at the lack of leg room! I'm only 5'4 and my knees touched the seat in front. Unable to reach anything I placed under the seat. First thing I told my 6'4 husband was that there was no way we could fly together - he couldn't fit and we can't afford upgrading every time. Passengers shouldn't be penalized because they are tall (or 5'4!)

Seats seemed to be even more cramped than a typical flight.  I was also forced to check my carry on bag as the overhead bins were full.  While I understand that can happen, I pack light specifically so I can avoid waiting for checked bags at my final destination.

The plane was so small and it was so cramped up and i had a first class ticket and still i had to find space for my cabin bag which was just 1 while people had stuffed 2-3 bags. How are they even allowed to get that many in cabin. Also the flight attendant who was announcing was constantly confused and not announcing well. Clearly either forgetting what to say or just not in the zone.

You screwed me over for two flights and stranded me in the airport with no compensation for a hotel, food, or extra milage for 12 hours. I explained I only had euros and the currency exchange was closed, but I was continued to be treated poorly. Wouldn't even give me a discounted hotel. I'm never flying United again, and will tell others to avoid it after this horrific experience.

We arrived early in Los Angeles, and there was no gate available; understandable.  However, by the time we actually got to the gate, it was well past our scheduled arrival time.  This means that the problem wasn't our early arrival, rather it was logistical on United's part.  Sat on the ground for nearly :30 following a 4 + hour flight.  Not great.
Economy Plus it was really bad. Appearing as 15 years old. Space between passengers is ridiculous.

I have never paid for carry on luggage.  In the fine print when I purchased the ticket. Evidently there is a PENALTY if u don't have a United  card.  I do get miles I have a mileage plus #.  So what is the deal. Xtra $50. Seems unfair
So sick of that cookie
Last 20 min of landing wasn’t  comfortable  I guess the pilot land down faster than what was expected so I felt  pressure in my head
The aircraft was in disrepair no running water to wash hands. Seats were dirty arm rests.
You have crammed too many seats in .  Horrible.
The handle on my luggage was broken off! Other than that, no!

Paid for an upgrade in my seat and unfortunately sat next to someone who didn’t fit in her seat. She needed a seat belt extension and was sitting on quite a bit of my seat with my hip smashed into the opposite side.  Very disappointed as I paid for an upgrade.
No wifi. A few people on the plane complained that they could finish watching the movies they started on the YWG>ORD flight and were expecting to finish them.

Late plane, tight connection to UA521, lackadaisical response fro two attendants about time constraint to next flight. I’m 71 years old with both hips replaced. I had to haul ass to get to UA521, or I would ‘t have made it. I also got help from the fellow sitting Reid’s me to know which gate we arrive at and which gate UA521 left from.  Of course, UA521 left from a different terminal   Useless!  I will attempt to avoid United.

I booked online via the app, had a confirmation number, but when I arrived to check in my reservation was completely missing.  A customer representative was helpful in resolving, but it was an extremely stressful experience and frustrating given the confirmation previously received.
Disappointed that the mobile app did not work in flight and only option was to pay for tv
I was very disappointed I wasn't upgraded

Our plane aborted our takeoff.  The captain muttered that “the tower pulled us off.”  We then literally taxied and parked, taxied and parked, looked like we were going to return to terminal (app suddenly showed us departing 4 hours later). Then with ZERO communication, we suddenly rolled forward, powered up, and took off. Lack of communication makes passengers feel uneasy, frustrated and trapped. We’d already been delayed for maintenance for 2 hours (most of that time spent on the plane) where again, and I quote from employees, “no one knows what’s going on.”  The lack of communication between employees and from United to passengers was totally unprofessional and unnerving. Also, as usual, most food options ran out about 5 rows in.
Experienced one of the most unprofessional and rude flight attendants in recent memory.
We sat in First class with paid seats, not award miles. The seats had no cushioning and there was a divot where you were forced to sit. Like sitting on a board. Very uncomfortable.

the 2 hour delay due to mechanical issues was unacceptable. The plane was obviously not in proper condition and United has done nothing to date to acknowledge the inconvenience this delay created for the passengers - a drink, snack, or small coupon would have gone a long way.
Bad attitude from a flight attendant!
The flight was late coming into Chicago and then we were delayed getting the aircraft De-ice. Communication was terrible; The Pilot said absolutely nothing in keeping us up to date on the delays.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Flight was delayed by an hour, causing me to miss a connection to Amsterdam. Landing gate was changed because of delay, requiring me to sprint from one terminal to another to try to make the connection. I arrived at gate 9 minutes prior to departure, plane was still there, jetway attached, but gate agent would not allow me to board. 2 other passengers were right behind me. Apparently, no one from the SFO-ORD flight contacted the Amsterdam crew to hold the flight for 1 minute, even though attendants did ask non-connecting passengers to stay seated to allow us to sprint off the plane. I missed my Amsterdam commitments, and flew back to SFO in an economy seat. All agents and attendants were courteous and tried to be helpful, but the system resulted in a 15 hour waste of time and energy and considerable loss of income.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: I was forced to check my bag, even though overhead bins were not full, the flight attendants were very harried, they changed our gate and we had to share one with another flight, which caused delays and confusion, was not at all happy with the service on this flight.
Half hour delay due to equipment problem

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: Flight attendants were fine but this one pax (maybe former or current employee) kept talking to them so service was kind of slow. The gate area was the biggest mess. The gate agent made us GS move over and push our way in front of the group 1 crowd cuz she refused to use the other scanner (where we were already lined up in front of in an orderly way).

I cannot believe you have a United Express plane for such a long flight. Four hours, and i could not even have the whole can of Diet Coke?????? only snack boxes for sale, when the inflight menu says there's food for flights over 3.5 hours. And the flight attendants never walked around with water or did a second beverage service....probably because they did not have any! very poor service and disappointed.

Flight attendants were not that great I ordered a tomato juice and I got the little cup with the juice in it but the flight attendant kept the can of juice on my flight to Palm Springs the flight attendant actually gave me the cup and the can to refill my cup another passenger sitting next to me and the way back to Chicago Said she too was not impressed with the flight attendants

Aside from Celeste, the chief purser, and Bill, who was happy to fix my seat, all other 4-5 flight attendants I came across had to be one of the worst team I’ve ever dealt with. The were inattentive, unresponsive, unmotivated when serving, rushed when service needed to be leisurely and slow when it needed to be fast. Anytime I asked a question they acted like I was inconveniencing them. One flight attendant spoke extremely loudly for no logical reason, but despite that, still made drink order mistakes with 4 passengers seated around me. She even mistakenly gave an alcoholic beverage to one passenger who was allergic to alcohol; fortunately, that passenger smelled the alcohol and asked before drinking it. Extremely subpar crew
The flight was nearly empty but I wasn't able to move to a seat closer to the front without paying more. I don't like that you are segregating the first class bathrooms.
Very disappointed in the row space.    Getting smaller and smaller.

The Canadaair 200 planes are nothing but cattle cars, too small, too many seats, seats most uncomfortable and no room in aisle. They should NOT ever be used for flights of this length and should be retired altogether
Most the smiairhostess are without smile.  Feeling not good

I left my iPad on the plane UA5960 seat 8B. They found it and gave it to the gate attendant at gate F22. I had to go to C when they called and told me my iPad was at F22. I had no time to go back as I was at C2 and I would have missed my connecting flight. I filed a report and still getting notices it is not found. How can that be when it was given to attendant at Gate F22?
I was not happy that on the PS Sercice a lifetime Gold cannot use miles to upgrade. Not good customer service
Only problem was the guy next to me had a nasty cold and it annoyed me the whole flight
Food was terrible. Probably the worst food I’ve ever had on a flight.
i was frustrated that the computer system dropped my TSA status on the last leg of my trip.  That makes no sense.

Yes -- a flight attendant in business class loudly asking each and every one of 16 passengers "ARE YOU THIRSTY? DO YOU WANT TO KEEP THE CAN?" was incredibly annoying, time wasting, and low rent.  That should not happen in business.  It made it harder to work and slowed down meal and other service.  Most passengers were shocked and couldnt process the question, and the volume of the question was disturbing.

I left  my book on the plane and would like it back. My bag was totally destroyed and I had bronchitis so I took the substitute bag to get my things home but was so sick I neglected to take a photo of my destroyed luggage or file a report for reimbursement.
The plane was freezing.  Very cold and uncomfortable. Snacks were limited and no food service. Not most comfortable seats and know head rests.

The staff was rude and would not let anyone use restrooms until they said it was ok. They kept saying “you guys are running use rugged.. there is two of us”.  They were cold aloof and disinterested as if we all were a burden. Not professional nor kind or considerate.
Lack of acceptable WiFi is a deal-breaker.  I am a regular customer but if this pattern continues I will be forced to consider switching airlines.

It always takes too long to load the plane. Charge people to bring their luggage on board and don't charge them to check it. The seats are too close together It was very cramped. While the food was what I expected, it was not a good thing charging me for a few pieces of cheese is annoying. I downloaded the United web service ahead of time and was very annoyed that I still had to pay to use any of it. So. It was less than what I expected and I didn't expect much.

The WiFi cost was $40!!!!  I was looking forward to using it until I saw the cost. $40 for Wi-Fi access for a six hour flight is insulting and outrageous. It is the single most aggravating aspect of my flying experience with United in quite some time.  The last time I flew with you the same service was less than $20. Please reconsider this.
