When the plane landed a young woman sitting next to my wife asked if she could use her phone. My wife didn’t have her phone with her and said no. When we deplaned, we saw the young woman walking in the terminal on her cell phone. Sounds like a scam to get personal information
1) Very nasty male steward; one incompetent female attendant who noticed nothing; checked nothing; and looked like she was 'out of it'

It would be great for United's management to fly some of the new Chinese airlines. Shenzhen, China Eastern ...any of them. New aircraft,young professional and above all enthusiastic flight crews. Just try them and see where the bar is being set. As you know from my nearly 1.4M miles with United I'm loyal, but I was forced to fly AA and BA earlier this month twice and I must say it was a world of difference. The London-Chicago flight on  very tired aircraft  and apparently tired ambivalent crew, is becoming an embarrassment.

After the superb flight from Singapore to LAX this was like descending into hell after having made it temporarily to heaven. The problem started when you changed the flight schedule from my original itinerary and put me and my partner in the back of the plane in regular coach, even though we had booked into Economy Plus. Then, because the flight was so full we could only change seats to the second most uncomfortable seats on this aircraft (after your basic coach seats)--an economy plus non-reclining exit row. It was like being in a straitjacket for nearly 5 hours. STOP DOING THIS SHIT! WHEN A CUSTOMER BOOKS AN ITINERARY THEY SHOULD BE GIVEN COMPARABLE SEATING ON THE CHANGED FLIGHT OVER OTHERS WHO BOOKED THEIR TICKETS LATER!

There are too many people bringing large bags on board on these flights.  Those of us ho bring a back pack have no room in the over heads if board last or late.  There was a family that had all four  with a big bag.  Yet the guy sitting next to me had no room for his back pack.  I also had a back pack.  No room!
I feel that the airline industry in general does not care or has any concern regarding it's passengers rather it is more concerned making more money at the discomfort for its passengers.

The only issue with my flight was sitting next to a young boy whose father paid no attention. The boy played a video game throughout the flight with an irritating loud noise - the father had headphones and didn't see what the problem was. He also fed the kid candy throughout the flight which gave the kid ever stickier fingers - which ended up on the arm of my sweater. He was just a kid - I don't blame him as such. The father's level of awareness around fellow passengers needs addressing. Maybe you should consider a separate seating area on the plane for parents with young families?
Had difficulty getting on another flight.  Had to postpone a critical meeting.  Understand that maintenance problems occur, and safety is paramount, just bad luck on timing.
the seats on the aircraft are getting a little tired. not so comfortable anymore.
The delay for an hour was not a pleasant experience. It seems every time I fly into Newark, there is a delay.
Missed meeting because of delay.

I know there’s nothing you can do about small children in business class, but there was a 3 month old who cried off and on, waking me up several times. My ears are unfortunately very small, making ear plugs difficult and uncomfortable—a personal problem, I know. The young couple had to move across from us because one of their seats malfunctioned—wouldn’t have been so noisy if they’d been able to stay in original seats. I don’t think you can do anything about small children, as I said, but it does change the experience...
Gate agent was on the rude side, not friendly at all and did not even smile

The plane ran out of water in the restrooms right after the breakfast meal service, right as so very many people needed (not wanted, but needed) to use the bathroom 12 hours into 13 hour flight.  I was fortunate to have used a GPU upgrade, so the business class restroom was not as crowded -- though still out of water and unable to flush, so getting disgusting fast.  The economy restrooms would have been a nightmare to me.  Clearly someone made a consequential miscalculation regarding how much water to haul.  I get that hauling water costs fuel.  But for ALL the restrooms to cease flushing is one of the worst and most disgusting problems I have encountered on my couple million miles of flight.  It is also the first time I have encountered that problem on a flight.  But I was shocked to hear it is NOT the first time it has happened on United between Beijing and Chicago!  If I can't count on restrooms on long haul flights I will be forced to use a different carrier.
In flight entertainment was horrible.  Took 3 hours to watch a 1 and a half hour movie because it kept buffering.  Very frustrating.
I forgot...electric receptacles for charging at Fort Lauderdale airport gate did not work. I was lucky to have found one having to sit on the floor to use. Many unhappy people.
Arrived early however the jet bridge at gate 133 ( I believe) did not operate so we were stuck on the plane for 40 minutes. VERY FRUSTRATING Crew on board Duda good job though
Frustrating basic service. Wanted to upgrade and wasn’t able to do so.  Probably should have spent the penalty $50 to bring a small carryon bag.
I think you guys should explain to passengers about this grey plastic box under the aisle seats. Not sure what it is, but it made the seating very uncomfortable.

Woman sitting next to me was invading my space , she didn't let me use arm rest, she was using it pushing my arm , I left airplane in pain . Some people should learn how to deal with flying and sharing common space. Very unpleasant woman, with no manners!!!!

I was never notified that this was transport by bus not by plane until I arrived at the airport.  This is something I should have been informed of when booking this trip.  The shuttle was very small and was not at all the experience that I would choose when traveling for business.  It was extremely uncomfortable and inconvenient.
I don't care for the new "basic economy" class, and being charged for a simple carry on
Delayed 2 hours and then additional mechanical problem delay
None of these survey questions address the main issue: multi hour delay with no proper explanation.
No. Boarding was difficult. Bag size rules need to be enforced. Too many are large.

The food in business class was a DISASTER. Absolutely the WORST meal I have ever had on a UA flight. Coach passengers kept using the Business class bathroom and it was also DISGUSTING!  Filthy experience. I’m extremely disappointed in United. The flight attendants were the ONLY saving grace. Sandy was outstanding.

that kind of plane is way too small, for a 4 hour international flight.  Also the plane had  TV/Monitor, wifi did not work the seats are extremely narrow and uncomfortable. Worst flight experience EVER!!!!!!!!!!!

I along with every other traveler hates United. You are the absolute worst airline.  Terrible service, nothing included, cramped flights.  It is miserable and soul sucking to fly United.  Not to mention the fear of being ripped out of your seat.
what will be done in future to avoid finding out about oil leak during flying hours (eg. is this part of a check each morning and each evening) vs checking mid-day?
The fact that there is no seatback screen and the seats are very hard makes it hard to choose this airline for my next trip in May. Delta is way ahead of you.

Person in seat next to me was so large they couldn’t fit in the seat.  Therefore, there was never an attempt to put on a seatbelt and the staff seemed to ignore the issue.  Seat was uncomfortable as a result.

They told me there was no room in the overhead & I had to check my bag--I told them on the flight down they said the same thing, but there was room. I asked if I could check myself & the male FA said no there is no room--I got on the plane & there was room--he just was too lazy to check-now my light pink bag is full of black marks for no reason--

The experience at ORD was frustrating: gate change from C ternimal to B terminal was not shown on original gate monitors & we did not receive phone/email notifications. We learned of the change because of curiosity & only 20 minutes before boarding. The electronic notification via telephone never came thru on my phone: it came thru on my friend’s 10 minutes before boarding & when he asked a United representative about it he was told, “sometimes the system doesn’t work”! The gate agent was extremely rude, bossy, and actually yelled at some passengers. She complained about the gate configuration yet chastised passengers for being confused.  My traveling partner remarked that, in the future, he would rather take another carrier where a layover in Atlanta is necessary than experience the crazy boarding procedures  - we paid extra to sit nearer the front of the plane on our trip to Chicago boarding in group 4 & overhead luggage space was only available rear of row 26; the space near our rows was taken by people seated at the rear of the plane.
The boarding process was all messed up.  If you are using two doors to board then the boarding team needs to pay attention.  Also it is terrible that you moved the seats so close together.

We were in first class and found the food to be poor. We were also very disappointed that there were no TV screens on this flight. Due to these two issues we would look into 1st class accommodations with other carriers.
Food selection in First Class not the greatest to and from Orange county airport.
I usually travel in economy plus but it was not possible on this flight. Regular economy is a terrible experience these days. You should be ashamed of yourselves.

Mis-information about the potential extent of the delay coupled with the the 1.5 hour delay before their was a decision to invite 10 people to abandon the flight amplified the overall disappointment about the situation. the pilot even reported at one point that he had been given no new information. His honesty was refreshing and his frustration understandable - but, in the end over sixty passengers were subjected to the suffering of paying the price for some in-attentive employees mistake. the airport failed too by not IMMEDIATELY having a crew back at the plane to begin to rectify the issue. Not seeing a vehicle arrive for the better part of 45 minutes demonstrated that no one actually cared about the impact that was being delivered to flight customers.
Extremely disappointed with the seating in Economy Plus, there were just 4 rows and 2 rows of economy seating between the bulkhead and exit row. Most other planes have economy plus in all 6 rows.

Baggage claim was incredibly fast.  I could not believe it.  I was seated in row 8 so I got off the plane quickly and only made a brief stop along the way.  Was shocked to see my bag come out after only a couple minutes.
seats are too small with no leg room.  and I hate paying a baggage fee. but you already know this and don't care and are thinking of new ways to gouge us.

Flight crew in first class seemed to have wanted to be somewhere else rather than on that plane. One stewardess had a shirt on that was too small and not tucked in and her belly button was showing.  Maybe that is the new uniform for stewardesses but this one needed to loose some belly fat before showing her belly.  I was seated in row 3 and of course my choice  entrée was already gone.  My traveling companion had the same problem.   Three days before we were offered the exact menu flying in and we both did not like our entrees so we asked for the third pasta entrée and it was gone.  A sandwhich was brought up to us from coach but it was terrible.
From NEWARK to Puerto Plata was terrible economy no leg room attendant kept bumping into me didn’t seem to care
Baggage handlers destroyed my luggage  when pickup my baggage  i discovered I was missing several items of clothing

Yes the man sitting next to me across the aisle in 1D asked the guy next to me in 1A whos name was Ira to put his phone down because it was glaring in the eyes of the guy next to him in 1F so after he shut the window shade I simply asked is that better and this guy went off on me calling me names bitch saying what kind of bitch ass comment is that and then he showed me a tattoo and said I don't wear this fucking tattoo for nothing your a bitch and I looked at the guy next to me Ira who closed the window and he told me just ignore him then the guy was even more belligerent and he was talking to the flight attendant who happened to be the same Chinese I guess and he was laughing at him his name was Johnny he was laughing at him as to be laughing at me saying these guys are bitches and he was almost borderline wasted and Johnny the flight attendant actually asked him if he wanted another cognac which thank God he said no otherwise they would have been a major problem in first class on that aircraft I was almost going to ask for the captain but I didn't want to cause a commotion and maybe the guy was going to go crazy or something but somebody should see about this guy find out who he is and I would love to press charges against him for harassment and or the flight attendant because they were basically two in the same it seemed they were totally racist against me because I was white and they were both Chinese Johnny the flight attendant wasn't at all like the guy was but when he was on his side as everybody In First Class can tell when he asked him for another drink or if he wanted another drink it was almost to add wood to the fire so I would like to have somebody contact me in regards to this because I had avoided a major problem on the aircraft and the flight attendant knows it and everybody in the first row knows it all three other passengers myself IRA and the man in 1E or 1F I don't know the numbers or how they coincide on the right side of the aircraft

I had upgraded my seat to economy comfort I chose a empty row . Then just as boarding was finished  this lady came from back of aircraft asked if anyone was sitting in my row and took the aisle seat . I told her to move to a different row and that I had paid to be in my seating section and if she wanted my row I would just call my friend up in row 36A Eric fritts. I told her it's rude to cheat the airlines of $ . So needless to say she sat aisle across from my row and gave dirty looks whole flight.
Late, old aircraft, limited overhead space. Dirty bathroom.

They ran out of snacks and I was in business class and you could not even supply enough chips to deal with a full flight. This was  3 hour flight and the business cabin should have had some sort of meal or at least enough snacks. Pitiful very disappointed.
your regular coach seats are torture. I’m 6 ft even, and hit my knees on the seat in front of me the entire trip. The seats are so uncomfortable, that my back still hurts. Never again!

My rollerboard bag was gate checked with many others. After deplaning and waiting for my bag on the jetway over 15 min, I was told it went to baggage claim. It may not seem like a big deal but standing around waiting to be told to go to baggage claim is very upsetting, not to me ion my bag was the only gate checked bag that went to baggage claim. Very disappointing.

I was extremely disturbed by my experience on this flight. The lady behind me was EXTREMELY ill with the flu and should not have been allowed to fly. She was coughing and sneezing for the entire flight, had a towel/ hood on and was blowing her nose into it. It was irresponsible of you guys to allow her to fly in that condition!! I complained to the flight attendant and she told me to definitely voice the complaint to you.

you ALWAYS have excuses for delays. I believe half the delays are planed excuses. I understand safety first but waiting for paper work,  air traffic, no gate, pull from gate and sit ( so you get on time departure) it's just tooo often. When i fly Jet Blue from Newark to Fort Myers ( and Return) very seldom do you have the delays, same airport. Flight attendants need retraining. NOT very friendly, to robotic!!  Can the service trays get any dirtier??? Do they ever get cleaned? Your slipping big time but unfortunately you are  the only airline in Newark with multiple flights daily for my schedule. Oh well just another cattle!  Please stop sending surveys because nothing changes.

two passengers continued to mess with their bags in the overhead bin and the aisle delaying boarding of the coach passengers and neither flight attendant said a word to them, even though they had a problem themselves to serve pre departure drinks. Also don't like the seats without the route map, and no leg lifts.

Leg room at seat is terrible. I’m not a big person and I was cramped and uncomfortable. If u want to make more revenue try another way instead of making it uncomfortable to fly. Especially on a 5 hour flight
The arrival at destination was late, the transfer to bus was very uncomfortable and disorganized, the plane and the seats were very old and dirty.
Seats are horrible

Worst wheelchair assistance in Newark airport we waited a whole hour for a wheelchair for my grandma maria perez 9f and they never came had all to walk all the way from the gate to customs then to baggage claim

Aircraft interior was old, showed signs of poor maintenance and UNACCEPTABLY DIRTY . Seat pockets were torn and falling apart.  The wall of the aircraft at our seat had visible unsanitary splatter. .??  Very disgusting and made our flight uncomfortable.

I checked in at the kiosk and my boarding pass did not display TSA PRE (as I am a Global Entry member) or other details. I was dismissed by the agent. I went through security without issues and proceeded to gate to wait for boarding. Closed to one hour went by and they called me to the check in counter a few minutes before boarding. No one could tell me why. They called an employee to escort me down back to security. I keep asking what happened as they keep escorting me, my companion stayed behind worrying. They brought me to security check point to open my carry on and search me. It was very unprofessional and embarrassing. They said it was the airline that require that.  That king of random check should be done right after security not when the flight is boarding. I was very upset and embarrassed
United lost my  bag, ticket agent at flight door was rude.  I am very unhappy

One piece of luggage fell off the baggage carrier, it did not make it to the baggage claim belt, yet when we inquired as to where the luggage was it was showing scanned and on the belt. After one hour it was finally found and my expensive luggage was scratched and scrapped up. Nothing was done to compensate me for my delay and stress as I also had some high end clothing in the baggage.

There were 2 flight attendants and 1 was great and the other terrible.  There were no name badges so I can’t provide a name but the African American flight attendant’s attitude and service was not terrible!

The flight was initially delayed because the  first aid kit was not replaced after an incident happened on the plane on the previous flight. Someone should have known that that needed to be replaced before the flight was scheduled to depart, it could have been done during boarding . Also after the flight I got an email that I was charged for a meal. I had NO meal..
Pushed back from the gate "early", but just sat on tarmac for almost an hour. Not sure why we either didn't wait to push back or simply delay the flight, other than for meeting metric targets.

Continuos desgn changes to squeeze more seats into plane is terrible.... unless you are a child or very petite, minimal room and forget about even tryiong to open up a laptop unless in business class.  Realise this isnot specific to United and many airlines doing the same... it has become a very uncomfotable experience and if travelling more than 3 hours can become painful.

I had to ask for water 3 times before I finally got any.  I asked one individual attendant as to not bother multiple attendants with a simple task but about 15 minutes went by between my first request until I finally got my water.  Mistakes happen but I thought it was bizarre that water was forgotten two times in a row.  Dominick was the attendants name.  I sat in 3B or 3A in the aisle seat.

These exact same comments apply to the return trip from Dallas to Newark. I will not be filling out a second survey for that flight. I paid $19 to have WiFi for the entire trip because I had critical business to conduct while en route and I could not accomplish it due to the God awful go-go WiFi service. Toss in being cramped and uncomfortable on a tiny plane for 6 hours makes me want to fly with someone else

Service was awful. It seems like asking for service like a water or a glass a wine is an inconvenience to some of the flight attendants. From the moment I entered the plane there was no hospitality from some of the flight attendants.  Very disappointed with service.
Movie selection not that good and no options for just listening to music.

When there is a non full flight and I arrive to the airport early, why can’t I get on the earlier flight without paying $75. ?   I wanted to get to to chicago, my midpoint, to reduce risk of a missed flight but was told no once again.   Why do you have this policy?
Bad service

Your baggage policy is horrible.  I had one very small carry on (smaller than a backpack).  I intentionally do that to not check a bag and have to go through baggage claim.  Other people had larger bags + computer bags and took up all of the overhead space.  Since I was in group 4, I was required to check my bag because your company doesn't enforce your policy of having smaller bags go under peoples seats.  When I got to my seat, I realized that my bag could have fit under the seat but your personnel compelled me to check my bag, which I didn't want to do because my computer was in it and it was an inconvenience.  I work for GE and am have little choice over booking specific airlines, but based on this level of service and ridiculousness of essentially not being allowed to have ANY bag with me on board the flight (because of my group number) I would not actively choose to fly your airline for personal trips.  It was entirely disappointing and it has happened on all of the trips I have been on in the last 4 months except for the ones I was in a lower group number.  There should be NO policy where a passenger is not allowed to have a single item with them on the plane.  That is unfathomable to me.
Your seats are horrible and room for legroom horrendous
nasty old plane  ripped seats  stained carpet
Ticket agent was dismissive and rude. I was asking for help but she had no time for me. Very unprofessional
Ur notifications of flights being delayed us terrible if I didn’t live in New Jersey would not fly United and I fly at least once a month first class

I was flying first class to D.C., got to the airport early and moved to an earlier flight.  At check-in I was given a new boarding pass, again first class.  I got to the gate and was told no one had entered my change into the system.  I could get on the plane but only in economy class.  Then the flight is delayed so I got home later than my original flight. Not happy.
I am sick of being on flights that are delayed - and THEN having zero choices on food. I was at front of plane in Economy Plus - and by 3rd row back - carts are out of food. Extremely irritating.
The 1 hour delay on a 53 minute flight is frustrating.

I had a torn rotator cuff (shoulder) while I traveled & was in a lot of pain after moving luggage around. When your stewards came around with cart, I explained I was in pain & wondered if I could have a closed can of cold soda to ice my shoulder a bit & minimize discomfort. The steward literally told me I'd have to wait because there was a full plane and she had to serve the passengers first & if there were any left over then she could give me one. I asked then for a bag of ice and although she eventually brought that for me (and it helped) I just found her initial response ridiculous & dismissive. You can't spare a can of soda to ice an injury down? Maybe you need to stock more soda ....  The call button wasn't great either. I wanted some ginger ale later in the flight for nausea from the pain & it seriously took over 15 minutes. It just didn't feel like United as a whole was concerned about the passengers experience.

My luggage was damaged and now unusable. Your bc will only give me a voucher for $50 when the item I have to replace is $156. I have only had my stroller for 10 days never used it. Bought it for my trip and your crew ruined it. I'm not happy and will not be flying with you for a while.

There were 2 flight attendants on my flight the one gentleman working the back was very nice and polite. The second was extremely rude and boarding on abusive. His name was Jimmy. Economy plus was empty and he was extremely rude about myself and another woman who wanted to move and we were both willing to pay for the seats.  Second he argued with about my phone being in airplane mode, touching my phone at one point even though I told him and then showed him it was in airplane mode. I was not the only person on the plane to experience this guys attitude problem, he has no business working with the public. Finally, when we were deplaning he hid behind the curtain in the front of the plane. The other flight attendant apologized profusely but Jimmy was confrontational and is going to end up causing a physical altercation for you. He touched people and their devices when confronting them. This is unacceptable behavior.

The crew just  ignored passengers expectations of aircraft on time departure  and arrival and never bothered  addressing the passengers to keep them appraised and just ignored  us, without an apology for being late upon arrival . Pure contempt and disdain. Very rude
Food and drinks were not good enough and up-dated. Especially, black tea was worse than Dunkin' dounuts.

Cabin was not cleaned at all between flights. my seat was covered in crumbs, the window had greasy fingerprints all. over it that looked like dried baby food.  I could not use the tray at all because it was also caked with dried food.  I know the weather caused issues, but this was unacceptable.

Forced to change gates at the last minute in Chicago.  Flight delayed by 1/2 hour and then we boarded and sat at the gate for over 1/2 hour waiting on fuel...  Not impressed as I didn't get home until 10:30PM and had to work the next day.
The delay was also unfortunate.  Overall, very poor travel experience.
Boarding was delayed approx 45 minutes because 2 seats in first class were broken.  This should have been addressed during the pre flight checklist.

There was very poor communication between gate attendants and maintenance due to the technical/mechanical issue on the plane.  We went to board the plane to find out we were not able to board, and left standing on the ramp in the cold for 15 mins.  There was poor communication of UA staff.  Then once we came back out, it took the UA agents too long to inform the passengers of the issue, and had very little details on expected departure time.  All resulted in a 40 min delay.

The boarding process was a shambles.  Although the plane had been sitting at least an hour prior to boarding, a mechanical issue was not identified until boarding began, and we were left standing in the jetway with no information.  After 10 minutes came the message everyone was to deplane that had boarded.  An original 10 minute delay turned into over 30 minutes before re-boarding occurred, and departure time was 45 minutes from the original scheduled time, arrived at destination 30 minutes late.  Even though no problem on the flight on Jan 22nd, without any known issues, the boarding process took extra time with no explanation.  Seems to be getting worse on United.

No club in C terminal at Ohara? Maybe due to construction. No first class security line. Priority bags don't seem to have any priority at Norfolk airport. Not just this trip, this is always a problem at ORF. The crew, equipment, gate - all very good, no problems.

The flight departed with some delay that was manageable but then wasted 20-25 minutes after landing as there was no gate available to disembark. At 10PM in the night after a long day, this was painful to keep waiting just to disembark!
Service wasn’t that great Despite being on time for flight, I had to checkin my carryon bag

Very noisy. Unfortunately, we had many unrespectful passengers, which is nothing you can do about.  Sitting next to the toilets does not help of course, some people like to slam doors during a night flight ....

The flight crew had been held in Tokyo due to flight cancellations.   It was clear they wanted to be home versus working.   Understandable, but they rushed everyone through he service portion.   The food was extremely over-cooked, I had the tenderloin.  Worst food experience I have had on United especially considering I was in 1st class.   Disappointing..
hated how cramped the plane was, like sardines in a can.  ridiculous

I am tired of being 1K and not being upgraded.  Also, your entertainment sucks on your Airbuses and 7 jets.  Get DIRECT TV for every one of these jets.  Your movies on the WIFI are old.. Your WIFI service is slow and sucks.. You need to get your crap together.. I thought after the David Dao incident you would get your crap together.. Same old cheap United.. We need to be entertained on these flights
The security system is too complicated and the people are not well informed and they sometimes are rude /(not with me, but I saw and heard- it is an education problem)
I really dislike the new seats and how they only recline two inches.  Stupid.  If there are no screens in the seat backs - there should be some type of mount for your cell phone
Just give passengers the whole can when they request drinks. There are small can and bottle options but pouring out drinks takes time and looks bad. Drinks can spill. Stop being cheap.
The seats are uncomfortable. no neck rests. padding is very hard

UA's Baggage claim person at San Jose airport gave me one of the worst experience in my 25 years membership with UA. Please reconsider to remove "Jay R" from the assignment. He could  be racist as well.

Departure gate C86 is too congested for a 737 aircraft - not enough room in waiting area.  Arrival was running about 30 minutes early but got delayed due to ground crew not being ready to receive plane promptly upon arrival.  They should be expecting the aircraft so 150 people are not waiting on them.
SHASPE UP YOPUR FLIGHT ATTENDENTS. TERRIBLE HIDING OUT.....
I don’t like TV monitors you can’t dim or turn off. It was difficult to nap with a flashing screen in your face (once the cabin lights were dimmed). Passengers should have option to turn it off.
Flight was delayed over 60 mins with no explanation and no compensation of any sort.
The comfort and cleanses of the cabin really disappointed. My seat and table tray and floor was very dirty
The seats on these planes are very uncomfortable. I’m only six feet but the head rest tops out at the lower part of my neck. Miserable.

The drink cart nailed me in the knee.  I was totally asleep and was not capable of knowing my knee was hanging out slightly but lets be serious, I 6'4" and this is an EMB170 - the flight attendants need to be more careful, my knee is killing me.

Your attendants at the check in and at the gate were rude. Why was there no Premier or Business access to the queues at the TSA, only one economy line?  Why have you taken one of your main lounges out of service for almost a year without providing an adequate temporary replacement?  Why have you stopped providing information on the wines that you serve on-board?  I thought that you were trying to make Polaris Business something special, it is just getting worse with every flight that I take.  The main dish served all came out as mush.  The selection of movies is pathetic. I do not expect to have to bring my own entertainment with me when flying business class. I don't suppose anyone reads or pays any attention to all of this as I never get any response.
You lost my snowboard bag and cost me $500 in wasted lift tickets between both my fiancee and I.
The flight got delayed by 50 mins. and has caused all dissatisfaction
Food has become awful on this flight. The prearrival meal was total crap ...

The check in agents were extremely not customer focused.  In particular the Asian lady at the travel assistance  line blocked us from entering until she knew if we "really" needed assistance.  I'm more than qualified to make this determination of whether I need assistance of not.  Also, when we finally did get bag tags I'd never put one on myself and asked for assistance from a fat white lady and she refused, pointing to the instructions.  Not good quality service.  I likely won't fly United again.  AA is much better in this area at EWR.

The plane had lights that were not functioning so we were delayed 30 minutes the seat did not recline and there was no leg space. I'm only 5'1" and was uncomfortable I can't imagine how uncomfortable normal sized people are.  There was not enough luggage space for carry ons so I had to gate check my bag and had to stand in sub zero temps waiting for my bag plane side for 20 minutes. Not impressed.

For some reason the APP did not update the gate number. This caused confusion, we were at the wrong gate. Late for boarding. I actually slept on the flight therefore no details around food, attendant etc.
Poor beverage selection apparently due to lack of stock of menu items. Seats are terrible in terms of width and pitch and ability to recline.  I always have a better experience on AA or Delta.

I was on a list for upgrades on the flight out Nash -> Chicago, but there were few seats available, and I didn't have enough status to qualify.  However, my flight back from Chicago -> Nashville was less than 1/3 full - plenty of empty seats in 1st and Premium sections - but the gate attendant and flight attendants would not allow anyone to move up!!  I'll stick with Delta next time.
There was no space left for cabin baggage. That's extremely bad. Also, space below the front seat (aisle) was not good enough to store cabin baggage.
Even sitting in first class, the seat was not comfortable and was very worn out.  The hour delay due to mechanical issues leading to a plane swap didn't help.

I carried my luggage so had to leave my roll-on with the crew. Instead of picking it up by the airplane, it went with the regular luggage, which took a LONG time. Worse than in L.A. Need better crew -- and we were delayed getting to the gate, though there were no other planes arriving.Terrible crew

Flight attendants seemed annoyed and agitated. The flight was full of religious Jews with huge families needing a lot of assistance. I am not & simply asked if a second pillow. I had pulled a muscle in my back weighing my suitcase for the flight. I brought my own water bottle but empty asked if could fill when drink cart went around. I was told only could be given a small cup. I get dehydrated on long flights easily. I was in the window seat 💺 with two sleeping gentlemen. I was extremely thirsty with dry mouth. I ended up with a headache. I was disappointed as didn’t seem much to ask for.
The security personnel was very agressive at the gate. Made it unnecessarily difficult to board. Horrible stressful experience.

Since we were flying with an infant , we were entitled to an additional carry-on suitcase. However, there was one flight attendant ,I don't know his name but it was a tall Hebrew speaking guy with an earring , that refused to allow us to take the additional carry-on on board claiming that the flight was oversold. When I got on the plane I saw a few empty seats and there was plenty  of additional overhead luggage space.  As a result of having to shift around our items from the carry on that we had to check in into the other carry-ons , we ended up leaving two pieces of luggage behind at the airport and they are now sitting in the lost and found in Tel Aviv. we still don't have a way of getting them to us! Very very very frustrating !
I awoke three hours before landing. I was skipped over for breakfast and not even asked if I wanted a cup of coffee. Very poor experience.
The food was horrible.  That is my one complaint about the flight.  No taste, smelled horrible, and just was not very appetizing.

I want a refund for my loss of income and the terrible experience at 5the airport  since the flight was cancelled and rescheduled for the next day. I remained at the airport all night and was given a sheet to request a $150.00 cash gift card since I did not get overnight lodging Serial number is 04988 on the certificate. I lost $300 in income because of the delay, Plus my amtrak ticket. I expect this to be acted on asap.

The service from one flight attendant Eana, extremely bad attitude ,rude and condescending responses to requests for routine services, this rude behavior continued until we couldn’t take it anymore,reported to the senior attendant Maria who replaced Eana with very delightful attendants who were extremely pleasant and helpful.  Along with the rude flight attendant Eana, there was a crying and knicking baby in seats behind us, the mother allowed the baby boy to act out for the entire 15hr flight, I and other were unable to rest, watch movies or sleep because of the Constance disruptions knicking and crying.  My entire flight was very restless, I developed a headache and became extremely tired.  Good part the flight the plane ride was smooth and the pilot kept us informed.

When I got to the gate, I discovered that my flight was delayed. On the United App, which I kept regularly checking on my phone, it kept stating that the flight was delayed by at least 40 minutes due the aircraft not having landed yet. I came up to the attendant at the gate and they didn't seem to know anything. I went to a cafe around the corner to get some food and wait. I came back 20 minutes later to check and spoke with the gate attendant again. She indignantly waved me off and said that she still didn't have a plane and that boarding couldn't possibly begin until 9:15pm at the very earliest. I went back to the cafe to eat and do some work. I came back at 9:17, knowing that since I was in the last boarding group, there was no way I could have boarded any sooner. I came up to the gate attendant and she told me that the flight was gone. Gone?! I asked. But you said boarding would not begin before 9:15 at the earliest! She shook her head and said it simply happened earlier and now the flight was gone. With the way she had dismissed me earlier, I was positive that there was lots of time to kill. I was very distraught. This was the last flight that was available to Des Moines that night, and now, even though I was at the gate early I had somehow missed it! I had to make it to my grandmother's funeral the next morning and I was ready to do anything to get there in time. I told the gate attendant this and she once more shook her head, she seemed to make a half-effort to look things up but it was clear she wasn't really going to help me. I called customer service and found a flight to American Airlines (through Boston, I had to drive 3.5 hours to Boston Logan Airport first) to take a flight out at 5am, to Chicago, then to Des Moines. It got me there just 40 minutes before the funeral on Wednesday morning, Jan. 24, 2018. (This was the only possible option, there are not many flights to Des Moines, Iowa.) I was exhausted and just barely was able to see my family at this most difficult time. The communication with that unhelpful, dismissive gate agent, almost completely ruined my chances of being able to be with my family at this critical time. Even though I have been a Mileage Plus Member for a long time (HCF95825) this horrible experience and my entire experience with United Airlines this week is making me consider permanently withdrawing my business from United Airlines. Additionally to this, in the past week, I took 3 other flights with United in order to visit my grandmother on her deathbed. Every single flight was severely delayed, one was so delayed that I had to stay overnight in Chicago. This has caused physical and emotional exhaustion and undue stress during a time that was already filled with great suffering for myself and my family.
The boarding process is horrible plus the amount of  over sized/ more than allowed carry ons is out of control.
The two-hour delay was unfortunate.

I expect full compensation, and apology, and some insight was to why I was profiled/humiliated on a flight, forced to move seats, for no reason.  This kind of racial, gender bias is never tolerated, yet at United it seems to be the common theme in your business model - 4 men were segregated, forced to the 'back of the plane', not compensated, apologized to or offered some reasoning....this is unacceptable.
Tuscany eggs were disgusting and probably severally unhealthy.

I paid extra money while buying the tickets so I won’t pay more for luggage at the airport, but I still had to pay 25 usd and I still don’t understand why! I was mad but I needed to take the flight and I didn’t had the time for arguing. But I would like to know why did it happened!!!!

Perhaps the coordination efforts would be too monumental,  but OFTEN when I take a regional aircraft into ORD we end up in in Terminal 2  at the E gates and our baggage claim is around carousel 14!  Is there no way for carousel assignment to be more aligned with arriving gate assignments?  We are in Chicago Illinois afterall.  A little properly placed bribe money might get ground operations to assist in this endeavor!
For spending money on 2 business class seats I was very disappointed that there was no television’s for anyone in first class. It was a 4 hour flight!!!!
Paying for bags is just WRONG!!!
Stop with the 1-2 lane and the 3-5 lane.  Have one for each.  Its too confusing and people cut too much with the shorter method.
The food was terrible. Serving a calzone in a flight to Hawaii!! Nothing healthy. Would a salad option be so difficult? And this was business class. A disgrace.

At least the wifi worked on this leg vs heading out to LA. You're the worst airline when it comes to wireless. You say you're fixing it but you lie. You also said the united club would be done in O'Hare by the end of 2017. How can you run out of breakfast food by the 13th row?  Your company must hate revenue.

The flight attendant (working the front of the plane- blonde woman) could not have been ruder or more combative.  The plane was more than 75% empty with almost all of economy plus open.  I asked the gate representative as she scanned my boarding pass if I could possibly move into an economy plus seat.  She was gracious and polite, explaining that she would love to have helped me, as she was the only person scanning passes, she needed to keep the boarding process moving and then suggested "speak to the attendant once you board and maybe they can help you".  When I did asked the attendant, her response was "The gate attendant didn't tell you that.  I know she didn't say that to you".  I tried explaining the situation again, and her response escalated, again calling me a liar.  At this point, I didn't feel it was really worth dealing with this person.  A simply and polite answer along the lines of "Oh, I am sorry she said that to you, I can't move your seat because of (and then explain the policy, etc).  Instead, this person chose to accuse me of lying.  And it was not just being accused of lying, but her dismissive and aggressive tone that shocked me.   When told this story to my coworker that was also on the plane, she instantly said she saw this flight attendant aggressively dismiss requests from other guest as well.  This small interaction was enough to leave a very sour taste in my mouth and question why would I want to ever deal with this lack of basic manners, politeness and customer service again.  I am able to hear that moving seats isn't possible for a variety of reasons.  But being called a liar is not acceptable.  I travel for business often and I have a choice in who I book my travel with.  I generally book United as my preferred airline, often paying a higher fair than your competitors.  But with an experience like this, I'll be more open to booking on other airlines.  I look forward to hearing how you would like to remedy this situation.
Leg room was lacking. Seats were very uncomfortable. Water or other liquid in a pool by toilet in one of the lavatories. Flight attendant extremely concerned about finding his lost cellphone.

One of the flight attendants lost his cell phone on our flight.  He shouldn't have had it out as he was on duty.  There were constant announcements being made for customers to check the floor by their seats to help find the attendants cell phone.  When no one claimed to find it, the announcements then became somewhat harrassing as the announced that security would be boarding the plane upon landing as a result of the missing phone.  It got really annoying.  The attendant should not have had his cell phone out while on duty!
No food on board including in Business Class. Only a 2 hour flight but could of had something beyond packaged Cookies in Business Class.  Not classy
We were delayed for 45 minutes and the resolution was duct tape.  I sat in 7B and it was a problem as everyone who passed me bumped into my legs.
With nearly 2m UA miles, this was one of the most disorganized and detached cabin crews I‘ve ever encountered.
changed my flight seat with customer service. They sent receipt for only one, because they could not changed the second though failed to tell me. Bad knee window seat did not work for me.

Change how you service your passengers going to that sector - South Asia and other countries. It seems United does not care about that sector. Horrible service in Economy class. The staff does not smile, probably do not want to be on that flight, no hello, nothing. They serve food and done with it. No other communication.

considering this was Mumbai to Newark flight, thought vegetarian food could be a bit better... but guess bad expectation... your staff could also smile a bit more... why the resigned look on faces... makes customers not so welcome..

First class food was awful.  The plane only stocked one meal because of a mistake at the airport so the menu wasn’t available.  Also food was really bad for first class.  For $10,000 ticket I would expect an edible meal service.

When flying a red eye flight, there is NO reason the flight attendants should turn all of the lights in the cabin completely on at 3 in the morning, and shake every passenger up asking if we’d like water. If I am a sleeping adult on an aircraft I only expect to be shaken awake by a flight attendant in case of emergency. There was also no comfortable way to sleep. The neck pieces are simply too high and push everyone’s heads down into their chests, creating massive strain. Either make these adjustable or leave us be with our own pillows. The blue lights were left on for the duration of the flight which was also awful. Every passenger was trying to sleep, and the people I sat next to lamented to me about their inability to sleep due to the extreme discomfort on the aircraft. I had to drive 8 hours after flying, and am very lucky I didn’t crash, considering the night of sleep I couldn’t possibly have gotten, even though I’d taken a melatonin. I’m very disappointed.
Seats were very uncomfortable.  No legroom and I am not tall.

I was told by one of your travel agents that my seat reclined to almost a lay flat bed! The only reason I booked my flight on the red eye. I didn’t get any sleep and my back was in pain when I got there. It was a horrible flight
There was an unexpected 'drop' turbulence when we were nearing Chicago that was really terrifying. Never received an explanation from the pilots...
Baggage area had no carousel monitors and the area overall seems to have been forgotten it looks dingy dirty and just unpleasant.
Too expensive need more often fights between dca and red and lower cost. Amtrak takes all your business

The lady that was checking my military ID was very rude that was the only negative thing I had I am an officer of the law and I do not handle for my badge to anyone she saw my ID she sought was official but she wanted to touch him I did not want her to have a my ID there was no reason too
Leg room in economy is non-existent. Until that changes, I will not fly United personally. My business uses United sometimes.

absolutely hate the direction United is going.  united club is smaller (perhaps under construction), booking travel under your uber economy ticket, without a seat assignment is horrible.  your  website for booking is terrible.  I fly jetblue every chance I can.  I fly probably 20 round trips from NJ to florida a year.  not at all happy with the direction united is going.

This is not the first time this has happened, but I paid for internet service and it didn't work. Probably the second time in the last month that it hasn't worked. It's pretty frustrating on a flight that long, but I'm not sure whether to blame UA at this point. So...that's about it. Also, will there ever be high speed internet on UAL flights?

Seat too small, absolutely no knee space (I am only 5-8, 160 lbs). Couldn't even reach my briefcase under my seat because there was not enough space to reach down.  The idea of having seats like these on a 5-6 hour flight is ludicrous particularly having spent over $500 for the flight.  In no way should a customer have to upgrade at a price to get a more comfortable seat.  It did not help that I was sitting in a middle seat with a 300 lb women sitting to the right of me with her shoulder and ass encroaching on my space.
Gate associate was rude and unhelpful. I made her aware of my disatisfaction. Which i regret. I feel as though she may have tried to retaliate against me. I feared for my safety
Fly the appropriate aircraft for a flight that is cross country not a aircardt that is antiquated passengers in 1 st said  next flight book economy plus no difference  That is not a good sign
The flight was smooth no problems there just wish there was more leg room as I am y’all and found the space to be uncomfortable with my knees touching the back of the seat
The flight was full and I can't tell if the flight attendants intentionally ignored my pained expressions the while flight or truly ignorant to my problem.
Flight attendant was distracted with her phone......and not very pleasant

My flight to Chicago I was delayed because of a problem with the aircraft at the gate, I had meetings to be to and missed them due to being put on a later flight because my aircraft was not going to get repaired for several hours. Then coming back to Bentonville that aircraft had a problem and that caused a delay and everyone moving to another aircraft that happened to work and had no issues. That was also late to depart.
When are you going to upgrade the planes flying to Cancun?  The entertainment is poor, the food is awful and this time the flight attendants were not helpful, except for the young man on the dlight
The plane was very old and not very clean,food was gross
it appears that seats on the plane were smaller and i was very cramped and uncomfortable because of limited legroom/armroom.

I was flying first class.   The flight attendants were on their phones and ignoring the customers trying to fit their bags into the old small overhead bins.   The plane was very old so space was very tight.  No offer to help first class customers.  The breakfast was a terrible cold plate of processed turkey and cheese.   After the terrible breakfast, the flight attendants disappeared and never offered anything else.   This was the WORST FIRST CLASS experience I have ever had.   I finally had to get up to get someone's attention to get a cup of water.   The two attendants on duty on my flight should be fired.    I get better service on Lufthansa flying coach.   This was deplorable.   To identify the individuals, this was flight 1075 on Thursday, Jan 25 - LAS to EWR.
Food had gotten worse, cabin is dirty and run down and flight attendants have an attitude.

Airline attendants did their job but did not smile. They were very unpersonal as if they hated their job or hated each other.  We couldn't figure out what their problem was and they definitely showed that there was a problem.  I'm not looking to have a full blown conversation but at least a smile or a you're welcome when I say thank you to them. I don't want to be on a plane with a robot.
Do not like the fact that some of the newer planes have no TV

Flight was filthy - there was even a flight attendant who apparently found a pair of underwear in the craft holding them out and complaining very loudly about it. Flight attendants were rude , there was an elderly woman who wanted to use the bathroom and simply needed help getting up from her seat, not using the bathroom, and the flight attendant told her "NO YOU ARE TOO HEAVY ! " I was in shock - I helped the woman get up from her seat and then she made her way to the bathroom. This same flight attendant stepped on my feet and did not even apologize just looked at me and said "KEEP YOU FEET OUT OF THE AISLE" This United flight was a true disappointment and felt very amateur . I am also a member of the United Credit Card and was never told I was eligible for a free checked back ! Overall horrible experience, not flying united again and cancelling my card ASAP.

The flight attendant was extremely rude and not very friendly. She did not show any respect or courtesy to the passengers getting on the flight and at one point yelled at passengers. This is now how one should behave. At the time of deplaning a flight attendant started arguing with a cleaning crew member in front of the passenger. This showed the complete lack of professionalism by the staff.
The product united offers is insulting to consumers. I travel internationally often, and by far the product you provid is by far the worst.
No communication as we sat in bus on tarmac until we got back to terminal then spotty . Two hour flight delay

My confirmed seat was 9D.  A passenger confirmed seat in 8C was not allow to seat there due to some dimension issue.  The gate agent asked passenger on 8 D but he rejected.  Then gate agent offered $150 if anyone give up the seat which passenger can get at SFO.  No one around willing to switch their seats.  Then he approached me.  I saw the whole incident.  I felt no problem to switch the seat with her.  Howver, I feel the gate agent credibility not correct.  I arrived at SFO and no one offer me the certificate.  Honestly, I don’t need the certificate.  I also feel the flight attendants didn’t work with gate agent to solve the problem.

Please get rid of the in-seat screens! They are extremely annoying.  At least make it easier for passengers to turn them off.  Also, in the window seat, the controls are in the armrest next to the middle seat, so all the passenger in the middle seat has to do is bump or touch those controls for my screen and it turns back on again.  Very annoying and distracting.
Once again your staff prior to boarding and while on the flight are unpleasant and rude people.

I had two checked bags and my ski bag did not appear when I got to Denver- asked and asked the baggage lady finally she looked it up I was 2minutes to get on my shuttle and she said it didn’t make the plane, would be in at 2. My shuttle was 12;30.she said she would send bag to place I was staying. Had to go so was a nervous wreck til the bag was finally delivered at 9 pm.  Went on where’s my suitcase to try to trace and it was very vague.

You need to fix the issue with baggage at Newark. It should not take 50 minutes to claim a bag. This is not the first time this is an issue.  As a frequent business traveler it is frustrating when priority bags come out last, there is an issue with the carousel and the mechanic is too busy talking and flirting. I was just on a 5 hour flight. I want to get home and spend time with my family. United needs to fix the problem in Newark ONCE AND FOR ALL.  It gets worse every time I need to claim baggage. What is the point of putting a priority sticker on a bag if it is going to be the last to come out.  Listen to your frequent flyers.
Wifi provided by GoGo is ridiculously expensive and was ineffective!! Again! Very disappointing.

I think you should serve the custom food fresh. I had ordered Asian Vegetarian Meal, for the flight on 25th, I saw the package saying the date of January 23rd (almost 2 days old) and the food was not so great with all the dishes mixed up and looked very messy.
The flight was routine; no problems.
Food was terrible.  The worst that I have had in three years +/-. Unfortunate, because I am generally delighted with United food.

Es increible que en el check in tenga un costo el documentar y en gate te documenten sin costo, esto derivado de un mal control con las maletas. Cuando subi al avion ya no hubo espacio con mi maleta por lo que la tuvieron que documentar y a ese momento entonces is ofrecen la opcion de sin costo. No hubo control en el numero de maletas que pasaba cada usuario y a medio abordaje ya no habia espacios en el carry on. todos los que estabamos en zona 4, nos estaban solicitando documentar, sin opción a decidir si quieres o no.

The seat design is uncomfortable (the curve in the back of the seat). We didn't like not having screens to watch movies like you used to have. Relatives who flew to Hawaii on American we're given meals on their flight at no extra cost. 8 wish we were given a meal at the price we paid for the flight and the fact that it was a 9.5 hour flight.
The seats and leg room were really, really tight. Other people around me were also commenting. Not comfortable. We joked that a few extra rows must have been installed.

I fly a lot for work and my experiences with United are really stacking up to where I cannot trust United reliably. I missed afternoon meetings due to this flight. The delay we were told was due to a latch being broken on a cockpit door. The desk agent updated us regularly, but it was always "20-30 more minutes" each time. Which in the end totaled a 3 hour delay. Very frustrating. I could have moved meetings/calls up and had them while waiting for the repair to be made. But every time we got an update, I was under the assumption we were about to starting boarding in 15-20 minutes.

I was shocked at the seats...i had upgraded to get more spacious seating and there was no legroom and the aisles were more narrow..totally could not squeeze thru with another person in aisle...southwest has wider aisles and better legroom on their bad I flights..real disappointed
Forced to use auto check in. Charges $25 extra to check a small carry on roller bag.

On my flight the stewardess working in business class by the name of Joan was quite rude. My child needed to use the restroom he’s 3 1/2 years old and the service car was blocking the area. I asked if I could use the restroom for him in business and she was quite annoyed. She said please don’t do it again

I was disappointed that the issue with the plane was not noticed until we had all boarded. My flight was delayed by almost an hour and I nearly had to spend another 8 at the airport in Chicago had I not ran to make my connecting flight. The same thing happened when I was leaving Salt Lake City on Monday January 22nd, my flight was delayed due to maintenance and again my connection was close.  While I understand and appreciate safety is a concern these items should be addressed while before passengers are on a plane . In the future I will not make connecting flights with less then a 3-layer hour layover. But I do feel if United is going to offer these connecting flights they should be able to meet them without delay. This caused undo stress on top of an already stressful situation. And have it happen twice in one week is quite ridiculous.

The seats were very small and uncomfortable - very old. The lounge area to board was way too small for the number of people on the flight, so everyone gets all anxious and stands and crowds the gate, which makes people more anxious, etc.
The cabin was freezing cold the entire flight despite being dressed for winter. It made it A miserable experience.
Your customer service is horrible!! And i will be reporting it!!!!

The gate agents didn't pass out the gate check tags so when people got to the boarding door there was chaos with what wouldn't fit and having to go back up the jet way to get the tickets it was not handled well
Pretzels not the best- maybe change up your snack
The aircraft is so cold and bathroom is so dirty and bad odor can even be smell outside the bathroom.

There were few major issues I experienced on Flight 3808 from ORD to CMH on 1/25/18.  I checked 2 bags - 1 bag was not delivered to CMH on the flight and left behind in ORD.  The other bag was delivered but was badly damaged upon arrival.  In addition, the flight attendant on that flight purposefully did not give out snacks to me even though I made eye contact with him and was not sleeping and he gave the surrounding passengers snacks which left me in shock.  I have never experience having 1/2 checked bags not making it with me, having one bag damaged, and then being treated rudely by the flight attendant - I have been flying United since the early 90's and can't recall having experienced this ever.  so disappointed!

there is too much carried on luggage (i assume because of fees) and it causes tension among passengers jostling for space for their items.  also causes passengers to be more cramped because they are forced to put bags at their feet when overhead space runs out.
Tampa baggage claim was delayed which was inconvenient

Upon arriving at Newark there were long lines at all the rest rooms in Terminal C. The rest rooms are dirty and overused.  You need to add more restroom facilities at Terminal C as soon as possible.   It is so bad that I tend to fly more out of Philadelphia on American.
Yes.Unfortunately I could not use my United Chase card because it had to be cancelled and reissued due to an unauthorized purchase.I had to pay for my checked bag .

I can not believe United management has any idea how poorly Newark baggage handeling is.  I took pictures is several people sitting behind desk on their cell planes while passengers struggled to get their bags from a flight that was more than 2 hours late already
Have never had this unpleasant a checkin experience
positive overall.  President's Club was packed and the check-in took too long due to computer problems, but the flight itself, no problems.

This could have been handled very simply: supervisor shows up, says they're very sorry, they'll talk to the ground crew and remind them to be careful, and then offer to cover the costs of anything they broke.  Instead, you decided to waste my time and treat me as unimportant.  You want my input as a survey?  I have NO faith that you'll do anything other than delete this and move on.  However you can bet I'm going to tell this story to everyone I can, including my boss, so I'll be giving feedback ABOUT YOU to anyone who will listen.

My only disappointment was finding out I was not eligible for upgrades for flights between EWR and LAX and SFO. These are flights I take frequently and I'll run out of the upgrades I get for being 1k soon.
WiFi service was horrible and unreliable. After purchasing, the service dropped and would not recognize my purchase. Wasted money on your WiFi service.
Bad signage at MIA security checkpoints for fast lane. Was very unclear to us how to proceed.

I had issues checking a bag at Disney. I wanted to use their service, but it said I had ticketing issues. I had to go to airport and on the kiosk , at first, it said I had no tickets. I had to reenter a couple times to get it to say I had tickets. It was very inconvenient and nerve racking.
The seats were new but we're not comfortable
Equipment.    older 737 for 4 plus hours in first class is an awful experience.   Old seats, poor comfort.
Very rude & unprofessional staff at check in counter.
flight attendants not friendly at all..not professional.. rude behavior

Very poor Flight Attendance that were our flight.  A young female dropped a plastic bottle on my wife's head and laughed about.  This young flight attendant was very disrespectful and rude.  I mentioned to her this was not funny - she shrewd her shoulders and turned away and was very nasty never asked if my wife was ok.

II was most dismayed that my checked bag did not make it on my flight to Chicago from Dulles, in spite of the fact that it was checked in early enough for the flight.  Apart from that, the flight was good.
When booking the flight from Buffalo to Newark the web site said there was no fee for the first checked luggage.  I printed that out.  That was not honored at check in

It is crazy to me how bad the flight attendants are. We always fly economy plus and they stink. We had a family in front of us who took up all 7 seats mind you they only purchased 3. When my husband asked for a second glass of wine the bitchy flight attendant said the service is over. Give me a break. My last flight with United I asked for 2 glasses of wine/ mind you they are Dixie cup size/ the flight attendant said she can’t do that. But then she did and said she would be watching me. Such an insult. I hate your airlines. The only reason I fly is because we are frequent flyers. Your food is the worst/ talk about salt trying to disguise bad food. And the flight attendants are older than my mother. They should retire and give the younger generation a chanxe

Your computer system is messed up big time.  When I made my reservation, I indicated I wanted an Economy Plus seat.  I received a receipt from United indicating that I paid for that and with an assigned seat in Economy Plus.   When I went to check in, my name was messed up, so I had to call to get that fixed.  Then my assigned seat disappeared and I was told I did not have Economy Plus! Very messed up

I’ve CC’d my response to  1Kvoice@united.com (Case ID number 17358293) and to Mr. Johnson. I am still awaiting their response. As you can see from the history of my messages, there has been no acknowledgement to my comments re: dealing with booking on United’s website. Furthermore, my praises were only for Patrick, not to his supervisor nor senior management. If I had received consistent and sufficient satisfactory service from your representatives during my current patronage with United, then I’d have complimented them as well. Not responding in a timely manner (or at all) to my disappointment from both 1K voice and Customer Care (Mr. Johnson) supports my opinion on how this behavior exhibits the lack of respect you have for both your customers and yourselves. What  is the point of having 1K status? I would really appreciate an answer or should I not bother to expect United to accept responsibility.   My recent flight from TAO to YUL (I48EEJ) via ORD and BOS was a disaster. At check-in, my reservation on the connecting flight to ORD/BOS/YUL was CANCELLED and even though I was on-time for boarding at check-in at PEK, I was informed of the cancellation, and then subsequently waited at the gate for 15 minutes as the agents tried to sort it out while passengers boarded. Needless to say, I lost the original confirmed seat and was now seated at the bulkhead. Because of physical discomfort from prolonged watching the IFE screen at a downward angle (limited mobility in my neck), I had no video entertainment for the next 12+ hours. Furthermore, the washrooms were significantly further because I had lost my originally booked seat which created more discomfort since I have stiffness in my hip joints (another reason for booking aisle seating). Then, on the ORD-BOS leg, I was again assigned a further seat and not an aisle but the dreaded window seat, an additional “pain” to struggle to the restroom. So I definitely did not enjoy my flights. Update: As I am writing this feedback, it had dawned on me that maybe the return leg of my trip was cancelled as well. A quick check on my United account confirmed that and now I am on the phone to the 1K desk with Annabel to correct this. Not looking good, United!!!! Well, Annabel has come through and re-booked me, kudos to her! But this shouldn’t have happened in the first place. Why didn’t the Beijing gate agents who told me that my flight was cancelled take the steps then to recover the complete reservation and avoid my referring to this current episode? One step forward, but two steps back. I really don’t need any added stress to my life.    Dear Mr. Johnson (or whoever is actually reading this),    I can only imagine how swamped you are in replying to United Pax since you've failed to acknowledge my frustrations in trying to book a flight on United's website. I also noticed that re: Patrick, you referred to "their" supervisor  .... " .... 'they' can be recognized ... ", so I can only imagine you are using form letters and "filling in the appropriate blanks." Your response is embarassingly unprofessional and insincere. Are you really a Team leader? United's  voice mail frequently informs callers that our calls can be recorded for "quality assurances ;" is there anyone monitoring Customer Care responses???  United failed to catch your inept response. So far United Customer Care appears to not really care. The

I was traveling with my 3 year old, my wife and my mother in law, we were separated in different seats which made our fly very unpleasant. My daughter wanted to stay with us together at all times, that caused walking on the plane almost the entire trip. Passengers next to us were not happy at all. The worst part was seats that were available in the same row.
I’ve said it all. Very disappointed
Delay. Getting on our original flight to DC and onto Greenville because of YOUR crew problems. Missed event that was purpose of trip

Sorry, this was a great flight.  I didn't have a good experience on the return flight and that is the one I had a problem with one of your flight attendants' customer service.  Please disregard my earlier negative review about the flight attendant service for this flight.
I was forced to check my bag and after the trip my luggage was broken.
The baggage handling at Newark was very poor; it took over an hour for items to get from the plane to the carousel due to a jam, and oversize luggage took even longer.
Disappointed with the 737-other airlines that use this same aircraft are roomier than United.  We were VERY uncomfortable on this ride.
Seating configuration is miserable.   Could not straighten my legs underneath the seat in front of me and my knees were pressure touching the seat in front of me.
The flight was so crammed, it was just ridiculous. It's no wonder folks are getting so agitated on flights. A very uncomfortable flight.

The reason I am dissatisfied is that the flight was very full, and after we were to have taken off the gate agent walked a family of five on board, scattered them in seats where ever they could, including remaining MP seats that I have to pay for, and as a result we took off 14 minutes late and were late to our destination.  This resulted in quite a bit of stress as I had to rush to make my connection.
time is everything in business.  you failed
Price was higher then some other airlines, there was the delay due to not having pilot and staff, no recognition or discounts for seniors or bereavement

The leg room is atrocious, I'm a 5'10" female and my knees were hitting the front seat. It was so uncomfortable and felt like a packed sardine or cattle in a pen. You should be embarrassed with your greediness for monetary gain by completely disregarding the quality of customer experience.
Had some trouble with stuttering of the in-flight entertainment for iPad, which made watching movies difficult
The leg room was so cramped it was uncomfortable. The tv monitor was so close that it was uncomfortable and it couldn’t be turned off if you didn’t want to watch it.

It was fine.  Check in person was dumb. Flight from Newark to phi was bad because they checked our carry on at gate which was not necessary and my husbands new shirts and dog bowls were stolen when we arrived in Florida. We will never part with carry one again at gate.once on board we found room overheads.
My new luggage that I bought in December was damaged. It is very dirty and look like I've had it for years. The luggage was bought less than a month ago.
4 hour delay due to a missing flight attendant is unacceptable. Next time maybe I should fly Delta

Even though it was a newer interior it looked beat up and old. Lack of TV's also frustrating when the flight down we had TV's and everything worked as expected. I'd rather have TV's at each seat and need to pay for it, rather then have the ability to use my personal device at no cost only to find out my device isn't compatible.

When I checked in, the flight showed still leaving on time. To me, it is very poor management if a sick flight attendant causes 4 hours delay. Don't you a backup plan for these things, that are regularyly happening ?

The TSA experience was awful.  One of them told me to; "Have a good day and go fuck yourself!"  This occurred after I complained to a TSA supervisor about how rude her co-worker was...and it was the supervisor that told me to go fuck myself.  This was the supervisor that was on duty at 4pm of Friday the 26th.  An African American woman that also told me to take a walk and addressed me as "Bobby Brown."
The worst seats ever with no ability to choose online even though I have status. Very poor onboard entertainment options compared to American Airlines
Sitting in aisle next to bathrooms, because it is flu season it freaked me ot

With this being a major route between two business hubs and a long flight I found it annoying that the flight did not have Wi-Fi to allow me to work during my flight. I was also perplexed that the flight attendant collected the suit jackets of the men around me to hang but disregarded me, when I had specifically asked about having my suit jacket hung up, until I tapped her on the arm
baggage claim is extremely frustrating that all signs tell you that they should be on carousel 1 nothing shows up then I turn around and see my bags on carousel 2. communication there stinks!
unfortunately, I got food poisoned from the coffee served on the flight. I believe it was not fresh.

column26: INFLT - CALL TO TECH OPS/NO MX ACTION REQUIRED
column79: One of our gate checked bags was opened but never properly closed by the staff before taking off. Though some fallen-off items were sent to us by the flight attendants, we were worried about losing other things from the bag for the whole flight and no body was willing to help.
I was sick and was in desperate need of a beverage. We were only offered a half cup of water. I had my medicine pills stuck in my throat until we reached Newark.

I paid for an upgraded aisle seat so I had room to work, unfortunately the person in the middle seat was so large I could not effectively work.  This is not the fault of the airline...just frustrating!

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: Flight left late, I could have still made my connection, but the gate checked baggage was very very slow to unload, pilot tried to intervene but checked baggage was unloaded first anyway.  It took more than 20 minutes to get bag back so that I could try to run to another terminal for my next flight.  Ugh.  worse than Greyhound.
The sound system on the flight back from Ft Lauderdale was not working well.   At least the one on my seat. so it was useless to buy any movies etc as they could not be heard well.

While the flight was fine the experience at Orlando airport was absolutely awful.  I waited on the priority line for TSA for over 40 minutes.   There is no priority preference at this airport was absolute mayhem.
Economy seats very uncomfortable. No room to move.
The boarding was disorganized at best.  The bus driver had no idea what was going on.  She literally drive in circles.  It was so bad that the pilot apologized for the confusion.

The flight attendants need to pay attention as passengers board that they don't continue to allow the inconsiderate people sitting in the back of the plane to put there bags in the storage bins at the front middle portion of the plane so that there is no room for those persons bags when they board.  Either you end up checking them or persons sitting in the middle have to put their bags in all the empty bins at the back of the plan which then delays deplaning.  Make the flight attendants do their job..
TSA personnel issue... Most, very professional. A couple were distinctly not. Easy to see how things could be missed.

Very unhappy with carry-on luggage procedures. First, planes should be designed with space for all carry-ons. The expectation is that you will have your luggage with you at all times, and decision like packing essentials such as medication are made based on that. Better enforcement or more stringent rules are needed about carry-on vs personal items.  Too many selfish people put their personal items above instead of under the seat. Finally, on this particular flight, gate agent made the decision to have all people boarding in group 3 and later check luggage. However, there was still plenty of overhead space on the plane. Two weeks ago, our carry-on luggage had to get checked, and then got lost. So tired of getting less and less and less from the airlines

I had an empty seat beside me, which makes all the difference. If another person was beside me, I would have probably been uncomfortable. I was grateful to be able to change to an earlier flight. I hate the "dungeon" gates we departed from - no natural light, no place to sit.

Bag check personnel at ORD are amazingingly rude, disconnected and unhelpful, terminal 1 young man sitting in a chair rudely indicated “ do you see any agents here, go to terminal 2”, terminal 2 used kiosk received a message that it was too late to check luggage went to agent station and was informed “ not my problem , see woman over there ( pointed) and went back to his cell phone. Horrible experience

I was not happy with the agent at the counter letting us on the plane. She was unprofessional, loud and rude. Based on my observation, 60% of the flight was in boarding group 2, which means there was no where to put my carry on bag and the wait was extremely long to get on the plane. I heard several times that you are not supposed to put jackets and other smaller bags in the overhead compartments, but there is no one enforcing that rule which lead to everyone in groups 3-5 checking their bags at the gate. Then when we landed, everyone in the front of their plane was trying to obtain their bags from the back of the plane. It was a very frustrating experience.  I am not sure United will be getting my business going forward.
Sorry the plane was broken n
