Airplane was filthy inside. Carpet was dirty, not even vacuumed. Seat pouch was full of garbage. This aircraft didn’t even seem to have been cleaned for this flight, absolutely disgusting.
it was quick and smooth. No complaints, slept right through.

We slammed down  (not an exaggeration!!) on Boston tarmac and immediately went back up, circle the airport and landed again.  There was NO announcement from pilots as to why! It was very scary and I am not a fearful flier.  Thi s was absolutely unacceptable! Why would they not make any announcement? Ridiculous and unacceptable!
Disappointed with the way upgrade was handled.  Tried to cancel at airport and was told by gate agent that she couldn't accommodate.
The seats on these planes are very uncomfortable. I’m only six feet but the head rest tops out at the lower part of my neck. Miserable.

The seating area at the gate of IAH is oddly designed. There are not many seats, and the way it is setup for the boarding line causes all of the people to wind into the main walkway blocking traffic. Sections 3, 4, and 5 were also in the same line which makes those designations useless; I was in group 3 but since we were all together by the time I got to the gate I was forced to check my carry-on bag which delayed my return home.

Yes, I was very disappointed in the check-in service attendant.   I checked in via my computer/mobile device the night before and upgraded by service to Premier and did not receive the Premier service.   When I checked in I had no seat assignment and was instructed to obtain one from the Gate Attendant.   When I arrived, he stated that he had no seats available at this time even though I procured by ticket several months in advance.   I even informed him that I upgraded to Premier Service and he stated that was tough because he would not be able to board me until the very end only if there was a seat available, if not then I would be bumped to the later flight arriving at nearly 12 midnight.   If there were no seats available, why was the option of upgrading to the Premier Service offered?   I literally had to wait until everyone was boarded before I received a seat.   There were three others in the same situation and he literally boarded them before me even though I was the first to come to the desk.   I was very disappointed in the service because in the past I had always had such a wonderful experience with United.
Horrible horrible pilots before landing they were turning the airplane very badly the passengers were like Terrified what’s going on
We had an hour delay sitting on tarmac with no announcement from crew as to the reason.
seats are painfully crowded.

No updates were available for flight 4846 at 3:45pm - website still says "taxiing to runway" 45 minutes after departure from Newark.  I called to ask for updates and still could not get an update - with only 55 minutes to connect in Newark this is unacceptable.  The plane to bus to terminal is ridiculous and ground agents are obnoxious telling us we have to form a line to pick up our plane side checked bags.  This process takes way too long and you do not allow us any time to get to our connecting flight.  I do appreciate that your automated system already had me protected on the later flight to Tampa on 1/25/18 as it was likely I would not make the plane.

Gate attendant made me size my luggage and refused to allow my carry on, after she allowed several people before and after me to proceed with their carry on that was in many cases larger than my own. I had to check my luggage and unpack certain items because that couldn't be checked. I am aware of that risk happening, however I stood in line early to make sure my chances of cabin space for luggage would be met. I travel on this flight every week and never had any issues with my carry on, why did this woman decide she was going to target me on this day, and no one else? NOT COOL UNITED! That alone left a bad taste with United and the rest of my travel experience was ruined because of the rude and prejudicial gate attendant.

Your flight attendants were rude often more c Nacer es with having loud personal conversations at the back of the plane than helping anyone. I needed water and asked for the attendant button and they never arrived I had to get them at the back of the plane were they seemed offended I interrupted their personal conversation. When asking for help with the screen they were extremely condescending I go on several flights every year and this was by far the worst flight I have ever taken.
My checked luggage was damaged.  That left a very bad taste!
The seats were uncomfortable, there was no wifi and the flight was over 2 hours late.

I was disappointed that there was no room for my carry on bag and that I had to remove my CPAP machine and have my carry on checked to my final destination.  I had a late arrival and had to wait at my home airport to retrieve my unexpectedly "checked" bag.  I wish that more room was allocated for carry on bags. I travel many over night trips for business and do not need to check a bag, so the inconvenience of having to wait for my "checked" bags is a real point of  dissatisfaction.
I have said it all.  Just continued to be frustrated with United's below average service
Why load the plane from front to back?  Makes no sense. As a result the jetway is jammed up as the folks in zone 1 put their bags away. Ridiculous.
The plane didn't work. They ran out of beverages (wine) after one ass through the cabin

I was originally supposed to fly Atlanta to Denver to San Jose.  I had to re-route due to a long mechanical delay which would have caused me to miss my connection home that evening.  While I got on an alternate flight, I lost my preferred seating.  In addition, I barely made my Chicago connection as this flight sat outside the gate for about 20 minutes prior to letting us off.
The previous flight had a faulty aircraft and this aircraft was then given for this flight to EWR and caused a delay, this is unacceptable.
Having to pay for Directv and not WiFi entertainment is wrong

It was such an uncomfortable flight. The seats were so tight and uncomfortable and the airplane was so hot the entire time. We were packed on in plenty of time but then sat an hour waiting to take off. There was a really sick person in front of us, truly the sickest person I have seen outside a hospital. The flight attendants should have moved the two people sitting next to him. They were desperate to move and the flight attendants kept ignoring them. There were extra seats on the flight. The entire experience was so awful it made me rethink flying to the Twin Cities and I will probably drive the seven hours next time instead.

Hate 737's, food in first class is HORRIBLE.  I have been eating the salmon for 4 weeks straight, options are terrible.  Personal device entertainment is really an issue and the selections are poor.  We were on time so that was a nice surprise.

The gate attendant unilaterally forced group 4 to check our carry on luggage claiming that there was simply no room for them. We boarded to find that the entire back of the plane had room for our luggage. The flight attendants were actually shocked that the gate attendant told us that.

Gate personnel boarded plane and then removed everybody from plane. Did not seem to know there was a delay at Newark. First told  one hour,forty min. Then one hour which was close. On Tarmac 25 min. So about 90 min. Late for takeoff.  Seats were too small and uncomfortable,no legroom at all.  I had not flown United in a number of years and will probably pay more to fly with another carrier in future.

When we arrived in RDU all the gate checked bags were jammed into the elevator on the jet bridge.  there was no employee there to unload or even assist.  the bags were jammed tight and many people trouble locating and extracting their bags.  I realize the plane was late arriving but I was disappointed in that experience...
Flight 661 - First Class - food was terrible. chicken curry dinner was dreadful, repulsive looking, and virtually inedible. Take that off the menu!!!!!
I gave feedback via email about my horrible experience and received a very generic response. I am very unhappy and will not fly with United again

Yesterday, January 19th, we had the flight UA71 from Amsterdam airport to Newark international airport. We experienced a horrible flight with unnecessary risks!  The problems already started at the check-in process because of system failure. We had to wait a long time before groundpersonel decided to start the check-in process manually. When we finally took off, after the delay, the problems got real. After flying approximatly three hours we turned back towards Amsterdam airport. The flightpersonal told us that several crew members had health issues and started becoming ill. Also several passengers on board started becoming ill. The crew then communicated that the airplane had oxygen problems and therefor decided to head all the way back to Amsterdam Airport. We found it strange because at that moment we’re already at Iceland and had to fly about 2 hours back.. In our opinion that is a strange call and a horrible experience for us as customers/passengers.  When we finally landed at Schiphol airport, none of the crew members told us what the intention was. We had to keep seeted and wait in the airplane that had oxygen problems. This also doesn’t make sence at all. Why again take that unnecessary risk to keep us passengers in a possible infected plane. When we got transfered from the plane to the arrival gate there was a lot of fuss. There were only a few members of united airlines and the communication was bad again. There wasn’t one spokesman that stood up and communicated to all the passengers. So all the passengers were scattered around and try to speak to the united airlines groundpersonel, u had to get lucky to be informed.  The groundpersonel also informed us that originally our flight had to be cancelled.  We have a sound fragment of this statement. They were for some reason be adviced not to fly but we still took off. We were shocked when your groundpersonel told us that.  As above mentioned we find several desisions by United airlines strange and trust unworthy. The lack of “safety first” isn’t       something where your originasation should stand for. At the moment we have a lot of questions about the (unnecessary) risks you’ve put us true and there for would like to see some answers.  Next to these questions we’ve made some additional cost/expensives. We had tickets for the basketbal game on Friday the 19th. We had additional costs for beverages. We had to pay an extra day parking costs for our car. We had additional hotel costs in NY, because of the rescheduele. Fortunately, we were able to rescheduele the return flight a day later to be a reasonable time in New York. But we were forced to take an extra day off from our work.  In the end we flew to Frankfurt with Lufthansa on January the 20th, after a stopover we arrived in New York. But also at check-in it was not properly arranged, one of us was registered for the flight the other 3 persons weren’t. During the trip we coudn’t sit together and we were all scattered around the plane. These days weren’t what we had been expected of our holiday to the USA and in particulair to New York. You could mention that this terrible expirience gave us a lot of stress and not the holiday expirience you would normaly have.  We kindly request you to pay the legal standard fine amount of €600 for each person for the more then 4 hour delay, the additional costs incured and looking forward to yo
Flight was delayed because checked baggage was not balanced properly. We had to leave the runway for this - this is a ridiculous reason to be delayed.

after leaving gate ontime, as we approached active runway we were told weight and balance was not correct and had to return to gate, to move luggage around in holds.  I am a pilot-NEVER LEAVE THE GATE WITHOUT COMPLETING WEIGHT AND BALANCE!  Is this United's way of freeing up gate space-depart before checking weight and balance.  One of dumbest things I have EVER seen on my thousands of flights.  absolutely ridiculous, no excuses.

I am frustrated that on both the outbound and return flights, the gate agent made me check my carry on. In both instances, they said that the overhead bin space was full and we would have to check our bags. In both cases, when I actually got onto the plane, there was space for at least 20-30 more bags easily. We ended up taking off with open bin space and everyone from boarding groups 3 to 5 were frustrated as they passed the open bin space. This costed everyone more time having to check their bags due to an absolute LIE.
United Airlines is the worst airline there is out there. It has actually become worse than Spirit.  I will never fly this airline ever again.

The gate agents in Chicago forced the last 12 of us in Group 4 to check our carry-on bags at the end of the ramp before boarding.  When the plan left, there were 25-30 completely empty spaces in the overhead bins.  The added delay at baggage claim meant I did not see my twin boys that night after a week of my travel (all on United, by the way).  No excuse for that.  The gate agent in DC told me that the Chicago gate agents should have checked the plane bins before forcing checked bags.  VERY disappointed in how I was treated.  (And to make it worse, I was using a 2/3 sized carry-on - super compact)

I thought it was ridiculous that we were told we needed to check our carry ons. Everyone should be able to have one bag before you sell 3+ to other passengers. No overhead storage and very cramped conditions!

The plane is just uncomfortable. No space to fit because it’s so small. The flight from Knoxville to Newark however. Was terrible because it was delayed for an extra hour because of a plane issue. You spend millions of dollars on planes and the one I was on malfunctioned? Are they not serviced properly. My ticket was 255 dollars and not 55 dollars.
Seats are terribly uncomfortable.

i do nto fly often so do not have much to compare but....i wish there was something in between the over indulgence of first class and coach. i know it is $$ so people expect to receive a lot but a little less there, less food, ammenties even room or less $ and give more space comfort in back of plane. it is so cramped in coach and not comfortable and they charge you for every little thing. i think thats why you have so many unhappy people and complaints. more people carry on their bags to avoid a luggage fee. 1 bad should be included or hide that cost within ticket price
The fruit plate for breakfast was inedible - fruit was not ripe and too hard to even cut. No apology offered. The flight attendants were in the aisles for hours, leaving little time for sleep.

Fight attendant let people put coats in over in before everyone got a chance to board and put bags into overhead bin. Some people had 2 bags a coat and a suit jacket in overhead bin. Useless flight attendant.
The food tasted bad and it was cold.

Boarded plane from Concourse C.  Had to go outside down a dimly lit ramp onto a bus.  Then from the bus through another dimly lit area to the plane.  It was dry but cold.  This must be a nightmare in bad weather.  Your regional jets are very uncomfortable

The seat were very uncomfortable. We didn't know that the ticket we bought  we could not bring even a carry on luggage. It was an average time flight almost three hours, but it was the most uncomfortable disgusting flight I have ever been on. My back was hurting for two days after the flight.
The gate agent was a total bitch.

The pilot on this flight was SO chatty! We received multiple delays, which was very annoying and inconvenient in and of itself. But the pilot came over the intercom > 5 times, including once to say "I have no update" and he just kept rambling. Things like "well at this point, you should call your ride in NYC and tell them that you're going to be late and I'm thinking that that time might be X:XX but also make sure you allow time to get from the plane to the curb and gee that might be X minutes". It was so disruptive! When the intercom comes over the air, I can't listen or participate in my phone calls I'm trying to have, and I also can't enjoy any of the music or other content I bring on the plane for entertainment. I just had to listen to this guy drone on - awful. There's no bigger pet peeve for a plane full of tired, hardworking people who are already mad about the delay on a commuter flight. I suggest this pilot gets some training to make his responses more pithy and also downloads Uber, because I guarantee 0 people in Newark needed to "call their rides" and needed detailed analyses for when to tell those rides they were coming (and change that time 4 times).

the door to the latrine was broken in the middle of the plane (between first and coach), i walked in on a passenger, and then did not feel confident while in there, the door did not fully engage, the flight attendant said she would make sure no one walked in.  Over all the flight was very pleasant since it was not a very full flight and everyone had elbow room....very rare these days.
Somewhere between having to gate check my bag, to picking it up at baggage delivery, you broke off my baggage tag; which was sturdy and not cheap. You also damaged my suitcase.

I sat in the last row next to the bathrooms on the aisle. The 737 was very cramped. Everytime the stewardesses went back and forth they either bumped my shoulder, stepped on my foot, or ran over my foot with the service cart. Passengers bumped me too. My shoulder now has bruises. The last row has no provision for passenger storage overhead at all. One side is reserved for emergency equipment and the other side for the stewardess carry ons. I had two small soft carry ons ( a computer case and a small shoulder bag) as well as an overcoat I would need to wear once we got to Newark. I had no choice but to put my soft bags where my feet normally would have gone. I couldn't put anything under my own seat, even though I was in the last row because the stewardesses had more boxes of emergency equipment under my seat. I wear size 14 men's shoes to accommodate two leg braces I have to wear. There literally was no where else to put my right foot. That's why it got run over. The lack of overhead storage made it an uncomfortable flight and the lack of ability to put anything even under my own seat made it very frustrating. Of course, by the time they get to the last row, there are no choices left on the advertised meals. For the rest of eternity I will avoid being dependant on United for an onboard meal as it is too much like Russian roulette - maybe, maybe not.
Entire aircraft was in horrible shape.  Very worn and dirty.

Your flight attendant was angry, rude and very unhappy. I was not interested in food or drink and she shoved it in my face and shook it. She was rude and short with other passengers and her performance was very unacceptable. I understand people have bad days but here behavior was unacceptable and not a good representation of the service i am used to from United...as i fly every week for work.
Aircraft seats are too small and very uncomfortable. Ridiculous that these planes are still in service

Lounge staff were rude.   Seat area had rubbish from previous flight.    Attendant was rude when I originally said I wouldn’t eat then changed my mind.   Side by side seats are hardly a modern business class.  Had to climb over isle passenger to get out.  I flew 120,000 miles last year.   I am gold on Virgin, BA, Emirates and Thai and silver on Lufthansa.
Gate agents were late and rude. Flight attendants were rude as well.

I travel 50% of the time on business. When boarding in group 2, at the door, the gate agent made me put my carry-on in the sizer. I travel with this bag constantly. It is well within regulation size and was not even expanded.  She was rude about the process and even the passengers behind me were appalled at her behavior. This would never have happened if I were a man. Many of the men’s bags were fully expanded but were not questioned. This is very poor service and perhaps your gate agents need some further training in not assuming older women’s bags are automatically larger than men’s.
Female gate agent was unprofessional and was badgering the male agent to find out why another female agent was mad at her... It was like teenage drama

I with my wife sat in the first two economy plus seats. The seats were extremely small and uncomfortable. Definitely not an economy plus seat. Additionally it was right next to the bathroom which was extremely unpleasant. We were very disappointed!!

The 2 flight attendents in First class was the worst that I have experienced in a long time. They were slow to respond, Did not provide the service expected in first class such as hot towel service, food tray was missing items, and most of the time they were chatting in the kitchen Area. Really bad service. Does United really care about it ? Don’t think so.

The food and beverage service was below average.  After dinner, nothing else was served for the 5.5 hour flight.  No drinks were offered, and no warm cookies were served.  Combined with my seatmate's constant flatulence and the freezing cabin, this made for a quite miserable flight.
I asked to go on an earlier flight which had empty seats and they said I would have to pay $75 each person or the plane would go out with empty seats - that stinks

Why do you guys remove direct flights sometimes during the year? It's STUPID. You force more travelers into your already overloaded hubs which makes everyone angry. According to flight attendants, my flight from ORD - SFO had 25% global services and group 1. By my count, it appeared more like half the plane boarded in group 1. I'm Premier Gold and barely got my bag on the plane, then had to put it way in the back and almost missed my connection. STOP trying to squeeze that last 1% of profit out of us! It's KILLING your customer SAT. Or don't you care??

Delayed coming and going which is expected because united rarely leave on time sfo ohare ohare sfo. I didn’t have tsa pre coming home so had to go to two security checkpoints and long lines at ohare. Movies are excruciatingly outdated for the most part so not much to watch. I’m going to try to fly out of Oakland next time because SFO to O’Hare on United is horrible! Why are you always late??? And if i don’t get precheck its even worse. I cancelled my international flight because I couldn’t take it after the two flights this week so uncomfortable.

The flight was completely full and I was in a middle seat. The bottom of the seat was slanted forward and was very uncomfortable. There was a lady sitting next to me on the aisle that was exceptionally large and needed a seat belt extender to buckle her seat belt. She was large enough that the arm rest would not go down and her thigh and butt pressed against me the whole flight. The temperature in the cabin was too warm (even with the air vent fully open). The flight was just miserable!
Absolutely brutal seating even with the extra legroom in an exit row. I arrive more sore than when I left
horrible checkin experience at ord global services desk.  worst airline employees i have ever encountered

The boarding gate experience for this flight was markedly bad compared with other flights.  The Zone 1 and 2 lines extended so long, they tailed into the line areas for Zones 3 and 5 respectively.  When Zone 1 boarded, Zone 3 followed behind them and were not stopped by the gate agent.  Similarly, when Zone 2 boarded, Zone 5 followed them and again were not stopped.  I ended up being forced to wait at the entrance to the jetway for approx 5 minutes for them to check if there was enough luggage space, then required me to gate check my carryon (along with the few people who had not boarded the plane outside of their zone already).  Onboard, when I reached my seat, the flight attendants had closed the overhead, despite there being room for my bag to be in there.  Other bins were full of small backpacks and coats.  This was a bereavement trip, and all time lost was time that could have been spent with my family.  I was frustrated by both gate staff and flight attendants not enforcing the simple policies the airline has set out for itself.
The aircraft has horrible PA announcement speakers. I was couldn't hear the captain's announcement at all.

Checking in is still a pain as self check in. You always end up needing help, ALWAYS. So why even have the self check in?? It’s a pain. The food was really terrible. Most unhealthy choices and so salty, I had to leave it back half eaten. Nothing there for someone health conscious.

The gate experience was terrible. You can’t put 3 groups in one line and just tell people to move out of the way. It was a massive cluster and took 45 minutes to board the plane. This is also the 3rd time in a row that I’ve had to check my carry on. If I don’t pay more and if I’m in group 4, even if I’m the first one, there’s apparently no room for my bag. The tv in flight is ridiculous. I understand paying for certain services or movies, but to make people pay to use the tv at all is crazy. Have a few channels that people can watch without paying and charge for movies or something. If not, there’s no need for a tv that just plays annoying ads throughout the flight. This was overall a terrible flight experience, especially pre-flight.

Horrible service at Newark. Was it a surprise we were flying in? We had to de-plane outside on the tarmac with temperatures in the teens at 9:30pm. We stood there waiting for our gate checked bags, then had to take a jam-packed bus ride to terminal C. I was standing and got jerked around as the bus started and stopped, some guy behind me fell into me. I am a 56 year-old woman. Not a good way to end the flight. We then had to walk up a steep ramp with our luggage into the terminal. It felt like an experience I would expect in a third-world country. Not at EWR! I fly almost weekly from Newark for work and have never had such an experience. There was no warning or mention or explanation given. We figured it out as we walked out of the cabin door.

Had to go to back-to-back funerals during the last 10 days (1 uncle, 1 father).  Was distressed to find out bereavement rates have been eliminated.  Also, it appears you have cut the number of economy + seats by over 60%.  What's up with that?
We paid for an upgrade to premium on our anniversary - seats proved to be very hard and uncomfortable and neither of us slept - it was a complete waste of money
Food choice was very poor.  My husband and I had the 2 different offerings and they were both bad!!!

Boarding at Newark was not handled well. I am assuming it was due to the low passenger booking, but it was haphazard and unprofessional. Did not even board handicapped passengers first, went directly to group 1 boarding.
Seat space and aisle space very small and uncomfortable. Very disappointing.
We tired to use Global Upgrades, but had to purchase upgrades to get First Class.  There were no flights shown that we could use our Global Upgrades.  you upgrade seats are too limited

My flight to Richmond was delayed 2.5 hours because we were waiting for the aircraft to come in from Richmond.  The incoming plane had been diverted to Baltimore because the aircraft did not have enough fuel.  Once in Baltimore, the plane was delayed for 2 hours.  My delay could have been avoided if the plane had been properly prepared in Richmond.  Also, in Newark, there was no gate attendant present for me to ask any questions to and during the whole 2.5 hour delay, we only had 2 updates.  No one from United seemed to be concerned that we were delayed for this long and no one wanted to give us information.  When a gate attendant happened to be at the podium for 5 minutes, I went up to ask her what was going on and she told me that she wasn't working the Richmond flight and that I would have to go to the service center or wait until the other gate attendant came back (which she never did). I am extremely disappointed with this flying experience as my ride home from the airport in Richmond had to drive out at midnight to come get me.  I had plans and reservations this night and they had to be cancelled.  Not impressed, United.

I'm a vegetarian but don't usually order a special meal because the business class offering usually includes a good pasta dish.  This one was portobello lasagna, and I hate portobellos.  Just a personal preference but I think a lot of vegetarians dislike being offered those giant mushrooms.!
It just seemed odd that the desk clerk didn’t know where are plane was, even as it was pulling into the gate.  He was impatient and sometimes rude during the delay.

I booked a first class seat. Had no meal service. The flight attendant paid no attention to us. I had to ask for refills. It was a joke. Flight was on time and pilots were very nice but the FIRST CLASS service was horrible.

My partner and I were returning home to Denver. Flight attendant forgot to return with headphones for my partner. But more importantly, failed to notice that the gentlemen in our row was overly intoxicated and should probably not have been served additional alcohol. We felt pinned in and bothered by this man for the majority of the flight.
This is about the second or third survey that I fill out with a fairly low NPS score, yet no one seems to be listening or following - your CX process is clearly broken or you simply don't care.
The seats are way to tight , no space, not enough bathrooms, not enough storage for luggage. Food is terrible in economy.
Cabin pressure was very bad. It was painful both on the way up and the way down. I've been on a lot of flights and this seemed particularly bad.
No WiFi is disappointing

Seats way too cramped not enough leg room. I am 5'10" and my knees were touching the seat in front of me. If the person in front pushed back their seat even a little it became very uncomfortable.   Also, the 737 was incredibly loud at times. Seat 25 F and had to cover my ears at one point- very unpleasant. They bumped up the passenger in the aisle in my row to first class. The woman in the middle seat never moved over into the aisle so we were very cramped. I think the flight attendant should have given her that option (she seemed like an inexperienced traveler who didn't know she could change her seat). The wall next to my seat below the window had old dried food on it (or worse- vomit?)- gross. The Directv screen was very bright and there was no way to turn it off. I was trying to sleep and the bright flickering screen made that impossible. Also the announcement that we are beginning our descent seems to come too early. In the past these were made 10-15 min before landing. Now it is sometimes 30 min or more which is excessive in my opinion. Also I find flight attendants in general are lax about telling passengers to move their seat back to the upright position. it is not enough to announce it- need to walk through the aisles and make sure. On my previous flight Boston to Newark the older man in front of me slept through the announcements and never put his seat up all the way until landing. I will be flying Delta in future for my business needs.

We are a famliy of 4 with kids.  We were each seated in a separate row.   Is having a family with the same last name sit in the same row something that you should charge more for on an economy ticket?  I have flown this airline for years, and the expense and greed of your company is leaving a bad taste in my mouth.  In the future I will look to other airlines for my flights.  Unfortunately, we are already booked on your airline for our next flight in May.

I had booked my return flight for Sunday. January 27 to arrive about 8 pm to Newark.  Then I looked at my itinerary  before leaving for Miami on Thursday  January 26,  and I was very surprised to see that my return flight was changed to Wednesday January 31.  I  wanted to change this obvious mistake  and  was told  I would have to pay $200 plus buy a new ticket.  What nonsense is this!  How can you change my fight without my permission?  And then to get my flight back I need to pay for my orinital ticket again.  YOU ARE DEPLORABLE!
The flight itself was great but the nasty attitude of staff caused by United’s new baggage policy for those in basic economy class is reprehensible. I can’t recommend this airline to others.
Dirty plane, uncomfortable seat,

I was forced to check my bag when I did not need to. There was PLENTY of room above and I know my bag can fit. I then had to wait 30 minutes for my bag, when I had a ride scheduled for immediately after the flight arrived. Very dissatisfied

FA service very poor on this flight. Did not receive a menu (even after I reminded lead FA twice), completely ignored by FAs at other points in the flight. FA handed hot towel to passenger next to me, ignored me completely. Asked twice for gel pillow, request was ignored. Very disappointing service.
Very old (looking) airplane with worn out seating. Stewardesses were rude and unfriendly!

The guy behind me woke me several times by digging his knees into my back. It was a red-eye: I was not very happy about that.  I guess he was tall and the seats were too close together. Not a great experience.
The room between rows is too small for grown humans. Flying is pain.
bathrooms were not cleaned during the flight, food was bad

The redesigned 77w is not made for long haul international travel. The seats and aisles are too narrow, with the extra people crammed into economy and you do not have enough overhead bin storage space.  What made the overly narrow seats even more unbearable on a 12 hour flight was that my seat 24a, has the aircraft door protruding two inches into my seta making a bad seat worse.
The cabin crew was terrible. They were extremely rude and not helpful.

The announcement is always made to wait to put your coats in the overhead bin until everyone has their suitcases in.  That doesn't work if you are in a window seat.  If you wait, then you have to ask everyone in your row to get out of their seats to be able to put your coat in the bin and you can't see if there is space until after you get out of your seat.  So you could cause a disruption and delay the completion of boarding.  I chose to just ignore the announcement and go ahead and put my coat in the bin when I first got to my seat and no one seemed to have a problem with it.  It just seems like such a nonsense, pointless announcement that doesn't sync with the reality of the passenger experience.
Portland station is under staffed. Complete confusion. Gate agent bordering on rude.
Check in attendants were very rude at LGA.

I thought it strange that my husband was upgraded and I was not and the reason he has gold status is because of me.  I am a lifetime gold member having flown over 1M miles in my lifetime and designated him as my gold companion.  It seems really odd he was upgraded and I was not.

The seating is getting ridiculous.  The airlines - not just United - are getting so greedy that fliers are packed in "like sardines".  Also, you are "ala carting" everything on the flight.  I was frankly shocked to see that you expected fliers to pay to use the in-flight televisions.  Unbelievable.

I was pleasantly surprised by how much leg room I had, however extremely disappointed by the fact that I wasn't seated with my husband. The tickets were bought together, it's literally more work to seat us separately.  Also, the basic economy tickets are such an unfortunate way to prey on passengers. I have traveled extensively throughout Europe using budget airlines almost exclusively, and the basic economy tickets are a combination of all the worst features of those budget airlines -- without the budget price! Some budget airlines in Europe won't allow you anything bigger than a personal item on board. Some make you pay a small ($10) fee for a regular carry-on. I didn't even have that option. My options were to purchase a large suitcase to check, or to bring only a personal item. Given the length of my trip, purchasing a large suitcase to check would have been a ridiculous waste of money and space. However, I struggled to fit everything into my personal item. Also, not being sat together with my husband is just an added frustration. Literally no one wins in that situation, and I just become angry with your customer service. I couldn't even pay in order to sit with him, and it seems like this practice is done almost out of spite.
Don’t take two years to complete the United lounges in Newark.  A total waste at the moment.   I read about lobster rolls in Boston but Newark is a mess.

The economy seats leave individuals crammed for space in the 737 800/900 and are very uncomfortable. Take some seats out of the plane.  In addition there needs to be more organization to the check-in process, it's disorganized. If you need reference look to Delta and Alaska for guidance as these are simple with them. In addition no check-in email was sent to me, that should be standard for all tickets.

I have never been so uncomfortable on a flight. I have been on this flight to and from Halifax/Newark many times and always understand it's sometimes a little cold on the small airplane - but this particular flight from Halifax to Newark was absolutely frigid. There was no heat whatsoever. I was completely frozen for the entire flight which made the experience terrible.
Check in was chaos.

Thank you for alerting me of 2 hour delay..but plane wasn’t in working condiction that add to a longer delay ..upon arrival we sat in runway area for almost hour due to no gate..ord is a hub..that’s an outrage..

I flew business. I was not offered a meal at all.... staff completely ignored me. I had to ask repeatedly for water when other passengers had wine meals and sodas. I ended up in tears.  I will never fly United again. What’s wrong with you people?
The chicken in the Polaris Business class dinner was embarrassingly bad.
About a 2 hour delay. No updates on departure time during the delay. The person just announced at about 1.5 hours into the delay that the flight would start boarding.
I lost a toy and I don't have faith in the lost and found process.

Surly check in personnel in Omaha, and then forced to gate check all rollaboards (due to aircraft size) without allowing check thru to final destination without a charge——a good way to miss a connection waiting for plane side bag delivery.  Always offered free check thru before, but Omaha personnel don’t seem to want to be bothered.  You ask for feedback, but doesn’t seem to help.
There is no reason to require a united employee to verify my carry-on.  It made me wait for her to finish assisting multiple other people, made me delay other’s check in process.  Wasted time

Traveling with infant twins and a three year old and security was excruciating... they made me throw out my breastmilk and the process took so long that i didnt have time to pump more or even buy breakfast for my older daughter. We had to immediately get on the plane where i was SEPARATED from my husband altho our seats had been booked together. Then the flight attendant accused me of “putting garbage on her nice clean counter “ when i hadnt even gotten up, so i said no that wasnt me, and i am busy caring for three babies as opposed to littering at which point she yelled at me not to be rude and that she has kids and i shouldnt assume she doesn’t (btw; i dont care what her personal life is). Then she didnt offer any food altho my three year old was hungry. It took more than an hour to get anyone to bring water tho my daughter was begging for it. None of us but my older daughter in particular got to eat breakfast or drink anything till we landed. Terrible and bitchy service...
Very disappointed in entertainment.  No free movies. Tired of getting nickel and dimed to death by the airlines.
Original flight was delayed 3 hours. After I got to the gate, another 40 minute delay. Then a gate change, then another delay. Then 40 on the tarmac. Overall disappointing experience

At gate / check-in, Rude African American lady is the only way  I can describe her and  as so incensitve to my wife & I. She Spent more time degrading her white male counterpart & bragging about her length of time employed & ignoring our cry’s for help. Disgraceful. She laughed is she schrugged is off. Corporate team indeed will  B informed to make Changes because Of such disrespect for the customer. I don’t recall her name. Angie?

The issue with the one hour wait for a first officer was frustrating. We understand things happen, but it was frustrating.  The seats also had very limited space.  I have short legs and I was hitting the seat in front of me.

Your flight attendant, Jeff, on my flight was exteremely rude and unprofessional. He ran the garbage cart into my leg (which was not in the aisle in any way shape or form) three times! He never apologized but rather yelled at me and told me to move. I know have a giant bruise on my knee from his actions. I filed a complaint online and never received a response. AND I paid to upgrade to Economy plus just to come out wounded!

Part of our baggage (car seat) did not make it on the flight, so we had to spend an extra 3 hours at Denver airport to wait for the next flight. The baggage personnel were helpful and gave us meal vouchers (it wasnt their fault anyway), but we were very frustrated that such a thing would happen in the first place. Baggage check in personnel were extremely unfriendly at Newark, no smile, just rude curt responses and they threw our bags around, besides the fact that some of it did not even get loaded onto our flight.

My children were standing at the gate ready to board but I got stuck at security bec I had liquid medicine for my son. They asked them to hold the plane. I ran through the airport holding a baby and when I got there they said they had closed the cabin door a minute before. They knew I would be there within a minute or two. We had just come off a 12 hour flight from Tel Aviv to Newark with 8 children. They could have waited another 5 minutes to let us get on the flight. We had to wait in the airport for 2 hours exhausted and then we were put on a flight to Houston scattered all over the plane and only one person offered to move so 2 of my Children could sit together. Flight attendants didn’t even try to help out they kept telling us we have to take our seats and my 2 year old was supposed to sit alone between two people. I’m extremely disappointed in United. We fly very often and this was unacceptable
Not being able to check in and get BPass without ticket agent approval of my carry on was infuriating considering the lines to see a ticket agent were very long.

Newark Airport Terminal C was horrific,  long lines from the check-in area all the way up to the security area. The lines in the check-in area were blocking passengers trying to get through to check-in.  Absolutely a chaotic scene,  a horrible way to start a flight.

Saet in bulkhead middle seat with a fracture in foot wearing a boot and on the window was a young woman with a large dog out of carrier who's lease got tangle around my leg.  Not a good thing! How this dog was able to be there I will never know it did not have a special notice!

We paid for an upgrade on Nov 15th for the Economy Plus Seats and they were confirmed when we flew to Florida.  When we did online check in the night before the flight our seats were moved all over the plane.  I spent 2 hours on the phone with many different people that tried to help but could not understand why our seats got moved and were not able to change our seats but told us that at the gate we would be able to help us.  As suggested we went early to the airport and spoke with the gate agents who were not able to accommodate us.  They told us that they asked all the people around and no one was willing to move so that we can sit together.  When we got onto the plane the passengers all were very accommodating and were all willing to move and said that they were never asked by the gate agents about moving to accommodate our family sitting together.  The flight attendants would not allow us to sit there because the gate agents already moved our seats to the back and told us that these seats were only for paying customers.  This experience was the worst customer service we have ever received flying with United.  We were very disappointed in how this was handled.  I still have not removed the credit back from the seats that we paid for and never got to use.  I have called 3 times but because of the winter storm no one is able to help and told me to call back another time.  Again the worst customer service experience for us.

You only ask about my flight to Syracuse, which was fine. Overall, my experience was awful. You cancelled my flight back to NYC, and you refused to re-book me on another airline. I had to pay for a new ticket, because if I had not, I would have been stuck in Syracuse indefinitely through a blizzard. Your phone lines were so backed up that I could not speak with anyone. Unless I'm offered a refund, I will try to avoid United wherever possible and will advise others to do the same.

Boarding process needs more order... the line for Group 2 was out of control and though a semblance of a line existed, people simply cut in front when boarding began.  The group blocked walkways and was a pain for passengers trying to get through.

The food was good except for the Beef Tenderloin. It was tough has rubber....no taste, no flavor and hard. Flight attended just said that I should mention it in the survey. Frankly, I was disappointed.

One of two golf bags did not arrive and , although we saw the attendant put them on the conveyor belt, one bag is showing as not being scanned in Newark. We were given a phone number to call but get the same recording- “we are searching for your bag”.  We Never speak to a human. Two other golf bags were reported as missing from this flight. So either there is major theft or major incompetence. Or TSA takes the bag to check and doesn’t return them??? Either way it is a very expensive loss and I’m sure United will give us a hassle regarding any claim . Aside from the inconvenience of not having them, the probability of the bag never showing up is very disturbing. We have no way of knowing if anyone is actually looking for this bag, or why it wasn’t scanned in the first place. We understand that the weather presented other issues fir the airlines, but that only adds to my belief that United will not locate the bag. In addition, your website for baggage tracing is useless. I put in a file number which takes me to baggage tracing results which asks for verification on the page. There Is No info on the page. It says then to call the airline. Which takes you back to the same recording. Useless and frustrating . I would like someone to contact me at 908 292-6264 or email: James.jim.watson@gmail.com

Our flight was severely delayed because of a mechanical failure that was discovered only after the plane was fully boarded. We then had to exit the airplane, wait for another aircraft to be cleaned, and then board again. We were given free tv as a consolation, a gesture which I found to be insulting! In the future, I will try my best to never fly United. I always feel scammed by the airline!

I volunteered in Ottawa to not board a flight to Chicago, then was routed through Newark but the plane I was on landed in Newark about ten minutes before the flight I was put on to take me to SFO. It was impossible, literally impossible, for me, needing a wheelchair but no one could have pulled it off, to get from international Newark terminal to the SFO gate in ten minutes. Why did you schedule me that way?  My luggage did not get put on my SFO flight so I had to wait extra hours at SFO airport for my suitcase, which contained my housekeys (a mistake on my part), among other life necessities like my insulin. If you had just routed me on a reasonable timing schedule, no problems. And my suitcase, when it tumbled onto the baggage claim machines in SFO had absolutely no luggage numbers or the ID luggage tag I had paid good money to buy. All identifying info was gone. I was almost a miracle my suitcase ended up in SFO on a later flight. I get putting my luggage on a later flight. I don't understand why you rushed me to Newark when there were several later Newark flights. The only reason I made the Newark flight to SFO was due to truly heroic efforts by the woman pushing my wheelchair:  she screamed all the way to get folks out of our way, I had to walk up a steep long ramp from the airport shuttle which is very painful for me and this was unnecessary for I could have taken a later flight. I could have, for example, taken the next flight that had my suitcase! And what the heck, if I had not opted to wait at SFO for that next flight, how would United have identified my suitcase since your employees removed all identifying tags, including my luggage claim number.  It made for a hellish day that did not have to be hellish. And I volunteered to be rerouted. And no one has offered to pay for me to replace my removed (it was buckled onto my suitcase) luggage ID doohickey tag. I had not eaten that day so I had to, because I am a type one diabetic, buy some of your overpriced and crappy on-plane food -- nothing offered that is good for diabetics, btw.  I had no time in Newark to get water or food. AND. . . AND. . my wifi would not work on the plane. I wanted to buy wifi but your system just wouldn't let me. My brand new Macbook Pro was not the problem. I also was unable to use the free inflight video service:  I just couldn't download the weird plug (I had never heard of it, I keep my machines up to date) to my laptop so I couldn't watch movies or get online. I had planned to get some work done online. The trauma of that absurdly tight scheduling in Newark was bad enough . . but then having to hang around for hours at SFO hoping my suitcase showed up on later flights when I should have been on a later flight.  I will fly United again because I got some vouchers but $800 in vouchers is not enough for the nightmare. You could easily have put me on a later Newark SFO flight and it is your job to keep luggage claim numbers with routing into on my suitcase . . .but you didn't. The whole day was hellish because of the stress I incurred by being stupid enough to volunteer to not take my original flight to Chicago, where, btw, I had plans for my adult daughter to come to O'Hare for a visit during my layover. So you cost me a visit with my only child, lots of stress in Newark and in SFO hoping my luggage would show up.  When I told some luggage folks in SFO a
Refurbish the restroom. They are in disrepair and smell of urine. It's quite disgusting. And the location mid-cabin means that frequently econo pax use the biz loo even when requested not to.
Please look after the passenger don’t treat them like animals like long line and less staff it was really nightmare no professionalism
I was very dissatisfied as a box that I had paid at check-in for was lost. I still haven't received it.

Prior to flight, I had called customer service to notify that I would be traveling with a service animal. I was assured by the representative that this note had been made on my reservation, and was given a bulk head seat to accommodate. The representative assured me that I would be on a window seat, as I made note to her that it would be extremely distracting for the animal to work with people walking by all the time. When I arrived at the HNL airport, I checked in, and was told there was no note on my reservation that I would have an animal with me. I explained that I had done so more than a month ago. The attendant made me wait over an hour to make a phone call and get things confirmed. I had also given my license to the TSA representative, and never got it back, causing further complication. Though I had to carry on without it because I had been so significantly delayed by the animal reservation complication. When I boarded, my seat was on an isle, despite previous reassurance that I had a window. The animal had complications and was less able to do her job as a result, though no major problem happened other than extreme stress and risk.   On my return flight, I moved smoothly through an extremely long security line, and when I approached the gate, notified the service person at the gate desk that I was traveling with a service animal, and needed to make sure I had a bulkhead window seat. She took over an hour, after boarding had already begun, to notify my that a seat change was made, without asking any questions or asking if the change was acceptable. My seat was changed to a window seat in row 38, CLEARLY not a bulk head. After excessive difficultly boarding with the animal, and being unable to fit into the seat with the animal anywhere else besides my lap (meaning I had to spend 10+ hours with a large animal on my lap!!), I attempted to get the attention of an attendant prior to take off, but was ignored and disreagarded. I looked for a way to alert the crew using the standard “call attendant” button usually found, but didn’t find any way to alert for help. After take off, I didn’t see another attendant until drunk/food service began. An older, black with short greying hair, female attendant, wearing a blue jacket approached and asked if I wanted a drink. I requested water, and attempted to hand her a hydro flask, but was denied, as she claimed I could only have one cup. I explained that I would need more for my animal and myself, she said she could give me only one cup more for the animal, and that I could have more when she returned on her next trip. As I was unable to call an attendant, I had to get out of my seat to request more water, traipsing over the polite customer next to me with the animal, causing her and I both discomfort and frustration. I had to do this multiple times, as the drink service only came through three times, with the same rude attendant, as of my knowledge. Anytime I had to use the rest room, I had to ask the guest next to me to stand, let us out, and it was extraordinarily unpleasant. My discomfort had gotten so bad with the animal on my lap that I had to stand repeatedly to alleviate the pain. As this was an extremely long flight, I had given up entirely on being able to be at peace at any point.   In conclusion, my recent experiences with United Airlines has been an overwhelming disgrace and I am extre
Disappointed in the 757. When ticket was booked, I was told I would have a 777 to fully recline!! Equipment was changed and as a result, I got NO sleep.
Other than their being no wi-fi access, no.
The seats are horrid. Make more room

The flight was rather bumpy, I have never experienced such turbulence and I would consider myself as a regular traveler.  However, my worst experience was the bathroom, I went twice early in flight because the TSA process was so long that I had to go directly to board flight and later just before landing, on the first visit the garbage area was full by the second visit it was overflowing.

You charge me $25 to check my bag, I got to the airport 2 hours before so no excuse to get the bag on the plane and then I get to Santo Domingo and my bag is not on the plane ....that’s said I had to wait 1 hour to get to the lady to file a claim ....so you charge me $25, it cost you $167 to have a courier bring me my bag the next day to my hotel 2.5 hours away plus you gave me $100 to buy essentials ....I would have rather had my bag ....really hate flying anymore
Flight was delayed. That may be excuseable but lack of information on why and correct info on when departure will be is not. Quit giving artficial/incorrect times!
The flight journey itself was good but the flight was delayed for almost 5 hours which was painful to just sit in the airport with Kids.

While the flight itself and flight attendants were great I was extremely disappointed that the plane's food inventory was ridiculously low. I was in row 35 and wanted to purchase an omelet, yogurt and fresh fruit, but the flight attendant had none of those and mentioned that they were only given 4 of each item. A quantity of only Four for a plane of a few hundred? ??? That was extremely disappointing as I was starving when I got off the 4+ hour flight.

Unfortunately, none of our suitcases made it to Newark when we did. This is incredibly frustrating, especially when traveling with young children. And now it's almost impossible to track them due to your antiquated system. No info, poor customer service. Not very friendly at all. Thanks United.
Long flight, no snack. Worse coming LA. Some carry on baggage far over size limits and weight limit.

Yes - as a person who is allergic to dog and cat dander I do not believe animals should be in the cabins with people. I had to take medication for my allergic reaction. In the waiting area a family put a shock collar on their pet to stop it from barking. We thought this was cruel.
Flight was delayed therefore cause my check in late to get lousy room the resort gave me. I’m very unhappy.
Check in took a long time.  Food wasn't great.  Eggs and sausage for breakfast did not taste good.  And flight was late.  Not a good experience.
My baggage didnt make it and then after 2 hours waiting they found my luggage.  Very disappointing and service personnel were understaffed at Houston

Our original Aer Lingus flight to London was cancelled and we were rerouted via Newark on an overbooked flight, resulting in the 3 of us being separated and in middle seats since we lost our seat assignments.  The breakfast meal was probalby the worst airline food I've ever experienced...a badly overcooked and charred omelete that was completely inedible.

Yes I would like to talk to someone about the seat not reclining. I am still in pain and I find it unacceptable that we are asked to fly for over 7 hours in a chair that won't recline. Then, when i told a crew member he acted as if he didn't care. No offer to move my seat etc., sad.
My newer suitcase was damaged and know the handle that extends out is broken!

I understand that delays happen. But there were several factors here that were within United's control. I've been on planes in Europe where I've seen several de-icing trucks working on small aircraft like a 737, however, you had one truck working on a 777, doing two different types of de-icing. Not catering enough food for a full flight is unacceptable. Additionally, I can't fathom how an aircraft that is arriving over an hour late did not have a gate ready on arrival. Sitting on the tarmac for as long as we did after landing only added insult to injury.

Damage to equipment in one of my bags. Item was completely ruined. Had to buy new item upon arrival to destination. Also one bag did not arrive. United did deliver later in evening same day, which was good.

Your baggage handlers DESTROYED my ski bag, skis and ski wear. I was tremendously inconvenienced. The baggage manager in EGE stated she never saw such terrible damage. After 48 hours i have YET to hear from anyone at United concerning my damages.

Lost baggage CUN43836m Now more than 30 hours later / day 2 with no clothes and no contact. I had no issue with it not making the connection but at least 3 more flights to here since then - now it is past an inconvenience  647-649-9260 cell
Horrible experience with de-icing truck experience had us grounded 1 hr late past departure time.  Then, the baggage claim area in PVR was a disaster.
Very poor experience with lead flight attendant. Terry made the trip uncomfortable.
Cabin crew informed me that my status does not require filling custom forms, and due to that I spent extra 45 minutes upon arrival, walking back and forth from custom control.. Very unprofessional
Airplane was old , Seats worn and bathroom was dirty

El personal de vuelo no habla bien español, si es un vuelo a México y van en español que sea correctamente. Deberían invertir más en la capacitación del personal. Fue un vuelo largo y también deberían incluir más alimento ya que la galleta que dan además de ser nada saludable no calma él hambre
Snacks for sale should be made available for the economy cabin. The food was not great so we were hungry for most of flight and nothing was available to eat.
Very upset that jetway didn't work and had to wait extra time to get off aircraft. Arrival gate was furthest from baggage claim and i am physically impaired and had trouble with the distance.

The infant car seat provided by United as a temporary replacement for the car seat United lost in transit was absolutely awful. I hate that I was forced to put my child in that seat and take her on the road but I was given no choice after United put our car seat on the wrong aircraft. The seat lacked sufficient instruction on installation, felt cheap and did not appear sufficient to protect my child in the event of an accident.

The seats are extremely small; much smaller than any other aircarrier I've flown with. Same goes for the tray tables. The amount of leg room is also criminal. I would not be surprised if people were getting blood clots while sitting in that horrific position. The aisles are also much smaller, which makes it harder to walk down. In fact, the aisles are so small that the cart the flight attendants used got stuck frequently. Putting the buttons for the TV on the left arm rest was also a fail. When you're sitting in an aisle seat it's a pain to have your arm extended in the aisle to reach the buttons and having people constantly bump into you. All in all, it was the most uncomfortable experience flying for me, to date.

The wifi was useless and I've requested a refund.  The flight attendants came around once for drinks on a 9hr flight and when I hit to call button it was never answered; I had to wait for one to walk by and stop her.

Was disappointed regarding baggage....apparently it arrived on an earlier flight...finally figured it out after waiting on line for an hour with many others.... why did that happen? Very frustrating to say the least

Yes. I have been waiting for 4 days for one of my bags to arrive in Nassau, Bahamas. Never in my life have I had such a frustrating experience with getting a delayed bag to myself.  I will never ever recommend anyone Fly United. All i get is excuses from the baggage people in New Delhi India. No one has done anything concrete to get me this piece of luggage. Worst airline ever.
Business class seating may be fine for Asian customers but for large Americans it is cramped and not so comfortable

Although it is not entirely United Airlines' problem the baggage service in Newark is very poor. The baggage did not start to come until over thirty minutes after landing. Then is came slowly. Ironically the baggage with the "priority" tags came after the regular baggage started coming out. Overall Newark airport lived down to its reputation as America's worst airport. Just for your records the baggage at LAX (my final destination) started within 5 minutes of my reaching the baggage area and the "priority" baggage came out first. LAX was every bit as busy as Newark.

All smooth but the baggage issue was horrible. Waited about an hour as 5 flights were all tryin GTO get bags from Carousel 4. Had to ask folks what flight they were on to determine if bags were coming off. Finally when. Just 5 people remaining around the carousel. My bag was the very last one off. I noticed that the erratic delivery of bagggage from 3 flights had orange priority tag show up at different times while unloading. And of course I had priority to and dead last bag.

The seats are so uncomfortable now. Compared to Colombian airlines, the flight from Colombia to US was very uncomfortable. I could hardly move my arms or legs. Then, the cabin was so hot that I got claustrophobic. Also, the chairs are very uncomfortable causing a cramp in my wife's back.
It was the worst flight that I have been on ever.............The flight attendants disappeared and did nothing to resolve the situation.
The delay in Brussels (1 hours) is never a pleasant experience!

I am extremely dissatisfied with the way United handled its communication of the delay.  While the plane left Newark with over 2 hours of delay, I received no text messages or emails to inform me of the delayed flight.
your luggage policy is ridicules, your basic economy fare doesn't allow family member to sit together ridicules I understand restrictions but the seating assignment is unnecessary and make no sense.
The WiFi/entertainment is very confusing and annoying. Why is it not supported in Mac books? What exactly am I paying for if I can’t get it to load.

Our Check in bag did not make it to San Diego with us and caused us some worry and inconvenience until it was delivered the next day.  We had to leave SD for another trip and if it had not come it would have a major impact on our trip.   But the lady at the lost baggage counter was very polite and helpful.  Anand Patel

Hello, As a first class passenger and at full fare how is it that out of the two meal options I am told we are out of chicken?   Really unacceptable.  If it had not been for another pax cancelling his meal I would not have an option. American Airlines allows you to select your meal up to 24hrs before take off.  IS UAL considering this? Rob Nostro
Charging for direct TV is bad business and a reason I would choose not to fly United again.

The flight was 1.5 hour delayed from takeoff from Houston, which I was very surprised by. Additionally the flight attendant, Beth, was quite rude on the plane. She got in an argument with the gentleman behind me and was disrespectful in her tone to passengers.

United was again very poor on this flight. Aircraft was freezing all the 9 hours, the crew were rude and unhelpful and did not even apologize to me. As a long standing customer United has gone to new lengths to disappoint me. What is more annoying is that no one from United will reach out to me to address my concerns so why go through this???????

My luggage got damaged and destroyed from Chicago to Sarasota. The customer service agents in Sarasota were very unprofessional and rude. I had to go out and buy another luggage piece to travel home with.

Flight was delayed - no reason given.  This delay caused me to miss my connecting flight in Chicago.  The end result is that I was delayed by 24 hours in reaching my destination and ultimately my luggage was lost. Here it is Saturday and I am in Singapore wearing the same clothes that I was wearing in Harrisburg on Wednesday morning.

My spouse was next up on the upgrade list, which I paid for with my miles, but the gate failed to process upgrades and cabin staff would not allow him to be moved up.   So, the 1st class seat next to me flew empty, and yet I paid miles for this segment and he was next on list and entitled to it.
There were three dogs on my flight that sat on their owners lap during the flight. I’m allergic to dogs and given the close quarters it was a miserable flight.
Food is very bad.
Attendant doing the speaking was poor.  Bad sounding voice.  Could not understand her.  Even when askedto do over.  Do not have do that speaking part again.  Also noticed how unkept she looked.

The boarding at psp was chaotic  .     The boarding at psp was chaotic. Announced people with disabilities to board which several did. Then allowed several people who were without kids or disabilities to board, then announced for kids under 2. Never announced for global services. I think it was a new not well trained gate person,
food is BAD

Baggage handling is terrible.  My Rimowa aluminum suitcase was damaged, with one of the wheels broken.  The rivet was pulled out due to a very hard impact.  United handles baggage roughly.  This needs to be improved.
the plane was 6 hours late leaving tulsa.  Missed connections to frankfort and then to Kiev. My baggage is still lost.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: This time I was not happy/ pleased with the crew serving us on board... a bit surprising.. they were not prompt to serve our meals around seats 1L and my wife was sitting on 1K. Missed our requests multiple times. Pretty disappointed with the Polaris business service this time on the flight.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Flight crew did not seem to care about tending to passengers. There a bothersome (loud talking, standing in the aisle, smelly food, ect.) group of passengers that were flying together, and the crew did nothing to help. It was a 15hr flight and I could not get rest because of their poor behavior, and these seats were next to where the crew sits. I did get my vegetarian meal, but they didn't care to pay attention and also give me the vegetarian snack. So that food went to waste. When ever I spoke to a crew member, they seemed unhappy that I was talking with them.

The flight attendants must be much more polite and customer oriented. In my case, the flight attendant who was not good was an asian-american woman. The other flight attendant, a guy (african-american) was very good, instead.

I became accustomed to having a priority tag on my luggage and getting it early. It was a very long wait for my luggage without that tag.  Also the line for group 2 at the gate in Sarasota was all over the place.  it was not clear where to stand and it broke off into 2 lines in a Y shape.
baggage delivery took a long time and putting a restaurant in the middle of the corridor leading to and from the gate makes getting to and from the gate very difficult and was a dumb idea.
We sat in economy. I understand the tight spacing, it’s what I paid for. The seats are ridiculously uncomfortable. Small is fine, why so hard?

Overall everything went fine for me this time around. I was a bit frustrated with the flight out of IND being delayed the day before causing me to miss my connection. The staff were friendly and offered me a flight the next day, but still it is always disappointing when getting to the airport and having to go back home.

My main flight attendant was an older lady (Caucasian) and she was quite rude. It may have been me that rubbed her the wrong way but she "accidentally" skipped me for drink service, and then was rude to me every time I asked for anything.  So rude in fact that I was uncomfortable asking her for help with the headphone jack issue.   Maybe she was just having a bad day - it IS a long flight, but it was probably amplified to me since I was right behind business class and I was watching a family being treated extremely well and It made her attitude blaringly obvious that she did not care for me.

Woman seated next to me had a dog on her lap she claimed was hypoallergenic, but I had a severe reaction. I am not clear on the protocol for allowing pets to be brought on board but it is unacceptable as they are a real health risk. The seat and surrounding area were also very unclean and there were discarded wrappers on the ground when we first boarded. I am extremely disappointed with the conditions of our travel overall, and have been equally disappointed on previous occasions. I will be making a conscious effort to take other airlines going forward.
The updates about this delay were not timely or clear. The confusion was unnecessary and forced passengers to stay at the gate just to understand what was happening.
The communication around the delays were very poor. Gate agents were rude to several passengers.

Why, oh, why can't you have food that is edible?  It has consistently gotten worse.  The attendant does not have to tell up what is available as it is always the same going and coming.  Have your top executives ever considered flying where the majority of people fly to see how unacceptable it is???????

I was forced by the gate agent to gate check my carry-on suitcase. I then sat in my seat on the plane and stopped counting after I saw 10 people bring carry-on bags bigger than mine on to the plane. So at arrival I had to go through the baggage claim pain.

We were originally scheduled to go to San Fransico, but due to mechanical issues of that flight were going to miss connecting flight to San Luis Obispo and no other connecting flight available there.  So after waiting at customer services for 1 hour, was finally rebooked to LA with an eight hr. layover.  Only compensation was 2, $10 vouchers.  Didn't even cover a meal in the LA airport except at Carls Jr.  We are 70 years old and this was not an easy layover for us, plus we were both on antibiotics for bronchitis and a sinus infection and weren't feeling the greatest in the first place.  We tried to see if we could receive some other kind of compensation such as use of your lounge to make our layover easier, and were rudely told no with no consideration for us.  Not to mention that we waited another hour in line at customer services to be treated that way.  Then on top of that, our connecting flight was delayed by a comedy of circumstances that we witnessed by waiting for our flight, which wasn't really very funny but sad.  As a result, we arrived at our destination 8 1/2 hours later than intended to find that our luggage had arrived earlier than we had and that just took extra time in finding what had happened to it.  At least it was there and not lost, but at 12:30 am or like 2:30 am Chicago time where we had originally left, we are still trying to recover from this trip with no help from United Airlines.  The only way I will ever fly United again is if the fare is considerably cheaper than other airlines and I would definitely not recommend it to anyone.

Bags were delivered promptly at baggage claim in San Diego.  I frequently fly out of Charlotte and bags are NEVER returned promptly in Charlotte even if priority tag is on bag.  Charlotte handlers ignore priority tags and provide poor service.   Charlotte needs to learn from San Diego.   In San diego 10 minute wait for bags.  In Charlotte 45 minutes is typical -- ridiculous.

Our carryon luggage was taken from us at the gate because they claimed the bins were full.  There was plenty of room in them when I got on.  After I got on others were allowed to bring theirs on.  In addition we were told they would be first off the plane but they were the last ones off. I had important medical things in the bags and it was very stressful waiting for the carryons.
THe flight attendant was asian and we couldn't understand half of what she was saying and she was the lead attendant. Not sure why you all do that. THe other attendants rarely smiled.

Huge problem at Check-in at BZN airport. We never really  check bags but needed to this time for ski equipment. Total chaos as we waited for printed bag tags. No order as the service agents were overwhelmed and standing in line did not matter. Names were being shouted out based on no system at all. Total shit show!  Luckily we arrived 1.5 hours early and disregarded our friend's advice which was that the "check in at B Z N was a breeze." It also meant nothing that we checked into our flight the day before. In face, that caused even more confusion because many folks thought they were already checked in and did not go to a kiosk. In that case, their name was never called! OMG!

Checking in was a nightmare.  Huge lines as you scheduled all your flights 15 min apart & didn’t have enough staff. then had to wait forever to have names called for bags to be tagged. Traveling with skis which we had no trouble with on our outbound flight but you gave us extreme trouble with on this flight.  Had to pay extra for it.  Makes us want to consider other airlines as we fly to Bozeman at least 6 times a year. Staff was grumpy & unhelpful at check-in.  We have flown your airline at least 4 times within the last year & overall our experiences have been disappointing.

We booked our flight out of Fort Lauderdale specifically to have access to The United Club.  We were NEVER told that it was closed and when we got to the terminal, we were told that there was no room available in the club.  We would've flown out of West Palm Beach had we known this.  We fly United because of our access from Northern New Jersey but think the airline is probably the worst around.

Flight was delayed for 3 hours. Was placed on a different connector flight from ORD to MSP. When I landed in ORD the flight was no longer showing on my united application that i was on the flight. I waited in the line and was told I wasn’t on standby and he added me to standby. I went to the gate and noticed I wasn’t listed on the board on the standby list. The woman at the gate said I wasn’t on it and she added me. Unclear why so much trouble with a connection flight and why two separately individuals couldn’t add me to the flight or a standby list.

Your website does not say when you have to check in your baggage, it only says check in time which you can check in online, we missed our check in baggage time as I had checked our baggage in online and ourselves and we arrived at the gate 30 min before and got told we missed the 45min check in time, we then got rebooked onto the next flight which I was happy was at no charge. Your controls on the flights for direct tv are on the arm rests, this has to be the stupidest spot on the entire plane to put your controls, why did you invest in this idea? Flight attendant shouts at you when handing out water and rubbish.
The stewards especially the older guy and the large woman in the main cabin were rude and made obvious facial expressions expressing their annoyance and impatience for all to see

Airport is terrible, under construction horrible mess, no working elevators and hardly any bathrooms.  Our car seat was nowhere to be found an each united employee told me a different story about where to find it.  Was carrying a lot of bags and 2 children and nobody would help me.

The seat space in coach “class” is horrible. The person in front of me reclined their seat and I could not turn pages in the magazine I was reading while resting it on the tray table. Why must you have seats SO CLOSE together? Flying is stressful enough nowadays. Can’t you make the onboard experience any better? Also, our flight arrived in Newark earlier than expected before a major snowstorm. Instead of getting our luggage to us in a timely fashion, the ground crew was sent out for storm preparations while passengers waited for an hour in baggage claim to retrieve their luggage. Seriously? You had passengers wait to leave the airport so you could do storm preparations? Baffling.

There was a pain experienced when we found out that due to the ticket we purchased that we could not bring on a bag to put in the overhead bins.  The current basic economy fare is a determint.  Find another way.  Also the leg room for a guy who is 6feet 4 inches was uncomfortable.
Way too expensive to pay foe first class and get this crappy commuter plane experience and charge me for wifi. I can get the same experience at Spirit and save 80% of the ticket price.
One hour delay leaving ABQ and luggage was damaged
