I am very disappointed in the pop up united club.  Costs were raised this year and I won’t have s decent club in my home airport for some time.  No soup, no salad at lunch time.  no rest room.  Very disappointing.  We should be getting a credit.
Check in experience was forgetful and chaotic

Yes, several. 1) when Im flying first class (and especially when I’m paying full fare) I’d like to check in with a human rather than a computer 2) Gate agents were not good at controlling boarding. First class passengers board after those who need extra time - which I have no problem with. However, the system is abused. Probably 20% of the aircraft claimed they needed extra time — no questions asked.  I try to play by the rules, but have little patience when the rules are so grossly abused. 3) I sat in the First Class bulkhead next to a man who brought on a 65 lb golden retriever service(!!!) dog. The dog was lovely but this was incredibly unfair to me. The poor dog tried but given her size, she took over all the floor space in from of both seats.  I had to constantly check to see where I could rest my feet, not to mention that the dos shed all over my clothes. You dont allow bags on the floor during take off and landing in the bulkhead for safety reason, but it’s ok to have a dog take up all the floor space??  I love dogs, but the “service dog” accommodations are getting out of control.  If the dog is so large that they need the width of two first class seats the passenger should have to purchase two seats. This is not fair to adjacent passengers!!!!

Airplane smelled horrible. Horrible service at the check in- everyone stood around and I had to ask several times to be helped. NOWHERE on my ticket or online said I would have to pay to check in a bag..would like a refund for the round trip cost to check in my bag.
Flight attendants very nasty! Not friendly at all!
Worst first class cabin I have ever flown in.

Poor customer service when checking in. I almost missed my flight because they did not tell me I didn't have to check my single carry-on baggage. In addition, when they finally told me I did not have to, they kept explaining to me of their reasoning and arguing while I was about to miss my flight. I told the lady I needed to go because I had only ten minutes to get to my gate and she kept blabbering about why I didn't need to check a baggage. And this was my flight from Newark to Minneapolis on Dec. 21, but I can't find the survey for that.
An 18 month old screamer made our trip most unpleasant.  The food choices were terrible!

Your airline is by far the worst! I cringe every time I am booked on your substandard airline that goes for gate agents, FA and aircraft. Oh let’s not forget about the Regioanls, you know the lowest paid and lowest bidders! I await retirement knowing I never have to fly on UAL again
As I said one of the flight attendants was not nice his comments were not right and the seats are extremely uncomfortable

Flight attendant in first class was lazy and disinterested.  There was a line of coach passengers using first class restroom and she refused to address.  I went to bathroom in coach, line was shorter.  Ridiculous.
The seats were very uncomfortable. There was no cushion in the seat
The food was mediocre.  The white wine was bad.

Boarding process in Newark was a fiasco; folks knowingly cutting the line resulting in people shouting at one another, overly emotional persons crying dramatically, unnecessarily and United personnel did nothing to deescalate the situation or correct the wrong.
On time, good service but snacks on offer were disappointing.
Flight Attendants treat passengers as a burden, rude behavior and bossy language.  Way too many PA’s.  737-900 is uncomfortably tight and slim line seats lack comfort.

During my baggage drop, the check in counter was extremely rude to me. It's not abundantly clear that even if you checked in online and paid for your bag, that you have to once again check in at a kiosk and then go to the front desk. I had put my bag on the scale and brought out my boarding pass and ID, and the lady proceeded to ignore me. After 3 customers, I had finally asked her politely how to get my bag. She rudely responded and kept pointing at the monitor like I didn't know how to use a computer. All she had to do was say "even if you've checked in, we still need to to check in at the kiosk" politely, but instead she was very hostile. Even if the check in counter wasn't great, it's not hard to have signs that will indicate to the customer that they must check in at an online kiosk.

Pilot error and stewardess errors compounded to a 16minute delay (took off 4 mins late they said due to lack of UALs foresight) and then they parked the plane wrong twice and had to ask people to sit down again due to premature turn offs (twice) at the chicago gate. Don’t know if people w connections Missed flights; but we were all asked to let them out soon...

Security in Vancouver was extremely slow, unhelpful, U.S. Customs was okay but the computer terminals and lines for a customs officer we're not well organized. On landing at ORD our gate was not vacant, the plane incorrectly misaligned with the jetway all contributing to a further delayed flight and people missing their connections. The baggage was extremely slow getting to the carousel which was as far as possible from where passengers arrive in the baggage area.

This flight was a logistical nightmare. Even the pilots agreed. I feel sorry for the number of people who most likely missed their connecting flights due to errors such as overshooting the jetway. Ridiculous.

Why am I told that I miss the flight when there are one hour prior to the departure. Totally ruin the trip, and I have to spend extra night in Chicago waiting for the connection flight, and this flight was late and kept us waiting before the stopping gate in Chicago. Where are the coordinators? Are you supposed to see the potential conflicts with two aircrafts using the same gate and make arrangement prior to the arrival? We simply wait in the aircraft in dismay. Please make sure the aircraft is officially landed before you call passengers to stand up and get off the plane. It is irresponsible and unacceptable to let us stand up and sit back and forth because of your own working mistake.  And I lost my luggage cover during the flight to Chicago, and the customer service said that they didn’t reimburse for the cover... But there is no denying the fact that you lost it. I flew with Delta using that covered suitcase three times, and each time the cover came with the suitcase. You should really improve your service quality, otherwise, I will never choose United Airlines. 88.

Security held us aside to check my traveling partners luggage, but turns out it was the wrong bag/person - not sure of the screw up.  Also, why can't you have "free TV" on the flights?  Just wanted to watch the flight map, but it wanted a credit card???

A mother and 10+/- year old son were traveling - seated back in the middle of the plane.  The mother came up to use the front restroom.  Her son came with her as well - and proceeded to stand and wait leaning up against the pilot door.  For about 3 minutes - while his mother was in the restroom.  The flight attendants were not in the front of the plane.  Then - the son went into the same restroom - and was in there for at least 10 minutes.  I walked to the rear restroom - and came back.  The son was still in there.  I think the flight attendants noticed now - and then the mother came, knocked on the door - the door opened , she said something - and then the door closed.  The kid came out about 2 minutes later.  The flight attendant looked in, and had to flush the toilet. So - I realize that there is nothing United can do about stupid, clueless passengers. My major complaint is the fact that this kid was waiting - where he is not supposed to be waiting. I don't care that he was only about 10 - or if it's an 80 year old. Security is an important issue to me - and it should be to United and everyone else on that flight.  And the fact that this kid was in the bathroom as long as he was - and he wasn't showing signs of sickness - it just made a few of us nervous.

The seats were very uncomfortable and narrow. There was little leg room. Seats weren't aligned with windows. I'm 5'10" tall and am not overweight. Can't imagine being on this plane for more than 2 hrs.  Really awful seating.
the baggage claim was a disaster
Delay of 4.5 hours in  Chicago was horrible. Why was alternate flight not offered?
Baggage claim in Chicago took over 60 minutes after we landed. Completely unacceptable!
Seating is far too tight and uncomfortable. Seats are much too close together. No leg room, cannot use the tray-table.

The bathroom cleanliness was fine before flight.  It was increasingly disgusting during the flight.  There seemed to be no refreshing of the bathroom during the flight - trash overflowed, floor sticky etc.
SEATS WERE DIRTY WITH FOOD CRUMBS.  FLOOR ALSO DIRTY.

despite landing and arriving at gate early, we had to sit for 30 minutes waiting for someone to move jet bridge over so we could exit the plane.   Shows poor organization and ruins what should have been a good experience (arriving early) - especially when there was no apology from the gate crew.
When arriving in Newark.  We were delayed de-boarding.  There was no one at the gate to drive the bridge to the plane.  Was a 20 minute delay.  That really seems excessive and unnecessary.

no food available for purchase on board and flight attendants impatient and unfriendly during meal and beverage service.  Tray tables very dirty.  Problems with computers in security caused problems but no United representatives in sight or information provided.
The flight attendant from Chicago to Knoxville was very arrogant - never a smile on his face and just unpleasant.

I had selected a seat when I booked the flight and when i went to the airport the seat had been given away.  The agent at the counter was extremely helpful and could see the error but this is unacceptable.

The actual flight attendants were great. Having said that, we had truly one of the worst experiences ever at the gate. Mr Noemio who was checking people in along with another woman(she was wonderful) was beyond rude and verbally aggressive and abusive.  He insisted from the very start that our carry on bag had to be checked because there was no room. It was within the guidelines of size, but was telling us it wasn’t. We were showing him how it fit in the “test” bin. We were being nothing but kind and just trying to understand the reasoning for his anger and actions. We saw other people in front of us walking equal size bags down the jetway. We finally said, can we try and get it on the plane and if not, just gate check it like others do all the time. His response was, “ you think you can be the last few people to board the plane and do what you want”. I was shocked and now furious with his obvious abuse of whatever power he possessed. He printed out a bag tag and wanted our bag. We refused to give it to him and asked for a manager. At that point, the woman who was working alongside, told us to grab our bags and come with her. We got to the plane, boarded and found ample space to put our bags. After doing this, I walked back to the front of the plane because I saw Mr Noemio talking to the flight attendants. I asked if there was a problem. He was now grilling the man that gate checks bags at bottom of the jetway. I informed him that there was ample space for our bags and more. He continued to be extremely obnoxious, to both myself and the man gate checking. When I asked for his name he first refused. I stepped off the plane and had to visually look at his tag. We fly 12-15 times a year and have NEVER experienced anything like this before. Being the last United Airlines employee the customers see before boarding, Mr Noemio is setting a terrible precedent and image of what we think is a wonderful airline. If it’s my company, Mr Noemio is either terminated or working in a department that doesn’t interact with customers. He is damaging your brand.
Holders at back of seats are too narrow to hold anything of substance.  You are extremely stingy with snacks and drinks.  You lost my suitcase.  Seat spacing is ridiculously small.

This leg was our return from Tampa.   Had you asked me about the leg from Newark to Tampa...United Flunked!! AWFULL!!  Why didn't you ask me about that leg on 12/28???  Bathroom did not work. We were forced to go to rear of plane. Water leaking into First Class Cabin from Bathroom.   Most glasses and products fell on the floor during take off (unsecured), making horrible crashing, glass breaking sound, 3 times.  No food. Snacks that were SUBPAR.  We had to ask for a snack box from coach.  I PAID 1,700 plus for 2 tickets. NOT WORTH IT.  United Airlines product is substandard.    I AM VERY DISATISFIED with UNITED
Was not happy I Had to pay for wi fi.
Checking in was painfully slow. There were 2 people doing the job of one and not doing it efficiently.
Check in at Sarasota Airport was a nightmare - too few gate agents and no skycap option...would have missed our flight if it took any longer

We were attending a family funeral outside of Newark. Several family members were slated to go out on Thursday -- all on United. With a huge storm coming Thursday, they tried to fly out on Wednesday with us. You actually told them you had no indication of bad weather the next day and that they would have to pay $400 to switch flights. Obviously, you were not telling the truth. And when the storm hit on Thursday, you still had to find new flights for them. So why not just tell customers the truth? (No seats available on Wednesday? Whatever!)

The check in could have had more people taking luggage.  In front of us was a family 3 kids, 3 booster seats.  Only 1 person working, people were getting upset.  As happened on our last trip, out luggage took an earlier flight, and was waiting for us, not on the carousel, at the counter in Burlington, not sure if this is a good thing or a bad thing?
I am a tall man (6'2")  It is not comfortable to sit in economy seating. The seats are far too close together. Also the temperature on the plane was not comfortable.  It was too hot.

newark baggage is the worst even though you put the orange priority stickers on them there is in fact no priority--we all wait an hour--after 10-12 priority bags come out in 15 minutes (then we all wait an hour) TERRIBLE
Worst turbulence I’ve ever had. It was a terrifying flight through a horrific storm.

The meal that was served was very good (Thai Curry), but the snack was horrible (one of the ingredients was "reconstructed turkey ham").  I'd much prefer a whole grain roll and a hunk of cheese to a prefab sandwich.
Aircraft terrible old  Dirty 30-45 minutes for luggage claim made catching connections almost impossible  Agents made NO effort to help get that flight Terrible customer service

My luggage did not make it to Nashville with me. I was told that my luggage would be on a later flight into Nashville and drive all the way back into the airport only to find that my luggage was still in Newark. I’m not happy. It’s day two and there is still no word (nothing has been texted and there is no update on the webpage I was told to visit) on when my luggage will be delivered which is super inconvenient as I have some items in my suitcase that I really need.
The floor was filthy in row 10. Pretzels and what appeared to be rice from a previous flight were not cleaned up. I have photos! Disgusting.

I was charged $150 for a carry on luggage that flew just fine in Southwest and American Airlines... Even though I was in business/first class... Your overly stingy way of screwing over your customers has ensured that I will think twice about ever flying business or first class with United even before I departed. However, this was not the biggest sin.   Upon landing, your baggage claim was a complete mess. It took me nearly 30 minutes to collect my belongings. What part of "Priority" luggage handling is so ambiguous to United? When my luggage did come out, it was a bungled mess with economy class luggage. The nail in the coffin was rude staff. I thought there may have been a mistake with the carousel number so I went to another United carousel just to double check. One of your staff asked me what I am looking for and when I told him my flight number, he treated me as if I'm some sort of an illiterate idiot.  I was mildly annoyed that I was charged $150 at check in. I was upset when my luggage failed to appear. I was infuriated by your rude staff at O'Hare. While I do not remember the staff's name, I can surely remember his face, and United's logo will always remind me of that face.

My main problem with United was the long delay. Aircraft not positioned correctly I assume because of the weather and I understand. There were three date changes that had me walking all around O'hare Airport. I specifically flew United because I was very disappointed in the service I got from American Airlines the last time I flew. I fly three or four times a year and I'm just looking for an airline that will get me to where I want to go and back without delays Etc. Personally I had no problems with the ticket or gate agents or flight attendants. They all seem very professional.
The flight from Chicago is fine, but the trip from John Wayne airport to Chicago was a bad experience.   Do impose excessive penalty, otherwise, people will use other airlines instead.
My baggage was not on my flight.  When it finally did arrive, one of the wheels were broken and the material was torn.
Boarding was very chaotic.  No attempt to use queues

I purchased a brand new perfume bottle in the box(Dolce Gabbana) put it in my check in bag. It was stolen out of my bag. I had no perfume on my trip. This ruin my experience and trust with United. My husband and I traveled first class and I really didn't feel the first class experience. We were disappointed. I will choose another airline next time.

your representatives almost forced us to take with us the checked luggage to terminal 1 after going through customs. Had we done that we would have certainly failed to make the connection. This was the worst united experience I ever had.
The United Club Lounge was sadly very small in Fort Lauderdale.  The attendants at the front lounge were extremely rude.
The aircraft could use  a cleaning. The seat backs in front of us were very dirty, probably caused by some spillage that was not addressed

Our experience has always been great with United. This trip was no different until we arrived in Chicago. I was traveling with a 4-month-old baby and checked a car seat and stroller. I waited an hour for them both to arrive. The stroller came out but there was no car-seat. I talked with an agent who told me it was scanned off the plane and should be there soon. After waiting another hour, I went to get a loaner. Now, after waiting for 2 hours I got a disgusting loaner seat that I am not comfortable placing in the car and driving on icy highways. The car seat is not just a piece of luggage it’s a safety hazard to put my child in that situation. It is unacceptable for something like this to happen and I am going to use a new airline moving forward. To put my family in danger is unacceptable and a car seat should never be lost!

Original flight itinerary connected through IAH. Itinerary was changed to connect through ORD with no notification. This ended up working out, but I wanted to go through IAH to avoid winter weather and was worried about possible delays or cancellations. Please notify passengers when you change their itinerary. This was the second time this happened to me and I am not amused.

no but on the way from Newark to Ithaca you cancelled the flight you said was snow related it was an outright lie no snow you didn't have a crew for the flight. you told us a buss was coming and you would handle the bags another lie we went and got our own bags and waited and waited I had to get to Athens PA. so I had to rent a car that coast me $ 400.00 your airline lied to me more than once and coast me a lot of time and money. NEVER AGAIN WILL I FLY UNITED AIRLINES

There were two gate changes, very far apart in different concourses and with very inadequate seating for passengers.  Looks like passengers are suffering due to new, high-priced restaurants located where gate seating used to be.

No, but I would like to leave a comment from my trip from DC to Chicago. The flight attendant was very rude to me. I purchased an extra seat for my 20 month old because it would have been exhausting to travel from AK to DC and back holding her. I had my daughter in her seat and before take off the attendant (holding a piece of paper) asked if she was a lap child or if I purchased a ticket. This I took offense to. Yes I bought her ticket, and this is something she could have checked without assuming. Second, we had not taken off yet, by daughter was standing up looking out the window. My hands were on her and I was in the process of sitting her down. The same attendant rudely said my daughter could not stand up. I replied I knew that and was in the process of her sitting. Lastly, my daughter and I had fallen asleep. We were not close to descending. She woke me up because my daughter was laying down in the seat without her seat belt on. One, I would have put her buckle on once we were descending. Two, if she were a lap child she WOULD NOT have been in a seat belt, so what was the difference. I felt this attended was very herassing the entire flight.

Could not make the flight on the way to Chicago, went on line and cancelled. Came for my flight home ord-lax to find out that my ticket has been cancelled and had to pay extra $200 to flight three hours later. Extremely disappointed with united personnel and can’t believe that without notice the seat was taken away(even though I paid for it)
Your customer service was poor and my travel agent was lied to multiple times!  Also I was never called with a change and it was a big issue!
Flight attendants were brusque impersonal and not at all helpful

The seat monitors are so insensitive to passenger’s touch that the passenger needs to somewhat ‘punch’ the screen to select a movie. I sat through the entire flight with the person behind me constantly touching the screen to be able to see a movie. This was a major inconvenience throughout the entirety of the flight.
Very late.  Terrible selection of "snacks."  No announcement on gate checked bags upon Chicago arrival.
Very crowded space, no reading light (broken), and unsatisfactory food offerings.
Baggage retrieval was not good and new bag was damaged and TSA damaged some of my GrandDaughters personal effects

We arrived on time after a 2-hour delayed departure.  It then took almost 1 hour to collect our bags at baggage claim.  Not sure what the cause of the delay was, but this seemed totally unreasonable. Co-passengers were all very annoyed and UA had some serious loss of good will with this delay.  It's hard to want to travel UA when things like this happen.
The flight left from a gate which was under construction so there were no seats and not even a functioning PA system. This created a chaotic boarding process

There was no flight to Chicago because there was a delay therefore I had to take a bus from Milwaukee to Chicago which was inconvenient and the bus voucher was obviously cheaper than my flight from Milwaukee to Chicago.

One of the Chinese speaking attendant is very rude.  I don’t remember her name but she is the shorter one and served in business class. She told two young ladies to put luggages up. Those ladies said they can’t reach and ask for help. She replied I can’t reach either and you should just check those bags.  She never asked other attendants to help.  Her tone of voices are really bad.  In mid flight, my husband approached her for an orange if it is available.  She said we are up in 3000+ miles up.  I can only give you whoever we have on board.  Again very bad tone of voice.  Of course we know we can only get what is available. Usually they do have a couple oranges as mid flight snack so we asked.  This is the first time I wrote about unpleasant flight attendant!!

Somehow the quality of the flight went down so fast it was a surprise to me.  Not a good feeling overall at all.  Very bad experience for a well-planned trip that was booked months ago for a business class ticket of almost $3,500.  Yall need to pay attention and find out how to make a total change; otherwise, it will be very disappointing for all of us, since I'm not coming back.

the flight was delayed too and I did not receive anything in return in addition changed loading doors several times with what almost lose the flight I had to run with my daughter in her arms and my spouse had his fractured foot and almost leaves us flight
Good service was poor.  Flavor combinations were unpleasant and quality was poor.

I was booked on the earlier flight but missed my connection due to mechanical. I was supposed to fly First Class but was rebooked 5 hours later in the Economy-Minus area with middle seats. I thought I had purchased First Class ticket but was informed that I had purchased a flight specific upgrade, which I missed because of United. Had I known that I was buying an upgrade and not a First class ticket I would have done the later and purchased a First Class ticket. Although several people were upgraded my family was not. The entire experience left me feeling that I had been a victim of a Bait and Switch Scam. Even though I live in Houston and I am forced to fly United sometimes I will, whenever possible, try and fly another carrier.

Delayed flight (#4948 EWR - IAD) to our connecting flight (#208 IAD - LAX) caused stress and anxiety. To start off, no one on the outbound flight was able secure us another direct flight because all knew it would be a very TIGHT squeeze.  When  we landed to connect to our next leg travel, there was no one to assist in our transition - had to have one member of the family run ahead to the new flight (#208 gate D5) while the others waited for the carry-ons.

Aircraft was downgraded and my wife lost her business class seat. Gate agents struggled to accomodate the 16 downgraded passengers and were overwhelmed and extremely rude to downgraded passengers. Boarding time was over an hour and other customers were allowed to board prior to my wife's seat assignment being given. Upon boarding there were no free overhead bins in the economy cabin where my wife was downgraded to. Given we were traveling with a lap infant this was extremely frustrating and could have been prevented should gate agents have worked out downgraded seat assignments prior to boarding lower groups.

After landing almost 3 1/2 hours later than scheduled, our 6 month old son was extremely tired and his ears were bothering him from the air pressure change in the cabin. He had finally fallen asleep and I was carrying him off the aircraft wrapped in my coat. I did not wake him up yet to put him in his own winter coat - as no parent would have when it's a short covered walk into the airport. While exiting the plane, instead of maybe apologizing for the delay or wishing us safe travels home, one of the flight attendants proceeded to chastise me for not covering up my son more and then put her hands on my coat and my child, trying to cover his face I presume. I pulled away and exited the plane. I am completely disturbed by this interaction, and will be taking it to higher ups. I want to make it clear it was the blonde older woman flight attendant who did this, not the younger dark haired flight attendant.    Also, I believe the pilot could have done with some coaching on how to speak to the cabin. When we were preparing to take off, he explained the plane was 3 hours late due to mechanical issues. He then proceeded to say he didn't know what those issues were, but he believed they were fixed. And then he said he actually didn't even know if this was the plane with the mechanical issues. It was almost comical, except for the fact that all of our lives are in his hands. I'm concerned that he wasn't more informed about the plane he was about to fly.
When there was a delay it took more than an hour to get someone to the gate to assist us. This was not acceptable.
Boarding at EWR was chaotic and very disorganized.

Oh hell yes....  Terminal C at EWR, why the hell can't customers pay for alcohol using cash?  I had a delayed flight, and almost nothing available on my card at the end of vacation, facing a 2.5 hour delay and no way to enjoy a fucking cocktail because of your assinine policy.      Your flight delay (due to equipment change) also came with a 1 hour luggage delay causing me to miss the last BART train home and I had to spend an extra $30 (IN CASH since I had nothing else left) to take a shuttle, which I had to wait another HOUR for.  I ended up not getting home  unti 2AM when I should have been home be 11pm.  FUCK YOUR AIRLINE AND YOUR GOD DAMN SHITTY SERVICE   I WILL NEVER FLY YOUR SHIT AIRLINE AGAIN.   GO FUCK YOURSELVES, EVERY LAST ONE OF YOU SUCKS SHIT

The most frustrating thing was that we sat for several hours not even knowing whether our flight was going to be cancelled entirely.  This was an almost 4 hour delay, and the second substantial delay I’ve experienced for this leg (which I fly regularly for business) in just a few weeks time.
Terribly delayed with no explanation from anyone.

1. Why are there no lanes in Boston? What good is it being in group 1 or 2 when there is no control set up for how people board? It was chaos. I was in group 2 row 11C, and I still had to go back to the exit row to stow my roller and then fight my way back up to my seat. Poor boarding process.
Make all seats non reclining...Not necessary and annoying to the person sitting behind the reclined seat. Seriously, you no longer need reclining seats!!!!

Flight was significantly delayed with very poor communication about the delay. Unusual and unexpected lines at the airport to get through security, about an hour. Rude and disorganized service checking our bag and asking questions about our flight and security.

The constant delays announced were a problem. Saying we were rescheduled to leave at 7:00 pm when the replace plane was not scheduled to arrive until 6:58 was just wrong. To deplane passengers, ready the plane with a new crew, and board new passengers in 2 minutes is just not realistic. It just served to further frustrate waiting passengers. This has happened to me on United before with hours of delay because of "mechanical problems" with a plane and a different on had to be brought in. Plus the waiting area at Gates B 21, 22, 23 was cold as hell.

We had a tight connection in Chicago afterward because it didn’t seem like the scheduling took de-icing and tarmac traffic into account.   The flight arrived late and then small calamities caused the flight to become extra late. We had a very stressful flight as we had few options of the flight plan hadn’t succeeded.

WHERE IS MY BAG??!!! I checked in business class/premier 2 hrs ahead of time AND YET YOU FAILED TO PLACE MY SKI BAG ON THE PLANE. IT'S NOW ALMOST 3 DAYS LATER & STILL NO BAG AND ZERO UPDATED DESPITE THAT I IMMEDIATELY REORTED IT MISSING (AND YOU ALSO ACKNOWLEDGED THAT YOU FAILED TO PLACE IT ON THE PLANE!! NOT EVEN AN UPDATE -- REALLY??!! And when I called you on the 4th you kept me hold for an hour and promised to call back and NEVER DID!!!
You need to provide a few inches more leg room in economy to people who must travel more than 4 hours.  It's just unhealthy.
So disappointed that the plane was not lutansa which flies with more upscale services and food

United has the least leg room of any airline I've flown on lately. Additionally, once we got to the baggage claim, we waited almost 40mins for our bags, which were it Alaska, we would've received a free flight for the inconvenience and poor service. Finally, the flight attendants didn't announce the change in the menu of the fact that they were out of the majority of the items, so I didn't get dinner and arrived in Chicago with low blood sugar and tired.

I got to gate and was forced to check my carry on because I was told there was no more overhead space. Bag was taken from me. I got to my seat and there were many empty overhead bins all around me.On arrival in Newark no one announced carousel for bag pick up; we were all searching the huge Carousel areA; our flight was not on any carousel board. A half hour later only a handful of bags came out of the chute! Found a luggage rep, showed him my receipts. He told me my bags would be coming out several different chutes! WHY????? After traveling all day I was in No mood to play a “Find your bag” game. Just rude! Bad customer service. After at least 45 minutes of running around the baggage claim area my bags arrived on two different carousels! Ridiculous!
Fuck you

Your operations blew this one.  Big-time.  Not only did you deliver passengers nearly 5 hours late to Jacksonville, but you did so in the middle of the night, placing EVERYONE at risk.  Shameful behavior.  You risked my health (fatigue and lack of rest), my safety (requiring me to drive one plus hour between 2am and 3:15am while fatigued), my professional business (impairing my ability to function in my work).  Really sad.
Flight attendants were extremely rude,I can tell they don’t like their job. It’s the worse experience we ever had!
We found that one of bag was teared/ destroyed at the baggage claim.  It was so horrible. Our new clothing was destroyed. It worth about 2500 dollars altogether

I was really disappointed with the way the delay was handled. I kept checking for an update to the time, I saw that the incoming plane was delayed an hour but my flight still wasn't updated. It wasn't until I was on the way to the airport that the delay was applied to my flight meaning I had to wait in the airport for an hour. We proceeded to get on the plane and had to wait another hour before take off. Better communication through the app and on the plane would have helped.   I was also really disappointed with the baggage claim experience at SFO. There were many open bag claims yet at least 2 flights were being offloaded on our one claim. This delayed the bags, meant there were way too many bags, and had people crowding around. Use your bag claim resources better!

The flight was delayed for two hours for no apparent reason.  After sitting at the gate for an hour we were informed by the captain they were still loading cargo.  We finally departed 2 hours late and arrived 1.75 hours late.  This is an extremely uncomfortable plane.  It was a 2-4-2 configuration.  The seats although leather or faux leather have very little padding.  They barely recline.  My legs were numb before we even took off.  The food was the epitome of airplane food.  Why didn't you sell the boxes?  They are significantly better.  And there was zero urgency to get us off the ground.  Your policy of not giving complimentary upgrades on transcontinental routes stinks and is destroying any brand loyalty that I have remaining.  I am Platinum 1K and frankly I received zero benefit from flying United.

The flight attendant in our area was very nice but I don’t know her name.  The flight attendant we contacted for trying to make our next flight was not helpful at all.  He basically ignored our request

Flight was delayed 2 hours do to aircraft mechanical problem. Landed 30 minutes before my connection to Sydney. Made the flight but my luggage didn’t. Everyone new about our connection no one helped. No one was at the gate to assist or direct us. The Sydney gate was not notified. There was no attempt to rush the luggage, as a meter of fact the aircraft left the gate 10 minutes before the scheduled time

My flight was delayed two hours for no reason (no problems with the plane or weather interference, just basic bad planning again). The wifi was almost non-existent, but by far the worst thing is that you took away the TVs/entertainment systems out from the back of people's seats. Why would you do that? That's the laziest, cheapest decision I've ever seen. You have become the McDonald's of air travel - basic and lowest possible quality. Please bring back the TVs and stop treating your customers like cattle.
I’ll complete the other survey you have in order to explain my complaints
Sadly there were no plug-ins to charge your phone
The flight was very delayed and more updates would have been helpful. The gate agent had to deal with a rude passenger which was unfortunate.

I booked the day before departure an Economy Plus seat, 28K. United changed that in 23K, that was not my order! I was planning to book a business class seat online but that was not possible. At the airport I asked what the extra price would be of a business class seat en they told me that all eats were sold out. But during the flight there were al lot of empty chairs. Price/quality Economy Plus was bad.
Chicago airport transfer signage very poor no info on connecting flights given Ought to provide info on plane
Staff in Newark were rude and not helpful.
Unexplained delays, eventually adding up to 2hrs, with no transparency or explanation. No gate agent was available to ask questions.

My two travel companions and I were very dissatisfied with the United Club. When we entered the room, the staff member behind the desk did advise us that it was a temporary set up.  However, when we went further inside we were beyond disappointed. The set up was certainly not that of the United Club that we are  used to enjoying.  Given our disappointment, we indicated to the staff member there that we did not wish to remain there and asked if we could have our club passes that we just used back. She indicated once your scanned, that's it.  It should be noted that the desk the staff sits at is probably the nicest thing in the room. Given the set up of the room, I am disappointed that you would even be required to use one of your passes. That's how unimpressed we were. And then to learn that we could not be credited additional passes was a huge  disappointment. We unfortunately wast d our time and our passes.

Baggage claim is the worst experience out of all airports I’ve been to.  Had to wait an hour and a half for luggage.  This is not the first time we experienced such a horrible delay getting luggage.  Last time was almost two hours.  I.T takes almost as long to get luggage as I.T did to fly home.  Disgraceful. Frustrating. Horrible.  And there is no one who can help you or knows anything that can help.  Newark rates the worst

ONE BAGGAGE LOST, NOT AT BAGGAGE CLAIM AT FINAL DESTINATION MONTEREY. DURING REVIEW BY ATTENDANT THE MISSING BAG WAS STILL AT DEPARTURE AIRPORT NEWARK. SUBMITTED DELAYED BAGGAGE REPORT #MRY18380M FOR BAG TAG #3016181877. AWAITING RESOLUTION. Also flight attendants responded several times how they have 360 passengers to service and need to wait, appeared as if the work is too much and she was being inconvenienced by our request for a beverage during normal service.

Al three meal entrees had kale featured in the dishes. I know we were going to CA but this was disappointing. Flight attendants lethargic and unresponsive, all in all one of the least enjoyable business class journeys on United.

Hi - When we arrived at the CDG baggage claim one of my bags had a missing wheel. This must have been broken during transit from Newark. The bag is not cheap ($300.00+) and one of the wheels was broken off when we grabbed the bag. Not a pleasant experience.

I witness a passenger who was very disgruntled about a flight attendant apparently threatening him. He clearly was just looking for a fight, but I was disappointed in how the flight attendants handled it. Each seemed to talk down to him, when I feel fairly certain that’s the last thing you want to do in that situation. I realize flight attendants have a rough job, but I did not feel like they had the situation under control.
Baggage destroyed, rude person at gate, no internet in every segment of the trip, and video not working from Ewr to Mxp. Think is enough
Meals were below average. Pasta was severely over cooked and did not taste very good. Croissant was stale (not even marginally fresh).   These part of the experience needs improvement.
There were a lot of kids who were really noisy. They were running but flight attendants did'nt say anything. It was very dangerous.

At counter check-in, the person checking us in seemed frustrated or unconcerned. Seemed to make several errors in printing our boarding passes and did not print boarding passes for our connecting flight in Newark.

I had seat 8c, directly outside the lavatory. The location and design of the bathroom door caused me to frequently experience the disgusting smell of the lavatory throughout the flight. I would suggest modifying the engineering of how the door opens or at least give a warning that the seat directly outside the lavatory may experience this smell. I had a slightly upgraded seat; I would not have paid additional money for the extra leg room had I known I would need to smell the lavatory throughout the entire flight.
Several people on the flight were quite ill. As this is severe flu season, when does the airline limit risk of illness and limit access to the plane to these ill people?
Gate 123 at Newark is horrendous for a large aircraft. You also did a poor job getting the aircraft from terminal B to C, which caused the departure to be about an hour late.
The flight attendents weren’t friendly during serving of food and beverages. When asking a question, they responded very short and annoyed.

You should look into your employee at the gate. With his short temper, he could be dangerous, specially working at the gate. His name was Angel Rodriguez (he refused to give us an employee id number), and the gate number was C123.
chaos with the check in computer... rude stuff (no you dont need a counter).. not working computer (need united stuff at 9from10 computer because they doesent work)...
The delay for the pilots was terrible. We were told 20 minute wait and it turned into an hour and a half

The seats were torturous.  There is no lumbar support, the seat bottom is like sitting on an upholstered brick.  There's no leg room.  The bathrooms are like a phone booth.  You're airline (and the others) have made travel something to endure, not enjoy.  It shouldn't be that way.  And even trying to make reservations is a frustrating experience.  I don't expect any changes, but there isn't another major industry that shows such disregard and disdain for their customers.  I would be out of business if I treated customers half as bad as you do.

No updates from the agent as to why we were delayed.  We had to figure it out for ourselves.  United employees that were also waiting for the flight commented that the gate agent would fail an audit due to lack of attention to the customers.  It seems that United does not care about flying between Milwaukee and Chicago.  I am delayed roughly 50% of the time I take one of these flights.  Others on the flight had the same complaint.  Flight was delayed for two different reasons. The first was waiting on inbound aircraft.  The second was waiting on crew.  How did the second one occur?  Would we have been delayed even if the inbound aircraft were on time?
We were in First Class, and did not have the best service on our flight - rarely did the attendants return to provide us with water/beverages.

luggage claim at SFO was like a zoo. With so many flights arriving at the same time why UA opens only one conveyor? I saw luggages piled up and damaged by the conveyor equipments. BAD management of UA staffs? Or company policy?

It was a very stressful experience to say the least. Even though I made the effort to rush to get to my flight on time my bags did not make it on with me and were subsequently sent with the next flight instead.

Had the worst check-in experience at the airport in Chicago. We looked for a supervisor since we were having issues with our bags and spoke to Joe Cuevas; he was rude and unhelpful. He would use internal terms that only someone who works for the company would understand, he would not let me talk, wouldn’t look at me when he was talking to me and I noticed that he was being completely different to the Caucasian travelers. Had never felt so disrespected and in a way discriminated by an airline employee.

My flight experience was fine, but I saw a situation with another passenger that was sub-par. There was a passenger who needed a wheelchair, and upon landing his daughter asked the flight attendant if there was a wheelchair there to pick him up. The flight attendant just said "I ordered one, but I don't know. Go to the top and ask them." The daughter was a bit flustered, especially because the jet bridge was freezing cold and she didn't want to leave her father who could barely stand there alone while she went up to ask. She asked the flight attendant again if they wouldn't come pick him up, and again the attendant said in a rude tone, "I don't know, I ordered it, and we have to take off again in 15 minutes so just go to the top and ask them." This was incredibly rude service and I felt very bad for this family. I understand that flights were delayed yesterday and she was on a tight schedule, but that does NOT excuse this treatment, especially of a disabled passenger.
I miss Direct TV badly

Why three flights? If I pay 60.00 for my two suitcases, I expect to get them upon my arrival NOT 10 hrs later. My new 135.00 suitcase arrived all scuffed up! Plus you can keep your comfort pkg. it was useless and insulting as I was going home and didn’t need it.
Our luggage was damaged. One was missing a wheel and the others handle was ripped.
The restaurants in the airport did not accept cash. This would stop me using Newark again

I am a 1K United traveler.  I fly on United quite frequently for business, but to be honest I am thinking about switching to an entirely new airline.  For at least the last year, on every United flight I have taken, at least something significant has gone wrong.  The in-seat power was unavailable on this flight, and the food was terrible -- much worse than the usual, which is typically not that great.  Recently I flew on United from Tokyo to New York in Polaris Business First, and my seat didn't function and thus couldn't be moved from sitting to sleeping position except manually, which was very disruptive and inconvenient.  On other flights, the in-flight entertainment screens have been broken or malfunctioning.  And so on, and so on.  I am finding it hard to avoid the conclusion that United's standard of service is slipping badly.  Compared to other airlines within the Star Alliance, it is notably worse in many respects.

3rd flight from EWR to IAH in last 30 days and all had a last minute gate change and a departure delay.  Arrival in Houston for all three flights we landed at the farthest gates in the E terminal from the baggage claim in the C terminal.  You could not logistically make it more difficult or inconvenient on passengers.
Newark facilities very poor, almost a third world standard.

The United terminal in Chicago was atrocious. When we exited the plane there were Cruise moving the seats around in the terminal that we had to walk around. We were at the far end of C terminal. The first restroom I passed was closed for cleaning. The second restroom had wooden boards around it for renovation. The third restroom was also closed for cleaning. I pushed it over and went in so I didn't wet my pants. Inside I was screamed at by two people cleaning the restroom. I told them it didn't work to have both of the restrooms available closed for cleaning at the same time. They told me I should go to the other side or wait until I got to baggage. Rude, inconvenient, and unworkable. Once we got to luggage we had to wait over 15 minutes before the luggage began to arrive. I travel in and out of Chicago regularly and this is one of my worst experiences in the United terminal. Please consider your customers.
The flight was delay 75 minutes and the hate changed 3 times prior with no announcements
The seats were horribly uncomfortable.
Gate changed 4 times. The flight was more than 2 hours delayed with no explanation as to why.

The baggage check in was great. We were traveling with a military person on our reservation and we had no issues checking bags. Unfortunately, the service checking bags on our flight home a few days later was incredibly unprofessional and unpleasant. The woman with blond hair and a blue outfit working at St. Louis Airport at about 8am was rude and dismissive of our military member and his service. She fought an argued that he should not exercise his baggage perks offered by United. She commented that his use of the baggage policy was an abuse and not right. It's shocking that a United employee would so openly denigrate the American military. What's worse, she began to question our personal associations with one another in the most unprofessional way imaginable. She was angry that our group may not have been the military members dependents to which one of her coworkers (an Italian woman who was AWESOME!) said that it was inappropriate to even ask (it IS inappropriate to ask). The angry woman then blurted out, "What? Are they married or something?" in a violent and dismissive way. Now, while none of our party is gay, what right does a United employee have to be so probing and nasty about men who may be in a relationship with one another? The baggage check in process was completely unacceptable in St. Louis (it was great in Newark). By the way, this is to say nothing of the fact that I booked with a United credit card which entitles me and a guest to a free checked bag. The angry woman couldn't even get to that fact because she was too busy denigrating our military. Absolutely unacceptable and totally insulting.
the flight attendants could only be described as surly.  One bashed a cart into my knee and instead of saying sorry blamed the cart designers!

We were very disappointed in our way back to FFL.For some reason when we were ready to  embark they sent us to another area because we have small carry on (which never paid  for it before) In that are a very unprofessional  lady said to us that we have to paid $60.00 for each carry one  or you lose the flight.To avoid losing the flight we ended paid $120.00 por for two small carry ons.  On top of that, at the arrival at midnight the luggage took 45 minutes to get into the conveyor. We are senior citizen couple and frequent flyer. We hope with these unpleasant experiences the company will take necessary steps to correct this kind of problems. kind of problems
I had a carry on bag that was within the restrictions and yet they gate checked it. so I was not happy I had to wait for my luggage.
I had to put my cello under but it did not get on the same flight with me. And now I'm still waiting for it to deliver to me. This is simply unacceptable.
There was no advance notice given to me about the delay prior to my arrival at the airport. I was given updates on every flight to Anchorage bot none on my return trilp to florida.
Flight attendance were very rude and forceful with customers on board.

It was extremely hot on the airplane making the flight very uncomfortable and already upsetting that we had major delays and missed flight making our arrival to New Orleans 10 hours later than originally expected

The flight attendant, named BB,  seemed overly concerned about redirecting blame from herself and the pilot.  She offered complementary alcoholic beverages as a consolation to passengers which was a poor choice for non-drinkers and not an option for youth aboard the flight.

The flight attendants were particularly bad: (1) The dinner portions size was too small. I asked if I could have an extra dinner roll and the attendant gave me a surprised look, said she would look for one later and never came back with any  (2) Wine and beer were complimentary. I had one wine and when I asked for a second one, the (other) air hostess simply stared at me and went on without giving me a second one and without any explanation (3) The second air hostess was particularly rude in the way she was talking to other passengers. Her demeanor was also absolutely not friendly.

Our car seats were never put on the plane. They were checked at the same time as our bags which made it just fine. Now there is a snowstorm and all flights are cancelled and I am without my car seats for possibly several more days. I had no connections and no reason why they did not make it on the plane. We arrived at our destination at 1 am and this added another 30 minutes to our time getting home due to having to wait on line to report the lost bags. This was so unfair to the 5 and 2 year old owners of said car seats!!!
The flight attendants weren’t nice. They didn’t smile or say anything they looked angry
Rarely have the opportunity to fly first class, service was awful less than economy. Unacceptable! Other than a comfortable seat I wouldn’t waste my money. Extremely disappointed.

Gate change occurred.  I was not notified via text, email or anything.  The new gate was a far distance from the original gate and had little time to get there.  I made to the gate on time, but was uncomfortable after having to carry all my luggage and running to the gate.  Not to mention the stress.

We were initially notified of the 3+ hour delay only about 25 minutes before flight departure.  This was due to a flight crew member that did not arrive because she was stuck on another flight that had been delayed.  This was obviously known ahead of time, more than merely 30 minutes before our departure.  The delay should have been communicated to us at least an hour in advance to help us manage our expectations so that we can plan accordingly.  We had one-time Club Passes that we had used and left the lounge to get to the gate in time for departure, only to find out a few minute after we arrived that we could have stayed in the lounge for much longer.  Also, it turned out to be a 4 hour 36 minute total delay. An apology directly from the flight crew member who was late (even if it wasn't her fault) would have gone a long way.  Aside from those issues, everyone else did what they could to make this delay more bearable.

was forced to check my bag upon boarding the aircraft, then once on and being seated noticed there was plenty of room for my bag. attendant said my bag would be at baggage claim #7 only that was incorrect information as it was actually baggage claim #4...this incorrect information caused me to miss my shuttle service and had a further delay of over 45 mins to get to my vehicle. it was a very frustrating experience.
The Club situation is bad and the plane is bad.  The video screen is tiny.  There are no outlets for personal devices.  Catch up with the industry.
It was a death in my family. And they don’t do barevement flights

A woman at the desk was very rude to me when I was about to board, repeatedly ignoring my question about what time boarding would end. Then as I was boarding, she checked my carryon, saying there was no room for it on the plane, which I saw to be untrue upon boarding. After arriving, it took me and a few other passengers over an hour of waiting to get our luggage from the carousel. It was after midnight and PBI was not busy at all. No idea why it would take so long. The staff seemed very disorganized and started to bring us to another location to get our luggage, but then sent us back to the carousel.

I was very upset as I ordered a gluten free meal, and double checked at airport that they had put in the request to which I was told yes  Then to my disappointment I was told onboard by a flight attendant that they have no record of a gf meal for myself So when the meal came out I was offered yoghurt, salad and some sort of tuna sashimi (I don’t eat seafood) the on second meal I was offered a second pot of yougurt  I was so angry and upset that such a simple request of a gluten free meal was ignored and I went without any sort of real food for over 7 hours It’s an utter disgrace
The attendant at the gate was very rude, my bag was covered in snow, and the plane was way too small.
On both the outward and inbound flights we had a suitcase badly damaged with no explanation or apology.  I feel that this is very poor.
my bag arrived in Brazil completely broken, I took pictures, where I send
Seat was disgusting, trash in seatback pocket and along the sides of the seat.

We had no food for a very long time, due to flight delay in Moline and no food available in Moline. No real food available on flight as it was late night flight. The "snack box" for purchase was expensive and terrible. Really, nothing but salt and sugar. Lack of any food was a big discomfort, particularly after racing to make the flight due to prior flight delay.

The lady flight attendant on our flight had horrible manners. I left my phone inside the airport and she said I wasn't able to get it in a VERY rude manner. She was not apologetic, she did not show concern, only attitude and hatefulness. Not to mention we sat on the aircraft for 20+ minutes without moving from the gate after I requested to get my phone. She still wouldn't ask the captain if I could grab it. Then when I was getting off the air craft, I looked down instead of making eye contact with her because I was upset and my husband was behind me and saw her staring at me and laughing with a smirk while shaking her head. (He wasn't sitting with me so she didn't know it was my husband). There was no reason for her to be so rude to me - I just asked her for help. Also, My crying daughter was in the row of seats next to me and wanted to sit on my lap and they made her get into her own seat, only to sit there for 20+ minutes. Several other nearby passengers saw this behavior as well and were upset. It was bad enough that my salesforce business phone is in chicago with no way for me to get ahold of someone and she wouldn't help me in any way...but her being hateful just spoiled the trip for us all. Very unnecessary.

While the plane landed in Chicago and passengers were still waiting to be let out of the plane, the food service company opened the back door to do their business which in my opinion was not thoughtful towards customers as it was negative degree outside and the temperature inside the plane dropped drasticaly.

You lost our luggage and no help finding it. We had all our things in it and had to go out and buy clothes. The system does not show our baggage but at the airport I was told it was in Chicago and missed connection, that was over 30 hrs ago and not contact from United. All automated and can’t talk to anyone 😡

Treated poorly by the staff on the ground, one guy allowed every other group to carry 2 sets of bags till group 4 and just decided that he wouldn't allow anyone in group 4 to carry any bags inside. I had gone to india for a family emergency, and just carried my carry on which was possibly the smallest size. I mentioned to the person i dont have any checked in bag, and need to leave early as soon as i land. The person was totally unapologetic and said i am sorry but it needs to go as checked in bag. The worse part is there were a lot of empty lofts when i entered the plane, how dumb can one be with such blissfull approach on a 14 hr flight. I had to waste time in baggage claim before i could hurry out. In my last 15 years with united,  i never felt so insulted and insinuated.
Check your outlet before each flight.  With no power, one can't access the entertainment.

yes, please call me at 5633496791 because this survey cannot convey the specifics and emotions felt from the incompetence to have a plane available, completely aware of this early on and yet utter failure in notifying us. we paid for 1st class but received none of the amenities and were herded up like 2nd class. you cost us precious time and money. and of course there is no live person to talk to. phx has no customer service desk and there is no number to call but rather after the fact when it's too late we need to spend more time filling out online forms to submit to consumer relations. hell, you even screwed up our flight on 12/24 to phx. if you really want to improve talk to your customers. call me

I was slightly unhappy with my attempts to upgrade my flight.  For days I was attempting to upgrade to first class.  Apparently no tickets were available.  Even at check in, no seats available.  At the gate there were indeed two seats in first available.  I attempted to purchase one of them and was told it was too late to purchase them.  How does this work exactly?

This was a horrible travel experience. We had to drive two hours in the night to transfer airports to then add an additional connection on to our flights because of a total catastrophe of planning on behalf of your flight coordination and schedules. Then after being put out for over 12 hours and jeopardizing my career, United left my luggage in Chicago which made me have to rearrange my schedule again... Horrible, horrible experience.

We had to wait on the plane at the gate for over 30 mins because no other crew was at the gate and there was another plane there.  This delay caused further delays with my morning make me late for my first scheduled meeting.
nope, best among recent 5 years trip
We were away from gate Before departure it took 45 minutes but NO ANNOUNCEMENT by pilot or attendant

Flight attendant who went to the bathroom before me could have emptied out the over flowing trash, but did not. It was hard to shove more paper towels into the overflowing bin. Also why aren’t tray tables and walls of the airplane inspected and cleaned? I always find stains on everything which is very disgusting.
Flight attendance was rude and not very safe.
Some employees by the gate are not very respectful and or rude. I have experienced it 2ce in the past.

Not being able to check in online ahead of time with the new United Economy level is horrible.  We are forced to stand in giant lines so someone can look at our bags before we can get a boarding pass. I understand that more $$ means more perks, but this is a penalty to the lower fare people - not a perk to the higher fare people.  Despite years of good service with United, now being treated as if anyone who wants a low-cost ticket is a thief has ruined by opinion of United.   Also, it is ridiculous that my TSA precheck extends to all people on my itinerary except my 13 year old son - especially since he was the only one with the same surname as me.
Customer service is so poor, that you drive customers away.

The check in process is ridiculous. It makes no sense that it should take longer to not check a bag than it does to check one. There was a severe shortage of staff to check people in at O'Hare. I agree that people should be discouraged from taking large amounts of belongings on the plane, but you're punishing the wrong group. (Those who are traveling without the heavy, time consuming bags.) It hurts me to write this, but Spirit does it better. Let us print the boarding passes at home and go straight to the gate; have some sort of receipt for those who paid for the bags. Or just hire an army of attendants who can check people in quickly at the airport. Many people were more frustrated than me. I'll fly again, but airports are already painful. I use TSA precheck and travel light to avoid hassles and make life as smooth as possible. United now has a reputation for doing the opposite. You should think about that.
Pre=TSA was very disorganized.  The Pre TSA line was backed up because there was no one to check four bags pulled out to be inspected.
Since you have enacted the new fare system, I did not get miles for my last flight.  This is so unfair.   So I will not be flying United anymore for many reasons.

Yes - I know it is probably too late to report as we left the airport really quickly (some people were expecting us), but we had 2 suitcases damaged - of which one the retractable handle is completely broken and unusable.  The retractable handle on the 2nd suitcase is also damaged - still usable but bent and difficult to pull out and bring down.  I understand that we can expect damages to the suitcases, but the handles??? Thank you for reading.  But the whole trip was fine - on time all over.

What's the scam with the Explorer card? I paid for my ticket with my card, and then required to pay a baggage fee, because my wife is the primary cardholder!!  Unless I am rebated the fee, I'm cutting up my card and sending it back.  Eric Stuhlmann

The check-in in Chicago was understaffed. We were checking a car seat and the girl behind the counter had no idea it was no charge and attempted just twice before doing something else to get clarification from someone else. She eventually completely ignoring us so We ended up having to pay the baggage fee for my daughters car seat.

I use United for 99% of my travel, it is convenient but the aircrafts are not clean.   Seats are not properly clean, windows (inside) are dirty, finger marks, etc.   I always find trash on the pocket and there are almost always crumbs on the trays; it is really gross.    I now travel with disinfecting wipes.

I had to stand there and watch one of your employees at Houston check in yell at me, in front of witnesses, for asking a basic question. I watched another one of your staff be so harsh with a girl who accidentally missed her flight that she broke down crying. The same staff member ended up being our guest service agent and held up her hand to us and told us to stop talking when we tried to explain the situation about our FOURTH canceled flight.
Interior of plane is worn and dirty. Being in first class, every surface was dirty and grimy. Need to clean better.

Flight was 5 hours late and we missed our connection. Weather was good in Chicago but plane problems caused our incoming plane to come in late. Every time we fly United we have an issue. We left a 2 1/2 hour layover but still missed our connection and had to rebook. Very annoying , no one gave us an explanation why the plane was late.
In my seat area there was no USB charging ports and i’ upset about that

Checking by boarding groups was not very clear at all. Once we were on the flight attendant did not explain how to use the electrical services on the plane. I understand that you have first class flyers but the attendants were very rude about using the bathroom up there.
hate the new ergonomic seat.  They are not as comfortable as the old seats.

Flight was good.  I hate the airport experience.   Lounge is good but security is a pain even with pre. I particularly hate losing site of my items while I’m backed up to walk through scanner and they pile up at he other end with a crowd jostling and bumping my computer.
The  way the A320 was set up was terrible and cramped.Im sure it was just as difficult for the stewards

Check in gentleman at mco was NOT customer friendly. He berated me for making a mistake while using self check in. He never put a priority sticker on my luggage. I was flying first class. His attitude was disgraceful. Choice of food in first class was sub par. Especially considering it should have been a lunch. I got 8 grapes 1 strawberry 2 pieces of cheese 1 pack of crackers and 1 square of ghiradelli chocolate.  This selection should have been more equal to the chicken cucus offered. It was so tiny. Baggage was put on same carousel as another flight that came in same time. Plenty of others carousels not being used.  Took 50 from landing to getting bag. Not acceptable.

I needed to get the ticket for my 6 year old grandson at the desk. I already had my ticket. The person I dealt with didn’t listen to me nor look at the confirmation number that I tried to show her for my granson’s ticket, but instead reissued my ticket. Then she charged me $35 for the second checked bag. (I had paid for mine online.) Rather than charging $25 for my grandson’s. She wouldn’t listen to my concerns but insisted it was a higher charge for the second bag. That was when I realized I still did not have my grandson’s ticket which explained her insistence on extra cost for the second bag. She gave me my grandson’s ticket and I reminded her she overcharged for the bag. She gave me a card with a number and said they would work it out. There was absolutely no one waiting so I am not sure why she did not take care of it. Then I tried the telephone number and the recording said it would take more that 30 minutes, so I went through security and tried the number again. I was on hold for over 40 minutes and had to hang up to get on the plane. It’s not the money so much as not having someone listen to me from start to finish and then to be passed off to a phone number to take care of my complaint. She was very unprofessional and I am not happy about it.

We waited at the airport for 5 additional hours (7.5 hours total) because a plane coming in was late.  The weather was bad in some regions, but our plane was come from Montana.  No bad weather.  So we had no idea WHY we had to wait and cut our vacation by so much???   Very unhappy with this experience.  I tried to stay at the United Club but only had 1 ticket for entry.  My wife and daughter were with me and they would not be accepted at the United Club, even though we were delayed.  Very unhappy.  I then paid for an upgrade so my wife and daughter could sit in biz class.  That was the least I could do for them for the 5.5 extra hour wait.  Not Happy!!!!

Paid for first class seats. Asked what I would like to eat and gave my choice. Attendant came back to us first and said there wasn’t enough and would one of us switch to the other option.  This is the second time this has happened to me. I could understand if we used miles to upgrade or to fly but that was t the case. We PAID for first class. Why wouldn’t you make sure of what you have available before offering it to everyone.  VERY disappointed. Next time I’ll bring my own food even when f I am in first class this way I have something that I will at least like.

I was incredibly dissatisfied with the attentiveness of the flight staff.  I was in a window seat, with two sleeping passengers blocking my way to the aisle.  I rang my service button 15 times in a hour and was never visited by a flight attendant. I had medicine to take, and was without water. To add to the frustration, i could see the attendants standing in the galley chatting with each other, and apparently ingnoring my calls.  I can also confirm that my service light and bell sounds were in fact working.  I was/am extremely angry over this.

I had recently had surgery and had problems with getting wheelchairs waiting for me when I was getting off the plane.  I checked at the beginning of each flight and things were set up but when we got of the plane we had to wait for a chair.  This was my only complaint.
The flight was delayed and the plane size denied us the ability to bring on carry-on items, which exacerbated the delay in Chicago in trying to get across the airport to my connecting flight.
I would prefer lower travel fares so we could fly out of Columbia more often instead of having to go to another city to use a carrier with lower fares.

Nobody. Not one single employee who works for Lufthansa or United knows what the hell they are doing. They are ALL rude. We even had one Supervisor in Frankfurt curse us “Americans” right to our face!! Never in my life have I experienced such incompetence!!

You really need to work on the food situation.  I know I was bumped up but I was at the top name on the the bump up to first class list, and in my mind, that meant I had priority over others.  I understand hat I cannot always get my first choice when it comes to the meal but  then they offered me something from the economy section. I asked for the chicken and then was told the only hot item the plane had was hamburgers.   I felt like we were on a plane that only had leftovers.  It was a terribly disappointing upgrade experience.

During check in, I checked 2 bags: 1 for each passenger. Instead of being charged 1 time fee of 50$, the agent charged my card 3 separate transactions of 50$, which totaled $150. Very inconvenient because that was all my money and I was unable to purchase items from the airport and aircraft.

My husband gave me his upgrade to business (very nice of him!). My only complaint is that the only meal available had chicken, shrimp, AND sausage in it!! You should always have plentiful vegetarian options available. I was not the only passenger who was disappointed (at least 3 others I heard complain).

Departure gate was changed several times, all changes we in the same area. No big problem, but makes it seem tat no one knew what was going on. Two flights departing at same time with announcements added to the confusion.

1) One of 9 bags did not make the flight and was sent on later flight.   As a 1K member, would think that our bags would have priority over non-premier members.  Bag left behind was a ski bag, but saw many other ski bags without premier tags arrive on our flight.  2) My wife's birthday was wrong on her ticket so she did not receive pre-TSA despite the fact the ticket was booked directly from her account using miles.  We had to go back to ticketing agent to figure out what was wrong which took additional time.  Seems this is a system mistake since birthday is correct in her profile.
Took more than an hour to get my bags at o'hare and the boarding process in Mexico City was disorganized and chaotic

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: Very rude flight attendants on this flight.  We fly United all the time and they were the worst crew ever.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: Understandable that United doesn't have control of the gates at the international terminal, but more should've been done behind the scenes to push for a gate. A flight that is scheduled should not have to wait an hour because a delayed flight is still there. The delayed flight should suffer while the scheduled/on time flight should stay on track.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: We had issues with the way the gate agent communicated to my parents that they could not seat in the emergency exit seats due to a language barrier. She was extremely rude almost bringing my mom to tears, she felt scared without really understanding what was happening. The seats were booked over the phone so we didn’t know about the language policy. There are a lot of ways to communicate with passengers and the gate agent wasn’t patient or attentive, just plainly rude, flustered and careless because according to her they were causing a delay to her. They were nothing more than an inconvenience. My only question was if I wasn’t on the flight to help translate and ask the flight attend for help what would had happened? They would had been kicked out since it was a full flight?

The problem was that we waited almost an hour for a gate after landing at O'Hare.  Unacceptable.  We waited 20 minutes after the captain said the gate was now available.  My flight to MSP on the previous day was delayed.  We were de-iced and then waited 35 minutes to push back.  This has become all too common with your regional jets.  You must not have adequate ground crews.  I think I should get my money back for this round trip.  Unnecessary delays on both ends.  The planes are not very comfortable to begin with, then we need to put up with excessive delays.  This is not weather or even mechanical.  This has to be an operations problem.  It's like a lower class of service all around when on an RJ.  It should be the other way.  Your name is on the plane.  I don't get to pick the aircraft.  You need to provide better service to compensate for the discomfort that goes with an RJ.
Waiting 75 minutes on the runway after we landed because they couldn’t get a hold of the grounds crew, after we’ve already been delayed 90 minutes in Minneapolis, is just a bad experience.

The kiosks were not visible because there were so many people in line at check in. People needed to get rerouted as the Neward flight was cancelled, I was waiting in line and would have missed our flight if it wasn't for a United employee who had to announced (using her own voice, no mic) that there were kiosks infront of the people in line. I was able to quickly print my bag tags and boarding passes but with causing a stir amongst the other waiting in line.

Your gate attendant in Ft Lauderdale was appallingly unfriendly. Didn’t even look at me when we spoke. And getting info from you prior to the flight was impossible. I’d been gifted 2 upgrades to first class. Neither worked on either flight and I never found out why or how it works. I tried calling (good luck getting through) and asking at airport (no one knew anything. I just wasn’t being upgraded). Very disappointing.

I sat in economy seat 10D/F to be with my son. The flight attendant was extremely rude to mostly everyone. He started by almost throwing snacks to passengers. Never said sir or madam. I rarely order drinks but I had a coupon which was about to expire. I did not know which order the drinks were served. I presented it to the attendant and he rudely asked “what is this” knowing very well what it was. Then with a glaring look and condescending tone, he said “ don’t you know the drinks come later and I haven’t served anyone yet ?” I made a note of this and complained to the senior attendant. The attendants in business class where my wife sat were very attentive but I have never encountered this sort of rudeness on United flights in the past and am very surprised. It ruined the rest of my flight. I never did get any drinks or any beverages since I did not want to see this person again. I am very disappointed being a 1K member.

It was very frustrating for them not to have the meal that I wanted. I was forced to have a vegetarian meal that was sub par and not what I would consider up to standards for a first class experience.
Flight attendants are not very helpful and often rude. No plugs in seats outside of premium class which is really outdated.

The check in process was worse than the already bad experience we had on the first leg of the trip. You seriously need to invest more resources into ticket agents that can help people at the self check in kiosks. I was in a line with 5 people at one point because the kiosk indicated that I needed an agent to verify our car seats. A much better system needs to be figured out because that poor woman was getting irate customers who had to wait for her to finish assisting some guy who decided to check an oversized television that took 10 minutes to figure out. The girl behind me in line missed her flight because no one else said they could help her but this lady.
Terrible that you get charged a fee for a carry on if u store on above bin your seat

The food was awful, inedible and quite frankly nauseating. We were in first class and while I don’t expect gourmet meals I do expect it be be edible. The chicken was rubbery and the fish was horrible.
