My kids got the pizza and burgers that were served in coach bc they didn’t want the first class choices and the pizza was soggy and the burger didn’t smell like beef and was awful tasting. We flew a competitor on the outbound flight to Maui 10 days earlier and the food was actually good.
Terrible boarding process. Pure chaos.
The overall flight was fine. It was regrettable that it took an hour from landing to arrive to the gate. Poor coordination of gate traffic and the reason I lowered my score for the flight.

My flight was cancelled due to weather but was not notified by email or text. I was at airport to check in and the lady helping could not figure out why my ticket to check bag would not print. As it turned out, the second leg of my flight was cancelled and therefore I had to reschedule my flight for the next day. The second flight was then delayed 4 hours and again I 2as not notified by email or phone. I was signed up for notification. I just don’t understand how it could be missed. The only reason I found out was my son was also on the same flight and he was notified of the cancellation and the delay.

I am appalled by how your staff handled a situation where they had put two passengers in the same seat.  My husband and I were assigned 7A and 7B.  When we entered the aircraft an elderly woman was in 7B and told us that the flight attendant put here there.  Her ticket said 7C.  Unfortunately, 7C was occupied by a mother with two children, one of which had a special needs seat.  We told the flight attendant that they had two passengers with the same seat and it needed to be fixed.  She told us that she needed to speak with the gate agent.  The gate agent arrived and we explained the situation.  We suggested that they put the woman in our seat right in front of us in an unused first class seat (which stayed empty for the entire flight).  She refused and attempted to have me sit apart from my husband.  We again suggested the empty first class seat.  She told me that that was, "outside of her ability." At this time everyone else was on the plane.  The gate agent then proceeded to ask every row if the passengers were flying alone so she could move both my husband and myself.  This was frustrating and time consuming.  We were finally relocated to seats further back on the plane.  No one asked me if I had paid extra for the seats in that section. Luckily I had not, but I found it inappropriate and rude for the gate agent to move us back on the plane without considering how much you charge to sit further up in the plane.  The hour and 20 minute flight was fine, but I am appalled by how your staff acted.  There was no reason the older woman, who needed wheelchair assistance when we landed, couldn't have sat two feet in front of the seat she was in.  Your first class on that flight had at least 3 empty seats.  Your gate agent stated that she herself had changed the seats for the mother (who definitely should have been in the bulkhead seats).  I have worked in customer service for many years.  I know that when you mess up you make things right.  In the future I will be looking for my flights elsewhere.  I don't want to fly with people who make mistakes and are unwilling to fix them without inconveniencing and passing the buck onto others.  A faster and better fix would have been to move the displaced lady to first class.  I still ask myself why that suggestion was treated like such a horrible idea.  I hope if we fly with you in the future your staff will not be so harsh and condescending when they make a mistake.
my luggage was damaged, but your company had prepared themselves how not to help with that. #bad

Awful service. Was ignored multiple times and i had an infant with me and kept being asked to stop her tablet because she doesnt have headphones. How does one out headphones on an infant??? Does United prefer crying babies? Very rude and never before flying united was this and issue till this flight.
The CRJ700 is the worst plane in the sky. Horrible seats, no room. I get stuck on one a couple of times a year and hate it.

I was dissatisfied with the fact that alcoholic beverages apart from wine and beer were not complimentary. Normally I fly either KLM or Delta, and with these airlines, these beverages are complimentary.   Also, the in-screen entertainment was outdated.

When it is below zero outside and you are forced to gate check your carry-on luggage, DO NOT have paying customers stand in the cold waiting for 30 minutes for their bags. Be intelligent and have them wait in the terminal until the bags are ready! Should not be a tough thing to think about, but apparently, your teams are very poorly trained in customer service and dangers of cold temperatures.
The airplane wasn't very clean - bathrooms were a mess. The small screen from the 90s is very hard to see.
The food was terrible! Cold, realkt untasty. The worst I have ever had on a flight!

Once we landed in Chicago we taxi-ed for 35 minutes which was longer than the actual flight time. Neither the pilot nor the flight attendant took the time to announce why we were circling the airport. Only after repeatedly asking did we finally get an update. The extended delay upon arrival would have been less frustrating if there had been any communication from the crew.
My TSA number was not included when I checked in.  Fortunately the airport TSA line was not long, but having gone to the effort of having obtained one, I was discouraged by it not being included.

The flight was cramped and there was no legroom. Add to that the lack of wi-fi entertainment and it was a miserable flight. The cheese and crackers were gone before the flight attendants made it to my row.
The lady hispanic gate attendant at C4 of our 7:00pm flight to ORD from FLL 1/4/18 was very rude a fake know-it-all and racist. She should not be in the position she is doing now.
I connected to Wi-Fi, but connection was very bad, it could not even load google.com
Flight Attendant Service was slow and poor. Meal choices were poor. I can not take Kinwa.
the aircraft was in a very bad shape (very very old). not just that the seats where in all kinds of colors (replacements over the years), the cover of the handle of the emergency door was loose, ...

The flight was delayed due to missing personnel. The flight back was delayed over 6 hrs due to a “missing part”- I switched planes for a later flight and not sure the original flight left. I have increased business travel to Des Moines & frankly I’m trying American next time.
First class service was sup par. Flight attendants were busy chatting with each other the whole flight. Very disappointing.
My husband's luggage was lost.  And on the way down 4 of our 6  bags were lost.  Houston seems to be the issue.
The gate was nearly impossible to find and very far from the gate where I arrived, the plane was incredibly uncomfortable, and United is a terrible airline I will avoid it at all costs in the future.
Got boarded on the wrong plan, they then had to take luggage off the flight and re load it and also redo all the paperwork. After a long day traveling and the money paid this is not acceptable.

The 777 was relatively new and very clean but the seats in economy were uncomfortable for long trips, specifically the bottom cushion and the inability to get the back down more than an inch.  Also the loss of the TV screen movies, music made a long flight even longer.

Sharon at the ticket counter was highly rude and I’m not the type that normally would go to this extent to write a complaint but I’m going to. She treated my wife and I with extreme disrespect, didn’t acknowledge we were there for over 5 minutes, instead she looked at the computer screen. Then when she finally said something all she said was “do you even have money to pay for the bags to be checked” I proceeded to tell her I’m active duty military on orders and my bag fees are waived. She then proceeded to tell me to pull up on the website where it said that.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Actually, the originating flight was the bigger problem, but the survey wouldn't open for that flight.  We were kept on the plane for an additional 75 minutes after landing because 3 separate gates to which we had been assigned were unavailable when we landed. We were told this was due to other planes having mechanical issues that were causing delays. So, instead of towing any of the other aircrafts away to open the gate or sending us a shuttle to deplane and get to the gate, they told us to stay on the plane and wait the extra 75 min after a 6 hour flight, ON CHRISTMAS DAY!!!!!!  People missed connections and some missed Christmas entirely for this absurd reason.
Very very slow for the bags to arrive at baggage claim (I waited more than 90 minutes) -- and the Priority bags did not come out first which was very disappointing.

The plane is particularly old. I have traveled on United to many parts of Asia, and this one to India (BOM) is in disrepair, old and worn out. Bathroom is in disrepair. The seat handle is broken, and put together with scotch tape. The seat cushion is not stable. For a $3000 ticket, this was one of my worst experiences with United, and having flown over 1.5M miles with you, I have to say this was a pretty terrible experience.

The flight was a red eye. Everyone was either sleeping or quietly keeping to themselves. Even the toddler in the seat ahead of me. I was unfortunately seated towards the rear of the plane. This didn’t bother me because I had the intent of sleeping the whole flight. Except I could not because the flight attendants were having loud conversation in the back. The plane was dead silent and all you could hear were those two chatting away having the time of their lives! SO ANNOYING

The electric sockets didn't work at the gate. Also, it's not necessarily limited to United but I hate flying for the simple reason that the seats are so uncomfortable, specifically the headrest. I have tried a variety of solutions and airlines but none seem to work.

my flt was delayed for bad weather and although I do understand this I did not receive a notice regarding this causing me to arrive very early and wait the entire additional five hours it was delayed.

Our connecting flight from Hayden to Denver on 1/3/18 was delayed almost 3 hours b/c of a malfunctioning radio in Denver. The pilot said they did not realize it would take that long to fix. As a result, we missed our Denver to Newark flight on that day by 10 minutes. For the sake of those 10 minutes, we were stranded in Denver until Friday the 5th. We were put up in a Marriott 15 miles away and given $10 each for dinner; both are entirely unacceptable and insufficient. We could only get on a 5:15 am flight on Friday the 5th so we had to stay at the Westin at the airport at our own cost. This was one of my worst flying experiences, and that's saying something. As a Platinum member, I expected more, and I ask for consideration of additional compensation for our troubles, personally and for our both missing two additional days of work. Again, this had nothing to do with the storm. But for a radio-related 3 hour delay, which itself is mind-boggling, we would have been back to NY well before the storm was even close.
i was forced to sit away from my baby children even as flight was half empty
The pilot should warn the passengers if there is turbulence ahead. It was very bad and people were worried

My experience with United on January 3 was horrid.  Announcing the flight was to leave at 5:45 pm (originally scheduled to leave 1:45 pm) and then moving it up to 4:30 pm caused me to miss it and be stuck in Chicago for two days.  Awful policy!  I wasted an entire day in the airport because of your company's poor planning/communication.  United has become my last choice to fly ever again!

Check in system is very confusing as a customer who used basic economy. Getting assistance for checking my bag took a very long time at the kiosks. Also, very displeased with the ticket, as when I purchased the ticket it said carry-on (backpack size) and one small personal item, and I discovered checking in that it was just one personal item for my ticket.

Everyone in the crew were extremely professional and polite. However, we were delayed on the plane by an hour due to a broken down catering truck. I understand things happen, but according to your app the plane had been in Newark since the day before. This is not the first or even the second time one of my flights has been delayed due to having to wait on something (i.e. paperwork, food, etc.) that should have some sort of contingency in place. Or at the least let me sit at the gate instead of cramped in my seat for an extra hour.
cabin needs updated. very disappointing in today's market. i will remember...

I was incredibly disappointed that after less than half of the plane had boarded we had to start checking our bags. That's ridiculous. The flight attendant was also extremely loud and inconsiderate of people sleeping on the 6am flight.

Your Basic Economy carry-on policy is the biggest load of horseshit I've ever experienced flying. I had 1 backpack and 1 duffel bag small enough to fit inside a can of sardines and I had to check one of them at a cost of $25 each way. Who doesn't allow a full-size fucking carry-on? Was this a plane for midgets? And of course that's a detail buried deep on the United site so its not apparent at the time of purchase. This is just a bullshit ploy to advertise the flight as $50 cheaper than it really is - because unless they're a fucking Depression-era hobo, every passenger carries more than one personal item the size of a bag of peanuts on even puddle-jumpers. You're all a bunch of cheap fucks, and you're just nickel-and-diming your passengers. Fuck you and fuck your cheap airline.

The seats are far too close together. This is the only 4hr+ leg we didn’t upgrade seats, and no sooner were we in the air than the person in front of me reclined their seat and jammed my knee. I couldn’t  even sit straight on in the seat without my knees touching the seat in front of me BEFORE it reclined, and neither could anyone else in my row. The only saving grace was that on our side of the aisle there were only two passengers for 3 seats so we each could use legroom from the empty middle. Our smaller aircraft with only two seats/side had quite a bit more space than this large plane. Very disappointing.

While the service was good while on the flight, I was very frustrated with the 5-hour delay. It took longer than anticipated to get off the ground. The flight attendants and crew at the airport were not particularly forthcoming with information about the flight and the delay.

If United continues to use short haul configured aircraft for transcontinental flights while charging premium prices .... It's likely that customer dissatisfaction will grow and demand will decrease.   Especially when such a poor experience is imposed on Mileage Plus Premier customers.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: No decent even snacks or food. No movies or tv for a 5 hour flight and everyone is jammed in

Our flight attendants were awful. We sat in first class and it was difficult to get a glass of champagne. We had zero contact with our flight attendants the last 2 hours of the flight. The row ahead of us had to use the call button to get a drink. Terrible, unfriendly service!!

I had a horrible time waiting for a flight, my plane was supposed to leave at 7:30 a.m. we didn't board the plane until about 1:50 p.m. because of all of the delays I made it there around 6:30 a.m. for my flight, but my flight kept getting delayed and then delayed again this was a horrible experience to have to sit and wait for a plane that didn't come until 5 to 6 hours later I was so tired of waiting I should have made it home around 1:30 p.m. but since I had such a long delay I had to call my job and call off because I was going to make it home too late to go to work and on top of that I was too tired to even go into work late because are such a long delay of sitting around waiting foreflight in the airport because of the long delays this caused me to have to miss work if this is how United Airlines do things then I will not be using United Airlines again

Apart from it being very late to leave EWR, in spite the fact that my bag had Priority tagging, it came very late, much later than ones that did not have Priority tags. Same happened in EWR on the flight from TLV. Took a very long time to come out.
Smooth flight in bad weather

In first class I couldn’t understand the descriptions of the breakfast from the flight attendant because of the background noise and my hearing difficulties. In the end I got a meal I didn’t enjoy. But to me the other meal wasn’t much better. They both were too fancy for my tastes. Even in first class I would rather cereal and fruit.

The irritation came from the carry on bags. I was in boarding section 4, the travelers were told space was tight and that they must put their personal items (backpacks, jackets etc) under the seat in front of them. By the time we boarded we were told there was no more room for carry on bags. They checked my family's 3 bags. As I boarded the plane I was looking in the overhead compartment to see plenty of open spaces along with many backpacks/personal items. I was frustrated that I was inconvenienced, had to modify my pickup arrangements and other personal arrangements because I had to spend extra time going to the baggage claim. I wouldn't have minded this inconvenience, but I felt that the flight attendants did not do an adequate job of getting the passengers to stow their items correctly. I ended up going on the plane with my personal item... a book, when other passengers had a suitcase and a backpack all stowed in the overhead.  Needless to say I was not satisfied as a passenger.
know there was a blizzard as I was diverted on a LHR to EWR flight to Chicago.  I was in this flight to EWR the next day.  The baggage retrieval took more than 90 minutes and was total chaos.

Desk agent helped me to check my baggage through Newark onto another United flight to Hong Kong.  A single baggage claim ticket was provided, with all flights and airports listed.  Baggage did not arrive at final destination (Haneda).  ANA had no record of baggage.  Checked Unitd App, and my second ticket had no record of baggage.  United shows my bags as having arrived at Newark, but after a week in Japan, ANA is still unable to locate my bags.  This is frustrating.

The baggage retrieval was horrible. The originally-assigned carousel was full of bags, which personnel asked the passengers to move from the carousel to make room for more bags. The carousel assignment was then changed three times before we received our bags -- it took 90 minutes.
It is also so frustrating when we arrive early and a gate is unavailable and we end up waiting on board for 30 + minutes.

Baggage claim was another disaster.  We waited for about 1 1/2 hours for our bags--only to be told after that time that the baggage handling equipment was defective, and the bags would be coming--that was after waiting for the bags for over an hour with no information and going to lost baggage--which only had one person handling claims for about 12 people waiting.

I was headed to pick up my 5 year old son who was visiting family over winter break. I absolutely hated that I was two hours late to get him. I know fight errors happen, but this really made for an unfortunate experience for me.
Sat in 5a the seat back in front of me was damaged and the arm rest fold away table took a few attempts to put away. I suspect it is as older plane.
The only vegetarian option in the breakfast menu was yogurt and cut fruits which was not available.  This was extremely disappointing.
Clear lack of communication from the boarding staff The flight kept being delayed and we did not get notified by anouncement nor texts or emails which was really frustrating !!

It was the WORST experience with United in all my years of flying. From checking in, to having to go through two security checkpoints, to not being told our flight was delayed, to waiting over an hour for our luggage — which never came because it was never loaded on to the plane. Since landing Friday morning (1/5/18 @ 10:15am) to this date (1/6/18 @ 8:59pm), we still have not received our luggage. We were told it would be coming yesterday by 5-6pm, and it did not arrive. Then we were told it would be coming this morning, and it did not arrive. And keep in mind, we got no notification that it was not arriving and had to waste a great amount of time calling and waiting to talk to someone each time. Worst experience ever.

Our flight the day before was cancelled, so we were fortunate to get on a flight the next day.  But the flight attendants were condescending and insulting.  And the delay of departure was handled poorly.. no information forthcoming until after sitting there for 45 minutes..very frustrating..then the announcement of a mechanic coming out.. then an announcement that said "oh, I think the engine just fixed itself"   .. that after an announcement at the gate that the plane at the gate may not be the right one... reversed 1 minute later confirming it was the right one.  Just kind of unprofessional and frustrating.
Boarding a free for all. Total chaos. Gate agents incompetent.
There was a delay, due to weather.   It appeared there were some chaos in managing the delay...

We were delayed which was understandable given the weather.  There was only one option for breakfast (the other option already ran out) and that option, which was eggs was terrible.  There also were not enough hot towels for the people in first/business class.  How do you already run out of things for an early morning flight?  Not to mention with the delay, we were on the plane for a long time; no snacks were offered.  Poor service and availability for first/business class.  I also traveled with my Mom; she does not have a computer, iPad or phone; shouldn't assume everyone does; there should be a screen for in flight TV/movies.

The Premier 1K check-in counter at EWR was closed, and the line to check in was so long that we might have missed our flight had other passengers not kindly allowed us to go ahead of them. We checked two bags, and only one was delivered to HNL, and we stil have not been told when the second will arrive.
Checking in was terrible because I was absolute chaos and there were no employees directing people to go which caused more chaos.

preboarding at the gate was disasterous - huge lines that were disturbing other passengers walkway for other gates.  none of the gate agents made announcements as to why the flight boarded almost 35 minutes late.  the flight left 1 hour late.  the gate agent was very arrogant and unfriendly and was being very unfair with passengers carry-ons.  she made her own choices as to who brought carry-ons.  My daughter and I were forced to gate check our carry on eventhough many bags just like mine (even slightly bigger) were allowed on the plane.  the bins on the 777 carrier were largely empty.  many passengers could have put their carry ons on the plane - there was certainly plenty of room.  lastly, my son's checked bag via the regularly check-in was priority check-in never made it with our flight to Chicago.  we were told it was coming on the next flight and that was not the case.  the bag came 2 or 3 flights later and finally made it to the hotel by 11pm that night.  as a long time member of the united frequent flyer program I just keep getting more and more disappointed with your services.  you basically offer nothing more than what your competition offers.  I am seriously considering never using United again and will likely be cancelling my credit cards with you.  I don't think you really should be using the slogan "Friendly Skies" - you are certainly far from being friendly.

issue was that my check in status showed that this flight had been cancelled, but the flight at the same time that it was on time. there was conflicting info from your computer system. i called in and the agent told me the same thing, and told me i would have to find out when i got to the airport -- a rather stressful experience.
I overlooked the bad reputation of layover issues in Chicago when I booked the flight & was burned on a day that had no weather issues

The food continues to be horrible. On this flight, it wasn't a proper lunch/dinner, but instead was an option of 'bacon and eggs' (being well beyond breakfast time) and 'unpronounceable berry pie'. The bacon and eggs was basically slop/inedible. The 'snack' before landing continues to be the execrable 'hot turkey sandwich' but this time, no chips or any condiments. Seriously, I pay $1200 for this excuse for food? Profit-raking, much?

There was at least a 2 hour delay sitting on the plane before being pushed back, and absolutely no information from the pilot or attendants.  I've been a united member for a long time and travel often for business, and this was a terrible experience, and basically ruined one half day in Punta Cana
The first plane had a mechanical failure.

Terrible experience. First, my flight got cancelled. I missed a day of vacation with my friends. We were able to fly out the next morning which got delayed... when we landed we saw that mine and 2 of my other friends luggage’s didn’t make it in the plane. We were told it didn’t fit and would be placed in the next plane. All of our items needed for the trip was in the bag, as we didn’t have a carry on. The next morning came and still no bags.. such a terrible experience and wasted 3 days of vacation.
My baggage did not arrived - wan't able to get a status, don't have my medicine that was inbaggage - worst airline ever
The boarding was disorganized in that particular lower  level gate
Uncomfortable seats    First flight cancelled. Waited 2 hours on phone to talk to someone then disconnected. Paid 1st class rebooked economy and no one to talk to to get reimbursement.
Nope, love United !
When our plane finally did arrive Chicago, emergency equipment was blocking its oath to pull in...added to long wait.

Very dirty seat area and my flight from Newark to Paris had a broken seat button preventing me from reclining the seat. This caused much discomfort. It was reported to the flight attendant, but they were unable to find another open seat.

No FOOD was served for a 9+ hour flight, i had to purchase over priced chips and cookies.   My 3 children were sick and vomited.   Plus I paid over $700 to upgrade and still we got only one cookie from this flight.    This was the worst experience flying with United in 25 years.

Your seats in economy are getting way too narrow and too close together. I can't even fit in regular economy seats anymore, especially on such a long flight, and find myself forced to pay for economy plus seats, since I can't afford business or first class, for most of my flying now. I do appreciate the 'upgrade' to TSA Precheck that I sometimes get, and would have enjoyed the upgrade to first class that I was supposed to get on a connection from LAX to HNL before my itinerary had to be changed due to a severely delayed flight out of MDT the day before.

Hate the fact that first class has a four seat middle row. The need to  crawl over seat mates ( particularly hard when the lay flat seats are in place) to go to the restroom really dilutes the first class experience. Also, because the Polaris seats do not allow the usual under seat bag,if you have the misfortune to sit up in the middle of the four row seat, it is difficult to het up and retrieve your bag from the over Head bin...again, you have to disturb your neighbor and vpcrawl over him or her. Makes first class much less valuable
Waited on the runway for 2 and a half hours!!! No drinks offered and couldn't get up to go to the bathroom. Ridiculous!

It was awful starting with 2 supervisor before boarding and being unnecessarily rude and charging me for my charging on luggage $60 each after no one stated I COULDN'T take my luggage as a carry on. The two rude women loud talked me and embarrassed me in front of everyone in the airport. My son ended up carrying on the luggage because NO ONE put it under the plane! So I paid to carry on my luggage. When we arrived in LA to get the one luggage I paid to put under the luggage tags I put on it from United was covered in black ink which got all over my son's hand and polo outfit and my new luggage i got for christmas.  I took pictures which I can supply. I am highly upset. I WILL NEVER FLY UNITED AGAIN AND WILL ADVISE MY FRIENDS, FAMILY AND CO WORKERS THE SAME. I will be registering a compliant against those women and asking for reimbursement for additional luggage fee (2 $60) charges and for replacement of my son's clothing and my luggage. I have never experienced this kind of unprofessionalism and destruction of my property before in my life on any other carrier. I can to LA to visit my daughter and celebrate my birthday TODAY! But United ruined that for me.

When my flight was cancelled it was very hard getting information as to when I could get the next flight to Aruba. No information on line 1/2 hr or longer on the phone.  I fell this is handled very poorly.  I was in panic mode because I couldn't get any information. Just luck I reached reservations.

Flight attendants were not very engaging and seemed to be 'going through the motions" as if the job was just routine and almost boring for them. They did not offer us complementary drinks or snacks, which we should receive as 1 million mile fliers, and which we did receive on the flight from Newark to Tampa on Dec. 19, 2017 without asking for them.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Gate management was pathetic.  It was changed twice and no reason given.  And the announcements were made 20 minutes after the UA website updated.  UA flight ops needs a lesson in timely communicating!!!!!

Check in at Newark was awful!  The kiosk did not work well.  I had paid for my bag on line which it was making me pay again.  Not enough help at these machines. Workers just standing waiting for luggage, not helping. Because of the storm there were so many people it was really necessary for more help.  Thank you for putting this direct flight on to Newark!

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: While I understand our flight was delayed, there was a severe lack of communication at the gate. There was no full-time agent to explain what was happening. All passengers were asked to shuffle between two different gates (83 and 90) multiple times. It was as if it was a circus and we were going back and forth for no reason. It was a true hardship with everyone's bags. Ans there was no explanation for it while on-site.
There was a noise whistle that started in the middle of the flight and it a worrisome. The flight attendant said it could be the air conditioning system but it was still worrisome...
The delays and lack of information makes for a frustrating trip.

We waited for almost 20 mins by the plane with 3 very tired children for our stroller to eventually be told it wasn’t going to be delivered plane-side but instead in the baggage hall. We then had to wait in very long immigration Lines (which would have been avoided if we had not waited by the plane after being told to do so by the staff on board).   After all that, we then had to wait 30 mins for our luggage. A very disappointing experience.

The flight was delayed, there were weather issues in the area.  I do not have a problem with that.  However, just 1 minute before the scheduled boarding, there was apparently a change of gate AND a delay -- neither of which were announced.  Some people received a txt and raced off - causing chaos in the queue.  The gate attendants were unconcerned and made no announcements.  Finally I had to walk off quite a ways to read the monitors and learn of the new gate -- there was still no updates regarding the delay on the monitor.  After I arrived at the new gate (C90), we were told to "clear out" from the Priority 2 lane so the inbound flight could deplane -- creating more chaos and pushing.  The conduct of the gate crew left a lot to be desired in managing through this.  I finally had to check the monitor again to learn about the 1 hour delay.  While delays are understandable in the context of bad weather and flight delays the day before, the handling of it left me wondering if there was indeed a coordinated system here.
having my flight delayed multiple hours that resulted in my bag being lost is not ok
Newark Airport needs a makeover.  Not clean/ staff was not pleasant at times.

This was an almost 4 hour flight, on which we were connecting from a long flight from Asia to finally head home. On a 777 with lie back seats, we could not get blankets in business class, since the flight attendants could not find any, the cabin was freezing cold. Not sure how a world class airlines operations could miss rudimentary things like blankets for business class customers on a 4 hour flight across the country. The baggage service in Chicago was atrocious. The "Priority" tag on United bags are meaningless as we got our bags dead last, after many bags from our flights with non priority tags came out first and after a 40 minute wait, we finally got our bags. After flying for close to 20 hours from Asia on a connecting flight that could not get us blankets in Business Class and looking forward to getting home, the last thing we need as Global Services Customers is to wait for 40 minutes for our bags to come while all other bags from that flight were delivered before ours.
was sitting in First class and there was no drinks or meals. there was no explanation as to why this occurred.

When we arrived at gate - attendants failed to tell us there would be no food and very limited water on flight up until we were actually boarding the flight. So we did not have time to purchase food or drinks before boarding. United used the excuse of poor weather however our plane had come in to pbi airport from Chicago which did not have the blizzard conditions and sat in the tarmac  from the night before our flight was taking off. My daughter has stomach health issues and was unable to have food and drinks.  I paid a lot of money for my tickets and I expect to be refunded. The flight attendants did not even come around to see if we wanted water to drink. They said it was for emergency only!! That’s ridiculous and poor way of traveling.

Very loyal 1K customer. Upgraded to business at the gate, seat double booked and shoved to the back of the plane after getting comfortbale in business class. This made for a terrible experience. I have lost the GPU I used as well, so will now have to take time to get this back. Newark airport is still a complete joke, 1K check in was chaos with no order and took 30 mins to check in. United employee attitude is still terrible, very rude, abrasive and no ownership of customer experience (not my job attitude). Security is still choatic and long. United lounges are messy, very crowded, and food is terrible. By far the worst I visit (I know it is being refurbished, but I am not holding my breath...). The gate was completely disorganized, no place to queue in groups so everyone just crammed at the gate. Gate was changed last minute, then flight delayed by 2 hours despite the incoming plane arriving on time, unacceptable and tough on a flight that is already 14.5 hours. Couple all this with upgrade mix up and you have a very unhappy 1K customer. I will certainly be looking for a new airline to take my 100k+ miles a year.

Bathrooms became filthy and FA on duty didn't bother to clean. In-flight snacks were appalling: junk food only — how many packs of Gummie Bears do you really think business class travelers want? The "sandwiches" were a joke, all bread and trace of ham/cheese. What ever happened to the veggie and turkey wraps? Those are actually a healthy alternative. The Thai chicken curry came out lukewarm. Why is food left unwrapped an sitting out on a counter for hours where everyone walking by can simply touch it? I could continue but the bottom line is your in-flight meal service supervisor should just be fired and replaced with someone who will give this even 5 minutes of genuine thought or attention.

Very disappointed with how (a) flight status was handled at EWR.  Not until 2 minutes before boarding time did any UA person know the status was not "on time".  There was a last minute gate change, airplane change and then a 2 hour delay which no one seem to know about., and (b) our check in luggage was opened for TSA inspection which is to be expected, however, we also had items stolen from the outside pocket of our luggage - jackets, sun glasses, hats - which we had placed in the outside pocket prior to check-in given the extreme cold weather in NY area.  We have heard stories of such theft but, were completely shocked to experience it ourselves.  It is thoroughly unacceptable and we are quite concerned about the baggage handling in EWR in general (as it is completely hit or miss on arrival in terms of bags coming out in order or even within a reasonable amount of time).

The incoming plane from Newark was late leaving Newark, so that was ostensibly the reason for our delay. Once the plane arrived, we all queued up to board. For some unknown reason, the passengers who were de-boarding were extremely slow. There were no wheelchair passengers. No explanation was provided the gate agents. No sense or urgency. After waiting 15 minutes for the last person to de-board, we finally started to board. However, the gate agent then made an announcement that there was a minor mechanical issue they had identified. So we stood another 30 minutes waiting. Finally, we began to board, almost 2 hours after our original departure time. Once we left the gate, we waited another 10 minutes or so due to runway traffic. Overall, very poor communication by the gate agents as to what happening and why we were delayed. Agents need to get in the intercom and keep passengers updated.
The paying for Direct TV is very disappointing (no one wants to watch ads when they pay for content!), especially when the TV screens don't work all that well.

Not only was departure delayed by 5 hours, we sat in a hot and stuffy plane on the tarmac for an hour after landing. The temperature in the cabin after landing was unacceptably hot and stuffy. Aside from verbal apologies, United did nothing to ease this very unpleasant journey.

Earlier and more accurate information when there are unavoidable delays. Departure time was pushed back three hours in about five small increments. The gate is not the happiest place to spend four hours.

just delays - got to airport at 9am, for 11am, then 11;45 for late crew, then ATC hold, 1:30pm, then 3:55pm, etc - we boarded at 4:15pm; then got to Newark at 8:30pm, but waited 50 more minutes to get into a gate - the gate time is a killer after a long day

TSA security at gate 3 were very insensitive to the fact that I have diabetes and that I have insulin pump , when I told them that I could not go through the detector and would need a manual pat down , they were very frustrated and said " Your doctor does not know anything "
Pilot was rude and condescending when we in the cabin were struggling to get our luggage in the overhead cabins, blamed us for losing take off spot

The flight crew did not represent United well.  I felt that myself and the surrounding passengers were an inconvenience to the crew.  We received no pre-flight drinks or chocolates in business class and Pamela Ladd pulled my phone charger out of the outlet and threw it on the ground prior to take off as I had forgotten it was plugged.  She then pulled the pillow from the passenger across the aisle and pushed his seat button to return his seat to the upright position with out asking him.  She then informed him he must of missed her announcement as he had his headphones on.  She left the bread off of this same passengers dinner service.  When he asked for a roll she informed he would have to wait until she could get to it.  We were both amazed at the uncharacteristic service on this flight.  I appreciate the upgrade I received on this flight but traveling over 100 fights a year this crew stands out as being highly experienced but going through the motions of a job and not concerned about a customer experience.

Can't believe that United downgraded the meal services on a 3 hour flight from lunch to a snack. With all of the billions United is making this seems like a slap in the face to customers expecting to experience a premium product. I noticed the same was the case for the morning flight going from breakfast to a snack. Disappointed in the decision to make this change.
I unfortunately got food poisoning from the dinner that was served (Salmon) on my flight.
4 hours delay with no compensation is a miss

The stewardesses on flight #50 from Madrid to Newark were rude, dismissive, unfriendly. There were several African American females who provided what can be described as low class serrvice. They acted as though they did not want to be interacting with us at all. One barked at me while I waited for the bathroom facilities. None said niceties such as please or thank you. I moved out of the way for one of them coming down the aisle and there was no acknowledgment. It was as thought we were there to serve their needs. It was awful!!  I’ve never experienced that kind of attitude from a crew, and not just one but the whole group, including a gay gentleman. When the doorcto the lavatory was stuck, I asked how to open it and the stewardess rudely said “turn the handle and pull”, which of course is what I had been doing. Then she turned back to her fellow stewardess and made a rude comment about me! Just awful, awful customer service on that flight and I was going to write to tell you. These people need to change their attitude toward your customers, which is very condescending, rude, impatient, unfriendly and shockingly low class service.

i couldn't get back to the beginning, the plane was unable to make hot water because a pump wasn't working. Most of the people on the plane, including my family were sick and wished we could have had some tea or any type of hot beverage.

I was almost late for my connecting flight in Chicago. It was a replacement for a cancelled flight and it was a mess. I ended up having to spend more than twice the amount of the tickets to still arrive late in my final destination
There was no notification of the previously. cancelled flight which caused undue stress, inconvenience and expense.

Traveling with an elderly family member who needed wheelchair assistance. A bit unorganized at gate in Newark (did not have skycaps available) and horrendous at Orlando. Wheeled passengers off and let them sit at arrival gate waiting for attendants. Eventually took passenger and wheeled her myself. After traveling (arriving at airport two hours in advance of flight and sitting during travel) no one wants to wait around again.

In addition to (a) being 5 hours delayed, (b) no catering on the flight, (c) one of our bags was damaged.  We did not report as we landed at 11pm and son had a college placement exam at 8am the next morning - did not arrive home until after midnight...  having to deal with additional time consuming administrative activities was not worth further limiting his ability to get some sleep.
Food was not great again
The service at the gate was terribly bad. we got the wrong information for hours.

We were fed about 1-2 hours after takeoff then not until about 1 hour from landing. Everyone was starved after 5+ hours with no food. Why wait until we have almost landed to heat up what was actually a dreadfully soggy piece of bread, cheese and turkey (which in my opinion is United's worst regular food offering).
Train your staff, they are very rude!
Flight was delayed because of a door problem.  The piolet made up some of the time lost with the problem.
The piolet made up most of the time lost with a door problem.

You broke the handle on my checked bag. The seats were extremely uncomfortable for both my husband and and the walk to baggage claim was too far for 70 yr old people to walk. Was so upset that we were not willing to seek out recompense for the ruined luggage
The food choices on the ORD/IAH flight have been severely degraded on this flight over the years.  They really are poor in quality.

The seats were very uncomfortable, was a short flight and yet being in that awful seat made me sore. Also, window seat arm rest should lift up, just wasted space! I am an average size person, and this flight made me want to avoid these types of planes.

We were a party of 6 traveling to Las Vegas for an engagement dinner. The brides luggage was lost. Her dress, shoes, meds. and all needed accessories were in her carryon. Her name Taylor Robles was told to gate check her bag at Albany place of origin. She received no receipt just assurances that it would be in Vegas. It wasn't. Friday night after 8 pm Albany time we are calling her doctor for her depression meds to get a prescription to a CVS that has the meds in stock. Then go buy a new dress, shoes and other items. The stress and anxiety on all six was exhausting. The groom. the bride, her mother and brother along with her grandparents should not have had to deal with such stress. The travel provided sufficient stress with late departing flights and changed planes. Some additional compensation is due the bride and groom.
Flight was about 90 minutes late due to a mechanical issue. Eventually a new aircraft had to be used with a gate change. Very poor communication from the gate agents as to what was happening.
Someone, her service is not good. feeling staffs are very unhappy

in Memphis, there was a baggage snafu.  don't know if it was the fault of United or the Memphis airport people.  Supposed to pick up bags just after departing plane on the bridge (?), but due to  "personnel shortage" we had to go to baggage claim, where we waited quite a while to get our luggage.  Annoying.

I have to admit that I rarely travel in coach however this time was a grim reminder of how long US airlines still have to go before flying becomes a more pleasant exoperience.  In the back there was a constant long line in front of the two bathrooms which are supposed to serve 150 people over a five hour period.  in addition to avoid infiltration of "their" space the cabin crew had tied together the two jump seat seat-belts to form a barrier between the galley and the lavatory area.  Apart from this being a safety hazard it symbolizes the careless attitude towards passengers.    The crew was indifferent to hostile.  When I pointed out to the purser that that wash basin in the toilet was clogged and no paper towels were available after 2 hours into the flight he said:  " can you believe that people throw paper in the sink? "  When I asked wether he wanted to do anything about he said 'No'.
DELAYED 3 HOURS (DUE TO MECHANICAL ISSUES) WITH NO COMPENSATION. HAD TO MARATHON SPRINT TO OUR NEXT GATE OVER A MILE AWAY WITHIN 6 MINUTES TO MAKE OUR CONNECTION. WILL NEVER FLY UNITED AGAIN.

Flt. Delayed before departure and on arrival. No word from cockpit about staying in air for another 30 min. after  announcing an earlier landing time. Couldn’t that have been communicated to airport gate to hold plane for us?  We ran to it but doors were already closed-aircraft still there. Or how helpful to have the drivers and car available to speed us there. Many cars no drivers. We missed    our flight and scheduled excursion in Buenos Aires.  A chance of lifetime for  these old people.  Few stations operating at customer service with a very long line and wait. With weather problems, wouldn’t you anticipate that?  Premier  we expected more.
Club was overcrowded-seems to be “temporary “ for a very long time. Food choices very poor

My main issue with my flight was the delay in departure from Newark. Due to the late arrival of the First Officer, the flight was delayed by almost an hour. Because of this very late departure, my ride home from the Santa Ana airport couldn't happen and I was forced to Uber instead. I don't know what happened in getting the First Officer to the plane on time, but I was very frustrated to be sitting on the tarmac for so long when I knew securing another ride would be impossible due to the late notice.
The gate area in Orlando is bad. No charging stations for devices. Terrible seating and few food options. Awful for a 3 plus hour delay.

Family separated with small kids 2 boys age 11 and 13 sitting on their own away from each other and parents! Boarded plane then told we had to get off due to storm at Newark Delayed 3 hours missed flight Connection stranded with 4 young kids till after midnight in freezing temperatures with no luggage until we finally got a hotel and return flight sorted which meant an extra stop! Flight was bad with turbulence I’m not a good flyer and my kids were sick! Can’t understand why United flew us into storm knowing we were going to miss connecting flight and all other flights booked up in Newark!!

The staff were very unhelpful.  Everything blamed on air traffic control and weather. Another reason for delay was letting 5 other people on the plane delaying it an extra 30 mins causing my family to miss our connection.
Three flights in 2018, 1 Cancellation with a 4 hour delay, another 4 hour delay and a one hour delay.  Not a great start.
I had a bad experience with rude customer service both at he kiosk and at the gate check in.

We were very disappointed that we showed up to the airport and our seats were reassigned to three middle seats and a window.  We were told it was an equipment change but having purchased our tickets EARLY it was disappointing.

Baggage claim at EWR was terrible. It took an hour and a half to get bags. First set of bags came out in 15 mins but the last set took an hour. Everyone thought the bags were lost. It was chaos trying to find our bags! Terrible experience!

I got messages saying we could switch to a later flight. Actually we would have liked to do that but it appeared there were no later flights. Although I'm a very frequent flier, I was really unsure what to do if our flight was cancelled.
The seats are more uncomfortable every time I fly with United. Stop making them smaller with less padding. It’s ridiculous

The initial mechanical delay that delayed our Vermont departure caused our arrival home in Anchorage to be 27 hours late.  We got a hotel in Chicago and spent the day.  However we learned later another family standing in line with us in Vermont, also traveling to Anchorage on the same initial flight, had been rebooked the same day to arrive just a few hours late.  The only rebooking offered to us was for a flight out the following night.  That was kind of frustrating.

If you are going to delay a flight over 6 hours with no guarantee of departure just cancel it from the beginning. Checked flight status all morning, flight stated on time. Not to just before boarding did you start delaying it. You knew the weather, you knew the situation at Newark, Why make us come to the airport to sit a wait and waste our time. Can't change flights without change fees which are very expensive. Paid First Class. Completely dissatisfied. You deal with weather all the time, it's your business, flight should have been canceled 1st thing in morning or night before.

The touch point TV screen was incredibly frustrating.  The mouse never lined up with what I was trying to hit.   I could also tell the person behind me was having the same issue because he was hitting the screen so hard I could feel it.

First class, having to eat gummy bears and pretzels is an insult. It loudly demonstrates total disregard for high paying passengers. You could give out two lousy White Castle burgers for $3.00. Very sad.

The gate changed from gate 1 to gate 13 to gate 16. I was at gate 1 at 1:00pm, boarding was to start at 1:02. I decided to check flight status to see if there was a change in leave time and I saw the gate change. I had to rush to the other side of the  terminal. I get the up date of the gate change 8 minuets later.  At the final gate change there was no organization on boarding. A large section of the Corredor was blocked off for no apparent reason and people trying to get to their gate had to push through the crowd of people trying to get on my flight at gate 16.
Flight attendant was very rude and the delay put a lot of stress on me

The seats on the plane are so uncomfortable. It was like sitting in a bowl. high along the back, deep dip in the middle. Just terrible to sit in. Obviously, these were not designed to stand up to constant use.

Baggage claim - three United flights arrived at the same carousel, two carousels next our carousel was not moving.  why spread out the baggage claim? Gate checkin - there was chaos, no priority lines, agent just made announcements, everyone gather at the gate check in till their number was called.   Arrival - plane waited at the tarmac for about an hour before deplaning.  explanation was that there were no gates, when we saw multiple gates unoccupied,
The Flight attendant was a bit confused with her announcement considering this was a short flight and we were all tired due to the delay .

1) Get organized at the gates. There is no reason for the chaos that is there. Why have three flights boarding at the same time, going through the same door? What could possibly go wrong. 2) I think it's time to retire the E145 that fly us to Toronto. The plane is in sorry condition and looked like a dump. The window frame beside the seat in front of me was almost unattached from the interior!

Left on the runway for over an hour because there was no one at the gate to accept our flight at Newark, this was after a 3 and a half delay which is underatandable due to weather but the quality of the information given was horrible. I was left sitting at the airport for 5 hours when they delay could have been relayed to the passengers. The gate agents had no information on how long we would be delayed which is just sloppy for such a big company. Also being left on the runway after the delay and the flight is just unacceptable and I’m not pleased with how United handled the day.

column26: TECH OPS-LATE TOW UP TO GATE
column79: Disappointed with the gates jammed together B20,21,22,23,24. Makes it difficult to know and hear when flights are boarding

It is very understandable that there were delays given the weather.   It was to be expected.  The issue was with conflicting information.    The app said one time, the board at the airport said a different time, the gate agents gave a 3rd answer and I called global services, only to get the same incorrect info that was shown in the app.   It was very frustrating.    My other complaint was the extraordinarily long wait time for baggage in Newark.   This is an ongoing problem and I'm not sure why Delta can get bags delivered within 15 mins of plane landing while United takes twice or three times as long.
Major delay and gate agents didn’t give enough on terms of updates. Electronic Sign was wrong and when someone pointed it out the gate agent said, it’s wrong, just disregard it.
Baggage claim was probably the worst part. It took an hour for me to get my bag after getting off the plane.
I'm kind of surprised given that I was dissatisfied that there are not any more questions as to why I had such a bad experience....
The baggage retrieveal at Charlotte is and has been a problem.  The worst in the world.  Get it fixed.
The bathroom attendant was nasty and rude. I don’t care for Chicago airport personnel they’re heartless to disabled people

They were quite hasty to turn the lights on or off and there was no warning or fade. As I had already had one flight I was quite tired, but when they suddenly turned the lights on for landing it was a bit much. Also, the cabin crew didn’t properly che k seat belts as the gentleman next to me did not have his buckled until we were 1 minute before takeoff.

My wife and I selected seats together when we booked the flight but when we checked in at SJD we had been separated, with no reason given. The same problem occurred on our flight to SJD from EWR. No one was willing or able to explain the reason for this seating separation, but it is an unfortunate policy that should not occur.

The check in attendant was rue and should find employment at gas station. She charged my wife for baggage despite the fact that I purchased the tickets with a Chase Presidential card and first class ticket.  I was returning the car and only found this out after going thru customs. If I had knew this ahead of time, I would have call her supervisor. If they don't like what they are doing or whom they are serving, such persons need a another line of work.  This usually never happens with United. The lady definitely needs retraining and perhaps working the flight line may cure her of such a bad altitude.

It is unacceptable, especially since tickets were purchased so far in advance that we were not all seated together and that we got stuck with the final row in the aircraft.  My wife and daughter ended up splitting the aisle and people were constantly rubbing up against them on the way to the restroom.  Again, I don't understand how seats are not assigned together as a default setting when purchasing tickets.

In first class there was only one choice of meal offered and it was extremely poor quality- cold noodle salad on a freezing winter day.  Really?  How come JetBlue can offer multiple hot meal options in their Mint service cabin
significant flight delay necessitates chaos and rushing one we get to old
We switched gates 5 times, it was tetious and annoying and there was little to no communication.

My flight was cancelled on Friday and I was told this flight was not available untill I requested s supervisor and got upset , this is all a scam as the plane had empty seats yet it was not originally available
No good vegan food options. Also were told my drink choice was not available, but then another attendant later provided it. Bad lies.
Mechanical problems are unpredictable, but l missed an important family event as a result.  That was highly disappointing.
Both flights from Lima to Newark and from Newark to Lima the people in the counter were not very respectful, they seem angry and their answers were somewhat rude.

5 hour delay in a dirty gate area (G) at Miami International;  with no decent amenities.  Only Pizza Hut, bar associated with pizza hut and a coffee/guava stand.  dirty carpet, uncomfortable chairs;  totally unacceptable.  also, no United Club and no associated club to spend time in a more comfortable and clean  area.

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Teeny weeny microscopic space for passengers. Feels very unhealthy.

Flight attendants were rude at the counter then the flight then they had pretzels added to their cart and delayed us further then the plane landed in buffalo and their was not enough staff at the airport to receive our plane so we sat longer (might I add I was traveling with a teething toddler so everything was amplified- but my seat mate was a young guy who was equally as miserable!)

FLight departure times were not accurate - they kept changing. I was afraid to leave the gate in case we did board. I had NO FOOD For many many hours. I missed my van to my school and had to pay $60 to uber because we were so late.

I will likely never fly with United Airlines again. The flight attendants were extremely rude to some of the passengers, and when I picked up my bag from the baggage claim, the entire front pocket was ripped off. I could not get it repaired since I was going on a cruise the following day, and was told to get it fixed when I returned to Boston. But, when I got back to Boston, my bag had been left in Newark and has to be shipped home to me. Then I was told to BRING IT BACK to the airport to get it repaired. This whole process is ridiculous. I have told my friends and family to avoid flying with your airline because no one I spoke to was very helpful and I was told different things by different employees. I also asked to speak with a supervisor, was told they would call me back in 24 hours, and it has been a week. Not happy.

The person who checked me in for the beginning of my flight in Burlington did not realize that the itinerary I was booked on required an India visa in order for me to get my bag and that I would not be able to take that itinerary without that visa. As a result, I had to change flights once I was alerted to this situation in Newark. If the gate attendant would have realized the situation, I could have rebooked well ahead of time. As it worked out, I missed my flight, had to stay in Newark overnight, and my luggage was lost in Newark and still has not been found. I am not in Nepal with no clothing or toiletries. This was a big fail and has caused a tremendously stressful trip when it didn't need to be this way.

We had economy plus seats.  We tried to upgrade to first class using mileage plus points.  The upgrade wasn't available, but we lost our economy plus seats!  We didn't try to upgrade to end up with economy!  VERY DISAPPOINTING!!!

Stewardess was rude and nasty to us. Yelling at man because his carry on was not fitting properly on overhead storage. Told people to move to make room for family and when 1 passenger got up and moved forward said where are you going with rude tone.

Very disappointing that the United Club was closed in the C concourse.  Heat in the Gate area was TOO HIGH.  Not enough seats waiting for the delayed flight.  NO INFORMATION from gate staff on what was happening (no gate staff present until the last 30 minutes before boarding).
no wifi really bad

I will try my best to be politically correct, this was the 2nd time this year a Indian man sat next to me and just plain stunk..it was another 3 hours of torture..whatever they eat causes them to protrude a strong horrible odor...why to we have to sit through this?  They should have their own flights, sorry but it was disgusting
Your charge for baggage is also horrible and takes too long. Charge $50 more for ticket.
There was only one vegetarian snack option and my children don't like hummus and olives so remained hungry during the four-hour flight, plus two-hour delay.

Due to weather I was checking my flight on an hourly basis the day before and the morning of my flight. I checked both my mobile app as well as your website. Everything showed on time. After I checked in, the airport monitors showed a 2 hour delay. Ugh! When I reached the gate, there was a plane still at the gate departing for Newark. The person checking me in originally never offered to put me on that flight. After all, they were still boarding standby passengers. This is awful customer service and I truly believe that United doesn't care. Due to your neglect, my flight ended up being 5 hours late. Why don't you update your technology so if a flight is truly delayed passengers can make the proper arrangements. What I mean is, I didn't have to return my rental car, or tried to change flights etc. I certainly realize that no one can predict weather Airlines need to look in the mirror and realize that travel is not what it's cracked up to be. At least I was able to assist your flight attendants with a sick woman onboard. If anything, I was proud to have assisted a fellow human being. That's all.

HUGE delays: flight left over 4 hours late. Another delay when we arrived at Newark (gate access problem). A THIRD delay - almost an hour to get my luggage. Needless to say, I will do everything possible to fly another airline.

Check in at Newark T1, is the WORST United experience I have ever had.  Only one giant line for baggage drop off, customer service, & check-in. Waited 40 minutes to drop our bags even though we were already checked in and "Premier Access". There was no separate line for bags or buisness class/premier. Staff was rude and surly. Hlf of them weren't even working. Just standing around behind the counter chatting. Really unprofessional and unlike other United check-in experiences.

No, but I would like to comment on my flight from Newark to Orlando. I travelled business class. there was very limited space in the overhead compartments.  I had to put my suitcase several seats behind my seat -- which made my exit from the plane difficult.  I learned after we landed, that the crew had taken up two bins with their suitcases, coats, etc.  I object to the fact that we don't get convenient overhead bin space due to the crew.  The crew could put their suitcases back of the plane. After all they leave after all the passengers have left.  It is not nearly as difficult for them to go back in the plane to get their luggage as it was for those of us in business class.
The baggage delivery at Boston continues to be horrible.
The plane reeked of a horrible odor. Unbearable. Absolutely horrible.

We were waiting to get our carryon in the Toronto airport upon arrival in the 0 F temperature. Flight attendance could have warned us to wait in the plane while the carryon were being brought out so that we didn't have to wait outside in the cold weather for 5 min. I was feeling really sick since I didn't expect that to happen therefore not enough clothing was with me.
Main issue is that the attendant was terrible in manner. Maintained a sarcastic expression. Not friendly

the experience in the airport was extremely unorganized and frustrating.  It took an extremely long time to get our bags accepted (after we had processed them in the kiosk).  The lines were extremely long and the process was very inefficient. We almost missed our flight.    Also, while not related to this leg of our tripour experience from IND to San Juan on Dec 27th was VERY bad -- our original flight was delayed and then canceled due to mechanical problems, leading our group to be broken apart and departure for one of party to be delayed by a whole day.  I intend to submit a separate complaint regarding that trip and request some compensation.

Never got my bags! My whole trip ruined because we were late (3rd flight in a month you could not take off on time) and I never got my bags in time. How do you not load my bags on a direct flight with -6 hours- of time available?!? You say you're "sorry" but you're not. If you were, you wouldn't do it in the first place. You make me work to correct your mistakes. I haven't even had time to file my claim when you decided it was "okay" to just add another stop to our flight to Houston for people not even paying for their flight to New Orleans...that was after being 5 hours behind schedule! You have stolen my time from my loved ones. You have lost my business.
3 hrs late due to mechanical and no apology. Gate agent was melting down and unpleasant to travelers asking basic questions
Your add on charges are getting ridiculous.

Flight was full,  and so were the overhead bins.  My husband and I had 2 carry bags that are truly carry on bag size.   We boarded in Group 4 and there was no space anywhere near our seats to put our bags.  We paid the upgrade for the extra leg room seats and my husband had to sit uncomfortably with his knees by his chin because the carry on bag occupied the room area where his feet should have been.   He was uncomfortable and unhappy.  The overhead bins were filled with bags larger than ours along with outerwear (coats since it was very cold).  They announced prior to boarding to check any bags that wouldn’t fit in the space to test your carry on.  No one paid attention to these obviously larger overstuffed bags going onboard.   (which is why people just disregard this regulation).    We’ll fly another airline next time.... and you’re losing long time faithful United Airlines passengers.   Joan Manahan Morristown NJ  1/5/2018

The delay was created by a delay on the in coming flight. While I understand that weather delays have a knock-on effect across the network, the bad weather on the East coast was not a surprise. You should have planned and routed aircraft accordingly - breaking the dependency on incoming flights from the east. I note that the AA flights to O'Hare were not at all delayed.
No power outlets on plane.  no head rest.  gate at key west has no convenient power outlets.
The entertainment system was broken in our seat and we paid extra for extra legroom so this was a disappointment to not have it work
Very disappointed with the selection of beer and running out of it. The food selection was bad as well.
United Club was unpleasant, the staff at desk was extremely rude and not accommodating, I walked out!!

Original flight cancelled due to weather, get new flight for next day and not direct, flight is delayed due to baggage cart went to wrong plane, waitedbut couldn’t wait for long, find out at IAH, 2 of our bags were on that cart so to top the whole cancellation delay fiasco no bags, event tonight n stuffis in the held back bag. Understand there are issue due to weather but once operation resumes at least then do it right.
The gate agent in Cedar Rapids was really bad. He didn’t have any information
No. But I was not happy that I had no access to movies on my HNL-LAX and LAX and ORD flights. No entertainment options.

Sat on the tarmac for almost an hour and  half which caused us to miss our connecting flight to Baltimore. UA was extremely unhelpful in accommodating us through this process, offering us only a 7AM train to Baltimore the next day, which would have met sleeping in Newark airport that night. They could have held the plane up for 5 minute, helped customers with connecting flights navigate security quickly, did something, ANYTHING, to compensate us for our troubles, or at the very least (and I mean VERY least), not made me fight with the baggage department for two days to get my bag (which did make it to Baltimore) delivered. I will most likely NEVER use United Airlines again. In an era where a lot of people complain about airlines, United out-does its competition and is the absolute worst airline I have ever experienced.
The male flight attendant was too wide to walk down the aisle without bumping everyone sitting on the aisle as he passed. He also had a bad attitude.
It was delayed and then we sat on the aircraft for almost 30 minutes with no explanation on the delay there

The incoming flight was delayed due to maintenance. The earlier flight out of LGA was delayed due to maintenance. The middle flight out of LGA left after my later, delayed flight. Not sure what the deal is but does not reflect well having so many flights delayed.  Additionally, my bag required a plane check after I was already at the back of the plane.  They should have determined that well ahead to bot run into that situation.  I was extremely disappointed by these circumstances and expect more.
the inability to use PreCheck in Dallas is a real pain. The checkpoint staff don't know how to handle this situation. Miami knows how to handle this, why doesn't Dallas?

Newark never put my daughters lacrosse stick bag on our flight I checked in an hour and half at least early - our whole trip was planned on a college recruiting camp my daughter plays attack her lacrosse stick is key it has ruined the whole trip when I went to fill out the form in fort Meyers the united rep was short with me and said it will be on the next flight and delivery goes at at 5am then we learned that didn't happen the camp started at 9am this morning and her stick bag is still in Newark my husband just drove to Newark  because everyone he spoke with at united couldn't tell her where it when the stick would make it to our hotel in Naples the camp ends tomorrow at 2pm so now she had missed the 1st day with the college coaches without her stick we are furious it is not acceptable - jet blue and delta are way better at lacrosse stick bags I expect the stick to make it today if it doesn't I am filing for a full refund if this entire trip including our hotel car camp and you can never compensate my daughter for losing out on this opportunity it is beyond disappointing and worse the people that work for you did a horrible job it's not that hard it's a small bag I will never fly united and I will tell everyone about this - my husband is probably at the Newark airport standing in a line getting thE run around after he made 5 calls last night - the airline should be embarrassed and your employees should have more empathy for a mom and her 15 year old daughter instead of being short and now I know completely unhelpful - annie mcginty

Paid extra to fly first class and bag is lost and no one knows where it is. I thought first class bags were treated with extra care. My daughter needs the items in her bag for school and the fact that they don’t even know where the bag is really is disturbing and annoying

When you upgrade a person who is nasty and inconsiderate flight attendants should have the power to return thT person to coach.  I am a Platinium member and bought my ticket —no mileage and should not be subjected to. Rude upgrages
Food was not good  - fruit hard as a rock. Flew Business from Beizing to Newark last week and it was the same menu and just as bad

- Flight attendant was extremely rude.  Non-existent in first class for a bulk of the flight (not easy to get a glass of water after first service).  Snapped at a customer in front of me for daring to take two snacks out of the basket! - No meals boarded

baggage service took 30+ minutes at EWR.  There were only 2 US Custome agents at EWR verifying documentation for thousands of incoming passengers, they were bad tempered and over worked, screaming and yelling at incoming passengers is not a good way to welcome back home coming US citizens and visitors from foreign land.
There was no snacks or food for the 9+ hours of flight. Only food for purchase which is ridiculous. Will fly the other airlines next time.

Ground crew in San Diego were very helpful--I had left an item on the plane and they retrieved it.  Also I could not access the movies on a Mac laptop but I could on my phone.  I followed all the instructions--that was annoying.
Honolulu airport check in was severely understaffed.  There were lines even at the Premier aisles. The airplane seats are too narrow and hard for this long flights.
Not a smooth take off & landing. Felt like I was in a roller coaster. I fly very often with most flights being with United but was shocked with the lack of “smoothness” in this flight.
Service onboard was very poor for 1st class

There is no water fountain or bottle filler once you've gone through security in Terminal A.  That is just WRONG!  One should not have to pay for water after needing to dispose of water before you enter.  Also, the gate area was very dirty.  There was trash on seats and tables.
It went fine but all the money you have to pay for extra leg room is horrible.  I am a medium size woman and I could not even put my Rms next to me.  Your seats are just disgraceful.
I was disappointed with the extensive delay due to the issue with the aircraft and lack of offering any compensation.

Flight was fine - one hour delay but understandable given weather. However, it took 40 minutes from when we landed to deplaning because: a plane was at our assigned gate, we got a new gate but no personnel were there to assist and finally the jetway broke. It was quite late when we got in and everyone was frustrated to have to wait more than 10 minutes on each of those items when we were so close to being off the plane.

Why am I always a low boarding group?   Not enough staff at gate. Took 45 mins to get put on standby and then missed I.T by one as a result.   Attendant tried multiple times to have me check a small duffel bag. This defeats the purpose of why I packed a duffel bag in the first place. Plenty of room on the aircraft.   Never any complimentary drinks like with SW.

The delay was unacceptable and seems to be an issue every single time I fly United. Additionally when we got to the airport there was nowhere to park as usual. The pilot had the nerve to comment that he got us in early??? And spent every announcement telling us it was 4 hours with time change, which was flat out wrong. (It was 4). So we were actually late on top of the delays! The guy behind me puked his brains out While we waited for a parking spot and nobody assisted him. It made me actually ill. This was another awful experience with United. I swear I will never fly you again every time, and continue to. This time I will go very far out of my way not to.

It was disappointing that there was not one food option that was Gluten-Free. I was traveling with my wife and 2 daughters, and 2 of them have Celiac Disease, which means they have to eat Gluten-Free. For an almost 8 hour flight having 0 options, that is just awful.
Gate area was very disorganized, Poor communication

Please go back to big planes on the ORD / ALB route .... The little planes are very uncomfortable and they get cancelled much more frequently than the larger planes. Also no first class on most of the little planes
my only complaint is the bell that comes on the intercom  when the pilot makes announcements or puts the fasten seatbelt sign on... its WAY TOO LOUD... UNCOMFORTABLY LOUD AND HURTS MY EARS.

Generally, my flight experiences are great.  However, this was challenging due to the weather in Newark.  Our flight was delayed - notice not given until we reached the airport - OK it happens.  We were kept up to date by the gate attendants.  However, once we boarded, the attendants were rude - loudly demanding that the passengers take their seats or else we were going to lose our take off spot and it would be our fault for being too slow.   So the plane was there, we sat in the airport and did not board until directed and then it would be our fault if we lost our spot?  Plus there was a piece of chewed gum on my seat - Yuck...

The in flight service was awful. We flew first class. Flight attendants neglected to pick up hot towel. The drinks, nuts main course and dessert were all served within five minutes of each other. Was not offered water or wine with the meal.

the gate experience was a complete shit show...There was no call for passengers in need of assistance, and the wheel chair attendants barged through group 1, as opposed to using the open lane or group 2.  A family of 4 just barged to the front and were let on, families with older kids were allowed to board, it was a complete mess.
It is frustrating to have a plane waiting at the gate for hours with insufficient flight crew to take off.  Poor planning. I would have served the pretzels myself to get off more quickly.

Was pre-TSA approved and had the yellow placard.  Felt like I was being treated very rudely.  Also, when I turned in the rental car it was not in the same lot I picked it up at.  The guy I asked for directions from was very short with me when I asked where to turn it in.  He rudely stated "Follow the signs!"  When you are from out of state and it is your first time getting a rental car, that is upsetting.  I found my way to where I needed to go, I think.
