An attendant took the keys from me and said I did not need to do anything additional.  This leaves a lot to chance...and left me very uncomfortable!

I accidentally left my American Express card in the check-in kiosk. I never got a beep to remove my card and thus walked away from it. I cancelled the card after realizing I had to card for getting a sandwich.

Upon arrival in Newark, we had to wait at least 30 minutes for a gate.  We arrived essentially on time or a few minutes late.   Waiting on the tarmac trying to figure out which gate to go to is frustrating.   The announcements in the cabin also indicated that they were waiting for guidance and did not know why there was a delay.  The flight crew was great, the in air experience was good but to land with no gate to go to doesn't make any sense.  The operations at Newark are poor.   For an airport of that size and volume something needs to be done.

EWR baggage handlers are consistently and horrifically slow. Even when there isn’t a major weather event or other delay. In addition, we sat on the runway for almost an hour after landing and were told, at first, it was because the plane at our gate needed to pull back. Understandable. We were forced to wait about 20 mins after the plane pulled away from our gate before we could pull in. Even our pilot ran out of excuses and said she had no idea what they traffic controllers on the ground were doing. From my window, it appeared they were standing around and doing nothing. Perception is a huge factor in customer service. The staff at EWR, as a whole, needs to appear more professional and engaged in their duties. It might make customers actually believe that the staff is really doing all they can to help.

When you cancel someone’s flight you should email them to let them know . I live an hour away from Tampa Intl and my mother in laws trip was cancelled and no one notified me .. drove an hour to take her , to then find out I’m half way home that it was cancelled .. had to order an Uber and that cost 62$ on top of what i wasted on gas and toll ..

same as before...I thought United would get their act together about seating after that tragedy of having a passenger pulled off the plave, but I guess not. I do hope to hear something formal about this issue: Specifically the seat location. Prior to checking in I received a notice that there was an aircraft  change.When I checked on this, I discovered my seat was moved to 22E (even though 21D, which I selected when I booked the flight, was available) so I moved my seat back to 21D. Then, a couple days later when I checked in (exactly 24 hours prior to flight take off time) I was properly seted in 21D. I printed my Board Pass with my seat 21D.  Next day when I arrived to the airport and checked in on bag of luggage, I discovered that my seat was changed to 23D. I spoke with the baggage attendant, who suggested that I speak with the gate attendants. When I showed the gate attendants my boarding pass which I printed out with 21D and the boarding pass given to me when I checked my luggage with 23D on it, they said they could do nothing and dismissed me. Horrible service and no explanation of what happened or why. I am still furious about this because the people in 21D and E could have been easily placed in 23 D and E. On the plane I spoke to s flight attendant who was quite surprised that this happened and said that this was a problem with another passenger who was supposed to also be in the Exit Row and was now in 22B instead. The in-flight attendant said to contact United.com.

Most of the ticketing and gate agents were not helpful in assisting me with information on getting an alternate or Stand-by flight. However, Marta, was exceptional on a previous flight I had from Dallas in that she was able to get me in a flight that other ticket agents either couldn't or wouldn't find for me.  Overall I'm dissatisfied and discourage my company from booking United flights.
I wanted to ask a question regarding the chances of our flight getting cancelled, but the attendant at the gate was extremely rude and refused to answer me.

Boarding time on UA mobile app said 17:35 at Gate 10 at LGA . Boarding did not begin until 17:51 for an 18:00 flight. This is 16 minutes later with **no*** announcement of the delay from the LGA C10 gate agents. This isn't the first time at LGA the ground staff has been lackadaisical about announcing boarding time delays which naturally occur at LGA due to the aggressive turn around schedules and ATC control issues. It's extremely frustrating having to leave the United or Air Canada club (which is not behind security) only to stand in line at the gate for 16 minutes. As soon as the published boarding time passes announce the delay. Don't pretend standing there for 16 minutes without any communication from the gates agents is acceptable. Very frustrating. Thx.

My chief complaint is with communications.  Finally went to UA website to find out where the incoming was coming from.  Posted arrival gate was C88 - #485 was C105 on boarding pass.  Did not get email from UA regarding lateness of outbound or gate change.  If the website knows things - why isn't the info at EWR accurate?  Frustrating for experienced, business travelers.

Yes - when group 3 was allowed to the plane, and with group 4 - all of a sudden at the door we were told that there was no space for our items in the overhead compartments.  Other airlines announce a full flight and ask for people to check their rolling cases before getting on the plane.  My family did not want to check ours - but there was no choice - and no time to look in the bags and take out any items.  We were instructed to leave our boarding passes on our rolling cases, and the stewards would bring our passes with baggage claims to us in our seats.  Shortly after seated, my name was called, asking me, Shirlee Nickow, to come to the front of the plane.  When I got to the front I was asked to identify my bag and did.  I was handed my boarding pass with a sticker for baggage claim. When I got to the baggage pick up area - it was identified that the sticker had the name Caldwell/Tobiass - not Nickow as on the front of my boarding pass, and the name that they called out to come to the front of the plane - Shirlee Nickow.  Apparently my bag was now on a flight to London/Frankfort, Germany.  Very poor service but the agents that asked Shirlee Nickow  to identify bag, and tagged my bag.  It is now approx 20 hrs since my arrival at Ohare and all I am getting is text messages saying that I will receive texts every 12 hours.

Very displeased with your Salvadorean crew, I flew to San Salvador on Friday, 1 bag missing, they told me it will be delivered next day, is Monday and nothing, the worse is that the phone # that was given to me does not work, I needed my golf bag for yesterday and I'm still waiting, very dissatisfied
Because of delay we missed our connection The line up to rebook was at least an hour with 2 people manning the desk while 50 people waited inline.Completly unsatisfactory

We were delayed 3h because the plane was missing a pilot. The level of information given to passengers was very poor. The lack of pilot should have been communicated as soon as the company knew about it. Why board the flight on time if you already knew the pilot would be late? Why the company doesn't have enough back up in an important hub like Newark, especially after all the flight cancellations on Thursday (weather)?

The steward in first class with the longer grey hair was rude ( he wore no name tag) The stewardess Barbara Clarke was very rude made faces and was not a very nice person. We usually fly first class but to Florida we go economy plus and we can see the difference in attitude . She was so rude to the gentleman next to me for no reason . We were in the bulkhead seat and he had a bag on the floor. She could have asked him to just move it. Instead she made all kinds of facial expressions and she did the same to me when I had my purse on my lap  Totally uncalled for. Even when she was giving out drinks she was abrupt.

A gentleman tried to help me with my bag. It slipped & fell but on second try we got it in. But it went in side ways. Next thing I hear is the flight attendant (gray beard and no name tag) screaming at me to straighten my bag. Not once but twice.

The fact that you gave away our seats is APPALLING.  Again, I am diabetic.  Being away from my husband is NEVER acceptable.  NEVER.  I would not fly if I knew this was a possibility.  NEVER has this happened on other airlines and we travel EVERY year minimally 3 times, and ALWAYS over X-mas/New Years.  NOT OKAY!

It was delayed 2 hours and then once we got on the plane my husband and I were confined to our seats for another hour due to another hour delay. My husband had just had shoulder replacement surgery and he was very uncomfortable in the tight seat even though he is average built.

A tray of orange juice and champagne was accidentally spilled on my head before take-off. Myself and my seat were wet. The flight attendant was very apologetic and accommodating but the head supervisor of the business cabin never came by to address it. At one point I got the head supervisor's attention and asked her for a wet hot towel. She never brought me one and nor did she acknowledge or apologize for the spill. I had to ask another flight attendant for the wet hot towel. It was very upsetting.
For the second time in 6 months my flight to Chicago was delayed so much that I missed my connection to Zurich.

Direct TV is really a lousy entertainment option.  I used to look forward to the movie options on flights and the limited options for movies combined with the addition of a large number of programs that are horrible and I could access at home anyway is a huge disappointment.

flying United from Miami to Newark on Jan. 5, was the worst airline experience I have EVER had, bar none. I rarely fly United and will not do so in the future. We purchased full fare business class tickets from New York to Lima. Due to weather, our connecting flight was cancelled upon arrival in Miami on Jan. 3. we were then put on three different flights (all cancelled) and downgraded to the worst seats in economy (back of the plane) and neither ticketing agents or 1800United1 had any interest in compensation for the down grade. I was happy to fly coach in order to return to NYC but think it's criminal that no one at United had any interest/ability/desire to try and compensate me for the flights. to add insult to injury, I upgraded two seats to economy plus and HAD TO PAY FOR THE UPGRADE. I promise you, in 40 plus years of flying around the world, I've never been treated so poorly by an airline. you should be ashamed. Ellen stacy kramer
Incredibly unprofessional staff. I️ will never fly United Airlines again.
Poor food choice, no screens on flight

Check in at the airport was horrendous, it was like we were in a third world country. There was mass confusion, extreme waits to get to a computer and then having to wait for an employee to look at your bag size was outrageous and incredibly long wait times with rude staff. After security, the gate changed about 5 times and no one knew what was going out. Our plane was delayed and then after boarding we had to get off due to a mechanical issue that was clearly known about before we boarded. Horrible experience.

We normally fly Delta out of a local airport. Traveler is military and family gets gate passes to spend extra time together. Unable to get hate passes on this trip because lines were too long we were afraid there wouldn't be time.

Captain failed to inform passengers why the flight was late for departure. Kept us wondering . Announcing why we are late rather than kept us in the dark.  It took about 30-40 minutes before updating  us.

I usually get the notifications for flight departure time changes and gate changes but didn't for this day. I understand that weather was poor but the gate staff and flight attendant on the plane were equally frustrated and were not able to calm angry customers. This was a tense day.
The global service check in staff in Newark was slow, not really helpful, and not particularly nice at all. Very dissappointing.

Was very disappointed for the 3 hour delay for our flight. While I realize this is not entirely United’s fault, we got very few updates from the gate staff about delays, gate changes, and reasons for the delay. Also very little acknowledgement from the onboard crew for the 3 hour delay in take off
Gates were changed 3 times. No text or email information was given it was extremely stressful for a heart patient. Regards

Maybe it is a good idea to check the touchscreens aboard sometimes, because I had to press the screen really hard to choose movies etc and it was not so pleasant for the guy in front of me. It was in a 777-200. I had no problems with the touchscreen in the 767-400er when I was flying from Brussels to Newark.
Late late late  No information  Ridiculous
The significant delay in PBI was not pleasant.  We realize it was not the airline's fault yet the experience was not good.  Waiting 45 minutes for luggage delivery made it even more distasteful.

The communication regarding the delay was horrible.  I never received an email or any other type of communication. And I"m Global Services so imagine how your not so frequent traveler feels.  Baggage claim was a horror show.

Travellers should have remained in the gate waiting area in the airport rather than staying in the plane for over an hour Also there should be an automated feature that deactivates the screens at night when not in use as these scrwens were left on during the flight. This caused discomfort to others especially those who wished to sleep Something should have been done to avoid multiple gate changes at EWR. Gate changed from C133 to C88 then to C82. This meant customers having to u necessarily move from gate to gate every hour over large distances in some cases

This was the worst trip I have ever taken.  I missed my connection out of Port of Spain.  Those of us who missed our connections had to sit waiting for a representative for around 2 hours with no information about what was happening.  I am stuck in Port of Spain indefinitely until we can figure out a route to Caracas.  I am concerned that I am going to have to pay out of my own pocket for another ticket and accommodation which I can not afford.  United should be compensating me for my lost time and money.  If I would have known in advance of the delays I could have planned differently.  Now I am stuck here, I am going to be missing work, and I will potentially be paying hundreds of dollars to get home.
our bag got totally ruined and I didn't know you had to tell them at the airport.  now what do we do?

The ground crew was courteous, even though information was sporadic. The purser was pleasant but the rest of the crew seemed put out.  I fly United round trip at least twice a year because it’s convenient and I’ve never had serious issues before, but on this trip, I felt that the service would have been of infinitely higher standard if the flight were going to London or Paris.  The experience felt denigrating, as though ‘third world’ passengers weren’t worthy of courtesy. We had been grounded for well over an hour before anyone passed out small cups of water.  Communication while we were grounded was poor, and any information given was done so grudgingly. Immigration forms were reluctantly handed out when we were finally on our way.  The entire on plane experience felt insulting.

The personal seating space is very limited. I have not flown United in a while and was very disappointed at how much the leg room and seat spacing had been reduced. If the seating has been reduced that much, the seat backs should not be allowed  to recline!

The rebooking was difficult as I was traveling with my 9 year old granddaughter and in the automatic rebooking we were not booked in seats together. The UA kiosks would not let me change seats and then I had to wait in a long line only to find out I had to pay an extra $100 to sit next to my granddaughter. Given how much bad weather we all experience I do not see how you could allow a plane be to freeze thereby inconveniencing all those passengers. But to then be secretive and not brief us is criminal.
No I wrote how I am dissatisfied with all this trip earlier in review.

In the gate the United personal was extremely rude. I didn't have an seat assignment I don't know why, and the man at gate told me rudely to wait and stop asking him questions, when all I wanted to know was the reason why I didn't have a seat number in my boarding. Of course I wasn't the only passenger on that situation, and this man didn't bother to answer to any of us.
Baggage really got dirty. Luggage tags torn off. Looked like bags had really been through some bad situations v

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Horrsble, flight on Thursday was cancelt, nobody from UA has informed us, we had to catch the detailed information via call to partner Lufthansa, for the new flight on friday UA app was not able to check us in, flight on Friday was too late, gate was to small,service worse than Ryanair, very bad stewardesses, unfriendly, bad bad service, I will never fly again with UA

column26: AIRCRAFT LATE TO GATE DUE TO GATE AVAILABILITY
column79: Very disappointed about how rebooking my delayed flight was handled along with misdirected luggage.

For our connecting flight to Manchester being delayed while they loaded the remainder of the luggage onto the plane, mine never showed up. I’ve been told when I reported it that many of the bags were still in Newark. With our flight being the only one from Newark to Manchester yesterday (Jan 5), they said it may or may not be scheduled on tomorrow’s flight (the flight going out Jan 6 arriving Jan 7).   It just seemed to be one problem after another with my two flights on this airline. I’m extremely disappointed. Additionally we were told that if we missed our connecting flight the airline wouldn’t be able to put us up in hotels (essentially we were to find our own accommodations for the night).
Yes, not everyone at the airport in Newark was informative nor helpful with anything. No one seems to know what's going on and always a language barrier problem. Always! !

The cabin was a mess. The restrooms both ran out of paper towels, which quickly makes them gross. The holiday led to lots of young children traveling, one of which took to throwing all of her food in the aisle (mother also let her use video device without headsets, which flight attendant did nothing about). It was pretty chaotic and difficult.

The food was horrible! I had the chix salad for dinner and it was totally frozen. Both the chix and the veggies. Also we had confirmed seats with printed tickets. The gate knew we were delayed on another flight and they gave our seats to someone else so we were not able to sit together. This travel experience was very disappointing all the way around. It’s certainly no way to treat global services

I missed my connection by minutes, the gate agent should have contacted my connection gate agent and told them to wait a few minutes before closing the gate doors.  The EWR worker who briskly walked me to the connection gate was even surprised that they practically closed the gate doors on our faces.  I had to wait in a customer service line for 3 hours to get a hygiene kit, meal vouchers, and no hotel voucher because the blame was placed on air traffic control.  Being a premier member made no difference.  The agent was not even able to book me on a partner flight that left earlier than the next available United flight to Tel Aviv.  I tried to get on an earlier flight in Atlanta and a partner flight but I could not get through security in time for the earlier flight and the agent on the phone said she could not put me on a partner flight until my Newark flight was guaranteed to not meet my connection. Yesterday sucked really bad and nobody in EWR tried to make it any better.
No just that the delay could not be helped. Weather is always out of your control.

On top of bad communication on delay and sitting on tarmac for far too long both before and after the actual flight, there was a very rude flight attendant who did not even do the bare minimum of collecting my trash.
worst customer service that I ever experienced!!! My bag from Newark didn’t arrive to Tel Aviv and I wearing the same clothes for 4 days

Every time I travel untied there is a problem with the flight and I am always delayed for extended periods of time. I travel frequently and this is a frequent occurance that I am dissatisfied and frustrated with.
There were no pillows on the plane at all. Very inconvenient for a night flight.  The movie and TV options did not work.

flight was scheduled 7:48 PM. Notice that flight was delayed because of late inbound aircraft was given way too late at 6:00 PM. New boarding was set to 9:25 PM. No notice was given about further delay. Pax waited at gate for almost another two hours without information about new departure time. Flight took off 11:20 PM. Almost 3 1/2 hours late.

Not only that the cabin was filthy lost a piece of luggage did not receive it was supposed to return it the next day and never did  we paid for first class and we believe we should have first-class service have a handicap son very   Lost a piece of luggage did not receive it was supposed to receive it the next day still haven't received it we paid for a first class we deserve FirstClass service have a handicap son and was not comfortable at all

Very DISSATISFIED that my priority tagged luggage did not make my flight after checking in 4 hours prior to my flight and had to actually go and pick my luggage up from Data Rush Shipping in Houston after waiting two days for delivery.  And had a similar experience on my flight from Houston to Newark where I had to wait for the next inbound flight to retrieve my lugguage.....United baggage personal told me that they would add 6000 miles to my Mileage Plus account and have not seen those miles posted, as of yet......

Unreasonable 2 hour delay - first told this was due to loading baggage, then given all kinds of excuses. Arrived at 1:30 am  in Phoenix, was unable to check into my hotel and missed my rental car pickup due to late delay. Just terrible.
Stuck for 3 nights paid for my own hotel. No help offered, stood in line for 2 1/2 hours for checking. Had to run to boarding gates for flights. Ground staff very rude.
You lost my luggage, please be quick to return it, unprofessional way to do things
Food service is very poor as compared to Lufthansa and other airlines. Portions are also very small for a 14 hours flight. There no choice to food either. It was only Indian food available on board.
Flight attendant in first class was not pleasant and seemed annoyed by simple requests. Took 45 minutes to get a beverage.
1. Could send delay notices via text 2. It's your gate in charlotte for us to wait 40 minutes because your other plane didn't push back is lame

Awful. Boarding then sitting on the tarmac for 4 hours was a waste of our time. Seeing the baggage handlers load the baggage of the plane next to us, even though that plan had not boarded at all, was dumb. I felt there were to many excuses for our delay. There are flights that leave out of colder airports than Newark and one of the "excuses" that we received was that the baggage handlers had to get warmed up before continuing to load baggage onto our plane, after they had loaded baggage onto the other plane.

baggage was backed up with bags that missed.  We asked if we had to wait, they said no and gave us a number to call.  When we called they told us we were supposed to wait in line (at 1:30am with children) to file the report.  They did relent, but wasn't the best customer service.
It was the worst waiting experience of my travel history in 20 years.
Horrible experience

We waited to board for people who were late which is unacceptable. Passengers on the plane were inconvenienced and were kept waiting because of other people’s tardiness. We had to wait for 1 1/2 hours for our baggage in Newark. Absolutely awful.
The ONLY really negative thing about it was the baggage issue (many bags were delayed in coming out to the passengers), which was caused by the extremely cold weather.

The crew for this flight was stuck in Savannah, GA.  This was known well in advance but not announced until time to board and that there would be a 2 1/2 hour delay and no other crews were available.  This shows very poor planning on United's part as far as not being courteous to your customers and exhibits a disregard for the value of their time.  If announced earlier, we could have made alternative plans and not been stuck in a small terminal at the airport for such a long time.  Once the crew did arrive, they had to spend 20 minutes tracking down a gate agent in order to do their pre-flight work.

We were delayed an hour because luggage from a connecting international flight was misplaced, but the captain and crew provided us with updates often and let us know exactly why we were delayed and what our expected updated departure time was. Because the pilot kept us informed, it kept passengers from being overly upset about the delay. Very professional, even though he had no control over the reason for delay, it was appreciated.
I would never recommend United

I was extremely disappointed once I entered the aircraft. the space foe the seats were extremely tight. I have never been so uncomfortable on a flight in my life. i felt like a sardine in a can.I will not fly united again
The quality of the food provided for dinner was poor. The meat had no flavor neither the potatoes

Hi,   I am writing to you in reference to a lost baggage  while I was flying out from Houston to New Delhi via Newark.   The flight number from Houston to Newark was UA-1945 and from Newark to New Delhi, was UA-82 on Jan 5, 2018.   I had my son accompanying me and had no problems for his checked in suitcase at Delhi.   The baggage had the bar code number as 6016959623.  For the lost baggage, I had filed a complaint too at the New delhi airport that has the reference number as DEL17532M.  Please let me know if you can provide me any update about the status of the baggage and any telephone numbers that I can try and reach you guys up for following.   Thanks, Nishant
Very crappy Wifi/Internet service... I spent the whole flight trying to watch something through the app... a waste of 2 hours...
the check in desk is lousy and very confusing

This was the worst in flight service I ever experienced. The attendants spent more time socializing in the galley than tending to the first class passengers. I don’t think I have ever rang the call button that many times.
Luggage!  Frustrating!  We sat at gate and were told it was to load luggage.   We got to BWI and no one got their luggage.  Getting updates on lost luggage is frustrating

They delayed takeoff because they were waiting on about 40 bags that they had to bring over from Terminal C to where we were in Terminal A. That was fine, since they knew we would all want our bags. Then they took off, so we assumed the bags were loaded. When we got to baggage claim in BWI at 11PM, only to find out that those bags didn't make it onto the flight after all. They knew there was a delay and even ANNOUNCED it to us but then decided to leave without them?? And they didn't even say anything to us when they made that decision, instead letting us get to baggage claim and find out? That's really discourteous and unprofessional.  Then, I had to wait in line for an hour when it was already so late just to give the people at the counter my address so that they could get the bags to me. They could have talked to us on the plane about that or had extra attendants come help. I tried calling the airline and it took almost that whole hour just to get an answer - and they just said they couldn't do anything to arrange shipping so we would have to continue waiting in that single slow-moving line. The whole thing was just very badly organized and a terrible way to treat people.
I was NOT happy that I had to pay for WiFi for my daughter to do HOMEWORK

The delay thing was pretty annoying. I wish they would have updated soon the delays so I could have changed my flight to the next day. Also we sat in the plane at gate for like 30 minutes with no update about why we were supposed to leave at 10:30 and ended up departing until after 11 at night. I barely ha a ride home by the time we landed in detroit. Also in detroit they had two flights on carousel 2 in baggage claim including ours but for whatever reason bags from our flight including my bag were on the wrong carousel and no announcement or placard was on carousel 3 that any bags should have been there. My suitcase litterally was disgusting and dirty as if someone tossed it on the floor or ground. Pretty annoying! Would love to be updated why we are constantly getting delayed and ahead of time knowing that the flight is delayed so late.

The purpose of my trip to Brazil was a job interview. My initial itinerary was departing from Denver on Wednesday (Jan 3rd) doing connection in EWR. Due to United technical problems in Denver I got 3 minutes later at the my boarding gate in EWR. The aircraft took more 10 minutes to leave the gate. United knew that my flight was getting there just in time, but I was left behind. With that being said, I was forced to stay in EWR for 2 days because of the snow storm. After these 2 days I finally boarded to Brazil. However, my luggage did not arrive along with my flight. Actually It took one week to be delivered to address in Brazil, but I am back in the USA. It is creating a big problem

My two baggage’s were lost and I am still waiting for the delivery of them to my home 33hours after filing the report.  The www.united.com/bagtrack was not helpful. The phone line 281-821-3526 always busy.

It was delayed 2 hours - but because of operation issues and not having the right staff. So by the time I arrived at BTV 1:00am I had no ride and had to take a taxi 30+ miles back home adding more expense to the trip.
Horrendous, cramped, dreadful food, outdated films, grumpy staff.

Gate agents in Newark were hostile and irrational. They were so rude and unreasonable that once on the plane other travelers that I did not know came up to me and told me I showed incredible patience in dealing with them. Those gate agents should be fired.

Yes!  I’m a TSA PRE CHECK passenger with a KTN.  I’ve flown out of EWR many times,  but this time I had a problem finding the TSA pre check area and (with a sore foot from an accident) I ended up walking very far away from where I was supposed to check in.  I felt the signage was  very poor and had to ask at the regular economy check in where theTSA was and it was behind me,  so I had to walk all the way back to where I’d been.  This wasn’t a time problem as I was plenty early for my 22:00 flight.  It was definitely poor signage. The rest of the airport experience was normal and I felt very fortunate to have gotten re-booked on a flight home to Chicago the day after the snowstorm and thousands of cancellations on the East coast.

The fact we sat delayed for 3 hours before the flight was switched to the next day is worst mismanagement I have experienced flying. I will never fly united again. The stress of scrambling for a hotel after midnight with 300+ ppl doing the same was awful. All of which could have been prevented if united had the proper staff to fly on hand to fly the plane that night.  Not the crazy to ask to have a standby crew at one of THE biggest hubs in the United States.

It was very disappointing to have waiting at the gate for a two hour delay only to have the flight cancelled when the aircraft arrived. I later learned that the plan was used for another flight. I cannot express how disappointed  I am in in your airline for this blatant disregard for the customer experience.

There was terrible communication regarding the reasons for the 12 hr delay on this flight. How do you not have a system in place that prevents “illegal” flight times for pilot and crew? For united to wait until the inbound flight arrived, for them to finally say “sorry there’s a legal crew issue” is ridiculous. We were all there waiting for our flight, they delay it 2.5 hrs “due to the inbound flight,” and then all of the sudden realize there’s a legal issue with the crew?? That’s the dumbest thing I’ve ever experienced. So disorganized. I’ve never experienced this with any other airline and I fly more than 3x a month! ON TOP OF THAT, when we finally board, How do you not have any cleaning supplies or wipes on board? My tray table was disgusting from the flight before and the flight attendants said there was nothing they can do about it. What a joke. An absolute joke of an airline. It’s a shame.

What's wrong with United? You delayed flight 415 five times, until you posted a 1:05 am departure. The crew lined up, the passengers lined up. Then you suddenly said, oops, the flight is cancelled and will take off 10:30 a.m. on 1/6/18. The gate attendant said there was no pilot available. How could you not know there would be no pilot? Couldn't you have told us a lot earlier so we could get on another flight or get a hotel? Why did you wait until the end of the night? Terrible. The line for hotel vouchers was so long I gave up and booked my own hotel.

The Security Checkpoint Staff told me wrongly that I needed the ETA to get into Canada. After I insisted that I had the Student Visa and my passport with the Canadian Visa the guy told me that I would have a problem with the Immigration without the ETA.  He was wrong and gave me (and to others travelers that I talked to, they complained about the same mistake) an incorrect information. When we have the Student Visa we DO NOT need the ETA to get in Canada.

It was not very clear that our ticket was. Basic economy ticket, so having to pay for a carry on bag at checkin was ridiculous especially when there was ample room in the overhead compartments. I also felt that the two middle seats that we had did not allow for adequate foot room. I will no longer be flying with united airlines given that the cost of the basic economy flight was not substantially cheaper than a southwest flight, which would have allowed us to carry on our small carry on luggage and check in bags if we needed to.
Check-in is rather chaotic, with the line to use the booths mixed with the line for baggage drop and the line for regular check-in. It got very confusing and I'm not sure it really saves time

Kids, yes, I'm talking to you kids who think this is the way to do a survey.  It's not.  You need to ask your questions and have a lot of room for the details.  You don't know why I wouldn't recommend United.  I selected that I wouldn't recommend United but you didn't ask why.  I don't recommend airlines.  Most people just go online and find the ticket that is the cheapest and meets their minimum requirements.  All of the planes have less room.  The seats recline one inch, it seems.  Everything is a la carte, which is fine.  The TSA areas have nothing to do with you, so why ask us?  But this flight was not normal because of the bad weather.  I was emailed from United, saying I could change my flight.  I tried.  I called and was connected to someone whom I didn't understand because English was not their first language.  I think it's great that bi-lingual people work, and it's sad that most Americans only speak English.  But I have to be able to understand the words.  Then I asked if I could change my flight to the following day.  I was told the flight I wanted was full in economy.  There were first class seats available but I was not offered them, even with paying to upgrade.  It seems when you call customer service, you're talking to someone who is looking at the same screen you can see online.  Next time you want to find out what people think, first, fly for yourself.  Ask yourself what you would change.  Then, if you insist on polling people, have a paid phone interview.  That's how adults talk.

I think it awful to charge for tv when it obviously readily available especially on a flight over 2 hrs. And if you are going to charge Do Not play it at all as a teaser. Also the seat was too narrow and too hard did not have enough cushion. Lastly, one cup - less than 8 oz of a beverage and 1 bag of pretezals on a flight over 4 hrs is also in poor taste in my opinion. Had not flown United in years - was reminded of exactly why not on this trip.

Our first class flight attendant disappeared after the first food service and did not surface until it was time to land. But that was the least awful thing to occur with this flight. Because there was equipment clutter at the gate when we arrived, our pilot would not pull in until after ground crew came out to better organize the carts, even though the weather was extremely cold. The ground crew then retaliated and did not unload our checked bags in a timely manner. Without anyone giving an explanation to the passengers waiting for their bags in the baggage claim area, we waited over 50 minutes at baggage claim before the suitcases started coming down the carousel and then the priority tagged bags arrived last. This was poor cooperation and communication between crews. As a result, we missed our connecting flight to Chicago, even though that flight was delayed by 15 minutes and was at a conveniently located gate. This whole fiasco cost us valuable time and inconvenience, plus the cost of a private car trip to LaGuardia to catch another flight to Chicago since everything out of Newark to Chicago was booked for the day and we would have had to stay in a hotel somewhere overnight. Shame on United personnel. We know the conditions were extremely cold but there was little consideration given to the needs of you intransit passengers. There were 4 of us traveling together, two of us with Global Services status. When we got to LaGuardia we had to rearrange our suitcases so that our non-status travel companion would not have to pay to check her bag.  United has to cope with extreme cold weather on a regular basis, so there should be good systems in place for bad cold weather working conditions. Our experience with this flight from Lima, Peru to Newark was truly an example of extremely poor customer service pushed on already tired intercontinental travelers.

2 less than memorable experiences before & after the flight: 1. Departure was 1 hr delayed. Crew made up time in-flight & landed @ 7:30am in Newark, but then, 2. there was a 30-minute delay in unloading bags from plane (flight #1005), so make-up time was lost/wasted due to delay.

I normally don’t answer surveys, but the amount of people, or lack thereof, that United had to assist with the check-in process was pathetic. At the kiosk check-in, all 12 people at machines needed an attendant and only 1 was available to help. People had gotten so frustrated that they started yelling - truly embarrassing. Step your game up.
Loss of luggage apparently for no reason. Very disappointed with the service.

The flight was delayed because of weather but we were not given good estimates for arrival so could not re-book on continuing flight at an appropriate time. I missed my continuing flight because the baggage was very late. I to go on standby and my travel companion and I were separated. The Supervisor at the Mileage Plus Gold helpdesk was very UNhelpful.
Staff at ticket counter were not very helpful. When I asked for assistance I was told to read the signs. There were no directions with lines for checking in
The new thinner seats on aircrafts are incredibly uncomfortable. Bad ergonomics. I have been in pain for days from just a 3 hour flight.

We paid more than 3.000,- USD for four tickets in Coach just to learn at the check-in that we will have to pay 135,- USD on top for the luggage. This was not clear when we made the booking.   In addition, the ground staff at Fort Myers made us re-arrange our whole luggage because two out of five pieces were slightly (0.3 lbs) above the 50 lbs limit. I find this unacceptable, especially because I am a Star Alliance Gold Card holder!  Even worse: when we re-checked in the exact same pieces of luggage at Newark, they all were 2 lbs lighter!!! Either they have magically lost weight during the flight or someone ripped us off in Fort Myers...   What a shame!

The agent we checked bags withwas extremely rude and unhelpful. She was angering multiple customers. We waited over an hour and a half in line, and when we finally demanded to speak to someone we were tolditwas too late to check bags

my flight was delayed twice, then cancelled and rebooked 2 days later which set my travel plans back. I was not compensated for this major inconvenience and am dissatisfied with United for this reason.
Jan 4 Flights were cancelled because of bad weather.we got tickets on Jan 6 with seat upgrade.
This flight was fine but I paid two sets of change fees for earlier flights (before weather) and all flights were canceled and got back 2 days after mtg I was going back for.   Very disappointing
The baggage check-in was horrifying.  A completely chaotic, disorganized mob scene.  Waited for 45 minutes to check in 1 bag.  Horrible check-in service
I was extremely frustrated with the line I encountered at Logan to check-in. I had to wait in line for over an hour to get my ticket.

My only negative was that my partner has the United card to get entrance into the United club and we mostly travel together. I have the Explorer card and get 2 passes a year which, as you know , cannot be used now due to construction of Polaris clubs. I feel this is not customer friendly nor not it engender good will. Particularly since I do have 400K frequent flyer miles. I know space is limited but I wasn’t happy not to be able to use my passes on one of the only 2 trips I will likely take this without my partner ( last year about 12-13 trips , this year probably 8)

This was the worst flight experience in my 30+ years of flying. I expect something to be done to remedy my concerns and make sure this doesn't happen again. My family may not fly United again because of this, unless something major is done.
The Syracuse staff did a horrible job of handling weather delays. They were rude and incompetent, and levied blame onto the passengers.
The flight attendants (several) were not courteous, and not helpful

The agent at the heck in counter was extremely helpful. My flights were delayed so bad that I wasn’t going to make it to my final destination before even leaving Halifax. But the agent worked all the options he could and I ended up arriving in Honolulu earlier than anticipated.

I saw the impending weather and called to see if I could change my flight to a day earlier, they told me yes but I would have to pay the $500. Not even an journalist later my flight was cancelled and I had to spend 90 minutes on hold to change my flight that I had tried to change before all the mayhem. They then informed me the next flight they could get me on wasn’t for 3 DAYS! To say I was pissed was an understatement. To make matters worse the flight was cancelled 12 hours prior to take off and in the morning when the flight was supposed to be the weather wasn’t even bad, and other flights were able to leave from the exact same airport. I then called back the next day and miraculously there was a whole list of new, earlier flights that I could take. It is ridiculous that you cannot change your flight on the website when their is a travel waiver without paying a fee. I was extremely disappointed in United costumer service and will certainly think twice about traveling with you again especially in the winter time.

Firstly, you delayed my flight five hours due to your own negligence.  Secondly, the agent who checked me in only gave me a boarding pass for one of my three legs.  She told me to get my other two boarding passes in Chicago.  Thirdly, the agent who checked me in gave me the wrong baggage claim ticket.  I discovered this because the bag was checked only to SFO.  An agent in SFO noticed the name on the baggage claim did not match my name.

Nonwherlchair to meet my disabled mother at either airport even though she requested both. Aircraft was old. Seat material was old and cracked. No tv. Plastic cups upon boarding. No extras. Just a mediocre meal. Cereal was offered. Cereal, really. This is first class.

Delay was 3 hrs but could have been only 2hrs.  Flight was finally ready to board at 830 yet the crew had miscommunications several times about the number of passengers on board, there was confusion due to a broken seat in 1A, luggage was not loaded on the plane.  It had be offloaded then reloaded and gate checked bags were almost forgotten.  We waited on the plane for over 45min before we left the gate.  Given there was already a delay of 2hrs one would think baggage, passenger count etc could have been done much more quickly
Many thanks to the outside ground crew.  Horrendous weather outside. Brutal cold.

This new Basic Economy is terrible. I couldn’t check in in advance and had to check my bag. I also had to board last. I’m extremely dissatisfied, and I plan to avoid flying United at all costs in the future. This nickel and diming is so frustrating. Treat me like a human being and a customer, not cattle.

The new GS checkin is not really great. Take the elevator down a level and then fight your way to weave through dozens of people. Please bring back the old old location which had the door that dropped right into the TSA line.
No room in seats and I'm only 5/10 very uncomfortable if the person in front seat reclined It would be terrible. Will fly United only as last resort.

Initial weight of my bag was 6 lbs over.  100 bucks extra.  Asked to take my unpowered harmless drill on board.  She said no, can't.  Other airlines have ignored a couple pounds.  Mind you i don't play the carry on game and had my phone and a jacket.   Meanwhile people are carrying double the weight.  Initially i was in line for a minute and the nice lady pulled me up to a closed scale as others were backe up.  I pull a pair of boots out and am under weight.  Go get in line.  The nice lady now has a line even though she was not open.  I get in a marked on the screen lane that says baggage drop.  Stand there, the lady apparently had a more important customer takes awhile with them, looks at the 5 of us and says" baggage drop is at that lane pointing next to her with the same screen as hers.  Now i am getting close to check deadline.  Finally drop my bag and was good to go.  Some people missed the deadline.  Shouldn't take 20 minutes.  I am really empathetic to all service employees.  What she did was ridiculous rude and not cool.

I was one of the first people to use the restroom and it was filthy.  Smelled like someone had urinated all over the floor.  Also my tray table was dirty.  Would it kill them to wipe them off between flights?

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: Fire the entire staff at Newark baggage handlers.    Lost my bag on the way to Milwaukee and whe. It was found 30 hours later - my meetings were either delayed or cancelled.  Entire trip was a waste of time , money and business.        Btw on the returm the bags were delayed as well.   50 minutes.    Newark is the worst.    Considering flying delta out of Philadelphia

I was surprised that there weren't any screens on the flight.  I couldn't get the free wifi to work.  I'm pregnant and I needed my husband to help me make a decision on what would go in the over head compartment but he was helping my other 3 children.  The flight attendant seemed irritated when I told him this.  There weren't any signs posted on where to pick up our luggage and I never heard an announcement on which carousel to pick up the luggage.  I had to find a luggage worker to figure it out.  Then it was a hike to get there.  Not an easy flight at all.

no priority lane at check in or security, no web check in possible so my requested upgrade fell through as people with less or no status got upgraded before i even could check in! no club, pop up was a disaster.. no food at all, not even oatmeal or sandwiches! not worth the far walk! than no food on the plane, not even for purchase! no wifi, no power! just complete dissatisfaction for 75k platinum member!

The baggage claim process at Newark was horrendous.  we waited 45 minutes for the bags to begin to arrive on the carrousel.  When they eventually did, despite the fact that we were supposed to receive priority baggage handling, we were among the last 10 or so passengers to receive our bags.  We had to pay a penalty to the car service which picked us up because the driver had to wait so long.
The first class flight attendant was not helpful or friendly. She also spent her time hanging in the back of the plane with the coach flight attendants.
I have a United Milage Plus visa and still charged for my one checked bag. That is wrong. Also, my sister and I had our seats changed with no notification and for no apparent reason.
My luggage was lost, my vacation ruined. My vital medicine was lost with the luggage
The flight was fine. No problems but I really think that you need to stop charging for tv/movies, 4 plus hour flight-its international and charging for s movie is rediculous.?

O'Hare was crazy. You would think people were just showing up to buy tickets and that United was completely taken by surprise by the volume, but I doubt it. We had to check a bag. Check-in machines were broken. There were no lines. People did not know where to go. It was chaos. And the few United staff available to help looked completely overwhelmed. And TSA was its usual rude and discourteous self, patronizing the customers and expecting them to know that there was a change in security procedures (e.g., being yelled at not to take off our shoes or not to take out laptops when we've been doing that ever since 9/11.)

1° - perdimos una maleta y pasaron 24 hs sin respuesta de la misma 2° - en check-in no hay gente que hable español y pueda ayudarte como corresponde, es más, te maltrataban, como si fuésemos un problema para ellos  3° - el avión parecía más uno de cabotaje que de un vuelo internacional
Lady at United Club rude and unpleasant
Auston back to Newark was TERRIBLE

The only time I have felt more cramped was during my basic training, the seats are absolutely abysmal compared to Delta, more expensive than southwest, and lower quality than greyhound busses. I will say the aircrew was on point, but your planes are miserable.
Very disappointed with baggage check-in and gate staff in Denver.  Attitude adjustment needed.
Check in was horrible. Don't understand why online checking is not allowed. Also my return flight was delayed for 3 hours for maintenance issues which is unacceptable.

There is mass confusion upon entering check in area. There is no guidance, no attendants available. There is no order anywhere, no lines.  When I got there, I didnt Know Where To Go. I Didnt Know Where The Lines Started Or Ended. People Were All Over The Place Trying To Take Care Of Their Travel. The Mass Chaos Was Bad For Me. Imagine How it Would Feel For First TIme Travelers And People Traveling With Infants.  The only employee i interacted with was the attendant who collected my baggage and that only lasted all of three minutes. This was a very uncomfortable experience.
Wrong Jamaican immigration forms were given, causing us to refill out at the airport.  Also wrong info posted on baggage claim area.

Newark personal at the area of premier acess are very rude with costumersas the guys that take the lugagge to put it in the band are also extremly rude and they dont speak good english barely you could understand anything
Flight was late --- maintenance... but communication at the gate was horrible. Plus... the area at the gate had almost no heat.... it was freezing.
Your seats are ridiculously small and uncomfortable.

I flew from Newark to San Francisco for business and checked 2 suite cases full of information for a conference. When I arrived at my hotel I realized that the lock on one of my suite cases had been removed. It is not in my suite case, there is no TSA note saying they accessed my suite case and at least one item was stolen from my suite case. The items was a small speaker and cord. I am trying to file a complaint with United Airlines costumer service.
Seats in the last row were very uncomfortable. Disappointed no tv or even music

You lost the golf bag. We have been lied to and promised call backs. Nothing. We have found out that the bag is laying in the storage room and is just sitting there. No one cares. You have completely disappointed us. No personal touch. It may be time to fly with another airline. We have been loyal customers, but you do not treat us as such. If you give a damn at all, you can respond at Jozee3@ optonline.net. Very unhappy.
Gate agent forced us in group 4 to check our bags but when I got to my seat nearly all the overhead bins were empty but they wouldn't allow us to retrieve bags.

my original flight was cancelled, so it took me 29 hours to get home and i still do not have one of my bags and i have been home for almost 48 hours now.  i can not get through on the phone to the SJD baggage office and i am wondering when i will see my bag.  i have also sent an email as indicated on my report slip, but no answer there either.  i realize the weather was the factor here, but when we were about to push back from newark to leave for SJD, the delayed to take some bags off of customers that did not board - clearly, the wrong bags were taken off, so that mistake has nothing to do with the weather - amistake made by baggage personnel!

Was the worst flying experience of my life.  United was a mess from airport arrival till they never sent all 5 checked bags of ours.  Made no effort to bring our bags on a later flight that day.  My son has special needs with eating and we experienced great difficulties when his bag with all his needs were inside didnt arrive at destination.  Could not get one supervisor on the phone after numerous attempts.  It seemed like no one carred about our bags and our sons needs. This is the first time I ever write a review that’s how disgusted I am with this experience.

I used to get checkin reminder emails but this time I did not. Also, when the flight was delayed I wasn’t notified via text or email when I had been on previous flights. Also the gate didn’t update the delays quickly enough in real time. Your seats don’t recline enough like other airlines: American Airlines, British Aireays, etc. I’m basically too vertical to sleep bc my head keeps falling forward when I’m teying to sleep. Annoying
The flight was apparently given 6 breakfast meals, for a full flight that didn't arrive in St. Lucia until 3 PM.  That is incompetence.

It takes a long time to get your baggage in SF. The internet connection was dismal and is never like this on Delta. It cut out over and over again, making a movie almost impossible to watch and making the work connection impossible. It is a long flight and I use it to work. When the internet keeps cutting out, I cannot do this and my time is wasted.

New plane with pressure problems along with no communication about why we were delayed. Also the check in process was a disaster with multi step process.   I was late to my appointment and I feel United’s weak apology just doesn’t cut it. I am very disappointed
I WANT MY LUGGAGE!!! I STILL HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THE HELL THE BAGGAGE AGENT PUT MY CAR SEAT BAG!! VERY DISAPPOINTED IN THE BAGGAGE HANDLING
The gate was not a positive experience. The 2 hour delay did not help but there is not even close to enough room to board the flight by the groups that you use
The worst flight/aircraft/food/service out all the airlines we had flown.

The flight attendants were not attentive. I flew first class and found the service sorely lacking. It was an 8:40 flight that took a hour and a half. The food service was a cold muffin, I found that appalling. There was no drink service before we were in the air. Nobody took my coat until we left the gate!  Flying first class should have extra perks, where were they?  I received nothing for the additional cost. The leg room was cramped, I was unable to cross my legs.  The flight attendants were so concerned about everyone’s carryon luggage and service was non existent.

Whilst I understand that severe weather conditions may have caused baggage delays from plane to baggage claim. As a bag tagged with priority, I waited one and a half hours, for my bag to be one of the last to arrive at the hall. Disappointed in the priority service.
The seat configuration in first class was very strange.  We flew backward.  Very  uncomfortable  and we were in 3A and 3B the light from the kitchen shown in my face the entire night.

It was extremely frustrating to be delayed over 12 hours then to have changes in the gate assignment that were not pushed through the app that I had just downloaded the day before in preparation for our trip. We had to scramble through a crowded airport to get to the correct gate that still displayed flight information from Paris. We had no choice but to sit on the floor for an additional hour before the flight was ready to board. In flight there were no issues but it was extremely upsetting once we landed in LA that one was f our bags were missing. We had to wait in a long line to fill out a report and did not get to our hotel until after 5 am. The bag did not show up until after 2:30 pm the following day. I had a number to call that indicated my bag was in route but did not receive any text updates. I had to purchase some items since I was not sure if I would receive my bag.
Our flight was 12 hours delayed and it was delay upon delay for this trip. Very dissatisfying

Our bags still have not arrives and we ha e received NO information despite emailing that there is medicine in the bags and repeatedly checking. We only got through to a baggage rep once and that was after waiting 35,minutes,utes on hold. You are in danger of losing a large family of customers. Lost baggage reference number BON11378M.
Newark airport is just a difficult place airport to utilize. Its dirty, terminal staff is not helpful. I despise flying out of there.

My bags did not make it on the flight, despite the fact that they were tagged  priority.  Apparently almost 20 bags did not make it including our flight   The most frustrating part is that we cannot get any answers as to the status of our bags. It has been over 24 hours!  We have called numerous times and are left on hold forever.  In addition, we are stranded at a hotel on vacation with nothing other than jeans and a sweater...we are in the Caribbean.  I am a loyal United flyer and a Platinum status member. The frustration level is incredible and service from United horrific. I expect to be covered for expenses and beyond. This is my one vacation per year with my wife and it is being ruined.  United seems to not care in the least

United ruined our vacation. We are currently three days into a five day vacation without luggage. I have spent hours and hours on hold and on the phone trying to get someone to help me. Awful just awful. Worst travel experience ever.
Your airport was a disaster!! The fligh almost felt me, becasuse I spent 2hours doing lines!! I dont even know why you have check in online, if its not working!!!

Due to delay, baggage did not make flight with me. It took OVER 48 HOURS to get my luggage to me. It should have make several flights from ORD to YYC  but it did not. Beyond me why. This really messed up first two days of my vacation....!!!!!!!   Really mad...... : (

The whole issue with the Kiosk ruined my experience. My cards were declined, and I had cash to pay for my baggage. Only when I wasted 15 minutes being sent to the wrong Lobby areas due to rude Travel Agents/Assitants- someone directed me to additional services. There I was charged to pay an extra 5$ only because I had issue with the Kiosks. The employees at United Additional Services were making rude comments and laughing in my face about my assumption of "not having enough money" because my cards declined and making it a joke. I know Chicago isn't a  place for Southern Hospitality like in Texas but I am hesitant about flying this airline again.
Frustrating experience at Denver with luggage loaded to wrong baggage area and then a subsequent luggage jam because no one had been taking luggage off.

When I purchased my ticket I didn’t have a seat assigned. When I tried to check in on line, I was not able to get the seat. When I got to the airport I was told my seat will be assigned at the gate area. When I got to the gate the customer service guy told me that there were not seats available, to come back in one hour, which it would be the departure time. When I tried to reason with him, explaining my dad was very ill and I thought I had a seat guaranteed when I bought the ticket he gave me a peace of yellow paper showing the right the airlines have to overbook the flights and rudely told me to move from the counter and let him do his job. I was in tears. Even when he assigned a seat he never let me know. This is the worse traveling experience I ever had. The attendant was rude, un compassionate and total disregard for my circumstances
Awful food - don’t provide it if it’s going to be that bad

We are 3 days into our vacation and our bags have not arrived. They were left in Newark and we have no clothes, no bathing suits, no toiletries,. 3 days is beyond ridiculous. We paid over 5 grand for our trip and you are incompetent as an airline and I will never fly your airline again. I will be sharing my story on social media to tell how bad of an experience we had. How do you not hustle and get us our luggage. It is unacceptable to treat people like this. Screw you united airlines!

My baggage has been held up in Newark. I have nothing at all for my vacation. I was supposed to receive it a day late, but it also did not make any flights today. Your service line is not getting me an estimate on when I will receive my bag, and the answer I recdived is i "maybe" getting it tomorrow. You have completely ruined my $3000+ vacation.
Horrible. Check all screens and headphone jacks.

Flight was ok, but on third day of no luggage and no resolution from United. Extremely dissatisfied and will not be recommending to other. Worst experience, and United is not helping to make up for this.

My bag has been missing. I have had to call to get a status and it has not been good. As of this morning, my bag was still not put on a flight. I am here for a business meeting. $200 travel expense does not even begin to cover expenses for replacement, I can’t wash my hair, as I don’t have the appropriate tools, I don’t have makeup, shoes business clothes, etc. I can’t believe that there have been at the least 5 flights since the one I took and my bag wasn’t put on one of them. Most of the baggage customer service people have not been helpful.
Crew was not ready for flight had to search for headphones not interested in passengers and cabin looked unkempt and tired extremely uncomfortable.

The fact that it took so long to find another plane is unacceptable. Had this been a weekday where something previous had been planned and I depended and needed to get home by 10:55 like originally planned, it would have been a disaster. I understand that things go wrong and come up, but something should have been done a lot sooner. I had been up since 3 to get on a plane in Tampa. I was tired and hungry and had no clue about the vouchers until it was nearly time to get on the plane. Then it wasn't even explained to me that it was a food voucher, so I didn't even use it. Also the flight attendant did not card the young gentleman sitting next to me when he ordered a beer. I don't know what your policy is under that, but he looked young enough to be carded for sure. Also the plane was tiny and extremely uncomfortable, especially after sitting in an airport for over 5 hours.

Long flight delay, one hour on tarmac, other planes taking off around us, why is that? The attendant in the back of the plane was a real bitch to all the customers, someone needs to give her an attitude adjustment, I have flown over two thousand times in my life and she was one of the top five worst in my experience...and in my other flying mates experience as well... Finally your luggage team broke the handle on my bag, and it was not overweight, that really pissed me off, I never bother with claims because they are stacked against me. So all in all I think I will go out of my way to NOT fly united in the future...
The only negative was that we were 30 minutes late due to a long delay on the runway at OHare

4 1/2 hour flight and only snack boxes were available. No sandwiches. Also, would it kill you to provide free movie viewing on such a long flight? Recently flew American from Chicago to Ft Lauderdale and they offered about 20 movies and other programs at NO CHARGE.

I am Premier 1K and I checked 3 bags, all with Priority tags. 2 bags were delivered upon arrival at FLL, one bag was missing.  How does something like that happen?  My missing suitcase was not delivered to my hotel in Miami until 3am, 13 hours after my arrival in a destination with many flights.  I am not pleased with my experience.

Flight was delayed in the usual way: at the gate UAL employees said first 30 minutes, then another thirty minutes, then another thirty minutes. This went on from 6:30pm until 11pm. At 11pm, as the plane we had been waiting for for more tan four hours was at the gate, we were told the flight was cancelled. We asked for explanations and the gate employees said there was no explanation, telling us "Flights have to be cancelled sometimes, write to United if you are unhappy about that". Same employee told us not to bother with customer assistance at gate A22 because the line was very long already - she suggested we take a shuttle to terminal C to then get to gate 90 for customer assistance! The whole process showed terrible disregard for the customers. PS the gate employees kept telling us about our flight being "OK in another half-hour" even though flightaware.com was already telling us that the incoming aircraft would be two hours late ... on the basis of information from United! Incredible.

The cabin, my seat in particular, was filthy. There was chocolate or something on my headrest cover, salt or sugar or some other substance all over the area with the cup holder, next to the seat, etc. I had wipes in my bag and wiped it all down before sitting down. It was disgusting and disappointing. The floor was also very dirty. The cabin should be cleaned much more thoroughly - the dirty seat and seat area detracted from the experience.

It was already a chao at step 1 when people were lining up for the baggage tag at the kiosk. Not all people know how to use those kiosk and not enough staff to help. In the result, the line for kiosk was long. Even I had done my check-in and paid my check-in baggage online, it still took me 40 minutes to reach a kiosk. Secondly, long line to drop the checked bag and I saw your staff was giving unclear instruction to a few passengers to where they should drop their checked bags. Thirdly, another long lines to go security check. The staff stopped the line and re-directed the line and I ended up following one line after another new line but always at the back of the line. Fourthly, you failed to deliver my bag yesterday evening and I still don’t have it now (it’s second day at 5pm)
Meal is first class was really horrible!  This was my second flight this year with a truly bad first class meal experience.  What have you done?

I know that you can’t control but TSA staff at Newark took a major RUDE pill. They were horrible and not just to me but others as well. I asked if I was in correct area and TSA agent’s response was “can’t you read?” But they had been moving signs around and a whole group of people didn’t know which line we were supposed to be in. They were horrible

CDG airport check in for United is horrid. It took us over 1.5 hrs to check in because there are no auto check in's. The representative sent us to the wrong line and after about an hour we finally got to someone who was able to send us to the correct check in line. I paid extra for premium access and felt we were treated like cattle.  Definitely considering not going back as this was our 4th trip and nothing changed. Maybe another airlines would be better equipped to handle their customers who pay extra for premium access. The blankets you provide are terribly thin and really do not provide much  warmth at all. Your food takes like paper. Either no taste or way too much spices.

We were charged $25 for checking in one bag.  We often fly United, and now we will have to invest time and effort to get the refund.  Quite disappointed that they could not resolve issue when we checked in.

Cavalier delaying attitude at Gate.  Forced to check carry on bag even though It always "passed" before.  Rude attitude from attendant about storing items in overhead bin.  No earphones offered for seatback entertainment.  General attitude of treating paying customers like cattle or holocaust victims in WWII Germany.

The TSA security line was absolutely ridiculous.  Never have I seen it that bad.  Through the regular lines, down the escalator, and almost all the way down the terminal on the next level!!  Open some more lines and keep people moving.

Worst flight of my life. For twenty minutes prior to the door being closed and throughout the entire flight a family with four or five young kids drove us mad. I was in row one and and at times there were two young kids in one seat behind me screaming and kicking. Non stop screaming and kicking and screaming. This faiml should NOT have been allowed to stay on this flight. After twenty minutes of non stop screaming and the door still open they should have been removed from this flight. Absolutely the worst flight of my life.

Some of your flight attendants don't seem to want to even be on the plane doing their job, which seems to be typical over the last few years.  There was not enough information given for the reason for the delay.  Delaying an international flight that is already over 14 hours by any amount of time is a very negative experience and unacceptable.

premium economy is not as good as other carriers -- need more room.  Food is also much worse than other carriers --- Crew very good, captain did a good job.  Just need to step up your quality and provide a little wider seating for economy plus seating.
My tv screen did not work and my son’s could not accept credit card payment for direct tv

The big problem that- on this direct flight- 40 bags ( including mine) were not delivered to the baggage carousel at Newark Airport!  I was without needed items in my bag for 3 days- and the foreign customer service representative I called about the delay in delivering my bag first told me it had been sent to Dulles Airport!  I had told lost baggage representative to send it to PHL and deliver it to my home.  The foreign customer service representative also asked that I come to the airport to claim the bag.  I had been told in Newark that it would be delivered to my home ( which it was).  Also I almost missed my train connection to get home because for 2 hours the loudspeakers at Newark Airport repeatedly told us the bags would arrive on carousel 14 shortly.  This whole baggage fiasco is why I’m reluctant to recommend United .

Delayed for 5 hours because of mechanical issues. Then delayed while we boarded because of hydraulic problems. Missed connection flight to Syracuse and stuck in airport for an additional 3 or 4 hours. Missed connecting flight on the way out between Denver and Grand Junction because there wasn't a crew available.

All the problems we found were with the security staff at Newark. They were so incredibly rude that they nearly ruined the holiday. What the hell is their problem? It makes me feel that the United States just hates everybody. I'm Australian. If the USA doesn't like their best friends, who else have they got?  Another thing. The landing cards are confusing and I consistently get it wrong on the question: "Number of people traveling with you" (from memory, but it's something like that). I always think it is IN ADDITION to me, not the total number of the people in the party/family. Can somebody please feed this back to customs and immigration, so that the landing cards use clearer questions? It might just avoid a bunch of hassle at the airports.
Seat space is very restrictive.  No room for your legs.  Very uncomfortable.
Lost bag and still no information as to where it is. Difficult to talk to human to get information. Website only says no information available. Not helpful.

Check in was chaotic.  We tried online check-in but due to China visa issues we could not get that done.  Used the kiosk.  My daughter studies in school and was 5 pounds over and we were charged $200 as excess baggage!!! She had only 1 bag!  We then tagged the bag and went to bag drop.  The lady there tagged the bag with an additional tag and asked that we keep the bag separate .  It was NOT put on the conveyor!  We double checked if it was okay!  She said yes!  My daughter is 17 and flying alone to Shanghai - when she got to Shanghai the baggage never arrived.  Her school is 2 hours from Shanghai - all her stuff for school is in the bag!  I called United this morning I.e. the 8th - 2 days after and found to my horror that the bag is STILL in Newark!!’  File number PVGUA3544.  Bag tag number 6016456242 KOVOOR/MEHER.  How can an airline be so INCOMPETENT that a bag scheduled to fly on 6th Jan is still stranded in Newark on the 8th!  My daughter is struggling to cope at school while United hatched her bag in Newark after taking $200 for being 5lbs over!   I am a UA Premier Platinum customer ME631562.  My daughter has asked me NEVER to book her on UA ever!!!

2 on 5 of our suitcases were( still are ...) missing and no one to talk with in Havana . Impossible to reach ( from Cuba )the 1-800 number ...cost us a fortune to call a landline in the US  I apparently have also to pay on my own the trip back and forth to pick up my suitcases from the airport ( if they are coming today ...)  Huge lack of service and informations . I’m with no clothes to changes or toiletries since yesterday...
Could be more food you cheap bastards

Unfortunately I don’t think this is related to this specific flight. United is more and more behaving like a low cost. Flying an old 757 crowded with the overhead compartments opening constantly opening and very little space is not what you expect. Again like a low cost carrier although with high cost pricing. When I compare today’s service with I was used to when I priveleged flying with Continental it is so obvious that what you get is not what you pay for. Sorry but it is indeed disappointing.

In my profile on United I have specifically indicated that I need to have the Indian Vegetarian mean. The meal that was provided to me was based on chicken, hardly a vegetarian option! I noted to the flight attendant that the meal was not appropriate, but she did not help at all, neglecting to offer one of the vegetarian options that they were distributing to the other clients and simply insisted on saying that the label on my meal indicated that it was right, even upon showing her the piece of chicken in the package. Simply not acceptable and entirely disrespectful of my food requirements.
Chicago airport lost my luggage piece when I went on to Frankfurt Germany. I am very disappointed.
The flight attendant yelled at an elderly woman who couldn’t figure out the bathroom light/lock, and she swore over the intercom. She was very unprofessional.

I was seated by the emergency exit and I was absolutely freezing the entire flight despite being wrapped in two blankets and my ski-jacket (and not really being very sensitive to the cold, typically).  Also, baggage delivery took 45 minutes in Newark, which is completely unacceptable for a 1st world major airport.

I have noticed on multiple flights that the business seat areas and overhead compartments are not clean. There are stains for liquids, crumbs etc throughout. I risk soiling anything that I store in the area. Even the flight attendant suggested to clean the area with vodka to sanitize the area because wet wipes were not available.
The seats are placed too close, no room to strech leggs.  I could not put the tray down.  I would suggest placing fewer seats to give more leg room, however, I doubt it will happen because of $$.
This plane felt OLD and DIRTY. Lots of food down the side of seats and floor. Bathrooms didn’t feel modern. Whole plane felt it needed cleaning and refitting

Yes. The porter at EWR was very rude - so much so I wonder whether there was something intentional with the delays in my bag arriving in SFO. He told me I had not waited in the appropriate line and should not have ducked the rope (which I did not do!). Then told me - even though I am gold status and had been waiting 10 min - that I needed to take my bag down 2 levels to economy because I was in an economy seat on the flight; I was confused because my bag tag was already printed and I was not sure if it was ok to check my bag in with another agent. He said fine he would take it - I should not have let him take my bag, or given him the $20 tip that I gave him for his trouble. The baggage services in SF informed me my bag was already on the next flight out and would arrive in 3 hours. This meant I had to purchase clothing for an important event in Sonoma that night. 4.5 hours later I received a text message saying my bag would arrive later than planned, with no additional context. I had to then purchase clothes, toiletries and undergarments for Sunday because I have a day of business meetings. The bag arrived close to 2 a.m. but the message that it would arrive that noght did not come soon enough for me to avoid the additional purchases.

We specifically chose this flight in order to make it to our cruise. The flight was then an hour delayed, our bags sent to MIA, and zero assistance to accommodate or provide explanations. We then missed our entire cruise completely.
The flight attendant was rude and not nice
Flight attendants didn’t seem friendly. Did not smile.

The flight was delayed for over 2 hours and I understand that it was not anyone's fault. But I think you should let the passengers know that there is going to be an extended delay. That way they can make certain arrangements for pickup or possible change connecting flights. The lack of information, and to keep saying its going to be a few minutes is unacceptable.
We sat on the runway with screaming babies (1 was mine) for 90 minutes after we landed. That’s insane.

The gate crew in Louisville did very little to inform waiting passengers what was happening around the delays. They wouldn't make eye contact with us; they said almost nothing for over an hour. The overall effect was hostile and unprofessional.
