Newark airport is horrible. While I realize the weather was an issue, there was much to be unhappy about. The customs agent was a jerk. Having to take a shuttle between terminals because the train was down was a nightmare. United needs to do something about that airport.

I am sick af of having United constantly lose my luggage and then take their sweet time getting to back to me. Then when you call to find out the status of your lost luggage the wait time exceeds 40 minutes! THEN some guy or girl from New Delhi answers your call and tries (inbroken English) to answer your questions! What kind of blind fuckery is this?!

Delayed several hours, again (also considering flight on 12/30/17). Missed my connection, again (also considering flight on 12/30/17). Overall my experience with United flying from Lexington, KY to Sioux Falls, SD (and return trip) has NOT been reliable. Also I was dissatisfied as my luggage was lost on 12/30/17 flight from Lexington, and did not receive until 1/1/18. I do not feel that the $50 voucher for future air travel with United was a sufficient apology for the terrible inconveniences I experienced on this trip.

I was in an economy seat but I still expect at 5'5" and 115 lbs to be able to fit into the seat.  My knees were jammed into the seat in front of me, there was no space for my coat, and I was unable to move at all.  Use of an electronic device was very difficult as it was jammed into my body.

One of the flight attendants was incredibly rude. There is an indicator at the front of the Economy+ cabin for bathroom availability at the front of the cabin, just like there is the same indicator for the bathrooms at the back of the cabin. The front indicator said the lavatory was available, the back indicator said the lavatories there were unavailable (and there was a visible line), so I used the lavatory at the front of our cabin. When I was returning to my seat, the flight attendant rudely told me I am not permitted to pass the bulkhead at the front of our cabin, with a disdainful tone that made it sound like she thought I was horribly despicable person.  Also - none of the flight attendants on this flight spoke fluent German. The German interruptions over the speakers were slow, mispronounced, and with frequent extended pauses, which was obnoxious and inconvenient. Since they were so drawn out, everyone in the cabin who was trying to use the entertainment systems were getting more and more frustrated at each announcement.

I am not sure why the boarding process seems backwards.  We were assigned to class 5 for boarding, however our seats were in the back of the plane.  By the time we made it to our seats, the plane was full and there was little storage.  To add to this frustration, we checked in one bag, a set of clubs, only to be told that the bag was never put on the flight.  My husband had a tee time for the next day but was unable to play.  United made no attempt to compensate for this delay.  The clubs were delivered the next day but had a terrible odor to the bag.   It took my husband a couple of days to try to dissipate the odor.

I purchased a 2 seats-   The back of the cabin design is very,very uncomfortable.   You have minimized space and cramped more seats so you can make money and it is extremely uncomfortable for taller people.   Shame on you!!!!!
I left my book on the plane, so sad.  Liane Moriarty "What Alice Forgot."

You were late again, making us miss our connection in Denver.  Your Club at Newark wouldn't let us in on a one-day pass.  You were three hours late in December, and this time you were 1-1/3 hours late.  Continental never held us up this bad.  And, we don't like that you cancelled the non-stop in the morning.  But, I will say that your Club is n Denver saved the day, otherwise we might be switching to Southwest.

The checking in Bozeman was a disaster.  Not enough attendants to handle the crowd and lots of confusion amongst the passengers and frustration amongst the attendants.  The flight took off over an hour late because of a lavatory problem.  The communication about this issue and the delay was not good
The baggage check in process was ABYSSMAL and CHAOTIC. Without the help of one of your staff, sadly I don’t remember her name, I would probably still be waiting.
Seat very uncomfortable. Pocket in front of seat broken with steel rod sticking out. Difficult to sit comfortably because of that. Generally an unpleasant experience.

There was a 2yr old screaming and having a tantrum a majority of the flight. She was kicking my son's seat and it was beyond annoying. We paid a lot of money for the ticket and to have an uncontrollable child kicking his chair really upsets me. The couple had 3 kids but only 2 seats. On such a small plane seems they should all have their own seats. I have 3 teenagers and they have been flying since infancy and never have behaved like this child. It was an unfortunate experience to have to put up with.
One particular attendant was particularly unfriendly and rude. I am not entirely sure if she was just rude in general or she was being racist since I am an Indian Passport holder.
Gate Agent was a real b*tch. Traveling with 2 small kids and she was rude, impatient, and unkind.

The original baggage check in person gave us the wrong tickets we tired to board and they were for the next flight even though she booked our luggage on the correct one We had to get out of line and go to the gate and get new tickets and the try again to board

The go around landing was not needed and the communication was not good. Also due to this people were getting sick and there were not bags for them to use. This was a serious issue and caused many issues.
The landing was terrible. The pilot missed the run way and we had to pull up suddenly and go around for a second landing. There was no warning or apology to passengers.

Yes, very disappointed with two employees at the premier access at Houston. The ladies behind the counter were fine and helpful, but there were two ladies out in front who were extremely crabby and actually treated the passengers very rudely

The flight was full and the flight attendants did not stop people from requesting seat swaps at first. It wasn’t until it became a chaotic mess that they told people to sit in their assigned seats so we could take off.
The economy flight attendant was very rude and was not helpful... I apologize for not getting her name.
The lunch on a scale of 10 was 3. Very poor considering how much time you had to serve it.

A cheese plate at lunch time.? Three small pieces of cheese, two crackers, 6 grapes, and 1 strawberry. Your first class passengers deserve a meal. You should be embarrassed. I thought it was an appetizer and was waiting for the meal. Your food service continues to be the worst I’ve ever experienced.
Highly disappointed in the club. I understand the issues with delays and over crowding di to canceled flights and delyas but to run out of food in the club when I pay $450 per year is crazy
My bag was lost and it took 24 hours to get it back.    I had clothes, and items for my business for a conference I was attending and missing the bag was hurtful to my business.

Check in was terrible.  We paid extra to have premier access.  We waited over 45 minutes just to get to the check-in desk and almost missed the window to check our bags.  Agent did accommodate us but it was very stressful to have to worry that our bags might not make flight.

Seats are too small.  Bathroom was disgusting after the first hour.  Man who.sat in the middle was a 6 5 monster.  Should not have been allowed a middle seat.  No gate when we got there.  No ticket agent for an hour.  Sat on the tarmac 1.5 hours after arrival after we were already an hour late.  Shoot the ticket agwnt.

Yes.  The flight was delayed 1 hour and 20 minutes because the pilot was late arriving.  The flight was fine and some of the time was made up, but after landing we did not have a gate or a gate agent, likely because of the delay.  We sat on the runway at Newark for over an hour.  Then when we went to retrieve our luggage, 2 of our 3 bagscame down to the baggage carousel.  Our third bag did not.  After waiting about 20 minutes and reading a sign that said if luggage is sent on a previous flight that a text would be sent to notify the person.  Well we did not receive a text or any notification.  Besides, why would we think our 1 bag would be sent separately from the others.  After about 20 minutes, we decided to go to luggage claim and low and behold, our third bag was there.  All of these experiences made the trip from LAX to EWR very unpleasant.

There was a delay of approximately 1.5 hours due to late inbound crew which was the result of the snow storm in the east two days prior.  I didn't have an issue with that.  When we landed at Newark, the Pilot advised that our assigned gate was being used and it would be approximately 10 minutes before we can move to that gate.  We waited for 20 minutes with no update from Pilot.  Our plane began taxiing which seemed like a distance of 2 miles before we approached a gate.  The Pilot advised that we needed to wait for a gate agent.  20 minutes passed. The Pilot said he didn't have good news.  There was no agent.  We waited another 15-20 minutes.  Still no agent.  Finally an agent was at the gate.  So from the moment we landed on the runway to the moment we deplaned, was approximately 1.5 hours!  Unnecessary wait!

I was in a middle seat and ended up with no armrest then the person in front leaned back and with the smaller seats I couldn’t even hold my book up to read. My husband couldn’t fit his legs so he had to share my space. Very uncomfortable

Horrible exhaust fumes in the aircraft during takeoff and landing. Most of my travel companions and I experienced extreme nausea on this flight, although CO isn't introduced into the cabin, it may have. None of us have ever experienced nausea due to turbulence or any factor in an airplane. First event.
The gate agent in ORD was very rude to a man on the flight. I noticed him be dismissing and uncaring in 3 different occasions to the same man. That's not the United I want to fly!

I was emailed to reschedule my flight because of east coast weather. I waited on hold for well over an hour to do this. The rep assured me I’d have an aisle seat (I’m tall and hate being cramped into the ever shrinking seats). When I got the email ticket, it had NO seat assigned. If I hadn’t double checked, I would’ve ended up stranded. Obviously by the time I logged in and called again, the only option was a middle seat. I had assured the rep I could take another flight or upgrade to economy plus to avoid the middle at all costs, so it’s his mistake that caused this to happen.
Our flight was cancelled due to snow storm. ,The damage control was very poor on United part
Please notify people more than 2 hours prior to a flight when bad weather.   Also try to speed up luggage at Newark.  It was over 1 hour before my bad was scanned and released.

Flight was late leaving, had to run across airport to next flight, boarding when I got there, out breath an sweating when I got there, thought I was going to have a heart attack, very embarrassing to be that close to other people sweating, ask an attending that was driving an empty cart, said he was not going in that directions
totally disorganized at check in counter why pay extra for primer access total mess

Air conditioning was extreme and uncomfortable for the first 90 minutes of trip.  My husband had to complain twice.  He flys at least once a month and says that this was the coldest flight he has ever taken

Check in was horrible. I had called united 800 number to confirm that I could carry on a bag and at the airport I was forced to wait 40 minutes at check in while they spoke to supervisors about it.  The fact that I was told something by united and they disagreed put me, the customer, in the wrong - totally unacceptable!!

There was a family on our flight with 1st class seat and 4 economy seats. This flight start with the wife getting up while were taxiing to take off so she could go to the bathroom causing the plane to stop and wait for her to come out. This family was allowed by flight attendants to constantly roam and linger in isle of first class. The adults constantly switched off sitting in first class inconveniencing the person in the isle seat and kept asking for food and drinks to bring to economy.  There have been numerous times that my husband and I have flown in first class with our kids in economy, we have never nor would we consider doing what this family was allowed to do. I was frustrated that the flight attendants kept allowing this family to be disruptive and disrespectful to everyone on the plane especially those the were in and paid for first class seats for all in our party.

Check-in procedures for both Economy and Premier Access in Providenciales were unacceptable.  Lines too long.  Several customers were able to skip ahead to the front of the line due to confusion, frustration, and mismanagement.  Gate area was much too small and could not accommodate passengers on scheduled flights.  Gate agents slow to act and unconcerned by long delays.

The check in process was chaotic. We have Premier Access and people who arrived late were allowed to jump ahead of us for an earlier flight. I waited 1.5 hours to just check in 2 bags. We barely made it through security which was another 30 min. We had 5 min to spare prior to boarding. The gate was again chaos with no orderly process and no where to sit. Will never take United there again. This is not the standard of flying that I expect for the price I paid. My relatives on Jet Blue did not have the same experience. There check in and boarding was orderly and quick. Take example from Jet Blue. Shame on United for putting its customers through such an aweful experience. The stewards on Flight 1922 had an attitude and were not helpful. They need a refresher on customer service. I usually  American Airlines. There is an enormous difference in customer service. My daughter flew business class from Turks to DC with United and also had a poor experience. Please feel free to reach out to us. We will share our dismay with our travel agent too.

United had the most people flying out but the smallest number of check-in desks.  Multiple flights leaving within an hour of each other created long lines.  Throughput very slow.  From time of printing ticket at kiosk to luggage check in was 54 minutes.  Getting to airport 2.5 hours early, my family and I barely made it to boarding.  It was not a relaxing way to end the vacation.  Worst flying experience ever.

The changing table in the restrooms are tiny. We have a 1 year old and she does not even fit. Her legs end up in the year. This is embarrassing.  No Tissue paper was available on either restroom.   They only offered potato chips of a random brand (Paps)...EXTREMELY salty.  The flight attendants looked upset that I asked for a bit of milk for my daughter's bottle.  Very unprofessional.

The plane was almost 2 hrs late leaving due to a staffing problem. Checked on line before I left for the airport said on time. Get to the airportposted 1 1/2 delay which turned into 2 hrs. They knew it was delayed before I left I didn’t have to sit at the airport almost 4 hrs. To make matters worse I received an email that there was a delay at 2pm for a 2;30 pm flight when it was posted at the airport since 10 am. On top of that we were put at the last gate and downstairs freezing cold no windows nothing like the main level. If you’re going to use this dungeon area at least update it. Flight crew were very nice but the airport experience was unnessarily unpleasant.

the senior team lead scolded my wife because se sent her food to me sitting at bulk edge... she does not eat the food on aircrafts.  He told he that does not serve coach and when I was cold she asked him if he could give me ( husband) a blanket as I was sitting in bulk edge.. he told her to give him hers and she did that with blankets and the meal and he proceeded to scold her, not too loud but loud enough that others could hear.... left a bad taste... nevertheless, United will take the side of the staff no matter what so I am not hopeful that his behaviour will be corrected as to how he speaks to customers when it seem that there is a breach.. aside from that, he was ok....
The agents in Montego Bay does not understand how vital it is to provide good customer service, seeing that their attitude towards the job was very rude and unprofessional.

There was no food on the plane; the flight attendant was rude and would not serve me coffee (along with the water and orange juice I asked for). There was one serving of water on the entire plane trip. Service was aweful.

Yes. Lots. You failed to provide any level of customer service to help me cope withe disruption. Having told me in Panama that the flight had been diverted due to a medical emergency, I was rerouted through Chicago to London and told I would get a hotel for the night in Newark. The belligerent, shouty customer service staff you had on duty said there had been no medical emergency and that no hotels were available. By now it was 2am and I was unable to drop my bag for the new routing. So you left me with no choice but to spend an uncomfortable night in Newark airport. While waiting in several slow moving lines for customer service I witnessed extraordinary levels of aggressive speech from your customer service staff. You gave me one ten dollar voucher for food in Panama but nothing at all for the enforced overnight stay in Newark. That cannot be right. Indeed your own terms and conditions say you will make reasonable efforts to accommodate passengers in such a situation through no fault of my own.  Well, the ordeal is over now and I can relax in the knowledge that I shall never have the misfortune to deal with a so-called customer services agent of United ever again as I shal never fly with you again.

It’s about my whole trip. First, the flight got delayed and I missed my connecting flight when I went to Richmond and came back from Richmond . I had to run to 5 to 6 gates due to that . Horrible experience in total. I’m never gonna Use United airlines .
No food.  Grumpy staff on plane.  Uncomfortable seat

We boarded a plane, then they unboarded us and moved us to another plane 2.5 hours later. We boarded that plane and waited 45 minutes to 1 hour only to be unboarded from that plane. Then 10 minutes later we boarded it again. It was a horrible experience.

Our bags did not arrive. They arrived in Detroit by 6pm but we're not delivered to us until 3pm the next day. It was a significant inconvenience as my daughter had to leave for college before getting her items back. I was disappointed by how long it took to get the bags.

Extremely disappointed in the service. Probably won’t fly again. I understand issues occur... but replacing a rubber covering on the floor should not constitute a deplaning and delays totally 5 hours. It’s unacceptable
It was a horrible experience. I request that you read my prior comments and make an arrangement for the compensation.
going between tvc and ord, my flights have been delayed 2 out of 5 times. and almost never for weather, just shitty planning, shitty maintenance, and late crew.

Baggage claim was a mess. No one in the office when we realized our bags were not there. Went upstairs since sign on the door said to go to the ticket office if no one was there. Once we got upstairs they had no idea what we were talking about and tried to send us back with no help. Got back down and there was a huge line with one person working. Desk attendant was quite rude and didn’t seem to know what she was doing. Bags had to be delievered to house and tracking them was an issu. Not impressed and CERTAINLY WILL NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE. Glad we chose to fly delta on the way to SLC.

Poor choice of aircraft (extra small!!!!!!) for a 3hr flight. Why such s small plane - this is a regional jet (1 hr is unpleasant enough on such a little craft), not  acceptable for 2-3 hr flight! Will not fly united again with such poor equipment choices.

I was very disappointed, as my family sat in row 25 on the International flight from Costa Rica to Chicago, when the flight attendants came around serving food and drinks there was nothing but snacks left to purchase.  My daughter who sat 3 rows in front of us said that the food ran out prior to her row as well.  Our flight attendant informed us that the aircraft was only stocked for food for 20 passengers and that we should have purchased our food at the airport.  Unfortunately, since we couldn't get to the airport in time to purchase food, due to road construction and a terrible accident on the two lane road from Tamarindo to Liberia (despite leaving 3.5 hours before our flight), then the extra long line through security, there was no time to get food and our flight was already boarding.  I would expect an airline such as united to have more food than for 20 passengers for ALL international flights.  Gone are the times food was provided on international travels, and now we can not even purchase food on the flights.  Very disappointing and poor planning on United Airlines part.

Seating has been changed to fit more passengers, right?  The amount of space/leg room per seat is absurd - very tight and uncomfortable. It's even worse when the passenger directly in front lowers their seat. The crew only offered drinks once on a five hour flight.
The female flight attendant was in general very angry and disrespectful.  Her behaviour was not acceptable and in some instances may have put the safety of the passengers in jeopardy!
I sent you two complaints from the plane and I look forward to hearing back from you regarding the very poor service from the flight attendants.
At the airport the gate attendants were totally uniformed and useless. On the plane, the bathroom was dirty and out of supplies

The check-in experience was pure chaos in Cabo.  Many of the automated Check-in Kiosks were malfunctioning.  The queuing lines were chaotic.  the Unite representatives were not informed or trained in how to maintain order.  The experience at the gate was also chaotic.

I was in the 12th row of Premium Economy and by the time the flight attendants got to my row they had run out of any kind of sandwiches.  Gate personal had no knowledge of situation with plane delay with no announcements.
Flight was delayed for mor then 2 hours.  Not good

Barely made flight- terrible check in and inefficient. No information on delayed flight- total chaos. Brought us on a bus then dumped us back with no info. Dumped my stroller at the baggage carousel that wasnt even our flight (was a gate checked item and not returned properly). It was not with our luggage. No one working to advise where our belongings were. My husband is a doctor and helped revive a sick patient. We received a voucher for $300. He appreciated this but honestly that is a lame gesture. What he did saved this womans life and he put his own self at risk. There should be some legitimate compensation. We had negative experiences both ways of our trip. Never have these terrible Experiences on other airlines.
Arrived early. Waited an hour on tarmac for gate  Then luggage took over an hour even though it was priority Priority luggage came last.  Over 2.5 hours from landing to leave ewr terrible

The baggage handling at Newark is a disaster and makes the return and having family wait around to pick us up a huge hassle.  Landed and waited over an hour just to get our luggage from the aircraft.  Total disgrace on the part of the luggage handlers.

We still have not received 3 ski bags almost 48 hours after landing.  United’s online portal gave no information other than ‘we are trying to locate your bags’.  One hold experience for a human representative was 28 minutes.  The next time I called (24 hours later after no updates) I received a message to expect a 40 minute wait.  Who can do that?  Horrible customer service to customers already experiencing an unfortunate event.   I was very disappointed by this experience.
Late and little to no information from the bus driver while our departure time passed. Very frustrating.

Flight itself was fine.  However our bags (as expected) did not make our flight.  One of the bags was completely destroyed.  There was no note left on the bag or any comments noting they had ruined the bag.  When calling United they said I could either get a credit to go through this fun again or drive back down to the airport (Providence) and dispute this with them.  That likely would have been a loosing battle because the damage to the bag could have been anywhere from when we gave the bag to a United employee in Kansas city through Chicago baggage services to baggage claim people in Providence.
Rude flight attendant  They did not respond to call button Very disappointed.  This is the second flight in a row that has been less than satisfactory.
the seats on this style aircraft seem to be less wide than on other flights. This means unless you are a tiny person you are crammed up against others making 4 hours not a great experience.
Unexpected delay due to mechanical problems was frustrating, as it brought us in to Miami late and we missed our dinner.

My seat and group number got changed during my walk from the check in counter and the gate. When I was about to board and I scanned my ticket the computer said I was in group four when my ticket said group three. The attendant immediately assumed I was trying to get ahead in the line and very loudly and rudely pointed out the discrepancy and asked me to step aside. I showed her how my ticket said group three and then she told me about the change and gave me a new ticket and let me through. What really bothered me, was that she embarrassed me and then didn’t apologize when she found out I hadn’t made any mistakes. I also disliked the fact that I was switched seats, and placed at a basic economy row
The 90 minute delay, which I believe was due to a mechanical error, was unfortunate. I wasn't too put off, but the people I was meeting at the destination had to pay the price.

They allowed too many people to walk around and stand in the aisle (particularly people with babies).  It was very annoying having people blocking the aisle and standing where there should not be a seat.  It makes the already crowded seating area seem even more crowded.

Once again, I had a 400+ pound person in my row.  Fortunately, there was an empty seat nearby and we ended up with an empty middle seat.  Otherwise, this man smelled horrible and could not fit in just 1 seat.  Isn’t there a rule about this?  It’s not fair to those of us forced to sit next to enormous people.
We were not at all happy that it took over an hour for our bags to appear at baggage ckaim after landing...not just ours but the entire flight’s! Numerous passengers missed connections.
Ridiculous hour plus wait for baggage to be delivered. Agents tried to handle but there was no information and the wait was unacceptable.

The flight itself was fine. The problem was when we arrived at O'Hare. We made it to baggage claim pretty quickly. A few people from out direct flight got their bags, then no more bags came. 1 hour after the bags stopped, other people from our flight were speaking with a United employee about the bags. She was getting no answers from whoever she was talking to on the walkie other than they had no idea where our bags were. 2 hours later after we arrived at baggage claim, the bags finally arrived. 2 hours later?! This is unacceptable. The flight had no connections. The bags went from point A to B then were lost. Several people missed their connecting flights. United asked for volunteers to check their carryon bags because the flight was so full so we voluntarily gave up my daughters bag only to have it lost for 2 hours. Unacceptable!

For the price you charge you should make sure the equipment is working for the flight.  There was already a stated flight delay and then when it was time to board there was additional delay  do to equipment issues. The delay was originally stated as 20 minutes and then it extended. When time to board the staff didn’t handle it in an organized manor.  Very disappointing end to a vacation.
Lack of food other than chips is not satisfying whn you have paid to upgrade.  If no food planned than please offer a snack from the back such as a classic snack pack.
Disorganized! Poor service

We postponed our trip from Thurs (which was cancelled b/c of the blizzard) to Saturday. We were told we would sit together - I was flying with my 2 young children. When the flight info came through, it turned out we were scattered throughout plane. I called back and this time was not on hold for 1 1/2 hrs as I had been before the blizzard. Instead it was very fast and we were given Economy Plus, which was great.  The only real bummer was we arrived in EWR early but the gate was occupied by a plane that according to the pilot was "broke" and relocated to another gate where the bridge was frozen. It was over an hour before we deboarded.

Newark airport was horrible.  Once we landed in EWR we have to stay in the aircraft for another hour. Our aircraft could not found the gate.  Once we found the gate there was no ground crew  to work at the new gate.  There was not enough update from the captain either.

We were kept on the plane for an HOUR after landing because we were early and gate personnel was unable/unprepared to accommodate the plane.  Furthermore, due to lack of oversight and ground crew readiness, our jetway had frozen and was unusable so we were all stuck on said plane for a long period of time.  It was a very full flight and incredibly uncomfortable and inconvenient.  We landed at around 10:20, and I didn't get to baggage claim till around midnight.  The blame lies solely with your ground crew not being where they should be or maintaining the equipment so it wouldn't freeze in such inclement weather conditions.

You hit the trifecta of poor performance. Flight delayed over an hour with no explanation. An hour and a half on the tarmac waiting for a gate in Newark and then 45 minutes to get our baggage despite having priority tags

I was asked to give up my business class seat and mobe to coach.  I refused and after 2 roumds they gave up.  I was annoyed to have even been asked.  I was in my seat and checked in amd should not have been asked to move.

It was necessitated due to the delay of my first flight. I was bumped out of first class and re booked 7 hours after my husband to Tampa. So I switched myself to Orlando and he came to pick me up in Tampa. When he picked me up in Orlando I still would have been on the ground in Newark. And the clincher was he had an empty seat on his plan even though the gate agents announced it was a completely full flight. We’ve been flying United all year to Chicago as premiere customers mostly first class seats and this trip to FL was a huge disappointment. Storm and all we understood the delays but the resulting travel was extremely inconvenient with us being separated.
My tv quality was poor and the audio was very poor, the service was Bad came around twice on a five 1/2 hour flight.  Attendants were just Rude.

I have currently lost over $5,000 in travle fees and hotel fees because united failed to send my luggage(sporting equipment) that was mandatory. The equipment was specific and unique and could not be replaced. My trip is ruined and they have still not sent my bags despite promising them the next day. I will never fly united again. I will be talking to customer service and be demanding a refund on my trip as well as reimbursement on all of the travle fees and hotel fees that had to be canceled upon arrival, which total thousands of dollars as well as risking my proffesional career that was potentially hundreds of thousands of dollars, because i was not able to perform without my equipment.
The phone customer service was a disgrace! Worst experience ever!
My luggage has been delayed, no one has tried to contact me in two days of filing my delayed baggage report.
Delayed flight, plus little to no service while in the business class section. What an awful expierence. I am very disappointed in you.

Checkin was one of the worst experiences I have ever had. First there was no premier access line, but even without it, the individual checking us in was just plain rude. She seemed frustrated and disturbed that I even asked her a question. Additionally, English was not her primary language and she was difficult for me to understand. I have no problem with an accent but if I ask her to repeat herself because I did not understand her, she should not act offended. Then we had to take our bags to another individual who was going to take the bags to the scanner. He was even more rude. Clearly he was not happy to be doing this job. I have lived on the east coast for 12 years, I’m used to a less than friendly attitude (especially in NJ) but this was really offensive. Not a smile from anyone.
they didn't inform us good about the delay, and there was garbish in the bookpart by my seat
Three hour delay with the reasons given (de-fueling and maintenance) suggesting extremely poor planning.  No in-flight service for apparently a non-reason (turbulence that did not exist).
Inexplicable delay waiting for gate to open up despite slightly late arrival.  Long delay waiting for baggage.

The communication regarding the delay was very poor. I experienced similar poor communication about a delay on a previous United flight. It is important to let  passengers know how long the delay is. It seems as though United is reluctant to do that and minimizes the time which only makes things worse.

We sat on the ground for 45 minutes after boarding waiting for other passengers to get through security.  I understand that the airport was way busier than normal, but in the end I got punished for showing up on time / early.

There should be a notification prior to the flight that in-flight entertainment was not going to be provided for a 4+ hour international flight.  Also, this should have been notified via screen, however it allows a customer to watch a movie for ~10 minutes, and then cuts it off.  This provides a very bad user experience, missing expectations.

I was originally scheduled to return on 1/4/18, but due to the weather I opted to rebook to 1/5/18.  The agent on the phone rebooked me for a route that was CID->DEN->ORD->YOW.  when i got to the airport on 1/5/18 I explained to the ticket agent that this flight path seemed  odd and they agreed that there is no reason I should have been booked to DEN and rebooked me to fly out later that day.  After waiting 6 hours in the airport for my next flight, the flight was delayed due to aircraft maintenance which caused me to miss my connection.  The gate agent booked me for the next day and refused to provide me with vouchers unless I flew to chicago and took standby on a 6am flight the next morning.  This is unconscionable as it's basically blackmailing me into flying to Chicago to wait in the airport at the crack of dawn for the hope of a flight. Instead I was forced to seek my own accommodations and take the flight out on the 6th.  I fly United frequently as I travel for work, but will not choose to use a different carrier is this is the level of service I can come to expect.
check in personnel was not friendly and not willing to help with flight information

My kindle was left in the flight, I realized it at the airport and was told the flight has left and to put in a claim, which I did (claim # 7416178) . A few hours later I asked the United customer services again who now tell me the plane is still there and they are looking for it but to still put in a claim. I do not appreciate being lied to by UA staff when they coulda retrieved my item instead of telling me the flight has left. Unprofessional!!!!
I don’t like that they change my seat number without notice and when I aske why they told me that because of aircraft was changed but iam not satisfied.
None. Nice flight. All smooth given crazy weather.

As noted, the flight was delayed. That said, we landed and then held on the plane for 75 MINUTES before a gate was found. 75 minutes. People were missing connections and overwhelmed with anxiety. The communications were not great and it ruins an already bad experience to have to wait that long.
Flight delay once we landed was unacceptable. We waited on the tarmac for 1 hr with no gate. We had an infant traveling with us and this was extremely inconvenient.

My bags were misplaced and left in Newark and I had wait for them in Miami for over 12 hours! The baggage claim customer service in the airport at Miami was absolutely horrific! One representative even leaned over the counter and threatened me then proceeded to remove his badge. I will not be flying United again specifically because of this experience. No one could seem to locate my bag properly or give me a straight answer and no one was willing to get on the phone to help locate my bag. I called the toll free number numerous times and was unable to reach someone until almost 1:30am. I am appalled at the whole experience.

We had a very bad experience. Our flight was about an hour late. However, the worst part of our trip was that we waited one hour and forty five minutes to get our luggage. There was no explanation for the delay.

The flight was delayed. There was no information at the gate about it. No one advised why. Then after rushing to get aboArd and get that on time push back from the gate we were stuck in the penalty box for another 20 minutes but no explanation why. This was after we had to switch to this flight because you made our originally booked non stop from Mia to ord to a one stop from Mia through Houston to ord. Communication is paramount to customer service
Red carpet club is a travesty in FLL

Flight was late to gate due to ground problems at Newark, which was beyond United’s control. However, staff was not helpful with information on if or how we would make our connection and this resulted in all our baggage being left in newark. Baggage department is not able to tell us when we will receive our luggage.
Going through all the lines is horrible in Aruba. There was a very limited selection of food onboard.
Not good you need to bring back the Essentials that we once had we pay a premium price but I get nothing for it very upset will not use United again

It is criminal the lack of leg room and size of personal space you offer. I sat in 34d , last row , rubbing up to an average size man for 2.5 hrs because the sear space was so cramed and im only 185 lbs. to make it even worse the person in front reclined his seat the whole way. Asked to change my seat was told a completely full flight yet they had 10 stand by passengers. No need to lie just say no

I have a home in the Fort Myers area and fly often.  Usually it is a very good experience.  I dislike the tightness in the cabin.  But since it is a short flight it is bearable, but not comfortable.  The airlines need to be more considerate of the seating, especially on long flights.  United is particularly at fault with uncomfortable and tight seating ever since you invented the economy plus.  It is just another way to make money and you sacrificed the space in the coach area.  I am not sure why you require the feed back.  I believe you are very aware of this problem, which most people seem to find it unbearable, especially on long flights.

We at 6:42 and it took almost an hour to obtain a gate so we sat in a holding area.  The weather was fine but cold.  My boss flew at the same time on Delta into Laguardia and had zero problems and was almost home before I even was able to get off the flight!!  I just don't understand knowing the flight is in the air coming from Orlando to not have a gate for almot an hour.  Totally unacceptable.
It is bad when seats were assigned at different rows for the single purchase persons.

My new Italian hardcase bag was checked at the gate and broken on all top corners by the time it came onto the baggage carousel. Now I have to drive three hours round trip back to SFO on my day off to show them the bag and file a claim. Utter bullshit.   I also purchased one hour of inflight wifi and was never able to get a connection (of course connection died after the purchasing process) so now I need to call about that as well.   Be nicer to peoples luggage and retire the fucking shitbox 757’s you’re still carting people around the country in.

Initial flight cancellation was due to weather but no similar flight options were offered the following day. In addition, the rescheduled flight was delayed for offboarding and baggage was 45min delayed.
Yes.  The assistance wasnt there when I arrived.  They caled someone but it took so long that I had to walk. The experience with assistance for this flight was very disappointing
Seat was extremely uncomfortable. Once we landed we had to wait 1.5 hours for a gate to be available. This was a horrible end to a 14 hour flight.

You are the only American airline that flies direct Shanghai to Newark so we are somewhat stuck - but really, why can't this airline get its act together.  One other thing - food awful - not business-class like at all.

The flight was delayed again due to United Airlines, therefore I missed my connecting flight and had almost a 3 hours delay in Chicago. I experienced this same problem betwn. these 2 cities on the 12/25/2017. This was very frustrating and on time departure and arrival services needs to change & would have preferred to get back at 8:30pm to LA instead of 11pm.  I hadn’t flown to the Flint airport in almost a year and on United in a while and this  makes me not consider this flight ever again. I am requesting compensation for this repetitive inconvenience.

the united app separated my family reservation at check in for the ourtbound leg. As a result, my wife never got the opportunity for a companion upgrade on the return leg, that i believe she would have gotten if the app did not have an apparent defect.   We had four travellers on one reservation. All have premier accounts. I am 1K. My wife and I are TSA Pre. On outbound check in, the app offered a companion upgrade. I selected my wife. On the check-in step, the app separated the reservation, and failed to check in any of the travellers. Then forced me to check in reservations separately and did not put my wife on the upgrade list.  I called united. they said i had to handle at the airport. At the premier counter the agent was able to add my wife to the upgrade list and succeeded.  Over the next week, I tried to get my wifes reservation back together with mine for the companion upgrade. Customer service said i would be able to after app-check in. I waited and checked in via app. Still no offer for companion upgrade. I called premier desk after check in and they said i would be able to fix at the airport. The airport was able to get my wife on the upgrade list, but she did not get upgraded. Based on the way the upgrade list filled up, i believe sub-1K travellers got the upgrade that my wife should ahve gotten.  So the use case that failed in the app is: multi-traveller reservation with: mix of 1K and not, mix of TSA PRE and not, checking in and managing companion upgrade. App must be able to keep reservation together and still support app-check and companion upgrade. Also must be able to reassemble reservation if app separates it.

Seats were very uncomfortable.  There was someone in my seat when I boarded and although they moved when I asked them, they took up their seat and part of mine, which made it a very uncomfortable flight.   Seats should be a little larger.

I asked for pasta, but could not have that since another traveler had already chosen the only one plate of pasta available for the 12 business passengers. I chose the short ribs which were tough. My diabetes reacted to the lack of food.
the only problem was the wait (over an hour) to get into a gate at Newark. I realize that traffic had been delayed into Newark, so I understand.

Our flight got cancelled twice. On the second day(01/05/2018), we had to wait at the airport for more than 4 hours undergoing security check and then realizing the flight got cancelled after 3 hours of delay. We could have saved time if the crew decided early about cancelling the flight. It caused inconvenience in that small town where the cafeterias are closed inside airport after 6.30 pm and that too when we travel with a toddler.
A 3 day delay was not a great experience

The Flight Attendants in First Class were terrible! They acted so put out to be working, not friendly or helpful. I have only experienced first class 8 times but it was the worst by a wide margin. I hope that you can see who was working that flight in first class and see if it is a constant problem.

There was a very ill gentleman sitting across from me.  He was surrounded by staff for appox half the trip.  While I absolutely empathize with him and wish him nothing but the best, it made it difficult to have a nice flight.  The gentleman was violently vomiting for a time at his seat.  I had ordered the express dining service but by the time I was ready to eat it was during the sickness of the gentleman.  Of course I'm not going to bother the flight attendants during this time but also, it would've felt rude to eat in the presence of someone so ill.  The smell might have made him feel worse.  So I went to the galley to get a small snack but I didn't find one so I assumed I needed to go up to first class where the flight attendant I recognized was ... he ended up scolding me for coming up from business class to first to get a snack.  I found this situation overall to be very annoying.  I spent a lot of money for myself and my 2 daughters to fly business class and overall it was a major disappointment.  I can appreciate that no one can predict a passenger's illness, but unfortunately that doesn't change how it impacted my experience and subsequent service.

The experience that was the issue was not the London Baggage claim, but that the Chicago baggage organization was erroneous. Our flight was delayed because they had to take bags off the plane that actually belonged on another flight. In that process they took off our bags. So when we arrived in London our bag did not make it. This bag contained our baby's car seat, our winter coats, and house keys. We checked into out flight over 2 hrs before the flight, and should not have run into the problem of our bags not getting on the plane. Especially being a 1K member.

While I appreciate how caring the flight attendants were to the passenger who was ill, the fact the flight left late and that I did not get one minute of sleep at all due to the commotion for the sick passenger, it was a tough flight and now am trying to get ready for my business meeting. Perhaps just some acknowledgement to the passengers around him would have helped and also at times one flight attendant was talking very loud and maybe she was fearful or anxious but that was pretty disruptive too. He literally was violently throwing up 6 inches from me. I hope he is feeling better - it was probably one of the worst flights I have ever been on.

My luggage was left in Newark. Considering there was well over an hour to transfer it, and on previous United flights through Newark with even shorter layovers no problems resulted, I wasn't happy. I did appreciate the next day delivery to my door

We had to wait for over an hour for 5 bags. No one could tell us estimated waiting times and they did a terrible job communicating what was going on. It wasn't fair to make everyone wait because the bags were not effectively sent over. It should not have taken that long.

The bathroom  was horrible. It was stinky and the toilet didn’t seem to flush all the way. There was a spray air freshener so I assume it  as an ongoing issue. Lots of tape and apoxy holding it together. Unsettling

Al abordar el avión en Newark me sentí muy triste y decepcionada al comprobar que habían al menos 5 asientos vacios en clase económica y que mi esposo y mi hija de 12 años pasaron esa noche en el aeropuerto porque según el personal de united el vuelo estaba full. Les falta empatía, me parece terrible que no ayuden a sus pasajeros. nos suspendieron el vuelo por condiciones climáticas que escapan de sus manos, pero también de las mias. no entiendo porque estando el resto de mi familia en el aeropuerto no los dejaron montar si aun habían espacios vacios en el avión. Una patética experiencia que siempre recordare
DELAYED UPON ARRIVAL OVER 1 HOURS DUE TO GATE SHORTAGE, NO JETWAY AND SLOW LUGGAGE

When I tried to recheck my luggage for this flight after my international SAS flight, I was told the baggage belt was broken and I had to go elsewhere; staff was unhelpful, signage nonexistent. TSA queuing was a chaotic nightmare, signage poor, understaffed.
If I do not hear back from the customer complaint I will be disputing the 435 dollar charge with my credit card and not flying United again

The setup and arrangement of gates C96 and C98 at EWR is a disaster. There are only one set of screens for both gates, so it is impossible to tell if you are at the right gate for your flight and the boarding queues are so close to each other that when two flights are boarding at the same time it is a mess to figure out where to line up. Also, the fact that my flight was delayed in boarding 2 hours but only half of the checked bags made it on time is ridiculous. More information at baggage claim that only certain bags made the flight would have been nice. Overall, a long, disappointing experience this weekend especially for a frequent flyer.

Gate was a complete disaster. Loudspeaker stopped working, but attendant did not handle adequately, resulting in massive confusion. Security (TSA) was also miserable, with agents shouting and generally treating people with disrespect (though I understand there is a limited amount United can do, and I don't expect better from the TSA).

We had requested Wheel Chairs for old and handicapped travelers. We waited for more than 30 minutes at Terminal E for Wheel Chairs. None arrived. Finally, my 72 yr old handicapped brother and his old wife had to go through security and walk all the way to the gate and they barely made the flight. I am told that upon arrival in Chicago, there were no wheel chairs either.  In Houston, I asked the agents behind kiosks for help. Their response was - " you have to stand in line. there are only 2 guys. it is going to take a while. there is nothing we can do".  This is unacceptable and disappointing.

Customs in Washington DC was horrible. There needs to be more people working in the Dulles Washington airport at customs. Over 100 people waited in line for customs with only 3 men working. Horrible service

So apparently I had a ticket that I couldn’t have carry ons. I had no idea and I have quite honestly never had this before. I travel for a living and had no clue these fare even existed. So I got to my gate about 45-an hour early in Harrisburg. The gate guy there informed me of this and I was pretty upset but ended up paying another $35  to check my bag. (Again, 45 min before the flight). Well when I land in OC that bag is still in Harrisburg. How the hell can you not get my bag on that airplane in Harrisburg in 45 minutes. What I think happened is that gate agent didn’t like that I was frustrated and purposely left my bag behind. Believe what you want but there is no excuse. There was plenty of time. Legit worst flight experience all year. And it was my first united flight. I usually fly delta and I travel for a living.
Seats are very close together and uncomfortable. I'm 5'0 foot and petite but it was still very uncomfortable compared to other airlines.

Because the long delay, the airline promise me a hotel to wait for the next flight to San Diego, but there was no room available, so I waited a lot, A LOT of time on the airport waiting for the next flight; and that was very annoying. Why you promised me a room at Newark if it is not true.
Nightmare, I even got sick from sitting on the terminal for 8 hours waiting for the inbound aircraft with technical problems  then ground traffic problems in EWR then crew member issues
Delayed 1 hr due to flight crew delay on inbound flight w our aircraft. Delayed 1 hr on arrival waiting for docking bay!  Got there later than flight scheduled 2 hrs after our departure

You delayed my flight in small increments for 4 hours, eventually dumping me in EWR too late to make my connection to Delhi. Information provided was consistently wrong and misleading, and utterly unhelpful.  No hotel vouchers were available, and on my rebooked flight I'm in coach having booked and paid for business class.  It doesn't get much worse.  Staff surly and defensive, misinformed, incompetent.
Unacceptable. Flight had a non-weather delay for 103 minutes. Then we sat on the tarmac for 70 minutes after landing because there was no gate.

Very bad experience with United. Flight delayed 40 min arriving to PBI, than delayed at the gate in PBI another 45min. After landing in ewr delayed again in the tarmac for 60 min before reaching gate, very disappointing!

On my trip from NWK to SJU my bag got lost, SJU to NWK flight arrived with 4 hrs delay and bags took over an hour to go out. NWK to GVA didn't have a seat up to the very last minute because of over booking. Overall very disappointing experience with United

We were delayed /4 hours and only given two meal vouchers despite missing three meals because of the delay... and the vouchers were only $10 each, I appreciate the presence of them but honestly this is an error completely of the airlines fault and I am not impressed to have to spend more money in order to have an actual meal

The flight attendant was extremely rude and inconsiderate to people either that needed any special assistance and were unfamiliar with flying all together. There was a woman that was on oxygen that could not bend down push her bag under the seat in front of her and he flight attendant just kept telling her “mam put your bag under your seat” when she was clearly having trouble the flight attendant rolled her eyes, shook her head and stuffed her bag under the seat. There was a person that hardly spoke English and was new to flying and didn’t understand how to fasten the seatbelt and the flight attendant snapped and said “ what do you mean you dont know how to buckle your seatbelt” followed by an eye roll amd head shaking. These may seem subtle in the big picture but several people on the flight were clearly uncomfortable with her tone with passangers. It made it a stressful flight wondering what might happen when we were in the air.

There was an older woman flight attendant who was exceedingly rude and unpleasant to be around. She was extremely demeaning and power hungry as she yelled at everyone MULTIPLE times for minute details such as having crossed legs on the airplane demanding that you must have two feet perfectly stationary on the ground while taking off. She was very unfriendly and made the passengers who could speak English very uncomfortable and made them seem like a huge inconvenience. I was EXTREMELY dissatisfied by the way this woman was treating myself as well as the other passengers and I will never fly United to Nashville in fear of taking this Same flight again.
Had to wait for a gate 30 minutes. The seats were not comfortable at all and my back hurt. First time that happened to me on an airplane.

The flight was awful, I barely could sleep whislt I was at the plane. When I arrived at Munich I figure it out the my luggage was missing and I didn't recive any help to spend my next couple of days without my luggage, since aall my clothes and most of my money was there. At least, I recived my luggage after two days without nothing out of where it belong and nothing was missed. Even though, I was a terrible experince!

We weren’t told about delay until right at boarding time.  We were than told pilots were on their way, but then they went to another gate.  Information was awful.  The flight attendants seemed unhappy to be there.
Our 5 pieces of luggage were lost and remain lost. We are very dissatisfied with United and Alitalia at this point. We had better be compensated for our troubles.

I don't understand why I couldn't check in online for my flight.  Very frustrating being forced to do so at the airport and then having to find an employee to look at my personal item.  Seems like a giant waste of time for all parties involved.
Fix the check in . There’s no reason not to be excellent in all phases of the flight experience .
The gate man was nice but didn’t know anything about my delayed flight and wasn’t helpful in helping me determine where to find flight status information
Having to deplane for an hour was ridiculous - they should have never let us on the plane in the first place. It caused more chaos and frustration for all.
Unacceptable to have a two hour wait to check in.  It was disorganized due to the computers being down.  Very frustrating to be on board the plane and wait two hours to take off.

We had to wait for luggage from int'l terminal and then it must have delayed our spot for departure.  No tv screens on seats, expecting us to have phones set up with app to watch shows.  Not convenient for foreigners with limited data or memory.  Plugs for charging very inconvenient.  Luggage wait I incredibly long in Boston due to cold weather- way over 45 min.  Flight departure and baggage delayed my departure out by 2 hrs.  Pretzels for that flight ridiculous.  Domestic airlines have no food or entertainment on seats- honestly archaic

The cart drivers are rude & need customer service classes. I know they are busy but it’s their job. Unacceptable to ignore pleas of handicap that walking that far is putting someone in great health danger. I had 2 1/2 hours till flight. I could have ridden in cart until a wheelchair could be found.
It was just the long delay that was really annoying

For the record, I copied and pasted my complaint.  >From: "Tanese, Naoko" <tanesn01@med.nyu.edu> >To: "CustomerCare@united.com" <customercare@united.com> >Subject: Re: Alliance Flight Experience  (KMM50233768V7569L0KM) >Date: January 7, 2018 2:59:27 PM CST > >Pamela, I appreciate your follow-up. Let me describe my experience >returning from Narita to Newark yesterday. I was the second passenger in >Business Class to board the plane. After I placed my order for a Japanese >meal, flight attendant came by to tell me they did not have enough >Japanese meals. I can only assume that after they collected all orders, >they decided who was going to get it and who wasn¹t. I was not selected. >How insulting is this? The attendant politely told me that if I wanted a >Japanese meal I should reserve one ahead of time. Is this what the rest of >the passengers did? Or did meals go to businessmen who are frequent flyers >in Business Class? The same thing happened one year ago on the same UA78 >flight from NRT to EWR. An attendant who took my order for a Japanese meal >came back and told me that all had been claimed by customers in First >Class who paid more. That¹s ridiculous. I did not think there was a First >Class, only Business. This was not the only poor experience on this >flight. For beverages, I ordered a glass of Sauvignon Blanc listed on the >menu. I was then made aware that they only served two different bottles of >Chardonnay, no Sauvignon Blanc. I also have to report that fruits that >came with my breakfast clearly had been frozen and thawed. I have never >been served a frozen-thawed fruit salad, not even in Economy. I am >guessing food items were stored in a wrong place or the temperature of the >fridge was mistakenly set too low. In any case, I don¹t know why I had to >put up with this after paying more than $6000. I just don¹t see any >improvement.

column26: FLT OPS-CALL FOR TECH OPS/NO MX REQUIRED
column79: The seats are bullshit.  I have very long legs and surgery scars from hip replacements.   I was in pain the WHOLE FLIGHT.  TAhere isn’t enough leg room to sit in chair or on toilet. I had to stil with my legs at the ankles because m legs don’t fit.  It was HORRIBLE.  When you are tall and can’t help it, you shouldn’t have to pay for extra space.  Tears.  :(
Great flight overall but Hate your check in at o’hare. Prefer the international terminal for everything!

While our flight arrived 15 minutes early, we ended up spending an hour on the ground taxiing to the terminal. While I understand this may have been out of United's control to degree, an hour on the ground to get to a terminal after landing, especially at an airport as large as Newark with hundreds of gates available, is really unacceptable. When you've spent a long day traveling and you're arriving at 9pm with tired children, the extra hour wait leaves a particularly bad taste in your mouth. United really needs to use it's influence with Newark Airport to design and implement a better system for loading and unloading aircraft so that such delays don't happen.
I had a problem with the suitcase, it did not come to my destination, 48 hours have passed and I still do not receive it. It is a big problem.

The lady in the process of boarding was  very very rude, I was traveling  with  my Family , she told me , we have to check your carry on the check bagage, because I always carry my documents and other importan things, I never leave in other place this luggage. They measure and fit, I use to travel a lot and I know  the  policys and event the lowers european airlines. I told her I have to carry this with me, and her very rude ask me with who i am traveling with, like her was intimadate to leave su without boarding, but when her saw the luggage fit in the measure bin, she was satisfied with that. She was very rude with verybody, this kind of job , is service mainly, this people doña have to be in service job
Was charged $25 for a carry on bag and there was no discussion with united agent. We were not charged going from White plains to ohare only  charged in Chicago.  Very disappointed.

I paid for an economy plus seat and the seat in front of my had a metal box taking up a 1/3 of my leg room. How can you charge economy plus and then have a 1/3 of the room taken. Very upset with your upcharge for economy plus for a seat with restriction. Your organization should take a serious look at this gross oversite

I was disapointed by the service during the check in. I had the right toi have 23kg. I had only 200g more and they ask me to remove things because they were counting in lbs. Furthermore, my lugage had been damaged during the flight from Paris to Newark. I was too tired to go to the lugage claim desk. Can I be compensate by those damages?
He flight was Delayed for 5hrs. After arriving in Chicago  nobody was present on the costumer services area. Very disappointed.
It was a terrible flight. My entertainment screen didnt work, the flight was delayed, i missed my connecting flight. will not fly united.
No seat assignment till check in at Gate left us worry a bit since there was a long waiting lists

Terrible experience. From the check in at EWR to the three hours on the tarmac go no WiFi on the flight... I’ll never choose united again. No chance. The employees at Newark were short and rude with passengers, the line was ridiculous and filled with confused people because there was no one explaining anything properly. Then we were delayed for two hours on the tarmac there and 30-45 minutes at lax. All of it was terrible and the basic economy ticket is a joke. You hAve to let people check in before they go. And pick their seats. You’ve lost a customer in me.

On 6 January 2017, my flight leaving Lansing, Michigan to Chicago O’Hare, with a final destination or Denver, was again delayed.  This is the second flight in a row that was delayed. This was due to the inbound aircraft again being delayed due to mechanical reasons. This caused me to miss my connecting flight UA269 to Denver. While in Lansing I was switched to an American flight from Chicago to Denver but due to the late arrival I missed that flight too. I ran from O’Hare gate B22 to K20 just to miss the door closing by minutes.  And because of the short schedules there were no further flights to Denver. I have tried contacting you previously via social media but was unsuccessful, so I am trying this method. I am in the military and get very few days of leave. Having to spend one of those stuck in Chicago and not with my wife is not acceptable. She lives in Colorado and I live in Hawaii, so as you can see we don’t get to spend much time together. After returning my daughter to her mother in Michigan I expected to return to Colorado and be able to spend my last few days at home with my wife. I have found this to be a huge inconvenience and would like to be reimbursed the cost of my airfare. I can be reached by any of the means provided. Thank you.

I think in general flight attendant attitude could be improved. This is the service industry after all. Also, the television screen in the empty seat next to me was broken and couldn't be switched off, so the light got irritating.
at least half of the time my flights are delayed.  This time not only delayed but you lost my luggage.

I checked in two bags for my flight and payed the additional fee for the second checked in bag. But when I arrived st baggage claim in Malpensa my second bag was missing, which was odd since the other checked in bag made it just fine. I made a report in the lost item section, got a claim number, and was told the second baggage never reached Malpensa Airport, and that they would try to get it on the flight the next day. I have yet to hear anything at all regarding this bag. I left my phone number and email and have received neither a call or email. I am beginning to be concerned about this bag and that is the reason why I left a bad score on this survey. I actually had an overall pleasant experience, except for that very unpleasant surprise in the end to find out my checked baggage is lost between airports.
Food very very poor

I politely asked the flight attendant to ask the person in front to put the seat in the upright position when food was served. This happens in every Alitalia, Delta, Lufthansa, Turkish flight I have experiences. The flight attendat answer was “ no, I am not going go say anything. You have to say it if you want. I do not care about this sort of things” . What an unpleasant answer
The person on the United desk from Guatemala to NJ was terrible, awful human being. My luggage was lost back to Guatemala. The worst.

Majority of ALL staff were rude and discourteous, very dismissive. My INFANT'S car seat was lost on the way from Newark to Tampa, which is completely irresponsible of your staff.  This left us with having to use a dirty, old car seat which was left at the airport by someone else. The car seat was to small for my child and VERY unsafe.  It took 3 days to locate the missing car seat.  When it was finally on it's way to be delivered, it arrived at 3am. Trying to speak to a representative from United proved to be impossible, as wait times were over 1 hour and often times would result in the phone being "disconnected".  After emailing a compliant i was sent a generated response stating they would respond back in 7-14 days.  How can you loss a necessary item and not get back to someone immediately.   United Airlines costumer service processes are HORRIBLE.  You are understaffed therefore creating a hostel environment for your staff, which in turn makes them HORRIBLE to deal with.  Your overall service is HORRIBLE.  You put my child's safety at risk and NO ONE has yet to contact me regarding this matter. I would hope someone would contact me after this review.  Lisa DePaolo 727-479-7802
The seat and pull out tray table from the center console in first class were very dirty. Disappointing.
We used our miles and had a bad experience on the return flight sitting next to a sick child.
Newark airport is the one if the worse airports that I have ever been in.  The people from check-in to the TSA are horrible.  The all need a class on common courtesy
Passengers  who are sick  should have masks made available to them upon boarding.
No. I already have reignited my anger
It took over an hour from when we were on the ground until I had my bag. This is completely unacceptable, especially late in the day when there are few incoming flights.

I could not believe what was going on on Saturday dec 6th!!!!! First, at the club, my husband and I could not be found in the system!!! My husband is a member!!!! Questioned mMANY times!!!! Then we got our first flight changed, followed by gate changes, luggage unknown location, horrible!!!! Everything was going wrong that day!!!!

We have been waiting to hear from someone about our lost baby car seat. We checked our child’s car seat along with our other luggage and the car seat came up missing.  We are at a major inconvenience and we are in need of our car seat immediately.

Our flight was delayed and there was very little information from the gate agent about anticipated arrival time.  When it was time to board, she called for Zones so close together there really was no difference between zones, negating the effect of getting on early and relaxing.  There was no clear direction when we arrived in Boise where our bags would be.  We waited for over 25 minutes before they finally started coming out.  It was so chaotic.  Check in at O'Hare was a nightmare as well.  No organization at all!
More information earlier could have helped, now the delay was announced each 10 minutes with another delay extension...

Flight attendant prevented my from using the washroom after we had been stuck at the gate for 20+ minutes (not even close to taxying) and sat a further 30 min after my request. Rude and inconsiderate.

This was the worst flight I've had in years. We sat on the tarmac forever--first with the door open at the gate, so as to avoid running the clock. Then actually on the tarmac. The plane was uncomfortable, the flight attendants rude. Neither the WiFi nor the in-seat power worked for me, and nobody seemed to care. My bag somehow arrived on a different flight, but nobody bothered to tell me until after I'd been waiting around at Baggage Claim forever. Just horrible.

The attendants were angry and negative.  They assumed we (everyone) were stupid and doing things just to delay or put people in danger.  They kept announcing that people should not stand when people were boarding.  Then during takeoff my daughter and I were sharing a sticker book puzzle and one flight attendant asked if it was “only a book” because we couldn’t have anything else. Later, I went to the bathroom and had to wait.  Apparently the woman in there was taking a long time. The flight attendant yelled at me for waiting back there and then made an announcement that we should all stay in our seats and twist around to see if the vacant light was on and then we could go to the bathroom, but we should not stand up and walk there if the light wasn’t showing vacant.  So people had to keep checking and then run before someone else got up to go.  I was having some GI discomfort, so telling me I couldn’t get to a toilet unless I kept twisting and checking for it to be vacant was extremely stressful. It was like if you did any misstep, they made an announcement chastising us.  Later the attendant yelled at my husband for having a “computer” out at the end of the flight when it was a tablet.  It was like they were constantly searching for people to be breaking rules.  On the other hand, the family in front of us let their toddlers sit together with no parent and the kids get hitting water bottles against the seats and dropping the armrest up and down, but no words to the parents that their children were being disruptive.  It was one of the most negative and unfriendly flights I have ever taken. Between the first and second leg, I will not consider United as a first choice for a trip...and will try to avoid it at all costs.
Not happy with the extra money charged for taking a carry on.
Non United Airport employees very rude. Food court staff horrible, TSA worse

There was no hot food options for a four plus hour flight. The connecting flight gave us 20 minutes to rush from gate to gate with no time to syop for food and we were traveling with a two year old child.

My bags from newark never arrived in San Jose.  When I inquired as to when my bags would be received I was told an undetermined time, and that they had not left Newark airport and it has been over a day.  This is not the first time I’ve had this experience.  United airlines is the worst service I’ve ever had.   I would never recommend them and they are the laughingstock of the airline industry

The flight was fine.  When we arrived in Vegas to collect our luggage only one of our bags arrived.  Our second bag - with all of our clothes, shoes, cosmetics and some work supplies only arrived 2 days later.  This was a huge inconvenience.  And when my bag did finally arrive and get dropped off it was broken and items inside broken apart.

We have been in Manchester for two days and our baggage is still missing and we can't find out what has happened or where our baggage is.  We came for a funeral and had to borrow clothes and buy clothes.  Still wearing same clothes as we arrived in Very very upset.
There is no agent to speak to regarding our missing suitcase. Wait time is ridiculous.

My bag was lost on the flight, as were many others on the same flight. Considering the number of bag lost there must have been a contained left behind. As I write this survey approx 36 hours after my arrival in Dublin I have had no update on the whereabouts of my bag and no respobne to the three messages left with Swissport.

Originally my booking had been cancelled without United informing me. I then had to spend hours on the phone from Ireland to rebook my itinerary, which I was unable to do - I had to change my flight plan on the way home. I was never properly told the reason for the cancellation and it took speaking to a different airline before I was properly able to rebook my flights and find out that United had messed up on their end. I was delayed about an hour then on my flight over. On my return flight, there was another lengthy delay and following that my luggage was left in the US. After having been assured that my luggage would be put on the next flight 23 out of Newark and delivered today (8th January) I was disappointed to find that it was not. I then had to call United on their main line because the dedicated baggage number given was engaged or would not work. I then spent over half an hour on hold, only to be told that my baggage was still in Newark, a fact that I had received no update on. The representative was unable to assure me that there would be continued contact from the airline as to the status of my baggage. Yesterday I was assured my baggage would be here by today, and I received no update to say it would not. It took over an hour just to do this. This is unacceptable - I have to go to work and to university. Not only does the bag contain important notes for my final exams, but I moreover do not have the time to wait around at home for a delivery that may or may not arrive.  The representative did inform me that I would be able to track the bag online, however, when I had tried to do that earlier the website did not provide full information about my bag's location. Furthermore, on calling I had to reinform the company of my email, and bag details, which had been incorrectly registered in the first place. I understand that there are difficulties due to inclement weather at the moment, however some level of better communication and an actual answer to the question of whether or if my bag will arrive rather than a platitude about the difficulty of not having my property would be appreciated. Overall I regret to say that I did not have a good experience of flying with the company - especially given I paid over €1,000 for flights. This is a lot of money for anyone, but particularly a college student. Given the cancelled flights, delay in my flight to Mexico City from O'Hare, lengthy delay from Newark to Dublin, delayed baggage and difficulty in getting any information about the status of that baggage (whose delivery was also delayed) I feel this disappointment is more than understandable.
Very limited announcements from gate staff on issue re delay
You lost my luggage for three days and handled it in the most disorganized manner.

The flight was good but the service and communication betweeny flights was bad. Delaying a flight until the following morning without compensation or immediate rebooking is bad service. I’ve flown before when this has happened with other airlines and have always been called by the airline to rebook for an earlier flight and given compensation for extra time in the airport. I unfortunately paid more for my ticket to avoid getting into Wichita at 10pm, but due to maintenance issues, I called to get on the flight that landed at 10 and my bag wasn’t moved with me.

When flights are delayed the customers should know sooner. If the airplane for the previous flight is delayed then obviously the next will be delayed. Just tell your customers so they can plan accordingly. I was very disappointed to hear that my flight was delayed 4+ times when they could've just said the other flight left over an hour late thus my flight would be an hour late.

The airport was tense after the storm.  I got there very early assuming it would be crowded and to leave plenty of time to get through security and to gate before boarding. Every dining area is a rip off. I do not have frequent flyer miles to use and the prices are all inflated to accommodate that.  Being stuck in the airport with 15.00 sandwiches is very annoying.  You charge for bags, rip us off on food, is a bathroom charge next.

My original flight 1/4/18 back to PBI was cancelled due to snow, so I called United and got on another flight for 1/6/18 my daughter and Inarrived 4 hour EARLY. When we went to the ticket counter, the employee at the check in point told me that my flight was cancelled. She put me in a flight for the nex day after her lie. I soon learned that my flight was NOT cancelled, what employee told me was NOT true, she lied, IT WAS NOT TRUE. But in spite of several calls to customer service NOTHING was done for me and my daughter who was flighting with me. We managed eventually to get on the flight last minute as STAND BY pasengers. What the ticket woman did to me, by telling me my flight was cancelled, is a violation, it was unethical, an integrity issue, IT WAS VERY WRONG!!! It was the worst day of my life.
Flight was delayed and took 2 1/2 to get my luggage bag... I was traveling for a funeral and needed my luggage

While the flight was fine - the handling of our arrival was deplorable. While we were 15 minutes early there was no gate - hard to believe since the airport was empty and you basically own Terminal c. Then we had to wait for an aircraft to move. 20 minutes later we could go to gate.
