But the ln had to wait 30 minutes for jetway personnel   How is it that a flight just left the gate - since that was why we could not get in early - but their is no personnel for jetway. Disgusting.

1) I am extremely unhappy with your gate agent C. Cunningham, who kept referring me to "baby." He made me check in my carry-on, which came with me on the plane from NYC to Managua with NO problems - it fit. I tried to explain this to C. Cunningham and he kept saying "okay, I know baby." Not just once, at least 3x. This behavior and communication to a passenger is NOT Acceptable  2) I would like a refund of my economy plus purchased seat (8B), which I recognize is for more space. Although, I do NOT understand how I ended up in group 4, which made me lose baggage space. The flight attendant explains UA boards by window, middle, aisle - this makes ZERO sense. But if this is the case - HOW were all the economy plus passengers comfortably seated by the time I boarded? Someone informed me that UA actually boards by status. If this is the case, also, inappropriate! I paid A LOT of money for my ticket. Just because I'm not gold or whatever doesn't allow UA not to let people board. Why should someone who is in row 35C but has status board before me??  JetBlue does NOT allow passengers to put their coats and small bags on top, they must be under their seat. Your staff should do a better job controlling was it being placed on board. I noticed a woman asking another woman if she could move her children's SMALL backpacks and the woman wouldn't. This is ridiculous!  Not only was your gate agent inappropriate with me, UA in a way segregates people due to their class. So, I ended up waiting for my luggage, that came on board with me to Managua and back. I would like a refund on the economy plus seat I purchased, plus an explanation of UA's boarding process. Please understand that these negative experiences make me NOT want to book United. I've tried to let this go, especially being a yogi, but besides the gate agent, checking in my luggage - United did not have a person assigned to the jetway in EWR, which left us on the plane for an additional hour and frozen conveyor belts not allowing us getting our luggage for two hours, getting home at 2:30am was not a great experience. I understand, airlines have no control over mother nature. But everything else was NOT OKAY.

Upon arrival into Newark there was not a gate available. I don't understand how that happens when they know we are coming. Then, there was no jet way operator to connect the plane to the jetway. Wasn't there just someone there with the plane that was previously in our gate? This is unacceptable. We actually landed early only to sit on the plane for another 45 minutes.

arrived 10 min early.  sat on run way for 45 min because gate was occupied, then blocked by equipment, then waited 20+ minutes because there was  no jet way operator.  finally arrived and it took over an hour and a half to get my luggage due to equipment issues.  not even a parking voucher offered for the extra time we were forced to stay or for our inconvenience.
Waiting for baggage for over 90 minutes is unacceptable when you pay a baggage fee of $25 per bag

The arrival at EWR was horrible!!! we landed at 11:15 and did not get to the gate until 11:40. 25 min from landing to get to the gate? Like they didn't know we were coming? if gate had plane in it, then find another gate, you have all of terminal C for that! The once we got gate we waited another 25 min to get  gate agent to get the ramp up to the plane. Now it is 12:05 in the morning! wasn't there a gate agent at the gate to get the plane off that was just blocking our arrival?? Now it is 50 min from landing to getting off the plane, i could have been homeboy that time. Aren't you embarrassed by this??? If no,you should be!!! This is no way to treat your customers! TOTAL FAILURE. Why are you going to do for me for wasting my time and making me wait and be later in getting home???
A 4 plus hour delay was unacceptable

Because of this experience, I do not want to fly United again. It hurt that I was not taken care of, especially as I had called ahead to make sure that I would be taken care of. The last thing I need is to have surgery again because I was hurt due to the negligence and disregard of my circumstances of your workers
abosutely no information at the gate changes gate several times. the issue no communication was stranded for hours with my elderly grandparent
Baggage claim in Nashville is ridiculous! Not only the wait to get the luggage but the confusion caused by having all flights on same carousel when there are 8 carousels.
Signage at the gate was inadequate. No visual indication letting us know we were at the correct gate, as monitor did not face people in line.
Pilot was "missing" at departure time so we were 45 minutes late!  Poor coordination!

considering the bad weather and the freezing temperatures, it was understandable that the trip would take longer than expected.  Newark airport is notoriously terrible with luggage anyway so this was just another hour and a half of problem after problem.

I used the same carry on with the same amount of stuff in it to fly to Newark that I used to fly from Newark back to Dallas a week later. There were no problems with boarding on my way there, but on the way back, the attendant who scanned our boarding passed prior to boarding  gave me attitude about my carry on size stating that I would need to check it because it was too big. I asked her how could that be if I used it only a week ago with no problem, at which point she just continued to say how it's too tall and would need to be checked. While tagging the bags with a flustered demeanor she felt the need to threaten me by saying "you better watch out or they are going to start charging you for this." I apologize for whatever hold up I may have caused the other customers, but that single encounter was enough to put me on the edge and vow never to fly united again.
